THE MISSION OF LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES NORTHWEST (LCSNW) IS TO PARTNER WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES FOR HEALTH, JUSTICE AND HOPE. LCSNW BUILDS COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITY. LCSNW IS A 501 (C) (3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR RSVP PIERCE COUNTY SINCE 2017, RSVP OF KITSAP COUNTY SINCE 1981, AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SERVING BOTH PIERCE AND KITSAP COUNTIES SINCE 1998. THE WORK OF LSCNW IN THE SOUTH SOUND IS FOCUSED ON SERVING SENIOR POPULATIONS, INCLUDING INDIVIDUALS WITH DEMENTIA AND THOSE WHO ARE HOMEBOUND. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR OUR WORK IN PIERCE COUNTY WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES.  AS OUR MISSION SHOWS, WE BELIEVE HEALTH IS THE FOUNDATION OF A QUALITY LIFE AND MAKES ALL OTHER PURSUITS, BY INDIVIDUALS AND SOCIETY POSSIBLE.  OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE 210 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN COMMUNITY SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ACROSS PIERCE COUNTY.  OF THAT NUMBER, 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  

IN 2021, RSVP PIERCE WILL CONTINUE WITH ALL SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS TO INCLUDE CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES CONGREGATE MEAL SITES, KOREAN WOMEN?S ASSOCIATION CONGREGATE MEAL SITES, NOURISH FOOD BANKS AND RETAIL STORES AT NORTHWEST FURNITURE BANK AND HABITAT FOR HUMANITY.

AT THE END OF THE GRANT YEAR AN ESTIMATED 210 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WORK AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES, FOOD BANKS, SCHOOLS, MUSEUMS AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 40,000 PEOPLE WILL BE SERVED.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $120,029 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $55,822.00 FROM STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER SOURCES.

CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES WW-NW - RSVP SPONSOR IN SNOHOMISH COUNTY.
FOR OVER 75 YEARS, CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES HAS BEEN A PLACE TO INSTILL HOPE, A PLACE TO CONSIDER WHAT OTHER POSSIBILITIES THERE ARE FOR A PERSON'S LIFE. OUR MISSION IS TO SERVE AND SUPPORT POOR AND VULNERABLE PEOPLE THROUGH THE PROVISION OF QUALITY, INTEGRATED SERVICES AND HOUSING. ALL OF THE FOLLOWING NUMBERS REFLECT MY OPTIMISM THAT EVERYTHING WILL GET BACK TO NORMAL AFTER COVID-19. AN ESTIMATED 238 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 135 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES: TRANSPORTATION; 35 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL TRANSPORT HOME BOUND SENIORS, VETERANS AND DISABLED ADULTS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND OTHER BASIC NEEDS APPOINTMENTS. COMPANIONSHIP WILL BE PROVIDED BY VOLUNTEER CHORE SERVICE (10 VOLUNTEERS) AND PEER TO PEER COUNSELING (25 VOLUNTEERS) THAT PROVIDES EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO SENIORS FACING DIFFICULT LIFE TRANSITIONS AND AGING ISSUES. 15 STATEWIDE HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS ADVISORS (SHIBA) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FREE, UNBIASED, AND CONFIDENTIAL ASSISTANCE WITH MEDICARE AND HEALTH CARE CHOICES. FOOD DISTRIBUTION; 50 VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE FOOD AT LOCAL FOOD BANKS TO PEOPLE EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 85% OF SENIORS, VETERANS AND DISABLED ADULTS SERVED WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT FROM COMPANIONSHIP, COUNSELING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICE ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES. SHIBA VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INSURANCE ASSISTANCE TO AT LEAST 4,000 ADULTS. AND 500 FOOD BANK RECIPIENTS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $89,839 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $82,782 IN LOCAL MATCH FUNDS FROM SNOHOMISH COUNTY LONG TERM CARE AND AGING AND WA STATE COMMERCE DEPARTMENT.

THE MISSION OF LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES NORTHWEST (LCSNW) IS TO PARTNER WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES FOR HEALTH, JUSTICE AND HOPE. LCSNW BUILDS COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITY. LCSNW IS A 501 (C) (3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE RETIRED AND VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF KITSAP COUNTY WASHINGTON SINCE 1981. THE WORK OF LCSNW IN THE SOUTH SOUND IS FOCUSED ON SERVING SENIOR POPULATIONS INCLUDING HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DEMENTIA.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR OUR RSVP WORK IN KITSAP COUNTY WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AS OUR MISSION SHOWS, WE BELIEVE HEALTH IS THE FOUNDATION OF A QUALITY LIFE AND MAKES ALL OTHER PURSUITS, BY INDIVIDUALS AND SOCIETY, POSSIBLE. OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE 184 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN COMMUNITY SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ACROSS KITSAP COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT SCHOOLS, MUSEUMS, LIBRARIES, A HOSPITAL, A BLOOD BANK AND OTHER COMMUNITY NON-PROFITS THAT ADD TO THE WELL-BEING OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

IN 2021, RSVP KITSAP WILL CONTINUE WITH SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS AND ADD AN ADDITIONAL STATION THAT WORKS TO PRESERVE THE ENVIRONMENT. WE WILL ALSO ADD A CONFERENCE WHICH WILL SERVE AS A RECRUITMENT EVENT WITH THE ADDED OUTCOMES OF COMMUNITY COLLABORATION, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO MORE FULLY UTILIZE THE TALENTS AND ENERGY OF CURRENT VOLUNTEERS.

INFORMALLY, RSVP KITSAP WILL JOIN FORCES WITH THE COUNTY GOVERNMENTS EFFORTS TO PROMOTE CREATIVE WAYS FOR THE COUNTYS AGING POPULATION TO UTILIZE THEIR TALENT, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE IN BOTH PAID AND UNPAID ROLES FOR THE BENEFIT OF BOTH THE INDIVIDUAL AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.

AT THE END OF THE GRANT YEAR AN ESTIMATED 184 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN KITSAP COUNTY WASHINGTON. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WORK AT MEALS ON WHEELS, FOODBANKS, LIBRARIES, HOSPITALS, MUSEUMS AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 30,250 PEOPLE WILL BE SERVED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $51,929 (SOURCES STATE $16,631, LOCAL $14,704, OTHER/IN-KIND $20,594).

AN ESTIMATED 250 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA OF SPOKANE COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN FOUR WORK PLANS LEADING TO OUTCOMES IN THREE FOCUS AREAS, WHILE 100 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUR OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WORK PLAN. WE ARE COMMITTED TO ADDRESSING THE CNCS FUNDING PRIORITIES OF "ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY," "AGING IN PLACE - INDEPENDENT LIVING," AND "EDUCATION - INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING."

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP OF SPOKANE COUNTY CONTINUES TO BE HEALTHY FUTURES, PARTICULARLY IN THE OBESITY & FOOD OBJECTIVE. OUR FIRST WORK PLAN WILL ENGAGE 20% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE IN NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING HOME MEAL DELIVERY, CONGREGATE MEAL SERVICE, AND FOOD BANK SUPPORT, LEADING TO INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR ALL DEMOGRAPHICS IN OUR COMMUNITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 4000 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.

ADDITIONALLY, OUR SECOND AND THIRD WORK PLANS WILL ADDRESS THE AGING IN PLACE OBJECTIVE, REFLECTING OUR COMMITMENT TO SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS IN OUR COMMUNITY TO ENABLE THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH GREATER SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVED HEALTH. THESE WORK PLANS TOGETHER WILL ENGAGE 8% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS.

OUR EDUCATION/TRAINING WORK PLAN WILL ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS AS COACHES AND FACILITATORS FOR A MATTER OF BALANCE: MANAGING CONCERNS ABOUT FALLS (MOB) AND FALLSTALK, TWO EVIDENCE-BASED FALLS PREVENTION PROGRAMS. MOB TEACHES PARTICIPANTS IN A CLASSROOM SETTING PHYSICAL AND MENTAL EXERCISES TO IMPROVE THEIR BALANCE AND COORDINATION, WHILE FALLSTALK INVOLVES FACILITATORS WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH CLIENTS REMOTELY IN A TAILORED, SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIP. ALTHOUGH THIS WORK PLAN FALLS UNDER THE ACCESS TO CARE OBJECTIVE, THE MOB AND FALLSTALK PROGRAMS ARE ALMOST EXCLUSIVELY DESIGNED FOR OLDER ADULTS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 20 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH, SUCH AS MAKING MODIFICATIONS TO THEIR ENVIRONMENTS OR ADDING NEW EXERCISES TO THEIR DAILY ROUTINES.

THE THIRD HEALTHY FUTURES WORK PLAN IS OUR COMPANIONSHIP WORK PLAN. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSEHOLD CHORES, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, AND REGULAR TELEPHONE CHECK-IN CALLS TO SOCIALLY ISOLATED SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 15 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.

EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY IN THE K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVE, WILL ACCOUNT FOR 12% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE IN A COMBINATION OF IN- AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL TUTORING AND YOUTH MENTORING ACTIVITIES, LEADING TO IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FOR SPOKANE COUNTY STUDENTS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 25 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.

OUR THIRD FOCUS AREA WILL BE CAPACITY BUILDING FOR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, ENGAGING 20% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS IN PROVIDING A VARIETY OF INDIRECT SERVICES TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, ENABLING THESE ORGANIZATIONS TO OPERATE MORE EFFECTIVELY AND EXPAND THEIR PROGRAM REACH. SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT WILL BE THE PRIMARY SERVICE ACTIVITY, BUT THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF CAPACITY BUILDING VOLUNTEERS MAY EXTEND TO FUNDRAISING, VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AS NEEDED. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST EIGHT ORGANIZATIONS WILL REPORT INCREASED EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, AND/OR PROGRAM REACH.

FINALLY, THE REMAINING 40% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ALLOCATED TO OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, WHICH INCLUDES OUR LONG-STANDING PROJECT WARM-UP INITIATIVE TO PROVIDE HANDMADE CLOTHING AND ACCESSORIES TO LOW-INCOME AND HOMELESS PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITY IN ORDER TO KEEP THEM WARM DURING COLD WEATHER. PROJECT WARM-UP DISTRIBUTES ANNUALLY OVER 10,000 ITEMS MADE BY OUR VOLUNTEERS.

RSVP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 2021

YAKIMA VALLEY COLLEGE ON BEHALF OF RSVP OF YAKIMA COUNTY SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR CNCS FUNDING TO SUPPORT 350 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT YAKIMA COUNTY. AS PER GRANT REQUIREMENTS, AT LEAST 75 OF THOSE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS. 

OVER THE THREE YEARS COVERED BY THIS GRANT, 2021-2024, HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA. ONE WORK PLAN WILL CONCENTRATE ON ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD IN FOOD BANKS TO PEOPLE EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY. A SECOND WORK PLAN WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING VITAL IN-HOME SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME AND HOMEBOUND SENIORS. A THIRD WORK PLAN OUTLINES DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION REGARDING HEALTH INSURANCE, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, AND HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS ON DISABILITY. A FOURTH WORK PLAN WILL ACCOUNT FOR THOSE VOLUNTEERS NOT COVERED BY OUTCOME BASED PLANS.

AT THE END OF OUR 3-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 200 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE THROUGH FOOD BANKS WILL REPORT REDUCED FOOD INSECURITY. APPROXIMATELY 60 HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIALIZATION BECAUSE OF IN-HOME ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. AT LEAST 5,000 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE PERTINENT INFORMATION REGARDING HEALTH INSURANCE, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND HEALTH CARE BENEFITS PROGRAMS THROUGH INDIVIDUAL CONTACT AS WELL AS HEALTH FAIRS, MAILINGS, GROUP PRESENTATIONS AS WELL AS NEWSLETTER ARTICLES AND RADIO SPOTS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,150 IN MATCH FUNDS AND $30,908 IN EXCESS FUNDS.

AN ESTIMATED 400 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN WASHOE COUNTY, NEVADA. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 116 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE 1) PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE FOR ISOLATED ADULTS 60 AND OLDER WHO HAVE MINIMAL OTHER SUPPORT; 2) PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR ADULTS 60 AND OLDER WHO HAVE LIMITED OTHER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND 3) SERVING AS HEALTH CARE PARTNERS TO EMPOWER VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, SPECIFICALLY HISPANIC AND AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES, TO ACCESS HEALTH CARE AND IMPROVE SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH.  EACH OF THESE PROGRAMS IS ADMINISTERED BY THE SANFORD CENTER FOR AGING, LOCATED WITHIN THE SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA, RENO.  THE SANFORD CENTER HAS A WELL-ESTABLISHED AND WELL-RESPECTED HISTORY OF IMPLEMENTING THE RSVP WASHOE COUNTY PROGRAM AND HAS DEMONSTRATED EXCELLENCE IN DELIVERING COMMUNITY SERVICE ABOVE AND BEYOND TARGETS OUTLINED BY CNCS.
      	THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF ADDRESSING THE COMMUNITY NEED FOR AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE.   THESE WILL ADDRESS THE FUNDING PRIORITIES OF THE FY2021 RSVP COMPETITION BY ADVANCING RACIAL EQUALITY BY REDUCING HEALTH CARE DISPARITIES, INCREASING KNOWLEDGE AND OPPORTUNITIES TO SEEK HEALTH CARE IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE CHANGE IN COMMUNITIES, AS WELL AS ADVANCING JUSTICE AND EQUALITY IN ACCESSING HEALTHCARE AND EMPOWERING OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. 
       AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WASHOE COUNTY RSVP ANTICIPATES AN OUTCOME OF AT LEAST 292 PARTICIPANTS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND AT LEAST 32 PARTICIPANTS WHO REPORT A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.   THESE OUTCOMES WILL DIRECTLY SERVE THE NEED IN THE WASHOE COUNTY COMMUNITY AS EVIDENCED THROUGH THE STRENGTHENING COMMUNITIES NARRATIVE.  RSVP OF WASHOE COUNTY IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE SANFORD CENTER IN PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS OVER 55 TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM, AND IN ACTIVELY IMPROVING THE LIVES OF WASHOE COUNTY RESIDENTS.  MOST OLDER ADULTS BEING SERVED THROUGH THESE RELEVANT SANFORD CENTER PROGRAMS ARE AT-RISK FOR LONG-TERM CARE PLACEMENT, EXPERIENCE SOCIAL ISOLATION, AND HAVE OFTEN EXPERIENCED THE NEGATIVE IMPACT OF HEALTH CARE DISPARITIES.  RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO CREATE A LASTING IMPACT LEADING TO LONG-TERM CHANGE IN WASHOE COUNTY, UTILIZING THE DEDICATED SERVICE OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS OVER 55 YEARS OF AGE.
     THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $116,251 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,170, THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES USED AS COST MATCH AS REQUIRED BY CNCS, WHICH IS 30% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST OF $166,421.

NEVADA RURAL COUNTIES RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (NV RURAL RSVP) IS A SELF-SPONSORED NON-PROFIT 501 (C)(3) COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES THE ELDERLY AND OTHER CITIZENS IN NEED IN NEVADA?S RURAL, FRONTIER AND WILDERNESS COMMUNITIES.  TODAY, RSVP SERVES 15 OF NEVADA?S 17 COUNTIES WITH A DEMONSTRATED RECORD OF OUTSTANDING SERVICE FOR 45 YEARS.  RSVP STRENGTHENS COMMUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE PROJECTS AND VOLUNTEERING, HELPS NEVADA?S ELDERS REMAIN AT HOME TO AGE IN PLACE WITH DIGNITY, MAINTAIN A HEALTHY QUALITY OF LIFE, AND BE A VITAL PART OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. 
  
NV RURAL RSVP?S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LIFESAVING VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS THAT HELP SENIORS MAINTAIN THEIR DIGNITY, SELF-RESPECT AND INDEPENDENCE.   OUR HIGH-QUALITY SUPPORTIVE PROGRAMS HELP OLDER ADULTS, VETERANS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND AVOID COSTLY LONG-TERM INSTITUTIONAL CARE.  

NV RURAL RSVP IS A CURRENT AND PAST SENIOR CORPS GRANTEE.  THE ORGANIZATION JOINS CNCS IN THE PURSUIT TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING.

IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, SERVICES FOR THIS POPULATION INCLUDE: 1) VOLUNTEER DRIVERS PROVIDE ESCORTED DOOR TO DOOR TRANSPORTATION; 2) HOME COMPANION VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT; 3) NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT IS PROVIDED TO LOW-INCOME SENIORS THROUGH SENIOR FARMER'S MARKET COUPONS AND FOOD DELIVERY; 4) VOLUNTEER DRIVERS PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR VETERANS TO ACCESS VETERANS RESOURCES, VA CENTERS, HOSPITALS AND SUICIDE PREVENTION RESOURCES; 5)  HOME COMPANION VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE TO VETERANS.  IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, SERVICES INCLUDE: 6) VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN A DIVERSE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT BROADER COMMUNITY NEEDS.
  
AN ESTIMATED 370 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING A 12-MONTH PERIOD.  OF THIS NUMBER, 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 4,575 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $465,549 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $236,274 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE JUST ONE PROJECT (TJOP) IS A GRASS-ROOTS NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE VISION TO INSPIRE, IMPACT, AND CHANGE OUR COMMUNITIES IS DILIGENTLY SERVING AT-RISK, LOW-INCOME, CHILDREN, YOUTH, SENIORS, AND FAMILIES LIVING IN SOUTHERN NEVADA SINCE 2014. OUR MISSION OF, "KEEPING OUR COMMUNITY CONNECTED BY INSPIRING PEOPLE TO GET INVOLVED, GIVE BACK, AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE," IS WHAT WE ASPIRE TO ACCOMPLISH DAILY. THE JUST ONE PROJECT MOBILIZES VOLUNTEERS TO BUILD STRONGER AND HEALTHIER COMMUNITIES. 

WITH THE LEADERSHIP OF OUR FOUNDER AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, BROOKE NEUBAUER, WE WANT TO MAXIMIZE OUR CONTRIBUTION TO THE LAS VEGAS COMMUNITY. OUR GOAL IS TO CREATE INNOVATIVE, DIGNIFYING, AND ENGAGING PROGRAMMING FOR THOSE WE SERVE AND TO ALWAYS SERVE WITH COMPASSION. THE JUST ONE PROJECT HAS FIVE MAIN PROGRAMS DRIVING OUR ORGANIZATION, POP UP & GIVE, COMMUNITY MARKET, HOME DELIVERY, YOUTH PROGRAMS, AND THE SMILE PROJECT.

AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 85 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND FOOD SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS CLARK AND NYE COUNTIES IN NEVADA. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 300 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AGED 55 AND OLDER WILL BE CONNECTED TO MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES; 600 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT; AND 150,000 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. KAUAI RSVP IS SPONSORED BY THE COUNTY OF KAUAI AGENCY ON ELDERLY AFFAIRS, WHO IS THE LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND THE DESIGNATED AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER.  THE MISSION OF THE AREA AGENCY: PLANS, IMPLEMENTS, SUPPORTS AND ADVOCATES FOR THE WELL-BEING OF KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS; AND SERVES AS A ONE-STOP SOURCE OF INFORMATION ON LONG-TERM CARE SUPPORT OPTIONS AND SERVICES FOR ALL RESIDENTS. THE VISION OF THE AREA AGENCY:
-KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS WILL LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME OR IN THE COMMUNITY WITH DIGNITY AND RESPECT.
-KAUAI'S FAMILY CAREGIVERS RECEIVE ADEQUATE SUPPORT TO CARE FOR THEIR OLDER ADULTS.
-KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS WILL MAKE INFORMED CHOICES AND HAVE STREAMLINED ACCESS TO LONG-TERM CARE SUPPORT.

THE PROGRAM STRIVES TO DEVELOP AND ALIGN WORK PLANS WITH THE SPONSOR AGENCY'S AREA PLAN TO HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS.  AN ESTIMATED 320 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THE $1,000 IN ANNUAL BASE FUNDING PER UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER CALCULATION, 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES.  THE REMAINING 245 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY OR ADDITIONAL OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS OBESITY AND FOOD BY INCREASING FOOD SECURITY PARTICULARLY AS PART OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC RECOVERY EFFORTS, FOR OLDER ADULTS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER RESIDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND HAVE BEEN FINANCIALLY IMPACTED BY THE PANDEMIC.  THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO ADDRESS THE OLDER ADULT POPULATION TO HELP THEM AGE IN PLACE BY PROVIDING SOCIAL SUPPORT TO OLDER ADULTS, ESPECIALLY THOSE HOMEBOUND AND WHO LIVE ALONE.  BECAUSE KAUA'I IS CONSIDERED A RURAL AREA WHERE RESOURCES ARE LIMITED, THE PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT SOCIAL SERVICE PROGRAMS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEED THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES THAT INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS, EFFICIENCY AND/OR PROGRAM SCALE AND REACH.  

THESE OUTCOMES WILL BE MET THROUGH THE FOLLOWING EXAMPLE OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES:
HEALTHY FUTURES: PROVIDE FOOD/NUTRITION SUPPORT THROUGH FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD DELIVERY AND SOUP KITCHENS.
HEALTHY FUTURES: PROVIDE SOCIAL SUPPORT THROUGH TELEPHONE REASSURANCE AND SOCIAL CONTACT USING SMART PHONES AND OTHER TECHNOLOGIES.
CAPACITY BUILDING: ASSIST SOCIAL SERVICE AND OTHER PROGRAMS THROUGH FUNDRAISING EFFORTS AT GIFT SHOPS, THRIFT STORES AND OTHER ACTIVITIES THAT LEVERAGE RESOURCES TO INCREASE EFFECTIVENESS, EFFICIENCY AND/OR PROGRAM SCALE AND REACH. 

KAUAI RSVP WILL ADDRESS NEEDS IN COLLABORATION WITH THE SPONSOR AGENCY, GOVERNMENT AND NON-PROFIT PARTNERS USING THEIR BEST PRACTICES AND PROVEN PROGRAMS WHILE PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIOR SERVICE TO ADDRESS UNMET LOCAL AND STATE NEEDS, EMPOWER THOSE 55 AND BETTER TO CONTINUE BEING A CONTRIBUTING MEMBER OF THEIR COMMUNITY AND GIVE THEM AN OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000, WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $165,936 BY THE COUNTY OF KAUAI.

THE CITY AND COUNTY OF HONOLULU'S DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS)/ELDERLY AFFAIRS DIVISION (EAD), HAS BEEN AN INTEGRAL PARTNER AND LEADER IN HAWAII'S AGING NETWORK FOR OVER 35 YEARS. SERVING AS THE DESIGNATED AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) FOR OAHU.  THE MISSION OF EAD IS TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE AND COORDINATED SYSTEM OF SERVICES TO ASSISTS OLDER PERSONS IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  EAD IS THE INCUMBENT SPONSOR FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIORS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU SINCE 2011. EAD VALUES RSVP AS A PROGRAM THAT MIRRORS THE CULTURAL VALUES OF OUR PEOPLE TO RESPECT AND VALUE OUR KUPUNA (OLDER ADULT).  THROUGH RSVP, EAD HONORS OUR KUPUNA BY HARNESSING THEIR PASSION, TALENTS, AND LIFE EXPERIENCES TO HELP ADDRESS CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDING THOSE ARISING FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.   

AN ESTIMATED 215 TOTAL UNDUPLICATED OLDER ADULTS WILL BE DEPLOYED TO SERVE ACROSS THE ISLAND OF OAHU.  OF THIS NUMBER, 165 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ASSIGNMENTS THAT WILL DIRECTLY SUPPORT CNCS ESTABLISHED OUTCOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES THAT WILL COINCIDE WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDING COMPANIONSHIP (FRIENDLY PHONE CALLS), NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT (MEAL DELIVERY AND SNAP EDUCATION/ENROLLMENT), AND COUNSELING AND COACHING (HEALTHCARE COUNSELING).  THE SECONDARY FOCUS AREA IS DISASTER SERVICES IN WHICH RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS RELATED TO DISASTER AND EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, APPROXIMATELY 200 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT; 800 REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; 300 REPORTING INCREASED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE; AND 500 REPORTING INCREASED DISASTER READINESS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
OUR PROGRAM PROPOSES TO UTILIZE 75 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS, ALL OF WHOM WILL BE PLACED IN ONE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT. THEIR TARGETED ACTIVITY WILL BE TO TUTOR STUDENTS WHO ARE ACHIEVING BELOW GRADE LEVEL, TARGETING STUDENTS WITH BELOW GRADE LEVEL SCORES ON THE STAR TEST* OF MATHEMATICS PROFICIENCY. VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR STUDENTS CURRENTLY IN GRADES THREE THROUGH SIX, 4-5 DAYS A WEEK FOR APPROXIMATELY 30 TO 45 MINUTES A DAY, SPECIFICALLY IN MATHEMATICS. VOLUNTEERS AND RECIPIENTS WILL USE AN INTERACTIVE SCREEN IN A VIRTUAL ENVIRONMENT TO COMPLETE THE TUTORING SESSIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, TUTORING. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE ANTICIPATE AN OVERALL INCREASE IN MATH GRADES AS ISSUED BY THE SCHOOL, AND AN INCREASE IN TEST RESULTS AS ADMINISTERED BY STATE TESTING PROGRAMS.

*STAR TESTING IS THE STANDARDIZED ASSESSMENT SYSTEM FOR THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA

KERN COUNTY'S 60 AND OVER SENIOR POPULATION CURRENTLY REPRESENTS 16% OF THE COUNTY'S TOTAL POPULATION (2018 CENSUS REPORTER).  IN THE NEXT 10 YEARS, THIS POPULATION IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE BY 51% AS A RESULT OF THE BABY BOOMER PHENOMENON. AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF PROGRAMS AND FUNDING FOR SENIORS DETERIORATES, MORE SENIORS WILL BE AT RISK, JEOPARDIZING THEIR HEALTH AND WELL BEING, THEIR QUALITY OF LIVING AN INDEPENDENT LIFE AS WELL. THE VOLUNTEER CENTER OF KERN COUNTY WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1972, DEDICATED TO SERVING THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF VOLUNTEERS. IT PRIDES ITSELF IN PROVIDING MORE THAN FORTY-EIGHT YEARS OF COMPLIANCE SPONSORSHIP EXPERIENCE WITH THE RSVP PROGRAM OF KERN COUNTY AND THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. MISSION STATEMENT: TO MOBILIZE PEOPLE AND RESOURCES TO DELIVER CREATIVE SOLUTIONS TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY ISSUES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM.

REBUILDING TOGETHER EAST BAY-NORTH WILL RECRUIT A MINIMUM OF 100 VOLUNTEERS. FOR AN INVESTMENT OF $75,000, OUR WORK AREAS ARE AS FOLLOWS:

1. HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE: USING A MINIMUM OF 30 SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS, TO HELP BOTH HOMEOWNERS BY MODIFYING HOMES FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.  WE MAY PARTNER WITH OTHER REBUILDING TOGETHER AFFILIATES IN ALAMEDA COUNTY, WHICH PERFORMS SIMILAR WORK, AND CAN SHARE SKILLED SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER TRADESPEOPLE. 
WE WILL USE SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS TO LEVERAGE OUR RESOURCES AND SKILLS AND EXPAND OUR SERVICES FROM HOMEOWNERS, TO INCOME-QUALIFIED SENIOR APARTMENT DWELLERS TO BRING MANY OF THE SAME SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS TO THEM AS WELL. WE WOULD EXPAND A PORTION OF OUR SERVICES TO COVER THOSE WHO FALL THROUGH THE PROGRAMMATIC CRACKS.  

2. CAPACITY BUILDING:  WE WILL USE AN ADDITIONAL 30 SENIOR CORP VOLUNTEERS, BY CONNECTING THEM WITH OTHER STATION PARTNERS, SUCH AS FOOD BANKS, AND FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES SUCH AS MEALS ON WHEELS. WE WOULD ALSO USE THESE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO TRAIN AND TRANSFER KNOWLEDGE TO NEW VOLUNTEERS.

3. DISASTER RESPONSE SERVICES: USING APPROXIMATELY 15 SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS, WE WILL COORDINATE WITH LOCAL HOSPITALS TO MODIFY HOMES OF PEOPLE RECOVERING FROM COVID-19, AND INSTALL NEEDED SAFETY EQUIPMENT.

4. VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES:  BY PROVIDING THESE SIMILAR SERVICES TO VETERANS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, WE EXPECT TO USE 25 SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS.

CHINATOWN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CENTER (CHINATOWN CDC) PROPOSES TO WORK WITH 75 SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL TRAIN CHINATOWN COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO PROTECT THEMSELVES FROM COVID-19, PREVENT FIRES, AND PREPARE FOR EARTHQUAKES. BOTH THE VOLUNTEERS AND THE 200+ COMMUNITY MEMBERS THEY WILL SERVE ARE PREDOMINANTLY LOW INCOME, LIMITED ENGLISH SPEAKING IMMIGRANTS FROM CHINA AND HONG KONG. THEIR PERSONAL BACKGROUNDS MAKE THEM THE IDEAL PEOPLE TO PROVIDE THIS COMMUNITY OUTREACH.

THE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE LIVE IN VERY CROWDED APARTMENT DWELLINGS, MOST OF WHICH ARE APPROXIMATELY 100 YEARS OLD. MANY OF THE ROOMS ARE ONLY 8 BY 10 FEET, AND HAVE SHARED BATHS AND KITCHENS. GIVEN THIS LIVING SITUATION, IT HAS BEEN VERY FORTUNATE THAT THERE HAVE NOT BEEN OUTBREAKS OF THE VIRUS, DUE IN LARGE PART TO NEIGHBORS PLANNING AMONG THEMSELVES TO SET SCHEDULES ON THE USE OF THE KITCHENS AND WORKING WITH CHINATOWN CDC ON PREPAREDNESS AND USE OF PPES (PERSONAL PROTECTION EQUIPMENT). WITH THE VIRUS STILL CONTINUING TO SPREAD IN SAN FRANCISCO AT THE TIME OF THIS APPLICATION AND NO VACCINATION IN SIGHT, WE ANTICIPATE IT WILL CONTINUE TO BE IMPORTANT TO PROVIDE PROTECTION FOR RESIDENTS THROUGH NEXT YEAR, WHEN THIS GRANT PERIOD WOULD BEGIN.

THE OVERALL BUDGET LISTED FOR THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES ALL THE DISASTER PLANNING AND ORGANIZING WORK CONDUCTED BY OUR EXPERIENCED AND KNOWLEDGEABLE ORGANIZING STAFF, INCLUDING THIS SENIOR CORPS PROGRAM SHOULD IT BE FUNDED. THIS GRANT WOULD GREATLY ENHANCE OUR WORK AN DEVELOP ENHANCED LEADERSHIP SKILLS IN THEIR COMMUNITY.

ALL PEOPLES COMMUNITY CENTER HAS SPONSORED RSVP FOR MORE THAN FORTY-THREE YEARS. WE HAVE BUILT A CORE OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH DEPARTMENT OF AGING, POLICE STATIONS, PUBLIC SCHOOLS, FAITH-BASED CONGREGATIONS, HOSPITALS, AND SENIOR CENTERS. AN ESTIMATED 184 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES IN GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY: CITY OF LOS ANGELES COMMUNITY OF SOUTH LOS ANGELES; THE CITIES OF BELL, BELL GARDENS, CUDAHY, HUNTINGTON PARK, LYNWOOD, MAYWOOD, VERNON, AND SOUTH GATE. THESE COMMUNITIES ARE HOME TO A DISPROPORTIONATE NUMBER OF THE ONE-IN-SIX COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO WERE LIVING BELOW THE POVERTY LINE. ACCORDING TO THE CENSUS BUREAU'S POPULATION ESTIMATES FOR JULY 1, 2019, PERSONS LIVING IN POVERTY RANGE FROM 18% FOR A POPULATION OF 93,444 IN SOUTH GATE TO 29.9% FOR A POPULATION OF 42,012 IN BELL GARDENS. HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT, HOMELESSNESS, ILLITERACY, AND VIOLENCE ALSO ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AREA, SO THE NEEDS OF RESIDENTS ARE ACUTE AND NUMEROUS. BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS, ALL PEOPLES RSVP LOOKS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT FIT IN WITH MEASURABLE OUTCOMES, ALLOW SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES, PROVIDING ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS COMBATING UNMET COMMUNITY NEEDS AND SUPPORT THE ROLE PARTNERS PLAY BY PROVIDING BASIC SERVICES FOR LOW INCOME RESIDENTS. AN ESTIMATED NUMBER OF 234 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 184 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WHICH WILL INCLUDE, HEALTHY FUTURES, DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS DISASTER SERVICES. DISASTERS OFTEN OCCUR WITH LITTLE WARNING AND THOSE THAT ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY LIFE ALTERING DESTRUCTION ARE THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN LOW-COME AREAS AND INCLUDE THE ELDER POPULATION AND HOMEBOUND. READY.GOV STATES "WHILE 60 PERCENT OF AMERICANS SAY PREPARATION FOR NATURAL OR MAN-MADE DISASTERS IS VERY IMPORTANT TO THEM, ONLY A STAGGERING 17 PERCENT OF AMERICANS CLAIM TO BE VERY PREPARED FOR AN EMERGENCY SITUATION, ACCORDING TO A NEW SURVEY COMMISSIONED BY THE AD COUNCIL." VOLUNTEERS WILL ATTEND TRAININGS CLASS ON HOW TO MAKE A DISASTER PREPAREDNESS PLAN AND THEN PROVIDE WHAT THEY LEARNED TO MEMBERS IN THEIR COMMUNITY.  WITHIN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, RSVP HAS ENGAGED THE COMMUNITY IN TO ESTABLISHING AN INTERGENERATIONAL MICRO FARM THAT HAS BECOME AN ICONIC ECOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL GATHERING FOR THE COMMUNITY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS ISSUES OF OBESITY AND FOOD INSECURITY, CHECKING IN ON HOMEBOUND, DISABLED, AND ISOLATED SENIORS. LOUDON COUNTY PROJECT NARRATIVE

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

IT WAS OUT OF THE URGENT NECESSITY TO ADDRESS THE ECONOMIC AND HEALTH DEVASTATION OF THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC, ALONG WITH THE CURRENT LACK OF AVAILABLE RESOURCES TO DO SO, THAT ALIGN9 WAS FOUNDED.  THE PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO ALIGN RESOURCES FOR THOSE IN THE 9TH JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE (ROANE, LOUDON, MORGAN AND MEIGS COUNTIES) SUFFERING FROM THE EFFECTS OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE DISORDERS, LACK OF HEALTHCARE RESOURCES, EDUCATION, AND THE ECONOMIC AND LEGAL HURDLES RESULTING FROM ALCOHOL AND DRUG ADDICTION.  

OUR MISSION IS TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES THROUGH COLLABORATION OF GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, NON-GOVERNMENT ORGANIZATIONS AND THE FAITH-BASED COMMUNITY.  WE SEEK TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION BY IDENTIFYING GAPS IN SERVICES, RAISING AWARENESS OF THOSE COMMUNITY NEEDS AND IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN BEING PART OF THE SOLUTION BY GETTING INVOLVED IN A TANGIBLE PROJECT TO MEET THOSE NEEDS.  

THE RSVP SENIOR CORPS PROGRAM FOR LOUDON COUNTY ALIGNS WITH THE OVERALL MISSION OF ALIGN9.  AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 75 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ADDRESSING THE OPIOID/DRUG EPIDEMIC THROUGH PREVENTION WORKING ALONGSIDE OF THE PREVENTION ALLIANCE OF LOUDON COUNTY, RECOVERY COACHING/MENTORING AND CONNECTING AND REFERRING THOSE WITH SUBSTANCE ABUSE DISORDERS TO RESOURCE LINKAGE.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO WORK TO BUILD CAPACITY TO ADDRESS NEW AREAS OF NEED RESULTING FROM THE RECENT COVID-19 EPIDEMIC.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD AND FOOD INSECURITY FOR LOW-INCOME AND ELDERLY POPULATIONS HAVE BEEN DOCUMENTED AS NEED AREAS IN LOUDON COUNTY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, POSITIVE CHANGES IN BEHAVIOR, IMPROVED HEALTH, INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD AND INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AND HEALTHCARE SERVICES AND INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND/OR SKILLS RELATED TO AVAILABLE SERVICES.  THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $7,500.00, IN-KIND, OR 10% MATCH OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOUSING UNIT REPAIRS, WEATHERIZATION, AND RETROFITTING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY - HOUSING. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, REBUILD UPSTATE AND RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE COMPLETED HOUSING UNIT REPAIRS ON AT LEAST 45 EXISTING LOW-INCOME HOMES AND WEATHERIZATION OR RETROFITTING ON AT LEAST 25 HOMES . THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $15,000 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH ANDERSON COUNTY AND THE UNITED WAY OF ANDERSON COUNTY IN ADDITION TO PRIVATE DONATIONS.

REBUILD UPSTATE?S APPROACH TO AFFORDABLE HOUSING IS SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT FROM OTHER AFFORDABLE HOUSING ORGANIZATIONS, INSTEAD OF PROVIDING NEW CONSTRUCTION, REBUILD UPSTATE EXCLUSIVELY FOCUSES ON REPAIRING EXISTING HOMES. BY FOCUSING ON HOME PRESERVATION FOR OUR LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORS, WE ARE ABLE TO MAKE HOMES SAFER, HEALTHIER, AND MORE LIVABLE. REBUILD UPSTATE ENGAGES WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO PROVIDE FUNDING AND VOLUNTEER SUPPORT FOR HOME REPAIR. THE IDEA IS SIMPLE: IF YOU PROTECT THE HOME, YOU PROTECT THE FAMILY INSIDE IT. THE BEST HOME FOR A HOMEOWNER AT-RISK IN THE AFFORDABLE HOUSING CRISIS IS THE HOME THEY ALREADY OWN.

THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN ENDS OF LANCASTER COUNTY IN SOUTH CAROLINA ARE DIVIDED NOT ONLY BY GEOGRAPHY BUT ALSO BY THEIR DIFFERING COMMUNITY CONTEXTS.  THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE OF THE COUNTY IS SQUARELY IN ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING AND MOST AFFLUENT PARTS OF THE CHARLOTTE, NC REGION.  NEARLY 30% OF THE COUNTY'S RESIDENTS ARE CONCENTRATED IN THE MORE DENSELY POPULATED PANHANDLE, INCLUDING IN SEVERAL LARGE ACTIVE ADULT LIVING COMMUNITIES; HOWEVER, CENSUS FIGURES FROM 2010 INDICATE THAT 50% OF THE COUNTY POPULATION LIVES IN RURAL AREAS.  THE SOUTHERN, MORE RURAL END OF THE COUNTY FACES THE CHALLENGES COMMON TO RURAL COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING DECREASED AVAILABILITY OF SERVICES, BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND OPPORTUNITY, AND INCREASED HEALTH INEQUITIES. A 2018 ANALYSIS BY THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL FOUND THAT THE GAP IN LIFE EXPECTANCY BETWEEN THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN ENDS OF LANCASTER COUNTY CAN BE GREATER THAN 10 YEARS.  

THE LANCASTER COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING, INC. (LCCOA) IS THE CATAWBA AREA AGENCY ON AGING'S LOCAL SERVICE PROVIDER FOR LANCASTER COUNTY. ITS MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A SYSTEM OF COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES TO ENABLE OLDER PERSONS OF LANCASTER COUNTY TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE.  WITH SATELLITE LOCATIONS THAT RANGE FROM THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN END OF THE COUNTY, LCCOA OPERATES PROGRAMS THAT COVER THE ENTIRE FOOTPRINT OF LANCASTER COUNTY.  IT IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO IMPLEMENT THE LANCASTER COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (LANCASTER COUNTY RSVP) AND CONNECT THE LARGE NUMBER OF POTENTIAL VOLUNTEERS FROM THE NORTHERN END OF THE COUNTY TO POCKETS OF NEED AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE SOUTHERN END.  HELPING OTHER PEOPLE EFFECTIVELY (HOPE) IN LANCASTER, INC., A NONPROFIT WITH MULTIPLE SERVICE LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY AND ITS OWN STRONG RECORD OF EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT, WILL PARTNER WITH LCCOA AS AN RSVP VOLUNTEER STATION AND PROVIDE A RANGE OF ADDITIONAL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THIS EFFORT.

AN ESTIMATED 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING VULNERABLE HOMEBOUND ADULTS WITH HOME-DELIVERED MEALS, REGULAR CONTACT, AND FACE-TO-FACE INTERACTION TO ASSIST THEM TO AGE IN PLACE; AND PROVIDING DIRECT ACCESS TO FREE FRESH AND HEALTHY FOODS AT FOOD PANTRIES AND DISTRIBUTION PROGRAMS FOR FOOD-INSECURE COUNTY RESIDENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 276 VULNERABLE SENIORS WILL RECEIVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND 1,675 RESIDENTS WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY THROUGH THE SERVICES OF LANCASTER COUNTY RSVP.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $27,461.

THE SENIOR CITIZENS ASSOCIATION (SCA) IN FLORENCE COUNTY IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION. SCA'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A FULL RANGE OF SERVICES TO FLORENCE COUNTY'S SENIOR CITIZENS. THE PURPOSE OF THESE SERVICES IS TO PROMOTE THE PHYSICAL, MENTAL, AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF SENIOR CITIZENS, ENHANCING THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN MAINTAINING INDEPENDENCE AND PERSONAL GROWTH. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF FLORENCE RSVP IS HEALTHY FEATURES. SCA FLORENCE AVERAGES 297 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, OF WHICH 260 VOLUNTEERS SERVE AT MORE THAN ONE PARTNERING STATION. FLORENCE RSVP HAS VOLUNTEERS IN FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES INCLUDING HOME DELIVERED MEAL PACKAGING AND DELIVERING, MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR VETERANS, INCOME TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS, AND ASSISTANCE IN SOUP KITCHENS AND FOOD BANKS. OF THE 260 VOLUNTEERS, 100 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES THAT ARE NOT FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, FLORENCE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:
-INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND FOOD SECURITY FOR OLDER ADULTS
-ACCESS FOR VETERANS TO PRIMARY AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTH CARE
-SUCCESSFUL APPROPRIATION OF TAX FUNDS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $21,892.00 FROM THE SENIOR CITIZENS ASSOCIATION

THE MEGIDDO DREAM STATION IN GRANITEVILLE, SOUTH CAROLINA SERVES INDIVIDUALS IN AIKEN, BARNWELL AND EDGEFIELD COUNTIES THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF OUR CURRENT RSVP GRANT.   CURRENTLY, AMID THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, 112 VOLUNTEERS ARE SERVING. NOW THAT WE HAVE DEVELOPED VIRTUAL PROGRAMS AND PLAN TO RESUME CLASSROOM TRAINING WHEN IT IS SAFE, WE ARE GOING TO NEED TO INCREASE OUR NUMBER OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO 150.  OF THE 150 VOLUNTEERS, 150 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY- WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE JOB AND PERSONAL SKILL TRAINING, FINANCIAL LITERACY CLASSES, INCOME TAX PREPARATION AND GED PREPARATION. SOUTHEASTERN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (SCC) SERVES AS THE SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS PROGRAM (RSVP) FOR COLUMBUS COUNTY AND IT HAS SERVED IN THIS CAPACITY SINCE 1973. SCC'S RSVP  FEDERAL BUDGET HAS INCREASED 10% DUE TO THE AUGMENTATION GRANT. DURING THE CURRENT FUNDING 2019-2020 FUNDING CYCLE,  174 ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS  PROVIDED ASSISTANCE AT 27 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. DUE TO COVID 19, ALTERNATIVE ACTIVITIES/JOBS HAVE BEEN PERFORMED BY THE ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS WHICH INCLUDE MAKING MASKS AND GOWNS, SENDING CARDS AND CONTINUING TO CALL AND CHECK ON THE SICK AND THE DISABLED.  THESE APPROVED ACTIVITIES HAVE ENABLED THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH VALUABLE ALTERNATIVE COMMUNITY SERVICES.
BASED ON THE CNCS FUNDING FORMULA, SCC'S RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE 103 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS (MINIMUM) IN THE NEW 3 YEAR GRANT CYCLE. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN A VARIETY OF FOCUS AREAS: DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND HEALTHY FUTURES. RSVP PLANS TO ASSIST RESIDENTS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN EFFECTED BY A DISASTER AND WHO MAY NEED ADDITIONAL RESOURCES SUCH AS HOUSING, FOOD OR SHELTER. THE PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, AS WELL AS THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS, ON FINANCIAL LITERACY BY OFFERING CLASSES ON FRAUD AND SCAMS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING SAVINGS PLANS. OUR PROGRAM WILL INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF ADULTS AND CHILDREN BY USING VARIOUS INSTRUCTIONAL METHODS TO TEACH CHILDREN 0-4 YRS. OLDER, K-12 AS WELL AS INDIVIDUALS SEEKING TO EARN A HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY DIPLOMA. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP BY IMPROVING WATERWAYS, ASSISTING WITH CONSTRUCTION OF  RAMPS AND RAILS FOR RESIDENTS AND PROVIDING FOOD FOR THOSE IN NEED. VOLUNTEERS WILL TRANSPORT SENIORS/DISABLED RESIDENTS TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS AS WELL AS PERFORM WELLNESS CHECKS.

SCC'S PROPOSES TO RECEIVE AN ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL AWARD OF $102,528 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $20,000 FROM LOCAL COUNTY FUNDS AND APPROXIMATE $27,206 IN NON FEDERAL IN-KIND SUPPORT PROVIDED BY SCC.

COVID-19 HAS ADDED CHALLENGES OUR TRADITIONAL SERVICE DELIVERY MODELS. ON SHORT NOTICE, INNOVATIVE APPROACHES WERE DEVELOPED TO OFFER DRIVE-THRU MEAL PICK-UPS IN LIEU OF CONGREGATE DINING, TAX PREPARATIONS WERE PREPARED VIRTUALLY, MEDICARE COUNSELING WAS CONDUCTED OVER THE PHONE THROUGH A FREE CONFERENCE LINE, AND VIRTUAL VOLUNTEER TRAINING CREATED. THE SPONSOR AGENCY IS COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CCA). IT IS A PRIVATE CORPORATION WITH A VERY PUBLIC MISSION: THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, SUPPORT AND SERVICES WE WILL EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES TOWARD A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE. INCORPORATED IN 1965, THE AGENCY IS PART OF A NATIONWIDE, FEDERALLY FUNDED, COMMUNITY ACTION MOVEMENT WHOSE FOCUS IS TO INTIMATELY INVOLVE LOW INCOME PEOPLE IN DEVELOPING THEIR OWN SOLUTIONS TO PERSISTENT POVERTY. A COMMON THREAD THROUGH ALL OF OUR SERVICES, FAMILY SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES OR HOUSING SERVICES IS TO CHANGE PEOPLE'S LIVES BY PROVIDING NEEDED RESOURCES AND SUPPORT. 159 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES IN THE SERVICE AREA.  THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OLDER AND DISABLED ADULTS IN A TWO COUNTY SERVICE AREA. SERVICE CATEGORIES WILL ASSIST WITH DAILY LIVING TASK AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS: SUCH AS TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, MAINTAINING AND STOCKING PANTRIES FOR FOOD DISTRIBUTION, COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIALIZATION AND DISASTER PREPARATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OUTCOME OF BENEFICIARIES RECEIVING SERVICES TO INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT SO THEY CAN HAVE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE WHILE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY.  AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $15,000.00 IN NON-CNCS FUNDING. THE MATCHING FUNDS WILL COME FROM HOME CARE AND COMMUNITY BLOCK GRANT, COUNTY SUPPORT AND IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS.  CCA'S RSVP PROGRAM IS WELL RECEIVED IN THE COMMUNITY AND STRIVES TO ADDRESS MANY OF THE PROBLEMS AND UNMET NEEDS IDENTIFIED WITH THE HELP OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS.

THE COLLIER COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT AND SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF COLLIER COUNTY. RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY HAS BEEN PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY SINCE 1998 AND HAS GARNERED COMMUNITY ATTENTION AND SUPPORT SINCE. COMMUNITY SUPPORT IS DEMONSTRATED THROUGH REGULAR IN-KIND DONATIONS OF COMMUNITY CLUBHOUSE SPACE FOR THE RSVP BONE BUILDERS HEALTHY FUTURES CLASS HELD MULTIPLE TIMES PER WEEK AT 14 LOCATIONS. COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS DONATE GIFTS SUCH AS GIFT CARDS, GIFT BASKETS, AND TICKETS TO EVENTS USED AS RECOGNITION FOR VOLUNTEERS AT THE ANNUAL EVENTS HELD BY RSVP. THE BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS SHOWS SUPPORT THROUGH THEIR WILLINGNESS TO COMMIT MATCH FUNDS TO RSVP, ATTENDANCE AT RSVP RECOGNITION EVENTS, AND ISSUANCE OF AN ANNUAL PROCLAMATION DESIGNATING A WEEK IN MID-APRIL TO CELEBRATE AND RECOGNIZE THE SERVICE OF VOLUNTEERS. THE CITY OF NAPLES ALSO RECOGNIZES VOLUNTEER SERVICE THROUGH THE MAYOR?S DAY OF SERVICE IN EARLY APRIL. 
	SINCE THE START OF RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY, OVER 1900 VOLUNTEERS HAVE CONTRIBUTED 1.5 MILLION HOURS OF SERVICE AT 153 STATIONS ACROSS COLLIER COUNTY. ACCORDING TO INDEPENDENTSECTOR.ORG, THIS EQUATES TO $38.2 MILLION IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO OUR COUNTY IN TIME, TALENT, AND EXPERIENCE DEDICATED TO MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN OUR COMMUNITY. 
	COUNTY AND COMMUNITY NEED CHANGES REGULARLY AND MUST EVOLVE WITH THE DEMOGRAPHICS. COLLIER COUNTY HAS EXPERIENCED A 19 PERCENT POPULATION INCREASE SINCE 2010 PRIMARILY COMPRISED OF FAMILIES AND CHILDREN LEADING TO AN INCREASED COMMUNITY FOCUS ON EDUCATION AND FOOD SECURITY RECENT DATA INDICATES 10.6% OF THE COUNTY?S POPULATION LIVES IN POVERTY, WHILE 20.4% OF CHILDREN RESIDING IN COLLIER COUNTY ARE STRUGGLING WITH FOOD INSECURITY. AN ESTIMATED 9.3% OF THE COLLIER COUNTY POPULATION ARE VETERANS.  
	VETERANS WILL BE THE MOST PROMINENT FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY. DUE TO THE STIGMA ASSOCIATED WITH VETERAN MENTAL HEALTH AND THE FACT THAT 50% OF VETERANS RETURNING FROM ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE IN NEED OF MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES DO NOT RECEIVE THEM (RAND NATIONAL DEFENSE RESEARCH INSTITUTE, 2020), IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT THE PROJECT DIRECTOR CONNECT VETERAN VOLUNTEERS TO VETERAN PROGRAMS TO ENCOURAGE SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES FOR THIS UNIQUE POPULATION. ANTICIPATED PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE THE VETERAN CENTER OF COLLIER COUNTY, WOUNDED WARRIORS, AND HOME BASE WARRIOR FITNESS, ALONG WITH THE VETERAN TRANSPORTATION NETWORK MANAGED BY THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. 
	HOUSING WILL ALSO BE A PRIORITY FOR RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY. THE PROJECT DIRECTOR WILL WORK WITH THE HUNGER AND HOMELESS COALITION OF COLLIER COUNTY TO DETERMINE SUCCESSFUL COMMUNITY HOMELESSNESS PROGRAMS THAT WILL PROVIDE HOUSING SERVICES OR ACCESS TO SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH HOMELESS PEOPLE OR THOSE AT RISK OF HOMELESSNESS TO CONNECT THEM WITH COMMUNITY SERVICES OFFERING HOUSING ASSISTANCE AND OTHER CRUCIAL SERVICES. THE PROJECT DIRECTOR WILL CONNECT WITH ORGANIZATIONS, SUCH AS HABITAT FOR HUMANITY, TO PROVIDE CONNECTION SERVICES TO HOUSING PROGRAMS AND TRANSITIONAL HOUSING SUPPORT. THE HOUSING FIRST METHOD, AN EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICE, WILL ASSIST WITH PROGRAM GUIDANCE AND CLIENT SUCCESS. 
	COLLIER COUNTY?S OVERALL FOOD INSECURITY RATE WAS 10% IN 2019 PRIOR TO COVID-19, MUCH LOWER THAN THE 2017 RATE OF 13%. FOOD FOCUSED PROGRAMS HAVE WORKED TIRELESSLY TO MAKE THESE IMPROVEMENTS AND REACH FURTHER INTO THE COMMUNITY. SADLY, COVID-19 HAS DAMAGED THE ECONOMY AND CAUSED MANY INDIVIDUALS TO LOSE THEIR SOURCE OF INCOME DUE TO LAYOFFS AND FURLOUGHS. THIS HAS LED TO FOOD INSECURITY FOR MANY CAUSING AN INCREASE IN DEMAND AT FOOD PANTRIES THROUGHOUT COLLIER COUNTY. HARRY CHAPIN FOOD BANK ESTIMATES AN 1800% INCREASE FROM MARCH-JULY OF 2020.

"IT WAS A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE FOR OUR STUDENTS...MANY STUDENTS SAID THEY WANTED TO GO BACK WITH THEIR FAMILIES...THEY LOVED THE SIMULATORS...FLYING THE PLANE...THE GUIDES WERE WONDERFUL AND MADE EACH STATION ENGAGING FOR THE STUDENTS... WHAT AN AWESOME EXPERIENCE FOR STUDENTS TO HEAR AND SEE HISTORY FROM THOSE WHO SERVED OUR GREAT COUNTRY...THIS IS A FIELD TRIP THAT TRULY SUPPORTS THE CURRICULUM WE TEACH IN OUR CLASSROOM... I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS EXPERIENCE TO ALL STUDENTS IN OUR STATE...NOT JUST OUR DISTRICT." ...MRS. CINDY GALEONE, SOCIAL STUDIES TEACHER.

CLASSIFIED BY THE STATE OF FLORIDA AS AN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION, THE MILITARY HERITAGE MUSEUM HAS ALWAYS SEEN ITSELF AS MORE THAN JUST A MUSEUM. PART OF THE MUSEUM'S VISION IS TO SERVE AS AN EDUCATION-CENTERED INSTITUTION. AN INSTITUTION THAT WORKS DIRECTLY WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS OFFERING HISTORY AND STEM (SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, MATH) BASED INTER-ACTIVE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO STUDENTS OF ALL AGES. THE MILITARY HERITAGE MUSEUM CONTRIBUTES TO THE ONGOING EDUCATION OF ITS CONSTITUENTS BY PROVIDING ONSITE HISTORY AND STEM LEARNING EXPERIENCES THROUGH A WIDE RANGE OF LEARNING METHODS INCLUDING REMOTE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES. WITH ITS MISSION-BASED FOCUS ON EDUCATION, THE MUSEUM HAS A FORMED A COLLABORATION WITH THE CHARLOTTE COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS FOCUSED ON ONE OF THE SCHOOL DISTRICT'S FOUR STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES: IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN US HISTORY IN GRADES 5-12. WITH ALMOST 72% OF THE STUDENTS CLASSIFIED AS ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND 23% PERFORMING UNDER THE MINIMAL STATE STANDARDS FOR US HISTORY, THE NEED WAS EVIDENT AND THE MUSEUM WAS WELL POSITIONED TO ALIGN ITS SERVICES AND LEVERAGE ITS CAPABILITIES TO MEET THIS NEED. 

THE MILITARY HERITAGE MUSEUM HAS LOTS OF ARTIFACTS, INTER-ACTIVE ACTIVITIES, A 247-SEAT THEATER, AS WELL AS AUDIO-VIDEO, VIRTUAL REALITY AND SIMULATORS THROUGH-OUT ITS FACILITY. PERHAPS THOUGH, THE GREATEST AND MOST SIGNIFICANT ASSET IN THE MUSEUM, IS THE MUSEUM'S EIGHTY VOLUNTEER VETERANS. VETERANS WHO SERVE, NOT ONLY AS PROGRAM GUIDES, BUT ALSO PROVIDE INSIGHT AND COMFORT TO THOSE SEEKING TO LEARN MORE ABOUT WHAT IT WAS LIKE FOR THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS AND ANCESTORS TO SERVE IN THE MILITARY. WITH SUCH A WIDE OFFERING OF SERVICES, THE MUSEUM'S CORE TARGET GROUPS ARE STUDENTS, VETERANS, FAMILIES, SENIORS, AND TOURISTS. 

IN APRIL OF 2019, THE MUSEUM RELOCATED TO AN INCREDIBLE NEW FACILITY JUST A SHORT DISTANCE FROM ITS PREVIOUS LOCATION. DURING THE DESIGNING OF THE NEW LOCATION'S BUSINESS PLAN, THE IMPORTANCE OF REACHING OUT TO STUDENTS WAS ELEVATED AS ONE OF THE TOP PRIORITIES. THE CONCEPT OF LEVERAGING THE LARGE CORPS OF VOLUNTEER VETERANS TO SUPPORT THE LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICT'S GOALS, ESPECIALLY IN US HISTORY, WAS FULLY ENDORSED BY THE MUSEUM'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. PRIOR TO OPENING THE MUSEUM IN ITS NEW LOCATION, DIALOGUE TOOK PLACE BETWEEN THE MUSEUM AND SCHOOL DISTRICT PERSONNEL TO ENVISION THE POSSIBILITIES. THE DISCUSSIONS LED TO THE CREATION OF HISTORY ACADEMY, OF WHICH THE PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL BASED PROGRAMMING TO STUDENTS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON US HISTORY. HISTORY ACADEMY PROVIDES A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY FOR SCHOOL AGED YOUTH FROM K-12 TO LEARN, EXPLORE AND CREATE PROJECTS. WHILE PRIMARILY FOCUSING ON US HISTORY, THE CURRICULUM ALSO SUPPORTS THE EDUCATIONAL THEMES OF SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, ARTS, AND MATH (STEAM). "ARTS" NOW BEING ADDED WITH THE RECENT RENOVATIONS OF THE 247-SEAT THEATER TO ALSO SERVE AS A PERFORMING ARTS VENUE. THE PROGRAM IS A COLLABORATION WITH CHARLOTTE COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS WITH A GOAL TO HELP DISTRICT STUDENTS MEET OR EXCEED FLORIDA STATE US HISTORY PERFORMANCE STANDARDS. EDUCATIONAL-BASED ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE IN  DESIGNATED SCHOOL CLASSROOMS AND AT THE MUSEUM.

THE DR. PIPER CENTER FOR SOCIAL SERVICES, INC. WAS ORIGINALLY FOUNDED AS A NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER CARRYING ON THE IDEALS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE EXEMPLIFIED BY DR. ELLA PIPER, A DISTINGUISHED PHYSICIAN AND COMMUNITY LEADER IN FORT MYERS DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE TWENTIETH CENTURY. THE CENTER HAS EXPANDED FROM A NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER TO A MAJOR FIVE COUNTYWIDE PROVIDER OF SERVICES THROUGH FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS WHILE MAINTAINING ITS NEIGHBORHOOD BASE. 
DR. PIPER CENTER IS NOW HOPING TO ASSIST MORE CITIZENS IN SWFL, BY SUBMITTING A COMPETITION GRANT FOR RSVP OF LEE COUNTY FOR THE TIME PERIOD OF 2021-2024 THAT WOULD UTILIZE 125 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO IMPACT 1,338 CITIZENS. THE PROGRAM WOULD LEVERAGE A REQUESTED GRANT AMOUNT OF $75,000 WITH $33,917 LOCAL MATCH SUPPORT BY THE END OF THE 3 YEARS FOR A TOTAL OF $108,917. THIS GRANT SUBMISSION WILL PROPOSE 95 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME MEASUREMENT WORK PLANS WHICH WOULD EQUAL A COST OF $789.47 PER VOLUNTEER PER YEAR. THE REMAINDER OF THE VOLUNTEERS (30) WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES TO SUPPORT THE AGENCIES INVOLVED IN OUTCOME WORK PLANS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH WORK PLANS FOR AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD. AT LEAST AT THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT, THE AGING IN PLACE WORK PLAN WILL INVOLVE 30 RSVP VOLUNTEERS DELIVERING MONTHLY FOOD BAGS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENTS/GROCERY SHOPPING, OR PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP THAT MAY OR MAY NOT INVOLVE TRANSPORTATION TO AT LEAST 188 CLIENTS WITH 100 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE OBESITY AND FOOD WORK PLAN WILL INVOLVE 50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN FOOD PANTRIES/FOOD BANKS WHERE THEY WOULD COLLECT, ORGANIZE, AND DISTRIBUTE FOOD TO 1,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE FOOD INSECURE. THE OUTCOME GOAL WOULD BE TO HAVE 200 OF THEM REPORTING AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY. OTHER WORK PLANS WOULD INVOLVE EDUCATION AND FINANCIAL LITERACY EFFORTS.

UNITED WAY OF MARTIN COUNTY'S (UWMC) MISSION IS TO IMPROVE 
LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF OUR COMMUNITY.  THIS IS 
ACCOMPLISHED BY THE RESIDENTS OF MARTIN COUNTY SHARING THEIR TIME, TALENTS AND RESOURCES.  UWMC HAS STREAMLINED ITS FOCUS TO THE THREE MAJOR AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTH AND FINANCIAL STABILITY.  WE RECOGNIZE THAT VOLUNTEERING IS VITAL TO A VIBRANT COMMUNITY BY FOSTERING CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AND HAVE MADE IT A MAJOR COMPONENT OF OUR BUSINESS STRATEGY.   SINCE 1979, UWMC HAS PROVIDED MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR SENIORS THROUGH THE SPONSORSHIP OF RSVP.   AN ESTIMATED 600 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE RSVP IN FY 2021-2023.  OF THIS NUMBER, 99 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.   SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MEASURABLE RESULTS-ORIENTED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING SUPPORT THAT CONTRIBUTES TO SCHOOL READINESS, DELIVERING NUTRITIOUSLY BALANCED MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, IMPROVING THE READING LEVELS OF CHILDREN THROUGH A STRUCTURED LITERACY PROGRAM THAT IMPROVES ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, AND UTILIZING TRAINED SENIOR CORPS RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WITH TAX PREPARATION SERVICES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT,  FORTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR THIRD GRADE STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND READING AT BELOW GRADE LEVEL, EIGHT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CLASSROOM SUPPORT IN VPK CLASSES, THIRTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS TO ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES, TEN RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, AND ELEVEN RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TAX PREPARATION SERVICE TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE.  FIVE HUNDRED AND ONE VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $98,844 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,948 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

UNITED WAY EMERALD COAST (UWEC) IS A LOCAL VOLUNTEER-BASED ORGANIZATION THAT BRINGS INDIVIDUALS AND GROUPS TOGETHER IN A COMMUNITY WIDE EFFORT TO HELP PEOPLE. UNITED, WE FIGHT FOR THE HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND FINANCIAL STABILITY OF EVERY PERSON IN OKALOOSA AND WALTON COUNTIES. TO DRIVE POSITIVE CHANGE, UWEC EVALUATES OUR COMMUNITY'S DIVERSE NEEDS, MOBILIZES THE CARING POWER OF THE COMMUNITY, AND DIRECTS RESOURCES TO THE AREAS THAT WILL HAVE THE MOST POSITIVE IMPACT.

UWEC'S ROLE IN THE COMMUNITY CONTINUES TO EVOLVE.  WHILE UWEC HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN A FUNDRAISING ENTITY, WE HAVE EXPANDED TO A TRULY UNIQUE POSITION TO RECRUIT, CONVENE, AND COLLABORATE WITH PEOPLE AND ORGANIZATIONS WHO BRING THE PASSION, EXPERTISE, AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO GET THINGS DONE.  TODAY, WE WORK WITH HUNDREDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SHARE A COLLECTIVE VISION FOR WHAT IS POSSIBLE WHEN WE UNITE OUR EFFORTS.  WE PROVIDE EVALUATED AND MEASURED IMPACTS AND INVESTMENTS OF FUNDS AND VOLUNTEER HOURS BASED ON POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN THREE CORE IMPACT AREAS OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND FINANCIAL STABILITY.

WE ARE REVITALIZING OUR FOCUS ON ENGAGEMENT. WE ARE COMMITTED TO INCREASING VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT IN OUR COMMUNITY IN AN EFFORT TO PROVIDE PURPOSEFUL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO ALL CITIZENS AND VISITORS. WE ARE COMMITTED TO ENABLING CITIZENS TO CREATE A BETTER COMMUNITY BY ENGAGING IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE WITH AREA NON-PROFITS, SCHOOLS, AND VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS MEANT TO CHALLENGE OUR CITIZENS TO CREATE SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS TO OUR MOST PRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS.

UWEC WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR AN ESTIMATED 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THROUGH RSVP.  OF THIS NUMBER, 75 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS; PREPARING TAXES FOR LOW TO MODERATE INCOME HOUSEHOLDS; A READING PROGRAM TO SUPPORT LOCAL CHILDREN INCREASE SCHOOL READINESS; AND A VIRTUAL MENTORING PROGRAM TO IMPROVE STUDENTS' ATTITUDES AND SCHOOL PERFORMANCE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE REQUIRED 10% NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $7,500 IN THE FIRST YEAR; IF CONTINUED, THE NON-FEDERAL MATCH INCREASES TO 30% OVER THREE YEARS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
AN ESTIMATED 141 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ANNUALLY WITH RSVP OF ST. JOHNS COUNTY.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE GRANT IS EDUCATION, AND ACTIVITIES IN THIS AREA WILL INCLUDE TUTORING KINDERGARTEN -- TWELFTH GRADE STUDENTS IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, MENTORING KINDERGARTEN -- TWELFTH GRADE STUDENTS IN A ONE-TO-ONE OR SMALL GROUP SETTING, AND PROVIDING LITERACY ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES TO PRE-SCHOOL STUDENTS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INSTRUCTIONAL SUPPORT AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN THE ST. JOHNS COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT (SJCSD), AND LITERACY ENRICHMENT IN SJCSD EARLY CHILDHOOD CLASSROOMS (HEAD START, PRE-KINDERGARTEN EXCEPTIONAL STUDENT EDUCATION, AND VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN) AND TARGETED CHILD-CARE CLASSROOMS (IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE EARLY LEARNING COALITION OF NORTH FLORIDA).  TUTOR SERVICES IN MATH WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED IN SJCSD ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE AND/OR HIGH SCHOOLS.  MENTORING SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IN THE SJCSD HOMELESS PROGRAM, STUDENTS IN THE TAKE STOCK IN CHILDREN PROGRAM, AND STUDENTS IDENTIFIED WITH ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT CHALLENGES. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 240 STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH.  ONE HUNDRED PRESCHOOL CHILDREN WILL DISPLAY GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.  TWENTY STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FROM TAKING PART IN A MENTORING RELATIONSHIP.  FIFTY STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AFTER TAKING PART IN THE SJCSD SUMMER READING PROGRAM.  THESE PROJECTIONS ARE MADE WITH THE EXPECTATION THAT VOLUNTEERING WILL TAKE PLACE REMOTELY, DUE TO COVID-19 RESTRICTIONS.  IF THESE RESTRICTIONS ARE LIFTED, THESE NUMBERS WILL BE HIGHER.   
SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING SCHOOLS THROUGH ACTIVITIES LISTED ABOVE THAT DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM DOSAGES; PROVIDING NON-ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE TO SCHOOLS; AND PROVIDING EPISODIC SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCIES IN ST. JOHNS COUNTY. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,174.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  MATCHING FUNDS WILL COME FROM THE SJCSD (CASH AND IN-KIND SERVICES), COMMUNITY SPONSORSHIPS AND IN-KIND SERVICES, AND FUNDRAISING.

SANTA ROSA COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC., (SRCS) A 1996 RECIPIENT OF THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) FEDERAL FUNDS, IS A 24-YEAR-OLD NON-PROFIT VOLUNTEER AGENCY SERVING SANTA ROSA COUNTY FLORIDA. OUR RSVP PROPOSED PROJECTS ALIGN DIRECTLY WITH THE GOALS OF THE SRCS PROGRAM. THE POPULATION BEING SERVED IS AT RISK ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDING IN SANTA ROSA COUNTY.  AN ESTIMATED 140 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO USE COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES AND FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY BEHAVIORS THAT WILL ASSIST ELDERS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THE SETTING OF THEIR CHOICE, BY OFFERING A COMPREHENSIVE ARRAY OF SERVICES AND RESOURCES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: HELPING WITH SOCIALIZATION PROGRAMS, TRANSPORTATION, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, AND PROMOTING EXERCISE PROGRAMS. WE ARE COMMITTED TO MAKING MORE OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO RSVP VOLUNTEERS THROUGH OUR DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY PROGRAMS. WITH OUR LAST TWO PRESIDENTIAL DECLARED DISASTERS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS REGISTERED 15,428 ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS FOR DISASTER ASSISTANCE. RSVP REPORTED A TOTAL OF 23,845 VOLUNTEER HOURS. BASED ON THIS DATA, RSVP CONTINUES TO EXPAND ITS DISASTER OPERATION PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH A STRONG FOCUS ON DISASTER SERVICES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHOICES AND SAY THEY HAVE STRONGER SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT. THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE OF DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND RESOURCES.

ELDER CARE SERVICES' RSVP PROGRAM ANTICIPATES AT LEAST 258 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN NUMEROUS CAPACITIES THROUGHOUT OUR 14-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF FLORIDA (WALTON, HOLMES, WASHINGTON, JACKSON, CALHOUN, GULF, LIBERTY, GADSDEN, FRANKLIN, LEON, WAKULLA, JEFFERSON, MADISON, AND TAYLOR COUNTIES).MOST OF THEIR TIME WILL BE SPENT ASSISTING SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE. RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO HOME-BOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING SHORT DISTANCE TRAVEL ASSISTANCE AND TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, AND ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE ASSISTING 150 HOME- BOUND SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE THROUGH DELIVERED MEALS; PROVIDING SHORT DISTANCE TRAVEL TO AT LEAST 20 SENIORS SO THAT THEY MAY STAY INDEPENDENT WHILE LIVING AT HOME; GIVING COMPANIONSHIP TO 20 ISOLATED AND VULNERABLE SENIORS THROUGH TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, SAFETY CHECKS DURING MEAL DELIVERIES AND TRANSPORTATION VISITS; AND OFFERING NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO 75 SENIORS EACH MONTH AT RURAL FOOD DISTRIBUTION SITES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $119,719 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $85,482 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

UNDER THIS GRANT PROPOSAL BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF TAMPA BAY (BBBSTB) WILL REPLICATE IN HERNANDO COUNTY, FLORIDA OUR VERY SUCCESSFUL RSVP MENTORING PROGRAM IN SUMTER COUNTY, FLORIDA UTILIZING (I) VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER AND (II) AGENCY STAFF WHO WILL BE DEDICATED TO THIS PROJECT IN HERNANDO COUNTY.  
ALL VOLUNTEERS UNDER THIS GRANT PROPOSAL WILL ENGAGE IN ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING IN EITHER A COMMUNITY- OR SITE/SCHOOL-BASED SETTING, IN ADHERENCE WITH THE HIGH STANDARDS OF BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF AMERICA. VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER WILL MAKE A COMMITMENT OF AT LEAST 15-MONTHS FOR OUR  COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING PROGRAM AND ONE YEAR FOR OUR SITE/SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING PROGRAM, THOUGH ON AVERAGE MOST OF OUR VOLUNTEERS CURRENTLY STAY ENGAGED WITH THEIR ?LITTLE?  FOR THREE YEARS OR MORE IN OUR COMMUNITY BASED MENTORING PROGRAM AND TWO YEARS IN OUR SITE/SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING PROGRAM. SITE/SCHOOL-BASED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT ONE OF THE TWO SCHOOLS ALREADY PARTNERING WITH US IN HERNANDO COUNTY (VOLUNTEER STATIONS), AND BBBSTB WILL SERVE AS THE STATION FOR COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY SERVING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUTH. AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF SEVENTY-FIVE YOUTH WILL HAVE BEEN SERVED IN ONE OF OUR MENTORING PROGRAMS BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS, WORKING TOWARD IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS OUR KEY OUTCOME. 
OUR MISSION AS AN AGENCY IS TO CREATE AND SUPPORT ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS THAT IGNITE THE POWER AND PROMISE OF YOUTH. WE ACHIEVE THIS BY PARTNERING WITH PARENTS/GUARDIANS, VOLUNTEERS, DONORS AND OTHER MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY AND BY HOLDING OURSELVES ACCOUNTABLE FOR EACH CHILD IN OUR PROGRAM ACHIEVING: (I) HIGHER ASPIRATIONS, GREATER CONFIDENCE AND BETTER RELATIONSHIPS, (II) AVOIDANCE OF RISKY BEHAVIORS, AND (III) EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS.
BBBSTB HAS BEEN PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING SERVICES SINCE 1964, AND STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES THROUGH THESE HIGH-QUALITY, LIFE-ENRICHING, ONE-TO-ONE RELATIONSHIPS FOR YOUTH, BY PAIRING THEM WITH CARING, SCREENED, TRAINED, AND PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED ADULT VOLUNTEERS. OUR MENTORING PROGRAMS ARE EVIDENCE-BASED, AND OUTCOME DRIVEN, AND WE ARE PROUD OF THE WAY OUR PROGRAMS HAVE HELPED YOUTH ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL!
