*EDUCATION - TUTORING/MENTORING MARSHALL COUNTY RSVP WILL PLACE 50 VOLUNTEERS AS READING BUDDIES IN 10 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH KINDERGARTNER THROUGH FOURTH GRADE STUDENTS TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND SOCIALIZATION SKILLS.
*ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP - IMPROVING WATERWAYS - 35 ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY EVIDENCE BASED TRAINED WATER QUALITY MONITORS WILL COLLECT OVER 2,500 WATER QUALITY DATA SAMPLES ON 54 STREAM SITES AND 5 ENBAYMENTS DURING THE YEAR, PRACTICING WHAT THEY LEARNED.
-  PROPER DISPOSAL OF UNUSED MEDICINES AND RECYCLING TO PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT - OPIOID ABUSE - 20 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH THE MARSHALL COUNTY DEU, DISTRICT ATTORNEY AND ALL FOUR POLICE DEPARTMENTS TO HOST A 'MEDICINE ROUNDUP' TO EXPLAIN THE PROBLEMS OF FLUSHING UNWANTED MEDICINES DOWN THE TOILET WHICH EFFECTS OUR WATER SUPPLY OR PLACING SUBSTANCES IN HOUSEHOLD GARBAGE, THAT CAN LEAD TO INADVERTENT ACCESS BY CHILDREN AND ANIMALS, WHICH WILL EVENTUALLY END UP IN LANDFILLS AND CONTAMINATE GROUND WATER.  
*HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE - 20 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL COACH OR ASSIST 60 OLDER ADULTS IN AN EIGHT-WEEK THE A MATTER OF BALANCE EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAM DESIGNED TO REDUCE THE FEAR OF FALLING AND INCREASE THE ACTIVITY LEVELS OF OLDER ADULTS.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL OFFER CONTINUING BALANCE FOR LIFE AND ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION EXERCISE CLASSES TWICE A WEEK AFTER PARTICIPANTS HAVE COMPLETED THE 8-WEEK CLASS.  
****ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES EACH YEAR:    EDUCATION - 50 STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS.  ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP - 110 INDIVIDUALS WILL CHANGE THEIR BEHAVIOR TO BETTER PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT.  HEALTHY FUTURES - 55 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.  ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY - 1,500 FAMILIES SAVED $441,000 IN TAX PREPARATION COSTS, FREEING MONEY FOR USE TO MEET NEEDS SUCH AS FOOD, HOUSING, UTILITIES, MEDICINE, ETC.
  ***THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $165,000 WILL BE MATCHED BY $70,714 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

PIKE COUNTY RSVP PROVIDES AN ESTIMATED 200 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS 55 AND OLDER TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR COMMUNITIES, AMELIORATE SOME OF THE CONSEQUENCES OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL POVERTY, AND ENSURE A BRIGHTER FUTURE. PIKE COUNTY RSVP HAS REALIGNED THE SERVICE DELIVERY, SUPPORT, AND DECISION-MAKING PROCESS TO REFLECT RSVP PROJECT'S HISTORY, MISSION, PRIORITIES AND STRENGTHS, BUILDS UPON PREVIOUS SUCCESSES, ADVANCES THE STRATEGIC DIRECTION OF THE PROGRAM, AND STRENGTHENS OUR COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICE WHILE FOLLOWING THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE CDC RECOMMENDATIONS FOR APPROPRIATE INTERACTION DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE FIRST PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS: VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TELEPHONE CONTACTS; CONTACTLESS FOOD DELIVERY; TRANSPORTATION FACILITATION FOR MEDICAL CARE AND TECHNICAL HELP BENEFITS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS AREA ARE: PROVIDED SERVICES TO 50 OR MORE MILITARY FAMILIES. THE SECOND PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS: DISASTER PREPARATION. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: BLOOD MOBILE DRIVE; EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS TRAINING; DISASTER RESPONSE TRAINING. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS AREA ARE: 85% OF ATTENDEES PASS THE TEST ON THE 3 KEY COMPONENTS OF AN EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS PLAN. THE THIRD PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TELEFRIEND CALLS; MEALS ON WHEELS; NUTRITION RISK ASSESSMENTS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS AREA ARE: 250 TELEFRIEND ASSURANCE CALLS; 100 MEALS AND FELLOWSHIP.  THE FOURTH PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION/CULTURAL HERITAGE. A NEW FOCUS IN THE AREA OF K-12 EDUCATION CONCERNING OPIOIDS AND ADDICTION WITH A TARGET OF 500 CHILDREN REACHED IN THE FIRST YEAR.  ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES IN THIS AREA WILL INCLUDE: PIONEER MUSEUM EDUCATIONAL TOURS; VOLUNTEER TUTORS/MENTOR. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS AREA ARE: 1000 EDUCATIONAL/CULTURAL HERITAGE VOLUNTEER HOURS.  THE FIFTH PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS: CAPACITY BUILDING. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: LEADERSHIP ROLES IN COMMUNITY AGENCIES (AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY, HEART ASSOCIATION, ART COUNCIL). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR AREA ARE:  ORGANIZATION CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE IS STRENGTHENED ALLOWING FOR MORE SERVICE DELIVERY TO COMMUNITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000.00 IN FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $36,000.00 IN-KIND MATCH AND $12,941.00 CASH AND DONATIONS.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF BARBOUR COUNTY IS A 501-C (3) ORGANIZATION.  RSVP HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE BARBOUR COUNTY COMMUNITY SINCE IT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1972.  RSVP HAS A TOTAL OF 136 VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN SERVING THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR MISSION AT RSVP IS TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE RETIRED OR SEMI-RETIRED THAT WANT TO STAY ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH SIGNIFICANT VOLUNTEER SERVICES TO NON-PROFIT AGENCIES /ORGANIZATIONS. AMONG THESE AGENCIES/ORGANIZATION IN WHICH OUR VOLUNTEERS SERVE ARE: SCHOOL SYSTEMS, NURSING HOMES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES.  RSVP'S MAIN FOCUS IS TO SERVE AND HELP THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY.  VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDE: CONNECTIONS RESPITE CARE, SCHOOL SYSTEMS, TWELVE STONES COMMUNITY GARDENS, EARLY LEARNING CENTER, JUST TO NAME A FEW. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: ASSISTING WITH ACTIVITIES AND EDUCATION OF PARTICIPANTS WITH DEMENTIA AND THEIR FAMILIES, SCHOOL READINESS, PREPARING AND DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY GARDEN, PREPARING AND DELIVERING HEALTHY MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, SEWING AND CROCHETING OF TOBOGGINS AND LAP BLANKETS, ALONG WITH BABY HATS AND BLANKETS.
AT THE END OF THE THREE (3) YEAR GRANT THERE WILL BE AN INCREASED NUMBER OF PRE-K CHILDREN THAT HAVE PARTICIPATED IN THE CNCS-SUPPORTED EDUCATION PROGRAM THAT WILL BE READY TO ENTER SCHOOL. THOSE CHILDREN WHO NEEDED TUTORING WILL HAVE AN IMPROVED LEVEL OF READING SKILLS. SENIORS AND CHILDREN WILL HAVE AN INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY NUTRITIOUS FOOD AND OBESITY AND HOW TO CHOSE THESE TYPE FOODS.
DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC IT IS RSVP'S MISSION TO KEEP OUR SENIORS AND VOLUNTEERS SAFE AND HEALTHY. CURRENTLY WE LIMITED TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO AGENCIES/ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITIES. MANY OF OUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS REMAIN CLOSED, THEREFORE OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE NOT ACTIVELY SERVING. HOWEVER, VOLUNTEERS ARE MAKING USE OF THEIR TIME AT HOME BY CROCHETING BLANKETS FOR OUR VETERANS AND SEWING, MAKING CRAFTS AND READING TO CHILDREN BY SOCIAL MEDIA AS A WAY OF CONTINUING TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY.   THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $50,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OTHER INCOME SOURCES.

RSVP/MACOA IS SPONSORED BY THE MONTGOMERY AREA COUNCIL ON AGING (MACOA). MACOA IS IN ITS 48TH YEAR OF OPERATION. THE MISSION OF OUR RSVP PROJECT IS TO LINK THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE OF THE VOLUNTEER AGE 55 AND OLDER WITH IDENTIFIED, CRITICAL NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY, AND TO PROVIDE REWARDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS. ACCORDING TO THE 2019 CENSUS DATA 16% OF THE POPULATION OF OUR FIVE COUNTY PROJECT IS MADE UP OF PEOPLE OVER THE AGE OF 65 AND 9% OF THEM ARE FOOD INSECURE. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AN ESTIMATED 1,109 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 726 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DELIVERING, PREPARING, AND PACKAGING HOME BOUND MEALS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS TO DOCTOR VISITS, THE PHARMACY, AND GROCERY STORE, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO THE HOME BOUND, PROVIDING TAX ASSISTANCE, FREE MEDICAL CARE AT MEDICAL OUTREACH MINISTRIES, FOOD ASSISTANCE AT LOCAL PANTRIES, AND BENEFITS ASSISTANCE TO VETERANS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD WE PLAN TO HAVE 3,000 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, DUE TO THE EFFORTS OF THESE VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $141,304 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $103,235 OF STATE, LOCAL AND SPONSOR SUPPORT.

THE MACON COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS EFFECTIVELY PROVIDED MEASURABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY CHALLENGES BY ENGAGING INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEERISM SINCE JUNE 1973.  AN ESTIMATED 175 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND OF THIS NUMBER, 50 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN AN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT.  THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ACTIVITIES THAT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS; DISASTER SERVICES; FOOD DISTRIBUTION; COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING AND PERFORMING OUTREACH AT NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS; AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ACTIVITIES THAT SERVE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES/OBESITY AND FOOD AND WE PLAN TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE 50 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN ASSIGNMENTS TO INCREASE COMMUNITY MEMBERS? ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOODS AT THE LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS AND THE FOOD BANK.  FURTHER, IF NEEDED, ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TRAINED TO SAFELY DISTRIBUTE BAG/BOX FOOD TO BE SAFELY DISTRIBUTED TO SENIORS.
	LIKE MANY OTHER SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS ACROSS THE COUNTRY, MACON COUNTY RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS ON THE SIX CRUCIAL SERVICE AREAS: DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, HEALTHY FUTURES AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, IN ORDER TO PROMOTE EFFICIENT PARTNERSHIPS AND GENERATE MEASURABLE OUTCOMES.   THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,000			 FROM MACON COUNTY COMMISSION, RSVP'S SPONSORING AGENCY, AS WELL AS $12,881			 SUPPLEMENT FROM STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.   IN ADDITION, OFFICE SPACE, UTILITY COST, LOCAL TRAVEL AND TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE MACON COUNTY COMMISSION.   FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND SUPPORT IS PROVIDED ALSO THROUGH OTHER LOCAL, STATE, SOCIAL, CIVIC AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. VALID STATISTICAL DATA FROM THE COUNTY CENSUS WILL BE UTILIZED TO ENSURE THAT RSVP SERVES THE ENTIRE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA.  MACON COUNTY COMMISSION IS GOVERNED BY FIVE (5) ELECTED INDIVIDUALS WHO ASSIST RSVP WITH INCORPORATING EFFECTIVE AND PRACTICAL APPROACHES TO ENSURE THAT COMMUNITY CHALLENGES ARE MET AND LIVES ARE IMPROVED BY INTEGRATING SKILLFUL SENIOR VOLUNTEER CITIZENS.

FOR YEARS THE CITY OF CORPUS CHRISTI HAS BEEN A PROUD SPONSOR FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.  AN ESTIMATED 385 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE CITY OF CORPUS CHRISTI AND THE NUECES COUNTY COMMUNITIES.  HEALTHY FUTURES IS OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS REPORTING A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.  VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILY FOCUS AREA, VOLUNTEERS WILL MEASURE THE IMPACT OF ACTIVITIES THAT POSITIVELY IMPACT THE QUALITY OF VETERANS AND IMPROVE MILITARY FAMILY STRENGTHS.  DISASTER SERVICES FOCUS AREA, VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP INDIVIDUALS AND THE COMMUNITIES PREPARE, RESPOND, RECOVER, AND MITIGATE DISASTERS AND INCREASE COMMUNITY RESILIENCY.  OTHER COMMUNITY NEED PRIORITIES AND CAPACITY BUILDING VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE HOSPITALS, SCHOOLS, HOMELESS COMMUNITY, AND OTHER LOCAL AGENCIES WHOSE MISSION IS TO HELP EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT MAKING HEALTHY CHOICES FOR THEIR FAMILIES.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $100,844.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, RSVP OUTCOMES IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES WILL INCLUDE DOCUMENTED INCREASES IN THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS REPORTING A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.
FOR RSVP APPLICANTS IMPLEMENTING PROGRAMMING IN SPECIFIC GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREAS.

AN ESTIMATED 400 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 97 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES. THE REMAINING 303 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, AND RESPITE CARE.   THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FOOD SECURITY TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN THE EL PASO AREA.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE WEEKLY OR DAILY WELLNESS CALLS TO AREA SENIORS TO STRIVE AND REDUCE OR ELIMINATE ISOLATION AND INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT.  ADDITIONALLY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL OFFER TRANSPORTATION TO ASSIST LOCAL SENIORS IN ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE RESPITE CARE TO GIVE CAREGIVERS REGULAR BREAKS AND PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP FOR THE CARE RECIPIENT. THIS GRANT WILL ALIGN WITH THE CITY OF EL PASO?S STRATEGIC PLAN, GOAL 8:  TO NURTURE AND PROMOTE A HEALTHY, SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY. 
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $96,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $75,721 OF NON-FEDERAL CITY MATCH FUNDS AND BY $32, 469 OF STATE FUNDS FROM THE TEXAS STATE HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES.

RSVP OF GALVESTON COUNTY (RSVP) HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRANCH (UTMB) SINCE 2002. THIS PROGRAM SERVES GALVESTON COUNTY (TX-24), POPULATION 342,139 OF WHICH 14.9% ARE AGE 65 AND OLDER. RSVP IS OPERATED UNDER THE DIRECTION OF UTMB?S SEALY CENTER ON AGING (SCOA), LOCATED IN GALVESTON, TX. SCOA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE ELDERLY THROUGH RESEARCH, EDUCATION, COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION AND ADVOCACY. UTMB IS REQUESTING $50,000 TO RECRUIT AND SUPPORT APPROXIMATELY 173 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WITHIN GALVESTON COUNTY. 100% OF THE VOLUNTEERS ARE RECRUITED TO SERVE IN THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOCUS AREAS. RSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROJECTS IN THIS GRANT WILL ADDRESS: AGING IN PLACE; OBESITY AND FOOD; ELDER JUSTICE AND SCAM PREVENTION; VETERANS AND FAMILIES SERVED COLLECTIVELY THROUGH 14 ESTABLISHED VOLUNTEER STATIONS. COVID-19 HAS CAUSED MANY VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO STOP UTILIZING VOLUNTEERS IN PERSON AND ARE SEEKING NEW WAYS TO GLEAN THEIR HELP.    AGING IN PLACE (H4A)  VOLUNTEERS ASSIST SENIORS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME THROUGH CALLS, VISITS, TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR/GROCERY, OR ENGAGE THEM IN ADULT DAY SERVICE TO STIMULATE THEIR MIND. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO THE ELDERLY AND MEDICALLY FRAIL. OBESITY AND FOOD (H4A) - ORGANIZE AND/OR PARTICIPATE IN NUTRITION EDUCATION, INFORMATION DISSEMINATION AND SERVICE PROGRAMS SUCH AS FOOD BANKS AND GARDENING PROGRAMS TEACHING HOW TO PLANT/EAT HEALTHY VEGETABLES. WE ARE COLLABORATING WITH A LOCAL CHEF TO CREATE MENUS OF EASY TO PREPARE MEALS THAT ADULTS AND CHILDREN CAN PREPARE.    ACCESS TO CARE (H4A) - PROVIDE LEARNING EXPERIENCES DESIGNED TO ENABLE/REINFORCE POSITIVE HEALTH BEHAVIORS. ACTIVITIES MAY BE IN-PERSON, BY PHONE, OR VIA COMPUTER ACCESS TO PROVIDE WORKSHOPS, HEALTH AWARENESS HANDOUTS AND INSTRUCTIONAL SESSIONS. HEALTH INFORMATION PROVIDED IN SPANISH AND ENGLISH. TOPICS INCLUDE OPIOID ABUSE, FRAUD/SCAMS, ELDER ABUSE, AND GENERAL HEALTH INFORMATION TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE AMONG GALVESTON COUNTY RESIDENTS, TARGETING DIVERSE COMMUNITIES.    VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES SERVED (V1) - THROUGH VA CLINIC IN GALVESTON COUNTY, THE GULF COAST CENTER VETERAN SUPPORT SERVICES, LIBBIE'S PLACE SENIOR DAY PROGRAM AND ELK'S LODGE #126, RSVP VOLUNTEERS HELP WITH  APPOINTMENT REMINDERS,ANNOUNCING VETERAN PEER SUPPORT GROUP MEETINGS, RECRUITING VETERANS TO HELP VOLUNTEER, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO MEETINGS AND RESPOND TO NEEDS IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE VETERAN'S COURT. THE NEEDS OF HOMELESS VETERANS WILL ALSO BE ADDRESSED. "PEACE AND NONVIOLENCE" CLASSES ARE HELD ONCE A MONTH TO INCARCERATED VETERANS AT THE GALVESTON COUNTY JAIL, REACHING APPROXIMATELY 20 TO 25 PARTICIPANTS IN EACH CLASS.

TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER (TTUHSC) GARRISON INSTITUTE ON AGING (GIA) IS THE CORNERSTONE OF THE TTUHSC AGING INITIATIVE. TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER GARRISON INSTITUTE ON AGING IS A UNIQUE ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY AGING THROUGH CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH IN ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE, DEMENTIA AND OTHER DISEASES RELATED TO AGING, AND THROUGH INNOVATIVE EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH OPPORTUNITIES OFFERED TO STUDENTS, HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS AND THE PUBLIC. TTUHSC GIA IS THE SPONSOR FOR LUBBOCK RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). LUBBOCK RSVP PLANS FOR AN ESTIMATED 578 VOLUNTEERS AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT CYCLE. OF THIS NUMBER, 451 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE HEALTHY FUTURES -AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE GRANT, WE EXPECT THAT HOMEBOUND PATIENTS ARE RECEIVING MORE DAILY MEALS TO COMPLETE THEIR NUTRITIONAL AND DIETARY NEEDS, AS WELL AS RECEIVE SOCIAL INTERACTION THAT THEY WOULD HAVE OTHERWISE NOT RECEIVED WITHOUT THE LUBBOCK MEALS ON WHEELS (LMOW) PROGRAM. THE H9A EXPECTED OUTCOME WILL BE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. WE EXPECT LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, HOMELESS, FAMILIES WITH YOUNG CHILDREN AND SENIORS TO REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY THROUGH OUR FOOD BASKET/VOUCHER SITES. THE H12 OUTCOME WILL BE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. WE ALSO EXPECT INDIVIDUALS WITH CANCER AND TERMINAL ILLNESSES, AND THEIR FAMILIES, TO REPORT AN INCREASE IN THE AMOUNT OF SOCIAL SUPPORT RECEIVED (H9A OUTCOME) THROUGH OUR HOSPICE LOCATIONS AND AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY -- HOPE LODGE. OTHER FOCUS AREAS FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDE VETERANS, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND CAPACITY BUILDING AND LEVERAGE. SURVEY'S, QUESTIONNAIRES, AGENCY DATA/LOGS AND SIGN-UP SHEETS WILL BE USED TO MEASURE EFFECTIVENESS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,935.

AN ESTIMATED UNDUPLICATED 123 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 122 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP BY DELIVERING MEALS ON WHEELS AND PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION. MITIGATING FINANCIAL EXPLOITATION WITH EDUCATION FOR SENIOR CITIZENS. PREPARING TAXES FOR ELDERLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED. SERVING AT FOOD BANKS. REDUCING PRESCRIPTION DRUG AND OPIOID ABUSE BY EDUCATING COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDING MEDICATION DISPOSAL MATERIAL. INCREASING OLDER ADULT ENGAGEMENT AND SCHOOL READINESS IN PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE THAT 40% OF RECIPIENTS SURVEYED WILL REPORT AN OVERALL POSITIVE IMPACT ON THEIR SOCIAL TIES AND FEELINGS OF SATISFACTION WITH THEIR LIVES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $122,500.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE REQUIRED 30% NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $52,500.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. COST PER UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED WORK PLANS IS $1,000.  THE OTHER VOLUNTEER IS IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND MUST BE ENTERED IN THE TARGETS IN EGRANTS.

INCA COMMUNITY SERVICES IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1965 AS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY SERVING SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA. IN 1985 INCA WAS AWARDED THE RSVP GRANT SERVING CARTER, JOHNSTON, AND MURRAY COUNTIES, THEN IN 2018 WERE AWARDED ADDITIONAL COUNTIES THAT EXPANDED THE SERVICE AREA TO INCLUDE THE UNSERVED COUNTIES OF ATOKA, COAL, GARVIN, LOVE, MARSHALL, AND PONTOTOC IN SOUTH-CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. INCA-RSVP WORKS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS THE SERVICE AREA TO HELP SERVE THE GROWING NUMBER OF OLDER PEOPLE IN CRISIS EVERY DAY. OUR WORK INVOLVES INVESTING IN INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO CONNECT STRUGGLING SENIORS WHO ARE 55 AND OLDER TO PROGRAMS, RESOURCES, AND BENEFITS TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR LIVES IN OUR FOUR IMPACT AREAS: HUNGER, COMPANIONSHIP, OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION, AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS. INCA-RSVPS INITIATIVES IN THE KEY IMPACT AREAS, FOCUS ON SUPPORTING THE TOP IDENTIFIED NEEDS AND SERVICE/VOLUNTEER NEED GAPS THAT EXIST IN OUR COMMUNITY, THAT SUPPORT INCAS AND OTHER LOCAL SERVICE PROVIDERS' CRITICAL MISSIONS. INCA, AS A COMMUNITY ACTION PROVIDER, UNDERSTANDS THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND CONTINUES TO IDENTIFY, AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO MEET THOSE NEEDS. WITH A PRESENCE IN 9 COUNTIES, INCA-RSVP IS WELL-POSITIONED TO REACH RURAL OLDER ADULTS WHERE THEY LIVE AND NAVIGATE ISSUES THAT ARE EITHER OF CONCERN OR OF VALUE TO THEM. 

AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 210 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH EMPHASIS ON ACCESS TO FOOD THROUGH PANTRY SUPPORT. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 72 UNDUPLICATED INCA-RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT. THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT OF THE FOOD PANTRY SERVICES, AT LEAST 1,200 PEOPLE WILL RECEIVE SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD, AND 800 WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENTS IN FOOD SECURITY. THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT WILL BE MEASURED BY PRE/POST SURVEYS OF THE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $127,500  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY SPONSOR SUPPORT AND IN-KIND DONATIONS TO MEET THE REQUIRED YEARLY MATCH OF 30 PERCENT. 

INCA-RSVP ANTICIPATES THAT 250 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN THE FOLLOWING ROLES IN OUR COMMUNITY: 159 IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, 51 IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, AND 40 IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS AS IDENTIFIED THROUGH INFORMATION FROM INPUT FROM THE RSVP ADVISORY COUNCIL AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. 

OUR HEALTHY FUTURES VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING ACCESS TO FOOD, SUPPORT SERVICE, COMPANIONSHIP, AND/OR REFERRALS TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER. EPISODIC VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDE: MEAL-PACKING EVENTS, MEAL PREPARATION, AND DELIVERY, AND DAYS OF SERVICE. ONGOING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES MAY INCLUDE: NUTRITION AND USDA INCENTIVE PROGRAMS AND NUTRITION EDUCATION. INCA-RSVPS HEALTHY FUTURES INITIATIVES WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS GAINING OR INCREASING ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, WITH 72 VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN WORK PLANS THAT WILL GENERATE AN OUTCOME FOR BENEFICIARIES REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY VIA A SURVEY INSTRUMENT. WITHIN THE LAST YEAR, INCA-RSVPS END HUNGER ACTIVITIES SERVED OVER 15,000 MEALS AND DISTRIBUTED MORE THAN 5,400 COMMODITY SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD (CSFP) BOXES TO LOW INCOME, OLDER ADULTS IN OUR NINE-COUNTY RURAL SERVICE AREA.

LAFAYETTE COUNTY RSVP IS SPONSORED BY THE OXFORD PARK COMMISSION.  THE OXFORD PARK COMMISSION (OPC) IS PART OF THE CITY OF OXFORD GOVERNMENTAL STRUCTURE.  THE OXFORD PARK COMMISSION STRIVES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR CITIZENS OF OXFORD AND LAFAYETTE COUNTY BY PROVIDING PROFESSIONALLY DESIGNED COMPREHENSIVE, RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.  TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, THE OPC PROVIDES DIVERSITY IN PROGRAMMING OPPORTUNITIES TO MEET THE CHANGING NEEDS AND INTERESTS AND BEHAVIORS THAT PROMOTE A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE AND ENCOURAGES THE DEVELOPMENT OF POSITIVE ATTITUDES REGARDING PARTICIPATION AND SPORTSMANSHIP.  RSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AND AGING IN PLACE.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD, ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY CLASSES AND SUPPORT FOR INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT THROUGH EDUCATIONAL TRAINING, AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR IMPROVED CAPACITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  THE PROGRAM IS REQUESTING FUNDING FROM CNCS IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 WITH NON-FEDERAL MATCH AND EXCESS RESOURCES TOTALING $136,207.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICE OR SUPPORT TO 37 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THROUGH A VARIETY OF SERVICE ACTIVITIES WITH 76 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND A MINIMUM OF 153 TOTAL VOLUNTEERS.   VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA BY SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS VIRTUALLY OR IN-PERSON WITH STUDENTS IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND HEAD START.

SMILE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY PROPOSES TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT BY PROVIDING SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE AGENCY, INCORPORATED IN 1968 TO ADDRESS POVERTY AS PART OF THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT, HAS SERVED MORE THAN FIVE DECADES AS A LEADING PROVIDER OF SOCIAL SERVICES THAT PROMOTES INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS IN SOUTH LOUISIANA.
   THROUGH RSVP, SMILE WILL PLACE 258 VOLUNTEERS AT WORK STATIONS ACROSS LAFAYETTE PARISH, INCLUDING THE PARISH SEAT AND METROPOLITAN HUB LAFAYETTE, AND ITS SMALLER ADJACENT CITIES AND TOWNS, WHICH ARE MORE RURAL IN NATURE. BY UTILIZING A CADRE OF COMMITTED VOLUNTEERS, SMILE WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE COMMUNITY THAT STILL EXPERIENCES POCKETS OF POVERTY COMPOUNDED BY THE ECONOMIC FALLOUT OF COVID-19, WHICH HAS DRASTICALLY IMPACTED THE OIL INDUSTRY AND TOURISM IN REGION THAT IS POPULAR GLOBALLY FOR ITS UNIQUE CULTURES, CUISINE, MUSIC AND TRADITIONS. ACCORDING TO RECENT CENSUS FIGURES, LAFAYETTE PARISH'S POVERTY RATE IS 15.3%, BUT THIS WAS BEFORE THE ECONOMIC DEVASTATION FROM COVID-19 COMPOUNDED RECENTLY BY HURRICANE LAURA. WHILE THE CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE MADE LANDFALL ABOUT AN HOUR AND HALF AWAY IN LAKE CHARLES, LAFAYETTE PARISH WAS IMPACTED, PARTICULARLY AS LAKE CHARLES EVACUEES SEEK RELOCATION AND ASSISTANCE.
   SMILE'S BUDGET FOR THIS APPLICATION TOTALS $89,158, INCLUDING FEDERAL FUND OF $50,000 (70%) AND NON-FEDERAL FUNDS OF $3,152 (34%).

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE TRI COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM SERVICE AREA OF COLUMBIA, UNION AND OUACHITA COUNTIES, ARKANSAS.  OF THIS NUMBER, 126 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS TO MEDICAL FACILITIES AND THE GROCERY STORE TO PROMOTE AGING IN PLACE, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, EDUCATING SENIOR ADULTS ON RECOGNIZING AND SAFELY AVOIDING POTENTIAL SCAMS, ASSISTING WITH COLLECTING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD ITEMS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, TUTORING ADULT STUDENTS WHO DESIRE TO IMPROVE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS TO OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT AND/OR PREPARE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION, AND INCOME TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $125,914 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $55,820 IN OTHER RESOURCES.

STUTTGART CHAMBER OF COMMERCE OF COMMERCE WAS FOUNDED IN 1940 AS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION WITH THE MISSION OF PUTTING STUTTGART ON THE MAP.  IN ITS MORE THAN 70 YEARS AS AN ADVOCATE OF AREA BUSINESS, THE STUTTGART CHAMBER OF COMMERCE HAS ESTABLISHED STUTTGART AS AN ECONOMIC LEADER IN SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS.  YOU COULD SAY THE STUTTGART CHAMBER OF COMMERCE WORKS ON THOSE ISSUES THAT AFFECT THE "QUALITY OF LIFE" IN OUR COMMUNITY WITH VOLUNTEERS BEING A CRITICAL PIECE IN OUR COMMUNITY.
 
IN JULY OF 1973 THE STUTTGART CHAMBER OF COMMERCE RECEIVED THEIR FIRST RSVP GRANT WITH THE FISCAL YEAR STARTING IN JANUARY OF 1974.  WITH A ESTIMATED 468 SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ARKANSAS, JEFFERSON, MONROE AND PHILLIPS COUNTIES IN SOUTHEAST REGION OF ARKANSAS, A RURAL AREA TYPICALLY KNOWN AS THE "ARKANSAS DELTA."  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $179,575 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $77,772 TOTAL BUDGET OF $257,347.   

SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP'S SPONSOR WILL SERVE ARKANSAS, JEFFERSON, MONROE, AND PHILLIPS COUNTIES IN ALL SERVICE CATEGORIES WITH THE MAJORITY OF VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN HEALTHY FUTURES AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS.  SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP, BUILDING ON  THEIR EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS WHILE BUILDING ON AN EVIDENCE BASED  WORK PLAN MODEL THROUGH EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH UNITED WAY OF SOUTHEAST  ARKANSAS, AMERICAN RED CROSS, OFFICE OF EMERGENCY SERVICES, TRI DELTA FOOD MINISTRIES, AND THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY COMMISSION, WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF HEALTHY FUTURES ACTIVITIES.  HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, PROVIDING SUPPORT SERVICES, AND EDUCATION TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM FOOD INSECURITY. VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDE: FOOD INSECURITY MEASURES, FINANCIAL COUNSELING, MEAL PACKING, DISTRIBUTING FOOD, PROVIDE IN-HOME AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO VETERANS, DISABLED AND THE ELDERLY INCREASING FOOD SECURITY VIA A SURVEY INSTRUMENT. 

MISSION STATEMENT
THE MISSION OF  THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF THE SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP SERVING (ARKANSAS, JEFFERSON, MONROE AND PHILLIPS COUNTIES) IN SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS IS TO PROVIDE A VARIETY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS AGE 55 AND OLDER, TO ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH SIGNIFICANT VOLUNTEER SERVICES WHILE STRENGTHENING OF BOTH SELF AND COMMUNITIES.

RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS PROPOSES TO UTILIZE 505 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED AND PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
1.)	ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP (PRIMARY FOCUS AREA) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN NATIONAL PARKS AND COMMUNITY GARDENS WHERE GROUNDS AND NATURAL HABITAT ARE WELL MAINTAINED.
2.)	HEALTHY FUTURES -  ELDER JUSTICE, THIS AREA WILL FOCUS ON EDUCATING BENEFICIARIES IN HEALTHCARE FRAUD AND ABUSE THROUGH THE SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL (SMP) IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ON SCAMS THAT ARE PLAGUING OUR SENIOR POPULATION. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE IN FOOD BANKS AND PANTRIES.
3.)	VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES - RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP ANSWER THE NEEDS OF TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM HOSPITALS AND VA CLINICS SO DISABLED VETERANS CAN KEEP NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS.
4.)	EDUCATION - RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AS MENTORS FOR STUDENTS WHO STRUGGLE WITH READING AND MATH SKILLS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO HELP ADULTS WHO HAVE CHALLENGES WITH ENGLISH SKILLS, HAVE PROBLEMS WITH LANGUAGE BARRIERS, AND NEED HELP IN FINDING JOBS. THIS WOULD INCLUDE VETERANS AND LOW-INCOME FAMILIES.
5.)	OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICES - RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN LOCAL HOSPITALS, SENIOR CENTERS, AND NURSING HOMES (WHEN ALLOWED DUE TO COVID-19) TO HELP HEALTHCARE ADMINISTRATORS WITH PATIENTS, ACTIVITIES AND OFFICE DUTIES. AT THE END OF THIS 3-YEAR GRANT, RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL MEET THE REQUIREMENTS, OUTCOMES AND NEEDS OF EACH WORK PLAN PRESENTED IN THIS GRANT.
THE CNCS SHARE OF $152,866 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY RESOURCES GENERATED OVER THE YEARS THAT ALLOW US TO EXCEED THE 10% MATCH REQUIREMENT. WE ARE PROUD THAT YEAR ONE OF THIS GRANT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $45,860 (30%) OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL SURVEY THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY IN COLLABORATION WITH PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE 4-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF PULASKI, SALINE, LONOKE AND GARLAND. COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMS TO NAME A FEW INCLUDE THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, VA HEALTHCARE HOSPITALS AND CENTERS, SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN THE 4-COUNTY AREA, AND NATIONAL PARKS.

AN ESTIMATED 238 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN CLAY, CRAIGHEAD, CRITTENDEN, CROSS, GREENE, JACKSON, LAWRENCE, MISSISSIPPI, POINSETT, RANDOLPH, ST. FRANCIS, WHITE, AND WOODRUFF COUNTIES IN ARKANSAS BY MARCH 31, 2021. WE HAVE ALREADY MET THIS GOAL WITH 238 VOLUNTEERS AT THE WRITING OF THIS APPLICATION. ARKANSAS IS RANKED FIFTH IN THE NATION FOR FOOD INSECURITY ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENT USDA RESEARCH. SINCE THIS IS A DOCUMENTED NEED IN OUR COMMUNITIES, THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE NEA ARCARE RSVP PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES BECAUSE OF ITS FOCUS ON INCREASING HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY FOR RESIDENTS THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS HELPING TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD. ACCORDING TO AR KIDS READ, 7 IN 10 ARKANSAS FOURTH GRADERS DON?T READ PROFICIENTLY. BECAUSE SCHOOL READINESS AND READING PROFICIENCY STARTS EARLY, A SECONDARY FOCUS FOR THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH AN EMPHASIS ON LITERACY IN ORDER TO COMBAT THE CURRENT LOW READING SCORES AND ARM OUR CHILDREN WITH THE TOOLS NEEDED FOR A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO MAINTAIN OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS AS A FOCUS AREA FOR OUR COMMUNITIES SO NEA ARCARE RSVP IS ABLE TO ADDRESS SPECIFIC NEEDS THAT MAY NOT FIT INTO PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS. EXAMPLES OF THESE PROJECTS ARE THE ARCARE AUXILIARY, SUPPORT FOR SENIOR CITIZEN WORKOUT PROGRAMS, AND VOLUNTEER POSITIONS SERVING SENIOR CENTERS OUTSIDE OF FOOD SECURITY SERVICES. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PARTNERING WITH STATE AND LOCAL PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND SOCIAL SUPPORT TO HOMEBOUND ADULTS OR DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND/OR REFERRALS TO LOW-INCOME, UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER, WORK TO INCREASE LITERACY WITH CHILDREN IN HEAD START PROGRAMS, AND WORK IN SHORT- TERM OR SPECIFIC PROJECTS TO MEET OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS PROVIDED SUPPORT, SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND/OR REFERRALS TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THOSE OF THEIR HOUSEHOLD, CHILDREN PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS LITERACY SKILLS, AND IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL BE MET BY VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $93,795 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,675 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 750 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 256 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE OPERATING VITA (VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE) AND TCE (TAX COUNSELING FOR THE ELDERLY) SITES OFFERING FREE PREPARATION AND ELECTRONIC FILING OF FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS FOR SENIORS AND FAMILIES WITH MODEST INCOMES; PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO PERSONS WITH MEDICARE (BOTH AGED AND DISABLED); AND REDUCING HUNGER. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PREPARING AND FILING INCOME TAX RETURNS RESULTING IN $5 MILLION IN REFUNDS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $255,882 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $109,878 IN MATCHING FUNDS.

AN ESTIMATED 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE CRANSTON COMMUNITY.  OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FINANCIAL FRAUD PREVENTION, FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, CLASSROOM SUPPORT, SERVICE LEARNING, NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT AND TRANSPORTATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 75% OF THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATED IN A SERVICE ACTIVITY WILL HAVE IMPROVED FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE, DEMONSTRATED GAINS IN SCHOOL KNOWLEDGE, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND/OR ENVIRONMENTALLY-CONSCIOUS PRACTICES, INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AND HAVE REPORTED A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $43,995 OF LOCAL MUNICIPAL FUNDING.

ORANGE COUNTY RSVP, SPONSORED BY THE ORANGE COUNTY OFFICE FOR THE AGING, WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 525 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING EACH YEAR FROM 2021-2024.  FEDERAL FUNDING REQUESTED FOR THIS PROJECT ($75,000) WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT ALIGN WITH THE RSVP NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND CAPACITY BUILDING, WITH HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE AS OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.  284 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PRIORITY OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WHICH INCLUDE: MEAL DELIVERY TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP, HOME VISITS AND SHOPPING FOR ISOLATED SENIORS, EMERGENCY FOOD SUPPORT INCLUDING FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT FOOD PANTRIES, DISTRIBUTION OF ACCESS TO CARE HEALTH INFORMATION, TAX COUNSELING AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.  BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER 738,000 MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, ASSIST 1,071 SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL/HEALTH APPOINTMENTS, PROVIDE FRIENDLY VISITS OR COMPANIONSHIP TO 540 SENIORS, CONTRIBUTE EFFORTS TO REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY FOR 2,100 HOUSEHOLDS, PROVIDE INFORMATION AND GUIDANCE REGARDING INCREASED ACCESS TO CARE TO 1,000 SENIORS AND IMPROVE AND SUSTAIN 35 ACRES OF COUNTY PARK LAND.  THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,048 OF ANTICIPATED NON-FEDERAL LEVERAGED RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 179 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HERKIMER COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT ONE OF EIGHT EMERGENCY FEEDING PROGRAMS AND ONE FOOD CO-OP; MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION OF THE FRAIL ELDERLY, DISABLED, AND VETERANS TO DOCTOR AND HEALTH RELATED APPOINTMENTS; COMPANIONSHIP AND SERVICES FOR THE HOMEBOUND, ISOLATED ELDERLY, AND VETERANS SO THEY MAY REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR HOMES; DISTRIBUTION OF MATERIALS AND ENROLLMENTS FOR CLIENTS NEEDING MEDICARE HEALTH INSURANCE AND PRESCRIPTION COVERAGE; EDUCATE AND PROMOTE AWARENESS OF OPIOID ABUSE; AND PROMOTE THE EMPOWERMENT OF OLDER ADULTS TO MAKE POSITIVE HEALTHY CHOICES FOR THEMSELVES THROUGH THE EVIDENCE BASED WISE(WELLNESS INITIATIVE FOR SENIOR EDUCATION) PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, CLIENTS ASSISTED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL REPORT INCREASED HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY; THE ISOLATED ELDERLY, DISABLED, AND VETERANS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, TOGETHER WITH AN ABILITY TO MAINTAIN AND/OR IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH STATUS AND AGE-IN-PLACE; SENIORS WILL EXPERIENCE IMPROVED MEDICAL AND PRESCRIPTION COVERAGE AFFORDING THEM ACCESS TO CARE AND THE WISE PARTICIPANTS WILL IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL HEALTH AND HEALTH CARE BEHAVIOR WHICH INCLUDES MEDICATION MANAGEMENT. VOLUNTEERS WILL ACCEPT ASSIGNMENTS IN ONE OF TWENTY-FIVE STATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT HERKIMER COUNTY, INCLUDING THE TOWNS OF HERKIMER, ILION, FRANKFORT, NEWPORT, DOLGEVILLE, LITTLE FALLS, OLD FORGE, VANHORNESVILLE, AND WEST WINFIELD. ONE STATION, LOCATED IN ONEIDA COUNTY, HAS A SATELLITE OFFICE IN HERKIMER COUNTY WHERE OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $51,344 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE VOLUNTEER TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (VTC), TAX COUNSELING FOR THE ELDERLY (TCE), NATIONAL DIABETES PREVENTION PROGRAM (NDPP) CLASSES, AND POWERFUL TOOLS FOR CAREGIVERS CLASSES (PTC). VTC VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS, IMPROVING ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, INCREASING SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVING BENEFICIARIES? CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. TCE VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPROVE THE FINANCIAL STABILITY OF BENEFICIARIES ENGAGED THROUGH THE DOLLAR VALUE OF THE RETURNS GENERATED.  NDPP LEADERS PROVIDE EVIDENCE BASED LESSONS DEVELOPED BY THE CDC TO FACILITATE CHANGES IN BENEFICIARY BEHAVIOR WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING HEALTH.  PTC LEADERS WILL PROVIDE EVIDENCE BASED LESSONS AND PROVIDE SOCIAL SUPPORT TO CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WAYNE COUNTY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. RSVP WILL: (1) SUPPORT 40 VTC VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE RIDES FOR 100 UNDUPLICATED SENIOR CITIZEN BENEFICIARIES, AND 80% OF THOSE BENEFICIARIES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORT AND ABILITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; (2) 10 TCE VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE $400,000 IN TAX RETURNS FOR BENEFICIARIES ENGAGED; (3) 5 NDPP CLASS LEADERS WILL PROVIDE ONE ANNUAL CYCLE OF  CLASSES TO 20 UNDUPLICATED BENEFICIARIES AND 80% WILL SHOW A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR, OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH; (4) 5 PTC VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE ANNUAL CYCLE OF CLASSES FOR 20 UNDUPLICATED BENEFICIARIES AND 80% WILL SHOW AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORT; (4) 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE IN OTHER DIVERSE SITES, INCLUDING AN ESTIMATED 10 VOLUNTEERS LEADING BONE BUILDERS AND A MATTER OF BALANCE CLASSES ON A REGULAR BASIS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $28,674 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

FOR 70 YEARS, VOLUNTEER NEW YORK! (AKA VOLUNTEER CENTER) HAS BEEN THE ONE-STOP RESOURCE DEVOTED TO INCREASING VOLUNTEERISM IN WESTCHESTER COUNTY, NY.  SINCE 1974, VOLUNTEER NEW YORK! HAS BEEN THE SOLE SPONSOR OF RSVP OF WESTCHESTER. RSVP OF WESTCHESTER WILL CONNECT 850 OLDER ADULTS WITH VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT ADDRESS PRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS.  OF THE 850 VOLUNTEERS, 744 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING, COMPANIONSHIP, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION, JOB TRAINING, AND FOOD SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS GRANT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,060 OF CHILDREN WILL IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS THROUGH TUTORING AND MENTORING, AT LEAST 280 WILL ENROLL IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION, AND 400 WILL EARN A POST-SECONDARY DEGREE THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF 326 DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS.  THE SECONDARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES TO SUPPORT THE GROWING POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS, MANY OF WHO AGE IN PLACE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. AND RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPROVE THEIR OWN LIVES AS THEY STAY ACTIVE AND ENGAGED, AND FEEL USEFUL AND VALUED.  
OUR EFFORTS TO SUPPORT THE WESTCHESTER COMMUNITY INCLUDE EXAMINING PRACTICES TO REMOVE STRUCTURAL RACIAL INEQUITIES, ADVANCE EQUALITY, AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES IN COMMUNITIES THAT FACE LONGSTANDING BARRIERS AND CHALLENGES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $114,234 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $75,230 IN MATCHING FUNDS, $63,863 VIA A GRANT FROM THE WESTCHESTER COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR PROGRAMS & SERVICES; $6367 FROM THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR THE AGING; AND $5000 FROM A GRANT FROM THE TD CHARITABLE FOUNDATION.

AT THE COMPLETION OF THE THREE-YEAR FUNDING PERIOD, AN ANTICIPATED TOTAL OF 403 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS: 7 FRIENDLY CALL VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE AND SUPPORT 14 ISOLATED SENIORS; 10 TAX AIDES WILL COUNSEL AND PREPARE TAX RETURNS FOR 1,790 SENIORS AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS; 2 LITERACY VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR 4 ADULTS WHO WILL OBTAIN THEIR HSE OR ENROLL IN A SECONDARY EDUCATION PROGRAM; 10 YOUTH MENTOR VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST 20 AT-RISK YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH MENTORSHIP AND INSTRUCTIONAL TRAINING; 8 OSWEGO TREE STEWARDS WILL IMPROVE 4 MILES OF LAND BY PLANTING NEW TREES; 12 VOLUNTEERS WILL PULL INVASIVE WATER CHESTNUT FROM LOCAL BODIES OF WATER, IMPROVING 4 MILES OF WATERWAYS; 3 RICE CREEK FIELD STATION VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPROVE 1 MILE OF WALKING TRAILS AND ASSIST THE STATION IN MAINTAINING THEIR HERB GARDEN; 69 OSTEO BONE BUILDERS, TAI JI QUAN: MOVING FOR BETTER BALANCE, AQUATIC EXERCISE AND SIX STEPS TO BETTER BALANCE INSTRUCTORS WILL TEACH AND EDUCATE 545 EXERCISE CLASS PARTICIPANTS, DECREASING THE RISK FOR FALLS, STRENGTHENING MUSCLES AND IMPROVING OVERALL HEALTH; 23 HOME-DELIVERED MEAL DRIVERS WILL DELIVER A HOT, NUTRITIOUS MEAL TO 2,000 ISOLATED SENIORS, INCREASING THEIR INDEPENDENCE; 15 CONGREGATE MEAL CENTER VOLUNTEERS WILL ENJOY A DELICIOUS MEAL WITH 200 SENIORS AT SENIOR DINING CENTERS; 85 FOOD PANTRY AND CO-OP VOLUNTEERS WILL INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR 25,000 INDIVIDUALS IN OSWEGO COUNTY; 25 MERRY STITCHERS AND SPRINGSIDE KNITTING CLUB MEMBERS WILL KNIT AND CROCHET HOSPITABLE ITEMS FOR 15 VETERANS AND HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS; 5 PUSH IT FORWARD VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE THESE ITEMS AND ASSIST VETERANS AND HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS; 3 DRIVER SAFETY INSTRUCTORS WILL EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON SAFE DRIVING; 7 VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON THE SERVICES RSVP OF OSWEGO COUNTY OFFERS; 9 SENIOR CAMPERS WILL PLAN AND IMPLEMENT TWO EDUCATIONAL AND FUN-FILLED DAYS OF SENIOR CAMP; AND 110 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OTHER PARTNERING AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS. 
THE APPLICANT IS THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION (RF) FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK (SUNY), RF IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT CORPORATION WHICH EXISTS TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES FOR SUNY INCLUDING MANAGING RESEARCH GRANTS AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS. THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS (ORSP) IS SUNY OSWEGO'S LOCAL RF OFFICE AND ADMINISTERS ALL SPONSORED PROGRAMS AT SUNY OSWEGO, INCLUDING RSVP OF OSWEGO COUNTY. RSVP OF OSWEGO COUNTY IS LOCATED WITHIN SUNY OSWEGO'S OFFICE OF BUSINESS AND COMMUNITY RELATIONS (OBCR). THE OBCR OVERSEES DAY-TO-DAY PROGRAM OPERATIONS, RSVP STAFF, AND PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE OF $75,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $105,799.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP OF SUFFOLK COUNTY, NEW YORK, HAS SERVED THE LONG ISLAND COMMUNITY FOR 48 YEARS, SINCE 1972.  AN ESTIMATED 804 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 786 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD SUPPORT, LEGAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, EDUCATION/TRAINING, AND COUNSELING SERVICE ACTIVITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH THE GOAL OF SUPPORTING THE INCREASING OLDER POPULATION AND HELPING THEM AGE IN PLACE AND HAVE ACCESS TO CARE. RSVP OF SUFFOLK WILL ALSO ADDRESS OTHER FOCUS AREAS INCLUDING EDUCATION THROUGH TUTORING AND MENTORING, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP TO SUPPORT LONG ISLAND'S ECOSYSTEM, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, CAPACITY BUILDING, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN LONG ISLAND, WE WILL DEPLOY THE SKILLS AND YEARS OF ACCUMULATED WISDOM AND DEDICATION OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 423 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND WILL IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR 5,943 PEOPLE: 2,628 PEOPLE WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; 2,880 WILL REPORT IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, AND 435 PEOPLE WILL REPORT IMPROVED HEALTH. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $111,467 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY SECURING FUNDING SOURCES PROVIDED ANNUALLY FROM COUNTY, STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES. $175,644 (FEDERAL PASS THRU) $22,899 (NON-FEDERAL) FROM THE SUFFOLK COUNTY OFFICE FOR THE AGING, $5,000 FROM THE TOWN OF EAST HAMPTON, $6,014 FROM THE NEW YORK OFFICE FOR THE AGING AND $38,213 FROM FUNDRAISING EFFORTS. THE TOWN OF EAST HAMPTON GIVES A $12,800 IN-KIND DONATION FOR THE USE OF OFFICE SPACE.

SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:

2. HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE SERVING IN ROLES FOR COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD DELIVERY, AND MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION.

6. ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP: IMPROVING TRAILS - AT-RISK ECOSYSTEMS
OUR PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR PROJECT EXPECTS TO REPORT THAT 60% OF SURVEYED CLIENTS OF FOOD PANTRIES AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION ORGANIZATIONS WILL BE REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  THE FRAIL ELDERLY, THE DISABLED AND ISOLATED SENIORS RECEIVING SUPPORTIVE SERVICES RELATING TO AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE, EMPOWERING 60% OF THESE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME.  THE CNCS FEDERAL ANNUAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000.00 SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,155.00 OF IN-KIND FUNDS, APPLICANT FUNDS, AND LOCAL FUNDS TOTALING $107,155.00.

OLD COLONY ELDER SERVICES (OCES) CURRENTLY SERVES AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SENIOR CORPS GRANT (PROJECT). THE PROJECT BECAME A SPONSORED PROGRAM OF OCES ON APRIL 1, 2015. OCES IS DESIGNATED AS ONE OF 25 PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AGING SERVICES ACCESS POINTS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS. THE MISSION OF OCES IS TO SUPPORT THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING ESSENTIAL INFORMATION AND SERVICES THAT PROMOTE HEALTHY AND SAFE LIVING. OCES' DYNAMIC PROGRAMMING, 47-YEAR HISTORY AND EXPERIENCE, AS WELL AS OUR COMMITMENT TO SUPPORT PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, CONTINUES TO PLACE US IN AN EXCELLENT POSITION TO MANAGE THIS PROJECT. OCES HAS A SIGNIFICANT PRESENCE IN THE COMMUNITY AND IS A REPUTABLE ORGANIZATION THAT PROFESSIONALS AND INDIVIDUALS TURN TO FIRST FOR ASSISTANCE, INFORMATION AND RESOURCES. THE PROJECT NAME WAS CHANGED IN 2017 TO RSVP OF PLYMOUTH COUNTY (RSVP-PC) TO BETTER REFLECT THE FULL SERVICE AREA. IT IS WELL KNOWN IN THE COMMUNITY THAT RSVP-PC IS SPONSORED BY OCES WHICH IS WHY IT HAS BEEN AS SUCCESSFUL AS IT HAS BEEN SINCE BEING ACQUIRED BY OCES. WE ARE PROUD TO HAVE A VOLUNTEER CENTER THAT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC ALLOWING VOLUNTEERS TO MEET VOLUNTEER PROGRAM STAFF AND PARTICIPATE IN VARIOUS TRAININGS SUCH AS IDENTIFYING FRAUD AND SCAMS, COMMUNITY SAFETY AND HONORING CHOICES - A PROGRAM TO EDUCATE PEOPLE ON DEFINING THEIR PREFERENCES ON END OF LIFE CARE. OCES HAS THE ABILITY TO INCREASE THE VISIBILITY OF OUR PROGRAMS THROUGH COMMUNITY OUTREACH SUCH AS BEING PRESENT AT HEALTH FAIRS AND OTHER COMMUNITY EVENTS. WE HAVE MORE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUCCESSFUL OUTREACH IN COMPARISON TO OTHER LOCAL AGENCIES DUE TO OUR DIVERSIFIED STAFF, VAST PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, AND HAVING A STRONG FOUNDATION OF BEING WELL KNOWN AND RESPECTED THROUGHOUT PLYMOUTH COUNTY. OCES IS REQUESTING FEDERAL INVESTMENT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOR OPPORTUNITY NUMBER MA-12 BEGINNING APRIL 1, 2021. AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 134 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS, PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION AND TUTORING STUDENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED SOCIALIZATION/QUALITY OF LIFE, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED FINANCIAL LITERACY, INCREASED TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS, INCREASED READING LEVELS/SKILLS FOR STUDENTS AND INCREASED VOLUNTEERISM TO ASSIST LOCAL AGENCIES TO DELIVER SERVICES IN THE COMMUNITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $133,632 (ANNUAL FEDERAL GRANT) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,271 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES) FOR A TOTAL ANNUAL BUDGET OF $190,903.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A SECONDARY FOCUS IN K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 22 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PANTRIES THAT ASSIST IN DISTRIBUTING FOOD, 25 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ALLOW INDEPENDENCE, 4 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH OUTREACH REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS TO INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE, AND 24 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP TUTOR STUDENTS WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING MATH AND READING SKILLS. FOR THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS, EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON INCREASING ACCESS TO EMERGENCY FOOD THROUGH VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING WITH EMERGENCY FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT LOCAL PANTRIES AND COMPLETING DAY TO DAY TASKS AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF PEOPLE WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED ELDERLY AND DISABLED. EACH INTERACTION WITH A HOME BOUND INDIVIDUAL WILL BE TRACKED BY THE VOLUNTEER AND A YEARLY SATISFACTION SURVEY WILL BE COMPLETED BY CLIENTS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF SENIORS REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ALSO, UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION, VOLUNTEERS, TRAINED THOUGH THE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT,  WILL EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE OPIOID CRISIS AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SECURING OR DESTROYING UNUSED PRESCRIBED PAIN MEDICATIONS THROUGH PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL PACKETS. SURVEYS WILL BE COMPLETED BY PARTICIPANTS WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. FOR A SECONDARY FOCUS, K-12 SUCCESS WILL PLACE VOLUNTEERS WITHIN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO HELP TUTOR STUDENTS IN MATH OR LITERACY WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF STUDENTS WITH INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN THOSE AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $10,333 MATCHING FUNDS AND $22,818 IN EXCESS OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM UWGKC.

WORKING AT THE NORTH 65 CENTER (SENIOR CENTER) WITH HOME DELIVERING MEALS, AND HELP TACKLE THE LIMITATIONS OF AGING, FIGHT OFF PARALYSIS OF ISOLATION BY CREATING A WELCOME ENVIRONMENT AND ENGAGEMENT IN FREE ACTIVITIES, CLASSES AND GROUPS. THESE ACTIVITIES FALL INTO OUR FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.

CENTRAL MISSOURI COMMUNITY ACTION IS A NON-PROFIT AGENCY THAT HAS SERVED AN EIGHT- COUNTY AREA IN MID-MISSOURI SINCE 1965 AND IS A PART OF A NATIONAL NETWORK OF COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES FOUNDED IN 1964. CMCA'S MISSION IS TO ?EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE SELF RELIANCE?. 
	CMCA WORKS WITH AUDRAIN, BOONE, CALLAWAY, COLE, COOPER, HOWARD, MONITEAU AND OSAGE COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MISSOURI.
	CMCA ADMINISTERS GRANT AWARDS FOR EARLY HEAD START, HEAD START, SECTION 8, COMMUNITY SERVICES BLOCK GRANT, WEATHERIZATION AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. 
	CENTRAL MISSOURI COMMUNITY ACTION (CMCA) IS CURRENTLY THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE CENTRAL MISSOURI FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM.  THE FGP PROGRAM SERVES 10 COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MISSOURI, INCLUDING COOPER COUNTY. CMCA HAS OPERATED THE FGP PROGRAM SINCE THE GRANT WAS AWARDED IN 1968.
	CMCA IS REQUESTING $75,000 TO FUND 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE IN COOPER COUNTY. CMCA PLANS TO HAVE ALL 75 VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME- BASED ASSIGNMENTS.
	THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY AND PROMOTING EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL SERVICES THROUGH THE SENIOR CENTER AND IN-HOME COMPANIONSHIP.
	THE SECONDARY FOCUS AREA IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY WITH ACTIVITIES THAT WILL INCLUDE FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, ADULT EDUCATION AND JOB READINESS.
	SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH VOLUNTEER STATIONS, VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS.  LOG SHEETS WILL BE USED TO ASSESS OUTCOMES FOR THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED ABOVE.
        AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, CMCA ANTICIPATES OUTCOMES THAT INCLUDE 50 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, 40 HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS WITH A REPORTED INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ADDITIONAL PLANS INCLUDE 300 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, 50 INDIVIDUALS WITH EDUCATION IN FINANCIAL LITERACY AND 50 INDIVIDUALS WITH IMPROVED JOB READINESS SKILLS.
	AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CMCA PLANS TO HAVE OUTCOMES ON 490 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING SERVICES AND AN IMPACT ON A MINIMUM OF 805 TOTAL INDIVIDUALS.
	THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE?S FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $7,500 OF NON-FEDERAL SHARE RESOURCES IN THE FIRST YEAR, INCREASING TO $22,500 BY THE THIRD YEAR.

THE BUTLER COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCE COUNCIL (BCCRC) SEEKS TO EXPAND THE RSVP PROGRAM INTO CARTER COUNTY, MO: VAN BUREN, ELSINORE, GRANDIN AND FREMONT. THE BUTLER COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCE COUNCIL EXISTS TO PROMOTE COORDINATION AND COOPERATION BETWEEN SOCIAL SERVICES PROVIDERS, CHURCHES, BUSINESS COMMUNITIES AND THE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM, IN ORDER TO EMPOWER FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS TO BECOME MORE SELF-RELIANT, RESPONSIBLE AND RESOURCEFUL. 
THE BCCRC HAS OVERSEEN THE BUTLER COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WHICH BEGAN IN 1973 AND HAS CONTINUED TO MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS IN BUTLER COUNTY, MO.  ONE HUNDRED AND TWENTY VOLUNTEERS SERVE LOW INCOME FAMILIES, SENIORS AND VETERANS IN TEN WORK STATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. OTHER FOCUS AREAS INCLUDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE AT 10 WORK STATIONS AND MEET NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY WHICH INCLUDE ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD AND FINANCIAL LITERACY.  
THIS CNCS GRANT WILL ENABLE THE BCCRC TO MEET THE NEEDS THROUGH EXPANSION INTO CARTER COUNTY WHICH WILL INCLUDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES (FINANCIAL LITERACY); OBESITY AND FOOD (INCREASED FOOD SECURITY); AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP (IMPROVING  PARKS AND RIVERWAYS). THE MAIN FOCUS AREA WILL BE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.
AT THE END OF THE 36-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD 250 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FREE TAX CONSULTATION AND PREPARATION AND THE ESTIMATED DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS GENERATED WILL BE $150,000.  APPROXIMATELY 75% OF INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES  SERVED WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; AND 10-15 MILES OF RIVER WAY AS PART OF THE OZARK NATIONAL SCENIC RIVERWAY WILL BE CARED FOR AND CLEANED UP TWICE A YEAR (SPRING AND FALL) . 
THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $22,500 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH WILL INCLUDE IN KIND DONATIONS AND LOCAL FUNDING.

THE LIBERTY PARKS & RECREATION DEPARTMENT (LPR) OF THE CITY OF LIBERTY A LOCAL MUNICIPALITY IN CLAY COUNTY MISSOURI (MO-14Y) IS PROPOSING TO IMPLEMENT A SENIOR CORPS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). OVER THE PROJECT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 200 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 75 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. LPR ALREADY HAS A HANDFUL OF VOLUNTEER-LED PROGRAMS IN PLACE THAT ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS: HEALTHY FUTURES, VETERANS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE RSVP OPPORTUNITY IS A WAY TO EXPAND OUR PROGRAMS AND SHARE OUR STORIES AND SUCCESSES AS PART OF THE SENIOR CORPS NETWORK.
     SOME OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA WILL INCLUDE ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY WITH OUR HUMAN FOOD DELIVERY FOR OUR MEALS ON WHEELS (MOW) PROGRAM, ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY WITH OUR PET FOOD DELIVERY MOW LOVES PETS TOO PROGRAM, OFFERING SOCIAL SUPPORT WITH OUR NEW MOW PHONE PAL PROGRAM, AND SUPPORTING EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS (EBP) WITHIN OUR HEALTH & WELLNESS DIVISION. IT IS WORTH MENTIONING THAT WE SERVE VETERANS AS A PART OF OUR CURRENT MOW PROGRAM. OTHER FOCUS AREAS INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP WITH AN EMPHASIS ON EDUCATION AS RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST LOCAL STUDENTS AND STAFF IN MAINTAINING PUBLIC LANDS AND CREATING A COMMUNITY GARDEN. 
     AS THE COUNTY SEAT, LIBERTY SERVES AS A HUB FOR SENIORS FROM THE SUBURBS AND RURAL AREAS TO GET INVOLVED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. LPR IS POWERED BY A TEAM OF DEDICATED PROFESSIONALS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO COMMUNITY IMPACT, IMPROVEMENT, AND INNOVATION. WE BELIEVE THAT CREATING COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS BY PROVIDING THE HIGHEST QUALITY PARKS, PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND FACILITIES IS ESSENTIAL TO A PROSPEROUS AND HEALTHY COMMUNITY. OUR WORK INCLUDES RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND SUPPORTING A ROBUST TEAM OF VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 AND OLDER TO SERVE THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. MANY OF THE PROGRAMS IN OUR PLAN ARE CURRENTLY SUPPORTED BY VOLUNTEERS IN OUR COMMUNITY AND RESOURCES FROM OUR PARKS DEPARTMENT. RSVP WOULD ALLOW US TO INCREASE OUR CAPACITY AND MEET THE INCREASED NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY DUE TO COVID-19. THROUGH OUR EXPECTED CAPACITY BUILDING, WE WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS; INCREASE THE RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS ADDING ADDITIONAL STATIONS WITHIN OUR COUNTY. 
      WE EXPECT OUTCOMES FOR OUR PRIMARY FOCUS OF HEALTHY FUTURES TO INCLUDE: OVER 40,000 HOURS OF SERVICE TO MORE THAN 200 UNDUPLICATED RECIPIENTS. WE EXPECT THAT OF RECIPIENTS OF THESE VOLUNTEERS 90% WILL REPORT IMPROVED OVERALL HEALTH AND THAT THE PROGRAMS ALLOWED THEM TO AGE IN PLACE. WE ALSO EXPECT THAT 80% OF THOSE INVOLVED WITH EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS WILL REPORT A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH. OUR PLAN INTENDS TO ADDRESS FOUR OF THE CNCS FOCUS GROUPS WITH 10 PERFORMANCE MEASURED OUTCOMES. WE WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS WITH A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 AND SUPPLEMENTED WITH $54,134  PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF LIBERTY, PARKS & REC, AND PROGRAM PARTNERS.

SENIORAGE IS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING IS THE FIRST CALL FOR SENIOR SERVICES IN 17 COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST MISSOURI. IN THE 36 COMMUNITIES WE SERVE THROUGHOUT THE OZARKS, WE CURRENTLY HAVE 1386 VOLUNTEERS WORKING FOR THEIR COMMUNITIES IN A RANGE OF ACTIVITIES.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, OUR SERVICES HAVE BECOME EVEN MORE ESSENTIAL. OUR HEALTHY FUTURES PROGRAMMING HAS BEEN A CRITICAL LIFELINE FOR MISSOURI'S HOMEBOUND SENIORS THROUGH ONE OF OUR KEY FUNDING PRIORITIES: ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $74,960 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $8374 OF SENIORAGE FUNDS.

AS WE BEGIN TO REQUEST THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, WE NEED TO HIGHLIGHT THAT SINCE MID-MARCH 2020, COVID-19 HAD A DIRECT IMPACT ON OUR ABILITY TO CONTINUE NORMAL PROGRAM OPERATIONS AT INTERSERV.  OUT OF AN ABUNDANCE OF CAUTION, OUR AGENCY WAS CLOSED IN ORDER TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF THE DISEASE AND PROVIDE SOCIAL DISTANCING MEASURES.  WE DID, HOWEVER CONTINUE TO PROVIDE, IN A SOCIALLY DISTANT AND SAFE WAY, HEALTHY FUTURES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY SERVICES SUCH AS MOBILE MEALS, CONGREGATE MEALS FOR THE AGED, TAX COUNSELING FOR THE ELDERLY AND THE MEDICARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.  MOST OF OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WERE RESTRICTED BECAUSE OF AGE AND HEALTH REASONS, FROM WORKING THEIR NORMAL, ONE ON ONE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES.  WE ARE STILL, SAFELY INSTITUTING WAYS TO BRING BACK ALL OF OUR ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEER STAFF BY PERFORMING SOCIALLY DISTANT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MAKING PHONE CALLS, SENDING CARDS, SOCIALLY DISTANT MOBILE MEALS DELIVERY AND SOCIALLY DISTANT FOOD PANTRY WORK AMONGST OTHER DEVELOPING IDEAS.  

INTERFAITH COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. (INTERSERV) IS A 111-YEAR OLD HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY BRINGING PEOPLE TOGETHER IN SERVICE AND ADVOCACY TO HELP CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES AND SENIORS LIVE LIFE MORE FULLY AND CAPABLY. THREE COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST MISSOURI ARE SERVED, INCLUDING THE CITY OF ST. JOSEPH. THEY WILL HAVE 130 VOLUNTEERS WITH A REQUESTED ALLOCATION OF $47,500, WHILE INTERSERV WILL LEVERAGE RESOURCES TO PROVIDE AN ADDITIONAL $49,873. HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE CHOSEN PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING IN CAPACITIES INCLUDING: FOOD SECURITY, HEALTH ACCESSIBILITY AND AGING IN PLACE. OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE MET BY IMPLEMENTING AND PROMOTING VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMPANIONSHIP AND FOOD DELIVERY, WHICH WILL ASSIST HOMEBOUND AND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, SO THAT THEY REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ADDITIONALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FOOD PANTRIES WITH BOTH ACQUISITION AND DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD, WITH THE OUTCOME ACHIEVED OF INCREASING FOOD SECURITY WITHIN FAMILIES WHO RECEIVE THE SERVICES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST SENIORS WITH HEALTHCARE ACCESSIBILITY BY COUNSELING CLIENTS THROUGH MEDICARE PART D ENROLLMENTS.

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS) IS LOCATED IN NORTHEAST MISSOURI AND SERVES THE COUNTIES OF LEWIS, MACON, MARION, MONROE, RALLS, AND SHELBY. THE TOTAL GEOGRAPHIC AREA COVERED BY DCS IS 2,611 SQUARE MILES, WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 64,372. THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS PRIMARILY RURAL WITH THE LARGEST COMMUNITY BEING HANNIBAL, IN MARION COUNTY WITH A POPULATION OF 28,174. 

THE MEDIAN INCOME LEVEL FOR THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS $38,896. EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND HEALTH CARE EMPLOY THE GREATEST PERCENTAGE OF WORKING PEOPLE WHO ARE 16 YEARS AND OLDER. THIS IS FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY MANUFACTURING AND RETAIL TRADE INDUSTRIES. ALTHOUGH THE AREA HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN ACCEPTED AS HAVING AN AGRICULTURAL ECONOMIC BASE, SHELBY COUNTY IS NOW THE ONLY COUNTY WITH A SIGNIFICANT PERCENTAGE OF EMPLOYMENT IN AGRICULTURE. 

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES IS GOVERNED BY A 16-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH REPRESENTATION FROM THE FINANCIAL, EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND BUSINESS SECTORS, AS WELL AS REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE FIVE MAJOR DCS PROGRAMS.  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETS SEMI-MONTHLY IN HANNIBAL, MO.  THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS MONTHLY.

CLARK COUNTY MISSOURI IS LOCATED IN THE VERY NORTHEAST SECTION OF MISSOURI, BORDERING ON IOWA.  THE COUNTY SEAT IS KAHOKA.  OF THE 7,139 COUNTY POPULATION, 17% ARE OVER AGE 65.

     AN ESTIMATED 625 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 190 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE CITY OF ST CLOUD IS A LONG-STANDING PARTNER OF SENIORCORPS AND HAS SPONSORED THE GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RSVP SINCE 1973, SERVING BENTON, SHERBURNE, AND STEARNS COUNTIES.  THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY PUBLIC SERVICES FOR OUR RESIDENTS IN A COST EFFECTIVE, RESPONSIVE, INNOVATIVE AND PROFESSIONAL MANNER GIVEN THE CHANGING NEEDS AND RESOURCES AVAILABLE.  THE CITY OF ST CLOUD IS A REGIONAL HUB WITHIN CENTRAL MINNESOTA LOCATED JUST 65 MILES NORTHWEST OF MINNEAPOLIS-ST. PAUL.  THE CITY RESIDES IN THE COUNTIES OF BENTON, SHERBURNE, AND STEARNS, SITTING ADJACENT TO WRIGHT COUNTY.
THE GREATER ST CLOUD AREA RSVP PLAYS A VITAL ROLE IN THE LIVES OF SENIORS AND THE COMMUNITIES SERVED AS EVIDENCED BY OUR 98% APPROVAL RATING FROM ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN 2019 THAT INDICATED THEY WOULD RECOMMEND RSVP TO OTHERS. THE SAME SURVEY FOUND 96% OF OUR SENIORCORPS VOLUNTEERS FELT RSVP ALLOWED THEM TO BE INVOLVED IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEERISM.  ADDITIONALLY, OUR MOST RECENT CNCS PROGRESS SUMMARY REPORT INDICATED 130% SUCCESS IN SECURING RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS WHILE 129% UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVED IN PROGRAM OUTCOMES.  THE CITY OF ST CLOUD AND THE GREATER ST CLOUD AREA RSVP HAVE THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT BY EXTENDING OUR RSVP SERVICES INTO WRIGHT COUNTY IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER.     
AN ESTIMATED 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITIES OF WRIGHT COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL OPTIONS TO SUPPORT ACTIVE AND HEALTHY LIVES BY HELPING WITH FOOD PACKAGING, FOOD DELIVERY, AND ASSISTING WITH THE FOOD SELECTION PROCESSES, THUS SUPPORTING HEALTHY FUTURES.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE VIRTUALLY AND IN-PERSON AS ACADEMIC TUTORS AND READING MENTORS TO PROMOTE POSITIVE CHANGES IN STUDENT SILLS AND MINDSET WHILE CONTRIBUTING TO INCREASED EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS.   THE TWO PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 310 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY AND 240 K-12 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $12,943.00 IN LOCAL FUNDING FROM THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD.

COLBY COMMUNITY COLLEGE, COLBY, KANSAS IS THE SPONSOR FOR THE NORTHWEST KANSAS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. (RSVP). COLBY COMMUNITY COLLEGE HOLDS THE SPONSORSHIP OF THE RSVP PROGRAM IN HIGHEST REGARD. THE RSVP PROGRAM AND ACTIVITIES ARE NOT ONLY OF VITAL IMPORTANCE TO OUR COMMUNITIES SERVED AND THE RECIPIENTS OF OUR NUMEROUS PROJECTS, BUT ALSO OF EMINENT VALUE TO OUR VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES. THE MISSION OF THE NORTHWEST KANSAS RSVP IS TO CONNECT INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER, THEIR SKILLS AND TALENTS WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE. NORTHWEST KANSAS RSVP IS A MULTI-COUNTY PROGRAM WITH AN ESTIMATED 168 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THAT HAVE PROVIDED CONTINUOUS VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO THE RURAL CITIZENS OF THOMAS, LOGAN AND SHERIDAN AND PHILLIPS COUNTIES LOCATED IN FAR NORTHWEST KANSAS SINCE 1973, CURRENTLY WITH A TOTAL MULTI-COUNTY POPULATION OF 18,854. THE PROGRAM WAS DESIGNED FOR THE DUAL PURPOSE OF ENGAGING PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS; AND TO PROVIDE A HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF VOLUNTEERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO STRENGTHENING THEIR PROGRAM, THEIR COMMUNITIES AND THEMSELVES THROUGH THEIR INVOLVEMENT IN A PROGRAM THAT HAS PROVEN ITS SIGNIFICANCE THROUGH ITS REPUTATION. ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-EIGHT UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PROGRAM WITH FIFTY OF THOSE VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE TO A MULTITUDE OF NEEDS WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ENSURE HEALTHY FUTURES TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY, AND/OR DISABLED, VETERANS AND UNDERPRIVILEGED OF THE COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL MEALS AND ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD. A POSITIVE IMPACT IS ANTICIPATED AT THE END OF YEAR 3, AS THE AGING IN PLACE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL ENABLE FRAIL ELDERLY, AND/OR DISABLED, VETERANS TO MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE THROUGH AN INCREASE IN IMPROVED NUTRITIONAL QUALITY, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY ALLEVIATING LONG TERM HUNGER AND THE BENEFIT OF SOCIAL INTERACTION. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE $50,000 SUPPLEMENTED BY $24,821 LOCAL FUNDS.

THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER KANSAS CITY (UWGKC) AND THE UNITED WAY OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY (UWWC) RECENTLY MERGED (JULY 1, 2020) TO BETTER UNIFY AND SERVE THE REGION. UWWC HAS SPONSORED THE RSVP OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY SINCE 1977 AND UWGKC HAS A DEEP COMMITMENT TO VOLUNTEER SERVICES IN THE REGION AS WELL AS SUPPORTS PROGRAMS THAT DOVETAIL WITH RSVP PRIORITY AREAS. UWGKC?S MISSION IS TO MOBILIZE GREATER KANSAS CITY'S COLLECTIVE GENEROSITY FOR THE GREATEST GOOD. THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE A VITAL RESOURCE FOR MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS AND THE MERGER ALLOWS US TO EXPAND RSVP IN THE METRO AREA WITH RSVP OF JOHNSON COUNTY, KS. IT IS PROPOSED THAT A MINIMUM OF 150 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH THE REQUESTED FUNDS OF $82,500. OF THIS NUMBER, 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH THE ADDITIONAL 67 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION & COMPANIONSHIP, TUTORING STUDENTS, AND DISTRIBUTING EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL BAGS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A SECONDARY FOCUS IN K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 30 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PANTRIES THAT ASSIST IN DISTRIBUTING FOOD, 25 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ALLOW INDEPENDENCE, 4 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH OUTREACH REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS TO INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE, AND 24 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP TUTOR STUDENTS WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING MATH AND READING SKILLS. FOR THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS, EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON INCREASING ACCESS TO EMERGENCY FOOD THROUGH VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING WITH EMERGENCY FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT LOCAL PANTRIES AND COMPLETING DAY TO DAY TASKS AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF PEOPLE WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED ELDERLY AND DISABLED. EACH INTERACTION WITH A HOME BOUND INDIVIDUAL WILL BE TRACKED BY THE VOLUNTEER AND A YEARLY SATISFACTION SURVEY WILL BE COMPLETED BY CLIENTS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF SENIORS REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ALSO, UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION VOLUNTEERS, TRAINED THOUGH THE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT, WILL EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE OPIOID CRISIS AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SECURING OR DESTROYING UNUSED PRESCRIBED PAIN MEDICATIONS THROUGH PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL PACKETS. SURVEYS WILL BE COMPLETED BY PARTICIPANTS WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. FOR A SECONDARY FOCUS, K-12 SUCCESS WILL PLACE VOLUNTEERS WITHIN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO HELP TUTOR STUDENTS IN MATH OR LITERACY WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF STUDENTS WITH INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN THOSE AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $11,166 MATCHING FUNDS AND $24,463 IN EXCESS OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM UWGKC.

AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH YEAR. OF THIS NUMBER, 170 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 

MENTORING FOR EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS -- A) VOLUNTEERS READ WITH 4-YEAR-OLDS TO HELP THEM PREPARE FOR ENTRY INTO KINDERGARTEN, AND B) VOLUNTEERS GIVE LITERACY ASSISTANCE TO K-3RD-GRADE STUDENTS TO HELP THEM READ AT GRADE LEVEL.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL IOWA RSVP ANTICIPATES THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:
-IMPROVE EDUCATION AND GRADUATION RATES BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICES THROUGH MENTORING FOR EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO APPROXIMATELY 210 KIDS/STUDENTS. 
-IMPACT AND IMPROVE FAMILY FINANCIAL STABILITY BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICES THROUGH TAX COUNSELING (4,500 CLIENTS) AND TRANSPORTATION (150 CLIENTS). VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY 4,650 CLIENTS.
-STRENGTHEN AND IMPROVE OPERATING CAPACITY AT 15 OF OUR 28 RSVP STATIONS BY PROVIDING SERVICES SUCH AS CLERICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES, COMMUNICATION ASSISTANCE, HOSPICE SUPPORT, EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT, AND BLOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION.

EVEN IN THE CURRENT COVID-19 ENVIRONMENT, WHICH IS IMPACTING VOLUNTEER SERVICE PROGRAMS AROUND THE COUNTRY, OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE INSPIRED TO MEET THE NEEDS AND SERVE THE PEOPLE OF CENTRAL IOWA SAFELY IN THE UPCOMING YEAR AND BEYOND.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $89,323 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,133 FROM LOCAL AND STATE SOURCES.

INSPIRED TO SERVE. NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS ARE INSPIRED TO MEET THE NEEDS AND CHALLENGES IN OUR COMMUNITIES WHILE ADOPTING CHANGES AND DISCOVERING OPPORTUNITIES TO CONTINUE THE IMPORTANT WORK ACCOMPLISHED IN OUR SERVICE AREA, EVEN IN THE CURRENT COVID-19 ENVIRONMENT, WHICH IS IMPACTING VOLUNTEER SERVICE PROGRAMS AROUND THE COUNTRY. RSVP HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY IOWA LAKES COMMUNITY COLLEGE (IOWA LAKES) IN ESTHERVILLE, IOWA, SINCE 1977. NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP SERVES CLAY, DICKINSON, EMMET, KOSSUTH AND PALO ALTO COUNTIES, ALIGNING WITH THE IOWA LAKES DISTRICT. AN RSVP OFFICE IS LOCATED ON EACH OF THE FIVE COUNTY, COLLEGE CAMPUSES. IOWA LAKES COMMUNITY COLLEGE COLLABORATES WITH BUSINESS, INDUSTRY, HEALTHCARE FACILITIES, SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES TO DELIVER COLLEGE CREDIT AND NON-CREDIT COURSES.
	THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AREA RESIDENTS SERVED BY RSVP INCLUDE ELDERLY, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, K-12 THROUGH ADULT STUDENTS, FAMILIES, VETERANS AND PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL, MENTAL OR EMOTIONAL DISABILITIES. OF THE ESTIMATED 300 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING THE NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP PROGRAM, 150 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS: 50 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN HEALTHY FUTURES AREAS OF MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT; 100 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN EDUCATION/K-12 SUCCESS WORK PLANS AS PEN PALS AND TUTORS WITH ELEMENTARY STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE FIVE COUNTY REGION. THE REMAINING 150 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED WITH OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WHICH WILL REFLECT GARNERING DONATIONS (THRIFT STORES FOR HANDICAPPED AND/OR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS), DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION (SHIIP COUNSELORS), SUPPORTING BLOOD DRIVES (AMERICAN RED CROSS AND LIFESERVE BLOOD CENTERS OF IOWA) AND ADULT ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL) ON A CONVERSATIONAL BASIS. RSVP STAFF WILL USE MEASUREMENT TOOLS AND SURVEYS TO CALCULATE AND REPORT THE PROJECT OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS.
	THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $92,908 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, $50,000 FROM NON-FEDERAL (STATE AND LOCAL) RESOURCES INCLUDING SUPPORT FROM ELDERBRIDGE AGENCY ON AGING, THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, STATE OF IOWA, UNITED WAY, COUNTY BOARDS OF SUPERVISORS, CITY COUNCILS, AND COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION GRANTS. 
	THROUGH THE SKILLS, EXPERIENCE AND COMMITMENT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS COMBINED WITH THE SUPPORT OF FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL ENTITIES, RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO ENGAGE 55+ VOLUNTEERS IN MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY SERVICE TO POSITIVELY IMPACT AND IMPROVE THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS, FROM YOUTH TO SENIORS, LIVING IN OUR RURAL SERVICE AREA.

CLINTON COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (CCRSVP) CHALLENGE INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER TO UTILIZE THEIR ENERGY, SKILLS, AND EXPERTISE RESPONDING TO THE ESSENTIAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE. THE EFFECTS OF COVID-19 CONTINUES TO CAUSE A DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY ON HOW OUR COMMUNITY WILL BE EFFECTED IN THE SHORT AND LONG TERM. GIVEN THE CURRENT POVERTY RATE OF 12.5% THE COMMUNITY DEPENDS ON VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT THE NECESSARY RESOURCES TO MEET THE HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE. CLINTON COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOCUSING ON THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, ELDERLY, AND DISABLED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE SERVING IN HEALTHY FUTURES; FOCUSING ON THE OBJECTIVES OF AGING IN PLACE, ACCESS TO CARE, AND OBESITY AND FOOD. CLINTON COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE IN THE AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. TARGETED POPULATIONS INCLUDE THE HOME-BOUND, DISABLED, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, OLDER ADULTS (INDIVIDUALS 65 AND OLDER), AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS. AN ESTIMATED TOTAL OF 185 CLINTON COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 127 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRIES, SHIIP, MOBILE MEALS, TAXES AND OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS, HEALTHY FUTURES. A TOTAL OF FORTY-FIVE (45) UNDUPLICATED CLINTON COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND A TOTAL OF FIFTY (50) WILL SERVE IN THE AREA TRANSPORTING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS; TIED TO AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME TO SUPPORT THE ABILITY OF INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS, VETERANS, OR HAVE A DISABILITY. ANOTHER SIX (6) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREA DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE, HEALTH CARE ACCESS AND HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS; TO SUPPORT ACCESS TO CARE.
