IN JULY 2016, FORT MADISON AREA UNITED WAY AND BIG RIVER UNITED WAY MERGED UNDER NEW LEADERSHIP AND RENAMED UNITED WAY OF THE GREAT RIVER REGION. THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RSVP PROGRAM, HAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ALL OF LEE COUNTY IOWA. RSVP HAS BEEN A PART OF THE LEE COUNTY COMMUNITY FOR OVER 25 YEARS. THE RSVP PROGRAM IS WELL RESPECTED AND LOOKED UPON WITH HIGH REGARD BY LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, BUSINESSES, AND INDIVIDUALS. LEE COUNTY IS AN AREA THAT USES EVERY RESOURCE AVAILABLE. LEE COUNTY AGENCIES RELY HEAVILY ON SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO ACHIEVE COMMUNITY GOALS WHILE OPERATING ON TIGHT BUDGETS.  LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RSVP PROGRAM IN THE COMMUNITY.
UNITED WAY/RSVP COMMUNITY PARTNERS ARE SELECTED BASED ON A WIDE VARIETY OF CRITERIA, INCLUDING EFFECTIVENESS OF CURRENT PROGRAMS, THE IMPACT PROGRAMS HAVE ON THE COMMUNITY, AND THE ORGANIZATIONS WILLINGNESS TO WORK WITH RSVP TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL AND REWARDING EXPERIENCES FOR THE VOLUNTEERS. THE RSVP PROGRAM CURRENTLY COLLABORATES WITH 19 PARTNER AGENCIES TO IMPLEMENT AND DEVELOP COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS THAT ARE BENEFICIAL TO THE ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS RSVP AND ITS VOLUNTEERS. THERE IS A DEMONSTRATED NEED FOR IMPROVING THE READING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY AND IMPROVE THE OVERALL HEALTH IN OUR PRIMARY REGION. AN ESTIMATED 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO HELP MEET THESE NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY. OF THIS NUMBER, 50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS THREE IMPORTANT AREAS IN OUR COMMUNITY ALL SHOWING A NEED:  1) READING LITERACY, 2) VITA AND 3) HEALTHY FUTURES.  
THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL PARTNER WITH LOCAL ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS TO OFFER AN IN SCHOOL READING AND TUTORING PROGRAM FOR 2ND AND 3RD GRADE STUDENTS IN LEE COUNTY, IOWA FOR SCHOOL YEAR 2021-2022. THE GOAL IN 2ND AND 3RD GRADE IS TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE FAST SCORES. THE LITERACY PROGRAM WILL MATCH VOLUNTEERS WITH A STUDENT TO IMPROVE READING AND COMPREHENSION. THE VOLUNTEER WOULD THEN FOLLOW THE STUDENTS? PROGRESS AND CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE STUDENT FOR 1-2 TIMES PER WEEK.
THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL OFFER VOLUNTEER TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE DURING TAX SEASON, STARTING IN FEBRUARY AND ENDING IN APRIL. THE GOALS ARE TO HELP STRUGGLING FAMILIES INCREASE THEIR FINANCIAL STABILITY, AND HELP RETURN FEDERAL DOLLARS TO OUR LOCAL ECONOMY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP LOW AND MODERATE INCOME FAMILIES FILE TAX RETURNS WITH NO CHARGE, MAXIMIZING THE BENEFITS TO OUR CLIENTS AND TO OUR COMMUNITY.
THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE OFFER A FOOD PANTRY GARDEN PROJECT TO OFFER EDUCATION TO CLIENTS ABOUT GARDENING, PREPARATION, AND CONSUMPTION OF FRESH INGREDIENTS. EDUCATION IS THE PRIMARY GOAL WHILE MAINTAINING THE GARDEN. MANY OF THE PEOPLE USING THE FOOD PANTRY ARE RELUCTANT TO PURCHASE FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES BECAUSE IT IS COST PROHIBITIVE. THE FOOD PANTRY GARDEN PROJECT HOPES TO EDUCATE THOSE INDIVIDUALS ON HOW TO, SHOP FOR, PREPARE AND STORE FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO INCREASE A HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE. ENCOURAGING HEALTHY EATING WILL BENEFIT OUR COMMUNITY IN MANY WAYS FAR BEYOND JUST FOOD IN STOMACHS. PROMOTING HEALTHY EATING EDUCATION CAN EMPOWER THOSE IN NEED TO "HELP THEMSELVES" RATHER THAN JUST ACCEPT A HAND OUT. WITH THE HELP OF VOLUNTEERS PLANS ARE TO ENGAGE THE FOOD PANTRY CLIENTS IN QUARTERLY EDUCATION CLASSES AND OR DEMONSTRATION AT THE FOOD PANTRY. CLASSES AND/OR DEMONSTRATIONS WILL BE PROVIDED ON HOW TO PREPARE FRESH FOODS, HOW TO INCORPORATE THEM INTO YOUR DIET, AND HOW TO STRETCH YOUR BUDGET WHILE INCLUDING NUTRITIOUS ITEMS. THE EDUCATIONAL CLASSES ALSO WILL PROVIDE RECIPES TO USE IN THE FUTURE ON HOW TO USE FRUITS AND VEGETABLE AND FOOD PANTRY COMMODITIES IN THEIR REGULAR MEAL PLANNING.

SCSC, INC. BEGAN AS AN RSVP GRANTEE IN 1973, SERVING STORY COUNTY AND EXPANDING TO SERVE MARSHALL COUNTY IN 2003.  MORE RECENTLY (2012), SCSC, INC. APPROVED THE EXPANSION OF CENTRAL IOWA RSVP TO ALSO INCLUDE HAMILTON AND WEBSTER COUNTIES, EACH REPRESENTING TWO FORMER PROJECTS THAT RELINQUISHED THEIR RSVP GRANTS IN 2011. STORY CITY SENIOR CITIZENS, INC. WAS ALSO AWARDED STATE FUNDING IN JULY, 2012 TO RESTORE SERVICES TO THIS GEOGRAPHIC AREA. THIS SUMMARY OUTLINES PLANS FOR CONTINUED SERVICE AND SPONSORSHIP OF CENTRAL IOWA RSVP.

THE HEART OF IOWA REGIONAL TRANSIT AGENCY, HIRTA, IS A QUASI GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY ORGANIZED UNDER A 28E AGREEMENT WITH THE STATE OF IOWA. HIRTA WAS CREATED IN 1981 TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN SEVEN COUNTIES IN CENTRAL IOWA, INCLUDING MARION COUNTY.

AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND ALL 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION / FOOD SUPPORT AND TRANSPORTATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 50 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $8,334 LOCAL INVESTMENT.

HIRTA HAS MANY COMMUNITY PARTNERS. WORKING WITH ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS AGING RESOURCES OF CENTRAL IOWA, MARION COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH, THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM AND LOCAL SENIOR SERVICES, HIRTA WILL EXPAND OUR CORE SERVICE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE AT RISK OF ISOLATION, WOULD OTHERWISE NOT BE ABLE TO ACCESS HEALTHY FOOD, MEDICAL SERVICES AND ALREADY IN THE HIGHEST RISK OF ISOLATION.

CREATING AN RSVP IN MARION COUNTY WILL ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR MANY UNDER-SERVED, WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY INCREASING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE WHO WISH TO SERVE. 

HIRTA HAS BRAND AWARENESS AND IS A TRUSTED RESOURCE IN THE COMMUNITY, THEREFORE EXPANDING A NEW PROGRAM, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CNCS, WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF MANY.

THE RSVP OF BUCHANAN COUNTY WILL SERVE 75 VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THIS PROJECT. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE OUTCOME ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVICE DISADVANTAGED YOUTH WHO ARE BEHIND IN READING SKILLS (EDUCATION), PROVIDING TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE TO LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS (ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY), AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, AND PREPARATION FOR TIMES OF DISASTER (DISASTER PREPARATION). OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL INCLUDE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AT 5 STATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS EDUCATION: HELPING DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IMPROVE THEIR READING SKILLS. IT IS ANTICIPATED AT THE END OF THE THIRD YEAR OF A 3-YEAR GRANT PERIOD A MINIMUM OF 30 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST MINIMALLY 75 STUDENTS IN IMPROVING READING SKILLS AND 15 UNDUPLICATED TAX VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST 200 LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN OBTAINING A TAX REFUND. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 PER YEAR WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $7,500 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES (INCLUDES IN-KIND).

SERVEWYOMING?S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES AND STRENGTHEN WYOMING COMMUNITIES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM, TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, SERVEWYOMING ESTABLISHED A SINGLE RESOURCE AND CENTRAL CLEARINGHOUSE FOR HELPING COMMUNITIES AND INDIVIDUAL ORGANIZATIONS WITH VOLUNTEER SUPPORT-RELATED SERVICES, CALLED VOLUNTEER WYOMING. THE GOAL OF VOLUNTEER WYOMING IS TO MEASURABLY INCREASE THE NUMBER AND EFFECTIVENESS OF VOLUNTEERS IN WYOMING AND TO SUPPORT NONPROFITS WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, MANAGEMENT, CAPACITY BUILDING AND SUSTAINABILITY.
SERVEWYOMING IS SUBMITTING FOR FEDERAL FUNDING TO SPONSOR THE SERVEWYOMING 55+ INITIATIVE, SERVING NATRONA, CONVERSE AND FREMONT COUNTIES IN CENTRAL WYOMING. 
AN ESTIMATED 175 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 105 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN VOLUNTEER ROLES THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE (NPM) OUTCOMES. 
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH FOOD INSECURITY, THOSE WITH DISABILITIES, PEOPLE LIVING BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL, AND VETERANS. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST INDIVIDUALS THROUGH SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MEAL DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP PROGRAMS, FOOD SECURITY PROGRAMS, HEALTHY ACTIVITY INSTRUCTION, PROVIDING SERVICES AND VOLUNTEER CAPACITY BUILDING. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY 20 STATIONS, SUCH AS CENTRAL WYOMING SENIOR SERVICES/CASPER SENIOR CENTER, MEALS ON WHEELS, DEPARTMENT OF AGING, VETERANS AFFAIRS, LOCAL HOSPITALS, OLDER ADULT SERVICE PROVIDERS, ADULT EDUCATION CENTERS, FOOD BANKS, COMMUNITY NONPROFITS, AND MORE. 
THE SERVEWYOMING 55+ INITIATIVE WILL FOCUS ON CAPACITY BUILDING. RSVP MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES OF VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING AND OTHER. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS CNCS FOCUS AREA CAPACITY BUILDING AND OTHER. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED CAPACITY BUILDING ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL NONPROFITS HELPING TO INCREASE THEIR OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY, PROVIDE HIGHER QUALITY SERVICE, LEVERAGED MORE RESOURCES, PARTICULARLY HUMAN CAPITAL IN THE FORM OF INCREASED VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND BETTER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 105,532 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 12,245 ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM CASH AND IN-KIND.

AN ESTIMATED 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE,  OF THIS NUMBER, 83 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE; COMPANIONSHIP (TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM) AND EVIDENCE-BASED HEALTH EDUCATION AND PREVENTION PROGRAMS, TO INCLUDE: CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT, DIABETES SELF-MANAGEMENT, CHRONIC PAIN SELF-MANAGEMENT, ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION EXERCISE PROGRAM, TAI CHI FOR ARTHRITIS, WALK WITH EASE AND STEPPING ON.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES TO INCLUDE ACCESS TO CARE AND AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 160 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BE PROVIDED TELEPHONE REASSURANCE WITH MINIMUM OF 112 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. AND 560 OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH IDENTIFIED HEALTH ISSUES/CONCERNS WILL HAVE PARTICIPATED IN ONE OR MORE EVIDENCE-BASED HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,256.00 IN MATCH FUNDS.

AN ESTIMATED 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE UTAH MOUNTAINLAND REGION. OF THIS NUMBER 84 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS ON WHEELS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING NEEDED TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS, MAKING WEEKLY FRIENDLY CALLS TO HOME BOUND INDIVIDUALS, AND TUTORING K-12 STUDENTS IN LOCATION ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE MOUNTAINLAND RSVP PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE WILL SHOW INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT FELT BY OUR MEALS ON WHEELS RECIPIENTS, OUR SENIORS RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, AND FROM OUR SENIORS RECEIVING WEEKLY PHONE CALLS FROM OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OUR MOW RECIPIENTS WILL ALSO SHOW INCREASED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. WE WILL ALSO SHOW ELEMENTARY STUDENTS IMPROVING THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $83,485 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $70,000 FROM MOUNTAINLAND ASSOCIATION OF GOVERNMENTS AND OTHER NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR NECESSARY EXPENDITURES TO CREATE A SUCCESSFUL RSVP PROJECT IN THE MOUNTAINLAND REGION.

COUNTY OF DAVIS, THROUGH THEIR HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S (DCHD) SENIOR SERVICES, SPONSORS AND MANAGES DAVIS COUNTY RSVP, THE INCUMBENT GRANTEE. AS AN AREA AGENCY ON AGING, SENIOR SERVICES INTERACTS WITH THOUSANDS OF OLDER ADULTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS EACH YEAR. PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OFFERED INCLUDE RSVP, MEALS ON WHEELS (MOW), SENIOR CENTERS, TRANSPORTATION, CASE MANAGEMENT, OPTIONS COUNSELING, AND IN-HOME SERVICES. THESE PROGRAMS HELP OLDER ADULTS REMAIN AT HOME AND IN THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, AGING IN PLACE WITH RESPECT, DIGNITY, AND INCREASED SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS.
DAVIS COUNTY RSVP PROPOSES TO FACILITATE AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICES FOR 375 VOLUNTEERS, AT 29 STATIONS, PROVIDING SERVICE TO OLDER ADULTS, PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, CHILDREN, COMMUNITY MEMBERS, ANIMAL SERVICES, VETERANS, MILITARY, AND THEIR FAMILIES. WITH AT LEAST 215 VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN WORK PLANS THAT GENERATE OUTCOMES, THE VOLUNTEER IMPACT WILL INCREASE SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS, FOOD SECURITY, INCREASE CHILDHOOD LITERACY, AND SUPPORT VALUABLE ECOSYSTEMS THROUGH PUBLIC LAND AND TRAIL IMPROVEMENT. HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, WITH 37% OF THE PROJECT'S TOTAL VOLUNTEERS SERVING TO MEET AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE OBJECTIVES.
VOLUNTEER SERVICES SUPPORTING AGING IN PLACE INCLUDE ASSISTING AND PROMOTING INDEPENDENT LIVING, MOW DELIVERY, AND CONGREGATE MEAL SERVICE; SOCIALIZATION TO HOMEBOUND, ISOLATED OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE ATTENDING SENIOR CENTER CONGREGATE MEAL SITES; AND ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION EFFORTS. SENIOR SERVICES IMPLEMENTS EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING AND WILL TRAIN RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO FACILITATE AND SUPPORT PROVEN HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS, INCREASING ACCESS TO CARE. ADDITIONALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FOOD BANKS WITH COLLECTION, SORTING, DISTRIBUTION, AND PREPARING OVER 1350 WEEKLY PANTRY PACKS TO SCHOOL CHILDREN WITH FOOD INSECURITY. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $182,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $78,200 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, $7000 FROM STATE GENERAL TAX FUNDS WITH THE REMAINING LOCAL COUNTY TAX DOLLARS SECURED IN A DESIGNATED FUND FOR HEALTH AND SENIOR SERVICES. DAVIS COUNTY SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED IN PERSONNEL EXPENSES, FRINGE BENEFITS, STAFF TRAVEL, SUPPLIES, VOLUNTEER SUPPORT COSTS, AND VOLUNTEER EXPENSES. NON-FEDERAL GRANT SUPPORT WILL ENCOMPASS 30.1% OF THE BUDGET TOTAL. DAVIS RSVP WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT AND GUIDANCE FOR AN ARMY OF 375 VOLUNTEERS MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF THOUSANDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC). CSC IS A NON-PROFIT MULTI-SERVICE CENTER THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY SINCE 1965, HOSTING THE RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 1981.THE CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES & EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES, & THE ELDERLY OF PORTALES & ROOSEVELT COUNTY. THE MISSION OF CSC IS TO PROVIDE ON-GOING OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPOWER ALL OF THE PEOPLE OF ROOSEVELT COUNTY TO COLLABORATE IN REDUCING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS. THIS ENLIGHTENED CONCEPT WILL BECOME THE NORM OF THE COMMUNITY. AN ESTIMATED 76 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, ASSISTING WITH COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT, TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE SERVICES, REFERRALS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ADDRESSED THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE OUTCOMES; NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT & NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT REPORTED INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO (VOR) COMMUNITY CENTER (CC), WHICH HAS SPONSORED THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SINCE 1994. THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO IS A MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT WITH A MAYOR AND COUNCIL ELECTED BY ITS RESIDENTS. 
MISSION STATEMENT: THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO IS A FULL-SERVICE MUNICIPALITY GOVERNED BY THE PROVISIONS OF NEW MEXICO STATE LAW AND THE VILLAGE CODES. THE VILLAGE PROVIDES A WIDE VARIETY OF SERVICES TO ITS 7,901 FULL-TIME RESIDENTS ACCORDING TO THE 2019 U.S. CENSUS AND UP TO 30,000 PART-TIME RESIDENTS AND VISITORS ON MANY WEEKENDS AND HOLIDAYS. MUNICIPAL SERVICES ARE FINANCED THROUGH A VARIETY OF TAXES, FEES, CHARGES FOR SERVICES, UTILITY RATES, AND INTERGOVERNMENTAL ASSISTANCE. THE VILLAGE ADOPTS AN ANNUAL BUDGET AS THE PLAN FOR DELIVERY OF SERVICES IN MANAGING RESOURCES AND REVENUES TO SUPPORT THESE SERVICES. THE VISION OF THE RUIDOSO COMMUNITY CENTER, WHERE THE RSVP PROGRAM IS HOUSED, IS TO BE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT SUPPORTS HEALTHY LIVING TO POSITIVELY TRANSFORM LIVES. THE MISSION OF THE RUIDOSO COMMUNITY CENTER IS TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH, EMOTIONAL, SOCIAL, AND INTELLECTUAL WELL-BEING OF EVERYONE, AND ESPECIALLY SENIOR ADULTS LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY. THROUGH DAILY PROGRAMMING AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHERS, SENIOR CITIZENS ARE OFFERED OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE IN VARIOUS ACTIVITIES IN A SAFE, FULFILLING ENVIRONMENT.
AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO SUPPORT 16 VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITH AT LEAST 15,000 HOURS OF SERVICE PER YEAR TO THE RUIDOSO AND THE LINCOLN COUNTY AREA.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOT MEAL DELIVERY TO ELDERLY HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS; DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD AND CLOTHING TO NEEDY INDIVIDUALS; TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES; ASSISTANCE IN NURSING HOMES TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS; EDUCATION AND LITERACY THROUGH CULTURAL HERITAGE PROGRAMS AND LIBRARIES; AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH SAFE WATER, WILDLIFE, LAND AND VEGETATION.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, RSVP WILL PROVIDE HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND MANY HOUSEHOLDS THAT ARE FOOD INSECURE WITH FOOD OR OTHER SERVICES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND WILL REPORT THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  APPROXIMATELY 9,000 MEALS WILL BE DELIVERED TO 35 HOMEBOUND ELDERLY ADULTS YEARLY, WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND REPORT THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  RSVP WILL REPORT THAT 700 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVED FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES OR OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND 300 OF THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT INVESTMENT OF $35,000 AND $3,850 PLUS $10,100 OF IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS FROM THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO.

SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SCSVP), LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS ARE ALSO SPONSORED BY SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. SANDOVAL COUNTY IS DIVERSE IN GEOGRAPHY, CULTURES AND PEOPLE. THE SENIOR POPULATION IS MICROCOSM OF THE LARGER DIVERSE POPULATION, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING OF CAUCASIAN RACE, FOLLOWED BY NATIVE AMERICAN AND A MUCH SMALLER AFRICAN AMERICAN RACE WITH ALMOST HALF OF HISPANIC ETHNICITY. THE SCSVP PROPOSES TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE RSVP PROGRAM WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS ARE OF HEALTHY FUTURES, TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY, HELP SENIORS MEET BASIC FOOD AND OTHER DAILY NEEDS AND INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE SERVICES THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ARE DELIVERY OF FOOD, REFERRAL FOR ACCESS TO FOOD AND NUTRITION TRAINING, MASKS, BLANKETS AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN THE COMMUNITIES OF BERNALILLO, PENA BLANCA, CORRALES, RIO RANCHO, JEMEZ VALLEY AND CUBA NM. ADDITIONAL SERVICES WILL BE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT WHICH INCLUDES GREETING CLIENTS, RECEIVING, ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AND CLEAN UP.
A COMMUNITY PRIORITY THAT WAS IDENTIFIED AND IN NEED OF INTERVENTION IS IMPROVING LITERACY FOR ADULTS AND CHILDREN WITHIN THE COUNTY. THE SERVICES THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE TO ADDRESS IMPROVING LITERACY ARE VOLUNTEERING AT LOCAL LIBRARIES AND A LITERACY PROGRAM. AN ESTIMATED TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, FOCUSING ON AGING IN PLACE, FOOD INSECURITY, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND SOCIAL CONTACT AND APPROXIMATELY 45 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTPUT ASSIGNMENTS FOCUSING ON IMPROVING LITERACY. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR TERM THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL BE 100 SENIORS RECEIVE FOOD, MASKS, BLANKETS AND SOCIAL CONTACT AS WELL AS NUTRITION INFORMATION, EDUCATION AND REFERRALS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR TERM THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUT FOR SUPPORTING FOOD BANKS WILL HAVE BEEN MET.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, INC. (COA).  THE COA IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) CORPORATION OPERATING AS A SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN LUNA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO SINCE 1976.  THE COA HAS BEEN THE LEADER IN IMPLEMENTING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS IN LUNA COUNTY WITH A STRONG MISSION OF PROMOTING INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVING DIGNITY, AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTY.  OUR ORGANIZATION ADVOCATES AND PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES TO OLDER, LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO HAVE HEALTH AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN A DIGNIFIED MANNER WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE COA CURRENTLY OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE THE SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT, SENIOR COMPANION AND RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.
FOR THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION'S RSVP PROJECT, OUT OF 135 VOLUNTEERS, AN ESTIMATED EIGHTY-NINE (89) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF "HEALTH FUTURES": FOR OUR IDENTIFIED  "PROGRAMMING FOR IMPACT" STATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE PROVIDING COORDINATION OF TRANSPORTATION FOR HEALTH CARE, FOOD PROVISIONS, AND ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSING AND UTILITY PROVISIONS.  
AT THE END OF A TWELVE MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THE THREE "PROGRAMMING FOR IMPACT" STATIONS WILL BE THE FOLLOWING:

1)DEMING SENIOR CENTER:  PARTICIPANTS/CLIENTS RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS/GROCERY SHOPPING, ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESS TO FOOD RESOURCES AND HEALTHY AGING INITIATIVES TO INCLUDE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY.

2) TRANSFORMING LUNA COUNTY (TLC): CLIENTS RECEIVE CRITICAL ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSING ISSUES, UTILITY EXPENSE AND FOOD.  THE NEED FOR THIS SERVICE IS CRITICAL FOR CLIENTS TO REMAIN IN THE COMFORT OF THEIR HOMES WITHOUT THE FEAR OF PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION.
3) HELPING HANDS: CLIENTS RECEIVE CONTINUED ASSISTANCE WITH FOOD ISSUES.  LUNA COUNTY IS LISTED AS THE POOREST COUNTY IN NEW MEXICO AND ALSO HAS THE HIGHEST UNEMPLOYMENT IN NEW MEXICO.   CLIENTS WILL HAVE THE RELIEF OF KNOWING WHEN AND WHERE THEIR NEXT MEAL WILL COME FROM.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT TO THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM IS $75,000 DOLLARS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH STATE, LOCAL AND IN-KIND FUNDS.  THE  THE STATE SHARE WILL BE $22,500. THE PROGRAM WILL RECEIVE AN ADDITIONAL $5,866 FROM THE CITY OF DEMING AS IN KIND. THESE AMOUNTS WILL TOTAL $97,500

CONCILIO CAMPESINO DEL SUDOESTE INC. (CONCILIO CDS INC.) IS A STATE-WIDE 501(C)3 PRIVATE COMMUNITY-BASED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972.  THE ORGANIZATION HAS A SERVICE HISTORY IN ADDRESSING NEEDS IN SENIOR ISSUES, HEALTH ISSUES, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.  WE SERVE STATE-WIDE IN NEW MEXICO AND ITS SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.  THE COMMUNITIES BEING SERVED BY ORGANIZATION INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED AS A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS.  THE DIVERSE POPULATIONS OF PEOPLE OF COLOR THAT WE SERVE REFLECTS THE COMMUNITY THAT INCLUDES: SENIORS, YOUTH, FAMILIES, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARM WORKERS & THEIR FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS, INDIVIDUALS FROM DIVERSE RACES, ETHNICITIES, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, RURAL RESIDENTS, PEOPLE LIVING IN POVERTY, MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED, SPANISH-SPEAKING AND NATIVE-SPEAKING INDIGENOUS POPULATIONS, VETERANS, AND MILITARY FAMILIES. CONCILIO CDS INC. ADDRESSES HEALTH INEQUITIES, ECONOMIC CRISIS, POVERTY, EDUCATION, HUNGER/FOOD INSECURITY, AND OTHER AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERISM. OUR MISSION: TO ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF INTER-GENERATIONAL CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY WITH PASSION AND COMMITMENT. 

NM-28Y, DONA ANA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO

THE RICHLAND COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (RCHD) HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE NORTHEAST MT RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 2004, NOW COVERING DANIELS, MCCONE, RICHLAND, ROOSEVELT, SHERIDAN COUNTIES, AND THE FORT PECK INDIAN RESERVATION. AN ESTIMATED 573 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 265 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DISTRIBUTING OPIOID & ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION INFORMATION; FOOD DELIVERY TO THE HOMEBOUND; CONNECTING VETERANS TO SERVICES; AND PROVIDING TUTORING FOR STUDENTS AFFECTED BY COVID. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $198,545 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TOTALING $106,766. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: 1. 200 INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN FRONTIER AREAS WILL KNOW HOW TO ACCESS PREVENTIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS; 2. 300 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD DELIVERY & COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; 3. 80 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE COMPANION TRANSPORTATION TO IN-TOWN AND REGIONAL MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS; 4. 300 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE BETTER PREPARED IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY SHELTER IN PLACE AND KNOW HOW TO ACCESS SERVICES; 5. ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED BY VOLUNTEERS ARE: STUDENT & ADULT LITERACY, ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS & STEWARDSHIP, VETERAN SUPPORT, OPIOID & ALCOHOL ABUSE EDUCATION, AND NON-PROFIT SUPPORT.
THE NORTHEAST MT RSVP PROGRAM HAS PLAYED AN INVALUABLE ROLE BY HELPING BRIDGE COMMUNITY GAPS AND COMBINE AVAILABLE RESOURCES SINCE 2004. THE VISION OF RICHLAND COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT NORTHEAST MT RSVP IS TO TRANSFORM OUR FRONTIER REGION BY SHOWING PARTNERING AGENCIES AND NONPROFITS HOW TO MORE EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS SO THOSE ORGANIZATIONS CAN BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BECOME A SERVICE ENTERPRISE. ADDITIONALLY, RCHD IS HOSTING ONE AMERICORPS GRANT PROGRAM. EIGHT FULL-TIME AMERICORPS MEMBERS WILL BE SERVING ON VARIOUS COMMUNITY PROJECTS AND ALONGSIDE RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO ACCOMPLISH SIMILAR GOALS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY THE BUTTE SCHOOL DISTRICT #1 IS THE PROUD SPONSOR OF THE BUTTE RSVP PROGRAM. THE BUTTE SCHOOL DISTRICT #1 WILL CONTINUE TO OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR AN ESTIMATED 240 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CONTINUING TO MAKE BUTTE, MONTANA THE "RICHEST HILL ON EARTH". OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVICE OUR COMMUNITY BY PARTICIPATING IN THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: K-12 EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS: OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR AND MENTOR STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT AT APPROPRIATE GRADE LEVELS FOR MATH AND READING. IDENTIFIED STUDENTS WILL WORK WITH OUR VOLUNTEERS IN CLASSROOMS TO IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PROGRESS. OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED WITH THE TOOLS CURRENTLY AVAILABLE IN SCHOOLS. THESE TOOLS ARE ISIP PROGRESS MONITORING (READING), DIEBELS PROGRESS MONITORING (READING) AND MAPS (MATH) AS WELL AS THE YEARLY SUMMATIVE ASSESSMENT FOR THE STATE FOR READING AND MATH CALLED "SMARTER BALANCE". WE WILL ALSO TRACK ATTENDANCE OUTCOMES WITH THE SCHOOLS WITH RSVP VOLUNTEERS. K-12 EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS WILL BE OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT. HEALTHY FUTURES: OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREA OF SUPPORTING AND ASSISTING OUR COMMUNITY EMERGENCY FOOD BANK. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSISTING WITH FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT IN THE WAREHOUSE. OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED BY THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY BECAUSE OF THESE SERVICES OF THE BUTTE EMERGENCY FOOD BANK. HEALTHY FUTURES: OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH SENIORS WHO ARE IDENTIFIED AS "AT RISK" DUE TO LACK OF SUPPORTIVE SERVICES. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE THE NEEDED SERVICES FOR THE IDENTIFIED SENIORS THROUGH FOOD DELIVERY AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES. ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY: OUR VOLUNTEERS ASSIST THE AARP TAX AIDE PROGRAM PROVIDING HELP TO INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED ASSISTANCE IN PREPARING THEIR OWN TAX RETURNS. THESE VOLUNTEERS ALSO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND INFORMATION ON TAX LAWS. THIS SERVICE ALLOWS INDIVIDUALS TO RECOUP MONIES THAT THEY MIGHT NOT HAVE DONE ON THEIR OWN. OUR BUTTE RSVP PROGRAM WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH A DIVERSE GROUP OF AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY BASED ON THE NEEDS AND PRIORITIES OF THE BUTTE SILVER BOW COUNTY. THEY INCLUDE SUCH NON-PROFIT AGENCIES SUCH AS ST. JAMES HEALTHCARE, OUR LADY OF THE ROCKIES FOUNDATION, , BUTTE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE, BUTTE SILVER BOW ARCHIVES, ACTION INC., THE WORLD MUSEUM OF MINING AND ALL OTHER APPROPRIATE PARTNERS. OUR GOAL FOR THIS GRANT CYCLE IS TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE IN WHICH INDIVIDUALS MAY SHARE THEIR EXPERIENCES, ABILITIES, AND SKILLS FOR THE BETTERMENT OF THEIR COMMUNITY AND THEMSELVES. BUTTE RSVP WILL ENSURE THAT VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTERESTS AND ABILITIES OF THE VOLUNTEER AND THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY SERVED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $89,193.00 ALONG WITH OUR NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF 30.5% WILL SUPPORT OUR DEDICATED AND MOTIVATED VOLUNTEERS IN BUTTE, MONTANA.

REGION 10 RSVP @ GUNNISON PLANS TO RECRUIT AT LEAST 100 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE AN ESTIMATED 450 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITHIN THE GRANT PERIOD. OUR COMMUNITY PARTNER IN THIS ENDEAVOUR WILL BE THE GUNNISON DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES WHO WILL ASSIST WITH MATCH AND HAS A GOOD GRASP ON THE NEEDS OF THIS COMMUNITY AND ITS RESIDENTS. 
 RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO THE HOMEBOUND, ASSISTING WITH DISTRIBUTION AND OPERATIONS AT THE LOCAL FOOD BANKS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS, SENIOR COMPANION/RESPITE CARE AND HANDYMAN SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES ENSURING THAT OLDER ADULTS HAVE EVERY POSSIBLE OPPORTUNITY TO AGE IN PLACE, HAVE ACCESS TO THE CARE THEY NEED, THAT THE PROGRAM IS INCLUSIVE, AND RESPITE IS PROVIDED FOR CAREGIVERS.
THESE OBJECTIVES ALIGN VERY WELL WITH THOSE OF THE OTHER PROGRAMS OFFERED BY REGION 10S COMMUNITY LIVING SERVICES PROGRAMS SUCH AS OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. AT THE END OF THIS 3-YEAR GRANT PERIOD WE ANTICIPATE A 20% INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND FOOD BANK DELIVERIES WITH A STABLE VOLUNTEER FORCE. NOT ONLY DOES THIS PROGRAM REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, IT ALSO ADDRESSES SOCIAL ISOLATION WITH REGULAR HUMAN INTERACTION AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO INTERVENE IF HELP IS NEEDED.  
MOST OLDER ADULTS PREFER TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME AS THEY AGE, BUT TO DO SO THEY OFTEN NEED THE SUPPORT OF FAMILY MEMBERS. KEEPING JUST ONE CAREGIVER FROM BURNING OUT AND PLACING A LOVED ONE IN A LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY ON MEDICAID WOULD SAVE TAXPAYERS OVER $60,000 PER YEAR; THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL LIKELY PREVENT SEVERAL NURSING HOME PLACEMENTS EACH YEAR. 
THERE IS CURRENTLY NO HANDYMAN PROGRAM  TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY. RSVP HANDYMAN VOLUNTEERS WILL BUILD WHEELCHAIR RAMPS, INSTALL GRAB BARS AND ASSIST WITH TASKS THAT MANY OLDER ADULTS STRUGGLE TO PAY FOR. DISABLED AND OLDER ADULTS WILL BE SAFER IN THEIR HOMES AND THE BASIC HOME MAINTENANCE NEEDS OF THE VERY LOW INCOME WILL BE MET. 
THE CNCS GRANT REQUEST OF $225,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH A $45,000 CASH AND IN-KIND INVESTMENT FROM THE GUNNISON DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AND REGION 10 OVER THREE YEARS. THE INDIVIDUALS, ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITIES SERVED IN GUNNISON COUNTY WILL SEE THE VALUE OF RSVP AND PARTICIPATE IN SUPPORTING THE PROGRAM.

REGION 10 RSVP @ DELTA PLANS TO RECRUIT AT LEAST 100 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE AN ESTIMATED 400 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITHIN THE GRANT PERIOD. RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO THE HOMEBOUND, ASSISTING WITH DISTRIBUTION AND OPERATIONS AT THE LOCAL FOOD BANKS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS, SENIOR COMPANION/RESPITE CARE AND HANDYMAN SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES ENSURING THAT OLDER ADULTS HAVE EVERY POSSIBLE OPPORTUNITY TO AGE IN PLACE, HAVE ACCESS TO THE CARE THEY NEED, THAT THE PROGRAM IS INCLUSIVE, AND RESPITE IS PROVIDED FOR CAREGIVERS.
THESE OBJECTIVES ALIGN VERY WELL WITH THOSE OF THE OTHER PROGRAMS OFFERED BY REGION 10?S COMMUNITY LIVING SERVICES PROGRAMS SUCH AS OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. AT THE END OF THIS 3-YEAR GRANT PERIOD WE ANTICIPATE A 20% INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND FOOD BANK DELIVERIES WITH A STABLE VOLUNTEER FORCE. NOT ONLY DOES THIS PROGRAM REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, IT ALSO ADDRESSES SOCIAL ISOLATION WITH REGULAR HUMAN INTERACTION AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO INTERVENE IF HELP IS NEEDED.  
MOST OLDER ADULTS PREFER TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME AS THEY AGE, BUT TO DO SO THEY OFTEN NEED THE SUPPORT OF FAMILY MEMBERS. KEEPING JUST ONE CAREGIVER FROM BURNING OUT AND PLACING A LOVED ONE IN A LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY ON MEDICAID WOULD SAVE TAXPAYERS OVER $60,000 PER YEAR; THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL LIKELY PREVENT SEVERAL NURSING HOME PLACEMENTS EACH YEAR.
THE HANDYMAN PROGRAM WILL BE NEW FOR THIS COUNTY, AND IS DESPERATELY NEEDED DUE TO THE HIGH PERCENTAGE LOW INCOME OF OLDER ADULTS. RSVP HANDYMAN VOLUNTEERS WILL BUILD WHEELCHAIR RAMPS, INSTALL GRAB BARS AND ASSIST WITH TASKS THAT MANY OLDER ADULTS STRUGGLE TO PAY FOR. DISABLED AND OLDER ADULTS WILL BE SAFER IN THEIR HOMES AND THE BASIC HOME MAINTENANCE NEEDS OF THE VERY LOW INCOME WILL BE MET. 
THE CNCS GRANT REQUEST OF $225,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH A $45,000 CASH AND IN-KIND INVESTMENT FROM REGION 10 OVER THREE YEARS. THE INDIVIDUALS, ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITIES SERVED IN DELTA COUNTY WILL SEE THE VALUE OF RSVP AND PARTICIPATE IN SUPPORTING THE PROGRAM.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES ENSURING THAT OLDER ADULTS HAVE EVERY POSSIBLE OPPORTUNITY TO AGE IN PLACE, HAVE ACCESS TO THE CARE THEY NEED, THAT THE PROGRAM IS INCLUSIVE, AND RESPITE IS PROVIDED FOR CAREGIVERS. 
THESE OBJECTIVES ALIGN VERY WELL WITH THOSE OF THE OTHER PROGRAMS OFFERED BY REGION 10S COMMUNITY LIVING SERVICES PROGRAMS SUCH AS OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.

NOT ONLY DOES THIS PROGRAM REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, IT ALSO ADDRESSES SOCIAL ISOLATION WITH REGULAR HUMAN INTERACTION AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO INTERVENE IF ADDITIONAL SUPPORT  IS NEEDED.  
MOST OLDER ADULTS PREFER TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME AS THEY AGE, BUT TO DO SO THEY OFTEN NEED THE SUPPORT OF FAMILY MEMBERS. THE HANDYMAN PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY OPERATED BY HABITAT OF HUMANITY OF THE SAN JUANS, WHOSE VOLUNTEER CAPACITY IS LIMITED BY AVAILABLE RESOURCES AS IT  IS UNDERFUNDED AND UNABLE TO MEET THE GROWING NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY.  THOUGH THIS RSVP GRANT AND REGION 10S CAPACITY TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN VOLUNTEERS, THIS PROGRAM WILL BE RE-ENERGIZED AND HAVE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITY AND VOLUNTEERS. RSVP HANDYMAN VOLUNTEERS WILL BUILD WHEELCHAIR RAMPS, INSTALL GRAB BARS AND ASSIST WITH TASKS THAT MANY OLDER ADULTS STRUGGLE TO PAY FOR. DISABLED AND OLDER ADULTS WILL BE SAFER IN THEIR HOMES AND THE BASIC HOME MAINTENANCE NEEDS OF THE VERY LOW INCOME WILL BE MET.

AN ESTIMATED 628 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA COLORADO'S LARIMER RSVP PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 215 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PRIMARILY PLACED IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES TO MEET THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 650 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORTS OR IMPROVED THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING BECAUSE OF NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. 65 CAREGIVERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS DUE TO RESPITE SERVICES. 413 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS IN HOUSING STABILITY AND HOMELESSNESS SERVICES, SOCIAL SUPPORTS FOR OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES, YOUTH EDUCATION AND MENTORING, DISASTER RESPONSE AND RECOVERY, HOME REPAIR ASSISTANCE FOR OLDER ADULTS, AND CULTURAL OR ARTISTIC OPPORTUNITIES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $129,502 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,374 LOCALLY. $1,00 OF THE MATCH WILL BE SOURCED FROM IN-KIND DONATIONS FROM LOCAL BUSINESS. $10,000 WILL BE FROM A GRANT FROM THE BOHEMIAN FOUNDATION. $44,702 WILL COME FROM GENERAL VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA FUNDRAISING EVENTS AND DIRECT DONATIONS.

ESTABLISHED IN 1970, NOW CELEBRATING ITS 50TH YEAR OF SERVICE TO SENIORS IN THE PIKES PEAK REGION, SILVER KEY SENIOR SERVICES OFFERS A DIVERSE RANGE OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT SERVE OUR COMMUNITY, CREATING MEASURABLE IMPACT, WHILE CREATING COMMUNITY CAPACITY AND PROVIDING LASTING BENEFITS TO VOLUNTEERS THOROUGH THE SERVICE EXPERIENCE.  THROUGH OUR COMPREHENSIVE AND EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER IMPACT PROGRAM (V.I.P.), SILVER KEY ACTIVELY ENGAGES MORE THAN 550 ADULT VOLUNTEERS ANNUALLY, PROVIDING OVER 55,000 HOURS IN DONATED TIME ? THE EQUIVALENT OF 26 FULL-TIME STAFF MEMBERS.  SILVER KEY IS BOTH A SENIOR CORPS/SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM AND AMERICORPS GRANT RECIPIENT, CURRENTLY IN GOOD STANDING WITH CNCS.  SILVER KEY EFFECTIVELY MANAGES A VISTA MEMBER PLUS A UNIQUE THREE-YEAR NATIONAL PILOT PROGRAM FUNDED THROUGH THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION, PROVIDING TRAINED VOLUNTEER COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES TO SENIOR VETERANS IN NEED OF REMAINING INDEPENDENT, AT HOME.  NO OTHER NONPROFIT IN EL PASO COUNTY HAS BEEN DESIGNATED AS A RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HOST; SILVER KEY IS READY, CAPABLE, ENTHUSIASTIC AND LOOKING FORWARD TO INCORPORATING THE SENIOR CORPS RSVP PROGRAM FUNDING AND OPPORTUNITIES INTO OUR V.I.P. PROGRAM WITH THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF ACHIEVING SUSTAINABLE CHANGE IN OUR COMMUNITY.  SILVER KEY?S VOLUNTEER INFRASTRUCTURE DIRECTLY ALIGNS WITH MANY OF THE CNCS/RSVP?S FOCUS AREAS, PRIMARILY ENCOURAGING GREATER DIVERSITY ENGAGEMENT AND STRENGTHENING COMMUNITIES.  THE TEN PERCENT (10%) MATCH WILL BE DERIVED FROM OVERHEAD EXPENSES INCURRED IN STAFFING AND OPERATING THE RSVP PROGRAM.

VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA COLORADO (VOAC), IS A NATIONAL, NONPROFIT, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO HELPING AMERICA'S MOST VULNERABLE. THROUGH MORE THAN 50 DISTINCT HUMAN SERVICE PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF COLORADO, INCLUDING HOUSING AND HEALTHCARE, VOAC HELPS MORE THAN 140,000 COLORADOANS EACH YEAR. SINCE 1896, THE MINISTRY OF SERVICE HAS SUPPORTED AND EMPOWERED AMERICA'S MOST VULNERABLE GROUPS, INCLUDING AT-RISK YOUTH, THE FRAIL ELDERLY, LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, WOMEN AND CHILDREN ESCAPING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, THOSE SEEKING AFFORDABLE HOUSING SOLUTIONS, SERVICES TO VETERANS AND HOMELESS VETERANS. THE MISSION OF THE VOA COLORADO IS TO IDENTIFY AND SERVE THE BASIC NEEDS OF THE MOST VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. AN ESTIMATED 600 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 110 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING STUDENTS ENROLLED IN GRADES K-12 WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, AGING IN PLACE: FOOD DELIVERY/SUPPORT, OBESITY AND FOOD: NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS/OPIOID EDUCATION AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 800 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND/OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, 15 INDIVIDUAL FOOD BANKS SERVED WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY TO BETTER SERVE THEIR CLIENTS, 35 STUDENTS TUTORED WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND 6 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE DISASTER PREPAREDNESS/OPIOID PROGRAMS/SUPPORT SERVICES WHERE 160 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED PREPAREDNESS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 86,058.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $121,422 BY VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA COLORADO. THE AMOUNT OF $94,604 FOR GRANTEE SHARE OF FUNDS AND THE AMOUNT OF $6,433 OF EXCESS FUNDS ARE SECURED CASH FUNDS TOTALING $101,037 WHICH ARE ALLOCATED TO THE RSVP PROGRAM AND SECURED THROUGH VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA FUND RAISING EFFORTS AND PROGRAM CONTRIBUTIONS. VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA GRANTEE FUNDS FOR VOLUNTEER EXPENSES OF $20,385 ARE PROPOSED GRANTEE MATCH FROM A VARIETY OF IN-KIND SOURCES AND IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS BUDGETS.

HIGH COUNTRY RSVP, A SPONSORED PROGRAM OF COLORADO MOUNTAIN COLLEGE, ANTICIPATES 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PITKIN COUNTY REGION.  OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVING WITH A LOCAL FOOD PANTRY, TUTORING AND MENTORING SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, DELIVERING MEALS TO SENIORS, AND AIDING IN DISASTER RESPONSE EFFORTS.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SELECTED OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE DISTRIBUTING FOOD THROUGH FOOD BANKS AND LOCAL MEAL DELIVERY PROGRAMS.    

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, OUR PLANNED ANNUAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE 300 INDIVIDUALS WHO WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENCE BY RECEIVING HEALTHY FOOD AND MEALS; 50 INDIVIDUALS WITH IMPROVED FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE THROUGH TAX PREPARATION AND COUNSELING ASSISTANCE; 50 STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS; TWO DISASTER SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES; AND FIVE ORGANIZATIONS WILL IMPLEMENT EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.  

WE KNOW THAT BEGINNING A NEW PROGRAM SITE, ADDING STAFF, AND PARTNERING WITH NEW VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL TAKE A GREAT DEAL OF TIME BEFORE WE EVEN REGISTER OUR FIRST VOLUNTEER.  BECAUSE OF THAT, WE HAVE PREPARED, WHAT WE BELIEVE TO BE, INTENTIONALLY ACHIEVABLE GOALS THAT WILL ALLOW US TO BUILD A START-UP ORGANIZATION ON A SUSTAINABLE FOUNDATION DESPITE BEING IN THE MIDST OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  

THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED OVER THREE YEARS WITH $45,000 IN ADDITIONAL NON-FEDERAL FUNDING FROM FUNDRAISING, GRANT WRITING, IN-KIND AND INDIVIDUAL DONATIONS.  THIS INCLUDES $7,500 IN YEAR ONE, $15,000 IN YEAR TWO, AND $22,500 IN YEAR THREE.

NORTHWEST COLORADO COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NWCCOG) SERVES THE FIVE-COUNTY REGION OF EAGLE, GRAND, JACKSON, PITKIN, AND SUMMIT COUNTIES. VINTAGE, FORMALLY THE ALPINE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, IS A DEPARTMENT UNDER NWCCOG AND HOSTS VINTAGE RSVP. TOGETHER, THEY ENSURE THAT OLDER ADULTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS HAVE ACCESS TO THE SUPPORTS, SERVICES, AND RESOURCES NEEDED AS PEOPLE AGE.
THE SUBMITTAL OF THIS GRANT OCCURS IN UNPRECEDENTED TIMES. ALTHOUGH VINTAGE RSVP HAS BEEN A GRANT RECIPIENT FOR SIX YEARS, AND SUCCESSFULLY NAVIGATED TO THE NEW REQUIRED NATIONAL INDICATORS IN 2018, THE PROGRAM LOST 85% OF ITS VOLUNTEERS AND FACED ADDITIONAL CHALLENGES IMPLEMENTING THE NEW REQUIREMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, JUST AS THE PROGRAM FACED THESE PROGRAMMATIC CHANGES AND CHALLENGES, VINTAGE RSVP NOW FACES THE UNKNOWN THAT THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BRINGS. VINTAGE RSVP CONTINUES TO LOOK TO THE EXPERTS AT THE LOCAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL LEVELS FOR INFORMATION AND DIRECTION TO PROTECT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO MAY FALL INTO THE VULNERABLE POPULATION CRITERIA AND WORK WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY THE NEW, INCREASING, AND EVERCHANGING NEEDS OF THOSE IN THE COMMUNITY. TECHNOLOGY WILL LIKELY PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE, AND AS SUCH, VINTAGE RSVP WILL STAY UP-TO-DATE WITH THE CURRENT INFORMATION TO IMPLEMENT AS MANY INTERVENTIONS AND PRECAUTIONS AS POSSIBLE.
AN ESTIMATED 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE UNDER THIS 2021-2024 RSVP GRANT. OF THIS NUMBER, 90 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE OR IMPROVE SAFE HOUSING, ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT, FOOD SECURITY, AND RESPITE, ORGANIZATIONS THAT WORK WITH INDIVIDUALS TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES, AND IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS GRANT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, VINTAGE RSVP WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES:
        NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING
        NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY

RSVP?S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC PARTICIPATION THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS AND ALLEVIATE ROOT CAUSES OF COMMUNITY NEED, SPECIFICALLY POVERTY AND RACISM.  THE INSTITUTE FOR RESEARCH ON POVERTY IDENTIFIES THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY AS: UNEMPLOYMENT/UNDER-EMPLOYMENT OF LOW SKILLED WORKERS; LACK OF, OR INADEQUATE EDUCATION; AGE; RACE; OTHER CULTURAL FACTORS. THE PROJECTED TARGETS ARE FOR MARCH, 2022 AND ASSUME A DIMINISHED COVID19 EFFECT THROUGHOUT OHIO BY EARLY TO MID-2021. WE WILL ADDRESS THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY THROUGH SENIOR VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (FINANCIAL LITERACY, JOB TRAINING & AFFORDABLE HOUSING), EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS), AND HEALTHY FUTURES (FOOD SECURITY, ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE, TRANSPORTATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP). 736 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, IN OUTCOME BASED PERFORMANCE MEASURES, WILL SERVE IN PORTAGE, ASHTABULA, STARK, JEFFERSON, COLUMBIANA, MAHONING, TRUMBULL, GREENE, MONTGOMERY, MARION, CRAWFORD, MORROW, HURON, SENECA, AND WYANDOT COUNTIES. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS WILL EXCEED 900. ACTIVITIES WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME, MINORITY, AND RESIDENTS IN NEED TO GAIN ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, AFFORDABLE PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS, AND FOOD SECURITY; PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS AND OTHERS WHO ARE SOCIALLY ISOLATED, ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; PROVIDE MENTORING AND TEACHING ASSISTANCE TO HELP CHILDREN IN IN LOW INCOME/MINORITY NEIGHBORHOOD SCHOOLS TO ACHIEVE ACADEMIC SUCCESS, KEY TO OVERCOMING POVERTY; PROVIDE FINANCIAL EDUCATION AND JOB TRAINING CLASSES FOR ADULTS TO SEEK AND SECURE GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT; CREATE AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $518,338 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $222,145 IN LOCAL, NON-FEDERAL FUNDING AND IN-KIND RESOURCES. PROGRAM COST PER VOLUNTEER WILL BE $705. LAST GRANT YEAR OUR VOLUNTEERS SERVED 68,198 HOURS ($1,734,275 VALUE; INDEPENDENT SECTOR ? VALUE OF VOLUNTEER HOUR $25.43@). THE RSVP PROGRAM IS SUPPORTED BY ALL THE RESOURCES IN FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. ADMINISTRATION.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE WILL HAVE ASSISTED OVER 7,000 INDIVIDUALS, INCLUDING OVER 4,000 CHILDREN, WITH FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER SERVICES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $371,887 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $232,000 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS.

SENIOR NEIGHBORS, INC (SNI) IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1972, SERVING OLDER ADULTS IN KENT COUNTY WITH PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT THEIR INDEPENDENCE INCLUDING CASE MANAGEMENT, TRANSPORTATION, SENIOR CENTERS AND HEALTH AND WELLNESS. AS AN OLDER ADULT SERVICE PROVIDER, SENIOR NEIGHBORS UNDERSTANDS THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS AND IS COMMITTED TO HELPING THEM REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL. WITH A PHYSICAL PRESENCE AT FIVE SENIOR CENTERS LOCATED IN BOTH URBAN GRAND RAPIDS AND THE OUTLYING RURAL AREAS OF KENT COUNTY, SNI IS WELL-POSITIONED TO REACH OLDER ADULTS WHERE THEY LIVE AND IS ABLE TO NAVIGATE AND ADDRESS LOCAL ISSUES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO AREA SENIORS. 
VOLUNTEERS HAVE BEEN -AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE - AN ESSENTIAL ELEMENT OF SENIOR NEIGHBORS SERVICES BECAUSE, VOLUNTEERING PROVIDES PURPOSE AND MEANING DURING A NEW PHASE OF LIFE THAT CAN BE OTHERWISE ISOLATING AND PROVIDES A WAY FOR CLIENTS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITY. SENIOR NEIGHBORS UTILIZES VOLUNTEERS WITHIN VARIOUS PROGRAMS AS WELL AS SPONSORING THE OTHER TWO SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS OPERATING WITHIN KENT COUNTY, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AND SENIOR COMPANIONS. RSVP ALLOWS SENIOR NEIGHBORS TO MAXIMIZE ITS IMPACT BEYOND OLDER ADULTS WHO NEED ASSISTANCE AND IS AN INTEGRAL PROGRAM CONNECTING OLDER ADULTS TO MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER POSITIONS AND PROVIDING INFORMATION, TRAINING AND EDUCATION ABOUT ADDRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS. SENIOR NEIGHBORS, INC PROPOSES TO CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN KENT COUNTY BEGINNING APRIL 1, 2021. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THE PROJECT WILL ACTIVELY ENGAGE 140 RSVP VOLUNTEERS, 85 IN THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS: EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. IN ADDITION, 55 VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS OTHER NEEDS AS IDENTIFIED THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY MATCH FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE STATE OF MI AND KENT COUNTY SENIOR MILLAGE.

THE NORTHERN KENTUCKY COMMUNITY ACTION COMMISSION (NKCAC) ENVISIONS A THRIVING COMMUNITY WHERE ALL MEMBERS ARE SELF-RELIANT, CAPABLE OF HELPING THEMSELVES AND OFFERING SUPPORT TO THEIR NEIGHBORS WITH ANY LIFE CHALLENGES THEY MAY FACE. THE ORGANIZATION WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1966 AS PART OF THE JOHNSON ADMINISTRATION'S "WAR ON POVERTY"  AND HAS EVOLVED TO BECOME NORTHERN KENTUCKY'S PREEMINENT MULTIPURPOSE HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY. NKCAC HELPS OVER 20,000 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES PER YEAR DEVELOP THE KNOWLEDGE, OPPORTUNITIES AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO ACHIEVE SELF-RELIANCE. WITH SERVICES SPANNING EIGHT NORTHERN KENTUCKY COUNTIES THAT INCLUDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING, CHILD ABUSE PREVENTION, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, FINANCIAL EMPOWERMENT, WEATHERIZATION, NEIGHBORHOOD CENTERS AND SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMMING, NKCAC IS GOVERNED BY A 21-MEMBER BOARD REPRESENTING DIVERSE SECTORS. 

NKCAC'S PROPOSED RSVP PROJECT WILL ADVANCE THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE?S MISSION TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP, FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, HOUSING ASSISTANCE AND TAX PREPARATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, NEARLY 500 INDIVIDUALS WILL ACHIEVE THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES RELATED TO SCHOOL READINESS, AGING IN PLACE, EMPLOYMENT, HOUSING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $225,000 ($75K ANNUALLY OVER THREE YEARS) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $63,500 (Y1-$8,500, Y2-$20,000 AND Y3-$35,000) WITH NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE RSVP PROGRAM IN LOUISVILLE, KY HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR OVER 40 YEARS AND ADMINISTERED THE LAST 20+ YEARS BY THE LOUISVILLE METRO GOVERNMENT. IT HAS BEEN AND CONTINUES TO BE A VITAL PROGRAM TO SOME 450 ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND NEARLY 70 VOLUNTEER SITES. OVER TWO DECADES THROUGH THE ADMINISTRATION OF LOUISVILLE METRO GOVERNMENT, SOME OF THE RSVP ACTIVITIES HAVE INCLUDED: PACKAGING AND DELIVERY OF NUTRITIONALLY-BALANCED MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS; ASSISTING AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS; PROVIDING TEACHING TOOLS AND TUTORING AT EVENING MEAL SITES, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS; ENHANCING ACCESS TO CARE AND PATIENT SERVICES AT THE ROBLEY REX VA MEDICAL CENTER; AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF LOCALLY-IMPORTANT ORGANIZATIONS TO FULFILL THEIR MISSIONS TO THE JEFFERSON COUNTY, KY COMMUNITY AT LARGE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROJECT FOR THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE IS "HEALTHY FUTURES". AS IT WAS IN THE LAST GRANT CYCLE, RSVP WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPACTS IN AREAS OF FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, AND SOCIAL OUTREACH TOWARD PRESERVATION OF INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AND SUPPORT OF $128,006 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $69,400 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES RESULTING IN A TOTAL OVERALL AMOUNT OF $197,406.

AUDUBON AREA COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC., THE LOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, OPERATES IN DAVIESS, HANCOCK, HENDERSON, MCLEAN, OHIO, UNION AND WEBSTER COUNTIES OF KENTUCKY AND STRIVES TO FULFILL ITS MISSION OF  "HELPING PEOPLE, CHANGING LIVES, BUILDING COMMUNITIES"  WITH SPONSORSHIP OF THE RSVP.  

IN 2021, AN ESTIMATED 350 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 164 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, HOUSING ASSISTANCE, TUTORING, FINANCIAL LITERACY ASSISTANCE, AND VETERANS' SERVICES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IN OUR HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF "OBESITY AND FOOD" WILL REFLECT 7,000 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD PANTRY SERVICES OF WHICH 500 INDIVIDUALS ARE EXPECTED TO REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY THROUGH THE ASSISTANCE OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $143,877 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 30% MATCHING NON-FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE MINIMAL AMOUNT OF $61,661 TO BE SECURED THROUGH DIVERSIFIED NON-FEDERAL ALLOCATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 199 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN BOTH MCCRACKEN AND HICKMAN COUNTY OVER THE NEXT YEAR. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ON NUTRITION, EXERCISE, MONEY MANAGEMENT, READING FLUENCY, HEALTHCARE ACCESS AND INDEPENDENT LIVING. 
READING FLUENCY WILL BE PROMOTED THROUGH A MENTOR PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN ONE OF OUR PARTNER STATIONS AND THE LOCAL PUBLIC SCHOOLS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE RECRUITED AS MENTORS AND MATCHED WITH STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT REACHING READING BENCHMARKS BY THE END OF THEIR RESPECTIVE GRADE LEVELS. IN ADDITION TO INCREASING THEIR READING FLUENCY, THE SUPPORTIVE AND POSITIVE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN YOUTH AND RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROMOTES SELF-ESTEEM AND BETTER SOCIAL SKILLS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL VISIT THEIR STUDENT ONCE A WEEK FOR AN HOUR AT THE SCHOOL. THEY WILL CHOOSE A BOOK(S) FROM THE SCHOOL LIBRARY AND READ TOGETHER. THIS POSITIVE ROLE MODEL RELATIONSHIP PROVIDES ANOTHER LAYER OF ACADEMIC SUPPORT AND GUIDANCE FOR THE STUDENT.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA ON THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THIS GRANT CYCLE, COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF ALL AGES WILL BE HEALTHIER AS A RESULT OF EXERCISE/NUTRITION CLASSES, RECEIVE FOOD FROM LOCAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS FOR HEALTHIER DIETS, BECOME MORE KNOWLEDGEABLE ON UTILIZING HEALTHCARE PROGRAMS AND LEARN LIFE SKILLS TO HELP WITH INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE MCCRACKEN AND HICKMAN COUNTY RSVP IS REQUESTING $77,373.00 IN CNCS FUNDING FOR YEAR 1 OF 3 FOR THE NEW GRANT CYCLE. ADDITIONAL INCOME WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $7,600.00 IN CASH MATCH AND $30,085.00 OF IN-KIND MATCH FROM THE APPLICANT.

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 133 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE EVIDENCE BASED ACCESS TO CARE OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION MENTORING, AGING IN PLACE - INDEPENDENT LIVING - CALL REASSURANCE, ACCESS TO CARE - DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION AND EDUCATION - INTER-GENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING TUTORING/MENTORING. IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, GAINS WILL BE MADE IN SPECIFIC PRIORITIES OF CNCS. EVIDENCE BASED ACCESS TO CARE - OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION; 450 STUDENTS WILL INDICATE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE ON PREVENTION RELATED MATERIAL AND DRUG REFUSAL SKILLS. AGING IN PLACE - INDEPENDENT LIVING, 45 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY 1200 INDIVIDUALS WILL INDICATE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF NEEDED FOOD ASSISTANT SERVICES AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO END LONG-TERM HUNGER. AGING IN PLACE - ELDER JUSTICE, 1000 INDIVIDUALS WILL INDICATE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE TO PREVENT FINANCIAL FRAUD, ABUSE AND/OR NEGLECT FROM INFORMATION PROVIDED TO THEM. IN EDUCATION - INTER-GENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING, 75 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL/ EMOTIONAL SKILLS. MSU/RSVP STRIVES TO PROVIDE WORK PLANS THAT ADVANCE JUSTICE AND EQUALITY IN AREAS SUCH AS EDUCATION, ACCESS TO FOOD AND HEALTH CARE, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, ELDER JUSTICE AND LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $89,424 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $54,477.

HEALTHY FUTURES AGING IN PLACE, 2. ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FINANCIAL LITERACY, 3. EDUCATION SCHOOL READINESS, 4. HEALTHY FUTURES ACCESS TO CARE, 5. VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES VETERANS & FAMILIES SERVED, 6. OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, AND 7. HEALTHY FUTURES OBESITY & FOOD.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 188 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, $37,500 WILL BE TAX DOLLARS RETURNED TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, 48 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, 375 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, 245 VETERANS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND 20 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FREE PRESCRIPTION ASSISTANCE. MASON COUNTY INTERAGENCY COUNCIL, INC., IS AN IRS 501(C)(3), NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHO IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF MASON COUNTY RSVP.  AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE MASON COUNTY RSVP, OF THIS NUMBER 92 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH ASSIGNMENTS WITH FOOD PANTRIES/FOOD PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO ELIMINATE LONG-TERM HUNGER FOR THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED IN OUR COMMUNITY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 85%OF THE FOOD INSECURE PEOPLE WE SERVE WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN.

OTHER SERVICE CATEGORIES WE ADDRESS IN OUR WORK PLANS ARE EDUCATION, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND NUMEROUS COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $91, 991, WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF CASH AND IN-KIND TOTALING $59,500.

THE LEGAL AGENCY NAME IS WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. (WICAA) IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, ESTABLISHED THROUGH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 1964. WICAA SPONSORS A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND IS FUNDED THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL SOURCES. THE GOVERNING, TRIPARTITE BOARD IS COMPRISED OF VOLUNTEER REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND LOW-INCOME SECTORS OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE. OUR AGENCY'S MISSION IS, TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES TO IMPROVE LIVING CONDITIONS AND PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN OUR COMMUNITY.  WICAA WILL ADVOCATE FOR AND STRIVE TO ALLEVIATE CONDITIONS OF POVERTY, IMPROVE LIVING CONDITIONS, AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND SOCIAL SERVICES TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN NEED WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA. ALL WICAA PROGRAMS ARE ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN REMOVING RACIAL INEQUALITIES, ADVANCING RACIAL EQUITY, AND INCREASING COMMUNITY OPPORTUNITY IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE CHANGE. ALL OUR ENDEAVORS ARE PURSUED WITH THE CLIENT IN MIND, NEVER FORGETTING THE VALUE OF EVERY HUMAN BEING OR THE IMPORTANCE OF OUR RESPONSIBILITY TO THE PUBLIC WE SERVE. 
THE WICAA RSVP PROPOSES TO SUPPORT 73 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO ONE OF THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF LOCAL AGENCIES TO IMPROVE OUR COMMUNITY, ALLEVIATE FOOD INSECURITY, AND EDUCATION ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF REDUCING WASTE AT AN ALUMINUM RECYCLING CENTER. OUR MAJOR PROJECTS ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, AS EXPANDED UPON IN THE WORK PLANS ARE TO HELP INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD BY REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND RESPONDING TO FOOD EMERGENCIES; PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO APPOINTMENTS, TRAINING AND BEING VALUABLE RESOURCE GUIDES. THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,429 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

LINCOLN HILLS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (LHDC) HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION OF THE CRAWFORD, PERRY, AND SPENCER COUNTIES RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 1977, AND THOUSANDS OF LOYAL AND DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS HAVE CONTRIBUTED SIGNIFICANTLY TO IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SOUTHERN INDIANA DURING THAT TIME.
LHDC WAS INCORPORATED AS A PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IN 1965 AND SERVES PRIMARILY CRAWFORD, PERRY, AND SPENCER COUNTIES IN SOUTHERN INDIANA. THE AGENCY IS 8GOVERNED BY AN 18-MEMBER VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND IS LED BY A TALENTED, DYNAMIC SENIOR EXECUTIVE TEAM. IT IS THE PHILOSOPHY OF THE BOARD AND STAFF THAT IMPROVING THE LIFE OF ONE PERSON DOES IMPROVE THE LIVES OF ALL PEOPLE, AND THAT PHILOSOPHY IS CARRIED OUT DAILY AS THE BOARD AND STAFF STRIVES TO MEET THE AGENCY VISION:
"WE BELIEVE IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL JUSTICE FOR ALL PEOPLE ACROSS SOUTHERN INDIANA?NOW AND ALWAYS."
THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF LHDC ARE TO PROVIDE THE FACILITIES, PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND ACTIVITIES IN SOUTHERN INDIANA THAT ENABLE AND EMPOWER SOME OF SOCIETY'S MOST VULNERABLE AND DISADVANTAGED CITIZENS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES. THE AGENCY EMPLOYS OVER 160 DEDICATED STAFF THAT PROVIDE SERVICES THROUGHOUT TEN (10) COUNTIES, INCLUDING HEAD START BIRTH ? 5 PRESCHOOL SERVICES, HEALTHY FAMILIES HOME VISITING SERVICES, ENERGY ASSISTANCE, WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE, HOUSING COUNSELING, RENTAL ASSISTANCE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING APARTMENTS AND RENTAL ASSISTANCE, HEALTH INSURANCE SERVICES, COMMUNITY SERVICES, RESOURCE COORDINATION, AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.
AN ESTIMATED 105 DEDICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH LHDC'S SPONSORSHIP OF THE PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 82 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WHICH IS DESCRIBED AT LENGTH IN LHDC'S WORK PLANS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL HAVE HELPED MANY LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND SENIORS WITH FOOD INSECURITY, ASSISTED AT LEAST 150 PRESCHOOL CHILDREN ANNUALLY WITH FREE VISION SCREENINGS AND ACCESS TO CARE, PROVIDED COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED SENIORS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, PROVIDED 600 EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS KITS ANNUALLY TO LOW-INCOME SENIORS AND PRESCHOOL FAMILIES, AND WILL HAVE RAISED THOUSANDS IN FUNDS FOR LOCAL NON-PROFIT OUTREACH ORGANIZATIONS.  
COVID-19 HAS HAD A SUBSTANTIAL IMPACT AND WILL CONTINUE IMPACTING THE RSVP PROGRAM. WHILE OUR AGENCY PUSHES FORWARD, WE KNOW THAT THERE IS A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE DAYS, MONTHS, AND POSSIBLY YEARS AHEAD WITH VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND VOLUNTEERS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,143 OF LOCAL IN-KIND SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 700 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN CLARK, FLOYD, HARRISON, JEFFERSON AND SCOTT COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA.  OF THIS NUMBER, 352 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME PRODUCING ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: WORKING IN PANTRIES AND SOUP KITCHENS; BUILDING WHEELCHAIR RAMPS; CALLING AND TRANSPORTING THE HOMEBOUND; PROVIDING WEEKLY SOCIALIZATION AND FRESH FLOWERS TO HOSPICE PATIENTS; PROVIDING INTEGRATION FOR ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES; AND TEACHING YOUNG CHILDREN HOW AND WHY TO WASH THEIR HANDS PROPERLY.  
     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH 4 OUTCOME-BASED WORKPLANS FOR AGING IN PLACE, 2 FOR ACCESS TO CARE AND 1 FOR OBESITY AND FOOD.
     AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, 100 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT THROUGH DIAL A CARE OR RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION; 30 FAMILIES WILL HAVE IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH RAMPS TO FREEDOM; 1,000 SENIORS WILL HAVE SAVED $200,000 BY HAVING THEIR TAX RETURNS PREPARED FREE; AND 25 AT-RISK THIRD GRADERS WILL HAVE MAINTAINED A C OR ABOVE IN LANGUAGE ARTS.  IN ADDITION, 1,000 FIRST-GRADERS WILL HAVE LEARNED ABOUT PROPER HAND-WASHING AND OF THE THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE SERVED THROUGH OUR PANTRIES AND SOUP KITCHENS, AT LEAST 500 OF THEM WILL REPORT AN IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR FOOD SECURITY.
     THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $84,210 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $79,609 OF LOCAL RESOURCES, WHICH INCLUDES BOTH THE REQUIRED MATCH AND 'EXCESS' RESOURCES GENERATED TO SUSTAIN THE PROJECTS DESCRIBED WITHIN THIS APPLICATION.

EXECUTIVE
TRI-CAP RSVP WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 195 VOLUNTEERS SERVING DURING THE GRANT PERIOD OF 4/1/21 THROUGH 3/31/24.  SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, CARING FOR INFANTS UNDER OTHER EDUCATION SERVICE, AT RISK ECOSYSTEM RECYCLING AND REUSING PROJECTS UNDER ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND OTHER CAPACITY BUILDING COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AND THE GRANT WILL ASSIST WITH MEETING HEALTH NEEDS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF DUBOIS, PIKE, AND WARRICK COUNTIES, INDIANA TO INCLUDE ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, AND OBESITY AND FOOD.  TO ACHIEVE PERFORMANCE GOALS FOR ALL THREE GRANT YEARS, UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SUPPORT THE ABILITY OF HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND ASSIST INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESS TO FOOD RESOURCES, AND WHOEVER ELSE MAY HAVE THE NEED WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL MIRROR THE CORE PRINCIPLES IDENTIFIED BY CNCS WHICH ARE TO IDENTIFY AND INVEST IN COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS; ENGAGE AMERICANS IN SERVICE; SUPPORT COMMUNITY EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS AND LEVERAGE PUBLIC-PRIVATE COLLABORATIONS. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, AN ESTIMATED 150 HOMEBOUND, SENIOR CITIZENS, AND OLDER ADULTS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, AND (200) ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS (UNDUPLICATED) IN THIS THREE COUNTY SERVICE AREA WILL RECEIVE SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND EXPERIENCE INCREASED HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $36,541.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 70 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND 57 OF THOSE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, PREPARING INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY FOR DISASTER, SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES AND SOCIAL PROGRAMS AT SENIOR COMMUNITY CENTERS, PROVIDING SUPPORT AT FOOD PANTRIES, REMOVING INVASIVE SPECIES, ASSISTING WITH VITA, AND SUPPORTING VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM AND SERVICE PROJECTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES: OBESITY AND FOOD. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AS A RESULT OF CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $21,429 WITH AN EXCESS OF $5,117.

THE INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (ICAP), INC., IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE "HELP FOR TODAY AND HOPE FOR TOMORROW". WE CARE ABOUT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY AND WE ARE DEDICATED TO HELP PEOPLE FROM ALL DIVERSITIES TO HELP THEMSELVES AND EACH OTHER. ESTABLISHED IN 1965, UNDER THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT, AS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, ICAP WILL DESIGN, SPONSOR AND ADMINISTER PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE HELP TO SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS THAT THEY MAY BECOME RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS. ICAP SERVES THE COUNTIES OF DELAWARE, FAYETTE, GRANT, HANCOCK, HENRY, MADISON, RUSH AND WAYNE LOCATED IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA. THROUGH GRANT PROGRAMS SUCH AS RSVP, THE AGENCY PROVIDES SUPPORT AND RESOURCES TO THE MANY COMMUNITIES IN NEED. WE ARE COMMITTED TO ACTIVELY ENGAGE IN REMOVING STRUCTURAL RACIAL INEQUITIES, ADVANCING RACIAL EQUALITY AND TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITY TO ALL INDIVIDUALS TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN CHANGE IN THESE AREAS. OUR FOCUS FOR THIS IS TO EDUCATE AND CREATE AWARENESS THROUGH COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, HOSTING AND PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS AT ROUNDTABLE COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND FORUMS AND CREATING SPECIAL PROJECTS AS THE NEEDS ARISE. VENUES WE PLAN TO USE FOR THIS ARE PREGNANCY CARE CENTERS, HOMELESS SHELTERS FOR BOTH MEN AND WOMEN, SUPPORTING MEAL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES IN DIVERSE NEIGHBORHOOD WITH VOLUNTEERS AND REFERRALS FOR ALL. WE ARE INCLUDING IN THIS GRANT A SPECIAL PROJECTS SITE- RSVP COMMUNITY PROJECTS WHERE WE CAN MEET THE CHALLENGES ABOVE AS WELL AS INCLUDE ADAPTABLE MEANS OF VOLUNTEERING SHOULD THE NEED ARISE AS HAS DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  WE ARE WELL AWARE OF THE SYSTEMIC AND SWEEPING CHANGES THAT NEED TO OCCUR TO FIND ALTERNATE AVENUES OF VOLUNTEERING. THIS HAS ALSO SHOWN US THE NEED TO PROVIDE ALTERNATE METHODS OF VOLUNTEERING FOR INTERESTED INDIVIDUALS REGARDLESS OF THEIR ABILITIES. 
 AS A RSVP GRANT APPLICANT, ICAP PROPOSES A TOTAL NUMBER OF 106 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS $50,000 PER YEAR IN FUNDS FOR THE GRANT PERIOD OF APRIL 2021 TO MARCH 2024. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS RSVP PROJECTS IN THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OF HEALTHY FUTURES, WHICH WILL INCLUDE WORK PLANS FOR FOOD DISTRIBUTION, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, AND ACCESS TO CARE. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR PERIOD, THE OUTCOME BASED MEASURES WILL SHOW THAT THE WORK OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTED TO INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR 24 INDIVIDUALS AND INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR AT LEAST 10 HOMEBOUND CLIENTS AS WELL AS AN IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. RSVP WILL ENHANCE THE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES FOR AT LEAST 66 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH INTERACTIONS AT THE SENIOR CENTER, COMMUNICATION WITH THE HOMEBOUND OR NURSING CARE RESIDENTS. ACCORDING THE NHTSA, TRANSPORTATION IN THE ELDER POPULATION BECOMES AN INCREASING BURDEN DUE TO SECURING AN AFFORDABLE MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION, VISION ACUITY, UNSAFE FEELING WHEN DRIVING AND VARIOUS HEALTH REASONS. THROUGH PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THOSE IN NEED RSVP WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND DISABLED ADULTS TO PROVIDE IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, THE OUTCOME BASED MEASURE WILL SHOW 10 CLIENTS WILL BENEFITED FROM THIS SERVICE. THE TRANSPORTATION WILL INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, SHOPPING, PHARMACY PICK-UP, ENTERTAINMENT AND DINING. ALL OF THESE WILL ALSO INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE CLIENTS AS THE VOLUNTEER WILL BE ABLE TO INTERACT WITH THE CLIENTS. ACCESS TO CARE IS AN INCREASINGLY DIFFICULT AREA FOR SENIORS TO NAVIGATE WITH INSURANCE INFORMATION CONFUSING AT BEST. TRAINED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION ON HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND AVAILABILITY OF SUPPORT TO 20 CLIENTS ANNUALLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 50,000 DOLLARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 21,429 DOLLARS THROUGH COMMUNITY DONATIONS OF VARIOUS MEANS IN CONGRUENCE WITH REGULATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 91 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT; COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS; AND COUNSELING/COACHING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUTCOMES WILL FOCUS ON INDIVIDUALS INCREASING FOOD SECURITY; INCREASING SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVING CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND INCREASING HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,365.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF FORT WAYNE-SOUTH BEND (CATHOLIC CHARITIES) HAS BEEN SERVING THE NEEDS OF THE POOR AND VULNERABLE IN SINCE 1922.  OUR MISSION IS TO "SERVE THOSE IN NEED AS CHRIST WOULD HAVE US DO." CATHOLIC CHARITIES SERVES ALL WHO COME TO OUR DOORS FOR ASSISTANCE BECAUSE OF THE BELIEF THAT WE ARE ONE HUMAN FAMILY WHATEVER OUR NATIONAL, RACIAL, ETHNIC, ECONOMIC AND IDEOLOGICAL DIFFERENCES. ALL OF OUR SERVICES ARE SECULAR IN NATURE.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES EMPLOYS A DIVERSE STAFF THAT SPEAKS 18 DIFFERENT LANGUAGES, IN OVER 20 SEPARATE PROGRAMS GEARED TO THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF THE DIVERSE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.
     CATHOLIC CHARITIES PRIMARY TARGET POPULATIONS INCLUDES ADULTS AND CHILDREN LIVING IN POVERTY AND ALL OTHER MARGINALIZED PERSONS IN NEED. CATHOLIC CHARITIES SERVICES RANGE FROM ASSISTING FINANCIALLY-CHALLENGED HOUSEHOLDS WITH BASIC NEEDS SUCH AS RENT, UTILITIES, FOOD, AND CLOTHING TO ASSISTING WITH EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT, BOTH PRIMARY AND POST-SECONDARY, THROUGH SECURING EMPLOYMENT THAT LEADS TO ECONOMIC MOBILITY. THE TWO-GENERATION APPROACH EMPHASIZES THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, ECONOMIC SUPPORTS, SOCIAL CAPITAL, AND HEALTH AND WELL-BEING TO CREATE A LEGACY OF ECONOMIC SECURITY THAT PASSES FROM ONE GENERATION TO THE NEXT.
     VOLUNTEERS ARE A VITAL PART OF EXTENDING OUR MISSION, VISION AND VALUES THROUGHOUT THE ORGANIZATION AND INTO THE COMMUNITY.  WE HAVE BEEN A SUCCESSFUL, SPONSORING AGENCY FOR RSVP FOR CLOSE TO 40 YEARS.  IN CHOOSING THE FOCUS AREAS FOR NEXT 3 YEARS, CATHOLIC CHARITIES GATHERED RESEARCH FROM UNITED WAYS, COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS, AND OTHER FOUNDATIONS TO DETERMINE COMMUNITY PRIORITIES IN EACH OF THE COUNTIES.   THE INFORMATION GATHERED HELPED US TO KNOW WHERE VOLUNTEERS COULD BE MOST USEFUL AND LED US TO DETERMINE OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. THIS GRANT CYCLE ADDITIONAL FOCUS AREAS INCLUDE FINANCIAL LITERACY AND EDUCATION, WHICH IS BEING ADDED AS EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION IS A TOP COMMUNITY PRIORITY IN ALL 3 COUNTIES SERVED. THROUGHOUT THIS UPCOMING GRANT CYCLE, CATHOLIC CHARITIES WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN AND SUPPORT VOLUNTEERS FOR THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: ASSISTING FOOD PANTRIES, PROVIDE VITA TAX SERVICES AND SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS.
     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  91 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND AN ESTIMATED 225 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER CAPACITIES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,950 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE FEDERAL AND INDIANA INCOME TAXES PREPARED, 3,000+ INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE EMERGENCY FOOD THUS DECREASING FOOD INSECURITY AND 225 YOUNG CHILDREN WILL BE BETTER PREPARED TO ENTER SCHOOL.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $89,548 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,025 PER YEAR.

ESTABLISHED IN 1974, THE FULTON COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING (FCCOA) IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION LOCATED IN ROCHESTER, INDIANA.  THE FCCOA SPONSORS RSVP OF FULTON COUNTY, AND BOTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE BASED OUT OF THE COMMUNITY CENTER IN ROCHESTER.  FCCOA & RSVP BOTH WORK TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT SUPPORT OUR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, BOTH YOUNG AND OLD, SO THAT LONGER INDEPENDENT LIVING IS ACHIEVED, AND THE LIVES OF THOSE IN OUR COMMUNITY WHO ARE DISABLED OR WHO ARE LIVING AT/BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL ARE ENRICHED.  AS OUR COMMUNITY CENTER GROWS, WE STRIVE TO BOOST OUR CURRENT ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS ADD EXTRA ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR EXPANDING AND AGING COMMUNITY.  THE GOAL OF RSVP IS TO MATCH INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN NEED OF HELP WITH VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE SKILLS AND TALENTS AND A DESIRE TO ASSIST THOSE IN OUR COMMUNITY.  STRONGER SOCIAL TIES ARE FELT BY BOTH THE VOLUNTEER AND THE RECIPIENT, WHICH LEADS TO POSITIVE CHANGES IN OUR COMMUNITY.  

AN ESTIMATED 231 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 116 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HELPING TO BUILD A NEW HOME, DISTRIBUTING FOOD FROM FOOD PANTRIES, PREPARING TAX RETURNS, PROVIDING FREE OR LOW-COST HEALTH CARE, AND ASSISTING WITH INTAKE OF RECYCLABLE MATERIALS AT THE LOCAL RECYCLING CENTER.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AND RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK AT STATIONS SUCH AS COUNTY FOOD PANTRIES, WOODLAWN HOSPITAL MEALS ON WHEELS, MATTHEW'S MARKET, UNITED MINISTRIES CHRISTMAS BASKETS PROGRAM, AND FREE MEAL @ GRACE TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: INCREASED SATISFACTION OF SENIOR CITIZENS WHO CAN STAY IN THEIR HOMES LONGER & ENJOY INDEPENDENT LIVING DUE TO ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD. AND AN INCREASE IN SATISFACTION OF FOOD PANTRY RECIPIENTS WHO HAVE FAMILIES/CHILDREN AT HOME AND ARE ABLE TO PROVIDE FOR THEIR FAMILIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $15,000 IN ANTICIPATED NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING IN-KIND, FUNDRAISING, DONATIONS, AND UNITED WAY SUPPORT.

UNITED WAY OF PORTER COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO LEAD, UNITE AND INSPIRE OUR COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE LIVES. AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR MAIN ACTIVITIES WILL BE ASSISTING WITH MEAL DISTRIBUTION FOR LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, MEALS ON WHEELS, AND SENIOR CENTERS WHERE THEY WILL SORT, PACK, PREPARE, DELIVER AND DISTRIBUTE SHELF-STABLE MEALS TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT ARE FOOD INSECURE. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES: OBESITY AND FOOD, UTILIZING NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT AS THE SERVICE ACTIVITY. AN ESTIMATED 400 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FIVE COUNTY AREA OF ADAMS, ALLEN, HUNTINGTON, WELLS AND WHITLEY COUNTIES IN INDIANA. OF THIS NUMBER, 229 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH AN ADDITIONAL 171 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN OTHER IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PROVIDING NUTRITION SUPPORT TO SENIORS AND LOW INCOME FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY WHO ARE EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY; PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION AND PREPARING FEDERAL AND INDIANA INCOME TAX RETURNS FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME FAMILIES; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS SO THEY CAN REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME; AND PROVIDIG ACCESS TO THE LEGAL SIYSTEM IN ORDER TO INCREASE JOB READINESS; THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD MORE LOW TO MODERATE INCOME RESIDENTS WILL HAVE FOOD SECURITY, MORE INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE RECEIVED ASSISTANCE WITH TAX PREPARATION AND GAIN FINANCIAL LITERACY AND JOB READINESS KNOWLEDGE, MORE SENIORS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIALIZATION AND COMMUNITY SUPPORT, LESS SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WILL BE THE VICTIMS OF PREDATORY SCAMS AND A GREATER NUMBER OF NONPROFIT COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS WILL HAVE AN INCREASED OUTREACH AND CAPACITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $227,249 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $102,737 IN THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
