THE COUNCIL OF THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS (CSM), AN I.R.S. DESIGNATED 501 C (3) NON-PROFIT WEST VIRGINIA CORPORATION, IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY ESTABLISHED IN 1964. A VOLUNTEER TRIPARTITE BOARD OF DIRECTORS GOVERNS THE AGENCY, WITH MEMBERS FROM THREE AREAS: 1) LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY, 2) ELECTED OFFICIALS AND 3) COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES. THIS BOARD SERVES AS THE ADVISORY COUNCIL FOR THIS RSVP PROPOSAL, WHICH CSM HAS SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED FOR OVER A DECADE IN MCDOWELL, MINGO, RALEIGH AND WYOMING COUNTIES IN SOUTHERN WEST VIRGINIA, AN ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED AREA.
THE MISSION STATEMENT OF THE AGENCY IS, THE COUNCIL OF THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS STRIVES TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP PEOPLE ACHIEVE THE DIGNITY OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY.
THREE-HUNDRED (300) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COUNTIES OF MCDOWELL, WYOMING, MINGO AND RALEIGH. TWO-HUNDRED, SEVENTY (270) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $96,147 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,206 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. SOME OF THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS; HOME VISITS TO THE SICK, ELDERLY AND SHUT-INS; FOOD PANTRY; NEIGHBORHOOD WATCH PROGRAMS AND RECOVERY COACHES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH OPIOID OR OTHER SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROBLEMS WITH HEALTHY FUTURES BEING THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.
THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS, AS DERIVED FROM THE AGENCY COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT, AS CERTIFIED BY THE WEST VIRGINIA DEVELOPMENT OFFICE ARE: TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; MANAGING VOLUNTEERS; HEALTHY FUTURES; HOSPICE AND VETERANS.
TO DETERMINE OUTCOMES, TRACKING SHEETS, ALREADY DEVELOPED, WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AND TABULATED BY RSVP STAFF WITH REPORTS TO STAKEHOLDERS. PRE AND POST ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENT TOOLS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO STATIONS MANAGING VOLUNTEERS TO MEASURE THE CAPACITY IN THE AREA OF VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT

WITH THIS PROPOSAL, VOLUNTEER FAIRFAX (VF) WOULD CONTINUE TO EXPAND THE CURRENT RSVP PROGRAM IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA. WHILE SPONSORED BY VF, THE PROGRAM REPRESENTS A UNIQUE PARTNERSHIP WITH VOLUNTEER ARLINGTON (VOLARL; A PROGRAM OF LEADERSHIP CENTER FOR EXCELLENCE), AND VOLUNTEER ALEXANDRIA (VOLALEX). ALL THREE ARE PRIVATE 501(C)3 ORGANIZATIONS. TOGETHER, THESE THREE LOCAL VOLUNTEER CENTERS ARE COMMITTED TO SHARING RESOURCES TO LEVERAGE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS ACROSS THE METROPOLITAN NORTHERN VIRGINIA REGION. THIS INNOVATIVE, COLLABORATIVE STRUCTURE IS KNOWN AS RSVP NORTHERN VIRGINIA (RSVP-NV), AND HAS PROVEN TO BE AN EFFECTIVE APPROACH TO REGIONALIZATION. THE THREE PARTNERING VOLUNTEER CENTERS HAVE BEEN SERVING THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR A COMBINED TOTAL OF MORE THAN 100 YEARS AND HAVE DEEP-SEATED RELATIONSHIPS IN THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING ITS VOLUNTEERS, COMMUNITY LEADERS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND THE NONPROFIT SECTOR. EACH HAS INDEPENDENTLY IDENTIFIED THE CONTINUED NEED TO ENGAGE IN TARGETED OUTREACH TO THE 55+ RESIDENTS FROM THEIR RESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES. THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE RSVP-NV TO CONTINUE ENGAGING AND PLACING SENIOR VOLUNTEERS IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES. OUR ORGANIZATION WILL CONCENTRATE ON SIX CNCS FOCUS AREAS:
*	HEALTHY FUTURES-OBESITY AND FOOD: NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT (FUNDING PRIORITY: ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY-HEALTHY FUTURES) (PRIMARY FOCUS)
*	EDUCATION-K-12 SUCCESS: TUTORING (NEW THIS GRANT CYCLE)
*	HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE: COMPANIONSHIP (FUNDING PRIORITY: AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING)
*	HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE: TRANSPORTATION (FUNDING PRIORITY: AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING)
*	HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE: NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT (FUNDING PRIORITY: AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING)
*	ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY-FINANCIAL LITERACY: FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION
A MINIMUM OF 75 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA BY PROVIDING FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION, AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT. BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 1,200 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE RECEIVED EMERGENCY FOOD SUPPORT OR OTHER FOOD SECURITY SERVICES FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER NONPROFITS THAT WILL RESULT IN INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN. WE HAVE ADDED A NEW FOCUS AREA FOR THE 2021-2024 GRANT CYCLE: EDUCATION-K-12 SUCCESS: TUTORING. WE WILL RECRUIT 16 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE AS TUTORS IN A CLASSROOM/CLASSROOM SETTING OR ONLINE. RSVP-NV VOLUNTEERS HAVE PROVEN EAGER TO SERVE IN THIS CAPACITY, AND WE ARE WORKING WITH OTHER PARTNERS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES IN THIS FOCUS AREA. AT LEAST 46 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING-IN-PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING, BY PROVIDING MEALS, TRANSPORTATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY. AT LEAST 18 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH FURTHERING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY TO BOTH STUDENTS AND ADULTS ACROSS THE REGION. THESE SIX FOCUS AREAS WILL PROVIDE 155 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS. WITH THE DIVERSE ARRAY OF OPPORTUNITIES IN THE AREA, AT LEAST 65 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE SERVING UNDER OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $154,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A NONFEDERAL SHARE OF AT LEAST $73,453.

AN ESTIMATED 56 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 47 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) HEALTHY FUTURES  AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD: WILL ASSIST WITH FOOD DELIVERY BY PROVIDING A HOT MEAL ONCE A WEEK, ALSO, ASSISTING FOOD BANKS WITH FOOD DISTRIBUTION TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN AND THE ELDERLY POPULATION TO HELP WITH FOOD INSECURITY ISSUES IN OUR SERVICE AREA. 2) ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY  FINANCIAL LITERACY: ASSIST THE VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) PROGRAM BY PREPARING TAX REFUNDS FOR LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES;  3) OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES: WILL SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN TO HELP WITH PACKING AND DISTRIBUTING CHRISTMAS GIFTS DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON SO THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL BE ABLE TO BUY MEDICATION AND PAY THEIR BILLS WITHOUT THE ADDED EXPENSES OF CHRISTMAS GIFTS;  ELDER ABUSE: WILL BE MET BY ADDRESSING SENIOR SAFETY THROUGH TWO EVENTS HELD IN MAY AND SEPTEMBER AND HOSTED BY THE TRIAD PROGRAM WHICH IS A COOPERATIVE EFFORT OF THE VIRGINIA ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE, LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES (POLICE/FIRE/SHERIFFS), SENIOR CITIZENS, AND SENIOR ORGANIZATIONS, FOCUSED ON REDUCING CRIMES AGAINST THE MOST VULNERABLE CITIZENS OF OUR AREA, OUR SENIORS; VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO FOCUS ON MARTIN LUTHER KING, JR. AND 9/11 DAY OF SERVICE PROJECTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM WILL HAVE SERVED A TOTAL OF 2,400 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE HEALTHY FUTURES WORK PLAN.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF WESTMORELAND COUNTY HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY WESTMORELAND COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE (WCCC) SINCE 1971. AN ESTIMATED 533 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY, 217 OF THESE WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS DURING THE NEXT THREE-YEAR FUNDING CYCLE. VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS INCLUDE PREPARING AND DELIVERING MEALS TO THE HOME-BOUND; SERVING IN FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND SOUP KITCHENS; PROVIDING FREE INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE; SERVING AS COUNSELORS THROUGH THE APPRISE AND APPRISE TELECENTER PROGRAMS, THE STATE HEALTH INSURANCE COUNSELING PROGRAM FOR INDIVIDUALS ON MEDICARE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, PROGRAM OUTCOMES WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT HOME-BOUND PARTICIPANTS RECEIVING VOLUNTEER ASSISTANCE WILL BE MORE LIKELY TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES AND INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL INTERACTION THROUGH MEAL DELIVERY, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS, AND FRIENDLY VISITORS. PA MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WILL RECEIVE FREE, CONFIDENTIAL, AND UNBIASED INFORMATION ON MEDICARE AND/OR HEALTH INSURANCE-RELATED ISSUES. THEY WILL BE ABLE TO MAKE MORE EDUCATED DECISIONS REGARDING THEIR HEALTHCARE AND HOPEFULLY SAVE MONEY.  INDIVIDUALS WILL BE ASSISTED IN APPLYING FOR PROGRAMS TO ASSIST IN LOWERING THEIR PRESCRIPTION AND INSURANCE PREMIUM COSTS. THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH WORKING WITH OUR NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. THE TARGET POPULATIONS TO BE SERVED INCLUDES FRAIL SENIORS, VETERANS, AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN LOW-INCOME SITUATIONS. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 70,997 WILL BE SUPPORTED BY 75,978 OF NON FEDERAL FUNDING.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
AN ESTIMATED 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES IN MIFFLIN COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF ACTIVITIES WILL BE DELIVERING MEALS, PROVIDING EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMS, PROVIDING HEALTH AND WELLNESS EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, WE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES FOR SEVERAL OBJECTIVES UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES. THE OBJECTIVE AGING IN PLACE OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE OBJECTIVE OBESITY AND FOOD OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, AND CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH, AND IMPROVED HEALTH.  THE OBJECTIVE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH, IMPROVED HEALTH AND IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE.
OTHER FOCUS AREAS TO BE ADDRESSED IN THIS RSVP PROJECT INCLUDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY WITH THE OBJECTIVE TO INCREASE FINANCIAL LITERACY: CAPACITY BUILDING AND LEVERAGE TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS AND LEVERAGE CASH OR IN-KIND RESOURCES: AND DISASTER SERVICES TO EXPAND PROGRAM REACH TO THOSE WHO HAVE BECOME ISOLATED DUE TO COVID19.
THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH AND ANTICIPATED $7,900 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING STRUGGLING READERS SO THAT THEY ARE READING BY GRADE 3; READING TO LOW INCOME HEAD START CHILDREN WHO OFTEN DON'T HAVE ACCESS TO BOOKS; PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND MORE BY DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME-BOUND RESIDENTS AND PROVIDING TECHNOLOGY TRAINING FOR HOME-BOUND SENIORS TO HELP THEM STAY CONNECTED; AND PROVIDING SKILLS BASED VOLUNTEERS TO HELP BUILD THE CAPACITY OF AREA NONPROFIT AGENCIES TO IMPROVE THEIR EFFICIENCIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80% OF PARTICIPATING HEAD START CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AS EVIDENCED BY HAVE INCREASED INTEREST IN READING AND EXPOSURE TO BOOKS. 75% OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN WHO WORKED WITH RSVP LITERACY TUTORS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AS EVIDENCED BY IMPROVED FLUENCY AND/OR COMPREHENSION AND AT LEAST 80% OF SENIORS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND REPORT AN INCREASED SENSE OF WELL-BEING AND SOCIAL CONNECTIVITY.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $141,403 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $86,126.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE OF ATLANTIC AND CAPE MAY COUNTIES (JFS) HAS DEVELOPED AN EFFECTIVE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) PROGRAM IN ATLANTIC COUNTY IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY. A MINIMUM OF 90 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH YEAR FROM 2021 THROUGH 2024. AT LEAST 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT AND COMPANIONSHIP. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION AS WELL AS FRIENDLY VISITING WITH ISOLATED OLDER ADULTS. IN ADDITION, 15 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT JFS WITH FUNDRAISING EFFORTS AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT. AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, JFS WILL HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD FOR 1,015 INDIVIDUALS PER YEAR. MOREOVER, 25 OLDER ADULTS PER YEAR WILL BENEFIT FROM ITS AGING IN PLACE SERVICES AS A RESULT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 PER YEAR WILL BE SUPPORTED BY $34,194 FROM JFS PER YEAR.

AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 195 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, DISTRIBUTING HEALTH CARE INFORMATION, AND TEACHING ADULT BASIC EDUCATION COMPUTER COURSES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, INCREASED BASIC SKILLS FOR JOB PLACEMENT, AND INCREASED HEALTH INSURANCE KNOWLEDGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,143 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. SINCE 1979 JEWISH FAMILY AND VOCATIONAL SERVICE OF MIDDLESEX COUNTY (JFVS) HAS BEEN THE LEGAL NAME OF THIS AGENCY. IN MAY 2014, THE AGENCY WAS ALSO REGISTERED AS "JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES OF MIDDLESEX COUNTY". FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION, THIS AGENCY WILL BE REFERRED TO AS JFS.

JEWISH FAMILY AND CHILDREN'S SERVICES OF NORTHERN NEW JERSEY (JFCS) IS HONORED AND PLEASED TO SUBMIT AN RSVP APPLICATION IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. SEVENTY-FOUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.  THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN WHICH THESE OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE INVOLVED INCLUDE DELIVERING KOSHER MEALS ON WHEELS, PROVIDING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE AND FRIENDLY VISITING, AND COOKING COMPANIONS WHICH WILL MEET BOTH A NUTRITIONAL AND SOCIAL NEED. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 125 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND/OR THEIR CAREGIVERS WILL BE SERVED AND THAT BETWEEN 84% AND 86% WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/SOCIAL SUPPORTS INCLUDING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. OUR OVERARCHING GOAL IS THAT SENIORS REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES, AS SAFELY AS POSSIBLE, FOR AS LONG AS THEY ARE ABLE.
  
JFCS WILL RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS WHO REFLECT THE DIVERSITY OF THE 932,202 RESIDENTS OF OUR BERGEN COUNTY COMMUNITY. WE WILL DO SO THROUGH RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCIES, SENIOR CENTERS, AND THE FAITH COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE COUNTY.

JFCS IS A MULTI-SERVICE, NONSECTARIAN COMMUNITY AGENCY WITH OVER 60 YEARS OF PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN NEED.  JFCS' PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO DEVELOP HEALTHY INDIVIDUALS, STRONG FAMILIES AND VITAL COMMUNITIES.  THE AGENCY MAINTAINS THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF ETHICAL LEADERSHIP, FISCAL INTEGRITY, TRANSPARENCY, COST EFFECTIVENESS AND RESPONSIVENESS.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 PER YEAR THAT WE RESPECTFULLY REQUEST WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED EACH OF THE THREE YEARS BY MATCHING FUNDS CONTRIBUTED TO JFCS BY THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF NORTHERN NJ.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
A MINIMUM OF 251 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE CUMBERLAND RSVP PROGRAM FROM 2021-THROUGH 2024. AT LEAST 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER'S WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON NUTRITION /FOOD, SUPPORT AND COMPANIONSHIP IN SENIOR CENTERS FOR AGING IN PLACE, PROVIDING SERVICE AND EDUCATION IN THE NUTRITION PROGRAM FOR OBESITY & FOOD AND DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION TO NON-PROFIT STATIONS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN STATIONS THAT ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN THE AREA OF HIGHEST NEED. 
THE SNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $38,164 BY THE CUMBERLAND COUNTY BOARD OF CHOSEN FREEHOLDERS.

THE BOARD OF CHOSEN FREEHOLDERS OF SOMERSET COUNTY NEW JERSEY IS APPLYING TO CONTINUE AS THE SPONSOR  FOR THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF SOMERSET COUNTY NEW JERSEY. THE BOARD OF CHOSEN FREEHOLDERS IS COMPRISED OF THE FIVE ELECTED OFFICIALS WHO OVERSEE THE MANAGEMENT OF THE COUNTY.  SOMERSET COUNTY GOVERNMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING ESSENTIAL AND NECESSARY SERVICES TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE COUNTY.  THE FREEHOLDERS LOOK TO THE COUNTY OFFICE OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES, WHICH WILL DIRECTLY OVERSEE THE RSVP PROGRAM, TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS TO HELP DELIVER THESE SERVICES.
AN ESTIMATED 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND OF THIS NUMBER 75 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THOSE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TAX COUNSELORS PREPARING THE TAX FORMS FOR LOW INCOME AND SENIORS RESIDENTS OF SOMERSET COUNTY. OTHERS WILL SERVE AS HANDYMAN VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL INSTALL SAFETY DEVICES SUCH AS GRAB BARS AND RAILINGS AND WILL ALSO BUILD WHEELCHAIR RAMPS FOR WHEELCHAIR BOUND DISABLE RESIDENTS OF THE COUNTY. WE WILL HAVE VOLUNTEERS WORKING AS TUTORS FOR STUDENTS IN ELEMENTARY GRADES. AND WE WILL ALSO HAVE VOLUNTEERS WORKING IN ELDER JUSTICE FOR FRAUD PREVENTION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. WE ANTICIPATE 
THAT AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, AT LEAST 2000 RESIDENTS WILL HAVE BEEN HELPED TO FILE THEIR TAX FORMS AND THE AMOUNT OF DOLLARS BROUGHT BACK INTO THE COMMUNITY BY THE REFUNDS FILED WILL BE IN EXCESS OF $1 MILLION DOLLARS. IN ADDITION, 12 RESIDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN HOMEBOUND WILL BE ABLE TO ACCESS 
SERVICES AND BECOME INDEPENDENT BECAUSE OF THE WHEELCHAIR RAMPS BUILT. WE ANTICIPATE THAT 120 RESIDENTS WILL HAVE SAFETY DEVICES INSTALLED IN THEIR HOMES. WE ALSO ANTICIPATE THAT 50 UNDER PERFORMING STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED GRADES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $30,003.00 IN COUNTY MATCH.          
WE HAVE CHOSEN TO CONCENTRATE OUR EFFORTS IN THIS FOCUS AREA BECAUSE WE HAVE SEEN A GREAT NEED FOR THIS TYPE OF PROGRAM THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY. IN ADDITION, OUR PROGRAM IS THE ONLY TYPE OF PROGRAM THAT OFFERS THIS SERVICE TO THE OVER 40,000 SENIOR AND LOW INCOME RESIDENTS.

AN ESTIMATED 133 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH LITERACY NJ AND SERVE ADULT LITERACY STUDENTS IN BURLINGTON COUNTY, NJ. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $9,482 IN NONFEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE MERCER COUNTY, NEW JERSEY AREA THROUGH INTERFAITH CAREGIVERS OF GREATER MERCER COUNTY'S RSVP PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT, TRANSPORTATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP TO AREA RESIDENTS WHO ARE AGE 65 AND OLDER AND/OR DISABLED.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES ? AGING IN PLACE, AND 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THESE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. IN ADDITION, 20 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED WITHIN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, INCLUDING WELLNESS AND SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THIS TARGET POPULATION.  
  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ICGMC ANTICIPATES THAT IT WILL SERVE AT LEAST 80 INDIVIDUALS EACH YEAR, WHO ARE AGED 60+  AND/OR WHO HAVE DISABILITIES , WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES THAT WILL HELP THEM TO AGE WITHIN THEIR HOME OR THE COMMUNITY.  FURTHER THEY WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  IN ADDITION, 20 SENIORS WILL BE SERVED THROUGH OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, FOR A TOTAL IMPACT ON 100 ELDERLY OR DISABLED RESIDENTS. 
  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,000 IN NON-FEDERAL SHARE MATCHING FUNDS, AND AN ADDITIONAL $37,410 IN ADDITIONAL OR EXCESS FUNDING, FOR A TOTAL ANNUAL BUDGET OF $147,410.
  ICGMC, IN OPERATION SINCE 1994, HAS A MISSION TO PROMOTE THE INDEPENDENCE, DIGNITY AND WELLNESS OF HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BY MATCHING THEM WITH CARING VOLUNTEERS WHO ASSIST WITH THE TASKS OF EVERYDAY LIFE. VOLUNTEERS ARE PROFESSIONALLY SCREENED AND TRAINED, AND ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED WITHOUT PROSELYTIZATION OR REGARD TO RELIGIOUS AFFILIATION. IN 2015 THE AGENCY ADDED THE RSVP PROGRAM, ALLOWING THE ORGANIZATION TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE RECRUITING AND SERVICE ACTIVITIES, AND IMPROVE VOLUNTEER RECOGNITION AND RETENTION.  AT THE END OF THE PAST 2019/2020 GRANT YEAR, THE AGENCY HAD A TOTAL OF 186 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO SERVED, AND DESPITE COVID-19 PANDEMIC LIMITS, AN AVERAGE OF 95-100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS REMAINED ACTIVE EACH MONTH OF THE CRISIS.  ALTHOUGH IT IS EXPECTED THAT MUCH OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC WILL BE RESOLVED BY THE BEGINNING OF THIS 2021 GRANT PERIOD, REBUILD AND EXPANSION ACTIVITIES WILL BLEND VIRTUAL AND IN-PERSON TOOLS TO ENSURE THAT OUR ELDERLY AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES BENEFIT FROM THE FULL RANGE OF THESE ESSENTIAL CAREGIVING AND WELLNESS SERVICES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
UPPER SHORE AGING, INC. (USA) SERVES AS THE DESIGNATED AREA AGENCY ON AGING FOR CAROLINE COUNTY, MARYLAND WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF SERVICES TO STRENGTHEN AND IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THE ELDERLY SO THEY CAN REMAIN, AND LIVE WELL, IN THE COMMUNITY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  AS PART OF ITS MISSION, USA PROVIDES CRITICALLY NEEDED SUPPORT AND SERVICES TO VULNERABLE SENIORS IN THE REGION, INCLUDING NUTRITIOUS FOOD, CONNECTION TO MEDICAL INFORMATION AND SERVICES, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR CIVIC AND SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT.  WITH LIMITED STAFF AND REDUCED FUNDING FROM THE STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTS, IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT USA EXPAND ITS VOLUNTEER-SUPPORTED PROGRAMS SO THAT IT CAN CONTINUE TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RAPIDLY GROWING ELDERLY POPULATION IN CAROLINE COUNTY.  
THE CAROLINE COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY FOR HOMEBOUND SENIORS, IMPROVE ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, INCREASE COMMUNITY HEALTH KNOWLEDGE AND PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION, SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT AND ADDITIONAL SUPPORT FOR VULNERABLE SENIORS.  SINCE MORE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE NEEDED TO KEEP PACE WITH THE GROWING SENIOR POPULATION IN CAROLINE COUNTY, THE CAROLINE RSVP PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON ATTRACTING A NEW CADRE OF SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL BE GIVEN BOTH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THOSE IN NEED AND THE CHANCE TO STRENGTHEN THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING.
THROUGH THE CAROLINE COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM, USA REQUESTS FUNDING TO MANAGE AND EXPAND ITS VOLUNTEER-SUPPORTED PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS FOOD SECURITY, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT SO THAT VULNERABLE SENIORS ARE ABLE TO AGE IN PLACE AND LIVE WELL INDEPENDENTLY.
FOR RSVP APPLICANTS IMPLEMENTING PROGRAMMING IN SPECIFIC GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREAS.

THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY, MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) GRANT OPPORTUNITY #MD-12. THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES IS TO ENSURE THE PROVISION OF COMPREHENSIVE AND RESPONSIVE COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT STRENGTHEN THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY COMMUNITY. THE LOCAL RSVP PROGRAM IS HOUSED IN THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES AGING AND DISABILITIES SERVICES DIVISION WHICH ALSO SERVES AS THE LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING.  
THROUGH THIS GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 450 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH APPROXIMATELY 20 HOST SITES.   OF THIS NUMBER, 280 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES COMPRISED OF NUTRITION AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES WILL INCLUDE MEAL AND GROCERY DELIVERY, AND COMPANIONSHIP. ADDITIONALLY, APPROXIMATELY 170 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  DUE TO VOLUNTEER ACTIVITY, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, SENIORS WILL RECEIVE HOME DELIVERED MEALS; CALLS WILL BE PLACED TO ISOLATED SENIORS RESIDING IN THEIR HOMES AND OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE GROCERY SHOPPING AND OTHER ERRAND PROVISIONING. IN ADDITION, ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO NON-PROFIT AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS.  THE TOTAL BUDGET FOR THIS PROJECT IS $130,774, THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $ 75,000 AND THE GRANTEE CONTRIBUTION IS $55,774.  THE SERVICE CATEGORIES SELECTED ARE A DIRECT RESULT OF IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS TO VOLUNTEER IN THEIR COMMUNITY THUS PROMOTING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.  IN ADDITION, WE ENDEAVOR TO ASSIST OLDER ADULTS WITH THEIR DESIRE TO AGE IN PLACE AND REMAIN SAFE AND WELL IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.

AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 75 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PREPARING AND DELIVERING MEALS TO FRAIL HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN OUR FOUR COUNTY AREA, AND CALLING HOMEBOUND SENIORS TO CHECK ON THEM DAILY. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THIS GRANT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES CONCENTRATING ON AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE.  WE WILL ALSO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY UNDER OBESITY AND FOOD, BY PLACING RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 850 UNDUPLICATED HOMEBOUND SENIORS PROVIDING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HELP THEM REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES LONGER AND HELP TO INCREASE THEIR FEELINGS OF SOCIAL SUPPORT. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE PIECE OF MIND TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS BY CALLING THEM DAILY TO CHECK ON THEM, INCREASING THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HELP TO SENIORS THROUGH THE SHIP PROGRAM, PROVIDE RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS, AND OTHER NON-PROFITS IN OUR AREA. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32314 IN MATCHING FUNDS FROM THE SPONSOR, LOCAL BUSINESSES AND LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS.

THE MISSION OF BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT IS TO ADVOCATE, LEAD, AND PROVIDE SERVICES OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY IN ORDER TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF BALTIMORE CITY RESIDENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A PRIORITY OF AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING. AN ESTIMATED 227 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COMMUNITIES OF BALTIMORE CITY. OF THIS NUMBER, 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE OUTREACH SERVICES, DISTRIBUTING FOOD, AND COMPANIONSHIP THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 600 OLDER ADULTS WILL HAVE REPORTED INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/SOCIAL SUPPORTS AND INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $103,237 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $81,643 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDS FROM BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT.

AN ESTIMATED 114 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 85 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING FREE INCOME TAX TUTORING FOR THOSE WITH LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME, WITH SPECIAL ATTENTION TO SENIORS AS WELL AS CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES FOR AREA NONPROFITS.
OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL INCLUDE THE BONE BUILDERS PROGRAM OFFERING FREE WEIGHT-BEARING AND BALANCE CLASSES TO MONTGOMERY COUNTY SENIORS RUN BY TRAINED RSVP VOLUNTEERS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE SECONDARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS CAPACITY BUILDING AND LEVERAGE.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 
AS A RESULT OF IRS-CERTIFIED RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING FREE INCOME TAX TUTORING THROUGH AARP TAX-AIDE, THE ESTIMATED DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS GENERATED WILL BE $2,219,186; AS A RESULT OF A NEW INITIATIVE FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AND LEVERAGE SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS, TEN NONPROFITS WILL BE SERVED AND EIGHT WILL INCREASE THEIR EFFECTIVENESS, EFFICIENCY OR PROGRAM SCALE/REACH.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,166 IN ANTICIPATED NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 1,001 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY OF BALTIMORE COUNTY, MARYLAND. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND FOOD TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS, AS WELL AS PROVIDING NUTRITIOUS MEALS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT FOR OLDER ADULTS LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 1,300 OLDER ADULTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO MAINTAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,454 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
IN FREDERICK COUNTY, MARYLAND, WE HAVE WITNESSED SIGNIFICANT DEMOGRAPHIC CHANGES OVER THE LAST THREE DECADES WITH GROWTH IN OUR PART RURAL AND PART SUBURBAN HOUSING, MOVING FROM A STRONG AGRICULTURAL ECONOMY TO A SERVICE AND RESEARCH-BASED ECONOMY, AND THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE IN MINORITY POPULATION.  WITHIN THESE CHANGES, SOME COMMUNITIES HAVE BEEN LEFT BEHIND, OFTEN HIDDEN IN BOTH RURAL AND URBAN AREAS.  ALL OF THESE POSTS MORE CHALLENGES BUT ALSO MORE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO FILL SOME OF THE SERVICE GAPS.   VOLUNTEERS PLAY A CRITICAL ROLE IN THE PROCESS, HELPING TO MEET BASIC NEEDS IN ALLEVIATING POVERTY AND ACCESSING HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICE FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS, SENIORS, IMMIGRANTS AND THOSE WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY. 
 
FOR FREDERICK RSVP PROJECT, WE WILL ADDRESS THREE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS WITH A TOTAL OF 7 OBJECTIVES: HEALTHY FUTURES (ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, FOOD & OBESITY), ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (EMPLOYMENT AND FINANCIAL LITERACY), AND EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS).  IN ADDITION, CAPACITY BUILDING AND "OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS" WILL ALSO BE ADDRESSED.  THERE WILL BE A TOTAL OF 17 VARIOUS SERVICE ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES SET FORTH FOR THESE PRIMARY FOCUSES. PERFORMANCE MEASURES ARE WELL DEVELOPED WITH DEVELOPED TRACKING SYSTEM TO EVALUATE EACH OUTPUT AND OUTCOME AS PRESENTED IN THE PROPOSAL.  WITH THE PROJECT, WE ARE PROPOSING 20 STATIONS WITH A COMMITMENT OF 236 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN OUR OVERALL PROJECT FOR APPROXIMATELY 6,000 BENEFICIARIES.  

THE ASIAN AMERICAN CENTER OF FREDERICK (AACF) IS A 'GO TO' COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCY WITH A VISION OF EQUITY USING THREE PILLARS OF PROGRAMMING: ENHANCE, EMPOWER, ENRICH. THE AACF MISSION IS TO EQUIP COMMUNITY WITH ESSENTIAL SKILLS TO BE INDEPENDENT AND SELF-SUFFICIENT, MAKING CONTRIBUTION TO COMMUNITY AND SOCIETY AT LARGE.  AACF RSVP PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CNCS'S VISION.  THE GOAL OF AACF RSVP IS TO OFFERS A DIVERSE RANGE OF VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT SERVE THE FREDERICK COMMUNITIES TO CREATE MEASURABLE IMPACT, BENEFIT VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THE SERVICE EXPERIENCE, AND CREATE COMMUNITY CAPACITY.  WITH 15 YEARS' EXPERIENCE TO PROMOTE HEALTH EQUITIES, HAS DEMONSTRATED AN ORGANIZATIONAL TRACK RECORD IN MANAGING VOLUNTEERS.  AACF'S SIGNATURE PROGRAMMING INVOLVES IN HEALTH CARE ACCESS, HEALTH EDUCATION, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, LANGUAGE SERVICES AND CITIZENSHIP INTEGRATED SERVICES.  WE ARE VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE ABOUT HEALTH DISPARITY ISSUES ACROSS ALL VULNERABLE POPULATION GROUPS INCLUDING AT-RISK CHILDREN/YOUTHS, FRAIL ELDERLY, AND LOW-INCOME, UNINSURED AND UNDER-INSURED PERSONS.  AS WE EXAMINE THE CURRENT SENIOR CITIZENS NEEDS ASSESSMENT, WE RECOGNIZED ITS LIMITATION TO TRULY REFLECT THE HEALTH NEEDS OF OUR SENIORS.  AS THE LEADING COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION WITH A HEALTH EQUITY FOCUS, AACF IS IN THE BEST POSITION IN FREDERICK COUNTY TO IMPROVE THE ESTABLISHED RSVP PROGRAM.  AACF'S DEDICATION TO COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT CAN BE SEEN THROUGH OUR EFFORTS TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO CHANGE THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS IN WAYS THAT INCREASE THE QUALITY OF LIFE. VOLUNTEERISM PRESENTS OPPORTUNITIES TO DO JUST THAT, AND AACF ENCOURAGES, TRAINS AND CHALLENGES VOLUNTEERS TO BUILD THEIR SKILLS AND ENGAGE THEIR COMMUNITIES.  

AACF HAS BEEN A SPONSOR FOR THE PAST 6 YEARS ALIGNING CNCS GOALS AND MEETING ALL OF OUR PERFORMANCE MEASURES. AACF HAS DEVELOPED STRONG EXPERIENCE IN THE ADMINISTRATION, DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION, MANAGEMENT AND EVALUATION OF SUCH GRANT-FUNDED PROGRAMMING.   THIS NEW RSVP PROJECT WILL BE AN INTEGRATED APPROACH USING AACF AND RSVP SUPPORT TO INCREASE THE IMPACT OF VOLUNTEERING AS A RESPONSE TO LOCAL COMMUNITY NEEDS.  THIS WILL BE CRUCIAL FOR IMPROVING COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR OLDER ADULTS TO AGE HEALTHILY IN PLACE ON THEIR OWN; INCREASING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE SERVICES, ESPECIALLY FOR THE UNDERSERVED LOW-INCOME AND ETHNIC MINORITY POPULATIONS; INCREASING FOOD SECURITY FOR THOSE UN

AN ESTIMATED 800  UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ANGELINA, HOUSTON, JASPER, NACOGDOCHES, NEWTON, POLK, SABINE, SAN AUGUSTINE, SAN JACINTO, SHELBY, TRINITY, AND TYLER COUNTIES, THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH ONE-HUNDRED (100) RSVP VOLUNTEER STATIONS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DISTRIBUTING NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO FEED THE FOOD INSECURE OF VARIOUS AGES THROUGH FOOD PANTRIES, AND SOUP KITCHENS; PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS THROUGH ADULT DAY CENTERS AND HOSPICES; OFFERING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES (VIA WEEKLY PHONE CALLS) TO HOME DELIVERED MEAL RECIPIENTS, FRAIL ELDERLY, AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE RSVP RING TEAM; PROVIDING TUTORING/MENTORING TO K-12 STUDENTS THROUGH PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS; ASSISTING VETERANS WITH CLINIC SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, AND MAKING COMFORT PILLOWS FOR REHABILITATION; GARNERING DONATIONS FOR MORE THAN TWELVE (12) NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN DEEP EAST TEXAS, WHILE ALSO RAISING FUNDS FOR MULTIPLE COLLEGE/UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND ENDOWMENTS; IN ADDITION TO OTHER PRIORITY SERVICES. THERE ARE FOUR (4) WORK PLANS (42.5% OF VOLUNTEERS) CONNECTED TO THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT; HEALTHY FUTURES. FIVE (5) WORK PLANS (37.5% OF VOLUNTEERS) ARE IN THE CATEGORY OF OTHER FOCUS AREAS AND CAPACITY BUILDING, AND ONE (1) WORK PLAN (20% OF VOLUNTEERS) SPEAKS TO COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 8% OF THE VOLUNTEERS (68) ARE VETERANS, AND THIS PROJECT AIMS TO SERVE MORE THAN 5,000 VETERANS/FAMILIES. AT THE END OF THIS GRANT PERIOD: AT LEAST 5,000 OF THOSE SURVEYED WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; A MINIMUM OF 75 CAREGIVERS OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS/INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES, AND 100 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES (VIA PHONE CONTACT); AT LEAST 100 STUDENTS (K-12) WILL BE TUTORED AND/OR MENTORED; 4,500 VETERANS WILL RECEIVE NECESSARY MEDICAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, AND/OR SUPPLIES; AND MORE THAN $200,000 WILL BE RAISED TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF TWELVE (12) AREA NON-PROFITS. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $85,132 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $86,291 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

APPROXIMATELY 1000 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE A VARIETY OF SERVICES TO COMMUNITIES IN A FOUR-COUNTY AREA. OF THIS NUMBER, 150 RSVP VOLUNTEER READING TUTORS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.

THE VOLUNTEER TUTORS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING IN READING TO AT LEAST 300 PUBLIC SCHOOL CHILDREN IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH THIRD GRADE.  TUTOR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  1) READ MATERIALS TO STUDENTS THAT ARE SLIGHTLY ABOVE THEIR READING LEVEL, 2) PRACTICE THE ALPHABET AND LETTER SOUNDS, 3) PRACTICE RECOGNITION OF "SIGHT WORDS" (IDENTIFIED BY THE TEACHER), 4) HAVE THE STUDENTS READ GRADE-LEVEL MATERIALS TO THE TUTOR, 5) HAVE THE STUDENTS PRACTICE WRITING ASSIGNED VOCABULARY WORDS AND "SIGHT WORDS."

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROJECT OUTPUT (ED1A) GOALS ARE TO:  1) PROVIDE TUTORING TO A MINIMUM OF 300 CHILDREN PER YEAR, 2) PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF 2000 TOTAL HOURS OF TUTORING PER YEAR, AND 3) PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF 10 HOURS OF TUTORING TO AT LEAST 100 CHILDREN PER YEAR.  

SPECIFIC OUTCOME MEASURES (ED5A) ARE:  1) 75% OF STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE TUTORING WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN READING ABILITY AND COMPREHENSION AS MEASURED BY STANDARDIZED  PRE-AND POST-TESTING ADMINISTERED BY THE SCHOOL (225 PER YEAR) AND 2)  70% OF THE STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE AT LEAST 10 HOURS OF TUTORING WILL READ AT OR ABOVE GRADE LEVEL AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR (70 PER YEAR). 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $92,818 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $59,000, PROVIDED BY THE STATE CNCS GRANT, PLUS LOCAL UNITED WAY AGENCIES, SEVERAL LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND FUND-RAISING ACTIVITIES.

THE STATE OF TEXAS, COUNTY OF HIDALGO-RIO GRANDE VALLEY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP PROJECT) IS FUNDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND SPONSORED BY THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY LOCATED IN EDINBURG, TEXAS. THE CURRENT RGV-RSVP VOLUNTEERS HAVE MADE AN IMPACT IN THE LIVES OF FAMILIES, CHILDREN, ELDERLY AND VETERANS FOR THE PAST 36 YEARS. THE CHCSA'S MISSION IS, "TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY OF THE LOW INCOME AND VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS BY PROVIDING EFFECTIVE, EFFICIENT, AND COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS." HIDALGO COUNTY RECORDS INDICATE THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA POPULATION IS 1,422,228 OF WHICH 410,103 INDIVIDUALS, 30,000 FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS OVER THE AGE OF 65 LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL. THE RGV-RSVP PROJECT AIMS TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS AND PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT IMPACT IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM. AN ESTIMATED 485 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AGED FIFTY-FIVE AND OLDER WILL BE PLACED IN VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS BASED ON THEIR PERSONAL EXPERTISE AND INTERESTS THROUGHOUT CAMERON, HIDALGO AND WILLACY COUNTIES. APPROXIMATELY THREE HUNDRED THIRTY-SEVEN UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS HELPING THE ELDERLY AND VETERANS IN SENIOR CENTERS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND VETERAN?S CLINICS. THE LOW-INCOME FAMILIES WILL BE ASSISTED WITH FOOD SECURITIES IN THE FOOD PANTRIES ON A WEEKLY BASIS. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH PROVIDING FOOD SECURITIES TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES AND WILL SERVE CONGREGATE-HOME DELIVERED MEALS TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY AND VETERANS IN COMMUNITY CENTERS AND IN THEIR HOMES. THE RGV-RSVP PROJECT WILL COORDINATE AND COLLABORATE WITH APPROXIMATELY THIRTY-EIGHT VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREAS TO GIVE VOLUNTEERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO HELP. THEY WILL BE AFFORDED A WIDE VARIETY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WHICH, IN TURN, WILL HELP THE RESIDENTS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE RGV-RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WHICH WILL HAVE THE GREATEST IMPACT AND INCREASED OUTCOMES IN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA. RSVP VOLUNTEERS FROM TWELVE FOOD PANTRIES UNLOAD, SORT, STACK, PREPARE AND ORGANIZE FOOD FOR DISTRIBUTION. A TOTAL OF 48 LOW-SOCIO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGE YOUTH WILL BE TUTORED BY VOLUNTEERS ON A ONE-TO-ONE-BASIS INDIVIDUALIZED INSTRUCTION IN CLASSROOM WITHIN LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST APPROXIMATELY VETERANS IN 14 VOLUNTEER STATIONS BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO CARE, PROVIDING INFORMATION ON HEALTHY HABITS, INFORMATION ON AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND ASSIST THEM AT THE VETERAN?S CLINICS. VOLUNTEERS WILL GUIDE TOURS, TELL SHORT STORIES ON THE HISTORY OF THE VALLEY TO RESIDENTS IN LOCAL MUSEUMS ACROSS THE COUNTIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 485 UN-DUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR HEALTH AND LIFE STYLES BY VOLUNTEERING AND WILL MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE LIVES OF THE ELDERLY, HOMEBOUND, DISABLED, VETERANS, LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND CHILDREN. THE RGV-RSVP PROJECT WILL CONNECT 485 VOLUNTEERS IN 38 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THAT WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY OF THE LOW INCOME AND VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS IN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA. THE CNCS FEDERAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF $84,251 WILL BE MATCHED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL IN THE AMOUNT OF $117,191 FOR A COMBINED TOTAL OF $201,442 FOR THE RGV-RSVP PROJECT.

CORNERSTONE COMMUNITY ACTION (CCAA) IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY ESTABLISHED IN 1965 AS A 501(C)3 NON-PROFIT CORPORATION. CCAA'S MISSION STATEMENT IS AS FOLLOWS: A COMMUNITY IN ACTION, EMPOWERING PEOPLE, CHANGING LIVES, AND OFFERING HOPE TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY. CCAA'S VISION STATEMENT IS AS FOLLOWS: TO BUILD THRIVING AND SELF-SUFFICIENT COMMUNITIES BY CREATING EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. 
CCAA HAS STRONG, EFFECTIVE SYSTEMS TO SUPPORT CONTINUOUS QUALITY CLIENT AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FOCUSED ON PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO THE RESIDENTS. CCAA USES FUNDS FROM THE HEADSTART GRANT, VETERANS GENERAL ASSISTANCE GRANT, HOUSING 4 TEXAS HEROES GRANT, COMPREHENSIVE ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (CEAP), UTILITY CORPORATION GRANTS, COMMUNITY SERVICES BLOCK GRANT (CSBG), THE HOME PROGRAMS AND VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) GRANT TO ASSIST THE POPULATION WITHIN OUR SEVEN COUNTY SERVICE AREA. CCAA HAS A LONG HISTORY OF WORKING WITH VOLUNTEERS TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT IN OUR COMMUNITIES. IN 2018, 50 VOLUNTEERS WORKED IN OUR PROGRAMS.

THE HEART OF TEXAS (H.O.T.) RSVP HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY MCLENNAN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (MCC) IN WACO, TEXAS FOR APPROXIMATELY 28 YEARS. THEY SERVE THE SIX TEXAS COUNTIES OF MCLENNAN, FALLS, BOSQUE, HILL, FREESTONE AND LIMESTONE (TX-11). THE COLLEGE ENGAGES AND STRENGTHENS ITS COMMUNITY THROUGH STRONG LEADERSHIP, SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS, BEST PRACTICES, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND INTEGRITY.  CORE VALUES ARE CONSISTENT WITH EXCELLENCE, INTEGRITY, INNOVATION, INCLUSION, ACCOUNTABILITY AND COLLABORATION. 
    MCC IS REQUESTING $79,365 AS A FINANCIAL INVESTMENT OF CNCS TO SUPPORT 365 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN THE H.O.T. REGION PERFORMING IN THE "FOCUS AREAS" OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VETERANS, OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND IF FUNDING IS AVAILABLE, DISASTER SERVICES.  THESE OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE TASKS WITH MEALS ON WHEELS AND FOUR FOOD PANTRIES THAT ADDRESS HUNGER AND NUTRITION. IF ADDITIONAL FUNDING IS SECURED, 40 VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS DISASTER SERVICES. THE H.O.T. RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF $167,590 ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL GRANTEE RESOURCES AND AN ADDITIONAL $80,421 ANTICIPATED EXCESS MAKING THE CNCS SHARE 24% OF OUR TOTAL BUDGET.
   THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAU STATES THAT IN TEXAS, 17.6 PERCENT OF THE POPULATION IS MADE UP OF SENIOR ADULTS AGE 55 AND ABOVE, YET IN THE CENTRAL TEXAS REGION OF H.O.T. RSVP, THIS NUMBER JUMPS TO 23.9 PERCENT IN OUR RURAL COUNTIES AND IS  EXPECTED TO RISE RAPIDLY.  TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR AGING CITIZENS, THIS PROJECT PLANS TO ADDRESS PRIMARY AREAS OF (H8) "AGING IN PLACE," ADDRESSING DELIVERY OF MEALS BY 136 VOLUNTEERS TO HOME BOUND FRAIL AND ELDERLY AND (10H) OBESITY AND FOOD, ADDRESSED THROUGH VOLUNTEER SUPPORT IN REGIONAL FOOD PANTRIES.  CURRENTLY, THIS SERVICE AREA IS ADDRESSED THROUGH THE CENTRAL TEXAS SENIOR MINISTRIES (CTSM) ORGANIZATION THAT DEPENDS ON VOLUNTEERS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OVER 5000 ISOLATED SENIOR ADULTS. THERE IS A WAITING LIST OF ALMOST 200 AT ANY GIVEN TIME. CTSM OFFICIALS STATE THAT VOLUNTEERS ARE THE CRITICAL COMPONENT TO SERVING THEIR CLIENTS AND WITHOUT NUTRITION, MOST WOULD NEED INSTITUTIONAL CARE WITHIN A FEW SHORT MONTHS. IN 2018, VOLUNTEERS DELIVERED  OVER 7,500 MEALS IN THIS REGION.  84 VOLUNTEERS SUPPORTED FOOD PANTRIES BY STOCKING AND DISTRIBUTING NUTRITIONAL PRODUCTS TO DISADVANTAGED CLIENTS. 8 TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO BE ASSIGNED TO PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS VETERAN NEEDS (V1), SPECIFICALLY PTSD AND SUICIDE PREVENTION. 
       IN THE AREA OF (SC1) "COMMUNITY PRIORITIES," RSVP WILL MANAGE VOLUNTEERS IN SUCH PROGRAMS AS HOSPICE, EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY AND OMBUDSMAN SERVICES.   MCC HAS A LONG HISTORY OF STRONG MANAGEMENT, FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY, MEASURABLE IMPACT AND VISIONARY THINKING.  MCC WAS RECENTLY AWARDED TWO CNCS AUGMENTATION GRANTS AND ONE REBUILD TEXAS/ONESTAR GRANT TO ADDRESS DISASTER SERVICES AND DEVELOPED A MOBILE VOLUNTEER CORPS WITH OVER 600 ENROLLED VOLUNTEERS THAT CAN TRAVEL TO SPECIFICALLY UNDER-SERVED AREAS OF NEED AND ASSIST COMMUNITIES DURING RECOVERY FOLLOWING A DISASTER.

HCRSVP WILL MAINTAIN AT LEAST 500 VOLUNTEERS AS WE TRANSITION INTO THE CNCS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES.  HCRSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH SERVICES CONSISTING OF: HOME DELIVERED MEALS/TRANSPORTATION/COMPANIONSHIP TO KEEP THE FRAIL ELDERLY LIVING INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE; FOOD BANKS/PANTRIES TO ADDRESS FOOD SECURITY ISSUES FOR ALL RESIDENTS; AND CAPACITY BUILDING-VOLUNTEER MANAGERS/RECRUITERS PLACED IN NON-PROFITS ENABLING THE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE DIRECT AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES OR BUILD CAPACITY TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS.

AN ESTIMATED 400 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS PART OF THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES RSVP PROGRAM. ALL 400 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: FOOD DISTRIBUTION; COMPANIONSHIP; TUTORING AT-RISK CHILDREN; PROVIDING HUMANITARIAN RELIEF; TAX INCOME PREP FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES; AND PROVIDING COMMODITIES FOR LOW INCOME SENIORS IN THE COMMUNITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, OUR GOAL IS TO: A) REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY; B) REDUCE ISOLATION; C) IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AMONG LOW-INCOME AT-RISK CHILDREN; D) INCREASE REVENUE OF TAX RETURNS; AND E) SERVING SENIORS AND THE GENERAL POPULATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $121,552 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $55,252 FROM STATE FUNDING.

RSVP OF DALLAS AND COLLIN COUNTIES HAS BEEN SPONSORED LOCALLY FOR OVER 40 YEARS BY THE SENIOR SOURCE, SENIOR CITIZENS OF GREATER DALLAS, INC., A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION PROVIDING SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE GREATER DALLAS AREA SINCE 1961. THE AGENCY HOUSES EIGHT PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON MEETING THE NEEDS OF SENIOR ADULTS. THE MISSION OF THE SENIOR SOURCE IS TO ENHANCE THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE AND EMPOWER ALL OLDER ADULTS IN GREATER DALLAS TO THRIVE. AN ESTIMATED 975 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THIS PROJECT. 580 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES.  250 VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS SPECIFIC CNCS PRIORITIES INCLUDING ELDER JUSTICE, INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING.  IN ADDITION, RSVP OF DALLAS AND COLLIN COUNTIES, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT ARLINGTON, WILL IMPLEMENT A PILOT PROJECT BASED ON A TELEPHONE REASSURANCE EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAM.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THROUGHOUT THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE MENTORING AT-RISK ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; PROVIDING MEDICARE FRAUD PREVENTION PROGRAMS TO THE COMMUNITY; MAKING HOMES SAFER AND MORE ACCESSIBLE FOR OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT; MAINTAINING AND SUSTAINING THE OPERATION OF NUTRITION AND FOOD-SECURITY PROGRAMS THROUGH VERIFYING CLIENT CRITERIA FOR PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AND ASSISTING WITH SERVICE DELIVERY; AND ASSISTING NON-PROFIT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO BETTER SERVE THEIR CLIENTS AND THE COMMUNITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: 350 OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES RESULTING FROM RSVP MEDICARE FRAUD PREVENTION PRESENTATIONS AND HOME SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS; 700 INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT DALLAS AND COLLIN COUNTIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND/OR THEIR CHILDREN (HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY) AS A RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS' SUPPORTED SERVICES; 70 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO WERE MENTORED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; AND 18 OUT OF 24 (75%) OF NON-PROFIT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS WILL INDICATE INCREASED CAPACITY BUILDING AS A RESULT OF RSVP SERVICES PROVIDED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $193,173 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $83,894 GRANTEE MATCH AND $1,987 EXCESS FUNDS.

FOR OVER 25 YEARS MIDLAND RSVP HAS BEEN LOCALLY SPONSORED BY SENIOR LIFE MIDLAND (SLM). SLM FORMERLY COMMUNITY & SENIOR SERVICES IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT AGENCY USING A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEET THE RECOGNIZED NEEDS OF OUR OLDER POPULATION IN MIDLAND COUNTY. WITH A 38 YEAR HISTORY, SLM HAS A PROVEN TRACK RECORD OF EXCELLENCE AMONG THE LOCAL NON-PROFIT SECTOR AND CONTINUES TO STRIVE TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPABILITY OF IT'S LARGEST SENIOR CORPS PROGRAM, MIDLAND RSVP. THE MISSION OF SLM IS TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES RELATED TO AGING AND DEVELOP EFFICIENT, FLEXIBLE AND COMPASSIONATE WAYS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY.

THROUGH RSVP, SLM EMPOWERS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO STEP FORWARD AND HELP ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF 41 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THAT WE CURRENTLY PARTNER WITH, AS WELL AS OTHER CRITICAL LOCAL NEEDS THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM THE SENIOR INVOLVEMENT. ANNUALLY, AN ESTIMATED 531 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH MIDLAND RSVP WITH 286 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AND OTHER PRIORITY AREAS. THEY WILL SERVE THE FRAIL, ELDERLY, HOME BOUND AND DISABLED SENIORS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE MEALS-ON-WHEELS DELIVERY, KITCHEN SERVICES AND HOME BOUND SERVICES THAT INCLUDE THE ANNUAL FUNDRAISER, THE TEXAS-SIZE GARAGE SALE, AND GENERAL SERVICES LIKE THE HANDYMAN PROGRAM, WHILE OTHERS WILL ASSIST IN THE BUILDING OF SAFE AFFORDABLE HOMES FOR NEEDY FAMILIES.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA BEING ADDRESSED IS HEALTHY FUTURES (H4A & H12 AGING IN PLACE AND SERVICE ACTIVITY MEASURED IS NUTRITION / FOOD SUPPORT. WE WILL MEASURE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED AND THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE SERVICE ACTIVITY WILL INVOLVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS HELPING TO PACKAGE DAILY MEALS, DELIVER MEALS, MAKE VISITS, AND CONDUCT CHECK-IN CALLS THAT IMPROVE ELDERLY SOCIAL TIES.

ANNUALLY 277 VOLUNTEERS, SERVE THROUGH MEALS-ON-WHEELS DELIVERY, KITCHEN SERVICES, AND THROUGH 6 FOOD BANKS AND PANTRIES, WHILE 80 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP ON THE HOME BOUND SERVICES FUNDRAISER, THE TEXAS-SIZE GARAGE SALE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $51,051 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $63,889 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES PLUS ($18,874) STATE GRANT FUNDS AND THE GOLF TOURNAMENT FUNDRAISER WHICH RAISED $39,593.12 IN 2019.   PROCEEDS WILL BE DIVIDED BETWEEN 4 PROGRAMS, RSVP, FGP, SCP AND MEALS-ON-WHEELS.  RSVP WILL RECEIVE $9,898 AS THEIR SHARE.

IN CLOSING, IN 2019 SLM ED, DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR, RSVP DIRECTOR, FGP/SCP DIRECTOR AND 2 SLM BOARD/RSVP VOLUNTEERS TRAVELED TO AUSTIN FOR SENIOR DAY AT THE CAPITAL. SLM BELIEVES IN ADVOCATING FOR OUR LOCAL SENIORS AND VOLUNTEERS.

BY THE END OF THE 36 MONTH GRANT PERIOD, APPROXIMATELY 725 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST INDIVIDUALS THROUGH NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT; COMPANIONSHIP FOR VETERANS; INCOME TAX PREPARATION AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES IN MORE THAN 60 AGENCIES LOCATED IN TWELVE COUNTIES OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 315 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED SERVICE ACTIVITIES.  
THE FOCUS AREAS FOR TEXAS PANHANDLE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (TPRSVP) IS HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. TPRSVP'S OBJECTIVES UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES ARE AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD. AT THE END OF EACH GRANT YEAR, AN ESTIMATED 140 UNDUPLICATED HOME BOUND ADULTS, VETERANS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT THROUGH HOME DELIVERED MEALS FROM VOLUNTEERS AND 120 WILL REPORT THEY HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT THROUGH FOOD PANTRY'S AND ANTICIPATE SERVING 1,000 INDIVIDUALS AND 500 WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY. TPRSVP'S OBJECTIVE UNDER ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY IS FINANCIAL LITERACY WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP APPROXIMATELY 450 CLIENTS WITH THEIR TAX RETURNS WITH A SAVINGS OF $74,000 IN TAX PREPARATION FEES FOR LOW INCOME AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. TPRSVP'S OBJECTIVE UNDER VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES IS VETERANS AND FAMILIES SERVED WHERE OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 100 VETERANS THROUGH NUMEROUS ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS THE VA, VFW, TEXAS PANHANDLE MEMORIAL CENTER AND 50 VETERANS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.  ADDITIONALLY, TPRSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE UNDER OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $149,119 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $1,500 (EXCESS COLUMN LINE ITEM) THAT WILL ALLOW FOR THE DIRECTOR TO WRITE GRANTS SUCH AS THIS ONE AND $84,448 WHICH INCLUDES NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND IN-KIND.

GOLDEN TRIANGLE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS BEEN PROVIDING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY, TEXAS FOR 47 YEARS. IN 2019, WE HAVE 419 VOLUNTEERS WITHIN RSVP THAT VOLUNTEERED AN AVERAGE OF 500 TO 1000 HOURS PER YEAR. RSVP SUPPORTS THE EFFORTS OF 50 DIVERSE NON-PROFIT AGENCIES IN THE THREE COUNTY AREA. RSVP IS THE ONLY AGENCY IN ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY TEXAS THAT PROVIDES VOLUNTEERS TO A DIVERSE, NON-PROFIT POPULATION. THE TOTAL COST OF THE GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP PROJECT WILL BE $360,269.00. WE ARE REQUESTING $219,648.00 FROM CNCS TO CONTINUE THE WORK OF GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP. GRANT FUNDS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF AN ESTIMATED 50 VOLUNTEERS PER YEAR IN ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY TEXAS. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO PAY SALARY, AND FRINGE BENEFITS TO HELP WITH THE OVERHEAD OF THE OVERALL PROGRAM OF RSVP. 
AN ESTIMATED 419 COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WILL VOLUNTEER WITH PUBLIC AGENCY, SECULAR OR FAITH BASED PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, OR PROPRIETARY HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATIONS. OF THIS NUMBER 321 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ONE OF A SET OF SIX CORE PRIORITY ISSUE AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE SERVE AMERICA ACT WHERE CNCS FOCUSES NATIONAL SERVICE AND MEASURES ITS IMPACT. 
THESE AGENCIES INCLUDE SOUP KITCHENS THAT FEED THE HOMELESS DAILY, A HOSPITALITY CENTER THAT CLOTHES THE LESS-FORTUNATE, MAINTAINING COMMUNITY GARDENS, AND THE PUBLIC LIBRARY THAT OFFERS TUTORING SERVICES FOR GENERAL EDUCATION DEGREE (GED) AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL).
UNITED CHRISTIAN CARE CENTER(UCCC) UTILIZES 36 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AS THE ONLY PEOPLE WHO OPERATE THE ENTIRE FACILITY.  GLENN BRADLEY FROM UCCC SAYS "WITHOUT RSVP, WE COULD NOT FUNCTION".  THE REASON GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP IS NEEDED IS BECAUSE OF THE GROWING VOLUNTEER NEEDS OF NON-PROFIT AGENCIES ARE NOT BEING MET. VOLUNTEERS ARE SERVING FOR NO COST AND SOMETIMES GIVE BETTER SERVICES TO CLIENTS, BECAUSE THEY ARE SERVING FOR THEIR PASSION FOR THE ORGANIZATION.

AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING THIS 3-YEAR GRANT CYCLE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 61 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.   VOLUNTEER OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE:  TRANSPORTING THOSE WHO ARE 55 AND OLDER TO INCREASE ACCESS FOR MEDICAL CARE, COUNSELING TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT MEDICARE AND PART D ENROLLMENT, PREPARING AND DELIVERING NOURISHING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS AND THE DISABLED, BUILDING RAMPS FOR BETTER ACCESSIBILITY TO AND FROM THE HOME, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS TO HELP CHILDREN IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, ASSIST WITH TAX RETURNS AND RESIDENTS OF KAY COUNTY WILL RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS WITH REGARDS TO ELDER JUSTICE, FRAUDS AND SCAMS, AND OPIOIDS AND DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS:  HEALTHY FUTURES.
ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES UTILIZING 61 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:  AT LEAST 900 PEOPLE WILL HAVE HAD ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR TAX RETURNS, OVER 2,000 RESIDENTS WILL BE MORE AWARE OF THE DANGERS WITH THE MISUSE OF DRUGS AND OPIOIDS, 60 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCES, 150 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE BEEN ABLE TO ACCESS TRANSPORTATION FOR THEIR MEDICAL NEEDS, 75 PEOPLE WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO AND FROM THEIR HOMES AND CAN NOW BETTER AGE IN PLACE, 75 PEOPLE WILL RECEIVE MEALS, AND 900 SENIORS WILL HAVE HELP IN NAVIGATING MEDICARE AND MEDICARE PART D. ALL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WILL HAVE DATA SYSTEMS TO TABULATE PROGRESS TOWARD DEFINED OUTCOME GOALS. 
A NEW STAFF PERSON WILL SERVE AS A SENIOR NAVIGATOR TO PROVIDE INFORMATION AND REFERRAL/ASSISTANCE SERVICES TO OLDER PERSONS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. THIS POSITION WILL FURTHER ALLOW RSVP VOLUNTEERS, AND SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO HAVE MORE EFFECTIVE AND CURRENT INFORMATION WHEN SERVING IN THE KAY COUNTY AREA. 
DURING THE NEXT THREE YEARS FURTHER WORK WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE COLLABORATION OF THE KAW NATION AND THE NATIONAL CLEARINGHOUSE ON ABUSE IN LATER LIFE (NCALL).  STRATEGIC PLANNING WILL BEGIN DEVELOPMENT LATE 2019 AND EARLY 2020.  EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS WILL BEGIN LATE 2020.  TARGETED AUDIENCES FOR COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS WILL INCLUDE:  LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT, ADULT PROTECTIVE SERVICES (APS) AND OTHER ELDER ABUSE WORKERS. 
THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE ASSOCIATION MONTHLY CAREGIVER SUPPORT GROUPS AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION WILL BE PROVIDED. AND YEARLY DRUG TAKEBACK DAYS WILL BE DESIGNATED THROUGHOUT KAY COUNTY.

AN ESTIMATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 145 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. EXAMPLES OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR LOW-INCOME ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE NO LONGER ABLE TO DRIVE, AND PROVIDING FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT TO LOW INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED FOOD RESOURCES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE ACHIEVED: 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTRIBUTE 100,000 SERVICE HOURS IN CNCS FOCUS/OTHER COMMUNITY AREAS. 65 OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE, DOOR-THROUGH-DOOR MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION TO 400 LOW-INCOME ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE NO LONGER ABLE TO DRIVE, AND 80 VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE HEALTHY AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO 5,000 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THROUGH FOOD PANTRIES AND HOME DELIVERED MEALS IN OKLAHOMA COUNTY, OKLAHOMA.
BASED ON THE 2019 INDEPENDENT SECTOR'S VOLUNTEER SERVICE WAGE VALUE FOR THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AT $22.95 PER HOUR, ANNUALLY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL GENERATE $2.3 MILLION DOLLARS OF SERVICE WHILE MEETING THE MOST CRITICAL NEEDS IN OUR SERVICE AREA. 
THE THREE-YEAR CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $900,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


BRYAN COUNTY RSVP, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT, 501C3 SELF-SPONSORED PROGRAM WITH A GOVERNING BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ADVISORY BOARD.  OUR MISSION IS TO LINK PERSON 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS AS WELL AS THE VOLUNTEER.  THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, AN ESTIMATED 200 RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES.  THEY WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO VETERANS IN THE FORM OF TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL CENTER APPOINTMENTS AND HELP COMPLETING THE NECESSARY FORMS.  THEY WILL ASSIST IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND CAPACITY BUILDING BY RECRUITING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS.  THEY WILL DELIVER MEALS ON WHEELS TO THE HOMEBOUND, HELP WITH BLOOD DRIVES, PREPARE INCOME TAXES, AND HELP WITH COATS FOR KIDS, AND NATIONAL DAY OF SERVICE AND REMEMBRANCE.  ALL THIS WILL BE CARRIES OUT THROUGH A NETWORK OF 35 VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  STATIONS INCLUDE:  EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT, DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS, VETERANS OF FOREIGN WARS, ALLIANCE HEALTH HOSPITAL, SENIOR CITIZEN CENTERS MEALS ON WHEELS DELIVERY, VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) SITE, CAPACITY BUILDING SITES AND OTHER COMMUNITY SITES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROGRAM IS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  AT THE END OF THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 1,200 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES, IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES AND COMMUNITIES.
BRYAN COUNTY RSVP IS REQUESTING $47,500.00 IN BUDGET SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR THESE ACTIVITIES.   BRYAN COUNTY RSVP WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FEDERAL BUDGET WITH $26,055.00.  BRYAN COUNTY RSVP, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT, 501C3 SELF-SPONSORED PROGRAM WITH A GOVERNING BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ADVISORY BOARD.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE (COA) DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS (DSA). THE MISSION OF DSA IS TO BE A COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, INVOLVES SENIORS AND PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN CREATING A COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL, SHARE THEIR WISDOM, MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE, AND LIVE WITH DIGNITY. IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, DSA OFFERS ADULTS AGE 50 AND OLDER A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED FOR ACTIVE TO FRAIL ADULTS THAT PROMOTE HEALTHY AGING AND INDEPENDENCE. THESE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO MEET INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF SENIORS THROUGHOUT THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY AREA. DSA OPERATES SIX (6) SENIOR CENTERS, TWO (2) MULTIGENERATIONAL CENTERS, FOUR (4) SPORTS/FITNESS CENTERS, AND 17 MEAL SITES. IN ADDITION TO THESE CONGREGATE CENTERS, DSA PROVIDES SERVICES TO SENIORS THROUGH HOME REPAIR, CHORE AND RETROFIT SERVICES, CARE COORDINATION, INFORMATION & ASSISTANCE SERVICES, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION, AND A CENTRAL KITCHEN.
RSVP WILL PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED 800 VOLUNTEERS TO THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY METROPOLITAN AREA TO SUPPORT APPROXIMATELY 70 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, 1,000 OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND ASSISTING WITH ENROLLMENT OF NEW PARTICIPANTS AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND SOCIAL SUPPORT; SERVING AT SENIOR CENTERS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION AND ASSISTANCE TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF SERVICES AVAILABLE IN THE COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; LEADING CLASSES AND ACTIVITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS TO INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT; ASSISTING FOOD PANTRIES/BANKS WITH FOOD INSECURITY INITIATIVES AT SENIOR AND MULTIGENERATIONAL CENTERS AND OTHER AREAS THROUGHOUT THE CITY; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, THE PHARMACY AND GROCERY STORES TO INCREASE ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE AND NUTRITION RESPECTIVELY; DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY, SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVE CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT OF $51,723  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,020 FROM THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND $157,673 FROM THE COA DSA.

FOOD INSECURITY, ACADEMIC STRUGGLES, AND AN INCREASING POPULATION OF SENIORS FACING NEW CHALLENGES - THESE ARE JUST A FEW ISSUES THAT MANY NEW MEXICANS FACE IN THEIR DAILY LIVES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS DEDICATE MUCH OF THEIR TIME TO HELP TACKLE THESE PROBLEMS AND MANY MORE, THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE MISSION OF OUR SPONSOR, THE CITY OF SANTA FE DIVISION OF SENIOR SERVICES IS TO ENCOURAGE AND ASSIST SENIORS IN MAINTAINING ACTIVE, HEALTHY LIFESTYLES THAT ENABLE THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, AND RSVP SANTA FE VOLUNTEERS DEFINITELY ASSIST IN MEETING THIS GOAL.

A PROJECTED 400 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ESSENTIAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO RESIDENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT SANTA FE COUNTY, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING WITHIN SANTA FE, THE CITY; AND OF THIS NUMBER THERE WILL BE [AT MINIMUM] 48 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING FOOD SUPPORT AND NUTRITION REFERRALS TO THE ELDERLY THROUGH FOOD DISTRIBUTIONS AND MEAL DELIVERIES; TRANSPORTING HOMEBOUND/FRAIL SENIORS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO APPOINTMENTS AND/OR ASSISTING WITH ERRANDS; AND SPENDING TIME WITH SENIORS WITH A GOAL OF INCREASING SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. UPON COMPLETION OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL HAVE ENHANCED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR MORE THAN 300 INDIVIDUALS, AND IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY FOR MORE THAN 800 INDIVIDUALS IN SANTA FE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $56,900 IN NEW MEXICO STATE FUNDS AND $78,893 IN LOCAL CITY FUNDS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE CURRY COUNTY RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. 
AN ESTIMATED EIGHTY-SIX (86) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND FROM THIS NUMBER, FORTY-EIGHT (48) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. WE HAVE CHOSEN HEALTHY FUTURES AS OUR PRIMARY KEY FOCUS AREA. ACTIVITIES IN AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING WILL INCLUDE: HELPING PREPARE OR DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS, PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AS WELL AS TRANSPORTATION, CONDUCT DAILY WELLNESS CHECKS FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED LIVING ALONE AND/OR HOMEBOUND. ACTIVITIES IN ACCESS TO CARE-OPIOID ABUSE WILL INCLUDE PARTICIPATING IN HEALTH EDUCATION ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO PREVENT OR REDUCE PRESCRIPTION DRUG, OPIOID ABUSE, AND ENCOURAGE PRESCRIPTION SAFE STORAGE. WE WILL ADDRESS THE LINK BETWEEN FOOD INSECURITY AND OBESITY IN ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE OBJECTIVE OF FOOD-OBESITY WHERE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN EXISTING FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, MEAL SITES, AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES THAT DIRECT FOOD DISTRIBUTION PROGRAMS. RSVP WILL ALSO SERVE IN THE FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY-FINANCIAL LITERACY. THEY WILL ASSIST LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY IN PREPARING INCOME TAX RETURNS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, WE WILL HAVE ENCOURAGED AGING IN PLACE BY ENABLING PEOPLE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, AVOIDING EARLY PLACEMENT IN A NURSING HOME, AND IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH. BY EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ON AWARENESS OF THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC, SAFE STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF OPIOID DRUGS, WE WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF OPIOID PRESCRIPTION DRUGS AVAILABLE FOR ABUSE. WE WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO FOOD FOR LOW INCOME ELDERLY AND FAMILIES IN ORDER TO ADDRESS HUNGER, FOOD INSECURITY, AND INADEQUATE DIETS THUS IMPROVING THE OVERALL HEALTH OF THOSE SERVED. THE REMAINDER THIRTY-EIGHT (38) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FOCUS AREA OF COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE AT NON-PROFIT 501C3 ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA OF CURRY COUNTY WHICH INCLUDES THE CITY OF CLOVIS, AND OUTLYING VILLAGES OF MELROSE, GRADY AND TEXICO.  THIS WILL IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THOSE SERVED AND/OR ASSIST THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN ACHIEVING THEIR SHORT AND LONG TERM GOALS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $25,875 NON-FEDERAL STATE AND LOCAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE LEGAL APPLICANT, THE CHAVES COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS FOUNDATION, INC., HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY MANAGING A RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM SINCE IT BECAME AN INCORPORATED NON-PROFIT AND SPONSORING AGENCY IN 2000.  PRIOR TO THAT TIME, THE BOARD MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION HAD SERVED AS THE ADVISORY COUNCIL TO THE RSVP PROJECT SINCE 1975.  THE MISSION OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO SUPPORT THE RSVP PROJECT BY ENCOURAGING AN ACTIVE LIFESTYLE FOR THOSE 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER BY OFFERING QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WHILE MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS. 

IN THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT PERIOD OF THREE YEARS, AN ESTIMATED 130 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT CHAVES COUNTY RSVP (CCRSVP). OF THIS NUMBER, 69 RSVP (53%) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY THE VOLUNTEERS WILL INCLUDE: DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY OF LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR VETERANS TO VETERAN HEALTH FACILITIES; BUILDING HOMES FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES; PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF NON-PROFITS; AND INCREASING ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND AWARENESS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES--OBESITY AND FOOD--WITH 32% OF THE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THAT CAPACITY.  

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 900 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; 100 VETERANS WILL BE PROVIDED SAFE TRANSPORTATION TO VETERAN ADMINISTRATION HEALTHCARE FACILITIES (WHICH ARE LOCATED 180 MILES AWAY FROM CHAVES COUNTY); FOUR (4) ORGANIZATIONS WILL REPORT INCREASED CAPACITY DUE THE VOLUNTEERS PROVIDED BY CCRSVP; FOUR (4) HOUSES WILL BE BUILT OR REFURBISHED; AND 100 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AWARENESS. APPROXIMATELY 61 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ADDRESSING "OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES" AT SEVEN (7) ORGANIZATION IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,310 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 34,780 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 133 DUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, ASSISTING TO PREPARE NUTRITIOUS HOT MEALS FOR SENIORS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. DELIVERING HOT NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO ONLY SENIORS WITH MEDICAL PROBLEMS, WHOM ARE HOME-BOUND WHICH IS VERY IMPORTANT TO THEIR PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH AND A SOURCE OF COMPANIONSHIP. TO PROVIDE SENIORS THE AID TO BE MORE HEALTHY THROUGH DIET, SO THEY MAY STAY INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES. SUPPLY LOW-INCOME FOOD-INSECURE HOUSEHOLDS WITH CRITICALLY NEEDED NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO COMBAT OBESITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA(S) ID #: 1.1 AND 2.1 OF THIS GRANT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. ALONG WITH TWO MEASURES OF CAPACITY BUILDING. AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, SENIOR ADULTS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND WILL BE MORE PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY HEALTHY. LOW-INCOME FOOD-INSECURE HOUSEHOLD WILL OBTAIN NEEDED NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO COMBAT OBESITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $49,198 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,000.

AN ESTIMATED 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN CHILLICOTHE R-2, LIVINGSTON COUNTY R-3 AND SOUTHWEST LIVINGSTON COUNTY R-1 SCHOOL DISTRICTS.  ALL 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. BUILDING ON ITS PROVEN MODEL AND EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS, OASIS WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND ACADEMICALLY AT-RISK CHILDREN. TO MEET THIS NEED, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, OASIS WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 83 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE DIRECTLY IN SCHOOLS (VOLUNTEER STATIONS) PROVIDING LITERACY TUTORING AND MENTORING SUPPORT TO 166 STUDENTS IN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MORE THAN 6,640 HOURS OF SERVICE PER SCHOOL YEAR. OF THE STUDENTS SERVED BY YEAR THREE, 150 STUDENTS WILL COMPLETE THE PROGRAM AND 80 PERCENT OF THOSE STUDENTS (120) WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AS MEASURED BY PRE-AND POST READING TESTS. LIVINGSTON COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL MEET THE CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED OF IMPROVING STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY WHILE STRENGTHENING SCHOOL COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE PRESENCE OF CARING, WELL-TRAINED, OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $9,575 FROM FUNDING FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATION.

THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MORE THAN 6,640 HOURS OF SERVICE PER SCHOOL YEAR. OF THE STUDENTS SERVED BY YEAR THREE, 150 STUDENTS WILL COMPLETE THE PROGRAM AND 80 PERCENT OF THOSE STUDENTS (120) WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AS MEASURED BY PRE-AND POST READING TESTS. CALLAWAY COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL MEET THE CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED OF IMPROVING STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY WHILE STRENGTHENING SCHOOL COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE PRESENCE OF CARING, WELL-TRAINED, OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $9,575 FROM FUNDING FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 450 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN ST. LOUIS CITY, ST. LOUIS COUNTY, ST. CHARLES COUNTY AND JEFFERSON COUNTY. ALL 450 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. BUILDING ON ITS PROVEN MODEL AND EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS, OASIS WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND ACADEMICALLY AT-RISK CHILDREN. TO MEET THIS NEED, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, OASIS WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 450 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE DIRECTLY IN SCHOOLS (VOLUNTEER STATIONS) PROVIDING LITERACY TUTORING AND MENTORING SUPPORT TO 925 STUDENTS IN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MORE THAN 36,000 HOURS OF SERVICE PER YEAR.
