THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $198,147 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $88,095 FROM FUNDING FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATION.

MANAGED BY JEFFERSON COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS (JEFFCAP), A DEPARTMENT OF JEFFERSON PARISH (AS THE GRANTEE), THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) COLLABORATES DIRECTLY WITH THE CITIZENS' AFFAIRS DEPARTMENT. JEFFCAP HAS ESTABLISHED A MISSION TO EMPOWER FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS OF JEFFERSON PARISH (JP) INCLUDING THE ELDERLY, DISABLED, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, AND YOUTH THROUGH VARIOUS PROGRAMS.  JEFFCAP STRIVES TO EMPOWER CITIZENS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY; CITIZENS AFFAIRS COORDINATES THE FACTORS NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE AGING POPULATION OF JP.  ADDITIONALLY, CITIZENS AFFAIRS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSISTING CITIZENS WITH DISABILITIES OR OTHER PHYSICAL LIMITATIONS THAT MAY HINDER SELF-SUFFICIENCY.   RSVP, JEFFCAP AND CITIZENS AFFAIRS SHARE A COMMON GOAL OF IDENTIFYING AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE, INDEPENDENCE, HEALTH, AND DIGNITY OF THE ELDERLY POPULATION IN JP BY MANAGING COMMUNITY-BASED SENIOR PROGRAMS. 
MORE THAN 300 VOLUNTEERS CONTINUE TO SERVE JP THROUGH RSVP AND ARE PLACED IN VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS ACCORDINGLY. THEIR ACTIVITIES PERTAIN TO THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THE 2020-2023 GRANT PERIOD IS TO CONTINUE THE "HEALTHY FUTURES" INITIATIVE; THE GOAL OF THIS INITIATIVE IS TO INCREASE AND PROVIDE AID TO THE SENIORS AND FAMILIES, OF JEFFERSON PARISH, WHO NEED FOOD.   THIS INCREASED FOOD SECURITY WILL CONTINUE TO BE FACILITATED THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF FOOD BANKS/PANTRIES, FOOD DRIVES, AND BY PARTNERING WITH NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $58,566 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $30,504 IN IN-KIND MATCHING FUNDS FROM JP THROUGH CITIZENS' AFFAIRS FOR A BUDGET TOTAL OF $89,070.

THE MISSION OF ST. CHARLES PARISH IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY, EFFICIENT SERVICES TO SUSTAIN AND ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF ST. CHARLES PARISH.  IN KEEPING WITH THIS MISSION, THE PURPOSE OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS TO ENABLE OLDER AMERICANS, AGE 55 AND OVER, TO STRENGTHEN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE, ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THE VOLUNTEERS AND THOSE WHOM THEY SERVE, AND PROVIDE COMMUNITIES VALUABLE SERVICES. 
THIS YEAR AN ESTIMATED 340 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT 61 STATIONS WILL PROVIDE A VARIETY OF INVALUABLE SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE RIVER PARISHES (ST. CHARLES, ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, AND ST. JAMES PARISHES). THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RIVER PARISHES RSVP PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN THIS AREA INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND A FOOD SECURITY PROGRAM TARGETED TOWARDS CHILDREN OF LOW-INCOME FAMILIES. OTHER FOCUS AREAS THE RSVP CONTRIBUTES TO INCLUDE EDUCATION, DISASTER SERVICES, VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THESE AREAS WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, COMPANIONSHIP PROGRAMS, COMFORTING CHILDREN, TREE PLANTING, AND MOCK EMERGENCY EVACUATION TRAININGS. THESE ACTIVITIES ALONG WITH NUMEROUS OTHERS WILL TOUCH THE LIVES OF 16,928 TRI-PARISH CITIZENS EVERY YEAR.
ST. CHARLES PARISH IS REQUESTING $62,400 IN ANNUAL FEDERAL FUNDING. THIS AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $230,585 DEDICATED FROM ST. CHARLES PARISH AND ANNUAL DONATIONS OF $20,000 FROM ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST PARISH AND $12,000 FROM THE UNITED WAY OF ST. CHARLES, AS WELL AS OTHER IN-KIND DONATIONS.  
IN 2018, VOLUNTEERS LOGGED A TOTAL OF 66,533.75 HOURS OF SERVICE AND THE RSVP ADMINISTRATORS ANTICIPATE MEETING OR EXCEEDING THAT LEVEL OF SERVICE IN 2020.  NEW CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS ARE LIKELY TO CREATE NEW STATIONS AND GARNER NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES IN THE RIVER PARISHES.  THE RSVP ALSO PLANS TO PROVIDE THE SAME FULFILLING OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEERS.  THE VARIOUS ACTIVITIES THE VOLUNTEERS PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS AND THE PARTNERSHIPS OFFER MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE AND IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE RIVER PARISHES.

THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER KANSAS CITY (UWGKC) AND THE UNITED WAY OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY (UWWC) WILL MERGE AS OF JULY 1, 2020 TO BETTER UNIFY AND SERVE THE REGION. UWWC HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1977 AND UWGKC HAS A DEEP COMMITMENT TO VOLUNTEER SERVICES IN THE REGION AS WELL AS SUPPORTS PROGRAMS THAT DOVETAIL WITH RSVP PRIORITY AREAS. UWGKC?S MISSION IS TO MOBILIZE GREATER KANSAS CITY'S COLLECTIVE GENEROSITY FOR THE GREATEST GOOD. THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE A VITAL RESOURCE FOR MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS. IT IS PROPOSED THAT AN ESTIMATED 162 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH THE REQUESTED FUNDS OF $68,746. OF THIS NUMBER, 69 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION & COMPANIONSHIP, TUTORING STUDENTS, AND DISTRIBUTING EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL BAGS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A SECONDARY FOCUS IN K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 16 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PANTRIES THAT ASSIST IN DISTRIBUTING FOOD, 25 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ALLOW INDEPENDENCE, 4 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH OUTREACH REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS TO INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE, AND 24 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP TUTOR STUDENTS WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING MATH AND READING SKILLS. FOR THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS, EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON INCREASING ACCESS TO EMERGENCY FOOD THROUGH VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING WITH EMERGENCY FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT LOCAL PANTRIES AND COMPLETING DAY TO DAY TASKS AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF PEOPLE WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED ELDERLY AND DISABLED. EACH INTERACTION WITH A HOME BOUND INDIVIDUAL WILL BE TRACKED BY THE VOLUNTEER AND A YEARLY SATISFACTION SURVEY WILL BE COMPLETED BY CLIENTS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF SENIORS REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ALSO UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION, TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE OPIOID CRISIS AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SECURING OR DESTROYING UNUSED PRESCRIBED PAIN MEDICATIONS THROUGH PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL PACKETS. SURVEYS WILL BE COMPLETED BY PARTICIPANTS WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. FOR A SECONDARY FOCUS, K-12 SUCCESS WILL PLACE VOLUNTEERS WITHIN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO HELP TUTOR STUDENTS IN MATH OR LITERACY WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF STUDENTS WITH INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN THOSE AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $68,746 FOR 20-21L YEAR, AND A REQUEST FOR THE 9 MONTH PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2020 TO MARCH 31,2021 OF $52,663 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $14,580 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM UWGKC.

?AN ESTIMATED 124 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 72 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE OPIOID DRUG INTERVENTION, ELDER JUSTICE: FRAUD AND SCAM PREVENTION, NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT, AND OUTREACH TO VETERANS AND VETERAN FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, INDIVIDUALS SERVED WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, AND AN INCREASED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AS A RESULT OF THE ACTIVITIES RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE INVOLVED IN. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $20,357 IN LOCAL DOLLARS AND $38,653 IN ADDITIONAL LOCAL EXCESS FUNDING.

AN ESTIMATED 104 RSVP VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 104 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED SENIORS, PROVIDING NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, INCREASING FOOD SECURITY THROUGH THE DELIVERY OF FRIENDSHIP MEALS, MENTORING LOCAL YOUTH DURING THEIR SCHOOL LUNCH HOUR, TUTORING AND/OR PROVIDING CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE, AND PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR OTHER LOCAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 170 ISOLATED SENIORS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AS A RESULT OF RSVP COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES; 10 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AS A RESULT OF NON-MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; 652 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AS A RESULT OF MEAL DELIVERY AND FOOD BANK/FOOD PANTRY SERVICE; 22 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE AS A RESULT OF NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION; 184 YOUTH WILL HAVE IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND/OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS AS A RESULT OF MENTORING, TUTORING AND CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE; AND 3 NON-PROFIT AGENCIES WILL INCREASE THEIR EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS AND/OR PROGRAM REACH THROUGH THE RECRUITMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF 55 VOLUNTEERS, THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $102,614 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $43,978.

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 83 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING IN MATH, ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND SCIENCE; LEADING AND CO-FACILITATING FINANCIAL LITERACY PROGRAMS; LEADING EDUCATION PROGRAMS ABOUT HEALTHY LIFESTYLES AND PARTICIPATING IN PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS GRANT IS EDUCATION: K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP BGCPC IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF 321 STUDENTS, INCREASE THE FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE OF 55 CLUB MEMBERS AND HAVE 459 CLUB MEMBERS REPORT A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR OR INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIORS THAT WILL LEAD TO A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE. THE POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN THREE YEARS WILL BENEFIT 834 CLUB MEMBERS AGED 6-18. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $8,250.

SINCE 1973, HIGH COUNTRY RSVP, A SPONSORED PROGRAM OF COLORADO MOUNTAIN COLLEGE (CMC), HAS BEEN POSITIVELY IMPACTING THE LIVES OF SENIORS IN GARFIELD COUNTY, COLORADO BY MATCHING SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WITH LOCAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS.  HIGH COUNTRY RSVP ALIGNS WITH CMC'S MISSION BY OFFERING LIFELONG LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO SENIORS THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE, EDUCATIONAL CLASSES, AND COUNSELING.   

AN ESTIMATED 180 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH HIGH COUNTRY RSVP.  OF THIS NUMBER, A MINIMUM OF 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEERS' SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, COUNSELING SENIORS ON THEIR MEDICARE AND HEALTH INSURANCE NEEDS, ASSISTING COMMUNITY VETERANS, PREPARING INCOMING TAXES FOR SENIORS, AND PROVIDING DISASTER PREPARATION AND RESPONSE SERVICES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE CONTRIBUTED APPROXIMATELY 60,000 HOURS OF SERVICE SERVING OVER 15,000 CLIENTS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $55,205 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,000 IN NON-FEDERAL MATCHING FUNDS.

RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE WILL PROPOSE 400 VOLUNTEERS OF WHICH 200 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL TO BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. OUR PLAN IS TO CONTINUE THE PROGRAMMATIC COMPONENTS THAT HAVE BEEN HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL IN TERMS OF OUTCOMES, PARTNERSHIPS AND INTERGENERATIONAL VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT. EIGHTY -THREE (83)  RSVP  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.    FIFTY-TWO  (52) VOLUNTEERS ACTIVITIES WILL BE TO IMPLEMENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION PROGRAMS INTO 16 STATIONS TO NETWORK WITH:  THE BOTH COUNTY BOARD OF EDUCATIONS, LAW ENFORCEMENT'S, MEDICAL AND MENTAL PROFESSIONALS, SENIOR NUTRITION SITES, AND NON-PROFIT CIVIC ORGANIZATION TO EDUCATED THE IMPORTANCE OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE FOR CHILDREN, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  WE WILL WORK WITH PROFESSIONALS THAT WILL PROVIDE RESEARCH BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE TO CHILDREN, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  PROPER EDUCATION ABOUT SUBSTANCE ABUSE IS CRUCIAL PREVENTATIVE MEASURE FOR KIDS, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  THE RSVP  VOLUNTEERS WILL SHARE FACTUAL INFORMATION ABOUT SUBSTANCE ABUSE TO 400  ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE, AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS BY ADDRESSING ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL LEARNING TO ADDRESS RISK FACTORS FOR DRUG ABUSE, SUCH AS EARLY AGGRESSION, ACADEMIC FAILURE, AND SCHOOL DROPOUT.  THE TRAINING WILL FOCUS ON HELPING STUDENTS TO DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR SELF-CONTROL, EMOTIONAL AWARENESS,  COMMUNICATION, SOCIAL PROBLEM-SOLVING, ACADEMIC SUPPORT, AND IDENTIFYING TRUSTED ADULTS WHEN SEEKING HELP.  ALSO THE VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE OVER 1,000 SENIOR CITIZENS ABOUT OPIOID MISUSE, PRESCRIPTION ABUSE, AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SAFE DISPOSAL OF MEDICATIONS.  THEY WILL PROVIDE INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND RESOURCES TO INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF OPIOIDS AND PRESCRIPTION DRUG ABUSE.  ALONG WITH INFORMATION ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION PROGRAMS THAT CAN ASSIST WITH SOMEONE OR THEMSELVES IF DEALING WITH AN ADDITION PROBLEM.  AS WELL AS THE OPIOID DRUG INTERVENTION WITH HEALTHY FUTURES WE ARE ATTACKING THE OBESITY AND FOOD CHALLENGES IN WEST VIRGINIA.   THIRTY-THREE (31) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER FOOD 3 TIMES A WEEK FOR 1 HOUR A DAY TO 300 CLIENTS.  THE PROGRAM WILL BAND TOGETHER WITH 10 STATIONS SUCH AS SENIOR NUTRITION SITES, SOUP KITCHENS, MOUNTAINEER FOOD BANK, AND FOOD PANTRIES TO ENSURE THAT SENIORS HAVE THE RESOURCES TO MAINTAIN THEIR NUTRITIONAL NEEDS AND KEEP THEM OUT OF HARDSHIP FROM FOOD SUPPLIES IN THE TWO COUNTIES OF BRAXTON AND POCAHONTAS IN WEST VIRGINIA.   THE TEN (10) VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE NOT SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS EMBRACE OTHER VOLUNTEER SERVICES IN 10 STATIONS WITH MANY OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES/OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION AND OBESITY AND FOOD.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 400 STUDENTS WILL HAVE BEEN EDUCATED ON THE IMPORTANCE OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE,  OVER 1,000 SENIOR CITIZENS IN THE TWO COUNTY AREA WHICH IS 10% (OF 10,624 SENIORS IN THE TWO COUNTIES) WILL HAVE RECEIVED INFORMATIONAL RESOURCES ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE, AND 300 SENIORS HAVE THE RESOURCES TO MAINTAIN THEIR NUTRITIONAL NEEDS AND KEEP THEM OUT OF HARDSHIP FROM FOOD SUPPLIES.  ALONG WITH VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE WORKED ON SEVERAL OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES  IN THEIR COUNTIES.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,914.00

THE MISSION OF THE ROANE COUNTY ANTI-DRUG COALITION (RCADC) IS TO REDUCE YOUTH SUBSTANCE USE; TO EDUCATE AND RAISE AWARENESS OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO AND OTHER DRUG ISSUES; TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT; AND TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND PREVENTION STRATEGIES IN ROANE COUNTY, TENNESSEE.  THE GOAL IS TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE POPULATION-LEVEL REDUCTIONS IN SUBSTANCE ABUSE RATES. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY IMPLEMENTING COMMUNITY-WIDE STRATEGIES THAT CHANGE PROBLEM ENVIRONMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS SUPPORTED BY THE PROGRAM IS 108 AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED IS $107,500. ALL 108 OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED TO ADHERE TO EVIDENCE-BASED PRINCIPLES FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION AS IDENTIFIED BY THE WHITE HOUSE'S OFFICE OF NATIONAL DRUG CONTROL POLICY.  THESE PRACTICES HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN DECREASING SUBSTANCE USE AND INCREASING COMMUNITY COLLABORATION.  MORE SPECIFICALLY, THE PROGRAM WILL MEET THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: DISTRIBUTION OF MATERIALS FOR THE "COUNT IT LOCK IT DROP IT" CAMPAIGN TO ENCOURAGE RESPONSIBLE STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF MEDICATIONS; THE LAUNCH OF A COUNTY-WIDE MEDIA CAMPAIGN FOCUSED ON INCREASING VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN PREVENTION; PARTICIPATION IN YOUTH PREVENTION ACTIVITIES IN COLLABORATION WITH ROANE COUNTY SCHOOLS; ORGANIZATION AND TRAINING FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON PREVENTION BASICS AND MAKING REFERRALS FOR TREATMENT; AND DELIVERING SUBSTANCE ABUSE EDUCATION AND INFORMATION ON ACCESS TO TREATMENT WITH A FOCUS ON MILITARY VETERANS.
IT IS PROJECTED THAT BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE NUMBER OF YOUTH WHO REPORT USING ALCOHOL, TOBACCO, MARIJUANA AND PRESCRIPTION DRUGS WILL DECREASE BY 2%; THE REPORTED AGE OF FIRST USE AMONG YOUTH WILL INCREASE; AND THE NUMBER OF OVERDOSE DEATHS IN ROANE COUNTY WILL DECREASE BY 3%.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $107,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $46,435 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. A RECENTLY COMPLETED BENEFIT COST STUDY SUGGESTS THAT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF EVIDENCE-BASED INITIATIVES WILL ULTIMATELY SAVE THE COUNTY $14.66 IN PUBLIC BURDEN SPENDING FOR EVERY DOLLAR SPENT ON PREVENTION.  THIS EQUATES TO A SAVINGS OF $4,727,850 OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.

LEGACY LINK, AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) PROJECTS A MINIMUM OF 275 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE GEORGIA MOUNTAINS RSVP SERVICE AREA, A DIVERSE TEN COUNTY REGION IN THE NORTH GEORGIA MOUNTAINS (BANKS, DAWSON, FORSYTH, FRANKLIN, HALL, HABERSHAM, HART, LUMPKIN, TOWNS, UNION AND WHITE). THE SERVICE AREA ENCOMPASSES OVER 2600 SQUARE MILES WITH 60 MUNICIPALITIES AND 70 ZIP CODES. MOST COUNTIES ARE RURAL AND INCLUDE TWO SMALL CITIES AND A SUBURBAN METRO AREA. AS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, LEGACY LINK IS AN AGENT TO PROMOTE AND ASSIST THE INDEPENDENT LIVING OF THE REGION'S AGING POPULATION. THE MISSION OF THE NON-PROFIT AGENCY IS TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT WHICH ENHANCES AND FACILITATES INDEPENDENCE AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF OLDER INDIVIDUALS. LEGACY LINK PROVIDES SERVICES, ASSISTANCE, INFORMATION, AND REFERRALS THAT ENABLE OLDER ADULTS TO AGE IN PLACE, THUS ELIMINATING OR POSTPONING THE NEED FOR MORE COSTLY ASSISTED LIVING ARRANGEMENTS OR NURSING HOMES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE GEORGIA MOUNTAINS RSVP PROGRAM IS TO SERVE LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA WITH ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE FOR OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES. TOTAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DELIVERING FOOD TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, PROVIDING RESPITE TIME FOR CAREGIVERS, PROVIDING MEDICARE BENEFIT INFORMATION, PROVIDING DISASTER PREPARATION INFORMATION FOR OLDER ADULTS, AND SUPPORTING CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES WITH INCREASED PROGRAM REACH.  AN ESTIMATED 275 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS  LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE TEN-COUNTY AREA. OVER 200 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME PRODUCING ACTIVITIES WHICH GREATLY EXCEEDS THE GRANT MANDATE OF 48. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, EXPECTED OUTPUTS ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE AS FOLLOWS: 1400 CLIENTS SERVED WITH MEAL DELIVERY, 25 CAREGIVERS WITH RESPITE TIME, 1000 MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WITH MONEY SAVING INFORMATION, 100 OLDER GEORGIANS WITH DISASTER PREPARATION INFORMATION, AND DOLLARS RAISED TO SUPPORT PROGRAMS AT STATIONS. PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED TO BE 75 HOME DELIVERED MEAL RECIPIENTS WITH INCREASED INDEPENDENT LIVING CAPABILITY, 10 CAREGIVERS WITH INCREASED PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, 300 MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WITH INCREASED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE, 75 OLDER GEORGIANS BETTER PREPARED TO FACE A DISASTER, AND 2 ORGANIZATIONS WITH INCREASED PROGRAM REACH. ADDITIONAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL PROVIDE ADULT EDUCATION IN COMPUTER SKILLS, CRAFTING, MUSIC AND EXERCISE; TELEPHONE REASSURANCE FOR HOMEBOUND ELDERLY; READING WITH STUDENTS; SENDING LETTERS TO OVERSEAS MILITARY; AND A VARIETY OF LOCAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPPORT FOR COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. LEGACY LINK AAA REQUESTS A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $27,333 OF LOCAL DOLLARS WHICH EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED 30% MATCH.

THE VNA OF THE TREASURE COAST (VNATC) HAS A LONG-STANDING HISTORY WITH OUR COMMUNITY, AND SINCE 1975, IT HAS GROWN TO BE ONE OF THE LARGEST EMPLOYERS AND HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS IN INDIAN RIVER COUNTY. HOWEVER, EVEN WITH ITS INCREDIBLE GROWTH, IT HAS NEVER LOST SIGHT IN WHAT THE FOUNDERS WANTED ITS PURPOSE TO BE: A COMMUNITY-MINDED ORGANIZATION THAT CARES FOR ALL.
VOLUNTEERS ARE THE HEART OF VNATC AND ARE A KEY RESOURCE TO THE AGENCY. MORE THAN 450 DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS GENEROUSLY DONATE THEIR TIME AND TALENT TO ASSIST IN VARIOUS ASPECTS OF THE AGENCY. WHETHER IT IS INTERACTING WITH PATIENTS, BEING AN EXTRA HAND IN THE VNA HOSPICE HOUSE, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE AROUND THE OFFICE, OR PROVIDING SUPPORT IN OUR HOSPICE THRIFT STORES, VOLUNTEERS CAN BE FOUND IN ALL ASPECTS OF OUR ORGANIZATION.
VNATC TO IMPLEMENT THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN INDIAN RIVER COUNTY, BEGINNING APRIL 1, 2020.  VNA OF THE TREASURE COAST WILL ENGAGE A TOTAL OF 241 VOLUNTEERS OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.  OF THESE VOLUNTEERS, 92 WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES.  THE REMAINDER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, 149, WILL BE ASSIGNED TO OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
THE HEALTHY FUTURES PROJECT AIMS TO DECREASE ISOLATION AMONGST TERMINALLY ILL PATIENTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS AND ENCOURAGE SOCIALIZATION AND COMMUNITY CONNECTION AMONGST PATIENTS FACING LIFE-LIMITING ILLNESSES.  RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES AND INTERVENTIONS WILL FOCUS ON INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND CAREGIVER RESPITE. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL MAKE SOCIALIZATION VISITS TO PATIENTS, PROVIDE RESPITE VISITS TO CAREGIVERS, AND INCREASE ACCESS TO COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES AND RESOURCES THROUGH TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD, 70% OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED BY 92 RSVP HEALTHY FUTURES VOLUNTEERS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND LESS FEELINGS OF ISOLATION AS DOCUMENTED IN THE SENIOR CORPS SENIOR COMPANION AND RESPITE SURVEYS.  THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF 149 RSVP VOLUNTEERS, OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL BE MET AS DETERMINED BY COMMUNITY PARTNERS, VNATC STAKEHOLDERS, AND ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS. 
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $91,959 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 10,217 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE VNATC.

AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 125 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
TUTORING - VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR STUDENTS WHO ARE STRUGGLING WITH THEIR LITERACY SKILLS IN KINDERGARTEN, FIRST, SECOND AND THIRD GRADES.
SCHOOL READINESS -- VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WEEKLY WITH STUDENTS IN VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN (VPK) TO IMPROVE THEIR LEVEL OF SCHOOL READINESS BEFORE THEY ENTER KINDERGARTEN.
CAPACITY BUILDING -- RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP NON-PROFITS WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT FOR COMMUNITY, EDUCATIONAL, AND FUNDRAISING EVENTS, AS WELL AS PROVIDE RECRUITMENT FOR DIRECT SERVICE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.  
DISASTER PREPAREDNESS -- RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ON THE DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TRAINING PLANNING COMMITTEE THAT ENSURES DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TRAININGS ARE AVAILABLE AND PROMOTED TO VOLUNTEERS IN OUR COMMUNITY.  ADDITIONALLY, IF A DISASTER AFFECTS OUR COUNTY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK IN DISASTER-RELATED ROLES AND RECRUIT COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO SERVE IN NEEDED POSITIONS.
OPIOID DRUG INTERVENTION ACCESS TO CARE-- RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH CONDUCTING AN OPIOID DRUG PREVENTION EVENT DURING NATIONAL PREVENTION WEEK IN MAY OF EACH YEAR.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, STUDENTS IN THE CNCS FUNDED PROGRAM WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY.  STUDENTS IN THE VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN PROGRAM WILL BE MORE READY TO START KINDERGARTEN AND WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS.  COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE TRAINED IN VARIOUS ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE THEIR DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE AND RECOVERY ABILITIES.  COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE EDUCATED ABOUT OPIOID AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES IN OUR COUNTY.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $51,260 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,014.  

FLAGLER VOLUNTEER SERVICES HAS BEEN THE PROUD SPONSOR OF RSVP IN FLAGLER COUNTY SINCE 2001 AND HAS BUILT POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY TO ENSURE THAT WE WILL BE ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY MEET OUR GOALS THROUGH THIS GRANT.  PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE FLAGLER COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT INCLUDING ALL ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, FLAGLER COUNTY EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT, FLAGLER COUNTY FIRE & RESCUE, UNITED WAY OF VOLUSIA/FLAGLER, EARLY LEARNING COALITION, AND MANY MORE.

THEY WILL DELIVER MEALS, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS AND VETERANS, INSTRUCT OSTEOPOROSIS PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT EXERCISE AND HEALTH EDUCATION CLASSES, AND SUPPORT SENIOR ENGAGEMENT THROUGH A NETWORK OF 16 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, SUCH AS SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAMS, TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS, SHARING CENTERS, SENIOR CENTERS, A CAREGIVER RESOURCE CENTER AND LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $115,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $49,362.00.  COMMUNITY SERVICE COUNCIL (D/B/A AGING MATTERS IN BREVARD), AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY, IS THE LARGEST MULTI-FACETED NON-PROFIT SENIOR SERVING AGENCY IN BREVARD COUNTY, ADMINISTERING NINE COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS.  INCORPORATED IN 1965, AGING MATTERS IN BREVARD STRIVES TO DEVELOP SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY PROBLEMS, TO PROMOTE AND MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE, AND MAXIMIZE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE CITIZENS OF BREVARD COUNTY, PARTICULARLY THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.  SINCE 1972, THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF BREVARD HAS SERVED AS THE LARGEST VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION ORGANIZATION IN THE COUNTY.  THE PROGRAM WILL CONCENTRATE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES, WHICH WILL EMPLOY A MEASURABLE, RESULTS-ORIENTED APPROACH THAT IS WELL PROVEN TO ADDRESS SOCIAL NEEDS AND COMMUNITY PROBLEMS.  BY PROVIDING CLIENTS WITH THE MEANS TO LEVERAGE THEIR EXISTING RESOURCES AND BUILD UPON THEIR SKILLS AND ABILITIES, THEY WILL MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE, AND ULTIMATELY, ACHIEVE SUSTAINED SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF TAMPA BAY'S (BBBSTB) MISSION IS SIMPLE AND BUILT ON RESEARCH AND EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES AS WELL AS DECADES OF EXPERIENCE. OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE AND SUPPORT ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS THAT IGNITE THE POWER AND PROMISE OF YOUTH. WE ACHIEVE THIS BY PARTNERING WITH PARENTS/GUARDIANS, VOLUNTEERS, DONORS AND OTHER MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY AND BY HOLDING OURSELVES ACCOUNTABLE FOR EACH CHILD IN OUR PROGRAM ACHIEVING: (I) HIGHER ASPIRATIONS, GREATER CONFIDENCE AND BETTER RELATIONSHIPS, (II) AVOIDANCE OF RISKY BEHAVIORS, AND (III) EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS. BBBSTB HAS BEEN PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING SERVICES SINCE 1964, AND STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES THROUGH THESE HIGH-QUALITY, LIFE-ENRICHING, ONE-TO-ONE RELATIONSHIPS FOR YOUTH, BY PAIRING THEM WITH CARING, SCREENED, TRAINED, AND PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED ADULT VOLUNTEERS. OUR MENTORING PROGRAMS ARE EVIDENCE-BASED, AND OUTCOME DRIVEN AND WE'RE PROUD OF THE WAY OUR PROGRAMS HAVE HELPED ALL YOUTH ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL! 

ALL VOLUNTEERS UNDER THE RSVP EXPANSION GRANT WILL ENGAGE IN ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING IN EITHER A COMMUNITY- OR SCHOOL-BASED SETTING. VOLUNTEERS WILL MAKE A COMMITMENT OF AT LEAST 15 MONTH FOR COMMUNITY-BASED AND ONE YEAR FOR SCHOOL-BASED, THOUGH ON AVERAGE MOST MATCHES ARE TOGETHER TWO YEARS. SCHOOL-BASED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT ONE OF THE THREE SCHOOLS ALREADY ENGAGED IN SUMTER COUNTY, FL (VOLUNTEER STATIONS), AND BBBSTB WILL SERVE AS THE STATION FOR COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY SERVING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUTH. AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF EIGHTY-THREE YOUTH WILL HAVE BEEN SERVED IN SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS, WITH THE OUTCOME OF IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.

THE APPLICANT SHARE OF TOTAL BUDGET WILL BE $35,179. THIS REPRESENTS CASH DONATIONS VIA PRIVATE REVENUE SOURCES. THE AGENCY'S PRIVATE REVENUE SOURCES INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL GIVING, CORPORATE SUPPORT, AND SPECIAL EVENTS. UNRESTRICTED FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO SUPPORT THIS PROJECT THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.

LEGAL APPLICANT-COLBERT COUNTY COMMISSION
PROPOSED VOLUNTEERS-160
THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE BUDGET IS 97,504 FOR A ONE YEAR PERIOD, THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE IS 54,223 WHICH EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED MATCHING FUNDS OF 30%. THE COLBERT COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 168 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 98 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE FOOD COLLECTION AND DELIVERY, MEAL DELIVERY, TUTORING, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS EDUCATION, AND NUTRITION EDUCATION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT OUR PROGRAM INTENDS TO BUILD UP FOOD SECURITY, EDUCATE ON HEALTH AND NUTRITION, AND INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND OVERALL NUTRITION. VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TOGETHER WITH COMMUNITIES, LOCAL AUTHORITIES, AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO ADDRESS AND HELP RESOLVE HUNGER BY PROVIDING FOOD ITEMS TO BE PACKED/DISTRIBUTED TO LOCAL SCHOOL CHILDREN, SHUT INS, DISABLED AND ELDERLY IN OUR AREA. THESE PROGRAMS WILL MEET BOTH IMMEDIATE NEEDS FOR NUTRITIOUS MEALS AND FOOD TO THOSE WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT RECEIVE IT. RSVP WANTS TO WORK TO BE A PART OF THE SOLUTION TO HELP FEED THOSE IN NEED IN OUR CITIES AND RURAL COMMUNITIES. WE ALSO WANT TO WORK TOGETHER WITH OUR AREA LEADERS, VOLUNTEERS, AND CITIZENS TO REACH A COMMON GOAL OF PROVIDING FOR THE NEEDS OF OUR NEIGHBORS AND FRIENDS.  WE HOPE TO INCREASE THEIR FOOD SECURITY, NUTRITION KNOWLEDGE, FOOD RESOURCES, AND PROMOTE BETTER HEALTH AND HAPPINESS FOR THOSE THAT WE SERVE.

POSITIVE MATURITY HAS BEEN THE PROUD SPONSOR FOR THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS SINCE 1972. OVER THE YEARS WE HAVE PLACED THOUSANDS OF ACTIVE ADULTS 55 AND OLDER IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND ASSISTING LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN NEED.

IN THE 2017/18 GRANT YEAR RSVP HAD 1838 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THROUGHOUT THE 4 COUNTY REGION (BLOUNT, JEFFERSON, WALKER, AND SHELBY). OF THOSE WHO VOLUNTEERED, 770 SERVED UNDER THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S PRIORITY AREAS.

THE 2018/19 GRANT YEAR INCREASED ITS NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO 1937 IN THE FOUR-COUNTY REGION. OF THOSE WHO VOLUNTEERED, 697 SERVED UNDER THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S PRIORITY AREAS.

AN ESTIMATED 1746 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN 2020 THROUGH POSITIVE MATURITY'S RSVP PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 582 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE; FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP, PREVENTING SENIOR FRAUD, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, AND OUTREACH.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE MEALS AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS WHO MAY NOT BE GETTING BALANCED MEALS AND MAY FEEL SOCIALLY ISOLATED.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE HOPE TO HAVE ACCOMPLISHED THE FOLLOWING GOALS:  1900 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDED 875,000 HOURS OF VOLUNTEERISM ADDRESSING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENCE (FILL IN YOUR OUTCOMES FOR 3 YEARS). 

POSITIVE MATURITY IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING $135,138 /YEAR FOR 3 YEARS WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $149,243/YEAR FOR THREE YEARS FROM STATE, COUNTY, AND LOCAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 260 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND PEOPLE, ASSISTING UNINSURED PEOPLE WITH PRESCRIPTION ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AND ASSISTING MEDICARE RECIPIENTS WITH THEIR PLANS, FREE INCOME TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW-INCOME AND ELDERLY TAXPAYERS, TUTORING ELEMENTARY STUDENTS IN READING AND ASSISTING LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WITH THEIR VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SKILLS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT:  500 PEOPLE WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO AGE IN PLACE, HAVE ACCESS TO FOOD AND CARE, 100 PEOPLE WILL HAVE IMPROVED FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE AND $575,000 WILL HAVE BEEN SAVED WITH FREE TAX PREPARATION, 60 STUDENTS WILL HAVE AN INCREASED READING LEVEL, AND 3 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL HAVE BETTER VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SKILLS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $170,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

HOUSTON, HENRY AND GENEVA (TRI- COUNTY) RSVP WILL PROVIDE 179 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS 55 AND OLDER TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR COMMUNITIES, AMELIORATE SOME OF THE CONSEQUENCES OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL POVERTY, AND ENSURE A BRIGHTER FUTURE FOR THE FAMILIES LIVING THERE. VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES WILL BE SERVED AND RECRUITED AS VOLUNTEERS. THE FIRST PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS: AGING IN PLACE WITH FOCUS ON ELDER JUSTICE AND INDEPENDENT LIVING. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TARGETED EDUCATION TO BOTH ELDERLY AND THEIR FAMILIES, COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS; TRAINING TO COMMUNITY PARTNERS; FRIENDLY VISITS FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND MASTER SOCIAL WORK/NURSING STUDENTS. RSVP WILL ALSO DO OUT-REACH TRAINING PROGRAMS ON THE TOPIC OF ELDER ABUSE. A FINAL COMPONENT OF THIS FOCUS AREA IS TO INFORM THE ELDER POPULATION CONCERNING RESOURCES AND BENEFITS AND THE HOW TO OBTAIN RESOURCES AND BENEFITS- ESPECIALLY MEDICAL AND END-OF-LIFE CARE. A COMMUNITY RESOURCE MANUAL FOR THE TRI-COUNTY AREA WILL BE DEVELOPED AND DISTRIBUTED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THIS MANUAL WILL BE A COLLABORATION WITH THE TROY UNIVERSITY COLEMAN CENTER VISTA GRANT UTILIZING INFORMATION AND ALREADY DEVELOPED PARTNERSHIPS. DISASTER PREPARATION. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: BLOOD MOBILE DRIVE; EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION AND RESOURCES (THIS INFORMATION WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE TRI-COUNTY RESOURCES MANUAL) THIS MANUAL WILL BE A COLLABORATION WITH THE TROY UNIVERSITY COLEMAN CENTER VISTA GRANT UTILIZING INFORMATION AND ALREADY DEVELOPED PARTNERSHIPS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS AREA ARE: 85% OF ALL RECIPIENTS OF THE RESOURCE MANUAL WILL INDICATE THEY HAVE USED THIS MANUAL TO CONNECT WITH INFORMATION CONCERNING A RESOURCE NEEDED.  IN ADDITION, 85% OF RECIPIENTS WILL HAVE A DISASTER PREPARATION AUDIT DONE BY A FRIENDLY VISITOR TO DETERMINE LEVEL OF PREPAREDNESS WITH AN ACTION PLAN TO CLOSE THE GAP ON NEEDS. FINALLY, THIS GRANT WILL FOCUS ON DEVELOPMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA IN ORDER TO BUILD AND MAINTAIN PATHWAYS FOR SUSTAINABILITY FOR THE ELDERLY AND THEIR FAMILIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $92,314.00. IN FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF $9,231.40 IN-KIND MATCH.

THE RESPONSIBLE PARTIES WHO WILL ADMINISTER THIS GRANT ARE: JANE COVELLA, CLALLAM/JEFFERSON RSVP PROGRAM MANAGER WITH FOUR YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN THE PROGRAM. MARKI LOCKHART IS MANAGER OF SEVERAL GRANTS IN THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITY SERVICES DIRECTOR WITH OLYMPIC COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS (OLYCAP) INCLUDING THE RSVP PROGRAM. BECKY ACEVEDO, RSVP VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR WILL RECRUIT AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO RETAIN VOLUNTEERS. ALL THREE OF THESE PROGRAM STAFF HAVE MANY YEARS OF NATIONAL SERVICE UNDER THEIR BELTS AS PREVIOUS AMERICORPS MEMBERS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS.  
DALE WILSON, OLYCAP EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS SUPPORTED COMMUNITY ACTION NEEDS FOR OVER 34 YEARS. HE IS INTERESTED IN RETAINING THE RSVP PROGRAM WITH SPONSORSHIP OF OLYCAP. OLYCAP HAS MANAGED RSVP PROGRAM NEEDS FOR 47 YEARS. WE ARE PLEASED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS NEXT GRANT FUNDING OPPORTUNITY. 
OUR ADVISORY BOARD OF SEVEN MEMBERS IS COMMITTED TO OVERSIGHT OF RSVP, CONDUCTING ANNUAL SITE VISITS, INTERACTING WITH VOLUNTEERS, AND CONDUCTING PROGRAM REVIEWS AND PROGRAM ASSESSMENTS ON A REGULAR BASIS.    
AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER AT LEAST 65 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: FOOD DISTRIBUTION, TUTORING OF STUDENTS, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, FOOD/MEAL DELIVERY TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, COMPANIONSHIP FOR SENIORS ATTENDING CONGREGATE MEALS, AND REFERRALS TO SERVICES FOR VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT AT LEAST 8,620 UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE BEEN SUPPORTED THROUGHOUT JEFFERSON AND CLALLAM COUNTY COMMUNITIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $63,960 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF 35.8% OF ADDITIONAL FUNDING OF $35,690 DOLLARS.

AN ESTIMATED 300 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ADAMS, CHELAN, DOUGLAS, GRANT, LINCOLN, AND OKANOGAN COUNTIES IN WASHINGTON STATE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 250 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  ONE OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE EMERGENCY FOOD PROGRAMS IN LOCAL FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER EMERGENCY FOOD PROGRAMS.  OTHER VOLUNTEERS WILL TEACH FALL PREVENTION CLASSES TO SENIORS, ENABLING THEM TO CONTINUE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THE COMMUNITY.  WHILE STILL OTHERS WILL HELP PROVIDE PRESCRIPTION DRUG EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY IN THE AREA OF OPIOIDS.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON OPIOID ABUSE EDUCATION, SAFE DISPOSAL OF ALL PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS, AND WILL PROVIDE TOOLS TO HAVE CONVERSATIONS ABOUT OPIOIDS. AT LEAST 600 SENIORS WILL ATTEND EDUCATION SESSIONS ON OPIOIDS AND PRESCRIPTION DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION AND 500 SENIORS WILL TAKE PART IN THE SAFE DISPOSAL OF ALL PRESCRIPTION DRUGS.  FINALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE EMERGENCY FOOD TO MORE THAN 1000 UNDUPLICATED FAMILIES, HELPING THEM TO MEET THEIR BASIC NEEDS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL ANNUAL INVESTMENT OF $122,746 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $62,281 IN LOCAL MATCH FUNDS.

COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (CCAP) HAS BEEN SERVING GRAYS HARBOR AND PACIFIC COUNTIES FOR OVER 50 YEARS AND HAS DEDICATED ITSELF TO HELP IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THE PEOPLE WITHIN THESE COMMUNITIES. CCAP IS VERY COMMITTED ABOUT THE SENIORS LIVING IN OUR COMMUNITY AND HAVE PROGRAMS THAT TARGET THE 60+ AGE GROUP. THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE; RSVP, SENIOR NUTRITION, IN HOME CARE, PRIVATE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, VOLUNTEER WELLNESS AIDS AND MEALS ON WHEELS. CCAP RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE AND IMPACT IT'S HAD ON THE LIVES OF OUR SENIOR COMMUNITY AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE AN ASSET FOR THEM. AN ESTIMATE OF 300 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN BOTH GRAYS HARBOR AND PACIFIC COUNTIES, ACROSS 35 WORK STATIONS, SPONSORED BY COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM. VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS AS A PART OF THE MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSIST LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, TUTOR ELEMENTARY STUDENTS IN READING AND MATH AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS, VOLUNTEER AT THE COMMUNITY HOSPITALS HELPING WITH BLOOD DRIVE, HOSPITAL GIFT SHOP, SERVE VETERANS THROUGH COMMUNITY BASED ACTIVITIES AND OTHER ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED AS COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROJECT COORDINATOR HAS SUCCESSFULLY DEVELOPED WORKSITE RELATIONSHIPS AND IMPACT BASED WORK PLANS TO ENSURE PARTICIPANT HAVE A VITAL AND MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE. AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES OR OTHER NONPROFITS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN. THE NUMBER OF VETERANS SERVED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE INCREASED THROUGH COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATION. THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $76,411 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,265 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR A TOTAL OF $108,676.

AN ESTIMATED 275 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 53 RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUIRED TO BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS; HOWEVER OUR OUTCOME VOLUNTEER PLACEMENTS WILL BE MUCH LARGER. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
UNITED WAY OF THURSTON COUNTY (UWTC), ON BEHALF OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF LEWIS, MASON, AND THURSTON COUNTIES, SEEKS THREE YEARS OF FUNDING SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. AS THE SPONSOR FOR THE PAST EIGHT YEARS, WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY AND ENTHUSIASTICALLY INTEGRATED RSVP INTO THE MISSION OF OUR WORK AND HAVE STRENGTHENED OUR COMMUNITY BY MOBILIZING PEOPLE AND RESOURCES TO MEET IDENTIFIED NEEDS. THE PROJECT WORK PLANS ARE ANCHORED BY A COLLABORATION OF UNITED WAYS IN LEWIS, MASON, AND THURSTON COUNTIES, WHERE THERE IS A LONG HISTORY OF WORKING TOGETHER. IN THESE CHALLENGING TIMES, WE RECOGNIZE THE RESOURCES OF OLDER VOLUNTEERS IN CONNECTING VOLUNTEER ASSETS TO MEANINGFUL SERVICE. UWTC LINKS VOLUNTEERS TO MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES, WHICH MEETS THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS AND COMMUNITY NEEDS. UNITED WAY WORKS TOWARD INCREASING AN INDIVIDUAL'S ACCESS TO QUALITY EDUCATION, SUSTAINABLE INCOME, AND GOOD HEALTH.  OUR WORK, RESPONDING TO COMMUNITY NEEDS, IS DUAL: PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION. OUR VOLUNTEER AND FUNDING RESOURCES SEEK TO PREVENT INDIVIDUALS FROM BECOMING AT-RISK AND INTERVENES WHEN INDIVIDUAL'S LIVES BECOME UNSTABLE AND NEED PUBLIC SUPPORT. AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ON BEHALF OF THE RSVP OF LEWIS, MASON, AND THURSTON COUNTIES. OF THIS NUMBER, 165 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE READING BUDDY VOLUNTEERS; WORKING WITH CHILDREN THAT ARE STRUGGLING TO READ AT GRADE LEVEL. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT TO SEE 12,000 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY HEALTHY FOOD AND 400 STUDENTS IMPROVE IN THEIR READING ABILITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $78,267WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,116 THROUGH VARIOUS SUPPORTERS, INCLUDING COMMUNITY DONORS, WA STATE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE, AND THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING OF LEWIS, MASON, AND THURSTON COUNTIES.

THEY WILL TUTOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN READING, REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS, HELP OLDER ADULTS REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES, PROVIDE INFORMATION AND TRANSPORTATION TO VETERANS, PROVIDE INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE TO SENIORS AND DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION TO HOSPITALS AND MUSEUM PATRONS THROUGH A NETWORK OF NATIONAL SERVICE PROGRAMS, THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. SIX COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) COVERS THE SIX COUNTY REGION WHICH INCLUDES (JUAB, SANPETE, SEVIER, WAYNE, PIUTE, AND MILLARD) COUNTIES AND WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 240 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO MAKE AN IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE AND 190 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED UNDUPLICATED OPPORTUNITIES. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, VETERANS AND FAMILIES IN NEED, PROVIDING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES TO THOSE WHO ARE STRUGGLING TO MAKE A LIVING, FRAIL ELDERLY, PERFORM OUTREACH IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE UNPREPARED FOR TIMES OF DISASTERS, EDUCATE AND INSPIRE YOUTH, WOMEN AND CHILDREN INVOLVED IN DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SITUATIONS, AND DISABLED VETERANS WHO LIVE ON SMALL FIXED INCOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND THE GOALS FOR THIS FOCUS AREA WILL BE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH CURCCC (CENTRAL UTAH REGIONAL CITIZEN CORPS COUNCIL), SHERIFF'S OFFICES, AND LEPCS. THROUGHOUT A THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE OVER 20 DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TRAININGS, AT LEAST 300 PEOPLE WILL BE TRAINED IN EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS SKILLS, OVER 1,000 PAMPHLETS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED, AND AT LEAST 10 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TRAINED WELL ENOUGH TO TAKE ON LEADERSHIP ROLES. THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS THROUGH A NETWORK OF 55 STATIONS. ADDITIONAL SITES WILL INCLUDE OTHER STATIONS SUCH AS: FOOD BANKS, HOME HEALTH AGENCIES, DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS, AMERICAN LEGION, SENIOR CENTERS, SCHOOLS, NEW HORIZONS CRISIS CENTER, AND VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. THE CNCS DOLLARS INCLUDE $95,888 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,153 THROUGH LOCAL SUPPORT.

THE RETIRED SERVICE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) WHICH HAS SERVED THE REGION FOR MANY YEARS, WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED EIGHTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL SERVE IN THE THREE COUNTIES. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HEALTHY FUTURES TO INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING AS THEY AGE. THIS VOLUNTEERISM WILL BE THROUGH A NETWORK OF STATIONS. THESE STATIONS WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO; SENIOR CENTERS, LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES AND LOCAL SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. BY THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED ONGOING COMPANIONSHIP TO OVER TWENTY HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, EXTENDING THE TIME THAT THOSE SENIORS CAN REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES. IN ADDITION, EDUCATION WILL ALSO BE ANOTHER FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT WITH THE INTENT TO PROVIDE EXTRA NEEDED SUPPORT IN RURAL CLASSROOMS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $20,358 OF IN-KIND, CASH, AND STATE SUPPORT.

THE COUNTY OF MAUI'S RSVP IS OPERATED AND MANAGED BY KAUNOA SENIOR SERVICES, ONE OF 7 DIVISIONS IN
THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND HUMAN CONCERNS. THE MISSION OF KAUNOA IS, "TO CONTINUOUSLY CREATE
THOSE SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCES AND OPPORTUNITIES WHICH WILL MAKE THE RETIREMENT YEARS FEEL
LIKE THE BEST YEARS." KAUNOA REACHES OUT AND TOUCHES OVER 7,000 OLDER ADULTS EACH YEAR AND OFFERS A
NUMBER OF SERVICES INCLUDING RSVP, CONGREGATE NUTRITION, ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION, MEALS ON WHEELS
AND LEISURE/WELLNESS. THESE SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES ALLOW OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES
FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE; TO AVOID UNWANTED OR UNNECESSARY INSTITUTIONALIZATION; AND TO AGE IN PLACE WITH
DIGNITY AND RESPECT.

INDIVIDUALS, SURVEYED THROUGH THE HOME DELIVERED MEALS, TRANSPORTATION AND CONGREGATE MEALS
PROGRAMS, WILL INDICATE HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT; THE DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX PREPARATION FEES SAVED

THAT THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS GENERATED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS' SERVICE WILL BE AT LEAST

COUNTY FUNDS.

RSVP WILL UTILIZE A VARIETY OF METHODS TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ITS SERVICE ACTIVITIES BY
INCLUDING SURVEYS, QUARTERLY AND ANNUAL REPORTS, STATION REPORTS AND OTHER OUTCOME MEASUREMENT
TOOLS DESIGNED DURING PROGRAMMATIC PLANNING. OUTCOMES INCLUDE NUTRITIOUS FOOD SECURITY, SECURED

HEALTH, STRENGTH AND BALANCE, AMONG MANY OTHERS.

AN ESTIMATED 440 MONTEREY BAY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.
OF THIS NUMBER, 265 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN EDUCATING SENIORS ABOUT FRAUD AND SCAM PREVENTION.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT TO HAVE THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AS FOLLOWS: (1) 200 SENIORS AND INDIVIDUAL WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVED 4 TO 6 RIDES PER MONTH TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND SHOPPING TRIPS TO OBTAIN FOOD (2) 500 SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE FOUR HEALTHY MEALS A WEEK (3) 200 LOW-INCOME SENIORS WILL RECEIVE HOME SAFETY AND FALL PREVENTION CHECKS WHICH WILL LEAD TO INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT. (4) 100 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMING THAT WILL REDUCE FEARS OF FALLING AND INCREASE ACTIVITY LEVELS AMONG COMMUNITY-DWELLING OLDER ADULTS. (5) 30 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT INTERVENTIONS AND PROMOTE EDUCATION AND PREVENTION OF ELDER ABUSE THAT WILL INCREASE AWARENESS AND IMPROVE THE OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF 75 SENIORS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $73,706 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37,147 WHICH WILL COME FROM LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES, INCLUDING BUSINESS PARTNERS, INDIVIDUAL DONORS AND PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS.

FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (FSA) OF SANTA BARBARA COUNTY IN CALIFORNIA PROPOSES THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF BOTH CHILDREN/YOUTH (AGES 6-17) AND SENIORS (AGE 55+) IN SOUTH SANTA BARBARA COUNTY (SSBC). OUR PROJECT INCORPORATES RSVP AS PART OF TWO, EXISTING MENTORING PROGRAMS THAT SERVE THE CITIES OF GOLETA, SANTA BARBARA, AND CARPINTERIA, AS WELL AS THE UNINCORPORATED AREAS OF MONTECITO AND SUMMERLAND: FSA?S SUCCESSFUL BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS (BBBS) MENTORING PROGRAM HAS BEEN OPERATING FOR OVER 30 YEARS AND IS A CURRENT RSVP STATION. FSA WILL ALSO PARTNER WITH ANOTHER LOCAL ORGANIZATION, THE COUNCIL ON ALCOHOLISM AND DRUG ABUSE (CADA), TO EXPAND RSVP IN SSBC THROUGH THEIR SCHOOL BASED MENTORING PROGRAM (SBMP). WE ANTICIPATE THAT 264 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ONE OF OUR TWO OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD, WITH 88 PLACED BY THE END OF YEAR ONE.  RSVP VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES THROUGH OUR PROJECT INCLUDE: WORKING AS A MENTOR FOR CHILDREN/YOUTH IN THE BBBS PROGRAM OR ACTING AS A SBMP MENTOR FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 3-12. BBBS AND SBMP MENTORS WILL ENGAGE IN A VARIETY OF EDUCATIONAL AND ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES FOR MENTEES, INCLUDING: HOMEWORK ASSISTANCE, TUTORING, SCIENCE PROJECTS, TRIPS INTO NATURAL SETTINGS (E.G., BEACHES, FORESTS, AND FARMS), ART ACTIVITIES, AND ACTIVITIES AT THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB. ACTIVITIES WILL VARY DEPENDING ON THE NEEDS AND INTERESTS OF THE MENTEE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CNCS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT-FUNDED PERIOD, WE ANTICIPATE ACHIEVING THE FOLLOWING K-12 RSVP SUCCESS OUTCOME: ED27C, 70% OF STUDENTS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE RSVP MENTORING WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL SKILLS, AS DEMONSTRATED ON ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS ON THE (FSA) BBBS YOUTH OUTCOME SURVEY OR (CADA) HEMINGWAY SURVEY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $87,500 IN YEAR ONE WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $37,660 IN LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS. THE RELATIONSHIP FORMED BETWEEN THE MENTEE AND THE RSVP VOLUNTEER MENTOR WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF BOTH MENTOR AND MENTEE PARTICIPANTS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN RURAL NEVADA COUNTY, CA. OUT OF THESE VOLUNTEERS, 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DISASTER PREPARATION FOR OLDER ADULTS AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR REDUCING SOCIAL ISOLATION AMONG ISOLATED SENIORS IN NEVADA COUNTY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE: DISASTER SERVICES AND AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, FOCUS AREA HEALTHY FUTURE WILL MEET THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE BY SERVING INDIVIDUALS WITH COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT TO INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVE CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING H4A, H9A, AND H12.  IN ADDITION, THE FOCUS AREA OF DISASTER SERVICES WILL MEET OBJECTIVE D5 OF INCREASING THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS REPORTING DISASTER READINESS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY MATCHING CONTRIBUTIONS OF $41,999 IN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL CASH CONTRIBUTION. 
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS TWO UNMET NEEDS FOR NEVADA COUNTY OLDER ADULTS:  DISASTER SERVICES AND AGING IN PLACE. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO ADDRESS THESE NEEDS BY (1) PROVIDING DISASTER PREPARATION EDUCATION ; (2) PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION AMONG HOMEBOUND VULNERABLE SENIORS AND 3) INCREASE FOOD SECURITY. 
 THROUGH THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, WE PLAN TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE OUR COMMUNITY RESILIENCY THROUGH DISASTER PREPARATION.  IN ADDITION, SENIORS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND, ISOLATED, LOW INCOME AND WITHOUT ADEQUATE RESOURCES WILL SIGNIFICANTLY BENEFIT OF VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO EASE LONELINESS AND SOCIAL ISOLATION TO CONTINUE TO AGE IN PLACE IN THE COMMUNITY.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM 600 HOME BOUND SENIORS WILL HAVE ACCESSED PREVENTIVE/MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER CRITICAL SERVICES WITH TRANSPORTATION PROVIDED BY 125 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OF THESE, 83% OF SENIORS WILL INDICATE "INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT." 5 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION TRAINING AND 100 SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE EDUCATION ON ELDER ABUSE. 82.5% OF SENIORS RECEIVING ELDER ABUSE EDUCATION WILL INDICATE "INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT" IN ADDITION TO THESE OUTCOME ACTIVITIES, 30 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO 75 HOME-BOUND SENIORS; 5 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST SENIOR VETERANS WITH TRANSPORTATION; 500 SENIORS OR DISABLED WASHINGTON COUNTY RESIDENTS WITH A CHRONIC DISEASE, ILLNESS, INJURY OR AMBULATORY DIFFICULTY THAT REQUIRES DURABLE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT/REFERRALS TO RESOURCES TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT WILL BE SERVICED BY 20 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS. CNCS'S FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500, WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH A 30% LOCAL MATCH OF $35,357 FOR A TOTAL INVESTMENT OF $117,857.

AN ESTIMATED 130 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE INTERFAITH CAREGIVERS OF OZAUKEE COUNTY (ICO) RSVP AGING IN PLACE PROGRAM.  ICO WILL SERVE AS THE RSVP SPONSOR AND SOLE VOLUNTEER STATION WITH TRAINING AND SCHEDULING OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONDUCTED BY ICO STAFF AND COORDINATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE PROGRAM BY THE RSVP PROGRAM DIRECTOR. ALL RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS SEVERAL COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, ACCESS TO MEDICAL MOBILITY EQUIPMENT, REDUCTION OF FOOD INSECURITY, REDUCTION IN SOCIAL ISOLATION, INCREASE OF COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE ON SENIOR ISSUES AND INCREASE IN COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES THAT ADDRESS SENIOR ISSUES.  SPECIFIC VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTING SENIORS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, FOOD PANTRIES AND GROCERY STORES; VISITING SENIORS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND COMBAT ISOLATION; PROVIDING EDUCATION AND GUIDANCE TO SENIORS, VOLUNTEERS AND THE COMMUNITY ON AN ARRAY OF ISSUES PERTINENT TO SENIOR SAFETY, THE PREVENTION OF ELDER ABUSE AND THE REDUCTION OF SENIOR ISOLATION; PROVIDING SENIORS AND THE COMMUNITY WITH ACCESS TO MEDICAL MOBILITY EQUIPMENT FOR A SMALL, REFUNDABLE FEE; COORDINATING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROJECTS THAT WILL HELP SENIORS FEEL SUPPORTED AND CONNECTED TO THE COMMUNITY; AND PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES TO CAREGIVERS OF SENIORS.   THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,500 SENIORS, CAREGIVERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR KNOWLEDGE OF SENIOR ISSUES AS A RESULT OF THE RSVP SERVICES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A $35,356 MATCH.

THE FRIENDS OF COULEE REGION RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, INC. (COULEE REGION RSVP) WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1994, AS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION FULFILLING OUR MISSION OF PROVIDING INDIVIDUALS AGES 55 AND BETTER WITH MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES. AN ESTIMATED 525 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH OUR PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY 125 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE FOLLOWING AREAS WILL BE OUR FOCUS WILL INCLUDE: COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, OUTREACH, TUTORING AND OTHER COMMUNITY NEED. COULEE REGION RSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AND THE KEY OBJECTIVE IS AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, WE ANTICIPATE THAT OUTCOMES WILL MEET OR EXCEED ALL WORK PLAN GOALS, MEETING THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY BY ENHANCING THE MISSION, PERFORMANCE, AND SUCCESS OF OVER 80 OF OUR CURRENT PARTNERED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $83,118 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $255,000.00 IN ADDITIONAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE ADRC OF ONEIDA COUNTY AND VARIOUS RSVP STATIONS.  OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR OPPORTUNITY WI-2X FOR ONEIDA COUNTY, WISCONSIN.  ONEIDA COUNTY IS HOME TO APPROXIMATELY 35,000 RESIDENTS, OF WHOM OVER 30% ARE AGE 60 OR OLDER.  ONEIDA COUNTY POPULATION IS DISTRIBUTED WIDELY OVER A NUMBER OF MUNICIPALITIES, THE LARGEST BEING RHINELANDER, WI FOLLOWED BY THE TOWNS OF MINOCQUA AND WOODRUFF.  SMALLER LOCALITIES LIKE SUGAR CAMP, THREE LAKES, HAZELHURST, AND LAKE TOMAHAWK HAVE POPULATIONS WHICH ARE WIDELY SPREAD.  ONEIDA COUNTY IS A RURAL COUNTY.

PSA 3 AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA3) TAKES PRIDE IN BEING A STATE AND FEDERALLY FUNDED ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-SPAN RESOURCES THAT INSPIRE, EDUCATE, AND EMPOWER OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS.  AAA3 WILL CONTINUE TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR AN ESTIMATED 190 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS UNDER THE CONTINUATION OF THE RSVP PROGRAM OVER THE NEXT 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD, IF AWARDED. THE PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE ON HEALTHY FUTURES, IN CONTINUING TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO CARE AND THE ABILITY FOR INDIVIDUALS TO BE ABLE TO AGE IN PLACE IN A HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED SETTING OF THEIR CHOICE. BOX BUTTE COUNTY RSVP IS WELL ESTABLISHED WITH A FORTY-THREE YEAR HISTORY OF PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT MEET IMPORTANT COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE RSVP OFFICE IS LOCATED IN ALLIANCE, NE AND SERVES THE CITY OF ALLIANCE AND VILLAGE OF HEMINGFORD. AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVES INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, COACHING, FOOD COLLECTION AND TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. FOOD INSECURITY IS HIGH FOR OUR MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. IN ADDITION, MANY OF OUR OLDER ADULTS NEED SOCIAL CONNECTION AS WELL AS HELP WITH THE BASICS OF DAILY LIVING. AT THE END OF THE REPORTING PERFORMANCE PERIOD, AT LEAST 40 HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO RECEIVING DELIVERED FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER HELP, 300 INDIVIDUALS WILL EXPRESS INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, AND 4 PEOPLE WILL BE PLACED IN STABLE HOUSING.  THIS IS JUST A SAMPLE OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH AN ORGANIZED AND WELL MANAGED NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS AND VOLUNTEER STATIONS. VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA AND INCLUDE SCHOOLS, NURSING HOME FACILITIES, ART CENTERS, MUSEUMS, LIBRARIES, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND MANY MORE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $27,564 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES EACH YEAR.

"LONELINESS IS THE NEW SMOKING," ACCORDING TO DR. VIVEK H. MURTHY, FORMER SURGEON GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES, "LONELINESS AND WEAK SOCIAL CONNECTIONS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH A REDUCTION IN LIFESPAN SIMILAR TO THAT CAUSED BY SMOKING 15 CIGARETTES A DAY AND EVEN GREATER THAN THAT ASSOCIATED WITH OBESITY." (A)

RURAL NW MN COMES WITH A UNIQUE SET OF CIRCUMSTANCES THAT OFTEN LIMITS RESIDENTS' ACCESS TO REMAINING HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT.  IN ALL 7 COUNTIES WITHIN THE RED RIVER VALLEY THE PERCENTAGE OF 65 AND OLDER PERSONS RANGES FROM 14.9% TO 22.9%; HIGHER THAN THE STATE AVERAGE.  WITH 33% LESS NURSING HOME PLACEMENTS AMONG THOSE 85 AND OLDER IN THE RRV, GREATER NUMBERS OF SENIORS ARE LIVING AT HOME WITH HEALTH NEEDS.  RECENTLY RELEASED STUDY RESULTS, LED BY ASSISTANT PROFESSOR CARRIE HENNING-SMITH, AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MN, REVEALED THAT "RURAL RESIDENTS ARE STILL AT A MUCH HIGHER RISK OF BEING LONELY." (B)  WITH TYPICAL AGING DIFFICULTIES, ISOLATING LIVING SITUATIONS AND LIMITED PROXIMITY TO SERVICES, SENIORS IN THE RED RIVER VALLEY NEED PROGRAMS WHICH CREATE CHANGE AND IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR SITUATION, PARTICULARLY IN THE AREA OF DECREASING LONELINESS, ENHANCING SOCIAL CONNECTIONS AND INCREASED INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES.  AS A RESULT, RSVP OF THE RRV IDENTIFIES OUR PRIMARY IMPACT AREA AS HEALTHY FUTURES.

SINCE 1974, THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF THE RED RIVER VALLEY (RRV) HAS BEEN IMPACTING THE LIVES OF NW MINNESOTA AGING ADULTS AND THOSE THEY HELP.  OUR MISSION ALIGNS WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) PRIORITIES, PROMPTING MEANINGFUL AND SIGNIFICANT CHANGE WHERE LIVES ARE IMPROVED AND COMMUNITIES ARE ENRICHED.   OUR SPONSORING AGENCY FOR 44 YEARS, THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA CROOKSTON, HAS SOUND INFLUENCE WITHIN THE REGION AND A PROVEN RECORD OF ENSURING EFFECTIVE FISCAL, PROGRAM AND GRANT MANAGEMENT.   

RSVP OFFERINGS WILL FOCUS ON INCREASING INDEPENDENCE, SAFETY AND HEALTHIER LIVING FOR SENIORS, ACCESS TO CARE FOR OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE AFFECTED BY THE OPIOID CRISIS, PLUS INTERGENERATIONAL OFFERINGS SUPPORTING LITERACY AMONG OUR YOUNG LEARNERS. RSVP OF THE RRV WILL ENGAGE APPROXIMATELY 600 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN IMPACTFUL VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES, WITH 242 OF THEM IN OUTCOME BASED, HEALTHY FUTURES WORKPLANS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RETURNED SURVEYS WILL INDICATE A CHANGE IN PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT/REDUCED ISOLATION, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, ABILITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY LONGER AND OVERALL IMPROVED WELL-BEING. 

THE CNCS BASE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $65,153 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL RESOURCES OF $30,262 (COUNTY FUNDING, LOCAL UNITED WAY, UMC), FUNDING FROM THE MINNESOTA BOARD OF AGING GRANT AT $26,342, AND CONTRACTUAL PAY FROM THE METRO AAA FOR JUNIPER PROGRAM, $7,275.  RSVP IS DEDICATED TO IMPLEMENTING NEW INITIATIVES, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, AND COLLABORATING WITH OTHER SENIOR SERVICES TO TRANSFORM LIVES AND COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE RRV.

THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD, MINNESOTA IS THE CURRENT SPONSOR OF THE GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD IS A RAPIDLY GROWING CORE CITY WITHIN CENTRAL MINNESOTA, LOCATED JUST 65 MILES NORTHWEST OF MINNEAPOLIS-ST. PAUL. THE THREE COUNTIES OF BENTON SHERBURNE AND STEANS AND FIVE INDIVIDUAL CITIES MAKE UP THE ST. CLOUD METROPOLITAN SERVICE AREA (MSA): ST. CLOUD, SARTELL, SAUK RAPIDS, WAITE PARK, AND ST. JOSEPH. THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY COST EFFECTIVE PUBLIC SERVICES. THE GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THIS MISSION BY SERVING AN ESTIMATED 1,000 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS BY CONNECTING THEM WITH TARGETED COMMUNITY NEEDS SUCH AS FOOD SECURITY, K-12 SUCCESS, AGING IN PLACE AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER.   THESE AREAS COMPRISE THE GREATEST NEED OF OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY. RSVP EXPECTS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF PEOPLE OF ALL AGES BY ADDRESSING PRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH HUMAN SERVICE, GOVERNMENT AND LICENSED HEALTH CARE AGENCIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO HAVE MET ALL OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES PROJECTED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES - FOOD SECURITY OUTCOME THROUGH THE SERVICE OF 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING 19,000 HOURS EACH YEAR ASSISTING 5,000 SENIORS AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS BY INCREASING THEIR FOOD SECURITY ON AN ON-GOING BASIS. RSVP WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO TRACK SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES THROUGH SURVEYS AND STATISTICS GATHERED FROM THE AGENCIES BENEFITTING FROM THE SERVICES OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $121,312 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $331,859 IN FUNDING FROM LOCAL FUNDERS: THE MINNESOTA BOARD ON AGING; CITIES OF ST. CLOUD, SAUK RAPIDS, ST. JOSEPH, WAITE PARK; COUNTIES OF BENTON AND SHERBURNE; AND UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL MINNESOTA. LOCATED IN ST. CLOUD, MINNESOTA, THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD-GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SERVES CENTRAL MINNESOTA COMMUNITIES LOCATED IN BENTON, SHERBURNE AND STEARNS COUNTIES.

AN ESTIMATED 1,365 ARROWHEAD RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 655 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THREE OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON AGING IN PLACE-COMPANIONSHIP. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, FRIENDLY VISITING, ACCOMPANIED SOCIAL ACTIVITIES, AND NON-MEDICAL HOUSEHOLD ASSISTANCE, I.E. LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, LAUNDRY, DISHES, MAKING PHONE CALLS, SIMPLE INDOOR AND OUTDOOR CHORES, MINOR HOME REPAIR/RENOVATIONS, ETC. THEY WILL PERFORM SERVICES AT THE PRIVATE HOMES/APARTMENTS OF FRAIL, DISABLED AND/OR ISOLATED RESIDENTS AGE 65+ IN NE MN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1200 INDIVIDUALS IN NE MN WILL HAVE BEEN ASSISTED IN THEIR HOMES; AND 120 OF THAT TOTAL WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $141,423 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 61,610.

THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) BEGAN AS A NATIONAL PROGRAM IN 1971.  ANOKA COUNTY HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1973, VALUING CITIZEN PARTICIPATION IN RESPONDING TO LOCAL NEEDS AND PARTNERING FOR SOLUTIONS.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP STARTED WITH 53 VOLUNTEERS AND CURRENTLY HAS OVER 500+ ENROLLED VOLUNTEERS.  IN THESE CHALLENGING TIMES, ANOKA COUNTY RECOGNIZES THE RESOURCES OF OLDER VOLUNTEERS AND AS A SPONSOR CONTINUES TO SUPPORT RSVP IN CONNECTING VOLUNTEER ASSETS TO MEANINGFUL SERVICE.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP [AC RSVP] LINKS VOLUNTEERS WITH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES WHICH MEET THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS AND COMMUNITY NEEDS. 

AN ESTIMATED 290 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE BENEFICIARIES IN A WIDE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDE RESPITE/COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND VETERANS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSIST 4 LOCAL FOOD SHELVES, PROVIDE FREE TAX ASSISTANCE, AND PROVIDE HOUSING ASSISTANCE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE AND INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES; INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD SHELVES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY; AND INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING HOUSING SERVICES WILL TRANSITION INTO HOUSING.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ANOKA COUNTY (LOCAL) IN THE AMOUNT OF $113,491.00 (INCLUDING EXCESS FUNDS) AND THE MINNESOTA BOARD ON AGING (STATE) IN THE AMOUNT OF $17,143.00 FOR A TOTAL OF $130,634.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP HAS DEMONSTRATED SUCCESS IN THE PREVIOUS GRANT CYCLE WITH 149+ UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING WITHIN PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND CAPACITY BUILDING AREAS EXCEEDING THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT OF 48 VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOMES-BASED WORK PLANS.

AN ESTIMATED 2,044 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY 619 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS/WORK PLANS. VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EDUCATION/TRAINING, COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT, INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE, AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR VETERANS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT, THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE ANTICIPATED: 
*OLDER ADULTS, HOME-BOUND ADULTS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE THROUGH OUR EDUCATION & TRAINING SERVICES 
*OLDER ADULTS, HOME-BOUND ADULTS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORTS OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH OUR COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES 
*INCREASED FOOD SECURITY THROUGH OUR NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT SERVICES 
*A HIGH DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS WILL BE GENERATED AS A RESULT OF ASSISTING VITA OR TAX TUTORING ACTIVITIES PROVIDED BY CNCS-SUPPORTED VOLUNTEERS 
*VETERANS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE DUE TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDED BY CNCS-SUPPORTED VOLUNTEERS 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,242 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $329,660 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH COME FROM LOCAL, STATE AND OTHER FUNDS, AND INCLUDES THE REQUIRED MATCH OF $35,247. THE SELF-SPONSORED, LEGAL APPLICANT IS A.C.E. OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA. OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE STRONG, INVOLVED COMMUNITIES FOCUSING ON VOLUNTEERISM AND ACTIVE LIVING PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS 55 & ABOVE, AND CARE PARTNERS OF ALL AGES. OUR ORGANIZATION SERVES 7 COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA, AND IT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (JOINT POWERS BOARD) MEETS MONTHLY AND PROVIDES OPERATIONAL OVERSIGHT AS WELL AS FINANCIAL SUPPORT (PER CAPITA, FACILITIES AND SPACE). OUR FINANCIAL AND DATABASE SUPPORT SERVICES ARE COMPLETED BY SOUTHWEST REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION STAFF, PER AN ANNUAL CONTRACT. A.C.E. OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA EMPLOYS AN EXECUTIVE/PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND 7 PROGRAM COORDINATORS. IN 2018, A.C.E. PROGRAM COORDINATORS MANAGED 365 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THAT LOGGED 267,623 HOURS OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE BY 2,192 ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THE CUMULATIVE COST PER HOUR OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR 2018 WAS ONLY $1.54/HOUR.

RSVP'S SPONSOR IS CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF WASHTENAW COUNTY (CSSW) WHOSE MISSION AND VALUES INFORM THE RSVP PROGRAM AND ARE EXPRESSED THROUGH STEWARDSHIP--TO HELP PEOPLE LIVE THEIR LIVES INDEPENDENTLY AND MEANINGFULLY. THE RSVP PROGRAM GOAL IS TO HAVE 256 VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 96 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS, INCLUDING PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION, FRIENDLY VISITING VETERANS/SENIORS AND TUTORING ENGLISH TO NON-ENGLISH IMMIGRANTS. SERVICE WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM TO PREVENT ELDER ABUSE AND PROVIDE OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION EDUCATION THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. WITHIN CSSW, RESPITE, ADULT DAY AND HOME REPAIR PROGRAMS SERVE 100+ SENIORS AND 500+ INDIVIDUALS RECEIVE FOOD FROM THE FOOD PANTRY. THE WORK OF OUR VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF MORE THAN 45,000 INDIVIDUALS IN WASHTENAW COUNTY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL MEET THESE OBJECTIVES:
*	(H14) NUMBER OF CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT
*	(H9A) NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED INDEPENDENT LIVING CAPACITY
*	(H12) NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY BY RECEIVING MEALS
*	(O21) NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH IMPROVED JOB READINESS THROUGH MENTORING YOUNG ADULTS, PROVING BASIC LITERACY TUTORING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL) TUTORING 
*	(H9AV) NUMBER OF VETERANS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $95,825 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,965 FROM THE STATE AND $56,212 FROM OTHER LOCAL FUNDERS.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF KNOX AND GREENE COUNTIES IS A PROGRAM THAT VINCENNES UNIVERSITY'S GENERATIONS (GENERATIONS), AREA 13 AGENCY ON AGING & DISABILITY WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE TO SPONSOR AS PART OF THE COMPETITION FUNDING THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE.  GENERATIONS IS PART OF VINCENNES UNIVERSITY'S COMMUNITY SERVICES DIVISION AND HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN THESE TWO COUNTIES FOR OVER 45 YEARS.
IN ADDITION, GENERATIONS HAS NEARLY 40 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE MANAGING VOLUNTEER PROJECTS INVOLVING OLDER ADULTS AS EITHER THE VOLUNTEER OR THE RECIPIENT OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITY.  PAST ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FOCUSING ON HEALTHY AGING, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, EDUCATION, REDUCING ISOLATION OF OLDER ADULTS, INCREASING INTER-GENERATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORTING LOCAL VETERAN PROGRAMS.  
RSVP OF KNOX AND GREENE COUNTIES WILL HAVE 100 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN ASSIGNMENTS WITH OUTCOMES IDENTIFIED IN HEALTHY FUTURES (INCLUDING LEADING EVIDENCED-BASED PROGRAMS), ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY OR TO MEET LOCAL NEEDS IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY.
RSVP HAS TRAINED STAFF TO TRAIN VOLUNTEERS IN MATTER OF BALANCE FALL PREVENTION CLASSES AND CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT.   VOLUNTEERS TRAINED BY STAFF WILL FACILITATE AT LEAST 4 CLASSES ANNUALLY WITH 60 PARTICIPANTS COMPLETING ONE OF THESE EVIDENCED-BASED CLASSES.
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PREPARE TAXES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND OLDER INDIVIDUALS WHICH WILL SAVE THEM MONEY  (OVER $50,000 SAVINGS ANNUALLY) AND ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO BUY FOOD, MEDICINE AND COVER OTHER DAILY LIVING EXPENSES.
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ATTEND AND HELP HOST COMMUNITY EVENTS BY DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION ON OPIOID ADDICTION AND APPROPRIATE DRUG DISPOSAL, STATE HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM, SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL AND ELDER ABUSE, CHRONIC DISEASE CARE, CAREGIVER RESOURCES AND OTHER HEALTH, DISABILITY AND INSURANCE RELATED TOPICS.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO HELP RAISE AWARENESS OF DISABILITIES THROUGH A WORKSHOP DESIGNED TO EDUCATE FIFTH GRADERS.  OVER 500 INDIVIDUALS WILL ATTEND THESE EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR AND 50 WILL INDICATE THEY HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE FROM ATTENDING THESE EVENTS.  
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SUPPORT FOSTER CHILDREN, CANCER VICTIMS, OLDER HOMEBOUND ADULTS, COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER NONPROFITS BY MAKING AND PROVIDING NEEDED SUPPLIES SUCH AS CHEMO PORT AND SEAT BELT COVERS, CHEMO CAPS, LAP PADS, PET PADS, BLANKETS, WHEEL CHAIR CADDIES, CLOTHING COVERS, BASIC NECESSITIES, ETC.  TWENTY OLDER ADULTS WILL INDICATE THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES DUE TO THE RSVP VOLUNTEER.
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO HEAD START, NOT-FOR-PROFIT PRESCHOOLS AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS HELPING CHILDREN PREPARE FOR KINDERGARTEN THROUGH VISION SCREENING, BASIC INSTRUCTION AND SOCIALIZATION ACTIVITIES.  
FIFTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, PACK BACKPACKS OF EMERGENCY FOOD FOR ELEMENTARY AGE STUDENTS IN NEED, HELP DISTRIBUTE FOOD VOUCHERS AND PROVIDE OTHER FOOD PANTRY SUPPLY SUPPORT.  AT LEAST 90 ADULTS WILL INDICATE THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS BY HELPING THE RED CROSS AT BLOOD DRIVES, MILITARY FUNERALS, SUPPORTING THE PLANTING OF TREES AND CONSERVATION, AND HELPING IN FAITH BASED ORGANIZATIONS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,357 MATCH IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TO SUSTAIN THIS PROGRAM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: DOVE, INC. IS A PRIVATE NONPROFIT, 501(C)(3), MULTI-SERVICE AGENCY HEADQUARTERED IN DECATUR, ILLINOIS. DOVE WAS CREATED AS AN EFFORT TO ADDRESS THE UNMET HUMAN NEEDS AND SOCIAL INJUSTICES EXPERIENCED THROUGHOUT OUR COMMUNITY AND CONTINUES TO DO SO TODAY. DOVE HAS SPONSORED THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN MACON AND DEWITT COUNTIES FOR 43 YEARS. IN OUR EFFORTS TO CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THIS LONG-STANDING AND SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM, WE ARE PROPOSING TO HAVE 375 VOLUNTEERS AND REQUESTING $70,268.00 IN FEDERAL FUNDING. THE REQUESTED FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $70,268.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A PROPOSED $34,541.00 IN MATCHING STATE FUNDS SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,386.00 IN AGENCY RECEIVED DONATIONS TO MEET THE 30% REQUIRED MATCH AND LOCAL DONATIONS TO SUPPORT THE TOTAL BUDGET OF  $146,195.00  AFTER SUCCESSFULLY NAVIGATING THE STATE OF ILLINOIS BUDGET CRISIS BEGINNING IN FY 16 DOVE AND THE RSVP HAVE WORKED TO STRENGTHEN OUR FOCUS ON OUR HEALTHY FUTURE GOALS. WE HAVE DONE SO BY GRADUATING STATIONS AND SOME VOLUNTEERS TO MEET THOSE GOALS AND BETTER SERVE THE COMMUNITY NEEDS. VOLUNTEERS HAVE REMAINED ACTIVE IN THE COMMUNITY SERVING THOSE WHO ARE MOST AT RISK, BUT VOLUNTEERS HAVE BECOME MORE SELECTIVE IN THE STATIONS AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT THEY FEEL DELIVER THE GREATEST IMPACT. STATION DYNAMICS CHANGED GREATLY AFTER THE STATE OF ILLINOIS BUDGET CRISIS WHICH FORCED MANY STATIONS TO PRIORITIZE THE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES BY ELIMINATING ACTIVITIES THAT WERE NOT COST EFFECTIVE OR HELD NO MEASURABLE IMPACT.  THESE CHANGES HAVE HELPED TIGHTEN THEIR BUDGET BELTS WHILE OFFERING VOLUNTEERS MORE IMPACTFUL OPPORTUNITIES. THIS HAS REDUCED OUR VOLUNTEER FORCE BY 35 VOLUNTEERS BUT HAS INCREASED MEASURABLE OUTCOMES IN A MORE TARGETED WAY.  BY OBTAINING FINANCIAL FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT, WE WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO WORK HARD IN OUR EFFORTS TO COLLABORATE WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, VOLUNTEER STATIONS, ADVISORY COUNCIL, VOLUNTEERS, AND STAFF TO ADDRESS OUR AREAS MOST PRESSING NEEDS.

AN ESTIMATED 400 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE YWCA RSVP OF MCLEAN COUNTY PROJECT. SOME OF THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION AND ASSISTANCE FOR CHILDREN AGE 3-5 YEARS OLD TO INCREASE SCHOOL READINESS; CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION, ASSISTANCE, AND TUTORING FOR CHILDREN AGE 5-12 TO IMPROVE SCHOOL SUCCESS; AND PROVIDE FOOD TO LOW INCOME STUDENTS. SOME OF THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES TO BE DONE THROUGH OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES INCLUDE: FOOD BANK ASSISTANCE AT FIVE (5) LOCAL FOOD BANKS WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL COLLECT, PACKAGE, AND DISTRIBUTE FOOD; VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH ASSISTING ACTIVE MILITARY MEMBERS AND VETERANS IN RECEIVING FOOD PACKAGES AND INFORMATION ON SERVICES; AND A TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE NON-EMERGENCY TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS TO ASSIST THEM IN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH AN EMPHASIS ON BOTH SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 TUTORING AND SCHOOL SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF YWCA RSVP OF MCLEAN COUNTY VOLUNTEERS, 150 THREE - FIVE YEAR OLDS WILL INCREASE THEIR SCHOOL READINESS, 150 SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN WILL PARTICIPATE AND SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR SUCCESS IN SCHOOL. IN ADDITION, THE AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES/OBESITY & FOOD WILL HAVE AN OUTCOME OF 200 INDIVIDUALS REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $65,633 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A 30% MATCH OF $28,137 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 270 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES. OF THIS NUMBER, 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PRIORITY OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DELIVERING FOOD AND MEALS TO SENIOR ADULTS, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO HOME BOUND SENIOR ADULTS AND VETERANS, EDUCATION ON OBESITY AND FOOD, TUTORING AND MENTORING OF CHILDREN IN SCHOOLS AND AFTER-SCHOOL SETTINGS, TAX PREPARATION FOR SENIOR ADULTS, EDUCATION ON OPIOID AND DRUG ADDITION, MEALS FOR CHILDREN ON WEEKENDS, BICYCLE REPAIR, AND MANY OTHER PRIORITY AND COMMUNITY ISSUES WILL BE ADDRESSED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE WILL BENEFIT 90 INDIVIDUALS. HANDSON SUBURBAN CHICAGO (HOSC) HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE SENIOR CORPS-RSVP OF NORTHERN COOK AND NORTHERN DUPAGE COUNTIES SINCE 1992. AN ESTIMATED 725 RSVP MEMBERS WILL SERVE. (1) THROUGH TUTORING  PROGRAMS, 260 ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS; (2) THROUGH THE INTERGENERATIONAL PEN PAL PROGRAM, 55 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS; (3) 8 ADULT ELL STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVED JOB READINESS;(4) 67 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES RESULTING IN IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE; (5) 6 HOMES OF AN ELIGIBLE SENIOR, VETERAN, OR PERSON WITH DISABILITIES WILL BE PAINTED OR REPAIRED RESULTING IN A TRANSITION TO SAFE, HEALTHY AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING; AND (6) 750 ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE NO CHARGE TAX PREPARATION AND FINANCIAL LITERACY ASSISTANCE, RESULTING IN A TOTAL OF APPROXIMATELY $755,000 IN TAX REFUNDS TO CLIENTS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $187,618 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF $95,673.
