RSVP OF JASPER COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO IMPACT AND BENEFIT CITIZENS OF ALL AGES IN JASPER COUNTY, BY UTILIZING THE EXPERIENCE AND WISDOM OF VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE AGE 55 AND ABOVE. RSVP OF JASPER COUNTY HAS BEEN LOCATED IN THE COUNTY SINCE 1973 AND HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY EXTENSION & OUTREACH SINCE 2005.  AN ESTIMATED 70 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COUNTY AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE IN HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND OTHER COMMUNITY IDENTIFIED PRIORITIES.  SOME OF THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:  HEART (HELP ENGAGE A READER TODAY); WRITING TO READ; TRANSPORTATION; TAX ASSISTANCE; AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES WILL BE REPORTED IN BOTH THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, OTHER FOCUS AREAS, AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES: (ED5A) NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND (ED27C) NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS; (H9A) NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR IMPROVED INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND (O19A) DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX RETURNS GENERATED.  EIGHTY-FOUR PERCENT OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE WORKING ON OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS.  FIFTY-ONE PERCENT OF VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE STATE OF IOWA $7,377.45, CITY OF NEWTON $12,500, JASPER COUNTY $10,000, JASPER COUNTY UNITED WAY $21,000, IOWANS FOR SOCIAL & ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT $10,750, SKIFF/MERCY ONE MEDICAL CENTER $1,200, IN-KIND SUPPORT FROM ISU EXTENSION & OUTREACH $8,331, AND ADDITIONAL INCOME SOURCES $1,325.55.  RSVP OF JASPER COUNTY IS EXCITED TO SERVE THE JASPER COUNTY COMMUNITY AND PROVIDE VITAL INFRASTRUCTURE FOR VOLUNTEERS THROUGH EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMMING WITH STRONG MEASURABLE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES.

ESTABLISHED IN 1974, CARROLL COUNTY RSVP, INCLUDING THE COUNTIES OF CALHOUN AND CRAWFORD, (CCRSVP) CHALLENGES PEOPLE AGE 55 AND BETTER TO USE THEIR ENERGY, SKILLS, INNOVATIVE SPIRIT AND EXPERIENCE TO RESPOND TO CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE. THE PRIMARY CNCS FOCUS AREA SELECTED FOR VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN IS EDUCATION. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE IN HEALTHY FUTURES, CAPACITY BUILDING AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. POPULATIONS SERVED INCLUDE HOMEBOUND ELDERLY, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGES INDIVIDUALS AND PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL DISABILITIES. IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, EDUCATION, 127 OR 49% OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS AND MENTORS IN PUBLIC AND FAITH-BASED K-7 SCHOOLS. A MINIMUM OF 123 AND UP TO 172 UNDUPLICATED CCRSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PROJECTS THAT RESULT IN AN OUTCOME. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE ED5A: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE; ED27C: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS; H9A: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; G3-3.10A: NUMBER OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT INCREASE THEIR EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS, AND/OR PROGRAM REACH; O9: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH IMPROVED FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE . STUDENTS RECEIVING RSVP VOLUNTEER HELP WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN LITERACY, COMMUNICATION SKILLS AND SOCIAL/BEHAVIORAL SKILLS. THE NUMBER OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING SERVICES MAY REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND INCREASE IN GENERAL NUTRITION. SENIORS ATTENDING FINANCIAL FRAUD PREVENTION PRESENTATIONS WILL RECEIVE INFORMATION ABOUT POTENTIAL FINANCIAL SCAMS, HOW TO PROTECT THEMSELVES AND WHERE TO FIND HELP THROUGH THE IOWA INSURANCE DIVISION. CCRSVP STAFF WILL UTILIZE CURRENT OUTCOME TOOLS AS WELL AS WORK WITH PARTNER AGENCIES DEVELOPING TOOLS AND SURVEYS THAT BEST MEASURE AND REFLECT THE PROJECT OUTCOMES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
THE CENTRAL VERMONT COUNCIL ON AGING (CVCOA) WISHES TO CONTINUE SPONSORING RSVP OF CENTRAL VERMONT AND THE NORTHEAST KINGDOM (RSVP). CVCOA HAS BEEN A SPONSOR AND CHAMPION OF SENIOR CORPS PROJECTS SINCE 1988. THE MISSION OF CVCOA IS TO SUPPORT VERMONTERS TO AGE WITH DIGNITY AND CHOICE.  THEY HELP ELDERS AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL, AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES. IN ALIGNMENT WITH OUR SPONSOR'S MISSION, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OLDER VERMONTERES IN THE COMMUNITIES WHERE THEY LIVE AND SERVE.  THIS PROJECT IS PROPOSING TO COLLECTIVELY ENGAGE 220 VOLUNTEERS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE HEALTHY FUTURES OF OLDER VERMONTERS. THEIR SERVICE IS IN PROGRAMING THAT IMPROVES SUCCESSFUL AGING IN PLACE (H4A) OF 1095 VERMONTERS. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES -THREE WORK PLANS WHERE OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED: PHYSICAL ACTIVITY (H18), NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT (H12) AND COMPANIONSHIP (H9A)

	THE SOUTHEAST PUERTO RICO RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SEPR RSVP) ADDRESSES THE NEED FOR IMPROVING COMMUNITY RESILIENCY THROUGH THE KEY ELEMENTS OF DISASTER PREPARATION, RESPONSE, RECOVERY, AND MITIGATION. THE TARGET AREAS TO BE SERVED ARE THE PUERTO RICO MUNICIPALITIES OF HUMACAO, LAS PIEDRAS, AND YABUCOA (PR-1X).  THE SEPR RSVP SEEKS TO ADDRESS THIS GOAL THROUGH EFFECTIVE RECRUITMENT, ORGANIZATION, TRAINING, AND MANAGEMENT OF VOLUNTEERS SO THAT WHEN A DISASTER STRIKES THERE WILL BE A KNOWLEDGEABLE CADRE OF NATIONAL SERVICE PARTICIPANTS AND VOLUNTEERS WHO KNOW WHERE TO GO AND WHAT TO DO IN ORDER TO SAFELY AND EFFECTIVELY AID THE COMMUNITY, AND WHO HAVE TRAINED OTHERS TO DO THE SAME. PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WILL BE ALIGNED WITH OTHER AMERICORPS DISASTER SERVICES GROUPED WITH RSVP: THE CNCS DISASTER CADRE, THE AMERICORPS DISASTER RESPONSE TEAMS, AND FEMA CORPS.
	THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THE SEPR RSVP WORK PLANS INVOLVE 150 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND A TOTAL OF 18 WORKSHOPS OVER A THREE YEAR PERIOD. THE OUTCOME OF THE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES IS GREATER READINESS BY THE VOLUNTEERS AND THE TARGET COMMUNITIES IN PUERTO RICO TO RESPOND TO A NATURAL DISASTER, MOST LIKELY A MAJOR HURRICANE WITH ITS MULTIPLE ATTENDANT CONSEQUENCES. SEPR RSVP ASSESSMENTS WILL BE ALIGNED WITH SENIOR CORPS RESEARCH AND FINDINGS IN THE CNCS EVIDENCE EXCHANGE.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC DIOCESE OF SYRACUSE, NY (CCOC) IS DEDICATED TO CARING FOR THOSE IN NEED WHILE PROMOTING HUMAN DEVELOPMENT, COLLABORATION, AND THE ELIMINATION OF POVERTY AND INJUSTICE.  THE AGENCY STRIVES TO EMPOWER THOSE SERVED TO TRANSFORM THEIR LIVES IN THE SPIRIT OF GOD'S LOVE AND COMPASSION.  CCOC IS AN RSVP APPLICANT WITH 450 VOLUNTEERS PROPOSED.  APPROXIMATELY 292 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS AND PROVIDING FOOD TO THE NEEDY THROUGH WORK IN FOOD PANTRIES, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSISTING WITH INCOME TAX PREPARATION, AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH 225 RSVP VOLUNTEER PLACEMENTS IN THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD.  SIXTY -SEVEN RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THE REMAINING 158 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ORGANIZATIONS MEETING OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
	THE AMOUNT OF CNCS FUNDING REQUESTED IS $72,233. THIS AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $35,382 CONSISTING OF $6,014 FROM THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR THE AGING AND $29,368 OF IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE FIRST YEAR. OF THIS NUMBER, 100% WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AFTER PARTICIPATING IN ULSTER LITERACY ASSOCIATION'S (ULA) 20-HOUR LITERACY TUTOR TRAINING PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE-TO-ONE BASIC LITERACY OR ENGLISH LANGUAGE TUTORING FOR ADULTS, ENGLISH CLASSES IN A SCHOOL OR WORKPLACE SETTING, AND TUTORING AT-RISK YOUTH THROUGH A NEW PARTNERSHIP WITH THE PEACEFUL GUARDIANS PROJECT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE ULA'S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS IN ULSTER COUNTY BY SERVING ADULTS AND YOUNG ADULTS AT THE VERY LOWEST LITERACY LEVELS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ULSTER LITERACY ASSOCIATION WILL HAVE EXPANDED ITS EXISTING PROGRAM TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND MANAGE 103 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $102,709 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,017 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES DURING THE FIRST 12-MONTH PERIOD OF THE GRANT. ULA HAS A 39-YEAR TRACK RECORD AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES THOSE 16 YEARS AND OLDER WITH MULTIPLE LITERACY-RELATED ISSUES. OVER 200 VOLUNTEERS CURRENTLY SUPPORT OUR MISSION BY TUTORING LEARNERS THROUGHOUT ULSTER COUNTY, SERVING AS BOARD MEMBERS, AND PROVIDING PROFESSIONAL IN-KIND SERVICES. WE RETAIN 75-85% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS FROM YEAR TO YEAR AND THE AVERAGE LENGTH OF TUTORING IS THREE YEARS. THE DEMAND FOR VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IS THRIVING IN ULSTER COUNTY. ACCORDING TO A RECENT STUDY, "VOLUNTEERISM IN ULSTER COUNTY", BY THE BENJAMIN CENTER FOR PUBLIC POLICY INITIATIVES (2017), 45 PERCENT OF ULSTER COUNTY RESIDENTS SURVEYED SAID THAT THEY HAD VOLUNTEERED AT LEAST ONCE IN THE PAST YEAR. BY EXPANDING OUR TRAINING PROGRAM TO RURAL AREAS AND OFFERING MORE FREQUENT TRAININGS, ULA CAN CAPTURE THIS ENTHUSIASM AND PROVIDE A PATHWAY FOR MANY RESIDENTS OVER THE AGE OF 55 TO VOLUNTEER IN THEIR OWN HOME TOWN. OUR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY BY KEEPING SENIORS INVOLVED, HELPING FAMILIES IMPROVE THEIR LIVES THROUGH LITERACY, AND ENABLING SELF-MOTIVATED ADULTS AND AT-RISK YOUTH TO REACH THEIR GOALS. OUR TUTORS, MANY OF WHOM ARE RETIRED EDUCATORS, SERVE NEARLY 400 LEARNERS ANNUALLY, YET IT IS ESTIMATED THAT 16,000 IN ULSTER COUNTY STILL NEED OUR HELP (2010 CENSUS, PROLITERACY). IT IS WELL DOCUMENTED THAT A LACK OF FUNCTIONAL LITERACY OR ENGLISH LANGUAGE PREVENTS A RUDIMENTARY UNDERSTANDING OF BASIC HEALTH, FINANCIAL, AND CONSUMER ISSUES AND IS THE COMMON THREAD OF THE INCARCERATED AND IMPOVERISHED POPULATIONS. OUR INSTRUCTIONAL SERVICES ARE RESEARCH-BASED, EMPLOY THE LATEST TECHNOLOGY, AND PROVIDE REAL-LIFE, CONTEXTUALIZED LEARNING DESIGNED TO BUILD PERMANENT LANGUAGE COMPETENCIES. LITERACY LEADS TO EMPLOYMENT, OPPORTUNITIES, AND INDEPENDENCE - GIFTS EVERY ULA VOLUNTEER GIVE TO THEIR LEARNERS EVERY DAY.

IN 1972, RSVP OF DUTCHESS COUNTY, NY-24, WAS ESTABLISHED ACCORDING TO THE OLDER AMERICAN'S ACT AND HAS BEEN SERVING THE RESIDENTS OF DUTCHESS FOR 47 YEARS.  FOR THE PROPOSED GRANT PERIOD OF 2020 -2023, AN ESTIMATED 320 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CITIZENS OF DUTCHESS COUNTY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH THREE OF THE FEDERAL FOCUS AREAS.  OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES, WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  FOOD DELIVERY TO THE HOME-BOUND AND DISABLED, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING, ADVOCATING FOR RESIDENTS LIVING IN SKILLED NURSING FACILITIES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES, RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS AND INCREASING FOOD SECURITY THROUGH FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION.  A TOTAL OF 165 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HEALTHY FUTURES.  IN THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA, VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSISTING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS BY ASSISTING WITH INCOME TAX RETURNS AND PROVIDING WOMEN WITH THE TOOLS NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE.  THE REMAINING AREA, COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, WILL BE SERVICED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN THRIFT SHOPS, ADVISORY BOARD MEMBERS, HISTORIC SITES, HOSPITAL SUPPORT, SERVING CONGREGATE MEALS AT FRIENDSHIP CENTERS AND MORE. 
AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED.  HEALTHY FUTURES WILL PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY 450 HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH FOOD, ACCESS TO MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND GROCERY SHOPPING AND COMPANIONSHIP, ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.    OVER 4,500 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES AND OVER NINETY-FIVE WOMEN WILL GAIN EMPLOYMENT.   IT IS PROJECTED THAT SERVICE HOURS RENDERED IN ALL THESE AREAS BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL TOTAL OVER 62,000 ANNUALLY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $88,479 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,998 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SINCE 1974, THE NORTHWEST NEW JERSEY COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. (NORWESCAP) HAS SPONSORED RSVP SERVING FIVE COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST NEW JERSEY: MORRIS, SUSSEX, WARREN, HUNTERDON AND PASSAIC. NORWESCAP, WITH A MISSION OF "CREATING OPPORTUNITIES, CHANGING LIVES", WAS INCORPORATED IN 1965, AND TOUCHES THE LIVES OF APPROXIMATELY 30,000 INDIVIDUALS EACH YEAR BY OFFERING, REFERRING OR COLLABORATING WITH OTHERS TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND EDUCATION THAT HELP FOSTER SELF-SUFFICIENCY. AN ESTIMATED 345 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 258 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEY WILL ASSIST INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, FRIENDLY VISITING AND HOME DELIVERED MEALS. THEY WILL PROVIDE HEALTH EDUCATION, INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE AND BENEFITS, AND FINANCIAL LITERACY WORKSHOPS AND VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE. SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 50 COMMUNITY PARTNERS SUCH AS CHURCHES, GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES, AND LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. DATA COLLECTION WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH SURVEYS, PRE-POST TESTS AND OTHER OUTCOME MEASUREMENT TOOLS AS DETERMINED DURING PROGRAMMATIC PLANNING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE, MONETARY SAVINGS AND TAX REFUNDS, IMPROVED STRENGTH, BALANCE AND HEALTH, SAFE AND INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $256,842 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $136,105 IN LOCAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CAMDEN COUNTY, NEW JERSEY THROUGH COMMUNITY PLANNING AND ADVOCACY COUNCIL'S (CPAC) CAMDEN COUNTY SENIOR CORPS/RSVP PROGRAM.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES INCLUDE: 80 VOLUNTEERS DISTRIBUTING AND SERVING HEALTHY MEALS THROUGH THE NEW MICKLE BAPTIST CHURCH COMMUNITY CENTER, SENIOR CITIZENS UNITED COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. AND MEALS ON WHEELS.  

AT THE END OF YEAR 3, OUR PROGRAM EXPECTS TO HAVE 80 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING EMERGENCY FOOD TO OVER 400 INDIVIDUALS AND  40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST OVER 100 VETERANS AND DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WITH OBTAINING HEALTHY, SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING, AS WELL AS ASSISTING WITH JOB TRAINING IN THE OTHER FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY; AND 60 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE OTHER FOCUS AREA OF CAPACITY BUILDING EFFECTING APPROXIMATELY 40 ORGANIZATIONS, SERVING THOUSANDS OF INDIVIDUALS.

AN ESTIMATED 215 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 165 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CLASSROOM SUPPORT TO INCREASE LITERACY, MENTORING, COMPANIONSHIP, AND COUNSELING/COACHING. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. CHILDREN REQUIRE STRONG COMMUNITY SUPPORTS AND PERSONAL RESOURCES TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS HEALTHY, PRODUCTIVE ADULTS. THE RSVP CENTER OF ESSEX AND HUDSON COUNTIES TAKES A TWO-PRONGED APPROACH THROUGH TWO TIME-HONORED PROGRAMS. THE FIRST IS A SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING PROGRAM ENTITLED LISTEN TO CHILDREN WHICH PAIRS OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEER "LISTENERS" WITH AT-RISK YOUTH, CREATING A SAFE NON-JUDGMENTAL ENVIRONMENT AND A SECURE SOUNDING BOARD FOR CHILDREN TO EXPRESS CONCERNS OR ANXIETIES.  THE SECOND, A READING PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES CLASSROOM SUPPORT IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, PLACES VOLUNTEER "READING BUDDIES" IN CLASSROOMS TO READ TO CHILDREN IN SMALL GROUP SETTINGS ON A WEEKLY BASIS THROUGHOUT THE SCHOOL YEAR. IN ADDITION TO IMPROVING SOCIAL SKILLS AND ACADEMICS, BOTH PROGRAMS ENABLE CHILDREN IN NEED TO FORM AN INTERGENERATIONAL RELATIONSHIP WITH RSVP VOLUNTEERS.   

THE SECONDARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE TARGET AUDIENCE FOR THIS FOCUS AREA IS FRAIL, HOMEBOUND, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED OLDER ADULTS. IT IS COMMONLY UNDERSTOOD THAT WITHOUT COMMUNITY-BASED SUPPORTS, OLDER ADULTS RESIDING IN THEIR OWN HOMES WHO STRUGGLE FINANCIALLY MAKE RISKY DECISIONS ABOUT WHETHER TO FOREGO DOCTOR VISITS AND PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS. THEY MIGHT CONSUME CHEAP, LESS NUTRITIOUS FOODS, DEFER BILL PAYMENT AND LET INTEREST EXPENSES ACCUMULATE IN ORDER TO MAKE ENDS MEET. FOR THOSE WITHOUT NEARBY FAMILY, SOCIALIZATION IS CONSIDERED A LUXURY THEY CANNOT AFFORD. THESE PRACTICES LEAD TO POOR HEALTH AND PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION. THE RSVP CENTER ADDRESSES THESE NEEDS THROUGH A MULTI-LAYERED APPROACH: MONEY MANAGEMENT, A SERVICE WITH WHICH JFS OF METROWEST HAS A SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD IN VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND OUTCOME MEASUREMENT; AND THE NEW JERSEY STATE HEALTH INSURANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SHIP), PROVIDING ASSISTANCE WITH MEDICARE GUIDANCE. 

ADDITIONALLY, THE RSVP CENTER ADDRESSES OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AS NEEDED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL AGENCIES.  

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 850 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE; 8 WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS; 18 OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR AN IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND, 250 OF OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $146,690 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $99,546 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

GRAFTON COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL, INC. (GCSCC) IS APPLYING FOR A $98,017 COMPETITIVE GRANT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOR RSVP FOR THE 2020 - 2023 PROGRAM PERIOD BEGINNING JULY 2020. GCSCC IS A 501 ( C ) 3 ESTABLISHED IN 1972, "TO PROMOTE, DEVELOP AND REINFORCE PROGRAMS WHICH SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE HEALTH, WELL-BEING, SELF-ESTEEM, DIGNITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES." GCSCC HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1988. CNCS'S INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $109,047 / 52.6%) GENERATED THROUGH NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING COUNTY AND TOWN FUNDING, UNITED WAY AND FOUNDATION GRANTS, FUNDRAISING, PLUS IN-KIND AND INDIVIDUAL DONATIONS. OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE 54 MOSTLY RURAL TOWNS THROUGHOUT 2,302 SQUARE MILES IN GRAFTON AND SULLIVAN COUNTIES, NEW HAMPSHIRE. THE MAJORITY OF OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE CNCS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. BASED ON THE CURRENT CNCS FUNDING FORMULA, A MINIMUM OF 98 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN AGING IN PLACE (H4A / H9A) ACTIVITIES AND OUTCOMES THAT ARE A MISSION FIT FOR OUR SPONSOR: CONTINUING CHORE CORPS FRAUD PREVENTION, GOOD MORNING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, AND RSVP BONE BUILDERS WITH THE GOAL OF EXPANDING WITH OTHER EVIDENCE BASED OR EVIDENCE INFORMED FALLS PREVENTION EXERCISE CLASSES SUCH AS BINGOCIZE, TAI JI QUAN MOVING FOR BETTER BALANCE AND / OR TAI CHI VERMONT'S CURRICULUM. THIS GRANT CYCLE WE WILL ALSO BE ADDING DISASTER PREPAREDNESS (D1A / D5) WITH A FOCUS ON OLDER ADULTS AND THEIR FAMILIES. ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE AVAILABLE THROUGH COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, INCLUDING TWO HOSPITALS, EIGHT SENIOR CENTERS, AND A POLICE DEPARTMENT.

SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE SERVICES, INC. (SNHS) IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT CORPORATION CHARTERED IN THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE IN 1965 TO SERVE AS THE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY FOR HILLSBOROUGH AND ROCKINGHAM COUNTIES. SNHS PROVIDES ACTIVITIES TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN THE AREAS OF HEALTH, NUTRITION, FITNESS, HOUSING, ENERGY NEEDS, AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT. AGENCY PROGRAMS ADDRESS ISSUES THAT BLOCK THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND THAT PERPETUATE POVERTY.
SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE SERVICES' RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS BEEN PROVIDING MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 AND OVER FOR 40 YEARS.  AN ESTIMATED 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE, 96 OF WHOM WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.
HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT WITH 69 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THIS AREA. AS A RESULT OF SERVICES PROVIDED BY SNHS RSVP VOLUNTEERS, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST:
 *	90 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY
*	75 CHILDREN WILL RECEIVE NUTRITIONAL EDUCATION FOCUSING ON REDUCING CHILDHOOD OBESITY
*	2,500 SENIORS WILL PARTICIPATE IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND EXERCISE PROGRAMS.   
OTHER RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE REPAIRING HOMES THROUGH THE FIX-IT CORP PROGRAM, MENTORING IN THE PEN PAL PROGRAM, SERVING AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, AND ASSISTING OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. RSVP PROJECT STAFF CONTINUALLY WORK WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY UNMET COMMUNITY NEEDS TO PROVIDE RSVP VOLUNTEER SUPPORT. 
THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $118,185 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,650 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

MONADNOCK RSVP VOLUNTEER CENTER HAS BEEN AT THE FOREFRONT OF MEETING CRITICAL NEEDS THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE, AS WELL AS PROVIDING MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO ADULTS 55 AND OLDER SINCE 1974 UNDER THE SPONSORSHIP OF MONADNOCK FAMILY SERVICES (MFS), A COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER SERVING SOUTHWESTERN NEW HAMPSHIRE.  WITH 195 EMPLOYEES, OUR 114-YEAR-OLD ORGANIZATION OFFERS MORE THAN A DOZEN DISTINCT PROGRAMS IN PARENT EDUCATION, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, FAMILY SUPPORT, ELDER CARE, VOLUNTEER SERVICES, SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT, AND INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP TREATMENT FOR PERSONS AND FAMILIES STRUGGLING WITH MENTAL ILLNESS.  WE ARE A MONADNOCK UNITED WAY AGENCY.  
WE ARE REQUESTING $86,913 TO SUPPORT AN ESTIMATED 150 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT 35 RSVP STATIONS AND IN OUR AMERICA READS AND NEIGHBORS-IN-DEED PROGRAMS.  OF THIS NUMBER, 103 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,792 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM MONADNOCK UNITED WAY, SUPPLEMENTAL GRANTS, FUNDRAISING, AND IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS.  
RSVP'S WORK PLANS WILL BE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION, IN WHICH 103 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE LITERACY SUPPORT TO CHILDREN IN GRADES K-3 AND IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO IMPROVE SCHOOL READINESS AND LITERACY SKILLS.  OTHER SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE IN THE AREAS OF: HEALTHY FUTURES, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILY MEMBERS, AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  OUR FOCUS IS TO BUILD STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS THAT ALIGN WITH NATIONAL PRIORITIES AND PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES.        
MONADNOCK RSVP HAS BROAD, LASTING EFFECTS ON A WIDE RANGE OF PEOPLE DOCUMENTED BY PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND STAKEHOLDER SURVEYS. WE REMAIN THE ONLY ORGANIZATION IN THE AREA THAT PROVIDES INDIVIDUALIZED VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR VOLUNTEERS AND AGENCIES.   WE ARE ALSO THE ONLY PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SCREENED, TRAINED VOLUNTEERS TO THE SCHOOLS TO TUTOR CHILDREN AND INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES FREE OF CHARGE. THROUGH COMMUNITY COLLABORATIONS AND OUR COMMITTED, UNPAID WORKFORCE, WE STRIVE TO IMPROVE SOCIAL LIVING CONDITIONS AND CREATE LONG-TERM CHANGE THAT PRODUCES HEALTHY, WELL-EDUCATED, AND FINANCIALLY STABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN OUR COMMUNITY.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF THE THREE-YEAR NON-COMPETITIVE GRANT TO OPERATE RSVP OF SOUTHERN MAINE FROM JULY 1, 2020, THROUGH JUNE 30, 2023. LOCATIONS OF ALL SERVICE ACTIVITIES ARE WITHIN AROOSTOOK COUNTY MAINE, AND INCLUDE PROJECT SITES SUCH AS AAAA, THE MAINE VETERANS HOME, UNITED WAY OF AROOSTOOK, AROOSTOOK NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE, NUMEROUS FOOD PANTRIES, HOSPITALS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY NON-PROFITS. THIS IS AN APPLICATION FOR FUNDING (YEAR 1 OF A 3-YEAR GRANT, 4/2020-3/2023) FOR THE NORFOLK COUNTY RSVP (RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM). THE APPLICANT IS THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE COUNTY OF NORFOLK, MA, AN INCORPORATED REGIONAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY WHICH HAS SPONSORED THIS VOLUNTEER COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATION FOR 30 YEARS, AS OF THIS YEAR. THE SERVICE AREA FOR NORFOLK RSVP CONSISTS OF ALL 28 OF THE COUNTY'S 28 CITIES AND TOWNS, COMMUNITIES MOSTLY LOCATED TO THE SOUTH AND WEST OF THE CITY OF BOSTON. INCORPORATED IN 1793, THE COUNTY PROVIDES REGIONAL SERVICES INCLUDING LAND RECORDS MANAGEMENT, VOCATIONAL EDUCATION, TRIAL COURT FACILITIES, ENGINEERING, VETERANS SERVICES, CONSERVATION, RECREATION, REGIONALIZATION PROGRAMS FOR OUR CITIES AND TOWNS (IE. PARTICIPATORY ANIMAL SHELTER) AND FULFILLS ADDITIONAL STATUTORY RESPONSIBILITIES. NORFOLK COUNTY RSVP'S CORE MISSION IS TO RECRUIT, PLACE, SUPPORT AND REVITALIZE VOLUNTEERS LIVING IN NORFOLK COUNTY AGE 55 AND OLDER IN PROGRAMS TO HELP MEET DIVERSE COMMUNITY NEEDS. AN ESTIMATED 285 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, WITH A MINIMUM OF 78 VOLUNTEERS TARGETED TO MEET SPECIFIC PROGRAM OUTCOMES TO MEET OUR 3 YEAR GRANT REQUIREMENTS. HEALTHY FUTURES IS OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR TARGETING TO MEET SPECIFIC PROGRAM OUTCOMES. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP, AND FOOD DELIVERY (MEALS ON WHEELS) TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING; RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM PANTRIES AND FOOD BANKS: INFORMATION ON HEALTH BENEFITS AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS FOR VETERANS; ADDITIONAL RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM AREAS INCLUDE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL K-5 ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OF STUDENTS IN THE READING AND TUTORING PROGRAM; OTHER VETERAN PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORT TO OUR GENERAL POPULATION OF OLDER AND DISABLED ADULTS THROUGH A VARIETY OF VEHICLES INCLUDING HOSPITAL AND COUNTY/TOWN MUNICIPALITY VOLUNTEERING ROUND OUT THE RANGE OF COMMUNITY NEEDS WE WILL ADDRESS THROUGH OUR PROGRAMMING. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, GOALS INCLUDE QUANTIFIABLE ASSISTANCE TO OLDER ADULTS, TO VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA; IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FOR ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS AND IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND FOOD SECURITY THROUGH OUR FOOD SERVICE PROGRAMS. IN THE FIRST YEAR, THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $78,602 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPLICANT NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF $128,945 OR 62.1% OF TOTAL PROJECT BUDGET.  IN FUTURE YEARS, APPLICANT RESOURCES ARE EXPECTED TO BE SIMILARLY PROPORTIONATE, WITH RESPECT TO THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
COMMUNITY TEAMWORK, INC. IS AN $97 MILLION DOLLAR COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY SERVING OVER 50,000 LOW INCOME RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER LOWELL AREA WITH A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE: ALL THREE SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS, CHILD, FAMILY AND ADOLESCENT SERVICES, HOUSING AND HOMELESS SERVICES AND ENERGY AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES. OUR MISSION IS TO SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR SOCIAL CHANGE. WE STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND REDUCE POVERTY BY DELIVERING VITAL SERVICES AND COLLABORATING WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS TO CREATE HOUSING, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES. WE ARE APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO ALLOW US TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT WITH AN ANTICIPATED 220 VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE CRITICALLY IMPORTANT SERVICE ACROSS OUR COMMUNITY WORKING WITH A WIDE RANGE OF INSTITUTIONS AND WITH AN EVEN BROADER RANGE OF INDIVIDUALS. CTI'S SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS HAVE ESTABLISHED THEMSELVES AS A VITAL CONTRIBUTOR ACROSS THE ENTIRE SPECTRUM OF NEEDS HERE IN OUR COMMUNITY. OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS TEACH BONE BUILDER CLASSES TO HUNDREDS OF PARTICIPANTS PROVIDING THEM WITH HEALTH EDUCATION AS WELL AS STRENGTH BUILDING. THEY SERVE IN LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS TO KEEP THEIR PEERS ENGAGED AND VITAL AND ACT AS FRIENDLY VISITORS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS. OTHER SERVICES OUR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE ARE HELPING LOW-INCOME FAMILIES TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF EARNED INCOME TAX CREDIT (EITC) TAX RETURNS, SUPPORT AMBITIOUS MATH AND LITERACY INITIATIVES WITH STUDENTS OF ALL AGES, WORK WITH LOCAL VETERANS PROVIDING RESOURCES, SUPPORT AND COUNSELING. RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE MIGHTILY TO THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN OUR REGION, OUR AGENCY AND OUR COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS GRANT CYCLE IS HEALTHY FUTURES. BY THE END OF YEAR ONE OF THE GRANT CYCLE, CTI ANTICIPATES THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED COMPANIONSHIP TO OVER 350 PEOPLE. THEY WILL ASSIST OVER 325 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH EMERGENCY FOOD NEEDS, OF WHICH 125 WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO OVER 29 NON -PROFIT AGENCIES IN THE COMMUNITY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS FOCUSING ON MATH AND LITERACY SKILLS WITH AT LEAST 25 CHILDREN. TEN VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT CTI'S EITC PROGRAM ASSISTING WITH OVER 500 TAX RETURNS, SERVING IN THE CHILDCARE ROOM WHILE PARENTS ARE HAVING THEIR TAXES DONE AND PROVIDING RESOURCES AND REFERRALS TO CLIENTS. ONE RSVP VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO OVER 30 VETERAN'S AND MILITARY FAMILIES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE THE COMMUNITY IN VAST WAYS. CTI FORESEES THAT RSVP'S WILL INCREASE RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT AND EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS FOR LOCAL NON-PROFITS TO OPTIMIZE THEIR SERVICE DELIVERY. THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,131.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $25,771.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY IS SPONSORED BY COMMUNITY ACTION PIONEER VALLEY (CAPV), THE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED ANTI-POVERTY AGENCY FOR FRANKLIN AND HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES.  THE AGENCY ALSO PROVIDES SERVICES IN CONTIGUOUS AREAS OF NORTHWESTERN WORCESTER COUNTY (NORTH QUABBIN), HAMPDEN COUNTY, AND BERKSHIRE COUNTY, AN AREA OF OVER 1,700 SQUARE MILES.  FOUNDED IN 1965 AS PART OF THE WAR ON POVERTY, COMMUNITY ACTION REMAINS TRUE TO ITS MISSION OF PARTNERING WITH PEOPLE WITH LOW INCOMES AND OTHER MARGINALIZED GROUPS TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC STABILITY AND SECURITY, AND WORKING TO BUILD COMMUNITIES IN WHICH ALL PEOPLE HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO THRIVE.  THE AGENCY HAS AN ANNUAL BUDGET OF $30 MILLION, OF WHICH 21.6% IS DIRECT FEDERAL FUNDING FOR HEAD START PROGRAMS IN HAMPDEN, HAMPSHIRE, AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES.    
RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY BEGAN IN HAMPSHIRE COUNTY IN 1973, EXPANDED NORTH INTO FRANKLIN COUNTY IN 1999, AND SOUTH INTO HAMPDEN COUNTY IN SEPTEMBER 2017.  RSVP IS A WELL-KNOWN AND WELL-RESPECTED RESOURCE IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  IN 2010, CNCS AWARDED RSVP A PROGRAMS OF NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE GRANT TO EXPAND ITS HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE PROGRAM, WHICH HAS SINCE GROWN BY 60% AND SERVES HUNDREDS OF SENIORS EACH YEAR AT 27 COMMUNITY SITES.  FOLLOWING A CNCS MONITORING VISIT IN 2016, CNCS STAFF DESCRIBED OUR CURRENT PROJECT AS "A STRONG RSVP PROGRAM THAT...HAS INVESTED IN ACHIEVING PROGRAM OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES WHICH ARE BOTH ACCURATE AND BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY."   
AN ESTIMATED 860 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 645 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PROGRAMS, COMPANIONSHIP, HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE CLASSES, BUILDING HOMES, AND EXTENSIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SUPPORT THROUGH NONPROFIT RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE CENTRAL OUTCOMES WE ANTICIPATE ARE:  SENIORS WILL INCREASE THEIR SOCIALIZATION AND ABILITY TO AGE IN PLACE AND PARTICIPANTS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE WILL HAVE TRANSITIONED INTO AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  LOCAL AGENCIES WILL INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INCREASED FUNDING AND SUPPORT OF THEIR PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $264,682 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $117,160 IN-KIND INVESTMENT.

THE MISSION OF MYSTIC VALLEY ELDER SERVICES, SPONSOR OF MIDDLESEX COUNTY RSVP IS TO SUPPORT THE RIGHT OF ELDERS AND ADULTS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH DIGNITY IN A SETTING OF THEIR CHOICE.  TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTEEN (213) UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE; ALL 213 OF THEM WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER, COUNSELING ON HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS TO FACILITATE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, TUTOR AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO SUPPORT STUDENT LITERACY, AND ASSIST WITH FINANCIAL LITERACY THAT WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES INCLUDING OBESITY AND FOOD, ACCESS TO CARE, AND AGING IN PLACE.  THE OTHER FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF K-12 SUCCESS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 450 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AFTER ATTENDING THE FOOD PANTRY 3 TIMES OR MORE, 52 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AFTER 3 OR MORE MONTHS OF MONEY MANAGEMENT SERVICES, AND 595 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AFTER COMPLETING 5 OR MORE MONTHS IN THE READING PARTNERS PROGRAM. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $82,397 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY SEVERAL NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES; THE GOAL WOULD BE TO RAISE NEEDED AMOUNTS FOR THE RSVP VOLUNTEER STAFFED PROGRAMS TOTALING OVER $235,000. CONTRIBUTORS WITH LONG -STANDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH SPONSOR MVES AS WELL AS MANY NEWLY CULTIVATED CONTRIBUTORS ARE INCLUDED IN THE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS AND BOTH HAVE BEEN ENGAGED FOR FFY 2020. GRANT REQUESTS ARE SENT TO LOCAL CORPORATE FUNDERS AND PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. ADDITIONALLY, DIRECT MAIL APPEALS ARE SENT OUT TO OUR COMMUNITY. SPECIAL EVENTS AND PLANNED BEQUESTS ALSO CONTRIBUTE. A FEW EXAMPLES OF SUPPORT ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE READING PARTNERS PROGRAM HAS RECEIVED $1,500 WORTH OF BOOK DONATIONS FROM 3 DONORS AND HOUGHTON MIFFLIN GIFTED THE PROGRAM WITH $2,666 WORTH OF BOOKS WITH A PLEDGE TO DONATE $5,334 MORE DURING THE UPCOMING GRANT PERIOD; THE MONEY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM RECEIVED $5,000 IN FIRST TIME SUPPORT FROM THE PEOPLE'S UNITED COMMUNITY FOUNDATION AND THE CHARLES F. BACON TRUST RENEWED THEIR SUPPORT OF $10,000 AND THE HOWARD C. CONNOR CHARITABLE FOUNDATION RENEWED THEIR SUPPORT OF  $10,000.

TEXOMA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS REQUESTING $57,479 OF FEDERAL FUNDING FOR SUPPORT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVICES IN TEXOMA. AN ESTIMATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN TEXOMA NON-PROFIT, PROPRIETARY, GOVERNMENTAL OR HEALTH CARE AGENCIES.  THE PROGRAM'S SPONSOR, THE TEXOMA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (TCOG) IS AN ORGANIZATION COMPRISED OF CITY AND COUNTY GOVERNMENTS, COLLEGES, SCHOOL DISTRICTS, AND CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE DETERMINED TO BUILD STRENGTH THROUGH REGIONAL COOPERATION. ITS MEMBERS ARE SERVED BY WORKING TOGETHER TO CONTINUALLY IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE CITIZENS OF COOKE, GRAYSON AND FANNIN COUNTIES.  CREATED BY THE TEXAS STATE LEGISLATURE IN 1968, THE TEXOMA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS SERVES GOVERNMENTAL MEMBERSHIP FROM THE AFOREMENTIONED TRI-COUNTY AREA.  
TEXOMA RSVP IS A PART OF THE TEXOMA AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA). THE GOAL OF THE AGENCY IS TO SERVE AS THE COMMUNITY CATALYST TO ENHANCE AWARENESS OF THE STRENGTHS AND NEEDS OF OUR OLDER POPULATION AND TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF SERVICES, PROGRAMS, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ENSURE THEIR PROLONGED WELL-BEING, INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY.
ACCORDING TO THE UNITED STATES CENSUS BUREAU, IN 2016 THERE WERE 49.2 MILLION SENIORS WHICH EQUATES TO 15.2 PERCENT OF THE U.S. POPULATION. IT IS ESTIMATED ONE IN FIVE RESIDENTS WILL BE OVER THE AGE OF 65 BY 2030, AND BY 2035, SENIORS WILL OUTNUMBER CHILDREN YOUNGER THAN 18. ACCORDING TO THE STATISTA.COM WEBSITE, THE TEXAS SENIOR POPULATION RATES THIRD HIGHEST IN THE NATION. THE AMERICAN HEALTH RANKING SENIOR REPORT 2018 INDICATES THAT 16.8% OF SENIORS AGE 60 AND ABOVE FACE THE THREAT OF HUNGER BECAUSE OF FOOD INSECURITY IN TEXAS. IN 2016, IT WAS ESTIMATED THAT 34,620 INDIVIDUALS IN THE TEXOMA REGION WERE AFFECTED BY FOOD INSECURITIES ACCORDING TO FEEDING AMERICA.ORG. THIS NUMBER INDICATES A FOOD INSECURITY RATE OF 17.37% IN OUR TRI-COUNTY AREA. SOME TEXOMA COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDE UNEMPLOYMENT, POVERTY, HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS TRYING TO MAINTAIN SOME LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE, ISOLATION DUE TO LACK OF SOCIALIZATION, AND AN AGING POPULATION WHOSE HEALTH PROBLEMS RELATED TO AGING CONTINUE TO INCREASE. THE CURRENT NEED FOR ASSISTANCE IN THIS AREA IS GREAT.
AN ESTIMATED FIFTY-EIGHT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THESE ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ADDRESSING HUNGER BY DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS HELP LESSEN THE EFFECTS OF ISOLATION THROUGH SOCIAL INTERACTION. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS WITH FOOD INSECURITIES BY ASSISTING IN LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES. VOLUNTEERS WILL BECOME CERTIFIED MATTER OF BALANCE COACHES AND TEACH SENIORS ON FALLS PREVENTION TO IMPROVE THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL CONSIST OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN HOSPITAL SETTINGS, CRISIS CENTERS, THRIFT STORES, TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, EDUCATING SENIORS ON FINANCIAL INFORMATION TO AVOID FRAUD AND ABUSE, AND PROVIDE HANDMADE BLANKETS AND HATS TO THOSE IN NEED.  TEXOMA RSVP SERVICE ASSIGNMENTS WILL ADDRESS AREAS FOCUSED ON HEALTHY FUTURES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES OBJECTIVES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD WE ANTICIPATE 250 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $57,479 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY STATE AND OTHER FUNDS IN THE COMBINED AMOUNT OF $44,119. THE TOTAL ANTICIPATED AMOUNT OF FUNDING WILL BE $101,598.

RUNNINGWATER DRAW RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS A FEDERALLY SUPPORTED GRANT PROGRAM SERVING THREE RURAL COUNTIES IN THE TEXAS PANHANDLE AND SOUTH PLAINS FOR OVER 45 YEARS. FLOYD, HALE AND LAMB COUNTIES ENCOMPASS 3,013 SQUARE MILES. PLAINVIEW, THE MOST POPULATED CITY IN THE AREA, WAS DESIGNATED BY THE COMMISSIONER OF THE TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AS A "CERTIFIED RETIREMENT COMMUNITY". THE GOOD QUALITY OF LIFE, HEALTHCARE, AFFORDABLE SENIOR HOUSING, REASONABLY PRICED MEALS AT THE LOCAL SENIOR CENTER, AND OTHER FUN ACTIVITIES MAKE LIVING PLEASANT IN OUR SMALL TOWN ATMOSPHERE.  A FEW NOTABLE LOCAL ATTRACTIONS LIKE PLAINVIEW POINT, A HISTORICAL MARKER THAT RECOGNIZES A SITE NEAR THE RUNNINGWATER DRAW, PAYS HOMAGE TO DISTINCTIVE SPEAR POINTS DISCOVERED AND ASSOCIATED WITH THE FOSSILIZED REMAINS OF ABOUT 100 BISON. JUST PAST THE HISTORICAL MARKER, RISING UP TO 22 FOOT IN THE AIR, A LARGE ARROW MARKS THE SPOT OF THE QUANAH PARKER TRAIL. THROUGHOUT TOWN RESIDENTS AND VISITORS ALSO SPOT LARGE PAINTED FIBERGLASS COWS ARTISTICALLY HIGHLIGHTING IMPORTANT LANDMARKS AND CREATIVELY SHOWCASING HISTORICAL THEMES ACROSS PLAINVIEW.
HALE COUNTY IS ALSO SLATED TO BECOME THE SITE OF THE WORLD'S LARGEST WIND FARM, A RECENTLY FORMED ENERGY PARTNERSHIP HAS ANNOUNCED.  HALE COMMUNITY ENERGY SAYS IT PLANS TO ERECT BETWEEN 500 AND 650 WIND TURBINES ON MORE THAN 122,000 ACRES WITHIN THE NEXT FEW YEARS.  THAT PENCILS OUT TO ABOUT 190 SQUARE MILES. THE PROJECT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO GENERATE 1,100 MEGAWATTS OF RENEWABLE ENERGY, ACCORDING TO TRI-GLOBAL ENERGY, ITS PARENT COMPANY.
BY INTEGRATING SENIOR SERVICE ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS, RSVP OFFERS THE VALUES, EXPERIENCES, EMOTIONS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND EXPERTISE OF OUR VOLUNTEERS TO CREATE A STRONG COMMUNITY CONNECTION.  THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF VOLUNTEER EFFORTS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND BY COMMUNICATION AND ENCOURAGEMENT OF RSVP STAFF, VOLUNTEERS MOBILIZE IN EFFORTS PROVIDING STRATEGIC SELFLESS SERVICE ACROSS THE COMMUNITY THROUGH A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS. AN ESTIMATED 245 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ELDERLY, HOME-BOUND, DISABLED, VETERANS, LOW-INCOME ADULTS, AND CHILDREN THROUGH THEIR EFFORTS AT 33 VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN FLOYD, HALE AND LAMB COUNTIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RUNNINGWATER DRAW RSVP WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND AN ESTIMATED 47 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS, UNEMPLOYED, UNDER EMPLOYED, VETERANS, THEIR FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH SITES PROVIDING FOOD DELIVERY. 
AT THE END OF THE 36 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 300 INDIVIDUALS ASSISTED THROUGH FOOD DELIVERY, WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $46,540 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,458 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 475 WEST TEXAS RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO MEET IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS IN THE ABILENE/BIG COUNTRY AREA AND SAN ANGELO/CONCHO VALLEY AREA OF TEXAS.  OF THIS NUMBER 139 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HEALTHY FUTURES, THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.  144 TOTAL UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PERFORMANCE MEASURES WITH OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES.  SOME OF THEIR VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES UNDER THE OBJECTIVE AGING IN PLACE WILL BE PROVIDING HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND TRANSPORTATION TO FRAIL ELDERLY INCREASING THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVING THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.  SENIORS WHO RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL ALSO HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE.  UNDER THE OBJECTIVE OBESITY AND FOOD, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN A MYRIAD OF WAYS IN SOUP KITCHENS, FOOD PANTRIES, COMMUNITY GARDENS, KIDS SUMMER FEEDING PROGRAM, AND FOOD BANKS.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE EDUCATION/TRAINING ON OPIOID/DRUG ABUSE FOR SENIORS AND USE DRUG DISPOSAL PACKETS FOR EXPIRED OR UNUSED OPIOIDS AND OTHER DRUGS DURING THESE EVENTS. FREE INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING THROUGH THE AARP TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. MANY OTHER IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL BE MET BY THE ANTICIPATED 331 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN DISASTER PREPARATION AND RELIEF, EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING IN COLLABORATION WITH THE AREA AGENCIES ON AGING, CAPACITY BUILDING, SERVICE TO VETERANS AND IN MANY OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $143,106 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 68,366 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR THE REQUIRED MATCH.

MONTGOMERY VA MEDICAL CENTER.

KI BOIS COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INC. (KI BOIS CAF) IS A MULTI-PURPOSE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY. ITS MISSION IS TO REMAIN DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING THE CAUSES OF POVERTY AND BETTERING THE ECONOMIC, MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF ALL PEOPLE, MOST IMPORTANTLY THE DISADVANTAGED, BY UTILIZING EFFECTIVE COORDINATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF AVAILABLE RESOURCES. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, AN ESTIMATED 135 RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES. OF THIS NUMBER, 49 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVICES TO HEAD START CHILDREN TO IMPROVE SCHOOL READINESS, MEAL DELIVERY AND SOCIALIZATION FOR SENIORS, SCREENING AND REFERRALS FOR VETERANS IN HOUSING CRISIS, FOOD PANTRIES, TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE, AND TRANSPORTATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 1000 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES, IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES, SCHOOL READINESS, NUTRITION, BLOOD SUPPLIES, AND SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,315.00 FROM THE SPONSOR AGENCY.

AN ESTIMATED 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE COMANCHE COUNTY.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AND 61 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN HEALTHY FUTURES WORK PLAN ASSIGNMENTS, WITH 53 RSVP VOLUNTEERS ASSIGNED TO OUTCOME-BASED PERFORMANCE MEASURES.  FORT SILL MILITARY RESERVATION, HOME TO BOTH THE US ARMY FIELD ARTILLERY AND AIR DEFENSE ARTILLERY, IS LOCATED INSIDE LAWTON'S NORTHERN BOUNDARY.  THIS PROJECT AND ITS MORE THAN 90 VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING MILITARY VETERANS, ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY, AND THEIR FAMILIES WILL INVEST HEAVILY IN THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEERS' ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:  1) DELIVERING NUTRITIOUS FOOD THROUGH THE MOBILE MEALS PROGRAM OR PROVIDING OTHER SERVICES TO THE HOMEBOUND WHO ARE AT LEAST 65 YEARS OF AGE OR DISABLED WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND TO FEEL MORE SECURE ABOUT OTHERS HELPING THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES; 2) WORKING TO ALLEVIATE HUNGER THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITIES BY LENDING ASSISTANCE TO THE LOCAL FOOD BANKS AND ISSUING EMERGENCY RATIONS; 3) PERSONALLY EDUCATING HUNGRY HEADS-OF-HOUSEHOLD IN COMANCHE COUNTY ABOUT A VARIETY OF FOOD SECURITY TOPICS TO INCLUDE SOCIALLY-ACCEPTABLE WAYS TO OBTAIN SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD, THEREBY EMPOWERING EACH PERSON TO MAKE BETTER AND SAFETY NUTRITION CHOICES; 4) PROVIDING RESPITE, REFRESHMENT, INFORMATION, AND TRAVEL OR OTHER ASSISTANCE TO MILITARY VETERANS, TO FAMILY MEMBERS OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL, AND TO ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY SERVICE MEMBERS TRANSITIONING VIA OUR REGIONAL AIRPORT; AND 5) TRANSPORTING CANCER PATIENTS FOR TREATMENTS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THIS PROGRAM WILL HAVE ENDEAVORED TO PROVIDE IN-RESIDENCE FOOD DELIVERY TO 140 ELDERLY OR DISABLED HOMEBOUND ADULTS, WITH 25 OF THEM EXPRESSING, IN WRITING, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES; IN-PERSON EDUCATION OR TRAINING TO 80 INDIVIDUALS, WITH 15 EXPRESSING A FEELING OF INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; AND ROUND-TRIP TRANSPORTATION FOR 150 CANCER PATIENTS SEEKING TREATMENT, WITH 75 EXPRESSING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES.  ADDITIONALLY, OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE LOGGED AT LEAST 2,880 VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS IN DIRECT SUPPORT OF THE LOCAL FOOD BANKS AND WILL HAVE PROVIDED AN ARRAY OF COMMERCIAL OR MILITARY AIR TRAVEL SUPPORT SERVICES AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO 75 VETERANS, 125 FAMILY MEMBERS OF ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL AND 200 ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY PERSONNEL.  THE FIRST YEAR CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ESTIMATED $41,684 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS.

LITTLE DIXIE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. (LDCAA) IS REQUESTING $54,299 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO CONTINUE PROVIDING SERVICES UNDER THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). FOR THE LAST 50 YEARS, LDCAA HAS WORKED TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN ATTAINING SELF-SUFFICIENCY. TODAY, THE AGENCY OPERATES A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS, WHICH DEAL WITH COMMUNITY SERVICE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, AND CHILD AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT. LDCAA SERVES THE RESIDENTS OF CHOCTAW, MCCURTAIN, AND PUSHMATAHA COUNTIES IN RURAL SOUTHEAST OKLAHOMA, THE TARGET AREA FOR THE GRANT PROJECT (OPPORTUNITY NUMBER OK-02). THE AGENCY'S MISSION STATEMENT IS "TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH SERVICE AND COLLABORATION LEADING TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY". SINCE 1973, LITTLE DIXIE RSVP HAS CHANNELED THE TALENTS AND ENERGIES OF PEOPLE AGE 55 AND OVER WHO WOULD LIKE TO BE OF SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. AN ESTIMATED 287 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 176 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL WORK TO ADDRESS INDEPENDENT LIVING (A FUNDING PRIORITY) BY PROVIDING PERSONS AGE 65 AND OVER AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA WITH LUNCHTIME MEAL DELIVERIES, TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, PHARMACY VISITS, GROCERY SHOPPING, ETC., AND COMPANIONSHIP OUTREACH. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN THE HEALTH CARE SYSTEM AND TYPICALLY UNSERVED POPULATIONS, BY PROVIDING OUTREACH TO:  IMPROVE HEALTH KNOWLEDGE AND POSITIVE LIFESTYLE CHOICES, PREVENT OR REDUCE PRESCRIPTION DRUG AND OPIOID ABUSE (A FUNDING PRIORITY), INCREASE AWARENESS OF AND ACCESS TO AREA PROGRAMS/RESOURCES, AND ENCOURAGE PREVENTIVE CARE. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST AT LOCAL FOOD BANKS TO PROVIDE EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE FOR AREA INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AS A RESULT OF CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICES, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS EXPECTED THAT 94 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND 169 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. IN ADDITION, 975 INDIVIDUALS WHO RECEIVED EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE FROM PROGRAM FOOD PANTRIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $54,299 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,341.

SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AREA AGENCY ON AGING, SPONSOR OF RSVP OF PEMISCOT/NEW MADRID COUNTIES SINCE 1986, IS A NON-PROFIT AGENCY SERVING 18 COUNTIES. THE MISSION OF RSVP IS TO ACT AS A MECHANISM IN SUSTAINING A STRONG INFRASTRUCTURE THAT MEETS CRITICAL SOCIAL NEEDS BY CONNECTING PEOPLE WHO WANT TO HELP OTHERS AND BY BUILDING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN RSVP AND COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE UNITED EFFORTS BENEFITS THE COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA.

 RSVP IS VITAL TO THE COMMUNITIES IT SERVES. UNDUPLICATED ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-FIVE (125) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, LOW INCOME FAMILIES, SENIORS, VETERANS AND CHILDREN. VOLUNTEERS WILL PACKAGE AND DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS, IMPROVE CHILDREN'S READING SKILLS, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY STORE AND SHOPPING; ASSIST AND RESPOND TO LOCAL DISASTER ORGANIZATIONS, OFFER FREE TAX SERVICES TO SENIORS AND LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, PROVIDE OUTREACH TO VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES AND OTHER NEEDS SPECIFIED THROUGH 11 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, TWELVE (12) VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO 300 HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN COLLABORATION WITH 4 VOLUNTEER SITES AND ALSO ON A MONTHLY BASIS HELP A LOCAL FOOD PANTRY DISTRIBUTE NON-PERISHABLE FOOD TO THE NEEDY.  THREE (3) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE 600 INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESS TO FREE TAX SERVICE AND FOLLOW-UP. THREE (3) VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING IN DISASTER SERVICES. 
SEVENTEEN (17) VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN DAILY/WEEKLY PHONE CALLS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS TO CHECK ON THEIR WELL-BEING.
 FOCUS AREAS OF VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES WILL ALSO BE ADDRESSED THROUGH THE YEAR. ALSO, TWELVE (12) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, BILL PAYING, SOCIAL SECURITY OFFICE OR DIVISION OF FAMILY SERVICES. SEVENTY-EIGHT (78) VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP LOCAL CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS DISTRIBUTE VITAL HEALTH INFORMATION OUT AT ANNUAL HEALTH FAIRS THAT ARE HELD IN 4 DIFFERENT TOWNS AND ASSIST CLIENTS WITH ENROLLING IN MEDICARE AND MEDICARE PART D.  THEY WILL ALSO, ASSIST OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WITH THEIR ANNUAL EVENTS.

 SURVEYS TO EVALUATE PERFORMANCE MEASURES WILL BE CONDUCTED BY ASSESSING 20% OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND 10% OF VOLUNTEERS. THE SURVEYS WILL SHOW THAT 80% OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS HAD THEIR NEEDS MET, 95% OF THE VOLUNTEERS ARE SATISFIED AT THEIR VOLUNTEER STATIONS, AND 50% MORE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES DEVELOPED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $47,626 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND IN-KIND DONATIONS. RSVP HAS 125 UN-DUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND 11 WORK STATIONS.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOME DELIVERED MEAL DELIVERY, MEDICARE COUNSELING, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, AND HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM INSTRUCTION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT, BENEFICIARIES WILL RECEIVE THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO ACCESS THEIR HEALTH CARE BENEFITS, AND PEOPLE WILL PARTICIPATE IN EVIDENCE-BASED HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS.  ADDITIONALLY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING ON OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION AS WELL AS FRAUD PREVENTION TO ENHANCE THE SERVICES PROVIDED.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $55,422 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $9,399 IN MATCH RESOURCES.

THE LEGAL NAME OF THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF ANDREW COUNTY RSVP (RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM) IS ANDREW COUNTY MINISTRIES, INC. THIS GROUP IS A MINISTERIAL ALLIANCE MADE UP OF ALL THE CHURCHES IN ANDREW COUNTY, MISSOURI, IRREGARDLESS OF DENOMINATION OR BELIEF. THE MISSION OF ANDREW COUNTY MINISTRIES, INC. IS TO TAKE CARE OF THE LESS FORTUNATE INDIVIDUALS OF ANDREW COUNTY, IRREGARDLESS OF FAITH DENOMINATION OR ETHNIC ORIGIN. CURRENTLY THERE ARE 255 REGISTERED VOLUNTEERS, OF WHICH 175 ARE UNDUPLICATED, WITHIN THE RSVP ORGANIZATION. 

WE ARE REQUESTING A GRANT AMOUNT OF $40,000.00 FROM CNCS. 

THE MAIN INDUSTRY IN ANDREW COUNTY IS AGRICULTURAL-RELATED. THE WEATHER PLAYS A MAJOR PART IN THE SUCCESS OF THE AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY.  ANDREW COUNTY RSVP PARTNERS WITH VARIOUS 501C3 GROUPS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN A QUALITY PROGRAM WITH QUALITY VOLUNTEERS WITHOUT THE HARDSHIP OF PAYROLL EXPENSES. 

TRACKING THE IMPACT OF THE VOLUNTEERING EFFORTS OF THE ANDREW COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS IS DONE IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. THESE WAYS CAN INCLUDE WORK STATION REPORTS, CLIENT SURVEYS, ACTUAL COUNTING OF DOLLARS THAT ARE SAVED ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENTS BY THE MEDICARE AND MEDICARE D PROGRAMS AND THE VOLUNTEER TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. 

ANDREW COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS ADDRESS HEALTHY FUTURES IN BOTH THE ELDERLY AND THE CHILDREN OF ANDREW COUNTY MISSOURI.  THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY PLACING VOLUNTEERS IN THE ANDREW COUNTY SENIOR CENTER, BY PROVIDING DRIVERS FOR HOME-DELIVERED MEALS, STAFFING THE BACK PACK BUDDY PROGRAM FOR UNDERFED CHILDREN, AND STAFFING THE ANDREW COUNTY FOOD PANTRY AND CLOTHES CLOSET.  ANDREW COUNTY RSVP HAS VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE DRIVERS FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENT TRANSPORTATION, WHO PROVIDE WELL-BEING PHONE CALLS AND HOME VISITS, WHO ASSIST WITH MEDICARE AND MEDICAID HEALTH AND PHARMACY ISSUES, AND PROVIDE A TAX-FILING SERVICE.

THE BUTLER COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCE COUNCIL (CRC) SEEKS TO CONTINUE THE RSVP PROGRAM IN BUTLER COUNTY, MO: POPLAR BLUFF, FISK, BROSELEY, QULIN, HARVIELL, AND NEELYVILLE. THE BUTLER COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCE COUNCIL EXISTS TO PROMOTE COORDINATION AND COOPERATION BETWEEN SOCIAL SERVICES PROVIDERS, CHURCHES, BUSINESS COMMUNITIES AND THE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM, IN ORDER TO EMPOWER FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS TO BECOME MORE SELF-RELIANT, RESPONSIBLE AND RESOURCEFUL. 
THE RSVP PROGRAM BEGAN IN 1973 AND HAS CONTINUED TO MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS IN BUTLER COUNTY, MO.  ONE HUNDRED AND TWENTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE LOW INCOME FAMILIES, SENIORS AND VETERANS IN TEN WORK STATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. OTHER FOCUS AREAS TO BE ADDRESSED DURING THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD WILL BE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT 10 WORK STATIONS WILL MEET NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY WHICH INCLUDE ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD AND FINANCIAL LITERACY.  
AT THE END OF THE 36-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, APPROXIMATELY 3,075 INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE SERVICES:  150 SENIORS AND DISABLED PERSONS WERE ALLOWED TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY BECAUSE OF WELLNESS CHECKS OR CALLS MADE TWICE A WEEK TO CHECK ON THE SENIOR'S WELLBEING AND 98 WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORT; 300 INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; 1,200 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE HEALTH INFORMATION AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL SYSTEMS; 1,350 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FREE TAX CONSULTATION AND PREPARATION AND THE ESTIMATED DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS GENERATED WILL BE $500,000.  ALSO 55 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND AVERAGE OF 2 HOURS PER WEEK (5,720 HOURS YEARLY) AND WILL PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICE OR SUPPORT TO FIVE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH A VARIETY OF SERVICE ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE SOME OF THE FOLLOWING: 
*	ORGANIZING AND CARRYING OUT DAY TO DAY ACTIVITIES CLERICAL WORK SUCH AS ANSWERING PHONES
*	STUFFING ENVELOPES AND REGISTERING PARTICIPANTS MAINTAINING RECORDS AND ARCHIVES
*	ASSIST WITH ACTIVITIES IN NUTRITION CENTERS SUCH AS TEACHING CLASSES, GIVING COMPUTER ASSISTANCE, STAFFING A LENDING LIBRARY, LEADING BINGO GAMES, LEADING EXERCISE CLASSES, PUTTING UP AND TAKING DOWN SEASONAL DECORATIONS OR ARRANGING COMMUNAL CELEBRATIONS, AND SERVING FOOD
*	WILL ANSWERS PHONES YEARLY FOR BUFF UP THE BLUFF, A CITYWIDE CLEANUP EVENT
*	WILL HELP AT LOCAL BLOOD DRIVES
*	VOLUNTEER IN HOSPITAL GIFT SHOP
THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $36,786 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH WILL INCLUDE, IN KIND DONATIONS AND LOCAL AND STATE FUNDING.

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS) IS LOCATED IN NORTHEAST MISSOURI AND SERVES THE COUNTIES OF LEWIS, MACON, MARION, MONROE, PIKE, RALLS, RANDOLPH, AND SHELBY. THE TOTAL GEOGRAPHIC AREA COVERED BY DCS IS 4,520 SQUARE MILES, WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 123,407. THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS PRIMARILY RURAL WITH THE LARGEST COMMUNITY BEING HANNIBAL, IN MARION COUNTY WITH A POPULATION OF 28,174. 

THE MEDIAN INCOME LEVEL FOR THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS $38,896. EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND HEALTH CARE EMPLOY THE GREATEST PERCENTAGE OF WORKING PEOPLE WHO ARE 16 YEARS AND OLDER. THIS IS FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY MANUFACTURING AND RETAIL TRADE INDUSTRIES. ALTHOUGH THE AREA HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN ACCEPTED AS HAVING AN AGRICULTURAL ECONOMIC BASE, SHELBY COUNTY IS NOW THE ONLY COUNTY WITH A SIGNIFICANT PERCENTAGE OF EMPLOYMENT IN AGRICULTURE. 

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES IS GOVERNED BY A 16-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH REPRESENTATION FROM THE FINANCIAL, EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND BUSINESS SECTORS, AS WELL AS REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE FIVE MAJOR DCS PROGRAMS.  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETS MONTHLY IN HANNIBAL, MO.

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 140 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEY WILL PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE FOOD, ASSIST FOOD PANTRIES, RECRUIT ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS, AND HELP GARNER BOTH IN-KIND AND CASH DONATIONS FOR NOT-FOR-PROFITS AT 9 VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 85% OF PERSONS SURVEYED WILL SELF-REPORT A GREATER FOOD SECURITY AND 5,000 MEALS WILL HAVE BEEN SERVED TO LOW INCOME CHILDREN.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT IF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF $62,854.

COUNCIL OF CHURCHES OF THE OZARKS (CCO), SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF SPRINGFIELD, MISSOURI, IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES THE MOST VULNERABLE PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITY (CHILDREN, SENIORS, THOSE WITH DISABILITIES, AND IMPOVERISHED FAMILIES) BY PROVIDING A VARIETY OF SERVICES THAT MAKE A DIFFERENCE. THE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIVES THROUGH COMPASSIONATE SERVICE AND OUTREACH "BY DOING TOGETHER WHAT CAN BEST BE DONE TOGETHER."
FOR RSVP SPRINGFIELD, AN ESTIMATED 146 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN SEVERAL FOCUS AREAS. OF THIS NUMBER, 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AT-RISK ELEMENTARY STUDENTS, ASSISTING PRE-K CHILDREN IN KINDERGARTEN READINESS, GROCERY SHOPPING FOR HOMEBOUND SENIORS, AND ASSISTING FOSTER PARENTS AND CHILDREN AT THE AMBASSADORS FOR CHILDREN KID'S CLOSET. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION: K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM EXPECTS AN INCREASE OF ACADEMIC LITERACY FOR 120 STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH THIRD GRADE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $66,917 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL GRANTS AND OTHER LOCAL SUPPORT DOLLARS WITH AT LEAST THE 30% MATCH REQUIREMENT OF $28,679.

SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AREA AGENCY ON AGING, A NON-PROFIT AGENCY SERVING EIGHTEEN SOUTHEAST MISSOURI COUNTIES, HAS SPONSORED RSVP OF CAPE GIRARDEAU/SCOTT COUNTIES SINCE 1992. THE MISSION IS TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS BY OFFERING A VARIETY OF SERVICES WHILE BEING A SIGNIFICANT COMMUNITY RESOURCE. RSVP IS VITAL TO MISSION. AN UNDUPLICATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CHILDREN, LOW INCOME FAMILIES, SENIORS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. VOLUNTEERS WILL PACKAGE AND DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS, ASSIST LOCAL DISASTERS, BUILD HOMES, IMPROVE CHILDREN'S READING SKILLS, CLEAN UP PARKS, PROVIDE OUTREACH TO VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND OTHER NEEDS SPECIFIED THROUGH 96 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERIOD, 42 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE NUTRITIOUS WEEKEND MEALS DURING SCHOOL YEAR TO 1750 CHILDREN AND 70 VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER DAILY HOT NUTRITIONAL MEALS TO 980 HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN COLLABORATION WITH 6 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. FOCUS AREAS OF DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES WILL ALSO BE ADDRESSED. SURVEYS TO EVALUATE PERFORMANCE MEASURES WILL BE CONDUCTED BY ASSESSING 20% OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND 10% OF VOLUNTEERS. SURVEYS WILL REVEAL 85% OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS HAD NEEDS MET, 95% OF VOLUNTEERS SATISFIED, AND 50% MORE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES DEVELOPED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,025 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $109,652 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 56 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL HEALTHY FUTURES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OLDER ADULTS WILL FEEL INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR SUPPORT AND BE HEALTHIER.  THOSE LIVING AT OR BELOW POVERTY LEVEL WILL BE ABLE TO APPLY FOR BENEFITS AND RECEIVE BENEFITS THEY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $73,100.  OF THIS, $33,940 WILL BE MATCHING AND $39,160 WILL BE EXCESS.

THE MALDEN AREA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE (MACC) SEEKS THE OPPORTUNITY TO SPONSOR DUNKLIN COUNTY RSVP. THE MALDEN AREA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE IS ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING, PROMOTING AND PROTECTING THE COMMERCIAL, INDUSTRIAL, PROFESSIONAL, AGRICULTURAL AND CIVIC INTERESTS OF THE CITY AND ITS SURROUNDING AREA. OUR GOAL IS TO BUILD HEALTHY ECONOMICS AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN OUR REGIONAL COMMUNITIES. WE BELIEVE THAT DUNKLIN COUNTY RSVP HAS THE SAME GOAL FOR VOLUNTEERS, FAMILIES, AND INDIVIDUALS IN OUR COMMUNITY. THE MALDEN AREA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE WAS ORIGINALLY THE SPONSOR OF DUNKLIN COUNTY RSVP BEGINNING IN 1973 AND HAS CONTINUED TO MEET THE NEEDS IN DUNKLIN COUNTY, MO. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND 65 VOLUNTEERS AT FIVE (5) WORK STATIONS WILL MEET THE NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY WHICH INCLUDE AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD, AND ACCESS TO CARE. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, APPROXIMATELY 950 INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES AND 300 WILL RECEIVE OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION INFORMAITON. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $10,099.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH WILL INCLUDE IN-KIND DONATIONS AND LOCAL FUNDRAISING.

THE RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN NEW ORLEANS IS SPONSORED BY THE NEW ORLEANS COUNCIL ON AGING (NOCOA). NOCOA IS A 501.C.3 NON-PROFIT SINCE 1974. AN ESTIMATED 320 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE RSVP IN NEW ORLEANS. OF THIS NUMBER, A MINIMUM OF 103 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING THE DISADVANTAGED AND HOMELESS PEOPLE OF NEW ORLEANS TO SECURE FOOD THROUGH:  ASSIST LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS AND HOMELESS PEOPLE TO ACCESS TO FOOD, AS WELL AS WITH APPLYING FOR THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP), ASSIST THOSE THAT ARE AFFECTED BY THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC, FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, ASSIST VETERANS IN ACCESSING STATE AND FEDERAL BENEFITS, AND SUPPORT VETERANS WITH MENTAL HEALTH ACCESS, AND ASSIST WITH TUTORING /MENTORING TO STUDENTS WHO ARE FROM ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH: AS THE FRANKLIN AVENUE BAPTISTE CHURCH SHARE THE HARVEST FOOD BANK AND SENIOR SOLDIERS, ST PETER CLAVER CATHOLIC CHURCH, VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA OF GREATER NEW ORLEANS TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM, THE SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA VETERANS HEALTH CARE SYSTEM (SLVHCS), THE JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER-RESPITE PROGRAM, THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW ORLEANS UPWARD BOUND AND UNITY OF GREATER NEW ORLEANS (GNO)-FOR THE HOMELESS OF NEW ORLEANS. RSVP VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE ALSO IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY, PEOPLE PROGRAMS, THE NEW ORLEANS COUNCIL ON AGING, AND THE NEW CANAL LIGHTHOUSE MUSEUM.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEATHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT RSVP OF NEW ORLEANS WILL HAVE ASSISTED ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS  INCLUDING VETERANS, THE HOMELESS AND FAMILIES IN NEED, WITH SECURING FOOD, BUDGETING THEIR INCOME TO HELP ALLEVIATE MAKING THE DECISION OF PURCHASING FOOD, OR PAYING THEIR LIVING EXPENSES OR MORE OVERLY PAYING FOR THEIR MEDICATION. RSVP OF NEW ORLEANS VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE AT SENIOR CENTERS, LOCAL MUSEUMS, PROVIDE TUTORING/MENTORING TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, HELP NEW ORLEANS RESIDENTS WITH EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE, ASSIST SENIORS AT RESPITE PROGRAMS, AND THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST VETERANS AND VETERAN FAMILIES IN ACCESSING BENEFITS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $102,633 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,927 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE UNIVERSITY OF LOUISIANA AT MONROE (ULM) IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR RSVP OUACHITA.  ULM VALUES THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL PARTNERSHIPS INVOLVING SCHOOLS, GOVERNMENT, BUSINESSES, AND A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES.  ULM IS CATEGORIZED AS AN SREB FOUR-YEAR INSTITUTION, AS A CARNEGIE MASTER'S COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY I, AND AS A COC/SACS LEVEL VI INSTITUTION.  ULM IS PROPOSING THAT 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUACHITA, UNION, AND LINCOLN PARISHES ACROSS A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS.  ONE HUNDRED TWENTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS. RESEARCH HAS INDICATED THAT COMPANIONSHIP PROMOTES GREATER WELL-BEING, QUALITY OF LIVE, AND PROLONGS INDEPENDENT LIVING OR "AGING IN PLACE".  THIRTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SECURITY HOUSE CHECKS TO OLDER ADULTS WHO ARE WHO ARE LIVING ALONE AND PREDOMINATELY HOMEBOUND. TWENTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH FOODBANKS AND DELIVERING FOOD AS PART OF OUR "AGING IN PLACE PROGRAM".  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER FOOD BOXES TO APPROXIMATELY 150 SENIORS EACH MONTH.  THIS WILL PROMOTE ENHANCED QUALITY OF LIFE. TWENTY RSVP VETERAN VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE VET-TO-VET MENTORING WITH NEWLY RETURNING VETERANS, ASSIST IN WORKING SPECIAL EVENTS SUCH AS THE TRAVELING VIETNAM MEMORIAL WALL, AND PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO NECESSARY MEDICAL VISITS. PRESCRIPTION DRUG ABUSE IS AT EPIDEMIC PROPORTIONS IN LOUISIANA.  TWENTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP PREPARE, PRESENT AND DISTRIBUTE DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION INFORMATION TO AREA SENIORS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE SENIORS ON PROPER STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION TO AVOID BECOMING A TARGET OF THEFT AND/OR ABUSIVE TREATMENT.  ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENT DCFS DATA THERE WERE 1129 CHILDREN IN THE FOSTER CARE SYSTEM IN THE MONROE REGION (11 PARISHES) IN 2018.  MANY TIMES THESE CHILDREN ARE TAKEN IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT OR WHEN THERE IS NO TIME TO PACK THEIR BELONGINGS. THIRTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PACK BACK PACKS OR SMALL SUITCASES WITH TOILETRIES, A BLANKET, CLOTHES, AGE APPROPRIATE TOY, A MEAL, ETC.  THIS WILL PROVIDE THEM SOME SECURITY BY HAVING SOMETHING OF THEIR OWN AND A MEAL.  FINALLY, EIGHTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE IN OTHER NON-PRIORITY AREAS OF COMMUNITY NEED, SUCH AS ASSISTING MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS IN HOSPITAL EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS, ST. VINCENT DEPAUL FREE PHARMACY, HOMELAND SECURITY, LAW ENFORCEMENT, ETC.  DOCUMENTATION OF HOURS OF VOLUNTEERS' SERVICE WILL BE TABULATED MONTHLY, SURVEYS OF RSVP VOLUNTEER MOTIVATION, SATISFACTION, AND NEEDS WILL COMPRISE THE EVALUATION OF RSVP VOLUNTEER'S INVOLVEMENT; THE ADVISORY BOARD WILL EVALUATE THE FUNCTIONING OF  THE PROGRAM SUGGESTED MODIFICATION AREA, AND NEW IDEAS FOR PROGRAMMING.  STATIONS WILL PROVIDE AN EVALUATION OF RSVP VOLUNTEER EFFECTIVENESS ANNUALLY.  THROUGH THESE MIXED METHOD EVALUATION APPROACHES, INTEGRITY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE ENSURED.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $113,383 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $59,210 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA ST. TAMMANY PARISH RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 340 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 91 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION; FORTY-SEVEN (47) UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR 50 ELEMENTARY STUDENTS ONE-ON-ONE IN READING THROUGH LITERACY PROGRAMS IN TWO ST. TAMMANY PARISH PUBLIC SCHOOLS, LYON ELEMENTARY AND CHAHTA IMA ELEMENTARY.  THESE PROGRAMS ARE THE STUDENT OPPORTUNITY FOR ADVANCED READING (SOAR) PROGRAM AT LYON ELEMENTARY AND THE READING INCREASES SKILLS EVERYWHERE (RISE) PROGRAM AT CHAHTA-IMA ELEMENTARY. THESE PROGRAMS WILL SERVE STUDENTS WHO ARE AT OR BELOW BENCHMARK WITH INTERVENTIONS THAT TARGET TWO AREAS: MAINTENANCE OF SKILLS/REGRESSION PREVENTION AND ENRICHMENT/ACCELERATION. EACH SCHOOL YEAR, THE FIFTY (50) UNDUPLICATED SECOND AND THIRD GRADE STUDENTS SERVED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ACHIEVE A SEVENTY-FIVE (75) PERCENT BENCHMARK RETENTION RATE.  WE WILL HAVE TWO FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES.  TWELVE (12) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR TWENTY-SEVEN (27) SENIORS TO THE DOCTOR, PHARMACY AND GROCERY.  AS A RESULT, THE 27 SENIORS WILL BE ABLE TO REMAIN STABLY HOUSED.  THIRTY-TWO (32) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CONDUCTING WORKSHOPS AND COMPILING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO EDUCATE OUR SENIORS ON HOW TO PREVENT ELDER ABUSE, ADDRESSING THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC, AND HOW TO AVOID BECOMING A VICTIM OF SCAMS AND FRAUDS THAT ARE TYPICALLY DIRECTED TOWARD SENIORS, HURRICANE SAFETY, AND HOW TO DEAL WITH VARIOUS HEALTH ISSUES. DISPOSERX BAGS WILL BE PROVIDED TO ATTENDEES AT THE WORKSHOP IN ORDER FOR THEM TO PROPERLY DISPOSE OF UNNEEDED DRUGS IN THEIR MEDICINE CABINET. THE OUTCOME AT THE END OF EACH YEAR IS SEVENTY-FIVE (75) SENIORS WILL ATTEND WORKSHOPS, 85% OF WHOM WILL INDICATE ON A SURVEY THAT THEY HAVE GAINED A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ISSUES DISCUSSED IN THE WORKSHOP.  THE REMAINING 249 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY NEED PRIORITIES. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO IMPACT THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THEIR SERVICE AT AREA HEALTHCARE FACILITIES AND NON-PROFITS. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $90,883 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,732 OF IN-KIND AND CASH DONATIONS BY AREA BUSINESSES AND VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA.

AN ESTIMATED 200 OR MORE RSVP FOUR COUNTY VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED AND RETAINED TO SERVE THE SOUTHEAST KANSAS COUNTIES OF CHAUTAUQUA, ELK, MONTGOMERY, AND WILSON THROUGH 22 OR MORE WORK STATIONS. OF THIS NUMBER, A MINIMUM OF 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND FOOD DELIVERY TO SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS; 2) FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, AND PROVISION OF COMMUNITY/CONGREGATE MEALS; 3) HEALTH INSURANCE COUNSELING; 4) PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF PREVENTION/EDUCATION MATERIALS RELATED TO ELDER ABUSE; 5) PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF PREVENTION/EDUCATION MATERIALS RELATED TO OPIOIDS AND DRUG-DISPOSAL OPPORTUNITIES; AND 6) PARTICIPATION IN EVENTS AND EFFORTS THAT SERVE VETERANS, ACTIVE-DUTY MILITARY AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH PRIORITY FUNDING FOCUS AREAS OF ACCESS TO CARE-OPIOID ABUSE, AGING IN PLACE-ELDER JUSTICE, AND AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING. THIS PROGRAM WILL ALSO ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREA OF VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL HAVE BEEN A POSITIVE EFFECT TO THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND AN INCREASED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING (FOR ELDERLY, DISABLED, VETERANS, AND MILITARY FAMILIES),  A POSITIVE EFFECT TO THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, AND A POSITIVE EFFECT TO THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $70,150 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,662 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND EXCESS FUNDS.

FORD COUNTY RSVP, FOUNDED IN 1975, IS SPONSORED BY DODGE CITY COMMUNITY COLLEGE. OUR PROGRAM CONTRIBUTES TO THE VITALITY OF THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO NON-PROFIT, PUBLIC SERVICE AGENCIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN FORD COUNTY, WHICH INCLUDES THE CITES OF BUCKLIN, DODGE CITY, FORD, AND SPEARVILLE. OUR MISSION STATEMENT IS TO STRENGTHEN AND FORM PARTNERSHIPS IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING A POOL OF VOLUNTEER RESOURCES THAT ADDRESS CRUCIAL NEEDS IN FORD COUNTY, KS. THUS, ENABLING INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER TO REMAIN ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH MEANINGFUL SERVICE AND SERVICE THAT MEETS BOTH THE COMMUNITY AND INDIVIDUAL NEEDS.
AN ESTIMATED 126 FORD COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL AND OTHER NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS; DELIVERY OF MEALS TO THOSE IN NEED OF NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT; CONDUCTING FALL PREVENTION CLASSES LEADING TO INCREASED INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR HOME-BOUND ADULTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 40 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 240 CLIENTS, OF WHICH 90 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. 10 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, SHOPPING, BANKING AND OTHER NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS TO 80 INDIVIDUALS. 15 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP DELIVER MEALS TO 80 HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS RESIDING WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF FORD COUNTY. 10 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONDUCT A MATTER OF BALANCE FALL PREVENTION CLASSES TO 40 INDIVIDUALS. AND 5 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE IN-HOME COMPANIONSHIP TO 40 ELDERLY AND DISABLED CLIENTS. 86 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN NON-OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THESE VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS FOR THE COMMUNITY WILL INCLUDE HEALTH FAIRS, LOCAL HOSPITAL GREETERS, LIBRARY AND MUSEUM AIDES, LOCAL THEATER DOCENT AND OTHER WAYS TO STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,250 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING, CASH, AND IN-KIND, FROM DODGE CITY COMMUNITY COLLEGE, FORD COUNTY, UNITED WAY, AND INDIVIDUAL DONORS.

THE UNITED WAY OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY (UWWC) HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1977.  THE MISSION OF THE UWWC IS TO INCREASE THE COMMUNITY'S UNDERSTANDING OF HUMAN NEEDS AND TO MOBILIZE THE RESOURCES TO MEET THOSE NEEDS.  THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE A VITAL RESOURCE FOR MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS.  IT IS PROPOSED THAT AN ESTIMATED 162 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH THE REQUESTED FUNDS OF $61,246.  OF THIS NUMBER, 61 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION & COMPANIONSHIP, TUTORING STUDENTS, AND DISTRIBUTING EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL BAGS.  

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A SECONDARY FOCUS IN K-12 SUCCESS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 20 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PANTRIES THAT ASSIST IN DISTRIBUTING FOOD, 19 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ALLOW INDEPENDENCE, 4 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH OUTREACH REGARDING THE OPIOID CRISIS TO INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE, AND 18 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP TUTOR STUDENTS WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING MATH AND READING SKILLS.  

FOR THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS, EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON INCREASING ACCESS TO EMERGENCY FOOD THROUGH VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING WITH EMERGENCY FOOD DISTRIBUTION AT LOCAL PANTRIES AND COMPLETING DAY TO DAY TASKS AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF PEOPLE WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED ELDERLY AND DISABLED. EACH INTERACTION WITH A HOME BOUND INDIVIDUAL WILL BE TRACKED BY THE VOLUNTEER AND A YEARLY SATISFACTION SURVEY WILL BE COMPLETED BY CLIENTS WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF SENIORS REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  ALSO UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES - OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION, VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE OPIOID CRISIS AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SECURING OR DESTROYING UNUSED PRESCRIBED PAIN MEDICATIONS THROUGH PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND MEDICATION DISPOSAL PACKETS. SURVEYS WILL BE COMPLETED BY PARTICIPANTS WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE. FOR A SECONDARY FOCUS, K-12 SUCCESS WILL PLACE VOLUNTEERS WITHIN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO HELP TUTOR STUDENTS IN MATH OR LITERACY WITH ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF STUDENTS WITH INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN THOSE AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $61,246 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,222 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM UWWC.
