SEDGWICK COUNTY DIVISION ON AGING (SCDOA) RSVP REQUESTS $47,932 FOR SEDGWICK COUNTY KANSAS TO SUPPORT ITS 350 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WITH A SPONSOR MATCH OF $20,543. 
OF THE 350 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, 48 SEDGWICK COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SCDOA IS PROUD TO BE THE SPONSOR OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM SINCE 2004, AND LOOKS FORWARD TO PROVIDING CONTINUED SUPPORT OF THE RSVP PROGRAM IN ITS COMMUNITY. 
THE MISSION OF SCDOA IS TO ASSURE QUALITY PUBLIC SERVICES THAT PROVIDE FOR PRESENT AND FUTURE WELL-BEING OF SEDGWICK COUNTY CITIZENS. RSVP STRENGTHENS AND SUPPORTS THIS MISSION BY COLLABORATING WITH LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. THE SCDOA RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL SEEK TO SERVE OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, WHILE CONTINUING TO SERVE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND THOSE WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF SCDOA RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE HEALTHY FUTURES; PARTNERING TO ASSIST ITS COMMUNITY?S DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO MAINTAIN AN INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY AND SERVICES. 
OUTCOMES WILL REFLECT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS ALLOWING RECIPIENTS OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES THE ABILITY TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. 
VOLUNTEERS WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS MEALS AND DECREASE SOCIAL ISOLATION IN HOMEBOUND SENIORS THROUGH FOOD DELIVERY PROGRAMS. THE RSVP TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE ITS PARTNERSHIP WITH RURAL SENIOR AND COMMUNITY CENTERS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION. THE AARP TAX AIDE PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO INCREASE FINANCIAL LITERACY FOR LOW INCOME CLIENTS (THE MAJORITY OF WHICH ARE 60 OR OLDER) BY PREPARING AND E-FILING TAXES.
SCDOA LOOKS FORWARD TO CONTINUING THE RELATIONSHIP WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND PROVIDING THE COMMUNITY WITH MUCH NEEDED SERVICES.

THE MISSION OF FINNEY COUNTY RSVP, INC. IS TO STRENGTHEN AND FORM PARTNERSHIPS IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING A POOL OF VOLUNTEER RESOURCES THAT ADDRESS CRUCIAL NEEDS. ENABLING INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER TO REMAIN ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. 

AN ESTIMATED 212 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT 56 RSVP PARTNERING SITES THROUGHOUT FINNEY COUNTY.  OF THIS NUMBER, 44 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 FOR 2019-2020 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,320 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING.  
     HEALTHY FUTURES, CAPACITY BUILDING AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ARE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS VOLUNTEER PROJECT WITH OUR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING SUPPORT AND PARTICIPATING IN ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE: LOCAL NUTRITION SITES, TAX PREPARATION, MEDICARE PART D HEALTH PLANS REVIEW/COUNSELING, LEVERAGING IN-KIND OR CASH DONATIONS AND OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS.  
     OUTCOMES ARE MEASURED WITH RESEARCH-BASED AND EVIDENCE-INFORMED METHODS, INCLUDING SURVEYS AND SITE STATION RECORDS.  CONFIRMATION OF NEEDS IS OBTAINED FROM THE KANSAS CENSUS, STATE STANDARD TEST RESULTS, COMMUNITIES THAT CARE, USD 457, IRS, AND LOCAL UNIVERSITY-BASED RESEARCH.  ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: NUTRITIOUS MEALS PROVIDED, AND A SOCIAL ENVIRONMENT CREATED FOR THE ELDERLY, HOME-BOUND AND LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, WHICH ADDRESS ACCESS TO HEALTHFUL FOODS AND SOCIAL ISOLATION.  INCOME TAX PREPARATION AND MEDICARE PART D COUNSELING PROVIDED TO NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING, ELDERLY AND LOW TO MODERATE INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES.

RSVP IS THE SPONSOR BY HARVEY COUNTY, UNDER THE SUPERVISION UNDER THE DEPARTMENT ON AGING, WITH A 30 PERCENT MATCH OF $19,409.00, WHICH IS ALSO FUNDED BY CNCS AT $45,300 AMOUNT TOTAL BUDGET OF $64,709.00.  HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR HARVEY COUNTY RSVP.   ADDITIONALLY CAPACITY BUILDING, OPIOID INTERVENTION AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE GRANT.  SUPPORT FROM THE LOCAL SENIORS TO VOLUNTEER HELPING IN HEALTHY FUTURES HELP MEET THE OUTCOMES AND MEET THE NEEDS OF HARVEY COUNTY.  

HARVEY COUNTY RSVP IS LOCATED IN NEWTON KANSAS.  THE CITIES WITHIN THE AREA HARVEY COUNTY ARE BURRTON, HALSTEAD, HESSTON, NEWTON, NORTH NEWTON, SEDGWICK AND WALTON.  HARVEY COUNTY, KANSAS, IS A SEMI-URBAN COUNTY WITH AN ESTIMATED POPULATION OF 34,544 IN 2017 ACCORDING TO THE CENSUS.GOV WEBSITE.  ACCORDING TO THE 2010 CENSUS.GOV THE 539.75 SQUARE MILE AREA OF THE COUNTY LOCATED 20 MINUTES NORTH OF THE LARGEST CITY IN KANSAS IS HOME TO APPROXIMATELY 64 PERSONS PER SQUARE MILE. HARVEY COUNTY POPULATION IS 19% OF SIXTY-FIVE AND OLDER TWENTY-TWO PERCENT LIVE ALONE.  IN THIS SENIOR POPULATION 5.2 PERCENT LIVE UNDER THE NATIONAL POVERTY LEVEL OF $12,140 ACCORDING TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES.  

SUPPORT OF SENIORS THROUGH THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE A GREAT COMMUNITY NEED. BY SUPPLYING FOOD AND SAFETY CHECKS THAT LESSEN CONCERN OF INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES FOR AGED INDIVIDUALS SEEKING TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT, THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL BE ABLE TO AGE IN PLACE. THIS WILL IN TURN CREATE THE OUTCOMES OF INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT/SOCIAL TIES BY THE HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS, AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES.

AN ESTIMATED 565 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE RENO COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM.  OF THIS NUMBER, 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:

?	PROVIDING TRAINING AND EDUCATION ON THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC AND THE SAFE DISPOSAL OF MEDICATIONS.
?	SERVING AS DRIVERS AND DELIVERY PERSONS FOR MEALS ON WHEELS AND FRIENDSHIP MEALS.
?	VISITING AND/OR GROCERY SHOPPING WITH SENIOR CITIZENS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: 
?	275 HOME-BOUND SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES INCLUDING FOOD DELIVERY AND COMPANIONSHIP

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $69,672 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $65,111.

BOULDER COUNTY RSVP BOARD, INC. DBA AS CULTIVATE (FORMERLY BOULDER COUNTY CARECONNECT), WAS FOUNDED IN 1972 WITH THE MISSION TO PROMOTE THE SECURITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF OLDER ADULTS AND HELP INDIVIDUALS FLOURISH THROUGH ACTIVE ENGAGEMENT WITH THEIR COMMUNITY.  FOR OVER 46 YEARS, CULTIVATE HAS MANAGED THE BOULDER COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM AS PART OF OUR LARGER MISSION TO SERVE SENIORS IN NEED. CULTIVATE HAS ALWAYS FOCUSED ON AGING IN PLACE, WHICH MAKES THE HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE, THE APPROPRIATE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR OUR RSVP PROGRAM. THE OTHER RSVP STATIONS IN BOULDER COUNTY SUPPLEMENT CULTIVATE'S UNIQUE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO PROVIDE EVEN MORE SUPPORT TO ADULT ADULTS AGING IN PLACE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  CONTINUING THE RSVP PROGRAM MEANS AT LEAST 353 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY IN 2019 AND BEYOND AT 23 STATIONS.  250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE OUTCOME BASED ACTIVITIES IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA: HEALTHY FUTURES, ARE FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION AND HOUSING SERVICES THAT ARE ALL CRITICAL NEEDS FACING OUR AGING POPULATIONS. THE CULTIVATE RSVP PROGRAM ALSO PLACES EMPHASIS ON THE FOCUS AREA: VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES BY PROVIDING PEER BASED MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION TO VA HOSPITALS AND CLINICS.  THROUGHOUT THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 353 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE  1400 SENIORS WITH OUT-COME BASED SERVICES THAT INCREASE SOCIAL TIES, SUPPORT INDEPENDENCE, PROMOTE SAFETY AND HELP ALLEVIATE ISOLATION. CULTIVATE SURVEYS CLIENTS ANNUALLY:  80% OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED WILL REPORT THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS INCREASED THEIR LEVEL OF SOCIAL SUPPORT.  OF THE 353 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS, AT LEAST 228 WILL SERVE AT CULTIVATE STATIONS AND AN ADDITIONAL 103 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY IN A VARIETY OF MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES THAT ADDRESS CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, EDUCATION, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS, DEMONSTRATED IN THE OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.   
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $80,694 FOR YEAR 1 OF THE GRANT CYCLE WILL BE MATCHED BY $43,135 BY CULTIVATE.

AN ESTIMATED 431 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, CAPACITY BUILDING, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ACTIVE IN APACHE, COCONINO, COCHISE, GREENLEE, GRAHAM, LA PAZ, MOHAVE, NAVAJO, SANTA CRUZ, YAVAPAI, AND YUMA COUNTIES WITH STAFF PLACED IN COCONINO, MOHAVE, NAVAJO, YAVAPAI, AND YUMA COUNTIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH 200 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD WORK PLANS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL FILL CRITICAL ROLES IN FOOD BANKS AND FOOD CENTERS THAT PROVIDE EMERGENCY SERVICES TO THOSE STRUGGLING WITH FOOD INSECURITY, SERVE AS COMPANIONS/FRIENDLY VISITORS, AND DELIVER MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, FORTY-FIVE (45) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HOME DELIVERED MEALS TO 300 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH FIVE (5) PARTNER AGENCIES. NINETY (90) PERCENT WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THIRTY (30) ADDITIONAL RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH FIVE (5) PARTNER AGENCIES TO A MINIMUM OF 70 INDIVIDUALS OF WHICH 90% WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ANOTHER 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TOWARD ALLEVIATING LONG-TERM HUNGER THROUGH EMERGENCY FOOD SERVICES FOR APPROXIMATELY 10,000 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH 12 PARTNER SITES. OF THOSE, 90% PERCENT WILL REPORT THROUGH AN ANNUAL SURVEY THAT THEIR FOOD SECURITY HAS IMPROVED. 
     OTHER VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN IN K-12 CLASSROOMS; ENCOURAGING MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO PURSUE CAREER AND COLLEGE PLANS; EDUCATING SENIORS ON THE DANGERS OF OPIOID USE; PLANNING AND CARRYING OUT VETERANS STAND DOWN EVENTS; SUPPORTING VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH VETERANS SERVICE PROVIDERS; HELPING STRENGTHEN PARTNER AGENCIES' VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING ENDEAVORS; AND SERVING AS DOCENTS AND EDUCATORS AT MUSEUMS AND ARBORETUMS. RSVP HAS OVER 50 PARTNER AGENCIES AND CONTINUES TO EXPAND THE PARTNER NETWORK TO PROVIDE EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE THROUGHOUT ARIZONA.
      CSI REQUESTS $165,226 IN FEDERAL FUNDS AND SUPPLEMENTS THE CNCS' INVESTMENT WITH A MATCH OF $70,812 IN REQUIRED NON-FEDERAL FUNDING AND $5,575 IN EXCESS FUNDING FOR A TOTAL OPERATING BUDGET OF $241,613.

AN ESTIMATED 188 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 99 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, OUTREACH, INCOME TAX TUTORING, OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION, AND ELDER JUSTICE: FRAUD AND SCAM PREVENTION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 300 OLDER ADULTS, VETERANS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; $475,000.00 IN TAX REFUNDS WILL BE GENERATED BY CNCS-SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS OR NATIONAL SERVICE PARTICIPANTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $98,638.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $45,955.00.

REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL (PDC) WAS ESTABLISHED BY WEST VIRGINIA STATE CODE IN 1972 TO PROMOTE AND ASSIST WITH COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION. THE COUNCIL WILL MANAGE THE RSVP WITH AN ESTIMATED 100 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE ACROSS BERKELEY, GRANT, HAMPSHIRE, HARDY, JEFFERSON, MORGAN, MINERAL AND PENDLETON COUNTIES.  SEVENTY-SEVEN RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE UNDUPLICATED AND WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HELPING LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS GAIN ACCESS TO FOOD THROUGH DISTRIBUTION AND FOOD COLLECTION; AND PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO INDIVIDUALS TO GAIN ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE; PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIORS TO HELP THEM REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY; AND TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE WITH LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSIST WITH OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION THROUGH EDUCATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH PROGRAMS WHICH HELP WITH RECOVERY FROM ADDICTION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 25 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE 3000 BACKPACKS FILLED WITH FOOD FOR 1000 STUDENTS PER YEAR TO HAVE FOOD FOR THE WEEKEND, 60 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO FOOD AND HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS PROVIDED BY 6 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, 40 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH FOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION THROUGH LOCAL FOOD BANKS AND COMMUNITY SPONSORED EVENTS WHICH WILL PROVIDE NOURISHMENT FOR 700 FAMILIES AND 10 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO 100 INDIVIDUALS TO ASSIST WITH AGING IN PLACE. THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDING EDUCATION AND EVENTS TO ASSIST WITH DRUG ADDICTION AND THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC THAT THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA FACES TODAY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $76,679 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,862 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

IN THE PROPOSED GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 200 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE EVALUATED AND ASSIGNED TO FILL VOLUNTEER POSITIONS WITHIN THE 6 DESIGNATED FOCUS AREAS. THE PROGRAM WILL MAKE EVERY EFFORT TO ENSURE THAT THE VOLUNTEERS ARE MEETING THE DESIGNATED GUIDELINES AND ALSO THAT THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROPERLY PLACED INTO POSITIONS THAT WILL MAXIMIZE THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PROGRAM. EACH POSITION WILL BE CAREFULLY LOOKED AT AND EVALUATED TO SEE THAT THE VOLUNTEERS HAVE THE MEANS THAT THEY NEED TO PROPERLY PERFORM THE JOBS AT HAND. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING SPECIFIC TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL JOB ASSIGNMENTS.
     CULTURE PLAYS AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN DETERMINING THE NEEDS OF EACH INDIVIDUAL COUNTY. EACH COUNTY WILL BE ASSESSED TO DETERMINE THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES AND HOW THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS CAN BEST BE UTILIZED TO HELP MEET THOSE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS. THE VOLUNTEERS THAT RESIDE IN THE COMMUNITIES THAT THEY SERVE ARE VERY MUCH IN TOUCH WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS. 
     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROGRAM WILL BE "HEALTHY FUTURES". ACCORDING TO THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAU REPORT ISSUED JULY 1, 2017, 19.4% OF THE POPULATION IN WEST VIRGINIA IS COMPRISED OF SENIOR CITIZENS. THE NATIONAL AVERAGE IS 14.9% OF THE GENERAL POPULATION, ACCORDING TO THE U.S. CENSUS REPORT DATED APRIL 10, 2017. THE SAME REPORT STATES THAT THE SENIOR POPULATION NATIONALLY GREW 1.6 MILLION FROM 2014. ADDITIONALLY, THE WEST VIRGINIA PARTNERSHIP FOR ELDER LIVING PROJECTS THAT BY 2035, THE SENIOR POPULATION IN WEST VIRGINIA  IS EXPECTED TO GROW BY AT LEAST 150,000. THIS WILL RESULT IN SENIORS COMPRISING ROUGHLY 1/4 OF THE STATE'S POPULATION.
     THE COUNTIES THAT WILL BE SERVED IN THIS PROGRAM HAVE THE FOLLOWING POVERTY RATES AS TABULATED BY THE U.S. CENSUS/AMERICAN COMMUNITY 5 YEAR STUDY FROM 2013: CALHOUN COUNTY 22%, JACKSON COUNTY 19%, PLEASANTS COUNTY 14.6%, RITCHIE COUNTY 21.1%, ROANE COUNTY 24.8%, TYLER COUNTY 19.9%,WIRT COUNTY 19.3% AND WOOD COUNTY 16.2%.  THE AVERAGE IN WEST VIRGINIA FOR SENIOR CITIZENS, ACCORDING TO THE U.S. CENSUS IS 19.4%.
     THE RSVP PARTICIPANTS WILL BE VOLUNTEERING IN POSITIONS THAT WILL HELP OTHERS DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A HEALTHY WAY OF LIFE. THE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE WILL VARY BY COUNTY BUT WILL INCLUDE: HEALTH AND WELLNESS CHECKUPS, INSTRUCTIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL CLASSES, FOOD PREPARATION, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, VARIOUS FORMS AND TYPES OF EXERCISE, ACCESS TO POOL FACILITIES AND INSTRUCTION, HEALTH FAIRS, MONTHLY BLOOD DONATIONS, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY, AND SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD VOUCHERS.
      THE PROGRAM WILL USE OTHER PERFORMANCE MEASURES TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL MAXIMIZE THE TALENTS OF THE VOLUNTEERS IN THE INDIVIDUAL COUNTIES. INCORPORATING EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS INTO THE PROGRAM WILL EXPAND THE REACH AND IMPACT OF THE VOLUNTEERS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.
     THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $113,317 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $49,720 RAISED THROUGH CASH AND IN-KIND MATCH TO THE PROGRAM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE 200  RSVP  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.    THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL BE TO IMPLEMENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION PROGRAMS INTO 16 STATIONS TO NETWORK WITH:  THE FOUR COUNTY BOARD OF EDUCATIONS, LAW ENFORCEMENT'S, MEDICAL AND MENTAL PROFESSIONALS, SENIOR NUTRITION SITES, AND NON-PROFIT CIVIC ORGANIZATION TO EDUCATED THE IMPORTANCE OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE FOR CHILDREN, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  WE WILL WORK WITH PROFESSIONALS THAT WILL PROVIDE RESEARCH BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE TO CHILDREN, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  PROPER EDUCATION ABOUT SUBSTANCE ABUSE IS CRUCIAL PREVENTATIVE MEASURE FOR KIDS, TEENAGERS, AND ADULTS.  THE RSVP  VOLUNTEERS WILL SHARE FACTUAL INFORMATION ABOUT SUBSTANCE ABUSE TO 400  ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE, AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS BY ADDRESSING ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL LEARNING TO ADDRESS RISK FACTORS FOR DRUG ABUSE, SUCH AS EARLY AGGRESSION, ACADEMIC FAILURE, AND SCHOOL DROPOUT.  THE TRAINING WILL FOCUS ON HELPING STUDENTS TO DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR SELF-CONTROL, EMOTIONAL AWARENESS,  COMMUNICATION, SOCIAL PROBLEM-SOLVING, ACADEMIC SUPPORT, AND IDENTIFYING TRUSTED ADULTS WHEN SEEKING HELP.  ALSO THE VOLUNTEERS WILL EDUCATE OVER 2,000 SENIOR CITIZENS ABOUT OPIOID MISUSE, PRESCRIPTION ABUSE, AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SAFE DISPOSAL OF MEDICATIONS.  THEY WILL PROVIDE INFORMATIONAL PAMPHLETS AND RESOURCES TO INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF OPIOIDS AND PRESCRIPTION DRUG ABUSE.  ALONG WITH INFORMATION ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION PROGRAMS THAT CAN ASSIST WITH SOMEONE OR THEMSELVES IF DEALING WITH AN ADDITION PROBLEM.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES/OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 400 STUDENTS WILL HAVE BEEN EDUCATED ON THE IMPORTANCE OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND OVER 2,000 SENIOR CITIZENS IN THE FOUR COUNTY AREA WHICH IS 10% (OF 22,233 SENIORS IN THE FOUR COUNTIES) WILL HAVE RECEIVED INFORMATIONAL RESOURCES ON SUBSTANCE ABUSE.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $81,394.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,861.00.
THE VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE NOT SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS EMBRACE OTHER VOLUNTEER SERVICES WITH MANY OTHER COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.  ALMOST DAILY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES PRESENT THEMSELVES AND FORTUNATELY ARE MET BY MANY SELFLESS INDIVIDUALS WILLING TO DEDICATE THEIR TIME AND ABILITIES REQUIRED FOR THESE CHALLENGES.  THE VOLUNTEERS IN FAYETTE AND NICHOLAS COUNTIES HELP TO FUND RAISE FOR THE AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY RELAY FOR LIFE.  IN WEBSTER AND GREENBRIER COUNTIES THEY CLEAN AND MAINTAIN THEIR COUNTY ROADSIDE PARKS; POLICEMAN AND FIREFIGHTERS VOLUNTEER THEIR TIME FOR DISASTER PREPAREDNESS CLASSES PROMOTED BY RSVP AND OUR NEIGHBORHOOD WATCH GROUPS; LOCAL HISTORICAL SITES ARE PROMOTED AND MAINTAINED BY A DEDICATED GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS MOBILIZED THROUGH RSVP.  ADDITIONALLY THEY WORK WITH OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICE ORIENTED PROGRAMS SUCH AS 4-H AND BOY SCOUTS AMERICA.  THE VOLUNTEERS WORKING WITH 4-H CAMPS TEACH CHILDREN COOKING, SEWING, CRAFTS, ETC.  SOME OF OUR OLDER MALE VOLUNTEERS ENJOY WORKING WITH SCOUTING.  IT GIVES THEM AN OPPORTUNITY TO PASS ALONG THEIR CAMPING AND BASIC SURVIVAL SKILLS TO LADS WHO PROBABLY OTHERWISE WOULD NOT GET ATTENTION.

BURLINGTON HOUSING AUTHORITY (BHA) IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR ALAMANCE COUNTY RSVP.  FORMED IN 1967, BHA'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SAFE, DECENT AND SANITARY HOUSING FOR PERSONS OF LOW INCOME, INCLUDING FAMILIES AND ELDERLY, HANDICAPPED AND/OR DISABLED PERSONS.  THE GOALS OF THE AGENCY ARE TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT, FINANCING OR OPERATION OF LOW-INCOME HOUSING AND PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICES NECESSARY FOR PERSONS TO ENJOY ACADEMIC, ECONOMIC, AND QUALITY OF LIFE SUCCESS.
WE PROPOSE TO RECRUIT 77 UNDUPLICATED, RSVP VOLUNTEERS: 67 UNDER THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION, SERVING AS TUTORS AND MENTORS FOR AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH AT 10 VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDING SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY-BASED AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS; AND 10 UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES, PROVIDING TELECARE COMPANIONSHIP WHERE 5 VOLUNTEERS WILL CALL 10 CLIENTS ON AN AVERAGE OF 80 CALLS PER MONTH.  ALSO UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES, OUR 5 MEALS ON WHEELS VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS TOP THOSE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AS WELL AS OUR 5 CONGREGATE MEAL VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE MEALS DAILY FOR THOSE AT BURLINGTON HOMES. 

TUTORING PROGRAMS WILL WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ALAMANCE-BURLINGTON SCHOOL SYSTEM AND COMMUNITY AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS LITERACY AND MATH.  WE WILL STRIVE FOR AN 85% SUCCESS RATE IN END OF GRADE TESTING SUCCESS EACH YEAR.

MENTORING PROGRAMS WILL TARGET AT-RISK YOUTH, ENCOURAGING THEM TO ATTEND SCHOOL AND AVOID GANG ACTIVITY.  OUR PARTNERS WILL BE THE DEPARTMENT OF JUVENILE JUSTICE DELINQUENCY PREVENTION DIVISION, LOCAL SCHOOLS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT.  OUR GOALS ARE TO REDUCE GANG INVOLVEMENT AND INCREASE OVERALL SCHOOL ATTENDANCE BY 75%.

THE TELECARE REASSURANCE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE A SUPPORT SYSTEM FOR OLDER ADULTS IN ALAMANCE COUNTY WHO ARE HOMEBOUND, LIVING ALONE, ILL OR DISABLED, INCLUDING VETERANS.    

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $77,166.00 FOR THIS RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,154.00 (30 % MATCH) FROM BHA.

COAHOMA OPPORTUNITIES, INCORPORATED IS A COMMUNITY-ACTION AGENCY THAT AIMS TO ASSIST LOW-INCOME CITIZENS IN BECOMING SELF-SUFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE.  COAHOMA OPPORTUNITIES, INC. HAS BEEN SERVING COAHOMA COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI OVER 53 YEARS AND HAS DEVELOPED A STRONG VALUABLE WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH PROGRAMS AND BUSINESSES IN COAHOMA COUNTY, SERVING 78% (AFRICAN AMERICANS), 19% (CAUCASIANS), BELOW 1% HISPANIC/LATINO AND BELOW 1% ASIANS.  SERVING THE RURAL MISSISSIPPI DELTA REGION FOR DECADES, THE AGENCY IS GOVERNED BY A BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHOSE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS PLANNING THE DIRECTION AND DEFINING THE FUTURE OF THE AGENCY.  THE BOARD DELEGATES TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR THE MAJOR RESPONSIBILITY AND THE AUTHORITY, DERIVED FROM THE BOARD, OF SELECTING THE SPECIFIC MEANS TO ACHIEVE THE GOALS THAT HAVE BEEN DETERMINED FOR PROMOTING THE GROWTH, SUSTAINABILITY AND EFFICIENCY OF THE COMMUNITY. 
NONETHELESS, THE MISSISSIPPI DELTA REGION IS HOME TO THE BLUES, AND ARTS CULTURE, AND UNFORTUNATELY, POVERTY.  WITH 48% OF COAHOMA COUNTY LIVING IN POVERTY, COAHOMA OPPORTUNITIES, INCORPORATED HAS, FOR MANY DECADES, PROVIDED RESOURCES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE COMMUNITY AND ITS CITIZENS.  AS THE NATION EXPERIENCED A DOWN-TURN IN THE ECONOMY, THE IMPACT FELT BY THE MISSISSIPPI DELTA WAS ENORMOUS.  MANY OF OUR CITIZENS, INCLUDING THE ELDERLY, HAVE FELT THE STAGNATION AND EXPERIENCED THE LACK OF JOB OPPORTUNITIES, WHICH WERE ONCE AVAILABLE TO OUR CITIZENS.  INASMUCH AS THIS HAS CAUSED UNDUE STRESS TO MANY HARDSHIPS TO MANY, INCLUDING SENIOR CITIZENS, IT IS EVEN MORE UNFORTUNATE THAT A LACK OF JOB OPPORTUNITIES SERVE AS THE ROOT CAUSE OF THE ESCALATION IN CRIMINAL ACTIVITIES AND THE UNWANTED EPIDEMIC BEING EXPERIENCED VERY VASTLY ALL ACROSS AMERICA, OPIOID OVERDOSES.  OUR SENIORS AND ELDERS ARE MOST VULNERABLE IN A CRIME-INFESTED COMMUNITY, WHERE THIS EPIDEMIC, TOO, IS WIDE-SPREADING AND OUR EFFORTS ARE TO KEEP THE SENIORS SAFE AND WITH A SENSE OF SECURITY.   IN SPITE OF THESE OBSTACLES AND ON-GOING BARRIERS, OUR AGENCY HAS ESTABLISHED SUCCESSFUL AND MEANINGFUL COLLABORATION WORKING AFFILIATION WITH THE COMMUNITY, LOCAL EDUCATION AGENCIES, CHILDCARE FACILITIES, THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE, MAJOR INDUSTRIES, CHURCHES, LOCAL BUSINESSES, THE POLICE DEPARTMENT, THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT, TREATMENT CENTERS, THE LOCAL HOSPITAL, MENTAL HEALTH AGENCIES AND OTHER PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE AN ENGAGING EXPERIENCE FOR OUR SENIORS AND VOLUNTEERS, AS WE SEEK TO ADDRESS SOCIETAL ILLS AND THIS WIDELY KNOWN EPIDEMIC.
FURTHER, COAHOMA OPPORTUNITIES, INCORPORATED RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS CONTINUOUSLY WORKING TO FULFILL THE MISSION OF THIS AGENCY AND THE PROGRAM, BY PROVIDING QUALITY AND TIMELY SERVICES TO THE SENIOR, YOUTH AND ADULT RESIDENTS OF COAHOMA COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS PROVIDING EDUCATION ASSISTANCE TO THE YOUTH THROUGH TUTORING AND MENTORING PROGRAMS AND SCHOOL READINESS FOR HEAD START EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION.  THE THERE ARE TEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS THAT THE RSVP PROGRAM USES TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE, SCHOOL READINESS AND TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AWARENESS FOR THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC.  THESE VOLUNTEER STATIONS CONSIST OF FOUR (4) HEAD START CENTERS, ONE (1) POLICE DEPARTMENT, ONE (1) SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT, TWO (2) ADULT SENIOR RESPICE CENTERS, ONE (1) CHURCH, AND ONE (1) CARE STATION.  THESE VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE SET UP THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY OF COAHOMA COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI..  THERE ARE AN ESTIMATED 112 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING WITH THE COAHOMA COUNTY RSVP.  OF THIS NUMBER, 40 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME EDUCATION ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING AND MENTORING YOUTH AND ADULTS, SCHOOL READINESS FOR HEAD START EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS WHO ARE WITHOUT TRANSPORTATION, OFFERING SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP FOR SENIORS WHO ARE HOME-BOUND, PARTICIPATING IN NEIGHBORHOOD WATCH, AND FEEDING AND PREPARING FOOD THE LESS

HARRISON COUNTY HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY'S MISSION IS TO ESTABLISH A BASE OF SERVICES FOR THE AGING WITH A SPECIAL FOCUS ON VETERANS, HANDICAPPED, ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY DEPRIVED. TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY (250) VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY SERVICES THAT MEET CRITICAL NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY. SIXTY ONE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED AND THIRTY DOLLARS ($61,531) IS BEING REQUESTED TO SUPPORT THIS EFFORT. THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) ADDRESSES THE AGING POPULATION WITH A FOCUS OF OPIOID ABUSE, HOME BOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOWS THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ASSIST SENIORS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM DOCTOR'S VISITS. VOLUNTEERS ASSIST WITH BUILDING HANDICAP RAMPS TO ENABLE DISABLED SENIORS TO GET IN AND OUT OF THEIR HOMES TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING. THEY ASSIST WITH SERVING AND HELPING PREPARE MEALS AT FOOD KITCHENS AND WITH FOOD DELIVERIES TO INDIVIDUALS UNABLE TO LEAVE THEIR PERSONAL RESIDENCE DUE TO DISABILITY, INJURY OR AGE. ACCORDING TO THE CENTER ON ADDICTION, IF THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC CONTINUES TO ACCELERATE AT ITS CURRENT RATE, 500,000 PEOPLE WILL DIE IN THE NEXT DECADE. VOLUNTEERS WILL GO INTO THE COMMUNITY AND EDUCATE SENIORS ABOUT WHAT THEY NEED TO KNOW ABOUT OPIOIDS. VOLUNTEERS WILL DO PRESENTATIONS AT SENIOR CENTERS, CLUBS, CHURCHES, ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES AND MORE.  TEACHING MATERIALS ARE OBTAINED FROM LOCAL SHERIFF DEPARTMENT, THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE, AMERICAN SOCIETY ON AGING AND CENTERS FOR ADDICTIONS. RSVP NETWORK WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AS A RESOURCE TO COLLECT UNUSED MEDICATION FROM HOMEBOUND SENIORS TO HELP KEEP THEM OUT OF THE WRONG HANDS.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE ALONG WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT ON NATIONAL DRUG TAKE BACK DAY. THE HARRISON COUNTY SHERIFF DEPARTMENT WILL TRAIN VOLUNTEERS TO REACH OUT TO THE AGING POPULATION TO EDUCATE THEM ON THE LATEST SCAMS TARGETING SENIORS AND TO BE AWARE OF ELDER ABUSE.     
ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT TO HOME-BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITHIN  HARRISON COUNTY AND AN INCREASE TO SENIORS ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. HARRISON COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) WILL NETWORK WITH OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO MEET CRITICAL NEEDS IN OUR AREA AND TO ADDRESS AREAS OUTLINED IN THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE PLAN. AGENCIES SUCH AS THE DISABILITY CONNECTION, AREA AGENCY ON AGING, LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES, THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION HOSPITAL, HABITAT FOR HUMANITY, CATHOLIC CHARITIES, AMERICAN RED CROSS AND ARMED FORCES RETIREMENT HOME WILL REQUEST ASSISTANCE FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THEIR ORGANIZATIONS GOALS. 
.

PART II, SECTION A. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: UNITED WAY OF THE BLUEGRASS (UWBG) IS AN IRS 501 (C) (3) APPROVED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITIES. IT ACCOMPLISHES THIS BY FOCUSING ON EDUCATION IN THE BLUEGRASS REGION OF KENTUCKY. UWBG IS HEADQUARTERED IN LEXINGTON, KENTUCKY AND IS A CURRENT GRANTEE UNDER THE RSVP PROGRAM. UWBG HAS EXPERIENCED SIGNIFICANT SUCCESS THROUGH ITS EDUCATION FOCUSED RSVP VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN ANDERSON, CLARK, SCOTT AND WOODFORD COUNTIES. AN ESTIMATED 169 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVED UNDER THIS PROJECT IN THESE FOUR COUNTIES DURING THE 2013 - 2016 PERFORMANCE PERIOD, WITH A FEDERAL SHARE OF $76,496, WITH A NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $38,548. ADDITIONALLY, 21 NEW VOLUNTEERS WERE RECRUITED FOR THE 2016 - 2017 SCHOOL YEAR AND 10 NEW VOLUNTEERS WERE RECRUITED IN 2017- 2018 (YTD.) THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS SIGNIFICANT COMMUNITY NEEDS IN THE AREA OF EDUCATION. KENTUCKY LAGS NATIONALLY, AND GLOBALLY, IN KEY EDUCATION INDICATORS. FOR EXAMPLE, KENTUCKY RANKS 49TH IN THE NATION IN THE NUMBER OF CITIZENS ACHIEVING A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND 47TH AMONG THOSE RECEIVING A FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE DEGREE. THIRTY-SIX PERCENT OF THE WORKING POPULATION IN KENTUCKY IS AT THE TWO LOWEST LITERACY LEVELS. WORKING TO ADDRESS THESE EDUCATION CHALLENGES, UNITED WAY ENDEAVORS TO RAISE AWARENESS, RAISE RESOURCES, MATCH RESOURCES TO MEET THE NEEDS, AND IMPLEMENT VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS LIKE RSVP TO FILL THE GAPS. TUTORING AND MENTORING, PROVEN RESEARCH-BASED METHODS THAT ENHANCE A CHILD'S ACADEMIC JOURNEY, WILL BE THE VOLUNTEER VEHICLES USED TO ADDRESS THESE NEEDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE TUTORING, COACHING AND MENTORING. THE SECONDARY FOCUS OF IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE ADULT LITERACY. THE MAJORITY OF PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL BE CONCENTRATED IN THE CNCS "EDUCATION" FOCUS AREA AND INCLUDE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND ENHANCING EFFECTIVE EDUCATION VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.AN ESTIMATED 125 RSVP (UNDUPLICATED) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING THE 2016 - 2019 PERFORMANCE PERIOD. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING K-12 STUDENTS, MENTORING K-12 STUDENTS, TUTORING ADULT STUDENTS, MENTORING ADULT STUDENTS, READING WITH CHILDREN, AND RECRUITING ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS. THE PRIMARY IMPACT AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 125 VOLUNTEERS WILL REACH 4000 STUDENTS (ED2), 1572 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT (ED27) AND 35 PROGRAM PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT THREE OR MORE EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (G3-3.3). THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $73,496 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,341.

VISION:  
LIVING LONGER, LIVING SAFELY, LIVING WELL

MISSION:
TO COORDINATE A SYSTEM OF SERVICES THAT PROMOTES THE WELL-BEING AND INDEPENDENCE OF OLDER AND DISABLED GEORGIANS, HELPING THEM ACHIEVE HEALTHY AND SELF-SUFFICIENT LIVES.

VALUES:  
LISTEN TO OLDER PEOPLE AND OUR PARTNERS WHO SERVE THEM.
ADVOCATE ON THE BEHALF OF OUR CONSUMERS BY ANTICIPATING THEIR NEEDS.
PRODUCE MEASURABLE OUTCOMES THAT SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACT THE WELL-BEING OF OLDER PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILY CAREGIVERS.
RESPOND TO CHANGING NEEDS AND PREFERENCES OF OUR DIVERSE AND GROWING ELDERLY POPULATION.
ACCOUNTABILITY AND RESULTS.

THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF RSVP OF DUVAL COUNTY SINCE 1985. THE MISSION OF THE SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION IS TO ENCOURAGE AND EMPOWER SENIOR CITIZENS TO LIVE ACTIVE, INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLES THROUGH SOCIAL, EDUCATIONAL AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF RSVP IS TO ENGAGE PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS AND TO PROVIDE A HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF VOLUNTEERS. RSVP OF DUVAL COUNTY STRIVES TO ALIGN THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE'S MISSION WITH RSVP'S PURPOSE BY PROVIDING FULFILLING VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT MEET THE COMMUNITY NEEDS. 

AN ESTIMATED 383 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN DUVAL COUNTY. OF THE 383 VOLUNTEERS, 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES; THE OTHER 300 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. RSVP OF DUVAL COUNTY VOLUNTEERS KNOW AND UNDERSTAND THE VITAL ROLE THEY PLAY IN HELPING TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND HEALTH IN JACKSONVILLE.  THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES FOR THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE TUTORING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS TO IMPROVE LITERACY RATES, DECREASE SOCIAL ISOLATION BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIORS AT LOW INCOME SENIOR HOUSING, AS WELL AS PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN NUTRITION AND FOOD SECURITY TO VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL IMPROVE 1,000 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENT LITERACY RATES, IMPROVE SOCIALIZATION IN 300 SENIORS AND INCREASE FOOD SECURITY IN 150 VETERANS. TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOCUS AREA OUTCOMES, VOLUNTEERS WILL READ ALOUD TO PRE-K, KINDERGARTEN AND 1ST GRADE CLASSES, VISIT AT RISK SENIORS ON A WEEKLY BASIS AND SERVE MEALS TO HOMELESS VETERANS. WE ARE REQUESTING THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $69,049 TO PARTNER WITH THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE?S MATCH OF $192,500 TO FUND PROJECTS THAT WILL ACHIEVE AN IMPROVEMENT IN LITERACY RATES, DECREASE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY.

VOLUNTEERS FOR COMMUNITY IMPACT, INC. (VCI)'S MISSION IS TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS THAT ADD VALUE TO THE COMMUNITY BY UTILIZING THE EXPERIENCE OF CARING ADULTS THROUGH HIGH-IMPACT VOLUNTEER SERVICE. VCI HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF RSVP OF OSCEOLA COUNTY SINCE 2012 AND IS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE CENTRAL FLORIDA COMMUNITY THROUGH RECRUITING, TRAINING, PLACING, RECOGNIZING, AND RETAINING VOLUNTEERS AGED 55 AND OVER TO MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH CNCS INITIATIVES. ADDITIONALLY, VCI IS THE SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM THAT SERVES ORANGE, OSCEOLA, SEMINOLE AND VOLUSIA COUNTIES, AS WELL AS RSVP IN ORANGE COUNTY. 

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR VCI HAS STRATEGICALLY ALIGNED THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S SERVICE CATEGORIES, PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND CURRENT INITIATIVES.

SUPPORT AGENCIES--TO THOSE SEVERELY FOOD INSECURE. AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 2,200 FOOD INSECURE OSCEOLA COUNTY RESIDENTS WITH AT LEAST 25% SUBSTANTIAL GAINS IN LONG-TERM FOOD SECURITY. 

AS A DIRECT RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS, 2,255 RESIDENTS OF OSCEOLA COUNTY WILL RECEIVE INCREASED SERVICES IN HEALTHY FUTURES AND OTHER IDENTIFIED AREAS. THIS ALLOWS FOR A MORE DIVERSE POOL OF VOLUNTEERS TO UTILIZE THEIR EXPERIENCES AND INTERESTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $105,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $42,477 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, THROUGH BOTH CASH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS.

VOLUNTEERS FOR COMMUNITY IMPACT, INC. (VCI)'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE LIVES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM.  VCI IMPROVES NOT JUST THE LIVES OF UNDERSERVED FAMILIES, BUT ALSO THE LIVES OF VOLUNTEERS WHO DONATE THEIR TIME AND PASSIONS TO MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  VCI ENABLES VOLUNTEERS THROUGH OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FGP) AND RSVP PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS SMALLER LOCAL BASED VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS. 

VCI IS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE CENTRAL FLORIDA COMMUNITY THROUGH RECRUITING, TRAINING, PLACING, RECOGNIZING, AND RETAINING VOLUNTEERS AGED 55 AND OVER TO MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH CNCS INITIATIVES.  VCI IS THE SPONSOR RSVP OF ORANGE COUNTY (SINCE 1974), RSVP OF OSCEOLA COUNTY (SINCE 2012), AND IS THE SPONSOR OF FLORIDA'S LARGEST FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP)(SINCE 1974).  OUR FGP PROGRAM SERVES ORANGE, OSCEOLA, SEMINOLE AND VOLUSIA COUNTIES WITH 300 FGP VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE 1 ON 1 MENTORING SERVICES FOR ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGED STUDENTS. 

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR VCI HAS STRATEGICALLY ALIGNED THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE'S SERVICE CATEGORIES, PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND CURRENT INITIATIVES. THIS PROPOSAL IS REFLECTIVE OF THE SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION OF RSVP TO AN IMPACT-BASED PROGRAM. 

105 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED ACTIVITIES TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES OF SUPPORTING VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND MENTORING SEMINOLE COUNTY ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS TO ACHIEVE GREATER ACADEMIC SUCCESS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA, OUR SECONDARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA.  

VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SEMINOLE PUBLIC SCHOOL?S (SCPS) DIVIDEND'S PROGRAMS PROVIDING TUTORING, MENTORING AND EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT TO ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS.  SCPS WAS THE FORMER SPONSOR OF SEMINOLE COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM BUT RELINQUISHED SPONSORSHIP IN 2017.  VCI HAS MET WITH SCPS TO LEARN THE PARTICULARS OF SCPS'S SPONSORSHIP OF RSVP AND TO ENSURE THAT VCI COULD ASSUME RSVP OBLIGATIONS TO PROVIDE CONTINUITY OF SERVICE TO RSVP PARTNERS AND STATIONS.  VCI HAS COMMITTED TO CONTINUING THE PREVIOUS WORK OF SCPS' RSVP PROGRAM, AND WILL WORK WITH SCPS TO REACH OUT TO PREVIOUS RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND RE-ENROLL THEM IN THE PROGRAM.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE WITH SCPS' FAMILIES IN TRANSITION (FIT) PROGRAM (AN INITIATIVE TO SUPPORT THE FAMILIES OF HOMELESS STUDENTS) AND ENSURE THAT STUDENTS HAVE ACCESS TO CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION BY REMOVING STRUCTURAL BARRIERS DUE TO HOMELESSNESS. 

ADDITIONALLY, VCI WILL PARTNER WITH SEMINOLE COUNTY GOVERNMENT TO SUPPORT THEIR VETERANS SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED 300-5OO ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS, ENSURING THAT 70% OF MENTORED STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  VCI WILL ALSO ENGAGE 5 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE MILITARY VETERANS TO SERVE IN VETERANS COURT.  VETERANS COURT IS A PROGRAM OF SEMINOLE COUNTY GOVERNMENT WHERE VETERANS WHO HAVE MINOR CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS ARE MATCHED WITH A VETERAN MENTOR WHO ASSISTS THE VETERAN OFFENDER IN SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE TERMS OF THEIR LEGAL ADJUDICATION.  VETERAN MENTORS WORK WITH CLIENTS FOR 8-10 MONTHS (ALTHOUGH MANY REMAIN FRIENDS WITH THEIR MENTEES AFTER THE OFFENDER HAS COMPLETED THE REQUIRED RESTITUTION FOR THEIR OFFENSE) TO HELP THEM TRANSITION BACK INTO BEING A LAW-ABIDING MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY.  AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD RSVP VETERAN VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ASSISTED 50 VETERAN OFFENDERS IN COMPLETING THEIR CRIMINAL EDICTS AND AGAIN BECOMING PRODUCTIVE MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $105,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $40,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, THROUGH BOTH CASH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 500 CITRUS COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THEIR COMMUNITY; WITH AN ESTIMATED 152 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. THEY WILL SERVE AS HOME DELIVERED MEALS DRIVERS DELIVERING NUTRITIOUS HOT AND FROZEN MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN THE MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM. THIS PROGRAM ALSO LENDS ITSELF TO INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT TO ASSIGNED HOMEBOUND SENIORS WHO LIVE ALONE, IN ORDER THAT THEY MAY FEEL SECURE IN THEIR HOMES AND LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE THE ENTIRE POPULATION BY HANDING OUT FOOD TO THOSE IN NEED SO THEY MAY INCREASE THE FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN.
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO OFFER A FRIENDLY AND FAMILIAR VOICE, SOCIALIZATION,  REASSURANCE, THROUGH THE TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM. IN THE FOOD STAMP ASSISTANCE PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST APPLICANTS OF THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM WITH THE APPLICATION PROCESS SO THAT THEY WILL BE ABLE TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS OF FOOD TO MEET THEIR FAMILY'S NUTRITIONAL NEEDS. CITRUS COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE AT THE LOCAL COUNTY ANIMAL SHELTER, TUTOR AND MENTOR YOUTH, GIVE TAX FILING ASSISTANCE, FAMILY COUNSELING, AND CONDUCT ADULT LITERACY CLASSES, GIVE EDUCATIONAL TOURS AT TWO LOCAL MUSEUMS, SERVE AS MASTER GARDENERS, SERVE CONGREGATE MEALS TO SENIORS, AND WORK IN THRIFT STORES. THEY WILL WORK AT HOSPICE TO OFFER COMPANIONSHIP, READ TO HOSPICE PATIENTS, RUN ERRANDS FOR PATIENT FAMILY MEMBERS, AND OFFER RESPITE CARE TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS, AND ASSIST IN SERVICE SUPPORT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE HPH THRIFT STORE. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE STATE PARKS, TRAILS, AND THE FOREST, AS WELL AS VARIOUS CONSTRUCTION AND SUPPORT TASKS FOR HABITAT FOR HUMANITY. IN THE AREA OF VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES, THE SCOPE OF THE VOLUNTEER WORK TO BE DONE WILL INCLUDE THE LECANTO VA OUTREACH CLINIC. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ALSO ASSIST VETERANS WITH CHECK IN, ASSIST WITH REGISTRATION IN THE MYHEALTHEVET PROGRAM, ESCORT VETERANS IN THE LAB AREA, ANSWER PHONES, AND PERFORM OTHER LIGHT OFFICE TASKS. THIS SITE PLAYS AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE DIRECT SERVICE TO VETERANS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $83,355 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,996 IN IN-KIND AND CASH MATCH FROM THE CITRUS COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSION, AND $8,362 FROM OTHER NON-PROFIT SOURCES.

MIAMI-DADE COUNTY (MDC) IS THE MOST POPULOUS COUNTY IN FLORIDA, WITH MORE THAN 2.7 MILLION RESIDENTS. MDC IS 67.7% HISPANIC, 16.1% BLACK (INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS OF HAITIAN DESCENT), 13.6% WHITE, 1.55% ASIAN, AND 0.6% OTHER (DATA USA, 2015). THE MOST REPRESENTED LANGUAGES ARE ENGLISH, SPANISH AND FRENCH/CREOLE. THE COMMUNITY ACTION AND HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT (CAHSD) IS PART OF MDC GOVERNMENT. ITS MISSION IS TO EMPOWER ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, RESOURCE MOBILIZATION, AND SERVICE DELIVERY. THE ELDERLY AND DISABILITY SERVICES DIVISION (EDSD) PROVIDES CULTURALLY SENSITIVE AND QUALITY SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE. EDSD HAS BEEN SPONSORING THE RSVP PROGRAM FOR MORE THAN THIRTY NINE (39) YEARS.  RSVP PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS AND OLDER TO USE THEIR TALENTS, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF OTHERS IN MEANINGFUL WAYS. 

THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ELDER AFFAIRS (DOEA) 2017 COUNTY PROFILE IDENTIFIED MDC AS ONE OF THE LARGEST CONCENTRATIONS OF LOW-INCOME MINORITY OLDER ADULTS, OF THIS AMOUNT 172,170 ELDERS ARE LIVING ALONE AND BELOW THE 125 PERCENTILE POVERTY GUIDELINES.
AN ESTIMATED 369 RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO ADDRESS THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS. OF THIS NUMBER, 107 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING (K-12), MENTORING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES (INDEPENDENT LIFE SKILLS), OFFERING DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND COMPANIONSHIP/RESPITE TO SENIORS AS WELL AS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS ARE THE FOLLOWING: 1) EDUCATION, 2) VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES; 3) HEALTHY FUTURES, AND 4) DISASTER SERVICES. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) INVESTMENT OF FEDERAL DOLLARS IN THE AMOUNT OF $104,310, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $158,498 OF COUNTY GENERAL FUND DOLLARS, FOR A TOTAL OF $262,809. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE IN-KIND DONATIONS OF $43,992.

AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ATHENS-LIMESTONE, ALABAMA (ALC) RSVP.  OF THIS NUMBER 133 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION (ACCESS TO CARE), AND COMPANIONSHIP TO INSURE A CARING QUALITY OF LIFE AND LIVING INDEPENDENTLY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD ALC RSVP WILL DEPLOY 101 (50%) OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE CARE, AND MEALS ON WHEELS FOR 100 HOMEBOUND CLIENTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND TRANSPORTATION TO 50 CLIENTS PROVIDING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE;  15 VOLUNTEERS (8%) WILL BE DEPLOYED TO EDUCATION INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING IN THE AREAS OF K-12 SUCCESS TUTORING 150 STUDENTS IN THE AREAS OF LITERACY AND MATH TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES;  17 VOLUNTEERS (9%) WILL SERVE IN ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDING  FINANCIAL LITERACY THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO MORE THAN 1800 ELDERLY, VETERANS AND LOW INCOME (A TOTAL OF 133 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME PERFORMANCE MEASURES) AND THE REMAINING 67 (33%) RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN CNCS FOCUS AREAS (COMMUNITY PRIORITIES) HELPING THE ELDERLY, DISADVANTAGED, VETERANS AND/OR FAMILY MEMBERS BY PROVIDING RESOURCES TO NONPROFIT AND PUBLIC AGENCIES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $132,514.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $74,882.00.

PART II -- SECTION A. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
RSVP OF TUSCALOOSA AND HALE COUNTIES IS SPONSORED BY FOCUS ON SENIOR CITIZENS, INC. FOCUS ON SENIOR CITIZENS IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, WITH 501 ? (3) STATUS AND WAS INCORPORATED IN 1972. FOCUS OFFERS A BROAD SPECTRUM OF PROGRAMMING AND SOCIAL SERVICES, INCLUDING: LOW-COST NUTRITION, COUNTY WIDE TRANSPORTATION, REPRESENTATIVE PAYEE SERVICES AND A FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ALSO THROUGH SENIOR CORP. FOCUS HAS DELIVERED LASTING, MEANINGFUL RESULTS BY MAINTAINING A SUCCESSFUL RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 1972, WHICH SPEAKS WELL OF OUR EXPERTISE, CAPABILITY AND LONGEVITY AS AN ORGANIZATION. THE MISSION OF OUR RSVP PROJECT IS TO CONNECT THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND EXPERIENCE OF OUR VOLUNTEERS OVER 55 WITH THE CRITICAL NEEDS IN OUR COMMUNITY THAT HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AND TO PROVIDE REWARDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR SERVICES. ACCORDING TO A 2017 ALABAMA FOOD BANK ASSOCIATION REPORT, 19.2% OF ALABAMA'S POPULATION IS FOOD INSECURE, WHICH EQUATES TO 919,670 PEOPLE.  OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WHICH ADDRESSES THESE SEGMENTS OF OUR POPULATION. AN ESTIMATED UNDUPLICATED 95 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, DISASTER SERVICES, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, CAPACITY BUILDING AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. OF THIS NUMBER, A MINIMUM OF 57 (60%) WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES ASSIGNMENTS. ACTIVITIES OF OUR VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS INCLUDE DELIVERING HOMEBOUND MEALS, PREPARING TAXES, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO THE HOMEBOUND AND VETERANS, AND GUIDING SENIORS IN ACTIVITIES TO KEEP THEM HEALTHY, ACTIVE AND INDEPENDENT. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, WE PROPOSE TO HAVE 800 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO THE EFFORTS OF THESE VOLUNTEERS. THE TOTAL ANNUAL BUDGET FOR THE PROGRAM IS $83,114.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $56,793 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,321 OF STATE, LOCAL AND SPONSOR SUPPORT OR 31.7%.  FOCUS HAS THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPABILITY TO MANAGE THIS PROGRAM BOTH FROM A FINANCIAL AND COMPLIANCE PERSPECTIVE. RSVP WILL HAVE ACCESS TO A CENTRALIZED ACCOUNTING FUNCTION, IT SUPPORT AND WILL BE ABLE TO LEVERAGE ITS PROGRAMMING TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF OTHER FOCUS ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE OF RSVP. PROPER OVERSIGHT EXISTS IN THE FORM OF SEVERAL LAYERS OF MANAGEMENT AS WELL AS BOTH PROGRAM SPECIFIC AND ORGANIZATIONAL-WIDE GOVERNING BOARDS. WITH APPROVAL OF THIS GRANT REQUEST, WE EXPECT TO CONTINUE TO ACHIEVE FAVORABLE RESULTS AND IMPACT THE LIVES OF LOCAL RESIDENTS IN A WAY THAT SUPPORTS THE VISION OF SENIOR CORP WITH MEASURABLE OUTPUT AND OUTCOME PAIRS.

RSVP OF MOBILE COUNTY ENGAGES AND CONNECTS INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 AND OLDER IN A DIVERSE RANGE OF COMMUNITY SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN FOCUS AREAS OUTLINED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS). WITH A MISSION OF ENRICHING THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS, STRENGTHENING THE COMMUNITY AND ENCOURAGING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, RSVP HAS PROUDLY SERVED OUR COMMUNITY FOR 45 YEARS. THE MOBILE COUNTY COMMISSION HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1993. THE COMMISSION IS A GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY WITH THREE COUNTY COMMISSIONERS THAT MAKES DAILY DECISIONS TO ENHANCE THE COUNTY'S INFRASTRUCTURE AND THE AREA'S ECONOMIC, SHIPPING AND SEAFOOD INDUSTRIES.

AN ESTIMATED 218 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES IN THE GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF MOBILE COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 187 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE 1)VOLUNTEERING AT A FOOD PANTRY TO ASSIST WITH THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM  (SNAP) 2) ASSISTING AT SENIOR NUTRITION CENTERS BY HELPING SENIORS RECEIVE HEALTHY FOODS, NUTRITION INFORMATION, SOCIALIZATION ACTIVITIES AND RECREATION TO KEEP THEM INDEPENDENT 3) ASSISTING OLDER PERSONS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WITH ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH ACCESSING AVAILABLE INSURANCE PROGRAMS AND BENEFITS AND MEDICATIONS THROUGH THE STATE HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM (SHIP) 4) ASSISTING THOSE IN NEED OF ACCESS TO FREE MEDICATIONS OR DISCOUNTED MEDICATIONS THROUGH OZANAM CHARITABLE PHARMACY 5) PROVIDING FREE INCOME TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUAL AND THOSE 60+ YEARS OF AGE AND 6) HELPING TO PREVENT ELDER ABUSE THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER GUARDIAN PROGRAM.

RSVP OF MOBILE COUNTY'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS ASSIGNED TO COMMUNITY WIDE PRIORITIES, CAPACITY BUILDING AND/OR OTHER AREAS TO INCLUDE EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, DISASTER SERVICES, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 87% OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE WORKING ON RESULTS TIED TO OUTCOMES. THE CNCS FEDERAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF $57,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TOTALING $112,168.

SOUTH ALABAMA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (SARPC) HAS SPONSORED RSVP FOR 13 YEARS AND IS APPLYING BY NEW APPLICATION IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO SPONSOR THE RSVP PROJECT IN BALDWIN AND ESCAMBIA COUNTIES IN ALABAMA UNDER THE NAME ESTABLISHED IN 2015, SOUTH ALABAMA RSVP.  AN ESTIMATED 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OF WHICH 78 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. OUR MAJOR PARTNERSHIPS ARE WITH THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, CITY AND COUNTY GOVERNMENTS, LOCAL FOOD BANKS, VETERANS GROUPS, IRS, AMERICAN RED CROSS, POARCH BAND OF CREEK INDIANS AND OTHER LOCAL NON-PROFITS.  YEAR THREE OF THE GRANT OVER 40,000 FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE FOOD SUPPORT TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY AND HUNGER, BETWEEN 400-500 LOWER INCOME MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE ENROLLED IN HEALTH INSURANCE OR HEALTH BENEFITS IN BALDWIN AND ESCAMBIA COUNTY PER YEAR, 180 PERSONS WILL HAVE ATTENDED EVIDENCED BASED HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAMS, OVER 1,300 LOW-INCOME SENIORS AND DISABLED PERSONS WILL HAVE RECEIVED FREE TAX ASSISTANCE, AND 200 OLDER AND DISABLED VETERANS IN NURSING HOMES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES WILL HAVE RECEIVED SUPPORT. ACTIVITIES THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS IN THE COUNTY SERVED; THEY WILL HELP THE SOUP KITCHEN, FOOD BANKS AND PANTRIES, HELP WITH FOOD COLLECTION, BAGGING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT THE HELP CENTER AND ST. CLASSES AND GROUPS.  IN ADDITION, THEY WILL HELP LOW-INCOME SENIORS STRETCH LIMITED FUNDS BY PROVIDING EXTRA FOOD.  ALL THESE ACTIVITIES FALL INTO OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.

SOUTHWEST ALABAMA RSVP COVERS THE SIX ALABAMA COUNTIES OF  CLARKE, CHOCTAW, DALLAS, MARENGO, WASHINGTON AND WILCOX.  THESE COUNTIES COVER MORE THAN 6,000 SQUARE MILES IN VERY RURAL AND ECONOMIC STRICKEN SOUTHWEST ALABAMA. OUR RSVP ORGANIZATION HAS 218 ACTIVE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS. 

IF THIS GRANT IS APPROVED, SOUTHWEST ALABAMA RSVP WILL PROVIDE: TUTORING, HOME DELIVERED MEALS, RECYCLING, FOOD COLLECTION/DISTRIBUTION, TRANSPORTATION, THRIFT STORES, NURSING HOME AND SENIOR CENTER ACTIVITIES, CULTURAL HERITAGE, DISASTER TRAINING AND ASSISTANCE, MENTORING YOUTH, LIBRARY SERVICES, TAX ASSISTANCE AND VETERANS ASSISTANCE, THROUGH A NETWORK OF 28 STATIONS SUCH AS SENIOR CENTERS, NURSING HOMES, SCHOOLS, VISITOR CENTERS,  MUNICIPAL BUILDINGS, AMERICAN LEGION POSTS, VFW AND EMA OFFICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PERIOD IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, SOUTHWEST ALABAMA RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE REPORTED MORE THAN 25,000 HOURS OF SERVICE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,803 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,828. NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR THE GRANT PERIOD OF APRIL 1, 2019 TO MARCH 31, 2020.

THE CITY OF THOMASVILLE IS THE SPONSORING AGENT FOR SOUTHWEST ALABAMA RSVP SINCE 2003. THOMASVILLE IS A MUNICIPALITY IN THE NORTHERN MOST  PART OF CLARKE COUNTY, ALABAMA. THE  2018 CENSUS QUICK FACTS, THE POPULATION WAS 4,209. THE GROWING ECONOMY OF THOMASVILLE IS LARGELY BASED ON RETAIL TRADE AND THE SERVICE SECTOR, WITH THE CITY SERVING AS A REGIONAL COMMERCIAL HUB. IT?S TRADE AREA IS MUCH LARGER THAN IS INDICATED BY ITS SMALL POPULATION. IN RECENT YEARS THE COPPER INDUSTRY HAS NAVIGATED TO THIS AREA OF ALABAMA OPENING ONE OF THE BIGGEST PLANTS IN NORTH AMERICA. THE CITY?S MISSION IS TO SERVE THE RESIDENTS OF  THOMASVILLE, POLICE JURISDICTION, AND RSVP SERVICE AREA. 

OUR SENIOR VOLUNTEERS, WITH THERE MANY YEARS OF EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE, CONTINUE TO TOUCH THE LIVES OF THE YOUNG AND OLD IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND IN TURN HELP THEMSELVES TO STAY ACTIVE AND ALERT.  FEELING NEEDED IS AN IMPORTANT PART OF A HEALTHY AGING PROCESS AND SOUTHWEST ALABAMA RSVP  HAS SOME OF THE HEALTHIEST AND MOST ACTIVE SENIORS IN THE COUNTRY WITH AN AVERAGE AGE OF 75.

THE LEE-RUSSELL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (LRCOG) SEEKS THE OPPORTUNITY TO SPONSOR THE RSVP PROGRAM IN LEE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES, AL.  THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) IS THE DEPARTMENT THAT WILL MANAGE AND OVERSEE THE RSVP PROGRAM. THE AAA WORKS WITH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AGENCIES IN THE PLANNING AND SERVICE AREA TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE AND COORDINATED SERVICE SYSTEM TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OLDER PERSONS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND CAREGIVERS IN THE TWO-COUNTY AREA. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING IS TO ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE, MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY; PROVIDE A CONTINUUM OF CARE, AND SERVE AS AN ADVOCATE. RSVP PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AN ESTIMATED 80 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN THE GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION OF LEE & RUSSELL COUNTIES:  LEE COUNTY; AUBURN, BEULAH, OPELIKA, LOACHAPOKA, SMITHS STATION AND RUSSELL COUNTY; HURTSBORO, FORT MITCHELL, AND PHENIX CITY.
EIGHTY UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE AT 10 WORK STATIONS TO MEET THE NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY WHICH INCLUDE PERFORMING OUTREACH TO ENROLL OLDER ADULTS IN HEALTH INSURANCE AND HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS, ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY BY ASSISTING WITH SORTING FOOD ITEMS AT THE LOCAL COMMUNITY MARKET, DELIVERING HOME DELIVERED MEALS, AND PERFORMING OUTREACH TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC REGARDING FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS SUCH AS THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP). MAJOR PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE THE AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER (ADRC) AND THE STATE HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM (SHIP). AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 500 MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WILL RECEIVE INFORMATION AND EDUCATION REGARDING HEALTH INSURANCE OR HEALTH BENEFITS.  APPROXIMATELY 100 UNDUPLICATED PERSONS WILL RECEIVE FOOD SUPPORT TO ADDRESS HUNGER AND FOOD INSECURITY.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE MATCHED BY $4,450 OF NON-FEDERAL LOCAL RESOURCES.

THE MONROE COUNTY COMMISSIONS HAS SPONSORED RSVP FOR FORTY-FIVE YEARS AND IS APPLYING FOR CONTINUATION OF THE RSVP PROJECT.  THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS A COUNTYWIDE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM DESIGNED TO FOSTER CIVIC PARTICIPATION BY RECRUITING SENIOR ADULT VOLUNTEERS TO AIDE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ENTITIES IN AN EFFORT TO REACH AND SERVE FRAIL SENIORS, VETERANS, AND CHILDREN. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO STRENGTHENING AND INSURING HEALTHY FUTURES FOR THE CITIZENS OF MONROE COUNTY BY PROVIDING COMPLIMENTARY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER NEEDED VOLUNTEER SERVICES. 
RSVP IS AN EVER-EVOLVING PROGRAM WITH OVER 160 VOLUNTEERS THAT HAS CONTINUED TO SERVE THE CITIZENS OF THIS RURAL COUNTY SINCE 1974.  BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS RSVP COVERS A BROAD SPECTRUM OF NEEDS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND DISASTER SERVICES WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES. THIS AREA FOCUS NEEDS SERVE AN OVERALL POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 21,000 PEOPLE WHERE OVER 23% LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL AND THE CURRENT UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IS 6%.  THAT INCLUDES 30.4 PERCENT OF SENIORS OVER THE AGE OF 55.THE RSVP PROJECT HAS PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES WITH MEASURABLE OUTCOME AS WELL AS SEVEN NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ALLOWS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.  VOLUNTEERS WORK WITH THE LOCAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS BY SETTING UP CLINICS, OFFERING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE, PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL MEALS, SUPPLYING NUTRITIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION TO THEIR CONSTITUENTS AND OTHER SERIOUS ISSUES FACING FRAIL SENIORS, VETERANS, AND CHILDREN. RSVP ANTICIPATES A POSITIVE IMPROVEMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE NEXT THREE YEAR PERIOD.  FRAIL SENIORS, VETERANS, AND CHILDREN SHOULD SEE AN INCREASE IN IMPROVED NUTRITIONAL QUALITY, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY ALLEVIATING MALNUTRITION AND LONG-TERM HUNGER, ENHANCED ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE, AND MORE OPPORTUNITIES TO RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION AND MENTORING ASSISTANCE.  
OVER THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD MONROE COUNTY RSVP WILL DEPLOY 55 VOLUNTEERS (35%) VOLUNTEERS IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, WITH ACTIVITIES THAT HAVE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES OUTCOME, 60 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO COMMUNITY-WIDE PRIORITIES AND THE REMAINING 45 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE CAPACITY BUILDING AND OR OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AREAS BY HELPING THE ELDERLY, MILITARY VETERANS AND OR FAMILY MEMBERS BY PROVIDING RESOURCES.
TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, THE MONROE COUNTY RSVP IS REQUESTING FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $40,000.00 FROM CNCS. THE MONROE COUNTY COMMISSIONS PROVIDES IN-KIND SPACE AND UTILITIES FOR THE RSVP OFFICE.  THE CITY OF MONROEVILLE, UNITED WAY, DONATIONS FROM LOCAL MERCHANTS COMBINED WITH RSVP'S REVENUE FROM CONCESSION'S SALE TOTALS A SUPPLEMENT MATCH OF $52,000.00 FOR THE CNCS GRANT.

RSVP'S MISSION OF IMPROVING LIVES WILL BE MET IN CACHE AND RICH COUNTIES BY BUILDING A VOLUNTEER NETWORK WHICH WILL PROVIDE RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS AND COMPANIONSHIP TO OLDER ADULTS. 

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OVER A THREE YEAR PERIOD. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND DELIVER EITHER RESPITE OR COMPANIONSHIP PARTNERSHIPS, WHILE SOME MAY BE ENCOURAGED TO ADDITIONALLY PARTICIPATE IN THE RECOGNITION EVENTS AND CONTACT ACTIVITY TO ENSURE THESE ACTIVITIES MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS. VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING RESPITE CARE TO CAREGIVERS WHEREVER THEY CALL HOME BE IT ASSISTED LIVING CENTERS, SKILLED CARE OR DEMENTIA CENTERS OR HOMES, AS WELL AS COMPANIONSHIP ACTIVITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVES OF AGING IN PLACE AND AGING IN PLACE - RESPITE. IDENTIFICATION OF CAREGIVERS WELCOMING RESPITE AND SENIORS WHO MAY BENEFIT FROM COMPANIONSHIP WILL BE AN ESSENTIAL PIECE OF THE PROGRAM. 

THE RSVP COORDINATOR WILL HAVE RESPONSIBILITY FOR CREATING FINAL PLANS FOR RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF BOTH RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND INDIVIDUAL SERVICE RECEIVERS, ORIENTATION, TRAINING AND VOLUNTEER MATCHING. ADDITIONAL SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED BY A STAFF ASSISTANT TO SCHEDULE VISITS, PLACE REMINDER CALLS, ASSIST WITH MATERIAL COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION AND GENERAL OFFICE ASSIGNMENTS. HIGH QUALITY ASSESSMENT AND ANALYSIS OF PARTICIPANT CHARACTERISTICS (RELATED TO RECRUITMENT/ATTRITION) AND PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS, AS WELL AS SPECIALIZED EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR THE RSVP DIRECTOR, STAFF ASSISTANT AND VOLUNTEERS, WILL BE SUBCONTRACTED TO 2 GERONTOLOGICAL FACULTY OF UTAH STATE.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 150 DEMENTIA CAREGIVERS OR OLDER ADULTS NEEDING COMPANIONSHIP WILL HAVE IMPROVED SOCIAL TIES, INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND REDUCTION IN DAILY STRESSORS. WE ALSO EXPECT TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT OF VOLUNTEERING ON STRESS AND WELL-BEING FOR THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 IN YEAR ONE WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $13,620.

AN ESTIMATED 350 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE PLANNED ACTIVITIES OF THIS APPLICATION. OF THIS NUMBER, 55 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE CARE, AND COMPANIONSHIP TO THE AREA'S FRAIL SENIOR POPULATION.  THEY WILL ALSO ASSIST OLDER ADULTS OBTAIN THE ACCESS TO THE CARE THEY NEED BY EDUCATING INDIVIDUALS ON MEDICARE, MEDIGAP AND MEDICATION PLAN OPTIONS THAT ARE AVAILABLE. IN ADDITION, THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE IS SERVED AS RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FOOD TO THE HUNGRY AND SERVE IN VARIOUS LOCATIONS SUCH AS THEIR LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENTS, RETIREMENT COMMUNITIES, AND LIBRARIES.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR AT 40 DIFFERENT LOCATIONS, SUCH AS THE CALL-A-RIDE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM, MEDFORD FOOD PROJECT, THE TERESA MCCORMICK CENTER, THE MEDFORD POLICE DEPARTMENT, AND THE S.H.I.B.A. (SENIOR HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS ASSISTANCE) PROGRAM.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AN ESTIMATED 673 INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $53,700 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $158,751.

UCAN RSVP IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF UNITED COMMUNITY ACTION NETWORK (UCAN), THE DESIGNATED COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY SERVING BOTH DOUGLAS & JOSEPHINE COUNTY. UCAN RSVP CONTINUES TO PROVIDE A SERVICE COMPONENT NECESSARY TO ADDRESS A GROWING AGING POPULATION, VETERAN HUB AND FUNDAMENTALLY INCREASING CAPACITY FOR OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS ADDRESSING SERIOUS SOLUTIONS TO POVERTY, EQUITY AND COMMUNITY WELLNESS. OUR PERFORMANCE MEASURES ARE IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES/ACCESS TO CARE AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY/FINANCIAL LITERACY, WITH 96 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS DEDICATED TO THESE PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES. OVERALL, AN ESTIMATED VOLUNTEER CORPS OF 422 WILL PROVIDE ACTIVE SERVICES TO VETERANS, SENIORS, DISABLED, LOW INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS THAT INCREASE COMMUNITY ACCESS TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS, SECURE BENEFITS FOR ECONOMIC STABILIZATION, EDUCATE TO STRENGTHEN CONSUMER PROTECTION AND ADVOCATE FOR REMOVAL OF BARRIERS TO INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $95,520 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $ 23,845.00 , WITH FUNDS INVESTED FROM LOCAL, STATE AND PRIVATE SECTOR. FOUNDED IN 1969, SPONSOR UCAN, HAS 50 YEAR HISTORY OF SERVICES AND COMMITMENT TO THE UTILIZATION OF NATIONAL SERVICE TO BUILD CAPACITY, INCREASE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND MAXIMIZE THE EFFORTS OF VOLUNTEERISM IN COMMUNITY OBJECTIVES. UCAN AS AN AGENCY OPERATES THROUGHOUT DOUGLAS AND JOSEPHINE COUNTIES WITH A STAFF OF MORE THAN 200+ INDIVIDUALS COMMITTED TO PROMOTING OPPORTUNITIES THAT INCREASE SELF-RELIANCE OF ALL LOW INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS. THROUGH THE OPERATION OF RSVP AS A UCAN SPONSORED PROGRAM, WE INCREASE OUR COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES, SUPPORTING UCAN'S GOAL TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY AND POSITIVELY IMPACT THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ELDERLY, POOR, AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. UCAN RSVP IS ESTABLISHED TO HELP FORTIFY A STRONG, SHARED MISSION OF SERVICE ON BEHALF OF THE CITIZENS OF DOUGLAS & JOSEPHINE COUNTIES.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $129,277 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $53,824.

AN ESTIMATED 177 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 70 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN  OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MONTHLY ASSISTANCE TO OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES WHO NEED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITH BUDGETING, BALANCING CHECKBOOKS, PAYING ROUTINE BILLS AND  KEEPING TRACK OF THEIR FINANCIAL MATTERS; SUPPORTING LOCAL FOOD BANKS AND ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESS TO FOOD; TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES; DELIVERY OF CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT (CDSMP) EVIDENCED-BASED WORKSHOPS IN THE COMMUNITY; ASSISTING  OLDER ADULTS WITH UNDERSTANDING THEIR HEALTH INSURANCE OPTIONS, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE & BENEFITS, FRAUD PREVENTION, AND OPIOID  AWARENESS. IN 2017/18, 185 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVED 32,122 HOURS, PROVIDING CRITICAL SERVICES TO COUNTY RESIDENTS THROUGH PARTNER SERVICE AGENCIES. IF, AS A COMMUNITY, WE WERE TO PAY FOR THESE SERVICES, THE COST WOULD BE NEARLY $800,000 ACCORDING TO THE INDEPENDENT SECTOR. CLACKAMAS COUNTY RSVP PARTICIPATED IN COMMUNITY IMPACT POSITIONS WHERE VOLUNTEERS  PROVIDED SUPPORT TO  FOOD PANTRIES AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION SITES, ASSISTED INDIVIDUALS WHO CAN NO LONGER MANAGE THEIR OWN FINANCES, EDUCATED SENIORS ABOUT MEDICARE OPTIONS AND FRAUD AWARENESS,  TRANSPORTED SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO CRITICAL CARE APPOINTMENTS AND PROVIDED SERVICES THAT HELP OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOME AND REMAIN INDEPENDENT FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  RSVP PLANS TO SUPPORT THE ON-GOING IMPLEMENTATION AND DELIVERY OF THE CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT CURRICULUM BY RECRUITING AND TRAINING VOLUNTEER LEADERS TO FACILITATE THESE CLASSES TO A MINIMUM OF 50 RESIDENTS. WE WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS WITH A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $67,777 PER YEAR, SUPPLEMENTED BY $105,884 PROVIDED BY OUR SPONSOR, THE CITY OF OXNARD.

FOOD SERVICES SUCH AS SENIOR BROWN BAG, HOME DELIVERED MEALS, AND COMMODITIES ARE AVAILABLE TO SENIORS WHO ARE LOW INCOME AND/OR HOMEBOUND AND ARE IN NEED OF ENOUGH FOOD TO LIVE AN ACTIVE HEALTHY LIFE. MOST HOME-DELIVERED MEAL PROGRAMS PROVIDE THEIR CLIENTS WITH A HOT MEAL FIVE DAYS A WEEK DELIVERED BY STAFF OR VOLUNTEER DRIVERS. BECAUSE OF THEIR FRAILTY, SENIORS RECEIVING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS ARE UNABLE TO MAKE THEIR OWN MEALS. SENIOR BROWN BAG AND COMMODITIES ARE DISTRIBUTED BY VOLUNTEERS SEVERAL TIMES A MONTH, WITHOUT WHICH MANY SENIORS WOULD GO WITHOUT NUTRITIONALLY ADEQUATE REGULAR MEALS. IN ADDITION, NUTRITION EDUCATION IS PROVIDED.  
SERVICE ACTIVITY: RSVP WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF PARTNERING STATIONS HAVE IDENTIFIED LOW INCOME AND HOME BOUND SENIORS NEEDING NUTRITION EDUCATION AND FOOD SERVICES. 109 VOLUNTEERS ARE NEEDED TO ASSIST WITH NUTRITION EDUCATION AND FOOD SUPPORT.
LOCATION OF SERVICES: SHASTA, TEHAMA, TRINITY, GLENN AND SISKIYOU COUNTIES.

IN ADDITION, 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES BY SERVING AT LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCIES, HOSPITALS, THRIFT STORES, SCHOOLS, LIBRARIES, PUBLIC SAFETY AND MORE.  
FUNDING: REQUESTED: $109,638

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
THE RIVERSIDE COUNTY OFFICE ON AGING (RCOOA) IS REQUESTING THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE SPONSORING RSVP OF THE COACHELLA VALLEY AND BLYTHE. WHILE THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) HAS A MISSION TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERISM, RSVP OF THE COACHELLA VALLEY AND BLYTHE IS STRIVING TO ENGAGE ITS VOLUNTEERS AND CITIZENS IN MEETING SPECIFIC COMMUNITY CHALLENGES.  OUR PROJECT PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS OLD AND OLDER TO VOLUNTEER THEIR TIME AND SHARE THEIR EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS IN RIDER TO ASSIST LOCAL PUBLIC AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. RSVP OF THE COACHELLA VALLEY AND BLYTHE MAKES A SUBSTANTIAL IMPACT IN THE COMMUNITY, WHICH IS MEASUREABLE BY BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATE MEASURES (OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES), ALLOWING THE PROGRAM TO DIRECTLY MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. 
THE 2019-2022 RSVP PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON TWO (2) MAIN CNCS FOCUS AREAS; HEALTHY FUTURES AND DISASTER SERVICES. HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AND WILL ASSIGN RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO COMPANIONSHIP ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN HOPES OF INCREASING THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST WITH LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES AND ORGANIZE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, AND PROVIDE EVIDENCE-BASED PHYSICAL FITNESS AND EDUCATION CLASSES THAT HELP TO DECREASE FALLS, MANAGE CHRONIC DISEASE, AND INSURE THE INCREASED HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE COACHELLA VALLEY?S OLDER ADULTS. DISASTER SERVICES WILL FOCUS ON HELPING INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES PREPARE FOR, RESPOND TO, RECOVER FROM, AND MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF DISASTERS, AS WELL AS INCREASE THE COMMUNITY?S OVERALL RESILIENCE IN THE EVENT OF A CATASTROPHIC EVENT. AT THE END OF THE UPCOMING GRANT CYCLE, GREATER NUMBERS OF THE COACHELLA VALLEY?S OLDER ADULTS WILL BE INFORMED ABOUT DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND MORE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE READY TO MOBILIZE FOR DISASTER RESPONSE.

KENOSHA AREA FAMILY AND AGING SERVICES, INC., (KAFASI) IS A PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT WHOSE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT HEALTHY AGING, STRONG FAMILIES AND A CONNECTED COMMUNITY, WHICH HAS SPONSORED RSVP OF KENOSHA COUNTY SINCE 1997.  IN 2017 KAFASI SERVED OVER 9000 INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT KENOSHA COUNTY AND CONTINUES TO BE A CENTER FOR VOLUNTEERS SEEKING TO STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY BY PARTNERING WITH A LONG-TERM, WELL RESPECTED ORGANIZATION.

RSVP OF ROCK COUNTY, INC. IS AN ORGANIZATION PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS 55 AND OLDER TO VOLUNTEER WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITY.  THE MISSION OF RSVP IS TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF PERSONS AGED 55 AND OLDER THROUGH MEANINGFUL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THAT MATCH THEIR LIFE SKILLS AND INTERESTS TO COMMUNITY NEEDS.  RSVP IS PROPOSING THAT AT LEAST 560 VOLUNTEERS WILL VOLUNTEER IN THE ROCK COUNTY, WI AND NORTHERN WINNEBAGO COUNTY, IL COMMUNITIES.  RSVP IS REQUESTING $84,480 FROM THE CNCS TO ACHIEVE OUR MISSION.  WE RECEIVE $122,235 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING.  THIS AMOUNT IS LOWER THAN 2017 LEVELS DUE TO CUTS IN FUNDING FROM THE COUNCIL ON AGING AND UNITED WAY BLACKHAWK REGION.  TO COMPENSATE FOR THIS WE HAVE LEFT THE PROGRAM ASSISTANT POSITION VACANT IN 2018. WE HAVE ADDED A PART TIME (20 HRS.) PROGRAM ASSISTANT POSITION IN OUR PROPOSED 2019 BUDGET.  WE DO NOT HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO INCREASE UNITED WAY FUNDING UNTIL 2020 SINCE UNITED WAY HAS GONE TO A TWO YEAR FUNDING CYCLE.  ROCK COUNTY INCREASED OUR FUNDING LEVEL FOR 2018 TO COMPENSATE FOR THE LOSS WHICH ALLOWED US TO KEEP MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT THE SAME FOR OUR VOLUNTEERS.  THE SERVICE CATEGORIES ADDRESSED ARE COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, DISASTER RECOVERY/RELIEF, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENT, HEALTH/NUTRITION, HOMELAND SECURITY, HOUSING, HUMAN NEEDS AND PUBLIC SAFETY.  OUR FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  COMMUNITY NEEDS ADDRESSED ARE ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG AWARENESS, FOSTERING STUDENT'S COMPREHENSION OF LOCAL AND STATE HISTORY, ASSISTING NON-PROFITS IN FULFILLING THEIR MISSIONS, PROVIDING CARING RELATIONSHIPS FOR YOUTH BY ADULTS OUTSIDE OF THEIR HOME TO DISPEL STEREOTYPES OF BOTH YOUNG PEOPLE AND SENIOR CITIZENS, READING PROFICIENCY FOR ELEMENTARY STUDENTS, CONGREGATE MEAL SITE SUPPORT WHICH FOSTERS IMPROVED NUTRITION AND INCREASES SOCIALIZATION FOR SENIORS, DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, SUPPORTING FOOD PANTRY OPERATIONS SERVING THE NEEDY, PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS FOR DISASTER RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE, AND HELPING SENIORS REMAIN INDEPENDENT.  OUR INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMS INCORPORATE RESEARCH BASED METHODS IN PROVIDING SERVICES THROUGH OUR FOUR SUB PROGRAMS ACHIEVING READING PROFICIENCY BY THE END OF THIRD GRADE, HANDS ON EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING DOVETAILING WITH SCHOOL CURRICULUM, PROVIDING SAFE AND STRUCTURED ACTIVITIES DURING THE TIME OF DAY WHEN CHILDREN ARE MOST VULNERABLE, AND EARLY DRUG AWARENESS HAVE ALL BEEN SUPPORTED BY NATIONAL AND LOCAL RESEARCH.  OUR COMMUNITY REFERRALS PROGRAM USES LOCAL AND NATIONAL RESEARCH TO NOT ONLY HELP FILL COMMUNITY NEEDS BUT TO MODIFY PROGRAMS AS NEEDS CHANGE.  OUR IN-HOME/GROUPS PROGRAM IS SUPPORTED BY AN ARRAY OF DATA SHOWING THAT ACTIVE SENIORS ARE HEALTHIER AND OBTAIN A SENSE OF PURPOSE.  THIS SUPPORTED BY NATIONAL AND LOCAL DATA (I.E. SEARCH INSTITUTE, COMMUNITY ACTION SURVEYS).  OUR OUTCOMES ARE LISTED SPECIFICALLY IN THE WORK PLANS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION.  GENERALLY, OUR PROJECTED OUTCOME IS TO MOBILIZE SENIORS TO HELP ADDRESS THE EVER INCREASING COMMUNITY NEEDS, REACHING THOUSANDS OF CHILDREN EACH SCHOOL YEAR, ASSISTING NEARLY 100 NON-PROFITS, AND PROVIDING DONATED CLOTHING ITEMS TO THE NEEDY.

THE OUTAGAMIE RSVP PROJECT INTENDS TO SUPPORT 300 RSVP MEMBERS ANNUALLY ACROSS OUTAGAMIE COUNTY TO HELP ADDRESS CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS FOR OUR AGING ADULT POPULATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF OUR PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND, TO MEET OUR PROGRAMMATIC GOALS, AT LEAST 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WHICH INCLUDE PROVIDING RIDES TO COMMUNITY APPOINTMENTS, VISITING HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY LEAVING THEIR RESIDENCE, AND DELIVERING AND SERVING MEALS. ANOTHER WAY WE SUPPORT OUR AGING POPULATION IS TO ENGAGING THEM IN OUR STRONG BODIES EXERCISE CAMPAIGN WHICH HELPS INCREASE BALANCE AND REDUCE INJURIES.

PARTNERSHIPS ARE ANOTHER WAY WE ACHIEVE OUR GOALS. WE PLAN TO PARTNER WITH HABITAT FOR HUMANITY TO HELP WITH THE CONSTRUCTION OF HOMES TO PROVIDE SAFE, STABLE HOUSING TO THOSE WHO NEED IT. RSVP OUTAGAMIE WILL ALSO BE PARTNERING WITH A LOCAL SENIOR CENTER TO SUPPORT A NEW TELECARE-TYPE OUTREACH INITIATIVE WHICH WILL EXPAND HOME VISITS AND REDUCE SOME OF THE BURDENS WHICH CAREGIVERS EXPERIENCE. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, RSVP OUTAGAMIE WILL FILL A UNIQUE NICHE BY ENSURING SENIORS GET THE SUPPORT THEY NEED WHILE REMAINING INDEPENDENT, SAFE, AND LIVING IN THE LEAST RESTRICTIVE SITUATION POSSIBLE.

THROUGH THESE INTENTIONAL INTERVENTIONS, OUR MEMBERS WILL PROVIDE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT TO OVER 493 OLDER ADULTS LIVING INDEPENDENTLY OVER OUR THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 84,143 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $39,873.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

UNITED WAY OF MARATHON COUNTY IS THE SPONOSORING AGENCY FOR UNITED WAY RSVP OF MARATHON COUNTY (UW RSVP).
