THE RSVP OF NORTHWESTERN OHIO SPONSORED BY THE AREA OFFICE ON AGING OF NORTHWESTERN OHIO IS ACCEPTING THE INVITATION FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE 2019 RSVP COMPETITION GRANT. RSVP OF NORTHWESTERN OHIO WILL FACILITATE AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS 55 AND OLDER RESIDING IN THE TEN COUNTIES OF DEFIANCE, ERIE, FULTON, HENRY, LUCAS, OTTAWA, PAULDING, SANDUSKY, WILLIAMS, AND WOOD COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST OHIO. 

AN ESTIMATED 550 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 207 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE CARE, FOOD DELIVERY AND DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE, HEALTH CARE ACCESS, AND HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, SOME OF THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE 3000 NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN HEALTH CARE INSURANCE PROGRAMS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $129,222 WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THE LOCAL CONTRIBUTION OF $211,737 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IN MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEER ACTION.

AN ESTIMATED 450 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 198 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING STUDENTS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; PROVIDING NUTRITION SUPPORT TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS SO THAT THEY CAN CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; PROVIDING NUTRITION SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS ALLOWING THEM TO BE MORE FOOD SECURE; EDUCATING SENIORS ON HEALTH RELATED ISSUES THROUGH OUR PLAYERS TROUPE AND REPAIRING HOUSING UNITS SO THAT INDIVIDUALS CAN BE TRANSITIONED INTO SAFE, HEALTHY AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE WILL BE TO SERVE 2000 CLIENTS THROUGH OUR HEALTHY FUTURES INITIATIVE.  OUR GOALS ARE THAT: 140 HOMEBOUND CLIENTS WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY DUE TO THE NUTRITION SUPPORT THEY ARE RECEIVING; 60 CLIENTS WILL BE ABLE TO STATE THEY ARE MORE FOOD SECURE; 45 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC SKILLS, 35 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT BEHAVIORS; 100 OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR HEALTH KNOWLEDGE AND 5 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE BEEN TRANSITIONED INTO SAFE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  
 
OUR RSVP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE SERVICES IN SEVERAL KEY CNCS FUNDING PRIORITIES.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS THROUGH THE EVIDENCE BASED AARP FOUNDATION EXPERIENCE CORPS PROGRAM.  IN ADDITION, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN THE PRIORITY AREAS OF: AGING IN PLACE- INDEPENDENT LIVING AND  EDUCATION- INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO BE SERVING THROUGH THE COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AREA IN: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY- WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND DISASTER SERVICES.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $197,098 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $129,050 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 110 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 87 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, HOME DELIVERY OF MEALS, COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION, AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  IN THE THIRD GRANT YEAR, 500 INDIVIDUALS WILL BE PROVIDED FOOD SUPPORTS AND 350 OF THOSE WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AFTER HAVING ACCESS TO SAFE AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO MAINTAIN A HEALTHY LIFE AS A RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEER GATHERING AND PACKAGING FOOD, ORGANIZING FOOD DRIVES, PROVIDING MEALS AT THE LOCAL SOUP KITCHEN AND STAFFING FOOD PANTRIES.  FURTHER, IN THE THIRD GRANT YEAR, OUTCOMES IN THE AREA OF 'AGING IN PLACE' WILL SHOW AND ESTIMATED 35 HOME-BOUND SENIORS, OLDER ADULTS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUAL RECEIVING HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND 28 OF THOSE REPORTING INCREASED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING BECAUSE OF THE SERVICES OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THIS SERVICE IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT IN OUR COMMUNITY AT THIS TIME BECAUSE RECENTLY IDENTIFIED GAPS IN FUNDING HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO A 40% REDUCTION IN LOCAL MEALS ON WHEELS PARTICIPATION OVER THE PAST YEAR. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DILIGENTLY TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO THE MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM AND RESTORE ITS PARTICIPATION LEVELS.  THE ABILITY OF THESE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND MAINTAIN THEIR MAXIMUM LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE WILL BE IMPROVED BECAUSE OF THE SERVICES THEY RECEIVE FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS. 
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST IN THE TRAINING OF A VOLUNTEER RECEPTION CENTER TEAM TO BE READY TO SUPPORT THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE OF NEBRASKA WITH VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT DURING A DISASTER.  BY THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, 12 HIGHLY TRAINED TEAM MEMBERS WILL BE READY TO SERVE IN THE EVENT OF A DISASTER.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $83,778 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $39,672 OF NON-FEDERAL MATCH.

THE DAWES AND SIOUX COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS SPONSORED BY NORTHWEST COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP (NCAP). NCAP IS WELL ESTABLISHED WITH A FIFTY-PLUS YEAR HISTORY OF PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS IN THE SPARSELY POPULATED, RURAL PANHANDLE OF NEBRASKA. THE RSVP CENTRAL OFFICE IS LOCATED IN CHADRON, NEBRASKA AND A SATELLITE OFFICE SERVING THE CITY OF CRAWFORD AND SIOUX COUNTY IS LOCATED TWENTY-THREE MILES TO THE WEST IN CRAWFORD, NEBRASKA. DAWES AND SIOUX COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE CHILDREN, HOME-BOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICES THAT ALLOW AREA NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER CNCS-APPROVED ORGANIZATIONS TO OPERATE FULLY THROUGH THE USE OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE FOOD PANTRY MANAGEMENT, FOOD DISTRIBUTION AND DELIVERY, SOUP KITCHEN OUTREACH, TRANSPORTATION, MENTORING, COMPANIONSHIP, DISASTER PREPARATION AND STAFFING BLOOD DRIVES, LIBRARIES AND MUSEUMS. THIS IS JUST A SAMPLE OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH A NETWORK OF NEARLY FIFTY VOLUNTEER STATIONS. VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA FROM MEALS ON WHEELS, FOOD PANTRIES, BLOOD BANKS, SCHOOLS, HOSPITALS, NURSING HOME FACILITIES, ART CENTERS, MUSEUMS, LIBRARIES AND FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. AS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, NCAP IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE MOST VULNERABLE MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY. RSVP HAS BEEN AN INTEGRAL PART OF NCAP'S  SUCCESS AND WE WOULD BE HONORED TO CONTINUE HOSTING THIS CNCS SENIOR PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 141 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 141 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TRANSPORTATION, FOOD DELIVERY, RESPITE CARE, COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, PROGRAM OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: 1,070 OLDER ADULTS, HOMEBOUND AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION AND FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES WILL REPORT THAT THEY HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN AT HOME, THUS AVOIDING THE EXPENSE OF MOVING TO AN ASSISTED LIVING OR LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY.  24 UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING RESPITE AND COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO SERVICES RECEIVED.  FOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION SERVICES PROVIDED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL RESULT IN 75 RECIPIENTS REPORTING THAT THEY HAVE A GREATER SENSE OF FOOD SECURITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $56,245 IN NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA-MINNESOTA (VOA-MN) BRINGS A 122-YEAR HISTORY OF HELPING PEOPLE GAIN SELF-RELIANCE, DIGNITY AND HOPE. IN LINE WITH ITS MISSION, VOA-MN'S RSVP GREATER TWIN CITIES (RSVP-GTC) SERVICE SEEKS THE CONTINUED SUPPORT AND PARTNERSHIP OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) TO ENGAGE THE SKILLS, TALENTS, AND LIFE EXPERIENCES OF VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE PEOPLE IN NEED, STRENGTHEN FAMILIES, AND BUILD COMMUNITIES.
VOA-MN'S RSVP-GTC PROGRAM PRESENTS A THREE-YEAR PLAN TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC PARTICIPATION WITHIN AN 11-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF RURAL AND URBAN MINNESOTA. RSVP-GTC'S SERVICE WILL PURSUE CNCS? FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND PRIORITIES OF ACCESS TO CARE-OPIOID ABUSE, AGING IN PLACE-INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. RSVP-GTC WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND SUPPORT VOLUNTEERS 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER IN RENDERING SERVICES TO A BROAD SPECTRUM OF PEOPLE AND ORGANIZATIONS SEEKING THIS INVALUABLE SUPPORT. IN TOTAL, AN ESTIMATED 550 RSVP-GTC VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 288 UNDUPLICATED RSVP-GTC VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. RSVP-GTC VOLUNTEERS PURSUING OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WILL SUPPORT ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE FOSTERING THE ABILITY OF HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESS TO FOOD RESOURCES; PROMOTING HEALTHY BEHAVIORS; IMPROVING FINANCIAL AND HOUSING STABILITY; AND ENHANCING THE STRENGTH OF MILITARY FAMILIES.
RSVP-GTC WILL ENGAGE 52 PROGRAM STATIONS INCLUDING FOOD SHELVES, HOMELESS SHELTERS, SCHOOLS, VA HOSPITALS, AND OTHER ACCESSIBLE COMMUNITY LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE RURAL AND URBAN 11-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP-GTC ANTICIPATES MEASURABLE OUTCOMES OF INCREASED HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY; INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT FOR ELDERS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THOSE THAT CARE FOR THEM; INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR VETERANS; INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE FOR SENIORS; THE DOLLAR VALUE OF TAX REFUNDS GENERATED; AND NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS TRANSITIONED TO SAFE, HEALTHY, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING. RSVP-GTC RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $287,827, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $114,486 IN MATCH FUNDING, AND $44,466 IN ADDITIONAL RESOURCES.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF SOUTHERN MINNESOTA IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION SERVING THE POOR AND VULNERABLE, ADVOCATING FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND INSPIRING ALL PEOPLE TO SERVE THEIR NEIGHBORS IN NEED IN THE TWENTY SOUTHERNMOST COUNTIES OF MINNESOTA  SINCE 1947.  WE SERVE ALL WITHOUT REGARD TO RELIGION, RACE, ETHNICITY, AGE, GENDER, OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION.  OUR PROGRAMS INCLUDE; THE ACTIVE AGING PROGRAMS (COMMON GOOD RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS, AGE WELL AT HOME), THE VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, GUARDIAN/CONSERVATOR SERVICES, MEDICATION APPLICATION SERVICE, COUNSELING, EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE, DISASTER RECOVERY ASSISTANCE, PARISH SOCIAL MINISTRY, REFUGEE RESETTLEMENT, FINANCIAL LITERACY, ADOPTION SERVICES, AND PREGNANCY AND PARENTING COUNSELING.

COMMON GOOD RSVP WILL MOBILIZE 1,115 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN SIXTEEN SOUTHERN MN COUNTIES (MN-03 -- MINNESOTA COUNTIES OF BROWN, BLUE EARTH, DODGE, FILLMORE, HOUSTON, GOODHUE, LE SUEUR, MOWER, NICOLLET, OLMSTED, RICE, STEELE, WABASHA, WASECA, WATONWAN, AND WINONA) OF WHICH 1,095 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS CONTRIBUTING TO CNCS NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES (810 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION, HOME DELIVERED MEALS, COMPANIONSHIP, SUPPORT AT FOOD PANTRIES AND EVIDENCE-BASED ADULT EDUCATION). ADDITIONAL FOCUS AREAS INCLUDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (70 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE TAX ASSISTANCE AND HOME MODIFICATIONS AND REPAIRS), EDUCATION (190 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE K-12 CLASSROOM SUPPORT), AND VETERANS (25 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE EVIDENCE-BASED EDUCATION TO VETERANS).

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, COMMON GOOD RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 6,190 INDIVIDUALS WHO WILL REPORT; INCREASED CAPACITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, SAFE AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING, INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE, AND INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. ADDITIONALLY, $800,000.00 IN TAX RETURNS WILL BE GENERATED. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $235,443.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $239,929.00 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  THE RETURN ON FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $215.00 PER RSVP VOLUNTEER PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES, SIGNIFICANTLY LESS THAN THE $1,000.00 FEDERAL INVESTMENT PER RSVP VOLUNTEER REQUIRED BY CNCS.

THE REQUESTED FUNDS ALONG WITH STATE AND LOCAL MATCHES IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,365 WILL MAKE IT POSSIBLE FOR US TO ENGAGE AT LEAST 517 VOLUNTEERS IN MEANINGFUL AND COMMUNITY DRIVEN SERVICE WITHIN OUR EIGHT COUNTY SERVICE AREA IN WEST CENTRAL MINNESOTA. OF THIS NUMBER, 411 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. NEARLY HALF OF OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TO REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY FOR OUR SERVICE AREA RESIDENTS THROUGH FOOD DISTRIBUTION AND MEAL DELIVERY (MEALS ON WHEELS). SOME OF THE OTHER SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TAX PREPARATION, LAND RESTORATION, CAPACITY BUILDING, EDUCATION, TRANSPORTATION AND SOCIALIZATION/COMPANIONSHIP. VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE FOOD TO OVER 4,000 INDIVIDUALS, ASSIST OVER 3,000 RESIDENTS AT VITA FREE TAX PREPARATION SITES, ASSIST 150 STUDENTS WITH TUTORING AND LITERACY BUILDING SKILLS, AND TEND TO OVER 2,000 ACRES OF PUBLIC LAND. MAHUBE-OTWA RSVP ANTICIPATES 600 VOLUNTEERS WILL ENROLL IN SERVICE AT 70+ ENROLLED COMMUNITY STATIONS EACH YEAR OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE. MAHUBE-OTWA COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP, INC. IS THE HOST SITE FOR MAHUBE-OTWA RSVP. WE ARE A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY; PROGRAMS INCLUDE CHILD CARE RESOURCE AND REFERRAL, EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE, ENERGY PROGRAMS, FAMILY DEVELOPMENT, FAMILY HEALTH, HOUSING, HEAD START, AND SENIOR PROGRAMS. THE MAHUBE-OTWA BOARD OF DIRECTORS CONSISTS OF 18 INDIVIDUALS WHO REPRESENT ELECTED OFFICIALS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. OUR MISSION: TO EMPOWER PEOPLE TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY. OUR VISION: ENDING POVERTY BY EMPOWERING PEOPLE EVERY DAY. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018, THE MAHUBE-OTWA AGENCY BUDGET WAS $31,141,300. MAHUBE-OTWA IMPLEMENTS A TWO-PRONGED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT WHICH WAS DISTRIBUTED TO A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS, CLIENTS AND VOLUNTEERS IN 2018, AND IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY, IN ORDER TO CAPTURE A TRUE PICTURE OF CURRENT COMMUNITY NEEDS AND TO SET CLEAR GOALS FOR ALL AGENCY PROGRAMS INCLUDING OUR RSVP PROGRAM.

A TOTAL OF 84 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THIRTY-EIGHT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS ASSISTING WITH TAX PREPARATION AND HOME REPAIRS TO ASSIST OUR VULNERABLE POPULATION TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES.  

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT A TOTAL OF 8 UNIQUE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH 90 VISITS TO PEOPLE WITH HOME REPAIRS IN THE COMMUNITY SO THEY CAN CONTINUE TO  LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THREE UNIQUE VOLUNTEERS (IN ADDITION TO OTHERS) WILL PROVIDE OVER 1,000 POUNDS OF FOOD TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH OUR COMMUNITY GARDEN. ALSO, 30 VITA RSVP VOLUNTEERS (IN ADDITION TO OTHERS) WILL PREPARE AN ESTIMATED  4,500 TAX RETURNS OVER THE ENTIRE 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD TO ASSIST LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN RECEIVING FUNDS SUCH AS HOME HEATING CREDITS AND EARNED INCOME TAX CREDITS, MANY OF WHOM ARE IN THE VULNERABLE POPULATION, SUCH AS SENIORS, DISABLED, AND LOW INCOME.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $0 REQUIRES NO MATCH. ALL MONEY FOR OUR PROGRAM COMES FROM THE STATE RSVP ($63,650) AND LOCAL IN-KIND MONEY ($33,095) FOR THE BUDGET PERIOD OF 09/30/19-09/29/20.

FRIENDSHIP CENTERS OF EMMET COUNTY--COUNCIL ON AGING IS THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF CHARLEVOIX AND EMMET COUNTIES (RSVP). AS THE COUNCIL ON AGING, FRIENDSHIP CENTERS OF EMMET COUNTY (FCEC) SERVES AS THE COUNTY'S FOCAL POINT FOR ISSUES RELATED TO AGING. THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO ENSURE THAT ALL SENIOR CITIZENS HAVE THE OPPORTUNITIES, INFORMATION AND SERVICES NECESSARY TO LIVE HEALTHY, SAFE AND ACTIVE LIVES IN DIGNITY. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY PROVIDING VITAL SERVICES FOR SENIOR CITIZENS AGE 60 AND OVER.
 RSVP IS THE ONLY FCEC PROGRAM THAT EXTENDS ITS SCOPE BEYOND EMMET COUNTY. OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CHARLEVOIX COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING HAS BEEN EFFECTIVE IN ALLOWING US TO PROMOTE AND OFFER VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO SENIORS IN BOTH COUNTIES. BOTH ORGANIZATIONS HAVE FOUND RSVP TO BE A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF THEIR OVERALL PROGRAMMING, IN THAT IT PROVIDES SENIORS WITH A VITAL MEANS OF STAYING ENGAGED AND ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. 
AN ESTIMATED 102 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MEDICARE COUNSELING, ASSISTANCE AT FOOD PANTRIES, AND PROVIDING TAX SERVICES TO LOW INCOME SENIORS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE 380 UNDUPLICATED FAMILY GROUPS RECEIVING NUTRITION INFORMATION AND FOOD. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $7500.00 (ONE-TIME AUGMENTATION) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $102,326.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP OF VBC HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL IN MEETING TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS  LAST YEAR APPROXIMATELY 500 ROUND TRIP RIDES WERE PROVIDED AND OUR INTENTION IS TO INCREASE THAT NUMBER BY A THIRD NEXT YEAR. VOLUNTEERS HAVE WORKED AT LOCAL PANTRIES, SERVING THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE IN NEED, ALONG WITH 300 SENIORS A MONTH AT FOOD TRUCKS & COMMODITIES DISTRIBUTION; AND OVER  14,000  SUBSIDIZED MEALS AT SENIOR CENTERS. WE EXPECT TO CONTINUE THIS EXCELLENT RECORD OF SERVICE IN ALL OF THESE AREAS IN THE FUTURE WE EXPECT TO HAVE OVER 70% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS IN FOCUS AREAS WITH NATIONAL PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES, AND 63% IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS. OTSEGO COUNTY IS LOCATED IN MICHIGAN'S LOWER PENINSULA ABOUT 250 MILES NORTH OF DETROIT.  IT IS A VERY RURAL AREA.    RESIDENTS 65 AND OLDER COMPRISE 19% OF OUR POPULATION.  THIS IS 4% HIGHER THAN MICHIGAN OVERALL.    "HEALTHY FUTURES" IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS RSVP GRANT APPLICATION.  WITHIN THAT OVERALL HIGH-IMPACT AREA, EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED UPON THE "AGING IN PLACE" H8. 
RSVP OF OTSEGO COUNTY CURRENTLY HAS 78, AND BY THE END OF GRANT YEAR THREE WILL HAVE OVER 80 VOLUNTEERS, UNDER WORK PLANS THAT WILL PROVIDE NON-EMERGENT MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND NECESSARY HOME REPAIRS TO ALLOW OLDER ADULTS, THE DISABLED, AND THE HOMEBOUND TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.   
THERE ARE 329 RSVP TOTAL VOLUNTEERS IN RSVP OF OTSEGO COUNTY.  IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE, 50 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE IN A ?NON-WORK PLAN? PRIMARY FOCUS AREA SUPPORTING OUR LOCAL FOOD PANTRY (WHICH IS 100% VOLUNTEER MANAGED).  THE REMAINING 199 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY THROUGH NUMEROUS "OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY" VOLUNTEER PROJECTS.  
THESE COMMUNITY PRIORITY SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY 55 VOLUNTEER PLACEMENT SITES.   EXAMPLES OF ORGANIZATIONS WHERE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS SERVE INCLUDE THE OTSEGO COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, GOODWILL PATRIOT PLACE, THE AMERICAN RED CROSS DISASTER SERVICES,, THE OTSEGO COUNTY UNITED WAY, THE OTSEGO COUNTY FOOD PANTRY, MICHIGAN DEPT. OF NATURAL RESOURCES, AREA PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICTS, AND A MULTITUDE OF "COMMUNITY PRIORITY" AGENCIES SUCH AS THE OTSEGO COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY AND GAYLORD HIGH SCHOOL'S GORNICK AUDITORIUM. 
THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES (H8) IS THE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT OF H14 (INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT). IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT TWO THIRDS OF THE ELIGIBLE SURVEY RECIPIENTS OF OUR WORK PLAN, DELIVERED BY OUR VOLUNTEERS, WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR INCREASED SOCIAL TIES WITH OUR PROGRAM AND PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS.  
THE FOREGOING OUTCOME IS IN ADDITION TO 3000 VOLUNTEER HOURS OF FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND 5000 VOLUNTEER HOURS OF COMMUNITY SUPPORT.  
IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 PER YEAR IS MATCHED BY AN ADDITIONAL $67,000 IN STATE AND LOCAL SUPPORT, AND THAT THIS GRANT EFFICIENTLY MANAGES TWICE THE CNCS REQUIRED VOLUNTEERS UNDER WORK PLANS.

THE MISSION OF MARQUETTE COUNTY'S RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS ENRICHING THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS BY MATCHING THEIR SKILLS AND INTERESTS WITH VOLUNTEER NEEDS IN OUR NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY.  

AN ESTIMATED 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS FOR ISOLATED, FRAIL AND HOMEBOUND SENIORS OVER THE AGE OF 60.  AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE AN ESTIMATED 175 UNDUPLICATED ISOLATED/FRAIL/HOMEBOUND SENIORS WILL BE TRANSPORTED BY 40 VOLUNTEERS TO AT LEAST 750 MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS EACH YEAR.  VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WILL PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED 60 TRANSPORTS EACH MONTH, SERVING AN AVERAGE OF 2 HOURS PER TRANSPORT.  THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER WILL ASSIST THE SENIOR CLIENT TO THE VEHICLE IF NECESSARY, TRANSPORT THEM TO THEIR APPOINTMENT, ESCORT THEM INTO THE MEDICAL OFFICE AND THEN RETURN THE CLIENT TO THEIR HOME, STOPPING AT THE PHARMACY IF NEEDED.   
TWENTY VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN THE VETERAN FOCUS AREA AND WILL ASSIST AT AREA VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS BY MAKING PASTIES AND WORKING BINGO AND OTHER ACTIVITIES, VISITING VETERAN RESIDENTS OF THE D.J. JACOBETTI HOME FOR VETERANS AND NURSING HOMES; AND HELPING WITH COORDINATION OF VOLUNTEERS AT THE ORGANIZATIONS.  THE VETERANS HISTORY PROJECT USES VOLUNTEERS TO CONDUCT INTERVIEWS WITH VETERANS, WHICH ARE RECORDED, TRANSCRIBED, COPIED AND THEN GIVEN TO THE VETERAN AND SENT TO THE LIBRARY OF CONGRESS.  

COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED BY THE REMAINING 192 RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL VISIT AND MAKE ITEMS FOR NURSING HOME RESIDENTS; ASSIST AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES, WITH NEWSLETTERS AND ACTIVITIES AT SENIOR CENTERS; OFFER INFORMATION, WORK AT GIFT SHOPS AND FILL OTHER VOLUNTEER NEEDS AT HOSPITALS; AND HELP COMMUNITY AGENCIES WITH CLERICAL TASKS AND MAILINGS.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 -- OR $1,000 PER VOLUNTEER FOR EACH OF THE 40 UNDUPLICATED FEDERALLY FUNDED VOLUNTEERS PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION -- WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $110,433 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 223 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE MENTORING/TUTORING, FOOD COLLECTION DISTRIBUTION/SUPPORT, INFORMATION AND REFERRAL FOR HEALTH RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, AND PROMOTING CULTURAL/HISTORICAL EDUCATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS PARTICIPATE WITH RSVP IN THE READING BUDDIES PROGRAM: W.C. CAMERON-GLADSTONE, RAPID RIVER-RAPID RIVER, LEMMER-ESCANABA, AND BARK RIVER-HARRIS-HARRIS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, PARTICIPATING STUDENTS IN GRADES K-2 WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN READING, SPELLING, AND COMPREHENSION. ALSO IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA IS THE GLADSTONE INDIAN EDUCATION PROGRAM. RSVP WAS INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN JANUARY OF 2018. THE MISSION OF THE PROGRAM IS TO PASS ON NATIVE AMERICAN CULTURE AND TEACHING THE STUDENTS TO KEEP THE TRADITIONS ALIVE. THIS IS PRIMARILY DONE THROUGH CRAFT MAKING AND TRADITIONAL NATIVE CELEBRATIONS (FOOD, DRUMMING, DANCING, ETC) THROUGHOUT THE SCHOOL YEAR. IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT 91% OF THE STUDENTS IN THE GLADSTONE AREA SCHOOLS ARE CAUCASIAN.  THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES AN EXAMPLE OF CULTURALLY AWARE INSTRUCTION WHICH PROMOTES TOLERANCE AND UNDERSTANDING OF BOTH NATIVE AND NON-NATIVE CULTURES. IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS, OUTCOMES INCLUDE: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISASTER ASSISTANCE, NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS/OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, NUMBER OF MILES OR RIVERS TREATED TO IMPROVING TRAILS, AND ORGANIZATIONS REPORTING RSVP VOLUNTEERS HAVE HELPED TO MAKE THEIR ORGANIZATIONS MORE EFFECTIVE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $66,968 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY STATE DOLLARS OF $29,007 AND A $18,535 IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS, WHICH EQUALS $47,542 FOR AN AMOUNT ABOVE THE REQUIRED 30% MATCH OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

DEARBORN/OHIO COUNTY RSVP:
	IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT PAIRS THE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE OF SENIOR CITIZENS WITH NEEDS OF COMMUNITY ENTITIES TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER SERVICES TO SCHOOLS, NON-PROFITS, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES AND  UNITS OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT
	HAS A SERVICE AREA COMPOSED OF THREE COUNTIES IN RURAL SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA (SPECIFICALLY DEARBORN, OHIO AND RIPLEY COUNTIES)
	IS SPONSORED AND GOVERNED BY A 7 MEMBER BOARD OF COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES, KNOWN AS THE  DEARBORN SOCIAL COUNCIL.  BOARD MEMBERS ARE NEITHER PAID NOR OTHERWISE COMPENSATED. 
	IS ADMINISTERED BY A FULL-TIME EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
COMMUNITY NEEDS ARE ASSESSED AND MONITORED THROUGH REQUESTS FOR SERVICE FROM EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, LOCAL NON-PROFITS, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES AND GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES.  
AN ESTIMATED 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ON THIS PROJECT.  OF THIS NUMBER, AN ESTIMATED 165 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, MENTORING, CLASSROOM SUPPORT, AND SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, CAPACITY BUILDING  AND DISASTER RESPONSE PREPAREDNESS.  INTERGENERATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND INTERACTIONS WILL BE KEY COMPONENTS.
 THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION WITH EMPHASIS ON THE SCHOOL READINESS (ED1) AND K-12 SUCCESS (ED5A) OBJECTIVES.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA - OBJECTIVES OF SCHOOL READINESS) WILL BE  400 CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.  RSVP WILL ACHIEVE THIS THROUGH THE CEP (CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENT PROJECT) EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES PREPARED BY VOLUNTEERS AND PROVIDED TO HEAD START FACILITIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA.
ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA -OBJECTIVE  K-12 SUCCESS (ED5A)  WILL BE 560 STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  THE ONE ON ONE TUTORING, MENTORING AND CLASSROOM SUPPORT WILL BE THE CHIEF ACTIVITIES OF VOLUNTEERS IN THIS PROGRAM. MATH, READING AND WRITING SECTIONS OF THE INDIANA STATE EDUCATION STANDARDS WILL BE TARGETED. 
IN ADDITION TO THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE ADDITIONAL FOCUS AREAS OF CAPACITY BUILDING, DISASTER SERVICES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $55,000.00 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TO BE SECURED LOCALLY THROUGH GRANTS FROM THE CITY OF LAWRENCEBURG, THE DEARBORN COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION, THE USBANK CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, AND UNITED WAY OF GREATER CINCINNATI AND  THROUGH IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS FROM MANY OTHER COMMUNITY ENTITIES.

THE RSVP VOLUNTEER CENTER SERVES DAVIESS AND MARTIN COUNTIES IN RURAL SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA. IN OPERATION FOR 45 YEARS, THE AGENCY IS A SELF-SPONSORED, INCORPORATED, NON-PROFIT AGENCY GOVERNED BY AN 18 MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS. 
AN ESTIMATED 325 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE BY YEAR THREE OF THIS GRANT CYCLE. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE EVIDENCE BASED FALLS PREVENTION PROGRAM, HEALTHY STEPS FOR OLDER ADULTS; TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW INCOME SENIORS AND FAMILIES; VISION SCREENING PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS; PROJECTS TO REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY; AND AN INTERGENERATIONAL PROJECT MATCHING RSVP VOLUNTEERS WITH CHILDREN IN LOWER ELEMENTARY GRADES TO PROMOTE LITERACY AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 20 OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR THAT WILL REDUCE THEIR RISK OF FALLING; $78,300 WILL HAVE BEEN SAVED IN TAX PREPARATION FEES FOR OLDER ADULTS AND LOW INCOME FAMILIES; 35 CHILDREN AND ADULTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED VISION CARE SERVICES FROM AN EYE CARE PROFESSIONAL; 400 FAMILIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; AND 45 CHILDREN WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS. 
THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $56,830 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $24,356 IN REQUIRED MATCH AS WELL AS $29,463 IN ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING.

AN ESTIMATED 82 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 52 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TAX PREPARATION, HOUSING UNIT DEVELOPMENT, ELDER FRAUD AND SCAM PREVENTION,  COMPANIONSHIP, AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM SUPPORT FOR PRE-SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, $100,000 IN TAX REFUNDS WILL BE GENERATED, TWO SAFE, HEALTHY, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING UNITS ARE MADE AVAILABLE, 30 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND 90 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $22,086 FROM UNITED WAY OF MADISON COUNTY AND OTHER COMMUNITY RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN EAST ST. LOUIS, CAHOKIA, AND BROOKLYN SCHOOL DISTRICTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 150 OUT OF 255 K-3 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AS MEASURED BY READING ASSESSMENTS USED BY THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS SUCH AS FOUNTAS AND PINNELL, GATES MCGINITIE, OR IREADY DIAGNOSTIC. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $13,753 FROM FUNDING FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATIONS. THE OASIS INSTITUTE (OASIS), A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION, IS PROPOSING TO IMPLEMENT A SENIOR CORPS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN SOUTHERN ILLINOIS, SPECIFICALLY EAST ST. LOUIS, CAHOKIA AND BROOKLYN SCHOOL DISTRICTS (IL-1X). THE MISSION OF OASIS IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY AGING THROUGH LIFELONG LEARNING, ACTIVE LIFESTYLES, AND VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT. THE OASIS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS RSVP PROGRAM WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 75 VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 AND OLDER BY THE THIRD YEAR OF PROGRAM OPERATIONS. BUILDING ON ITS PROVEN MODEL AND EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS, OASIS WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND ACADEMICALLY AT-RISK CHILDREN. THERE IS CONSENSUS AMONG EDUCATION EXPERTS THAT IT IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT FOR CHILDREN TO READ AT GRADE LEVEL BY THE END OF THIRD GRADE. RESEARCH HAS DEMONSTRATED THE CORRELATION BETWEEN A STUDENT'S READING ABILITY AT THIS POINT AND HIS OR HER SUBSEQUENT ACADEMIC SUCCESS. ILLINOISREPORTCARD.COM IN 2016-2017, THE STATE'S OFFICIAL SOURCE FOR INFORMATION ABOUT PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN ILLINOIS SHOWS 53.8 PERCENT AND 59.5 PERCENT OF THIRD GRADERS IN EAST ST. LOUIS AND AT LALUMIER ELEMENTARY IN CAHOKIA SCHOOL DISTRICTS RESPECTIVELY DO NOT DEMONSTRATE READINESS FOR THE FOURTH GRADE IN ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS; 83.3 PERCENT OF THIRD GRADERS AT LOVEJOY ELEMENTARY IN BROOKLYN SCHOOL DISTRICT DID NOT DEMONSTRATE READINESS TO ADVANCE IN ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS. TO MEET THIS NEED, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, OASIS WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 75 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE DIRECTLY IN SCHOOLS (VOLUNTEER STATIONS) PROVIDING LITERACY TUTORING AND SUPPORT TO 255 STUDENTS IN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MORE THAN 14,280 HOURS OF SERVICE. OF THE STUDENTS SERVED BY YEAR THREE, 90 PERCENT OF STUDENTS (230) WILL COMPLETE THE PROGRAM AND 65 PERCENT OF THOSE STUDENTS (150) WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AS MEASURED BY PRE- AND POST-TESTS. THE OASIS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS RSVP PROGRAM WILL MEET THE CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED OF IMPROVING STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY WHILE STRENGTHENING SCHOOL COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE PRESENCE OF CARING, WELL-TRAINED, OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS.

C.E.F.S. ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY CORPORATION (C.E.F.S.), SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP), IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY.  C.E.F.S. IS A 501 (C) 3 NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION STRIVING TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED BY DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND EVALUATING SOCIAL SERVICE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE PEOPLE IN THE SERVICE DELIVERY AREA. OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE THROUGH EDUCATION AND SUPPORT TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN SELF-SUFFICIENCY. THE AGENCY MOTTO IS "HELPING PEOPLE. CHANGING LIVES." 

RSVP WILL SERVE CLAY, EFFINGHAM, MOULTRIE AND SHELBY COUNTIES IN RURAL CENTRAL ILLINOIS. AN ESTIMATED 390 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY LIVE. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS TO HOME-BOUND SENIORS; PROVIDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT BY COLLECTING CANNED GOODS, STOCKING SHELVES AND PACKING FOOD BOXES; PROVIDE SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP; OFFER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS WHO NO LONGER DRIVE AND ASSIST THEM WITH ERRANDS AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SO THAT THEY MAY CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; AND LEAD MATTER OF BALANCE CLASSES TO EDUCATE SENIORS ON FALL RISK PREVENTION. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN ARE TUTORING ELEMENTARY STUDENTS THROUGH THE TUTORING PROGRAM; MENTORING ELEMENTARY STUDENTS THROUGH OUR INTERGENERATIONAL PENCIL PAL PROGRAM; READING TO HEAD START STUDENTS; AND OTHER MISCELLANEOUS ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE COMPLETED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 65 STATIONS THAT INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: SENIOR NUTRITION SITES, SENIOR CENTERS, SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS, CHURCHES, FOOD PANTRIES, AND COUNTY OUTREACH OFFICES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE FRAIL SENIORS, CHILDREN, LOW INCOME FAMILIES, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 3-YEAR PERFORMANCE PERIOD, AN ANTICIPATED 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS TO 350 UNDUPLICATED HOME-BOUND SENIORS RESIDING WITHIN THE FOUR-COUNTY SERVICE AREA THROUGH 8 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,052 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $33,511. 00 FROM STATE AND LOCAL GRANTS.

THIS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) ENCOMPASSES ALL OF ADAMS, BROWN AND PIKE COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS.  THESE THREE VERY DIFFERENT RURAL COUNTIES ENCOMPASS JUST OVER 2,010 SQUARE MILES AND ARE BORDERED ON THE WESTERN EDGE BY THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND THE STATE OF MISSOURI.  THE THREE COUNTIES HAVE A WIDE VARIETY OF COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND A DIFFERENCE IN THEIR COMMUNITY NEEDS. ADAMS, BROWN AND PIKE COUNTIES RSVP IS SPONSORED BY JOHN WOOD COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THE RSVP PROGRAM CURRENTLY OPERATES THREE OFFICES.  THE HEADQUARTER OFFICE IS HOUSED ON THE MAIN CAMPUS OF JWCC LOCATED IN QUINCY, IL -- ADAMS COUNTY.  SATELLITE OFFICES ARE LOCATED IN THE JWCC EDUCATION CENTERS LOCATED IN MT. STERLING, IL (BROWN COUNTY) AND PITTSFIELD, IL (PIKE COUNTY). 
SEVEN HUNDRED VOLUNTEERS FROM THE THREE COUNTIES SERVE IN THIS PROJECT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH 145 RSVP VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THAT PROMOTE AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE.  IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN OTHER CNCS FOCUS AREAS -- CAPACITY BUILDING, DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.   THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES ARE PERFORMED AT 120 STATIONS SUCH AS ILLINOIS VETERANS HOME, MEALS-PLUS FOR SENIORS, BLESSING & ILLINI HOSPITALS, SENIOR CENTERS IN MT. STERLING, PITTSFIELD AND PLEASANT HILL, IL, COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND COUNTY EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT CENTERS IN THE THREE COUNTIES, THE UNITED WAY, AMERICAN RED CROSS AND SALVATION ARMY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 6,000 INDIVIDUALS WILL BE POSITIVELY IMPACTED BY THE WORK OF AN RSVP VOLUNTEER.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $145,190 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY FUNDS FROM THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT ON AGING ($51,575), UNITED WAY OF ADAMS COUNTY ($10,000), ADAMS COUNTY ILLINOIS BOARD OF SUPERVISORS ($10,000), BROWN COUNTY UNITED WAY ($1,400) AND FROM FUNDRAISING AND OTHER CONTRIBUTIONS ($1,000).

SENIOR SERVICES ASSOCIATES, INC. HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY FOR RSVP OF MCHENRY AND KANE COUNTIES, IN ILLINOIS SINCE 1987. A SUCCESSFUL GRANT APPLICATION WAS WRITTEN AND IN 2012, AND OUR PROGRAM NOW COVERS KENDALL COUNTY AS WELL, THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL NOW BE COMBINED AND WILL COVER ALL THREE COUNTIES.   
THE PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT A TOTAL OF 710 VOLUNTEERS WHO ANNUALLY WILL REPORT APPROXIMATELY 104,500 HOURS OF SERVICE.   THESE VOLUNTEERS SUPPORT 83 STATIONS THROUGHOUT KANE, KENDALL AND MCHENRY COUNTIES.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF SERVICE WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE MAKING THE MOST IMPACT WILL BE "HEALTHY FUTURES" -- "INDEPENDENT LIVING" VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO FRAIL SENIORS UP TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK, THROUGHOUT OUR SERVICE AREA.  THESE MEALS WILL BE DELIVERED TO HOMEBOUND AND FRAIL ELDERLY THAT HAVE BEEN ASSESSED AND CONSIDERED "AT RISK".  AS THE MEALS ARE DELIVERED, A WELLNESS CHECK IS ALSO PROVIDED AS MANY OF THESE SENIORS RARELY GET OTHER VISITORS ON A DAILY BASIS. A TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM IS AVAILABLE TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS ALLOWING THEM A HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE RIDES FREE OF CHARGE, ALLOWING THE SENIORS TO HAVE MORE MONEY TO SPEND ON HEALTHIER FOOD AND NEEDED MEDICATIONS.  TRANSPORTATION IS PROVIDED TO NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS AND REGULAR TRIPS TO THE GROCERY STORE AND PHARMACY.  SMALL HOME REPAIRS WILL BE OFFERED BY SKILLED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL ASSIST WITH SMALL HOME REPAIRS INSURING THE HOMES ARE KEPT IN GOOD REPAIR AND RESULTING IN A SAFE LIVING ENVIRONMENT. AS MANY SENIORS RISK ISOLATION BECAUSE OF TRANSPORTATION ISSUES, FAMILY SEPARATION, AND OTHER CAUSES, WE OFFER A FRIENDLY VISITING PROGRAM IN WHICH RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED, SCREENED AND MATCHED WITH HOMEBOUND SENIORS. 
"HEALTHY FUTURES" - "ACCESS TO CARE" -- WORKPLANS WILL INCLUDE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING WITH EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMS; MATTER OF BALANCE, FIT AND STRONG, AND TAKE CHARGE OF YOUR HEALTH. ADDITIONALLY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED SHIP COUNSELORS.
SEVERAL OF THE PROGRAMS THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS SUPPORT IN KANE, KENDALL AND MCHENRY COUNTIES SUPPORT THE ABILITY OF THE SENIORS IN OUR AREA TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES, LESSENING THE RISK OF INSTITUTIONALIZATION.
IN SUPPORT OF THE PROJECT, $93,966 CNCS FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUESTED.  $46,483 WILL BE INVESTED BY THE STATE AND THROUGH LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES.

SENIOR SERVICES OF CENTRAL ILLINOIS (SSCI) HAS BEEN A SPONSOR FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) FOR NEARLY 45 YEARS. SSCI IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT SPECIALIZES IN NON-MEDICAL SERVICES TO SENIORS WHO ARE AGE 50 AND OLDER LIVING IN THE SANGAMON, MENARD, MASON AND LOGAN COUNTY AREAS. THE MISSION OF SSCI IS TO SUCCESSFULLY ASSIST SENIORS IN MAINTAINING THEIR INDEPENDENCE AND TO AVOID LONG TERM CARE FACILITIES. 
CURRENTLY THE RSVP HAS 380 VOLUNTEERS WITH 258 OF THOSE NON-DUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS BEING ACTIVE IN 39 STATIONS. THE VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE THEIR TALENTS BY ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS, LOW INCOME SENIORS, HOMEBOUND SENIORS, DISADVANTAGED YOUTH, TUTORING AND MENTORING ALL AGES AND COLLECTING ITEMS FOR SPECIAL PROJECTS TO SUPPORT OUR MILITARY SERVICE MEN AND WOMEN. DUE TO THE MANY PROGRAMS THAT SSCI HAS IN PLACE FOR SENIORS, THE RSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. THIS FOCUS AREA HAS THE LARGEST NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS THAT PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE NUTRITION PROGRAM, MONEY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND ELDER ABUSE PROGRAM. THE OUTCOME FOR THIS FOCUS AREA WILL BE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO NEARLY 1500 SENIORS ANNUALLY. ALL ACTIVITIES IN THIS FOCUS AREA WILL HAVE THE GOAL OF INCREASING THE WELL BEING AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE SENIORS WITHIN THE SANGAMON, MENARD AND LOGAN AREAS. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SUPPORT PROGRAMS IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS INCLUDING EDUCATION, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 
RSVP CONTINUES TO PARTICIPATE IN DAYS OF SERVICE AND SENIOR CORPS WEEK TO PROMOTE AWARENESS ABOUT THE PROGRAMS THAT IS OFFERED THROUGH CNCS. WE ARE REQUESTING $40,000 IN FEDERAL FUNDING TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE SANGAMON, MENARD AND LOGAN COUNTY AREAS.

FAMILY SERVICE RSVP HAS SERVED CHAMPAIGN, PIATT & DOUGLAS COUNTIES SINCE 1972. AN ESTIMATED 600 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIS GRANT PERIOD. THEY WILL DELIVER GROCERIES TO CHRONICALLY HUNGRY LOW-INCOME SENIORS; PROVIDE EMERGENCY FOOD TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AT PANTRIES AND SOUP KITCHENS; PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND HOME DELIVERED MEALS FOR OLDER ADULTS AND/OR THE DISABLED; DELIVER LIBRARY BOOKS, PROVIDE FOOD, ETC TO THE HOMEBOUND AND FRAIL ELDERLY, PROVIDE ADULT LITERACY SERVICES, TUTOR IN K-12, PROVIDE TAX-AIDE SERVICES TO SENIORS AND THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, SERVE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND THEY WILL WORK IN HOSPITALS, LIBRARIES, MUSEUMS AND OTHER NON-PROFIT AGENCY OFFICES. VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE A NETWORK OF 100+ STATIONS SUCH AS FOOD BANKS, SOUP KITCHENS AND FOOD PANTRIES, MEALS ON WHEELS, FAITH IN ACTION, AARP TAX-AIDE, ADULT LITERACY PROGRAMS, LOCAL SCHOOLS AND SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES. THERE WILL BE 185 VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, CHRONICALLY HUNGRY SENIORS AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; THE FRAIL ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WILL CONTINUE TO LIVE AT HOME AND WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; LOW-INCOME TAX PAYERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF TAX CREDITS AND TAX LAW; GRADE SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL MEASUREMENTS; STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES WILL HAVE RECEIVED TRANSPORTATION, ACCESS TO SERVICES, COMFORT AND OTHER SERVICES; ADULT LEARNERS & ESL LEARNERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED JOB SKILL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND ENGLISH SKILLS TO INCREASE THEIR EMPLOYABILITY. LIBRARIES, HOSPITALS, MUSEUMS, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES AND OTHER NON-PROFITS WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO SERVE THEIR CLIENTS WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OUR FEDERAL FUNDING IS 52% OF OUR FUNDING WHILE NONFEDERAL IS 48%.

AN ESTIMATED 333 RSVP OF NORTHWEST ILLINOIS VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 49 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTORS AND GROCERY STORES, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS DAILY, INSTALLATION OF LIFELINE SERVICES, FRIENDLY VISITING GIVING THE HOMEBOUND TIES TO OUTSIDE THEIR HOME, DELIVERING MEALS ON WHEELS, ASSISTING IN DISASTER SITUATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS  HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF "AGING IN PLACE". CNCS-RSVP COMPETITION
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

SGA'S RSVP FOR CPS YOUTH PROJECT WILL ENLIST AN ESTIMATED 300 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS RESIDING IN SEVERAL UNDERPRIVILEGED COMMUNITIES AND EXPERIENCING ACADEMIC OBSTACLES.   OF THIS NUMBER, 223 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUT OF SCHOOL TIME PROJECT ASSIGNMENTS AND 77 WILL BE PLACED IN TUTORING ASSIGNMENTS. AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CONDUCTING READING AND MATH GROUPS TO INCREASE THE LITERACY SKILLS OF 1,100 ELEMENTARY AGED STUDENTS; PROVIDING INTENSIVE TUTORING SUPPORT TO 240 INDIVIDUAL K-8TH GRADE STUDENTS; AND, 300 SENIORS POSITIVELY BONDING WITH THE YOUNGER GENERATION IN THE BRIGHTON PARK, ROSELAND, AND SOUTH LAWNDALE CHICAGO COMMUNITIES. 
EDUCATION IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT WITH THE PROGRAM MODEL BEING INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING USING THE CENTER FOR COLLABORATIVE CLASSROOM'S (CCC) KIDZLIT AND KIDZMATH CURRICULA.  THE USDOE WHAT WORKS CLEARINGHOUSE INCLUDES THE CCC CURRICULA IN ITS DOCUMENTATION OF NOTED IMPACT STUDIES. KIDZLIT AND KIDZMATH ARE COMPARABLE TO THE SOUND PARTNERS AND READING PARTNERS MODE & DURATION OF DELIVERY AND EVIDENCE REVIEWS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 75% OF YOUTH SERVED THROUGH THIS INITIATIVE WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR ACADEMIC OUTCOMES TO EITHER MEET OR EXCEED LEVELS IN READING AND MATH; 100% OF PARTICIPATING SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR ENGAGEMENT WITH YOUNG PEOPLE IN THEIR COMMUNITY; AND, 75% OF SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED TRAINING ON EVIDENCE-BASED CURRICULUM LEADING TO IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT OF THE MOST DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS.  THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $222, 964 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $24,315, REPRESENTING THE REQUIRED 10% MATCH OF CASH AND/OR IN-KIND SERVICES BY SGA YOUTH AND FAMILY SERVICES DURING THE FIRST YEAR OF PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION, WITH 20% AND 30% MATCHES OCCURRING IN THE FOLLOWING YEARS, RESPECTIVELY.

THE MISSION OF SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS COLLEGE (SWIC), THE GRANT APPLICANT, IS TO UPHOLD THE DIGNITY AND WORTH OF ALL PEOPLE AND HOLDS THE BELIEF THAT LEARNING IS A LIFE-LONG PROCESS WHICH ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE.  THE COLLEGE PROVIDES FOR INDIVIDUAL GROWTH THROUGH EDUCATIONAL EXCELLENCE AND ACTIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY. SWIC SEEKS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES BY APPLYING FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2019 RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) OF THE RSVP GRANT PROVIDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS).  IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CNCS STRATEGIC PLAN, SWIC RSVP HAS PRIORITIZED HEALTHY FUTURES AS ITS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.  IF GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE AWARDED THIS RENEWAL GRANT, SWIC RSVP WILL PLACE 707 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP BUILD CAPACITY, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY, ASSIST IN TRANSPORTATION FOR VETERANS AND OTHER OLDER AND DISABLED ADULTS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, MENTOR AND TUTOR STUDENTS, ASSIST WITH FINANCIAL LITERACY AND RAISE OPIOID AWARENESS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  SWIC RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO STRIVE TO MEET THE COMMUNITY NEEDS IN ST. CLAIR COUNTY AND SWIC'S COLLEGE DISTRICT IN MADISON COUNTY THROUGH SUPPORTIVE PARTNERSHIPS OF 111 VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  OVER THE NEXT 3 YEARS SWIC RSVP HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA HAS 3 OBJECTIVES: AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD, AND ACCESS TO CARE.  SWIC IS REQUESTING THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $91,060.00 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $43,047 OF LOCAL FUNDING AND IN-KIND SUPPORT, AS WELL AS $52,766 FROM THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT ON AGING.  SWIC RSVP PROVES TO BE A GREAT INVESTMENT AS IT WILL PROVIDE THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES 707 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, WHICH IS A FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF ONLY $129 PER VOLUNTEER. THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL SHOW EVIDENCE THAT SUPPORTS WHY SWIC HAS BEEN SO SUCCESSFUL AS A SPONSOR FOR ALL 3 SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS AMERICORPS FOR OVER THE PAST 45 YEARS AND WILL CONTINUE TO SO IN THE FUTURE.  
	IT SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED THAT WITH 45 YEARS OF SUCCESSFUL GRANT MANAGEMENT, SWIC HAS CHOSEN TO APPLY FOR THE GRANT OPPORTUNITY NUMBER IL1X WHICH COVERS THE EAST ST. LOUIS, CENTERVILLE, ALORTON, BROOKLYN, WASHINGTON PARK, FAIRMONT CITY, AND ST. CLAIR COUNTY.  WE BELIEVE THAT BLENDING THESE 2 GRANT OPPORTUNITIES UNDER ONE SPONSOR AND UNIFYING THE EFFORTS ACROSS THE ENTIRE ST. CLAIR COUNTY WILL ONLY STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES.

THE RSVP OF BLACK HAWK AND FAYETTE COUNTIES WILL SERVE 250 VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THIS PROJECT. OF THIS NUMBER, 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE OUTCOME ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVICE DISADVANTAGED YOUTH WHO ARE BEHIND IN READING SKILLS (EDUCATION), PROVIDING TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE TO LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS (ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY), AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, AND PREPARATION FOR TIMES OF DISASTER (DISASTER PREPARATION). OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL INCLUDE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AT 15 STATIONS.  

THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS EDUCATION: HELPING DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IMPROVE THEIR READING SKILLS. IT IS ANTICIPATED AT THE END OF THE THIRD YEAR OF A 3-YEAR GRANT PERIOD A MINIMUM OF 130 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST MINIMALLY 350 STUDENTS IN IMPROVING READING SKILLS AND 30 UNDUPLICATED TAX VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST 800 LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN OBTAINING A TAX REFUND. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $87,585 PER YEAR WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $13,014 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES (INCLUDES IN-KIND).

THE MAJORITY OF VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOLS TUTORING AND MENTORING STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT READING AT GRADE LEVEL.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP OF NORTH CENTRAL IOWA (NCI) IS EDUCATION.  

APPROXIMATELY 438 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING THE 2019-20 YEAR.  INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING INCLUDES READING BUDDY, READING COACH, AND PEN PAL PROGRAMS.  BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IN THE READING BUDDY PROGRAM, 166 (30%) OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE THEIR READING BY .5-.99 AND 333 (60%) WILL IMPROVE BY ONE OR MORE GRADE LEVEL(S).  IN THE READING COACH PROGRAM, 16 (20%) OF MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE THEIR READING BY .5-.99 AND 40 (50%) WILL IMPROVE BY ONE GRADE OR MORE LEVEL(S). 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $129,147 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $65,004 OF LOCAL MATCH.  RSVP OF NORTH CENTRAL IOWA IS SPONSORED BY NORTH IOWA AREA COMMUNITY COLLEGE (NIACC) IN MASON CITY, IOWA. RSVP DUBUQUE COUNTY (RSVPDC) PROVIDES COMMUNITY MEMBERS AGE 55 OR BETTER WITH VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT USE THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCES AND SKILLS TO MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS.  UNITYPOINT HEALTH-FINLEY HOSPITAL HAS SPONSORED RSVPDC SINCE 1982.

A TOTAL OF 360  UNDUPLICATED  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COMMUNITIES OF DUBUQUE, ASBURY, CASCADE, DYERSVILLE, EPWORTH, FARLEY, NEW VIENNA, PEOSTA, AND WORTHINGTON IOWA. 

    THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF RSVPDC IS HEALTHY FUTURES, FOCUSING ON INCREASING SOCIAL SUPPORT OF SENIORS AND ASSISTING THEM TO HAVE AN IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. VOLUNTEERS ALSO SERVE IN THE AREAS OF: CAPACITY BUILDING, DISASTER SERVICES, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 

IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES, 50 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE HOME DELIVERED MEALS PROGRAM, THE DUBUQUE FOOD PANTRY, AND DURIDE. THE POPULATIONS SERVED INCLUDE SENIORS, HOMEBOUND ELDERLY, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS. 

    THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,376 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY FUNDING FROM THE STATE OF IOWA IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,468 AND FUNDING FROM THE DUBUQUE COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,200.  UNITYPOINT HEALTH-FINLEY HOSPITAL WILL CONTRIBUTE OFFICE SPACE, PHONE AND INTERNET SERVICE, PRINTING, POSTAGE, MEETING ROOM USAGE, AND STAFF SUPERVISION TOTALING MORE THAN $12,345 OF IN-KIND SUPPORT.

UNITED WAY OF EAST CENTRAL IOWA (UWECI) CONTINUES TO SEE THE IMPACT THAT VOLUNTEERS 55 AND BETTER MAKE IN OUR COMMUNITY AND IS RECOMPETING FOR THE RSVP OF LINN & JONES CO TO CONTINUE PROVIDING THIS IMPACTFUL RESOURCE FOR OUR COMMUNITY. UWECI'S 55+ INITIATIVE ENGAGES AT LEAST 350 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WITH A MINIMUM OF 75 SERVING IN CNCS APPROVED OUTCOME-BASED OPPORTUNITIES.

RSVP IS A PILLAR OF SERVICE FOR ABOUT 40 YEARS. UWECI IS LEVERAGING THIS RECOMPETITION TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFICIENCY AND PERCEIVED VALUE OF RSVP SERVICES BY ALLEVIATING THE REPORTING BURDEN ON MOST VOLUNTEER STATIONS. WE WILL RECRUIT AND PLACE RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN IMPACTFUL OPPORTUNITIES. WHAT WE WILL MINIMIZE IS THE NUMBER OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE TO TIE OUTCOMES BACK TO RSVP VS. NON-RSVP VOLUNTEERS; THIS HAS BEEN A STRUGGLE FOR STATIONS DUE TO VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE AND STATION STAFF TURN-OVER. UWECI WILL NOW SHOULDER THIS BURDEN BY HAVING MOST OUTCOME-BASED VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES DONE WITH COLLABORATIONS THAT UWECI RUNS OR IS INVOLVED IN. THIS WILL INCREASE THE VALUE OF RSVP IN OUR COMMUNITY BECAUSE STATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO RECEIVE THE BENEFITS WITH A MUCH SMALLER REPORTING BURDEN.

RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT COMMUNITY NEEDS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MEAL DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP PROGRAMS, FOOD SECURITY, PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON EDUCATION AND PROVIDING SERVICES, DISTRIBUTION OF INSURANCE INFORMATION, BUILDING WHEELCHAIR RAMPS AND VOLUNTEER CAPACITY BUILDING; SUPPORTING A NETWORK OF ABOUT 40 STATIONS THAT COVERING CNCS FOCUS AREAS AND OBJECTIVES. 

55+ INITIATIVE WILL CONNECT VOLUNTEERS WITH HEALTHY FUTURES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION AND CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME-BASED ACTIVITIES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ANNUALLY INCREASE ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE FOR 150 CLIENTS, BRING AT LEAST $500,000 BACK TO OUR COMMUNITY IN TAX RETURNS, HELP INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE FOR 20 STUDENTS, INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS, EFFICIENCY AND/OR PROGRAM REACH FOR 12 STATIONS. WE WILL PROVIDE EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING FOR AGING IN PLACE -- INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH THE NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION WORK PLAN.

DURING THE UPCOMING GRANT PERIOD OUR RSVP DIRECTOR WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH THE OFFICE OF THE IOWA ATTORNEY GENERAL TO DETERMINE THE BEST WAY THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS CAN ASSIST WITH THEIR EFFORTS FOR ELDER JUSTICE AND THE LOCAL AREA SUBSTANCE ABUSE COALITION TO SEE HOW 55+ INITIATIVE CAN SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS FIGHTING THE NATIONAL OPIOID CRISIS. WHEN AN IMPACTFUL VOLUNTEER ROLE IS DEFINED WE WILL WORK WITH OUR CSO TO ADD THE APPROPRIATE WORK PLAN(S).

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE MATCHED WITH AT-LEAST $12,000 IN LOCAL NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP WILL PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OLDER WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO USE THEIR ENERGY, EXPERIENCE AND LIFE SKILLS TO RESPOND TO COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH SERVICE. AN ESTIMATED 536 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. AN ESTIMATED 538 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT THE WESTBAY COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (WESTBAY) IN A NETWORK OF 33 DIFFERENT STATIONS. THEY WILL PERFORM, AMONG OTHERS, THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: FOOD DELIVERY AND COMPANIONSHIP AT MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAMS AND AT SENIOR CENTERS, COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES THROUGH THE FRIENDLY VISITORS PROGRAM AND MILITARY VETERANS MENTORING OTHER VETERANS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE WESTBAY RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES WILL HAVE BEEN ACHIEVED: 1,890 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT, BY SURVEY, HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; THIS PROGRAM GOAL INCLUDES 82 VETERANS. THE SERVICE STATIONS WILL BE PRIMARILY LOCATED IN KENT COUNTY, RHODE ISLAND; ALTHOUGH SOME WILL BE LOCATED IN PROVIDENCE COUNTY AND WASHINGTON COUNTY, BOTH OF WHICH ARE ADJACENT TO KENT COUNTY. AS A COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, WESTBAY PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE HUMAN SERVICES TO THIS POPULATION WITH A FULL TIME STAFF OF 65 EMPLOYEES AND 26 CASE MANAGERS. WESTBAY WILL INTEGRATE MANY RSVP STATIONS INTO ITS SERVICE PLATFORM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $72,706 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $79,585 IN MATCHING FUNDS FROM WESTBAY. THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA WILL BE ADVANCED THROUGH THE VETERAN MENTOR PROGRAM, WHICH WILL ASSIST VETERANS INVOLVED IN THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM. RSVP VOLUNTEER MENTORS WILL OFFER MENTORING AND REFERRAL ASSISTANCE TO VETERANS THAT ARE PARTICIPATING IN AN ALTERNATIVE SENTENCING PROJECT. WESTBAY EXPECTS 5 RSVP VETERANS TO PARTICIPATE AT THIS WORKSTATION. WESTBAY'S RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN EXPECTED 35 VETERANS PARTICIPATING AT OTHER WORKSTATIONS THROUGHOUT THE PROGRAM. THESE VETERANS WILL BECOME MEMBERS OF THE RI VET CORPS, A PROJECT STARTED BY WESTBAY IN 2016. RSVP VETERANS WHO VOLUNTEER FOR THE CORPS WILL BE TRAINED WITH THE LATEST INFORMATION ON VETERANS' SERVICES. THE RSVP VETERANS WILL THEN ACT AS MENTORS AND REFERRAL AGENTS FOR FELLOW VETERANS.

THE MUNICIPALITY OF SAN JUAN IS THE CAPITAL CITY OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO. THE MISSION OF THE MUNICIPALITY OF SAN JUAN IS TO PROVIDE CITIZENS A QUALITY OF LIFE, WATCH OVER ITS PUBLIC SAFETY AND SEARCH FOR ALTERNATIVES IN EMPLOYMENT, ACCESS TO QUALITY HEALTH CARE, ACCESS TO QUALITY RECREATIONAL PROGRAMS AND IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC POSSIBILITIES OF ITS POPULATION. UNDER THE RSVP PROGRAM WE PROPOSE THE RECRUITMENT OF 130 VOLUNTEERS. OUR MISSION IS TO COLLABORATE ON THE BETTERMENT OF THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE MORE VULNERABLE CITIZENS TO THE CITY OF SAN JUAN, THROUGHOUT THE PARTICIPATION OF THESE VOLUNTEERS. LIKEWISE, WE OFFER THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS ALTERNATIVES TO HELP THEM PROVIDE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO BENEFIT THE ELDERLY AND THE HOMELESS POPULATION. THIS PROGRAM IS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE DEPARTMENT FOR SOCIAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT OF MUNICIPALITY OF SAN JUAN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS "HEALTHY FUTURES", IN WHICH 109 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, SUCH AS HOMELESS, SENIOR CITIZENS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED IN THE AREAS OF FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP, ASSISTING SOUP KITCHENS, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND OTHER SERVICES THAT HELP THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL CONCENTRATE EFFORTS IN PUBLIC FACILITIES, SUCH AS THE 12 SENIOR CITIZEN CENTERS, 2 PRIVATE NON-PROFIT FACILITIES: "CENTRO CULTURAL CANTERA" AND "FONDITA DE JESUS" AND THE AUXILIO MUTUO CANCER CENTER.  THIS CENTER IS A UNIQUE CONCEPT IN PUERTO RICO AND THE CARIBBEAN THAT HOLDS A PROMINENT POSITION IN THE HEMISPHERE. THE CENTER HAS A MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM OF HEALTH PROFESSIONALS THAT ANALYZES AND INVESTIGATES EACH CASE TO ACHIEVE A COMPLETE DIAGNOSIS AND PLAN ACCURATE TREATMENT. THE 10 VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE PATIENTS AND THE FAMILIES THAT FACE THIS ILLNESS, MITIGATING THE PAIN AND OTHER SYMPTOMS AND PROVIDE EMOTIONAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL SUPPORT FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE DIAGNOSIS UNTIL THE END OF THEIR LIFE AND DURING MOURNING. THE OTHER VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY AT THE COMMUNITY CENTERS OF SHANGAI, PLAYITA, AND RIO PIEDRAS. THESE ACTIVITIES PROVIDE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR VOLUNTEERS, TO EMPOWER THEMSELVES BY OFFERING THEIR KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES AND EXPERIENCES TO CITIZENS OF THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. IN SHANGAI AND PLAYITA THEY WILL OFFER WORKSHOPS IN AREAS SUCH AS BAKERY, JEWELRY CREATION, CRAFTSMANSHIP, AND SEWING. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEARS WE HOPE TO HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE WELL-BEING OF THE SENIOR CITIZENS THAT PARTICIPATED BY OFFERING THEM SUPPORT AND COMPANIONSHIP AND TO HAVE HELPED THE HOMELESS RECEIVE BALANCED MEALS AND SENSITIVE AND DIGNIFIED TREATMENT, AS ESTABLISHED BY OUR CONSTITUTION. FOR THIS EFFORT, WE ARE REQUESTING THE AMOUNT OF $59,307.00 IN FEDERAL FUNDS, AND ALLOCATING $25,486.00 IN MATCHED LOCAL FUNDS.

COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CAI) IS A CHARITABLE 501 (C)(3), NON-PROFIT CORPORATION ESTABLISHED IN 1965.  CAI HAS A SUCCESSFUL HISTORY OF DELIVERING DIVERSE SERVICES TO LOW INCOME FAMILIES, STUDENTS, AND AGING POPULATIONS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES.  CAI IS DEDICATED TO BEING A COMMUNITY CATALYST, PROVIDING AND COORDINATING ACTIVITIES WHICH ALLEVIATE POVERTY, PROMOTE SELF SUFFICIENCY AND ADVANCE COMMUNITY PROSPERITY, AND STRIVES TO BE RECOGNIZED AS A PREMIER ORGANIZATION SOLVING SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC PROBLEMS IN OUR COMMUNITIES.  CAI HAS BEEN A SENIOR CORPS-RSVP SPONSOR SINCE 1971.   

CAI'S SENIOR CORPS-RSVP WILL SERVE VOLUNTEERS IN CLARION, INDIANA, AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES. BY THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE IN YEAR THREE, A MINIMUM OF 61 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  AN ADDITIONAL UNDUPLICATED 100 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA TO ADDRESS ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY NEEDS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO AGING SENIORS, LOW INCOME FAMILIES, AND CHILDREN BY DELIVERING MEALS, ASSISTING AT FOOD PANTRIES, ANSWERING MEDICARE/MEDICAID QUESTIONS, PREPARING FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL TAX RETURNS AND PROPERTY TAX REBATES, PROVIDING SUPPORT IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING LOCAL NON-PROFITS ACHIEVE THEIR MISSION, AND ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE AVAILABLE TO VOLUNTEERS THROUGH 50 PLUS STATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT CLARION, INDIANA, AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES INCLUDING: AREA AGENCIES OF AGING, FOOD PANTRIES, VITA SITES, HOSPITALS, LIBRARIES, HEAD START CENTERS, FAITH BASED ORGANIZATIONS, PROPRIETARY HEALTHCARE FACILITIES, AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.  OUR FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD, CAI EXPECTS TO MAINTAIN/RECRUIT AND ASSIGN 61 VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: HOME DELIVERED MEALS, FOOD PANTRY ASSISTANCE, AND APPRISE HOTLINE. 
 THE OUTCOMES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,847 AND $26,078 OF NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT.

FOR THE PROPOSED GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 375 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE CITIZENS OF ROCKLAND COUNTY BY PERFORMING SERVICE ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH THREE OF THE SIX FEDERAL FOCUS AREAS. CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF OGDENSBURG IS A 501(C) 3 NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS TO RESPOND TO THE NEEDS OF THE MOST VULNERABLE MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY. CATHOLIC CHARITIES WAS ESTABLISHED BY AN ACT OF THE NEW YORK STATE LEGISLATURE IN 1917. CATHOLIC CHARITIES MISSION STANDS ON THE FOUNDATION OF THREE CONCEPTS: RESPONDING, INVITING AND EMPOWERING. CATHOLIC CHARITIES COVERS THE EIGHT (8) NORTHERN MOST COUNTIES OF NEW YORK STATE. CATHOLIC CHARITIES INVITES OTHERS (SUCH AS VOLUNTEERS) TO BECOME ACTIVE MEMBERS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND WORK TOWARDS BUILDING HEALTHY COMMUNITIES FOR ALL CITIZENS. THE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES PROVIDED BY CATHOLIC CHARITIES ARE GOAL-ORIENTED AND FOCUSED ON EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO BUILD BRIDGES TO HEALTHY LIVES. CATHOLIC CHARITIES BELIEVES THAT HEALTHY INDIVIDUALS AND HEALTHY FAMILIES BUILD HEALTHY COMMUNITIES. CATHOLIC CHARITIES ADMINISTRATION, STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS REMAIN CONSISTENTLY OPEN TO RESPONDING TO FRAGILE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH THE HOPE THEY WILL GAIN ENOUGH TRACTION TO IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL CIRCUMSTANCES.
