THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE REMAINING 50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO SUPPORT OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVICE AS STATE CERTIFIED OMBUDSMAN, TO ADVOCATE FOR INDIVIDUALS IN NURSING HOMES. OTHERS WILL SERVE AS COUNSELORS IN LIFESPANS FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. THEY WILL PROVIDE IN HOME SUPPORT WITH BUDGETING, BALANCING CHECKBOOKS AND BILL PAYING. VOLUNTEERS SERVING OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL PROVIDE A SAFETY NET TO CATCH FINANCIAL AND OR HEALTHCARE ISSUES BEFORE THEY BECOME OUT OF CONTROL. THESE PREVENTATIVE MEASURES WILL HELP CREATE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL IN RECEIPT OF SERVICES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE 250 PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE COMPLETED MATTER OF BALANCE, LIVING HEALTHY WITH DIABETES AND/OR TAI CHI FOR ARTHRITIS WORKSHOPS WITH 95 % INDICATING THEY WILL MAKE CHANGES TO LIFESTYLE BASED UPON THE INFORMATION SHARED.  VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WILL HAVE TRANSPORTED 350 UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. THIS INTERVENTION WILL POSITIVELY IMPACT THE INDIVIDUAL'S PERCEPTION OF HAVING IMPROVED ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE. GOAL IS 95% INDICATING IMPROVEMENT.  RSVP NATIONAL VETERAN CORPS MEMBERS WILL HAVE SERVED 25 FELLOW VETERANS BY PROVIDING A SOURCE OF COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIAL SUPPORT. AS A RESULT, WE PROJECT AN IMPROVEMENT IN PRE-VS POST SCORES AS MEASURED BY THE DUKE SOCIAL SUPPORT INDEX AND/ OR UCLA LONELINESS SCALE. VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN MEALS ON WHEELS ASSIGNMENTS WILL HAVE SERVED 500 MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, THUS INCREASING FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 126,779 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 57,000.

THE LEGAL AGENCY NAME IS ELDERLIFE, INC. DBA PARKWAY CENTER. THE PARKWAY CENTER IS A SENIOR SERVICE AGENCY WITH OVER 60 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE. THE AGENCY HISTORY DATES BACK TO 1957 AND HAS GONE THROUGH SEVERAL CONSOLIDATIONS, WITH THE MOST RECENT IN 2005, WHERE THE CORNHILL SENIOR CENTER AND ELDERLIFE, INC. MERGED TO FORM THE PARKWAY SENIOR CENTER. IN 2013, THE PARKWAY SENIOR CENTER WAS REBRANDED AS THE PARKWAY CENTER. THE PARKWAY CENTER SERVES OVER 3,500 PERSONS 50+ YEARS OF AGE. THE PARKWAY CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS 50+ EMPOWERING THEM TO LIVE HEALTHY AND VIBRANT LIVES. THE PARKWAY CENTER HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR AGENCY FOR THE ONEIDA COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM SINCE 1999. THE PARKWAY CENTER PROPOSES TO SUPPORT 215 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION, BILL PAYER PROGRAM, A MATTER OF BALANCE FALLS PREVENTION PROGRAM, STAY YOUNG STRONG BONES PROGRAM, EMERGENCY FOOD AND FOOD INSECURITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROJECTS ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, AS EXPANDED UPON IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES WORK PLANS ARE TO INCREASE SENIOR'S ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE AND TO INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD BY REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND RESPONDING TO FOOD EMERGENCIES. RSVP WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH STATIONS TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS LOCAL COMMUNITY PRIORITIES IN ONEIDA COUNTY AND WILL WORK WITH THE ROME VA AND THE CENTRAL NEW YORK VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER TO SERVE VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES.

200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN GENESEE COUNTY, NEW YORK (NY) WITH 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS, DRIVING OLDER ADULTS AND VETERANS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH FRIENDLY VISITS, HELPING TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY TO COMBAT THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC AND TO ENCOURAGE HEALTHY AGING WITH INTENT TO CHANGE BEHAVIOR; AND ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT LOCAL PANTRIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 160 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES AND 80 PEOPLE WILL REPORT HAVING IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; 2,000 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE EMERGENCY FOOD WITH 500 REPORTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; AND 120 PEOPLE WILL INCREASE THEIR ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH EDUCATION ON HEALTHY HABITS IN AGING (AGING MASTERY PROGRAM) AND OPIOID AWARENESS, WITH 10 PEOPLE REPORTING A CHANGE IN BEHAVIOR AND 50 REPORTING INCREASED HEALTH KNOWLEDGE ABOUT OPIOIDS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $36,840.

THE COMMUNITY SERVICE SOCIETY OF NEW YORK (CSS) IS AN INFORMED, INDEPENDENT, AND UNWAVERING VOICE FOR POSITIVE ACTION ON BEHALF OF MORE THAN 3 MILLION LOW-INCOME NEW YORKERS. CSS DRAWS ON 175 YEARS OF EXCELLENCE IN ADDRESSING THE ROOT CAUSES OF ECONOMIC DISPARITY. OUR RICH LEGACY OF ACHIEVEMENT INCLUDES SERVING AS THE CATALYST BEHIND NEW YORK'S FIRST TENEMENT HOUSING LAWS; ESTABLISHING THE PROTOTYPE FOR THE NATIONAL FREE LUNCH PROGRAM AT SCHOOLS; DESIGNING THE CURRICULUM FOR WHAT WOULD BECOME COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY'S SCHOOL OF SOCIAL WORK; OPENING THE CITY'S FIRST HOMELESS SHELTER FOR MEN; AND CREATING THE PROTOTYPE FOR WHAT BECAME THE NATIONAL RSVP.  AN ESTIMATED 2,300 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 835 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 
        1. NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT (THROUGH MEAL DELIVERY AND FOOD PANTRY/SOUP KITCHEN SUPPORT).
        2. COMPANIONSHIP (TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND VETERANS).
        3. COUNSELING (PUBLIC BENEFITS). 
465 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT WE WILL HAVE ACHIEVED OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES THROUGHOUT ALL OF OUR FOCUS AREAS AND WORK PLANS.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES BASED ON THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES LISTED ABOVE ARE SUMMARIZED BELOW AND QUANTIFIED IN THE WORK PLANS.  
        1. OLDER ADULTS IN NEED OF NUTRITIOUS MEAL DELIVERY WILL FEEL MORE SOCIALLY CONNECTED DUE TO THE ACTIVITY OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  NEW YORKERS EXPERIENCING HUNGER WILL REPORT AN INCREASED LEVEL OF FOOD SECURITY DUE TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY RSVP FOOD PANTRY AND SOUP KITCHEN VOLUNTEERS.
        2. VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS WILL FEEL LESS ISOLATED DUE TO THE COMPANIONSHIP THEY RECEIVE FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS. HOMEBOUND VETERANS WILL FEEL AN INCREASED LEVEL OF SOCIAL SUPPORT BECAUSE OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.
        3. LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WILL IMPROVE THEIR ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE DUE TO THE PUBLIC BENEFITS COUNSELING THEY RECEIVE FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $728,668 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $900,784, WHICH INCLUDES THE MATCH AND EXCESS OF THE NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 255 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 145 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS IN OUR HOME DELIVERED MEALS PROGRAM (HDM) AND PROVIDING RIDES IN OUR HOMEBOUND MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (HMT). THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 120 OF THE 145 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE WORKING IN THE HDM. USING THE RSVP INDEPENDENT LIVING PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEY WE WILL ANNUALLY SURVEY CLIENTS WHO HAVE RECEIVED A MINIMUM OF 5 MEALS A WEEK FOR AT LEAST 6 WEEKS, WE BELIEVE THAT 70% WILL FEEL THEY HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO THE HDM VOLUNTEERS. 25 OF THE 145 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE DRIVERS IN HMT. THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE 110 CLIENTS RIDES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. CLIENTS RECEIVING HMT FOR A MINIMUM OF 2 RIDES (WITH A DURATION OF 30 MINUTES OR MORE) OVER A 3 MONTH PERIOD WILL BE SURVEYED USING THE INDEPENDENT LIVING PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT SURVEY ANNUALLY TO DETERMINE IF THEY HAVE INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO THE HMT VOLUNTEERS. WE ANTICIPATE 90% OF THE CLIENTS SURVEYED WILL INDICATE A POSITIVE RESPONSE EVIDENCING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,898.00 FROM GREENE COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES

TRI-COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC., (TCCAP), A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT 501 (C) 3 AGENCY, IS COOS COUNTY RSVP'S SPONSORING AGENCY.  TCCAP IS A MULTI-PROGRAM AGENCY WITH PROJECTS AND SERVICE LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT COOS, CARROLL, AND GRAFTON COUNTIES AND PREDOMINATELY SERVES LOW INCOME AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS.  TCCAP IS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE LIVES AND WELL-BEING OF NEW HAMPSHIRE'S RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITIES AND IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES AND SUPPORTS FOR PEOPLE TO GROW IN SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND BETTER CONDITIONS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  OVERALL, THE AGENCY HAS ANNUALLY SERVED OVER 24,000 NORTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE CITIZENS THIS PAST YEAR BY ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES VIA THE FOLLOWING SERVICES: HEAD START;  ELDER PROGRAMING; GUARDIANSHIP SERVICES; ENERGY AND FUEL ASSISTANCE; HOUSING AND COMMUNITY CONTACT; DOMESTIC ABUSE; AND RURAL TRANSPORTATION  PROGRAMING.  COOS COUNTY RSVP COVERS THE MOST AGED AND IMPOVERISHED AREA OF THE THREE COUNTIES SERVED AND BATTLES WITH THE HIGHEST MOUNTAINOUS TERRAIN, HARSH WINTERS, LIMITED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION,  VERY LIMITED SPECIALIZED HEALTH CARE FACILITIES, LIMITED GROCERY RESOURCES, AND THE MOST RAPIDLY AGEING SENIOR POPULATION IN NEW HAMPSHIRE.
WE PROJECT THAT 350 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 150 OF THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE  IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS:  HEALTHY FUTURES (WHICH INCLUDES MATTER OF BALANCE AND BONE BUILDER CLASSES); FOOD RESOURCES; ESSENTIAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; AND FRIENDLY CALLS AND VISITS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, WE WILL REPORT THE RESULTS OF SURVEYS OF OUR MOST VULNERABLE SENIORS. WE ANTICIPATE THAT, AS IN THE PAST, THESE SURVEYS WILL INDICATE BOTH INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND ABILITY TO AGE IN PLACE DUE IN PART TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $68,572 PER YEAR FOR THREE YEARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $20,572 -  THE SUM OF FUNDING FROM THE COUNTY OF COOS, SMALL LOCAL GRANTS, SPECIAL EVENTS, AND DONATIONS.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES MAINE (CCM) WILL RECRUIT AND PLACE 165 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN KENNEBEC COUNTY AND SOMERSET COUNTY, MAINE BETWEEN APRIL 1, 2019 - MARCH 30, 2022.  ALL WILL BE PLACED IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE (NPM) WORKPLANS THAT SUPPORT THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.  
UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THREE WORKPLANS: COMPANIONSHIP (70 VOLUNTEERS), TRANSPORTATION (70 VOLUNTEERS) AND REFERRALS (25 VOLUNTEERS).  ALL ARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST ISOLATED, LOW INCOME SENIORS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WEEKLY VISITS WITH SENIORS IN THEIR HOMES, ASSISTANCE WITH CHORES IN THE HOME AND YARD, SOCIAL INTERACTION, DRIVING SENIORS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY STORE, DRUG STORE, AND REFERRING THEM TO COMMUNITY SERVICES FOR SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD, FINANCIAL SUPPORT, AND HOMEMAKING ASSISTANCE. CCM WILL BE THE SPONSOR AGENCY AND WILL DIRECTLY OVERSEE 2 VOLUNTEER STATIONS; ONE EACH IN KENNEBEC AND SOMERSET COUNTY.
THE RSVP SPONSORED BY CCM WILL SERVE 198 LOW-INCOME SENIORS -  THE MAJORITY OF WHO LIVE ALONE, DO NOT DRIVE/LACK ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION, AND ARE SOCIALLY ISOLATED.  AT THE END OF THE THREE- YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES UNDER NPM H9A:  INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING: 
-	178 SENIORS WILL REPORT THAT COMPANIONSHIP IMPROVED THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; 
-	168 SENIORS WILL REPORT TRANSPORTATION IMPROVED THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND
-	89 SENIORS WILL REPORT REFERRAL SERVICES IMPROVED THEIR CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.

AN ESTIMATED 240 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH RSVP OF ST. MARY'S COUNTY UNDER THE SPONSORSHIP OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGING & HUMAN SERVICES. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PERFORMANCE MEASURE WORK PLANS WITH OUTCOMES. OUR PRIORITY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AMONG OUR RSVP PROJECT'S SERVICE ACTIVITIES, OUR SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO CARE BY RENOVATING, DISTRIBUTING, AND DELIVERING MEDICAL EQUIPMENT FREE-OF-CHARGE TO INDIVIDUALS IN NEED, SUCH AS THE FRAIL ELDERLY, PERSONS  WITH DISABILITIES, INDIVIDUALS RECOVERING FROM SURGERY, AND DISABLED VETERANS. THIS SERVICE HELPS CITIZENS REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES CLOSE TO THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT SYSTEMS RATHER THAN HAVING TO GO INTO EXPENSIVE REHABILITATION, ASSISTED LIVING, OR NURSING HOME FACILITIES. THIS SERVICE IS ESPECIALLY VALUABLE TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PERSONS WHO CANNOT AFFORD TO RENT OR BUY THE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT THEY NEED SUCH AS WHEELCHAIRS, WALKERS, AND HOSPITAL BEDS. ANOTHER WAY OUR SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP HOMEBOUND CITIZENS MAINTAIN THEIR HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE IS BY PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THROUGH THE SENIOR RIDES PROGRAM. THIS VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITY IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT IN OUR RURAL COMMUNITY THAT OFFERS VERY LIMITED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS.  SENIOR RIDES VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HOMEBOUND PERSONS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO IMPORTANT HEALTH SERVICES, MEDICAL TREATMENTS, AND SURGICAL PROCEDURES. ADDITIONALLY, OUR SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER DAILY MEALS TO HOMEBOUND PERSONS THROUGH A HOME-DELIVERED MEALS PROGRAM, PROVIDING HOMEBOUND PERSONS WITH THE NUTRITION, WELLNESS CHECKS, AND SOCIAL SUPPORT THEY NEED TO MAINTAIN THEIR HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE. IN ANOTHER VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITY IMPORTANT TO HEALTHY FUTURES, OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON LOCAL HEALTH SERVICES, RESOURCES, AND PROGRAMS THAT WILL ENABLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO GAIN ACCESS TO THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO MAINTAIN THEIR HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE. OUR TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON HEALTH SERVICES, PROGRAMS, AND RESOURCES AT A LARGE-SCALE COMMUNITY HEALTH FAIR, THEREBY HELPING HUNDREDS OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS BECOME AWARE OF THE HEALTH RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THEM AND HOW TO ACCESS THOSE RESOURCES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, MORE THAN 1,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF ALL AGES WILL BENEFIT FROM VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE THE OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF LOCAL CITIZENS. AT LEAST 240 RSVP SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE VOLUNTEER SERVICES UNDER THIS GRANT. THE PROPOSED ESTIMATED NUMBER OF STATIONS FOR THIS PROJECT IS AT LEAST 20. THE CNCS BASE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A PROPOSED ESTIMATED $60,808 OF LOCAL, NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 165 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE RSVP OF WASHINGTON COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER,  92 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING EDUCATION AND RESOURCES TO COUNTY CITIZENS ON PREPARING FOR AND ACCESS TO SERVICES POST  FLOODS TO SUPPORT THE DISASTER PREPAREDNESS GOAL.  THEY WILL SUPPORT AWARENESS AND STEWARDSHIP, AS WE ARE DEDICATED TO PROVIDING TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL AGENCIES AROUND APPROPRIATE DRUG DISPOSAL OPTIONS OR DRUG TAKE BACK PLANS IN AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE THE WASTE MANAGEMENT AND ULTIMATELY THE WATER SUPPLY.  THIS ALSO SUPPORTS THE WASHINGTON COUNTY GOES PURPLE INITIATIVE TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF DRUGS ON THE STREET.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INCOME TAX TUTORING AND SUPPORT FOR SENIORS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES.  THESE VOLUNTEERS ARE ALSO COMMITTED TO A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY PRIORITIES SUCH AS FOOD PANTIES, CONGREGATE SITES, THE SENIOR CENTER, THE LOCAL HOSPITAL, HOSPICE AND VARIOUS OTHER NON-PROFITS. 62 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE AGING IN PLACE AND OBESITY AND FOOD.   THROUGH THESE PRIMARY FOCUSES, IT IS OUR INTENTION THAT THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE BY PROVIDING A NOON MEAL FIVE DAYS PER WEEK TO MEDICALLY HOME BOUND SENIORS IN AN EFFORT TO REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY. OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO, PROVIDE EDUCATION THROUGH A VARIETY OF AVENUES TO IMPROVE HEALTHY FOOD CHOICES AS IT CORRELATES TO NUTRITION AND OBESITY TO SUPPORT THE OBESITY AND FOOD PRIMARY FOCUS.  IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY TO DISCUSS PREVAILING HEALTH ISSUES FACING INDIVIDUALS IN OUR COMMUNITY BASED ON THE COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT OR OTHER HEALTH ISSUES AS THEY RAISE THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.   
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE INTENTION IS FOR OUR VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE THE SERVICES AND MEET THE GOALS ESTABLISHING IN THE WORK PLANS.  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED UTILIZING THREE PART TIME EMPLOYEES.  THE PROGRAM MANAGER HAS A PROVEN SUCCESS RECORD WITH PART TIME DUTIES IN THIS ROLE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $48,497 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 30% OF LOCAL COUNTY FUNDS AND IN-KIND DONATIONS MAKING UP $21,200.  OUR ORGANIZATION HAS A HISTORY OF EXCEEDING SEVERAL OF THE GOALS AND BENCHMARKS WE SET FOR OURSELVES.
WE HAVE TAKEN THE TAG LINE, "HELP US HELP YOUR NEIGHBORS" IN AN EFFORT TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE NEEDS IN OUR COMMUNITY AND REMIND INDIVIDUALS HOW IMPORTANT THE IMPACT IS TO OTHERS THROUGH VOLUNTEER EFFORTS.  YOU NEVER KNOW WHOSE LIFE YOU WILL TOUCH THROUGH VOLUNTEERING!

AN ESTIMATED 310 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 287 RSVP VOLUNTEER WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, COMPANIONSHIP, AND PREVENTING ELDER ABUSE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES (OBESITY & FOOD AND AGING IN PLACE). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT , WE HOPE TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR AT LEAST 3,000 INDIVIDUALS, INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT AND PREVENT ELDER ABUSE FOR 620 INDIVIDUAL. THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,152.

RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY IS SPONSORED BY COMMUNITY ACTION PIONEER VALLEY (CAPV), THE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED ANTI-POVERTY AGENCY FOR FRANKLIN AND HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES THAT ALSO PROVIDES SERVICES IN CONTIGUOUS AREAS OF NORTHWESTERN WORCESTER COUNTY (NORTH QUABBIN), HAMPDEN COUNTY, AND BERKSHIRE COUNTY.  FOUNDED IN 1965 AS PART OF THE WAR ON POVERTY, COMMUNITY ACTION REMAINS TRUE TO ITS MISSION OF PARTNERING WITH PEOPLE WITH LOW INCOMES AND OTHER MARGINALIZED GROUPS TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC STABILITY AND SECURITY, AND OF WORKING TO BUILD COMMUNITIES IN WHICH ALL PEOPLE HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO THRIVE.  THE AGENCY HAS AN ANNUAL BUDGET OF $30 MILLION, OF WHICH 21.6% IS DIRECT FEDERAL FUNDING FOR HEAD START PROGRAMS IN HAMPDEN, HAMPSHIRE, AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES.    
RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY BEGAN IN HAMPSHIRE COUNTY IN 1973, EXPANDED NORTH INTO FRANKLIN COUNTY IN 1999, AND SOUTH INTO HAMPDEN COUNTY IN SEPTEMBER 2017.  RSVP IS A WELL-KNOWN AND WELL-RESPECTED RESOURCE IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  IN 2010, CNCS AWARDED RSVP A PROGRAMS OF NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE GRANT TO EXPAND ITS HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE PROGRAM, WHICH HAS SINCE GROWN BY 60% AND SERVES HUNDREDS OF SENIORS EACH YEAR AT 26 COMMUNITY SITES.  FOLLOWING A CNCS MONITORING VISIT IN 2016, CNCS STAFF DESCRIBED OUR CURRENT PROJECT AS "A STRONG RSVP PROGRAM THAT...HAS INVESTED IN ACHIEVING PROGRAM OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES WHICH ARE BOTH ACCURATE AND BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY."   
WE ARE REQUESTING $192,886 WITH A $83,990 NON-FEDERAL MATCH, AND WE PROPOSE TO ENGAGE 860 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, INCLUDING 645 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN IMPACT-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE RELATED VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MEALS PROGRAMS & FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP & TRANSPORTATION, HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE CLASSES, MONEY MANAGEMENT & BENEFITS COUNSELING, AND LEADING ENRICHMENT CLASSES.  THE PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY THROUGH BUILDING HOMES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE EXTENSIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SUPPORT THROUGH RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE CENTRAL OUTCOMES WE ANTICIPATE ARE:  SENIORS WILL INCREASE THEIR SOCIALIZATION AND ABILITY TO AGE IN PLACE AND PARTICIPANTS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE WILL HAVE TRANSITIONED INTO AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  LOCAL AGENCIES WILL INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INCREASED FUNDING AND SUPPORT OF THEIR PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE.

AN ESTIMATED 400 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WITH THIS GRANT. OF THIS NUMBER,  265 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN SERVICE ASSIGNMENTS WITH "OUTCOMES", WITH 205 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF "HEALTHY FUTURES". RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP PREVENT ELDER ABUSE THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S THREE-PART SENIOR FRAUD INITIATIVE: FRAUD SQUAD PLAYERS WHO PERFORM SCENES DEPICTING CURRENT FRAUDS FOLLOWED BY A VOLUNTEER-LED DISCUSSION; THROUGH THE FRAUD BRIGADE SENIOR CENTER-BASED "ACTIVE LISTENERS" WHO HELP OTHER SENIORS WHO BELIEVE THEY HAVE BEEN TARGETED; AND THROUGH "RSVP'S SENIOR FRAUD HELPLINE" A TOLL-PHONE NUMBER ANSWERED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS TRAINED TO HELP THE CALLER DETERMINE IF THE THREAT IS REAL, AND, IF SO, REFER THE CALLER TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES, INCLUDING THE MA ATTORNEY GENERAL'S WORCESTER OFFICE, THE A.G.'S CONSUMER RIGHTS PROGRAM IN WORCESTER, LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT, THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE FOR THE COUNTY, AND MORE.  RSVP'S PROJECT DIRECTOR IS A MEMBER OF THE MA ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE COALITION ON IDENTITY THEFT.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OVER 2000 SENIORS WILL  HAVE HAD A DAILY HOT MEAL THROUGH RSVP MEALS ON WHEELS AND CONGREGATE MEALS VOLUNTEERS; 40 SENIORS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR HEALTH AND DECREASE THEIR LIKELIHOOD OF FALLING; 2025 ELDERLY WILL HAVE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF SCAMS AND FRAUDS BY ATTENDING FRAUD SQUAD PLAYER PERFORMANCES OR CALLING THE HELPLINE; 3500 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, AND 500 STUDENTS WILL INCREASE THEIR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  RSVP WORCESTER VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE: COMPANIONSHIP WHILE SERVING AS HOSPICE VOLUNTEERS, TUTORS OF FIRST GENERATION STUDENTS HOPING TO ATTEND COLLEGE, SUPPORT THE BUILDING AND REPAIR OF AFFORDABLE AND SAFE HOUSING UNITS, SERVE AS ESL TUTORS, IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AS STORY TIME READERS, AT A BLOOD-PRESSURE CLINICS, AND MUCH MORE.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $195,847 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $83,933 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
MERRIMACK VALLEY COMMUNITY SERVICE CORPS W (MVCSC) WILL MEET A MINIMUM OF 90% OF THEIR ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES. CNCS'S INVESTMENT OF $127,342 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST A 30% MATCH FROM NON-FEDERAL SOURCES. THE MATCH WILL BE COMPRISED OF BOTH IN-KIND AND MONETARY SOURCES. THE GREATER LAWRENCE/ HAVERHILL RSVP IS SPONSORED BY MERRIMACK VALLEY COMMUNITY SERVICE CORPS, INC.  ITS MISSION IS TO PROMOTE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND SERVICE WITHIN THE GREATER LAWRENCE/HAVERHILL AREA FOR THOSE OF ALL AGE, RACE, CREED AND ABILITY. MVCSC IS COMMITTED TO MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS WITH ITS 400 RSV'S.  MVCSC IS ABLE TO PROVIDE EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE SERVICE TO A COMMUNITY THAT IS LARGELY ESL, WE ALSO ENCOURAGE AND ARE ABLE TO HAVE SERVICES AND TRAINING AVAILABLE BECAUSE OF CLOSE RELATIONSHIPS WITH ALL WORK SITES WHERE THE MANY RSV?S ARE STATIONED WE ASSIST IN OFFERING SERVICES THAT ARE NEEDED TO ENHANCE THE SENIOR'S QUALITY OF LIFE. SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE HEALTHY MEALS, OBESITY AWARENESS, SUPPORT SERVICES, SIGHT, HEARING AND DIABETES TESTING, ABUSE AWARENESS AND MOST IMPORTANTLY PROVIDES SERVICE OR ASSISTANCE IN OBTAINING SERVICES TO THE HUGE POPULATION OF THE AREAS NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING INHABITANTS. INFORMATION IS GATHERED FROM BOTH THE VOLUNTEER AND THE WORK SITES IN THE FORM OF QUESTIONNAIRES, TIME SHEETS, AND SITE VISITS. PROJECTS ARE THEN MONITORED AT EACH OF THE WORK SITES WHILE COORDINATION AND STREAMLINING OF PROVIDING THE SERVICE IS HANDLED AT THE HOME OFFICE. WE ANTICIPATE POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN ALL OF OUR SERVICE PROJECTS. OUR 400 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE OUT OF 6 WORKSTATIONS LOCATED IN HAVERHILL, LAWRENCE, METHUEN, AND NORTH ANDOVER MASSACHUSETTS.  TWO HUNDRED AND TWO (202) OF THESE VOLUNTEERS ARE WORKING IN PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES.  SOME ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BROWN BAG, CONGREGATE MEALS, AND MEALS ON WHEELS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, FINANCIAL LITERACY INCLUDING FRAUD PREVENTION, TRANSPORTATION AND HOMEBOUND VISITS.  
UNDER THE FOCUS AREA HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE AGING IN PLACE WE HAVE SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION AND NUTRITION.  THESE ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE AT FOUR OF THE SIX WORKSTATIONS.  
UNDER THE FOCUS AREA HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE OBESITY AND FOOD WE HAVE SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE BROWN BAG PREPARATION AND DISTRIBUTION AND CONGREGATE MEAL PREPARATION AND SERVICE.  THESE ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE AT FOUR OF THE SIX WORKSTATIONS.
UNDER THE FOCUS AREA FINANCIAL LITERACY WE OFFER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND GUIDANCE, TAX HELP, AND FRAUD DETERRENCE AND PROTECTION ACTIVITIES.   THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE AT FIVE OF THE SIX WORKSTATIONS. 
UNDER OTHER OBJECTIVES WE HAVE ACTIVITIES UNDER OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THESE TWO AREAS ARE NOT PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS BUT ARE IMPORTANT TO THE CORPS OF 200 PLUS VOLUNTEERS THAT WORK IN THIS AREA.  SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE AREAS OF RECREATION, HEALTH AND EXERCISE, ENRICHMENT AND VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND RECRUITMENT.  IN THESE ACTIVITIES SENIORS WILL LEARN TO LIVE MORE HEALTHY LIFE STYLES, WILL LEARN WHAT SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE AND HOW TO OBTAIN THEM, WILL LEARN THE IMPORTANCE OF EARLY DETECTION OF THINGS LIKE DIABETES, EYE AND HEARING ISSUES. WITH OUR CREATE AND COMFORT PROGRAM WE SEE SENIORS THAT CREATE DOLLS, BLANKETS, SHAWLS AND CANCER CAPS THAT GIVE JOY AND COMFORT FOR THOSE THAT HAVE SUFFERED TRAUMATIC EVENTS.

THE MODERN MATURITY C??ENTER, INC. (MMC) IS A MULTI-PURPOSE SENIOR CENTER LOCATED IN DOVER, DELAWARE. MMC IS A RESOURCE FOR COMPANIONSHIP, EDUCATION, WELLNESS, NUTRITION, AND RECREATION FOR OLDER ADULTS AS THEY AGE IN PLACE. THIS NONPROFIT HUMAN SERVICE AGENCY IS INVESTED IN ITS MISSION TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE, WITH RESPECT AND DIGNITY, FOR INDIVIDUALS AGE 50+. MMC HAS BEEN SPONSORING THE RSVP PROJECT SINCE 1972. THE CURRENT PROJECT WILL BE COMPRISED OF APPROXIMATELY 763 ACTIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS. WE ARE REQUESTING $48,617 TO RUN THE KENT COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM SUCCESSFULLY. THIS PROJECT WILL MEET THE LOCAL NEEDS OF KENT COUNTY WITHIN THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OF FOOD SECURITY, AGING IN PLACE, TAX PREPARATION, ADULT EDUCATION, SCHOOL READINESS, SCHOOL MENTORING, HOUSING, VETERAN SUPPORT, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. BASED ON THE MOST RECENT 2017 ANNUAL POPULATION PROJECTIONS, UTILIZED FOR STATE PLANNING IN DELAWARE, THE DELAWARE POPULATION CONSORTIUM PROJECTS A TOTAL OF 33,375 SENIORS AGE 60 AND OLDER RESIDING IN KENT COUNTY IN 2018. BY 2025, KENT COUNTY'S SENIOR POPULATION WILL INCREASE 9%, A TOTAL OF 38,798 RESIDENTS THAT WILL REQUIRE SUPPORT AS THEY AGE IN PLACE (DELAWARE POPULATION CONSORTIUM). NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL NEED TO ORGANIZE VOLUNTEERS TO MEET THE INCREASED SERVICE DEMAND. TO REACH THESE RESIDENTS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF HEALTHY FUTURES, THE PRIORITY FOCUS AREA, THROUGH UTILIZING PARTNERSHIPS WITH MEALS ON WHEELS, LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS, MEDICAL FACILITIES, AND ADULT DAY PROGRAMS. BY IMPLEMENTING THE NECESSARY ASSISTANCE FOR OLDER ADULTS IN KENT COUNTY, RESIDENTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY LONGER WITHIN THEIR OWN HOMES, REDUCING THE UTILIZATION AND COST OF SERVICES PROVIDED AT THE STATE AND FEDERAL LEVEL. THESE VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMES, PROVIDING SOCIAL SUPPORT WITHIN ADULT DAY MEMORY LOSS PROGRAMS, AND IMPROVING ACCESS TO CARE WITHIN MEDICAL FACILITIES. IN ADDITION TO MEETING THE NEEDS OF LOCAL SENIORS, KENT COUNTY RSVP WILL ALSO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS TO FULFILL STATE INITIATIVES THAT ADDRESS COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. OTHER STATE INITIATIVES INCLUDE SERVICES EDUCATING THE PUBLIC, PROMOTING THE LOCAL ECONOMY AND FACILITATING COMPANIONSHIP PROGRAMS FOR OLDER ADULTS THAT REDUCE ISOLATION.

CRT IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS).  CRT WILL RECRUIT 340 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN OUR RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.   CRT HAS OFFERED THE RSVP FOR OVER 20 YEARS AND HAS A STRONG TRACK RECORD OF DEVELOPING QUALITY VOLUNTEER STATIONS, PROVIDING A VARIETY OF MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERS AND WORK PLANS THAT ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEED AND LEAD TO NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES OUTCOMES.

CRT'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS K-12 SUCCESS WITH 56% (192 OUT OF 340 VOLUNTEERS) OF OUR VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN SCHOOLS WORKING ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING STUDENTS AND OVERALL 83% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACED IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN OUTCOMES.  ADDITIONAL FOCUS AREA INCLUDES  AGING IN PLACE WHERE WE HAVE DEVELOPED THREE WORK PLANS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO SENIORS TO KEEP THEM SAFE AND SUPPORT THEIR INDEPENDENCE SO THAT THEY CAN REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES IN THE COMMUNITY AND AVOID PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION.  THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE OUR HIGHLY REGARD VOLUNTEER MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WHICH HAS SEEN TREMENDOUS GROWTH, WITH THIS APPLICATION WE ARE EXPANDING FROM THREE COMMUNITIES TO FIVE (ADDING SUFFIELD AND WINDSOR LOCKS).  ANOTHER PROGRAM IS A PARTNERSHIP WITH CRT'S MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM - WHERE VOLUNTEERS DELIVER HOT MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS.  IN OUR ELDER JUSTICE, FRAUD AND SCAM VOLUNTEER STATION, VOLUNTEERS ARE LOCATED AT THE ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE TO ASSIST CLIENTS WHO HAVE BEEN VICTIMS OF FINANCIAL SCAMS AND FRAUD.  

OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE VOLUNTEERS STATIONED AT OUR BRADLEY AIRPORT AMBASSADOR PROGRAM; SIENNA ADULT LITERACY CENTER; HARTFORD HOSPITAL; AND HARTFORD MARATHON FOUNDATION JUST TO NAME A FEW.

RSVP OF GALVESTON COUNTY (RSVP) HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY SERVING NON-PROFIT AGENCIES WITH RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, PLACEMENT AND RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND OLDER, THROUGHOUT GALVESTON COUNTY (POPULATION 329,431 PER 2016 US CENSUS) SINCE 2002. 

RSVP IS SPONSORED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS MEDICAL BRANCH (UTMB) -- SEALY CENTER ON AGING (SCOA), LOCATED IN GALVESTON, TX. SCOA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF THE ELDERLY, NOT ONLY WITHIN THE HOUSTON/GALVESTON AREA BUT ALSO STATEWIDE AND NATIONALLY, THROUGH EDUCATION, RESEARCH, CLINICAL AND SOCIAL SERVICES, COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION AND ADVOCACY, AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF COOPERATIVE LINKAGES WITH OTHER GERIATRIC AND GERONTOLOGICAL CENTERS. THE RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM FITS WELL WITHIN THE SCOA MISSION AS IT NOT ONLY ACTIVATES/MOTIVATES THE SENIOR POPULATION AS VOLUNTEERS, MANY OF THE COMMUNITY NON-PROFIT PROJECTS ARE DIRECTED TOWARD THE AGING POPULATION OF OUR COUNTY. RSVP IS FORTUNATE TO HAVE SCOA AS ITS SPONSOR BECAUSE SO MUCH OF THE RESEARCH AND CLINICAL COMPONENTS OF THEIR WORK PROVIDES A UNIQUE ACCESS TO A MULTICULTURAL SENIOR POPULATION FOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. NUMEROUS UTMB DOCTORS, PHYSICAL THERAPISTS AND OTHER STAFF REFER THEIR PATIENTS TO OUR PROGRAM AS A WAY TO KEEP THEIR OLDER PATIENTS MORE SOCIALLY ACTIVE, ALERT AND INVOLVED IN THE COMMUNITY. THE SCOA DEPARTMENT RECOGNIZES THE VALUE IN OUR RSVP PROGRAM AND PROVIDES MANY METHODS OF SUPPORT (PEER ASSISTANCE FROM STATISTICIANS, SOCIAL WORKERS, TECHNICAL WRITERS AND MEDIA DEVELOPMENT) TO HELP US ACHIEVE OUR GOALS. UTMB AS AN INSTITUTION IS SUPPORTIVE TO RSVP BY PROVIDING ON-GOING TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO STAFF AND SENIOR VOLUNTEERS ALIKE. HIRING PRACTICES AT UTMB PROMOTE DIVERSITY, ALLOWING STAFF TO WORK ALONGSIDE PEOPLE OF MANY DIFFERENT CULTURAL BACKGROUNDS AND AGES. A PRACTICE THAT IS CARRIED OVER INTO THE RSVP RECRUITMENT EFFORTS. THIS ENHANCES MULTICULTURAL UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT, FOR THE STAFF, WHEN MEETING NEW AND POTENTIAL RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THE RSVP DIRECTOR IS AN ELECTED MEMBER OF THE UTMB DIVERSITY COUNCIL.

LUBBOCK MEALS ON WHEELS (LMOW) CURRENTLY PREPARES OVER 700 HOME-COOKED MEALS EACH DAY.  DELIVERIES ARE MADE TO ELDERLY OR DISABLED (HOMEBOUND) CLIENTS THAT ARE UNABLE TO PREPARE A MEAL AND HAVE NO ACCESS FOR THE NOON MEAL. SPFB ALSO SERVES AN AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM DESIGNED TO COMBAT CHILDHOOD HUNGER AS WELL AS A LUNCH SUMMER FEEDING PROGRAM AT SELECTED ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS. FOOD VOUCHERS ARE INITIATED AT OVER 20 SITES IN LUBBOCK COUNTY.  THE SITES USE THE DATABASE OF THE SPFB TO VALIDATE ENTRIES AND ELIMINATE DUPLICATIONS.  MANY VOUCHER SITES PROVIDE EMERGENCY FOOD STAPLES TO ELIMINATE GAPS IN SERVICES.  SURVEYS, QUESTIONNAIRES, AGENCY DATA/LOGS, VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR REPORTS, AND SIGN-UP SHEETS WILL BE USED TO MEASURE EFFECTIVENESS.

NAME OF LEGAL APPLICANT: CHISHOLM TRAIL RSVP, INC. DBA RSVP: SERVING DENTON COUNTY
MISSION STATEMENT: CHISHOLM TRAIL RSVP, INC. IMPROVES LIVES, STRENGTHENS COMMUNITIES AND FOSTERS CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH NATIONAL SERVICE (RSVP, AMERICORPS VISTA) AND VOLUNTEERING IN DENTON COUNTY, TEXAS AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.
RSVP: SERVING DENTON COUNTY (REFERRED TO AS RSVP HEREAFTER) HAS SUCCESSFULLY PROVIDED SERVICES IN THE FORM OF VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, PLACEMENT, AND MANAGEMENT TO NON-PROFIT AND GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES SINCE 1973.  IT BECAME A SELF-INCORPORATED PROJECT IN 1984.  IN ADDITION, IN 2013, IT BECAME AN AMERICORPS VISTA (VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE TO AMERICA) INTERMEDIARY PROJECT. 
ALL BUSINESS IS CONDUCTED AT THE MAIN OFFICE IN DENTON (NORTHERN PART OF THE COUNTY.)

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) COMBATING OPIOID CRISIS: TAKE BACK PRESCRIPTION DISPOSAL EVENTS 2) DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, 3) SERVING MEALS TO THE HOMELESS AT SOUP KITCHENS AS WELL AS DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT FOOD BANKS,  4) READING AND MENTORING PUBLIC SCHOOL CHILDREN IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THRU THIRD GRADE, 5) AND  TEACHING GRAND PARENTING 101 FOR THOSE WANTING TO UPDATE PARENTING SKILLS.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF TULSA, INC., IS A 501C-3 AND SELF-SPONSORED RSVP PROJECT ESTABLISHED IN TULSA, OK AS ONE OF THE 11 PILOT PROJECTS OF RSVP IN 1971. WE ARE 100% RSVP FOCUSED. OUR MISSION IS: RSVP ENHANCES OUR COMMUNITIES BY ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OVER, MATCHING THEIR EXPERIENCE, TALENTS AND INTEREST TO MEANINGFUL SERVICE.  WE ARE GOVERNED BY A BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH A MAXIMUM OF 21 COMMUNITY LEADERS AND AN ADVISORY COUNCIL WHICH INCLUDES A CROSS SECTION OF AGENCY PARTNERS, COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES AND RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR $99,447 TO SUPPORT 125 RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  OUR SERVICE CATEGORIES COVER THE CNCS SERVICE AREAS, CURRENTLY IDENTIFIED ON EGRANTS AS EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  WE UTILIZE THE WORK PLAN FORMAT FOR MEASURING OUTCOMES WHICH VARY ACCORDING TO THE AREA OF SERVICE.  
IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, AS WELL AS THE OTHER FOCUS AREAS, WE MATCH THE BROAD BASED NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY WITH OUR VOLUNTEERS TO DELIVER SERVICES. THESE INCLUDE MEAL DELIVERY TO HOMEBOUND CLIENTS, MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR RURAL AND COUNTY RESIDENTS, MILITARY FAMILIES AND VETERANS, TUTORS, MENTORS AND CLASSROOM SUPPORT IN AREA SCHOOLS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS. RSVP WILL DEVELOP A PROJECT TO PROVIDE OPIOID ADDICTION AND ABUSE EDUCATION TO TULSA, WAGONER, AND CREEK CO SENIORS.  WE WILL RECRUIT 6-10 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO MAKE 1-HR PRESENTATIONS TO TULSA COUNTY COMMUNITY-DWELLING SENIORS, THEIR PEERS, AND ALSO TO INDEPENDENT LIVING FACILITY SENIOR RESIDENTS ABOUT WHAT THE NATIONAL OPIOID EPIDEMIC IS AND WHY THERE IS AN EPIDEMIC: THE RISK OF OVER-USE AND THE EFFECTS ON OLDER PEOPLE; THE RISK OF OTHERS IN HOMES HAVING ACCESS TO OPIOIDS AND ALL OTHER PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS LEFT UNATTENDED; AND HOW THEY CAN HELP BY BEING INFORMED REGARDING THEIR OWN USE, AND BY DONATING UN-USED PRESCRIPTIONS TO TULSA COUNTY RECYCLED MEDICATION PROGRAM.   WE UTILIZE SURVEYS, ATTENDANCE RECORDS AND DATA THAT IS AVAILABLE FROM OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY PLANNING ENTITY PLUS STATE AND LOCAL RESEARCH STUDIES AND INITIATIVES AS WELL AS EVALUATIONS TOOLS FROM OUR AGENCY PARTNERS TO ASSESS THE NEED FOR VOLUNTEERS.

CONCILIO CAMPESINO DEL SUDOESTE INC. IS A 501(C)3 PRIVATE COMMUNITY-BASED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972 IN SOUTHERN NM.  ORGANIZATION HAS A SERVICE HISTORY IN ADDRESSING NEEDS IN SENIOR ISSUES, HEALTH ISSUES, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.  WE SERVE STATE-WIDE IN NM AND ITS SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.  THE COMMUNITIES BEING SERVED BY ORGANIZATION INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED AS A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS.  THE POPULATION THAT WE SERVE INCLUDES: SENIORS, YOUTH, FAMILIES, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARM WORKERS & THEIR FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS, AND A LARGE PERCENT OF PEOPLE WHO ARE MONOLINGUAL SPANISH OR BILINGUAL.  ORGANIZATION ADDRESSES HEALTH DISPARITIES, ECONOMIC CRISIS, POVERTY, EDUCATION, HUNGER, AND OTHER AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY VOLUNTARISM. OUR MISSION: TO ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY WITH PASSION AND COMMITMENT.

COMMUNITY NEEDS:
NEW MEXICO IS A GEOGRAPHICALLY LARGE, PREDOMINANTLY RURAL STATE. IT IS THE 5TH LARGEST, AND THE 6TH MOST SPARSELY POPULATED STATE IN THE NATION. NEW MEXICO?S POPULATION IS ETHNICALLY AND CULTURALLY DIVERSE, WITH LARGE HISPANIC, ANGLO AND NATIVE AMERICAN INDIAN POPULATIONS. OVER A THIRD OF THE STATE?S POPULATION IS NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING; THE PREDOMINANT OTHER LANGUAGES ARE SPANISH, DINE (NAVAJO) AND PUEBLO DIALECTS. NEW MEXICO?S AGING POPULATION IS GROWING RAPIDLY. BY THE YEAR 2030, NEW MEXICO?S POPULATION OF PERSONS AGE 60 AND OLDER IS PROJECTED TO INCREASE BY 70%. BY THE YEAR 2030, 32.5% OF NEW MEXICO POPULATION WILL RANK 3RD IN THE NATION IN PERCENTAGE OF POPULATION AGE 60 OR OLDER. THE 85+ POPULATION WILL BE MORE THAN TRIPLE FROM 23,306 IN 2000 TO 75,629 IN 2030. IN NEW MEXICO 15% OF THE POPULATION 60 OR OLDER LIVE AT OR BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL; 17% LIVE AT 125% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.  NEW MEXICO?S GROWING POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS REFLECTS THE AGING OF ITS BABY BOOMERS, AS WELL AS THE CONTINUING MIGRATION OF RETIREES AND OTHERS TO WESTERN STATES. THIS STATE CONTINUES TO EXPERIENCE INCREASING DEMANDS FOR SERVICES FROM PERSONS WITH LOW INCOMES. ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL FOUNDATION TO END SENIOR HUNGER, MORE THAN 42,300 NEW MEXICANS AGE 60 OR OLDER ARE FOOD INSECURE. THESE SENIORS ARE NOT SURE THEY HAVE ENOUGH MONEY TO BUY FOOD; AND MANY DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH TO EAT. THUS, THE PROBLEMS OF HUNGER AND FOOD INSECURITY IN NEW MEXICO ARE MAJOR. IN NEW MEXICO OVER 40.3% OF COMMUNITY-LIVING POPULATION AGE 65 AND OLDER HAVE DISABILITIES; MANY HAVE MORE THAN ONE DISABILITY; AND A GREAT NUMBER SUFFER FROM ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE OR RELATED DISORDER. IN ELABORATION, IT HAS BEEN REPORTED THAT SENIORS ISOLATED IN THEIR HOMES, THE LACK OF COMPANIONSHIP CAN CONTRIBUTE TO A WIDE VARIETY OF PROBLEMS (DETERIORATION IN MENTAL WELL-BEING, INCREASED SUSCEPTIBILITY TO CON ARTISTS WHO PREY ON THE ELDERLY, ETC.) THAT IN TURN CAN HASTEN DEPENDENCY AND LEAD TO INSTITUTIONALIZATION.  REGULAR SUPPORTIVE VISITS FROM CARING PEERS CAN HELP DECREASE FEELINGS OF ISOLATION (NMALTSD 2017-2021 STATE PLAN). CONCILIO CDS INC. IS FOCUSING ON ADDRESSING THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS AND IS ANTICIPATING THAT COMPANIONSHIP WILL CONTRIBUTE TO POSITIVE OUTCOMES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
	NEW MEXICO IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PART OF THE UNITED STATES.  VALENCIA COUNTY, CONSISTING OF LOS LUNAS, BELEN, RIO COMMUNITIES AND 12 PRIMARILY RURAL COMMUNITIES, IS SITUATED IN THE CENTRAL PART OF THE STATE.  IN 2010- 2012, VALENCIA COUNTY WAS HOME TO 77,000 INDIVIDUALS - 26% WERE 18 AND YOUNGER AND 14% WERE 65 YEARS AND OLDER.  VALENCIA COUNTY IS STRUGGLING WITH: HUNGER/POVERTY ISSUES (37% OF CHILDREN UNDER 18, AND 19% OF RESIDENTS 65 AND OLDER WERE LIVING IN POVERTY); ISOLATION OF DISABLED AND ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS (24% OF RESIDENTS LIVED ALONE); ILLITERACY (IN 2012-2013, ONLY 45% OF BELEN STUDENTS AND ONLY 50% OF LOS LUNAS STUDENTS WERE PROFICIENT OR ABOVE IN 4TH GRADE READING); AND LACK OF SUPPORT FOR THE 6,886 VETERANS3 AND THEIR FAMILIES. 
	THE MID-RIO GRANDE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY THE CITY OF BELEN, IN VALENCIA COUNTY, SINCE 1990.  IN 2015-2016, THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS FOR THE 169 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE: INCREASING FOOD SECURITY TO CHILDREN, OLDER ADULTS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, AND FAMILIES; TUTORING  CHILDREN DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR, AFTERSCHOOL AND SUMMER BREAK IN ORDER TO IMPROVE LITERACY SKILLS; PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE TO OLDER PERSONS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND RESPITE TO THEIR CAREGIVERS; PROVIDING SUPPORT TO VETERANS; MAINTAINING THE ENVIRONMENT; AND MEETING ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY NEEDS.   
	THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $32,436 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,436 FROM LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND $16,000 FROM STATE GOVERNMENT.

COLBY COMMUNITY COLLEGE, COLBY, KANSAS IS THE SPONSOR FOR THE NORTHWEST KANSAS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.  (RSVP).  COLBY COMMUNITY COLLEGE HOLDS THE SPONSORSHIP OF THE RSVP PROGRAM IN HIGHEST REGARD.  THE RSVP PROGRAM AND ACTIVITIES ARE NOT ONLY OF VITAL IMPORTANCE TO OUR COMMUNITIES SERVED AND THE RECIPIENTS OF OUR NUMEROUS PROJECTS, BUT ALSO OF EMINENT VALUE TO OUR VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES.  THE MISSION OF THE NORTHWEST KANSAS RSVP IS TO CONNECT INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER, THEIR SKILLS AND TALENTS WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE.

NORTHWEST KANSAS RSVP IS A MULTI-COUNTY PROGRAM WITH AN ESTIMATED 160 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THAT HAVE PROVIDED CONTINUOUS VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO THE RURAL CITIZENS OF PHILLIPS, THOMAS, LOGAN AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES LOCATED IN FAR NORTHWEST KANSAS SINCE 1973, CURRENTLY WITH A TOTAL MULTI-COUNTY POPULATION OF 18, 854.  THE PROGRAM WAS DESIGNED FOR THE DUAL PURPOSE OF ENGAGING PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS; AND TO PROVIDE A HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF VOLUNTEERS.

RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE DEDICATED TO STRENGTHENING THEIR PROGRAM, THEIR COMMUNITIES AND THEMSELVES THROUGH THEIR INVOLVEMENT IN A PROGRAM THAT HAS PROVEN ITS SIGNIFICANCE THROUGH ITS REPUTATION.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE TO A MULTITUDE OF NEEDS WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS ENSURE HEALTHY FUTURES TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY, AND/OR DISABLED, VETERANS AND UNDERPRIVILEGED OF THE COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL MEALS AND ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD.
A POSITIVE IMPACT IS ANTICIPATED AT THE END OF YEAR 3, AS THE AGING IN PLACE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL ENABLE FRAIL ELDERLY, AND/OR DISABLED, VETERANS TO MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE THROUGH AN INCREASE IN IMPROVED NUTRITIONAL QUALITY, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY ALLEVIATING LONG TERM HUNGER AND THE BENEFIT OF SOCIAL INTERACTION.

THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE $42,334 SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,371 LOCAL FUNDS.

THE PURPOSE OF THE NWCCOG IS TO BE RESPONSIVE TO MEMBER'S NEEDS AND INTERESTS BY PROVIDING GUIDANCE AND ASSISTANCE IN PROBLEM SOLVING, INFORMATION SHARING AND PARTNERSHIP BUILDING, ADVOCATING MEMBER'S INTERESTS AND NEEDS WITH LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL ENTITIES, AND PROVIDING QUALITY SERVICES TO OUR MEMBERSHIP THAT ARE RELEVANT, EFFECTIVE, AND EFFICIENT.

FRANCIS, WHITE, AND WOODRUFF COUNTIES IN ARKANSAS BY MARCH 31, 2021. USDA ARKANSAS IS RANKED FIFTH IN THE NATION FOR FOOD INSECURITY ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENT RESEARCH. SINCE THIS IS A DOCUMENTED NEED IN OUR COMMUNITIES, THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE NEA ARCARE RSVP PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES BECAUSE OF ITS FOCUS ON INCREASING HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY FOR RESIDENTS THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS HELPING TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD. ACCORDING TO AR KIDS READ, 7 IN 10 ARKANSAS FOURTH GRADERS DON?T READ PROFICIENTLY. BECAUSE SCHOOL READINESS AND READING PROFICIENCY STARTS EARLY, A SECONDARY FOCUS FOR THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH AN EMPHASIS ON LITERACY IN ORDER TO COMBAT THE CURRENT LOW READING SCORES AND ARM OUR CHILDREN WITH THE TOOLS FOR A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO MAINTAIN OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS AS A FOCUS AREA FOR OUR COMMUNITIES SO NEA ARCARE RSVP IS ABLE TO ADDRESS SPECIFIC NEEDS THAT MAY NOT FIT INTO PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS. EXAMPLES OF THESE PROJECTS ARE THE ARCARE AUXILIARY, SUPPORT FOR SENIOR CITIZEN WORKOUT PROGRAMS, AND VOLUNTEER POSITIONS SERVING SENIOR CENTERS OUTSIDE OF FOOD SECURITY SERVICES.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PARTNERING WITH STATE AND LOCAL PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND SOCIAL SUPPORT TO HOMEBOUND ADULTS OR DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, PROVIDE SUPPORT, SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND/OR REFERRALS TO LOW-INCOME, UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER, WORK TO INCREASE LITERACY WITH CHILDREN IN HEAD START PROGRAMS, AND WORK IN SHORT- TERM OR SPECIFIC PROJECTS TO MEET OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, THE  NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS PROVIDED SUPPORT, SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND/OR REFERRALS TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THOSE OF THEIR HOUSEHOLD, CHILDREN PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS LITERACY SKILLS, AND  IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL BE MET BY VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $93,795 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,100 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

OF THIS NUMBER, 121 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS TO MEDICAL FACILITIES AND THE GROCERY STORE TO PROMOTE AGING IN PLACE, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, ASSISTING WITH COLLECTING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD ITEMS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, TUTORING ADULT STUDENTS WHO DESIRE TO IMPROVE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS TO OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT AND/OR PREPARE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION, AND INCOME TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS.    THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 50 CITIZENS WILL BE ABLE TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND AGE IN PLACE, 1500 FAMILIES WILL HAVE GREATER FOOD SECURITY; ADULTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR LITERACY SKILLS HELPING TO SECURE EMPLOYMENT; 350 LOW -INCOME CITIZENS WILL HAVE RECEIVED FREE INCOME TAX PREPARATION; AND LOCAL NONPROFITS WILL HAVE RECEIVED NEEDED VOLUNTEER SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $120,914 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $58,076 IN OTHER RESOURCES.

RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS PROPOSES TO UTILIZE 497 UNDUPLICATED  VOLUNTEERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
1.) ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP-PRIMARY FOCUS AREA - VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PARKS AND GARDENS WHERE GROUNDS AND NATURAL HABITAT ARE WELL MAINTAINED. 
2.) DISASTER SERVICES - PARTNERING WITH THE ARKANSAS EMERGENCY AGENCIES DURING NATURAL DISASTERS SUCH AS, TORNADOS, FIRES, AND FLOODING.
3.) HEALTHY FUTURES - THIS AREA WILL FOCUS ON EDUCATING BENEFICIARIES IN HEALTHCARE FRAUD AND ABUSE THROUGH THE SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL (SMP). SERVING IN FOOD BANKS AND PANTRIES.
4.) VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES - VOLUNTEERS WILL ANSWER THE NEEDS OF TRANSPORTATION TO HOSPITALS AND APPOINTMENTS, FEEDING DEMENTIA PATIENTS, COMPANIONSHIP AND OFFICE NEEDS.
5.) EDUCATION - SERVING IN PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AS MENTORS FOR STUDENTS WHO STRUGGLE WITH READING AND MATH SKILLS.
6.) OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICES - RSVP WILL SERVE IN LOCAL HOSPITALS HELPING HEALTHCARE ADMINISTRATORS WITH PATIENTS.
AT THE END OF THIS 3-YEAR GRANT, RSVP OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL MEET THE REQUIREMENTS, OUTCOMES AND NEEDS OF EACH WORK PLAN PRESENTED IN THIS GRANT. 
THE CNCS SHARE OF $145,336 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $43,601 (30%) OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMS INCLUDE: ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, VA HEALTHCARE HOSPITALS AND CENTERS, SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN THE 4-COUNTY AREA, ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AND NATIONAL PARKS.

THE COUNCIL OF THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS, AN I.R.S. 501 C (3) NON-PROFIT WEST VIRGINIA CORPORATION, IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY ESTABLISHED IN 1964.  THE AGENCY IS GOVERNED BY A VOLUNTEER TRIPARTITE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WITH MEMBERS FROM THREE AREAS: 1) LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY, 2) ELECTED OFFICIALS AND 3) COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES.  THIS BOARD SERVES AS THE ADVISORY COUNCIL FOR THIS RSVP PROPOSAL, WHICH CSM HAS SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED FOR OVER A DECADE IN MCDOWELL, MINGO, RALEIGH AND WYOMING COUNTIES IN SOUTHERN WEST VIRGINIA, ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED AREAS.
THE MISSION STATEMENT OF THE AGENCY IS:  ?THE COUNCIL OF THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS STRIVES TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP PEOPLE ACHIEVE THE DIGNITY OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY.?
THREE-HUNDRED (300) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COUNTIES OF MCDOWELL, WYOMING, MINGO AND RALEIGH.  TWO-HUNDRED, SIXTY-NINE (269) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $88, 647 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37, 992 OF NONFEDERAL RESOURCES.  
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS; HOME VISITS TO THE SICK, ELDERLY AND SHUT-INS; FOOD PANTRY; SUBSTANCE ABUSE EDUCATION; DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND NEIGHBORHOOD WATCH PROGRAMS WITH HEALTHY FUTURES BEING THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD THERE WILL BE SEVENTY-THREE (73) RSVP VOLUNTEERS MANAGING SIXTY-FIVE (65) COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS; ONE- HUNDRED, SEVENTY (170) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE CALLING OR VISITING THREE-HUNDRED, FORTY (340) SICK, ELDERLY OR SHUT-INS;  FOURTEEN (14) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE HELPED TRAIN OR PASS INFORMATION OUT TO FOUR-THOUSAND, FIVE-HUNDRED, SEVENTY-SEVEN (4,577) CITIZENS; TWENTY-SIX (26) VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP DISTRIBUTE FOOD TO THE UNDER PRIVILEGED INDIVIDUALS; AND SIX (6) VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION ON DRUG EDUCATION AND ELEVEN (11) WILL HELP WITH HOSPICE AND VETERANS. 
THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE, AS DERIVED FROM THE AGENCY COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT, AS CERTIFIED BY THE WEST VIRGINIA DEVELOPMENT OFFICE:  TRAINING VOLUNTEERS; MANAGING VOLUNTEERS; HEALTHY FUTURES; HOSPICE AND VETERANS.  THE RESEARCH METHODS USED TO DETERMINE THE COMMUNITY NEEDS WERE:  U.S. CENSUS BUREAU DATA, COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT INSTRUMENTS AND GROUP FOCUS MEETINGS.  THE RESEARCH-BASED METHODS THIS PROJECT WILL USE ARE:  1. OBSERVATIONS AND FORMATION OF THE TOPIC;  2. HYPOTHESIS;  3.  CONCEPTUAL DEFINITION:  4. OPERATIONAL DEFINITION;  5.  GATHERING OF DATA;  6.  ANALYSIS OF DATA;  7.  DATA INTERPRETATION;  8.  TEST, REVISING OF HYPOTHESIS;  9.  CONCLUSION.
FINALLY, TO DETERMINE OUTCOMES, SURVEYS WILL BE MADE AND TABULATED BY RSVP STAFF WITH REPORTS.  PRE AND POST ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENT TOOL WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO STATIONS MANAGING VOLUNTEERS TO MEASURE THE CAPACITY IN THE AREA OF VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT.

GOVERNING WITH THE VISION TO BE THE MOST COLLABORATIVE PROFESSIONAL, VALUE-DRIVEN LOCALITY IN VIRGINIA IS THE TAGLINE AND MAIN GOAL OF BOTH CAMPBELL COUNTY AND CAMPBELL COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER (RSVP) PROGRAM. CAMPBELL COUNTY RSVP HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972 WORKING WITH AREA GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS, NON-PROFITS AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS. WITH AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AGED 55 AND OVER, CAMPBELL COUNTY RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE THROUGHOUT CENTRAL VIRGINIA REGION 2000 SERVICING APPOMATTOX COUNTY, BEDFORD COUNTY, CAMPBELL COUNTY, AND LYNCHBURG CITY. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: ENDING LOCAL HUNGER BY DONATING FOOD, ASSISTING WITH THE OPERATIONS OF LOCAL FOOD BANKS, TRANSPORTING AND SERVING HOME-COOKED MEALS TO ELDERLY, DISABLED AND/OR HOMELESS, AND PROVIDING LITERATURE ON NUTRITION; ASSISTING OLDER CITIZENS AS THEY LIVE INDEPENDENTLY BY PROVIDING OUTLETS SUCH AS TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP; AND ASSISTING ACTIVE MILITARY FAMILIES BY PARTNERING WITH AN ORGANIZATION TO SEND COUPONS OVERSEAS TO LOWER THE EXPENSE OF FOOD ON MILITARY BASES TO ASSURE FOOD SECURITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE CAMPBELL COUNTY RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE REDUCING HUNGER AND OBESITY, ASSISTING AREA OLDER CITIZENS REMAIN INDEPENDENT, AND INCREASING SUPPORT OF ACTIVE MILITARY AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH FOOD SECURITY. CAMPBELL COUNTY RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE FOUNDATION OF PREVIOUS WORK PLANS AND REMAIN IN SUPPORT OF ADDRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS.  IN A REGION WHERE CITIZENS NEED COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, FOOD SECURITY AND MEANINGFUL LIFESTYLES, RSVP CONTINUED EFFORTS WILL ASSURE THESE NECESSITIES ARE BEING MET. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $34,490 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,743 APPROVED AND PROVIDED BY THE CAMPBELL COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.

AN ESTIMATED 212 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DRIVING SENIORS OR VETERANS AND THEIR SPOUSES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, TUTORING CHILDREN, DELIVERING DISASTER PREPAREDNESS EDUCATION TO 4TH GRADE STUDENTS OR WORKING AT THE LOCAL FOOD PANTRY TO PROVIDE FOOD TO NEEDY FAMILIES.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, SENIORS WILL REPORT AN INCREASED PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $81,693 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,089 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

WITH THIS PROPOSAL, VOLUNTEER FAIRFAX (VF) WISHES TO CONTINUE TO EXPAND THE CURRENT RSVP PROGRAM IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA. WHILE SPONSORED BY VF, A PRIVATE 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, THE PROGRAM REPRESENTS A UNIQUE PARTNERSHIP WITH VOLUNTEER ARLINGTON (VOLARL), A PROGRAM OF LEADERSHIP FOR EXCELLENCE A PRIVATE 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, AND VOLUNTEER ALEXANDRIA (VOLALX), ANOTHER PRIVATE 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION. TOGETHER, THESE THREE LOCAL VOLUNTEER CENTERS ARE COMMITTED TO SHARING RESOURCES TO LEVERAGE OLDER VOLUNTEERS ACROSS THE REGION. THIS INNOVATIVE, COLLABORATIVE STRUCTURE IS KNOWN AS RSVP-NORTHERN VIRGINIA (RSVP-NV), HAS PROVEN TO BE AN EFFECTIVE APPROACH TO REGIONALIZATION. THE THREE PARTNERING VOLUNTEER CENTERS HAVE BEEN SERVING THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR A COMBINED TOTAL OF MORE THAN 100 YEARS WITH DEEP-SEATED RELATIONSHIPS IN THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING ITS VOLUNTEERS, COMMUNITY LEADERS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND THE NONPROFIT SECTOR. EACH HAS INDEPENDENTLY IDENTIFIED THE CONTINUED NEED TO ENGAGE IN TARGETED OUTREACH TO THE 55+ RESIDENTS FROM THEIR RESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES.
     SINCE INITIATING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT FOR RSVP-NORTHERN VIRGINIA IN JUNE 2013, THE PROGRAM HAS SUCCESSFULLY RECRUITED MORE THAN 500 INDIVIDUALS WITH OVER 260 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS FROM THE COMMUNITY SERVING ANNUALLY. BY APPLYING AN UNDERSTANDING OF GENERATIONAL DIFFERENCES IN VOLUNTEER MOTIVATION, RSVP PROGRAM STAFF HAVE BEEN ABLE TO CREATE AND IMPLEMENT COMMUNICATION/MARKETING STRATEGIES THAT APPEAL TO THE TARGET POPULATION.
     THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE RSVP-NV TO CONTINUE ENGAGING AND SUPPORTING OLDER VOLUNTEERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, SPECIFICALLY OBESITY AND FOOD. APPROXIMATELY 77 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT OBESITY AND FOOD BY PROVIDING FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION, AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT. BY THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, 1,100 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE RECEIVED EMERGENCY FOOD SUPPORT OR OTHER FOOD SECURITY SERVICES FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER NONPROFITS THAT WILL RESULT IN INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN. APPROXIMATELY 55 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING-IN-PLACE BY PROVIDING MEALS, TRANSPORTATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY.  THE REMAINING 15 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN CAPACITY BUILDING ROLES BY MANAGING VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $147,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A NON-FEDERAL SHARE OF AT LEAST $63,000.

SOUTH CAROLINA-#02; RSVP OF GREENVILLE COUNTY

GREENVILLE COUNTY'S RSVP PROGRAM, SPONSORED BY SENIOR ACTION, WILL ENGAGE 50 VOLUNTEERS IN CRITICAL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THAT PRODUCE MEASURABLE OUTCOMES IN THE COMMUNITY.  SPECIFICALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL MENTOR UNDERPRIVILEGED STUDENTS, COMPLETE MINOR HOME REPAIR PROJECTS FOR SENIOR ADULTS, AND PROVIDE TAX ASSISTANCE FOR INDIVIDUALS THAT LACK THE KNOWLEDGE OR RESOURCES TO COMPLETE THEIR OWN RETURNS.  BASED ON THE SIGNIFICANT NEED FOR ADULT MENTORS IN GREENVILLE COUNTY AND OUR COMMUNITY'S RAPIDLY GROWING RETIRED AND SENIOR POPULATION, WE HAVE CHOSEN EDUCATION: K-12 SUCCESS AS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF OUR PROJECT.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 20 OR MORE STUDENTS WILL SHOW EVIDENCE OF IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND WILL BE ENCOURAGED TO COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION.  WITH STRONG, EXISTING NON-PROFIT PARTNERSHIPS, WE FEEL THAT THIS PROJECT IS POISED FOR LONG-TERM GROWTH TO BECOME OUR LARGEST AND MOST SUCCESSFUL PROJECT IN HISTORY.  TO APPEAL TO A WIDE DEMOGRAPHIC OF VOLUNTEERS AND TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY IN A VARIETY OF AREAS, THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO STRIVE TO ACHIEVE POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY: FINANCIAL LITERACY FOCUS AREAS.  AT THE END OF THIS GRANT CYCLE, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST 50 SENIOR ADULTS WITH MINOR HOME REPAIRS THAT WILL HELP THEM STAY IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THEY WILL ALSO PROCESS OVER 1,600 FREE TAX RETURNS THROUGH A FINANCIAL LITERACY PROGRAM MARKETED TOWARDS SENIORS WHO HAVE LOW FINANCIAL LITERACY OR LACK OF MONETARY RESOURCES.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $49,128 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,004 IN SPONSOR RESOURCES.  A TOTAL INVESTMENT OF $70,132 WILL WORK TO TRANSFORM THE LIVES OF MANY IN THE GREENVILLE COMMUNITY.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $81,693 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35091 FROM LOCAL SOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MISSION OF THE HARNETT COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH IS TO PREVENT ILLNESS, DISEASES, AND INJURIES, PROMOTE HEALTHY LIFESTYLES, AND KEEP THE ENVIRONMENT CLEAN, HEALTHY AND SAFE. AS A PART OF THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, THE HARNETT COUNTY DIVISION ON AGING COORDINATES SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR OLDER ADULTS, EDUCATES THE PUBLIC IN SUCCESSFUL AGING, AND ACTS AS A CATALYST FOR NEW PROGRAMS AND SERVICES IN THE INTEREST OF OLDER ADULTS. THE HARNETT COUNTY DIVISION ON AGING IS PROPOSING TO UTILIZE 275 OLDER ADULTS AGE 55 AND OVER AS VOLUNTEERS IN THE RSVP PROGRAM AND IS REQUESTING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $40,000.00. SERVICE CATEGORIES IN THE RSVP GRANT INCLUDE, HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, CAPACITY BUILDING AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. HARNETT COUNTY RSVP WILL ADDRESS NEEDS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR OUR OLDER ADULTS WITH HOME DELIVERED MEALS, TRANSPORTATION, AS WELL AS SUPPORT SERVICES AT LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS. LITERACY WILL BE ADDRESSED BY VOLUNTEERS TEACHING ADULTS AND TUTORING/MENTORING CHILDREN. FAMILIES SUFFERING FROM FOOD INSECURITY WILL BE SERVED BY VOLUNTEERS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES. SENIORS WHO ARE UNABLE TO ASSIST THEMSELVES WITH ISSUES PERTAINING TO MEDICARE AND THE FILING OF INCOME TAXES WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE FROM THE SHIIP AND VITA RSVP VOLUNTEERS. HEALTH SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH LOCAL HOSPITALS AND BLOOD DRIVES. NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE SKILLS OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS SUCH AS CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE, THRIFT STORES AND LOCAL MUSEUMS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES THROUGH SUPPORT AND MENTORING IN THE VETERANS TREATMENT COURT SYSTEM IN HARNETT COUNTY. TO EVALUATE THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THE RSVP STAFF WILL MEET WITH EXISTING SITE MANAGERS, REVIEW CURRENT "CUSTOMER SURVEYS" AND RESEARCH LOCAL AND NATIONAL DATA FOR TRENDS IN THE NEEDS OF OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES. INPUT FROM THE RSVP COMMUNITY ADVISORY GROUP IS CRUCIAL TO STRENGTHEN CURRENT NEEDS AND ADDRESS NEW NEEDS IN EACH COMMUNITY. THROUGH RESOURCES PROVIDED BY THIS GRANT, HARNETT COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM ANTICIPATES INCREASING THE NUMBER OF SENIORS LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, DECREASING THE NUMBER OF FOOD INSECURE FAMILIES, DECREASING THE NUMBER OF ADULTS WHO CANNOT READ AND HELP OUR CHILDREN TO BE BETTER EDUCATED. MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WILL HAVE AFFORDABLE INSURANCE THAT WILL MEET THEIR NEEDS AND SENIORS AND LOW INCOME CLIENTS WILL FILE TAXES ON TIME AND WITH MORE MONEY TO PUT BACK INTO THE LOCAL ECONOMY.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE NAME OF THE APPLICANT OF THIS GRANT IS NEW HANOVER COUNTY SENIOR RESOURCE CENTER.
THE NEW HANOVER COUNTY SENIOR RESOURCE CENTER ACTS AS A RESOURCE AND ACTIVITY CENTER FOR SENIOR ADULTS IN NEW HANOVER COUNTY TO PROVIDE SERVICES WHICH PROMOTE WELLNESS, ENCOURAGE INDEPENDENCE AND ENHANCE QUALITY OF LIFE. THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS , ACTIVITIES, CLASSES, SEMINARS, AND SUPPORT GROUPS, SENIOR SERVICE CORPS, INDEPENDENT LIFE SERVICE AND THE HOME DELIVERED MEAL PROGRAM.
AN ESTIMATED 550 RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIS PROJECT. THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING INSURANCE COUNSELING THROUGH THE RSVP/SHIIP (SENIOR HEALTH INSURANCE INFORMATION PROGRAM), PREPARING INCOME TAX RETURNS THROUGH THE RSVP VITA PROGRAM (VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE),  DISASTER ASSISTANCE AND PREPAREDNESS, ASSISTING THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERAN AFFAIRS, SCHOOL READINESS, PROGRAMS LINKED TO HEALTHY FUTURES AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT 550 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE CLIENTS SERVED IN THIS PROJECT.
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $111,097 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $63,174 BY THE GRANTEE THROUGH DIRECT FUNDING AND IN KIND SUPPORT.

SOUTHEASTERN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (SCC) SERVES AS THE SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED VOLUNTEER SERVICE PROGRAM (RSVP) FOR COLUMBUS COUNTY AND IT HAS SERVED IN THIS CAPACITY SINCE 1973. SINCE ITS INCEPTION, SCC'S RSVP  VOLUNTEER BASE HAS INCREASED 68 % AND THE FEDERAL BUDGET HAS INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY. DURING THE CURRENT PROGRAM YEAR RSVP HAS SERVES 125 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS AND WHO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AT 22 VOLUNTEER STATIONS.

 IN THE NEW GRANT CYCLE THERE WILL BE 95 VOLUNTEERS BASED ON THE NEW FORMULA THAT WILL SERVE IN A VARIETY OF AREAS SUCH AS: DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND HEALTHY FUTURES. BY THE END OF THE NEW THREE- YEAR GRANT CYCLE, PARTICIPATING SENIOR CITIZENS WILL HAVE EXPERIENCED AN INCREASED FINANCIAL LITERACY, INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT PARTICIPATION, JOB TRAINING OR SKILL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES, WHILE CHILDREN WILL INCREASE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS AND STUDENTS IN GRADES 3-5 WILL DEMONSTRATE ACADEMICALLY.  SCC ANTICIPATES RECEIVING  AN ANNUAL FEDERAL GRANT OF $95,028 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $20,000 LOCAL FUNDS AND IN AN EXCESS OF $25,000 IN NON-FEDERAL IN KIND SUPPORT PROVIDED BY SOUTHEASTERN COMMUNITY COLLEGE.

SPONSOR DURHAM TECHNICAL COMMUNITY COLLEGE (DURHAM TECH)
DURHAM TECH SERVES OVER 18,000 STUDENTS:  11% ARE AGE 17 AND UNDER, 45% ARE 18-25, 25% ARE 26-35, 11% ARE 36-45, AND 8% ARE OVER AGE 46.  DURHAM TECH'S MISSION IS TO ENRICH STUDENTS' LIVES AND THE BROADER COMMUNITY THROUGH TEACHING, LEARNING, AND SERVICE.  THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS AN OPEN-DOOR GUIDED PLACEMENT ADMISSIONS POLICY AND OFFERS OVER 100 TECHNICAL AND OCCUPATIONAL PROGRAMS LEADING TO AN ASSOCIATE'S DEGREE OR CREDENTIAL; CORPORATE AND CONTINUING EDUCATION; AND ADULT BASIC SKILLS INSTRUCTION.

BY MARCH 31, 2021, AN ESTIMATED 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN VOLUNTEER STATIONS. FIFTY NINE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH THE FOLLOWING PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS:   
ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY: FOCUSING ON VITA TAX ASSISTANCE SERVICES. THIRTY-TWO VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FREE INCOME TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) PROGRAM FOR AN ESTIMATED 1350 LOW-TO-MODERATE INCOME TAXPAYERS AND SENIORS. FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS WILL BE COMPLETED FREE OF CHARGE WITH A TOTAL VALUE OF REFUNDS GENERATED AT $600,000.	 
HEALTHY FUTURES: THIRTEEN VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS THROUGH MEALS ON WHEELS TO 70 HOMEBOUND, ELDERLY, AND DISABLED RESIDENTS TO INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT. 
FOURTEEN VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT SIXTY DURHAM TECH STUDENTS AND /OR STAFF WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH THE DURHAM TECH COMMUNITY THROUGH THE CAMPUS HARVEST FOOD PANTRY.  EDUCATION AND SUPPORT SERVICES, AS WELL AS FRESH PRODUCE AND NONPERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS ARE OFFERED AT DURHAM TECH'S CAMPUS HARVEST FOOD PANTRY SUPPORTED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  
ADDITIONAL OUPUT PERFORMANCE MEASURES INCLUDE:
CAPACITY BUILDING: THREE AREA ORGANIZATIONS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE LEADERSHIP OF EIGHT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO IMPLEMENT INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMS IN A NEW CAPACITY BUILDING INITIATIVE CALLED THE INTERGENERATIONAL LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE. ILI GRADUATES, REFERRED TO AS FELLOWS, WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT NEW INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMS IN PARTNERING ORGANIZATIONS.  AN ADDITIONAL SEVEN RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN LEADERSHIP FOR TWO ORGANIZATIONS AS BOARD, COMMITTEE, OR ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS.
EDUCATION:  FORTY STUDENTS (GRADES K-12) WILL PARTICIPATE IN CNCS SUPPORTED TUTORING IN READING AND/OR MATH WITH EIGHT VOLUNTEERS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $51,067 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF $26,886 PLUS IN-KIND FROM DURHAM TECHNICAL COMMUNITY COLLEGE.

THE SPONSOR AGENCY IS COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CCA). IT IS A PRIVATE CORPORATION WITH A VERY PUBLIC MISSION: THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, SUPPORT AND SERVICES WE WILL EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES TOWARD A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE. INCORPORATED IN 1965, THE AGENCY CAME INTO BEING AS PART OF A NATIONWIDE, FEDERALLY FUNDED, COMMUNITY ACTION MOVEMENT WHOSE FOCUS IS TO INTIMATELY INVOLVE LOW INCOME PEOPLE IN DEVELOPING THEIR OWN SOLUTIONS TO PERSISTENT POVERTY. A COMMON THREAD THROUGH ALL OF OUR SERVICES, FAMILY SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES, OR HOUSING SERVICES, IS THAT WE HELP PEOPLE CHANGE LIVES BY PROVIDING NEEDED RESOURCES AND SUPPORT. A MINIMUM OF 159 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH PROJECT YEAR. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OLDER OR DISABLED ADULTS IN A TWO COUNTY SERVICE AREA. SOME OF THE SERVICE CATEGORIES IMPLEMENTED WILL ASSIST WITH DAILY LIVING TASKS, SUCH AS TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ACQUIRING BENEFITS, MEAL DELIVERY THROUGH MEALS-ON-WHEELS, MAINTAINING FOOD PANTRIES AS WELL AS FOOD PANTRY DISTRIBUTION, WORKING WITH VETERANS AND MANY OTHERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OUTCOME OF THE BENEFICIARIES RECEIVING THE SERVICE REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT, ADDING TO THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $12,000 IN NON CNCS FUNDING. THE MATCHING FUNDS WILL COME FROM HOME CARE AND COMMUNITY BLOCK GRANT FUNDING, COUNTY SUPPORT AND INKIND CONTRIBUTIONS. THE PROJECT WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH OTHER AGING PROVIDERS IN ITS TWO COUNTY SERVICE AREAS, TO LOCATE AND ADDRESS UNMET NEEDS. CCAS RSVP PROGRAM IS WELL RECEIVED IN THE COMMUNITY AND STRIVES TO ADDRESS MANY OF THE PROBLEMS AND UNMET NEEDS IDENTIFIED WITH THE HELP OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS.

RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICE OR SUPPORT TO 41 NON-

THE RSVP PROGRAM IN LOUISVILLE, KY HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR OVER 40 YEARS AND ADMINISTERED THE LAST 20+ YEARS BY THE LOUISVILLE METRO GOVERNMENT.  IT HAS BEEN AND CONTINUES TO BE A VITAL PROGRAM TO SOME ESTIMATED 600 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND UP TO 60 VOLUNTEER SITES.  OVER TWO DECADES THROUGH THE ADMINISTRATION OF LOUISVILLE METRO GOVERNMENT, SOME OF THE RSVP ACTIVITIES HAVE INCLUDED: PACKAGING AND DELIVERY OF NUTRITIONALLY-BALANCED MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS; ASSISTING AT EMERGENCY FOOD BANKS; PROVIDING TEACHING TOOLS AND TUTORING AT EVENING MEAL SITES, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS; ENHANCING ACCESS TO CARE AND PATIENT SERVICES AT THE ROBLEY REX VA MEDICAL CENTER; INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF LOCALLY-IMPORTANT ORGANIZATIONS TO FULFILL THEIR MISSIONS TO THE JEFFERSON COUNTY, KY COMMUNITY AT LARGE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROJECT FOR THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE IS "HEALTHY FUTURES". AS IT WAS IN THE PAST AND THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPACTS IN AREAS OF FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, AND SOCIAL OUTREACH TOWARD PRESERVATION OF INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AND SUPPORT OF $120,506 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,772 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES RESULTING IN A TOTAL OVERALL AMOUNT OF $178,278.

 OUR SPONSOR: THE SOUTH GEORGIA PARTNERSHIP TO END HOMELESSNESS, INC (SGPEH) IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION THAT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1995 BY A GROUP OF LEADERS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION TO STRENGTHEN SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR HOMELESS AND AT-RISK HOMELESS RESIDENTS AND TO DEVELOP A NETWORK TO ASSIST PROVIDERS WITH THE MISSION OF ENDING THE CAUSES OF HOMELESSNESS. OUR MISSION IS ACCOMPLISHED BY WORKING WITH FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, SGPEH IS ABLE TO PROVIDE SERVICES AND SUPPORT TO POVERTY-STRICKEN AND OTHER DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS. BASED IN VALDOSTA, GEORGIA, SGPEH SERVES THE 18 COUNTIES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY AFFAIRS (DCA) REGION 11 WHICH INCLUDES: ATKINSON, BACON, BEN HILL, BERRIEN, BRANTLEY, BROOKS, CHARLTON, CLINCH, COFFEE, COOK, ECHOLS, IRWIN, LANIER, LOWNDES, PIERCE, TIFT, TURNER, AND WARE COUNTIES. SGPEH IS ABLE TO PROVIDE AID TO THOSE IN NEED IN THIS REGION BY LOCATING AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND FUNDING FOR HOMELESS AND AT-RISK HOMELESS POPULATION.
