VOLUNTEERS FOR COMMUNITY IMPACT, INC. (VCI)'S MISSION IS 'IMPROVING LIVES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM'. VCI HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF RSVP OF ORANGE COUNTY SINCE 1977 AND IS DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE CENTRAL FLORIDA COMMUNITY THROUGH RECRUITING, TRAINING, PLACING, RECOGNIZING AND RETAINING VOLUNTEERS AGES 55 AND OVER TO MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) INITIATIVES.  

ADDITIONALLY, VCI IS THE SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM THAT SERVES ORANGE, OSCEOLA, SEMINOLE AND VOLUSIA COUNTIES; VCI ALSO SPONSORS RSVP IN OSCEOLA COUNTY AND, UNTIL MID-2017, SPONSORED RSVP OF VOLUSIA COUNTY. 

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR VCI HAS STRATEGICALLY ALIGNED THE ORGANIZATION WITH CNCS?S SERVICE CATEGORIES, PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND CURRENT INITIATIVES. 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ACTIVITIES TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES OF: ALLEVIATING FOOD INSECURITY AND THE HARSH CONDITIONS OF HOMELESSNESS AND POVERTY IN ORANGE COUNTY'S 'FOOD DESERTS'; SUPPORTING STUDENT LITERACY, VOCABULARY ACQUISITION AND READING COMPREHENSION THROUGH VARIOUS DATA-DRIVEN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS; CONTRIBUTING TOWARDS JOB PLACEMENTS AND TRAINING THROUGH THE ADULT LITERACY LEAGUE; AND FINALLY, CONTRIBUTING TO THE HEALTH, WELLNESS AND INDEPENDENCE OF OUR CENTRAL FLORIDA SENIOR COMMUNITY THROUGH VARIOUS INITIATIVES PUT ON THROUGH OUR PARTNERS IN THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY (HOSPITALS AND HOSPICE). 

AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ORANGE COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME SPECIFIC EXAMPLES OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: SERVING IN ORGANIZATIONS WHICH PROVIDE HOT FOOD SERVICES AS WELL AS FOOD PANTRY AND FAMILY/EMERGENCY SERVICES; VOLUNTEERING IN COMMUNITY GARDENS; READING TO CHILDREN TO INCREASE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS; ASSISTING WITH PATIENT HOSPITALITY AND ADDITIONAL CARE FUNCTIONS; AND HELPING TO TEACH ADULT BASIC EDUCATION COURSES, AS TOUCHED ON ABOVE. AS A DIRECT RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS, OVER 1,275 RESIDENTS OF ORANGE COUNTY WILL RECEIVE INCREASED SERVICES IN EDUCATION AND OTHER IDENTIFIED AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $110,665 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $65,975 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

UNITED WAY OF MARTIN COUNTY'S (UWMC) MISSION IT TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF OUR COMMUNITY.  THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY THE RESIDENTS OF MARTIN COUNTY SHARING THEIR TIME, TALENTS AND RESOURCES. UWMC HAS STREAMLINED ITS FOCUS TO THE THREE MAJOR AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTH AND FINANCIAL STABILITY. WE RECOGNIZE THAT VOLUNTEERING IS VITAL TO A VIBRANT COMMUNITY BY FOSTERING CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AND HAVE MADE IT A MAJOR PART OF OUR BUSINESS STRATEGY.  SINCE 1979, UWMC HAS PROVIDED MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR SENIORS THROUGH THE SPONSORSHIP OF RSVP.  THE $91,344 FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL SUPPORT THE ACTIVITIES OF 600 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE REQUIRED MATCH OF $39,147.  
BY THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT NO LESS THAN 91 OF THE 600 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN WORK PLAN ACTIVITIES THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES. MEASURABLE RESULTS- ORIENTED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING AN ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN TO PREPARE FOR KINDERGARTEN, DELIVERING NUTRITIOUSLY BALANCED MEALS TO FRAIL, HOMEBOUND SENIORS; IMPROVING THE READING LEVELS OF YOUNGSTERS THROUGH A STRUCTURED LITERACY PROGRAM; PROVIDING DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TRAINING AND 509 VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS OTHER COMMUNITY NEEDS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

AN ESTIMATED 141 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ANNUALLY WITH RSVP OF ST. JOHNS COUNTY.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE GRANT IS EDUCATION, AND ACTIVITIES IN THIS AREA WILL INCLUDE TUTORING KINDERGARTEN -- TWELFTH GRADE STUDENTS IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, MENTORING KINDERGARTEN -- TWELFTH GRADE STUDENTS IN A ONE-TO-ONE OR SMALL GROUP SETTING, AND PROVIDING LITERACY ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES TO PRE-SCHOOL STUDENTS.  MANY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROMOTE LITERACY PROFICIENCY, AS THEY PROVIDE INSTRUCTIONAL SUPPORT AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, AND LITERACY ENRICHMENT IN SCHOOL DISTRICT EARLY CHILDHOOD CLASSROOMS (HEAD START, PRE-KINDERGARTEN EXCEPTIONAL STUDENT EDUCATION, AND VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN) AND TARGETED CHILD CARE CLASSROOMS (IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE EARLY LEARNING COALITION OF NORTH FLORIDA).  TUTOR SERVICES IN MATH WILL BE PROVIDED BY A SMALL GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS.  MENTORING SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IN THE ST. JOHNS COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT'S (SJCSD) HOMELESS PROGRAM, STUDENTS IN THE TAKE STOCK IN CHILDREN PROGRAM, AND STUDENTS IDENTIFIED WITH ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT CHALLENGES.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 360 STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH (K-12 SUCCESS, TUTORING PUBLIC SCHOOL).  TWO HUNDRED PRESCHOOL CHILDREN WILL DISPLAY GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS (SCHOOL READINESS, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM).  TWENTY STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FROM TAKING PART IN A MENTORING RELATIONSHIP (K-12 SUCCESS, SCHOOL BASED MENTORING).  EIGHTY STUDENTS WILL DISPLAY IMPROVED LITERACY SKILLS AFTER TAKING PART IN THE SJCSD SUMMER READING PROGRAM (K-12 SUCCESS, TUTORING PUBLIC SCHOOL).  
SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING SCHOOLS THROUGH ACTIVITIES LISTED ABOVE THAT DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM DOSAGES; PROVIDING NON-ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE TO SCHOOLS; AND PROVIDING EPISODIC SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCIES IN ST. JOHNS COUNTY.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,769.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,279.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  MATCHING FUNDS WILL COME FROM THE SJCSD (CASH AND IN-KIND SERVICES), COMMUNITY SPONSORSHIPS AND IN-KIND SERVICES, AND FUNDRAISING

THE COLLIER COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT AND SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY. RSVP OF COLLIER COUNTY HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM SINCE 1998 AND ITS LONGEVITY HAS GARNERED AN ABUNDANCE OF LOCAL COMMUNITY SUPPORT. THIS SUPPORT IS DEMONSTRATED IN WAYS SUCH AS THE DONATION OF COMMUNITY CLUBHOUSE SPACE TO HOST THE BONE BUILDERS CLASS AT OVER 10 DIFFERENT COMMUNITY SITES, THE INVOLVEMENT IN VOLUNTEER RECOGNITION EVENTS BY NUMEROUS LOCAL BUSINESSES THROUGH GENEROUS DONATIONS, NATIONAL SERVICE RECOGNITION DAY CELEBRATION AND THE COLLIER COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS' WILLINGNESS TO MATCH THE GRANTOR'S FUNDS. 
SINCE THE INCEPTION OF RSVP IN COLLIER COUNTY APPROXIMATELY 1,900 VOLUNTEERS HAVE CONTRIBUTED OVER 1 MILLION HOURS AT 153 DIFFERENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS ACROSS COLLIER COUNTY. ACCORDING TO THE IRS, THIS EQUATES TO A SAVINGS OF $24.1 MILLION TO OUR COUNTY BECAUSE OF THE TIME, TALENT AND ENERGY OUR VOLUNTEERS DEDICATE TO MAKING A DIFFERENCE. 
RSVP OF COLLIER PROPOSES AN ESTIMATED 83 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING THIS GRANT CYCLE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS FOR RSVP COLLIER COUNTY FOR 2018-2021 IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND EDUCATION 59 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THESE AREAS. RSVP WILL PLACE HEALTHY FUTURE VOLUNTEERS AT BONE BUILDER SITES, FOUNDATION FOR DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED, SERVING OUR SENIORS AND RIVIERA GULF ESTATES AND EDUCATION VOLUNTEERS AT LITERACY VOLUNTEERS AND BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB.  IN ADDITION, THE COLLIER COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL ALSO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF VETERAN/MILITARY FAMILIES WITH 15 VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THE COLLIER COUNTY VETERAN TRANSPORTATION OFFICE, DISASTER WILL INCLUDE 2 VOLUNTEERS AT THE NORTH COLLIER FIRE DEPARTMENT CERT AND 7 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE FOLLOWING CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) OUTCOMES WILL BE MET IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS: (A) IMPROVING ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT IN THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN MENTORING/TUTORING PROGRAMS, AND (B)INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS AND (C) OUTCOME BASED BONE BUILDERS PROGRAM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $54,522 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,366 OF CASH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS EACH YEAR.

SANTA ROSA COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC., (SRCS) A 1996 RECIPIENT OF THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM(RSVP) FEDERAL FUNDS, IS A 22-YEAR-OLD NON-PROFIT VOLUNTEER AGENCY SERVING SANTA ROSA COUNTY FLORIDA. OUR RSVP PROPOSED PROJECTS ALIGNS DIRECTLY WITH THE GOALS OF THE SRCS PROGRAM. THE POPULATION BEING SERVED IS AT RISK ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDING IN SANTA ROSA COUNTY.  THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO USE COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES AND FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY BEHAVIORS THAT WILL ASSIST ELDERS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THE SETTING OF THEIR CHOICE, BY OFFERING A COMPREHENSIVE ARRAY OF SERVICES AND RESOURCES. WE ARE COMMITTED TO MAKING MORE OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO RSVP VOLUNTEERS THROUGH OUR DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY PROGRAMS. WITH OUR LAST TWO PRESIDENTIAL DECLARED DISASTERS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS REGISTERED 15,428 ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS FOR DISASTER ASSISTANCE. RSVP REPORTED A TOTAL OF 23,845 VOLUNTEER HOURS. BASED ON THIS DATA, RSVP CONTINUES TO EXPAND ITS DISASTER OPERATION PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH A STRONG FOCUS ON DISASTER SERVICES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY LIFESTYLE CHOICES AND SAY THEY HAVE STRONGER SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT. THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE OF DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND RESOURCES.

THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF PINELLAS COUNTY (RSVP) IS ONE OF 6 DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS OFFERED BY PINELLAS OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC. (POC), A PRIVATE NOT-FOR-PROFIT "COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY" THAT HAS IDENTIFIED AND ADDRESSED THE MANY AND VARIED MATERIAL, EMOTIONAL, SOCIAL, AND EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF PEOPLE - PARTICULARLY THE ECONOMICALLY-DISADVANTAGED - THROUGHOUT PINELLAS COUNTY, FLORIDA, SINCE 1968.

THE PURPOSE OF RSVP - BEGUN LOCALLY IN 1977 - IS TO CREATE MEANINGFUL AND WELLNESS-ENHANCING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS AGE 55 AND ABOVE TO PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN THE LIFE OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE.  THE PROGRAM MATCHES THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE OF THIS VITAL AND RAPIDLY GROWING AGE GROUP TO CRITICAL NEEDS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY. POC IS NEARING THE END OF A THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE THAT STARTED IN 2015 WITH A TOTAL OF 552 VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE GIVEN MORE THAN 180,500 HOURS OF SERVICE TO THE THOSE IN NEED IN PINELLAS COUNTY. THIS EQUATES TO MORE THAN $4.3 MILLION IN IN-KIND LABOR DONATIONS TO RSVP'S PARTNERING ORGANIZATIONS.  

THE PINELLAS OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC. IS REQUESTING $117,889.00 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES TO PROVIDE A VARIETY OF SERVICE ACTIVITIES REFLECTED THAT WILL SPECIFICALLY ADDRESS SOME OF THE MOST URGENT NEEDS AND ISSUES CURRENTLY EXISTING THROUGHOUT PINELLAS COUNTY. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCREASE THE ABILITY FOR OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES; IMPROVE NUTRITION FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING FOOD INSECURITY; PROVIDE STABILITY TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHO ARE HOMELESS OR AT IMMINENT RISK OF BECOMING HOMELESS; IMPROVE EMPLOYABILITY FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PERSONS LEADING TO INCREASED SUCCESS IN GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT; IMPROVE CHILDREN?S SAFETY, WELFARE AND OVERALL HEALTH AND; ADDRESS THE COMPREHENSIVE NEEDS OF A LARGE AND EXTENSIVE VETERAN AND MILITARY COMMUNITY.

POC?S PRIMARY FOCUS FOR 2018 WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. IN ADDITION TO HEALTHY FUTURES, THE RSVP OF PINELLAS COUNTY WILL ALSO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT FOCUS ON ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND WORKING TO IMPROVE SCHOOL READINESS FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE IN SAFETY, WELFARE, AND HEALTH PROGRAMS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, RSVP OF PINELLAS COUNTY WILL HAVE RECRUITED, TRAINED, AND PLACED A MINIMUM OF 140 VOLUNTEERS IN 23 COMMUNITY-BASED WORK SETTINGS, GENERATING A COMBINED TOTAL OF 87,360 HOURS OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE OVER THE THREE YEAR COURSE OF THE FUNDING PERIOD, OR 29,120 HOURS PER YEAR. THE HOURS SERVED BY OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL NOT ONLY CREATE A POSITIVE EXPERIENCE FOR THOSE WHO HAVE DEDICATED THEIR TIME AND THEIR TALENTS TO THOSE IN NEED, BUT WILL ALSO BE INSTRUMENTAL IN HELPING OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS ACHIEVE THEIR MISSIONS IN ADDRESSING CRITICAL NEEDS THAT BETTER THE LIVES OF THOSE LESS FORTUNATE.

IMPACT BROWARD HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SINCE 2003. THE RSVP RENEWAL WILL ENGAGE 150 VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55+, TO SERVE DURING THE 2018-21 CONTRACT YEARS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES SUPPORTING HEALTHY FUTURES' AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE. VETERAN SERVICES WILL SUPPORT ACCESS TO LEGAL ASSISTANCE, ACCESS TO STATE AND FEDERAL BENEFITS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 
RSVP CURRENTLY MAINTAINS THE LARGEST NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS AT BROWARD'S VA CLINICS WITH 56 TOTAL. SINCE 2003, 238 VOLUNTEERS HAVE BEEN PLACED AT THE CLINICS, DESPITE NOT HAVING A PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF VETERANS. RECOGNIZING THIS COMMUNITY NEED AND REALIZING RSVP'S SUCCESS TO DATE, ALL ACTIVITIES WILL NOW BENEFIT VETERANS. 
RSVP BROWARD SPEARHEADS A PROJECT IN COLLABORATION WITH THE BROWARD VA CLINICS IN WHICH VOLUNTEERS ASSIST PATIENTS WITH ENROLLMENT AND USAGE OF MY HEALTHEVET, THE VA PATIENT PORTAL. THANKS TO THESE EFFORTS, BROWARD'S CLINICS HAVE LED THE STATE IN THE NUMBER OF VETERANS ENROLLED. VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THIS INITIATIVE AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES WILL ALSO BE IMPLEMENTED WITH SENIOR PLANET CLASSES. TECHNOLOGY TRAININGS WILL BE HELD AT BROWARD'S PRIMARY VA CLINIC AS WELL AS FOUR COMMUNITY-BASED SITES. THESE TRAININGS WILL ASSIST SENIORS AND VETERANS WITH ACCESSING COMMUNITY RESOURCES, DIGITAL COMMUNICATION INCLUDING E-MAIL AND SOCIAL MEDIA, HEALTH MANAGEMENT, AND ON-LINE SECURITY. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED: 300 SENIORS AND VETERANS WILL RECEIVE TECHNOLOGY TRAINING TO INCREASE THEIR ACCESS TO RESOURCES AND REDUCE ISOLATION; 90 VETERANS FULFILLING THEIR SENTENCE IN THE VETERANS TREATMENT COURT WILL BE MENTORED TO IMPROVE THEIR CIVILIAN LIFE AND DECREASE RECIDIVISM; A MINIMUM OF 1,000 VETERANS WILL BE ENROLLED IN MY HEALTHEVET; AND THOUSANDS OF VETERANS RECEIVING TREATMENT AT THE VA CLINICS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $120,130 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $77,7779 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. RSVP SECURES SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING THROUGH SPECIAL EVENTS, AND CORPORATE AND FOUNDATION SUPPORT. 
IMPACT BROWARD IS THE SPONSOR OF RSVP, AS WELL AS SCP AND FGP. SINCE 1965, IMPACT BROWARD HAS MET ITS MISSION TO IMPACT AND ENRICH THE COMMUNITY BY ENGAGING INDIVIDUALS THROUGH SERVICE TO MEET CRITICAL NEEDS. IMPACT BROWARD STAYS AT THE FOREFRONT OF RECOGNIZING EMERGING NEEDS AND PROVIDING SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF ALL BROWARD COUNTY RESIDENTS THROUGH THE TIME AND TALENT OF THE 55+ COMMUNITY. IN RESPONSE TO IDENTIFIED NEEDS, IMPACT BROWARD IS REBRANDING AND WILL BECOME THE SOUTH FLORIDA INSTITUTE ON AGING (SOFIA) ON FEBRUARY 2, 2018. SOFIA WILL BE A "THINK" AND "ACT" TANK, THE FIRST OF ITS KIND IN SOUTH FLORIDA, FOCUSED ON SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC INSIGHTS AND SERVICES TO EMPOWER PEOPLE AS THEY AGE.

ELDER CARE SERVICES' RSVP PROGRAM ANTICIPATES AT LEAST 300 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN NUMEROUS CAPACITIES THROUGHOUT OUR 14-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF FLORIDA (WALTON, HOLMES, WASHINGTON, JACKSON, CALHOUN, GULF, LIBERTY, GADSDEN, FRANKLIN, LEON, WAKULLA, JEFFERSON, MADISON, AND TAYLOR COUNTIES). MOST OF THEIR TIME WILL BE SPENT ASSISTING SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE. RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO HOME-BOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING SHORT DISTANCE TRAVEL ASSISTANCE AND TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, AND ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE ASSISTING 150 HOME-BOUND SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE THROUGH DELIVERED MEALS; PROVIDING SHORT DISTANCE TRAVEL TO AT LEAST 20 SENIORS SO THAT THEY MAY STAY INDEPENDENT WHILE LIVING AT HOME; GIVING COMPANIONSHIP TO 20 ISOLATED AND VULNERABLE SENIORS THROUGH TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, SAFETY CHECKS DURING MEAL DELIVERIES AND TRANSPORTATION VISITS; AND OFFERING NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO 75 SENIORS EACH MONTH AT RURAL FOOD DISTRIBUTION SITES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $112,219.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,247.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP OF AUTAUGA, COOSA, ELMORE, MONTGOMERY AND TALLAPOOSA COUNTIES (RSVP/MACOA) IS SPONSORED BY THE MONTGOMERY AREA COUNCIL ON AGING (MACOA). MACOA IS IN ITS 46TH YEAR OF OPERATION.  THE MISSION OF OUR RSVP PROJECT IS TO LINK THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE OF THE VOLUNTEER AGE 55 AND OLDER WITH IDENTIFIED, CRITICAL NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY, AND TO PROVIDE REWARDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS.  

14% OF THE POPULATION OF OUR FIVE COUNTY PROJECT IS MADE UP OF PEOPLE OVER THE AGE OF 65 AND 17% IS FOOD INSECURE.  OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES WHICH ADDRESSES THESE SEGMENTS OF OUR POPULATION.

AN ESTIMATED 1,064 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ALL SIX FOCUS AREAS AT 137 STATIONS ACROSS OUR SERVICE AREA.  OF THIS 1,064, 441 OR 41%, OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS BEGINNING YEAR ONE.  661 VOLUNTEERS OR 62% ARE PLACED IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.    ACTIVITIES OF OUR VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME BASES ASSIGNMENTS INCLUDE DELIVERING HOMEBOUND MEALS, PREPARING AND PACKAGING FROZEN MEALS, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS TO DOCTOR VISITS, THE PHARMACY, AND GROCERY STORE, AND PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO THE HOMEBOUND.

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD WE PLAN TO HAVE 555 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO THE EFFORTS OF THESE VOLUNTEERS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $133,804 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $117,647 OF STATE, LOCAL AND SPONSOR SUPPORT.

THE MACON COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS EFFECTIVELY PROVIDED MEASURABLE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY CHALLENGES BY ENGAGING INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEERISM SINCE JUNE 1973.  AN ESTIMATED 295 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 40 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS; DISASTER SERVICES; FOOD DISTRIBUTION; COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING AND PERFORMING OUTREACH AT NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS; AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ACTIVITIES THAT SERVE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES/AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE 40 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SEE INCREASED PARTICIPATION AMONG HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND/OR SOCIAL SUPPORT. 
	LIKE MANY OTHER SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS ACROSS THE COUNTRY, MACON COUNTY RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS ON THE SIX CRUCIAL SERVICE AREAS: DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, HEALTHY FUTURES AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, IN ORDER TO PROMOTE EFFICIENT PARTNERSHIPS AND GENERATE MEASURABLE OUTCOMES.   THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $51, 174.00  FROM MACON COUNTY COMMISSION, RSVP'S SPONSORING AGENCY, AS WELL AS $10,000.00 SUPPLEMENT FROM STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.   IN ADDITION, OFFICE SPACE, UTILITY COST, LOCAL TRAVEL AND TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE MACON COUNTY COMMISSION.   FINANCIAL AND IN-KIND SUPPORT IS PROVIDED ALSO THROUGH OTHER LOCAL, STATE, SOCIAL, CIVIC AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES. VALID STATISTICAL DATA FROM THE COUNTY CENSUS WILL BE UTILIZED TO ENSURE THAT RSVP SERVES THE ENTIRE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA.  MACON COUNTY COMMISSION IS GOVERNED BY FIVE (5) ELECTED INDIVIDUALS WHO ASSIST RSVP WITH INCORPORATING EFFECTIVE AND PRACTICAL APPROACHES TO ENSURE THAT COMMUNITY CHALLENGES ARE MET AND LIVES ARE IMPROVED BY INTEGRATING SKILLFUL SENIOR VOLUNTEER CITIZENS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF BARBOUR COUNTY(RSVP OF BC) IS A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION AND HAS BEEN PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICES TO BARBOUR COUNTY, ALABAMA AS A VITAL PART OF THE COUNTY SINCE ITS BEGINNING IN 1972. BARBOUR COUNTY RSVP IS A VITAL SOURCE FOR RETIRED SENIORS WHO WANT MORE OUT OF LIFE AND STILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY RSVP INC. SINCE ITS BEGINNING IN 1972. WE HAVE A CURRENT TOTAL OF 166 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS OF WHICH 110 OF THE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE THE ENTIRE BARBOUR COUNTY COMMUNITY. RSVP OF BARBOUR COUNTY HAS A MISSION TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS WHO ARE RETIRED OR SEMI-RETIRED SO THAT THEY MAY REMAIN ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH SIGNIFICANT VOLUNTEER SERVICE TO NON-PROFIT AGENCIES SUCH AS SCHOOLS WITH TUTORING/READING, NURSING HOMES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES WHO WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO THE SICK AND SHUT IN. OUR MAIN FOCUS IS TO SERVE AND HELP THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY PROJECTS THROUGH THE NETWORK OF TWENTY-NINE (29) VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS COMMUNITIES OF TRANSFORMATION, ALABAMA COOPERATIVE EXTENSION, ADOPT-A-NATIVE ELDER PROGRAM, DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS, TWO LOCAL SCHOOLS (EUFAULA PRIMARY AND EUFAULA EARLY LEARNING CENTER) AND THE FAMILY SERVICE CENTER. 
AN ESTIMATED 110 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING/MENTORING PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN, ASSIST WITH PROJECT FOR 4-H, GARDENING WITH SENIORS WHO HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO FOOD BY PROVIDING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS; ASSIST AND IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC STATUS OF PARTICIPANTS, PROVIDE LAP BLANKETS, BOOKBAGS, CLOTHING AND HYGIENE NECESSITIES FOR THE NAVAJO TRIBE.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE (3) YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL BE AN INCREASED NUMBER OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED SENIORS AND OTHERS WHO WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO SERVICES,AND BENEFITS AIMED AT CONTRIBUTING TO THEIR FINANCIAL LITERACY, LEADING TO INCREASED SUCCESS IN BECOMING EMPLOYED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37,836.23.

PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AND ANTICIPATED OUTCOME:   EDUCATION
MARSHALL COUNTY RSVP WILL PLACE 68 VOLUNTEERS AS READING BUDDIES IN ALL 12 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN OUR COUNTY WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH KINDERGARTNER THROUGH FOURTH GRADE STUDENTS TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  IN 2015, 65% OF FOURTH GRADERS WERE CLASSIFIED AS READING BELOW THE PROFICIENT LEVEL.  54.4% OF CHILDREN ENROLLED IN MARSHALL COUNTY SCHOOLS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR EITHER FREE OR REDUCED LUNCHES. 
     EVALUATION OF THE ANTICIPATED 100 STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THE PROGRAM BASED ON PRE- AND POST- EVALUATIONS FOR EACH CHILD, RSVP'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE 90 STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR READING SKILLS.
     TO ELIMINATE THE SUMMER READING LOSS, RSVP WILL PARTNER WITH THE 5 PUBLIC LIBRARIES IN THE COUNTY TO CONTINUE ONE-ON-ONE READING IN A UNIQUE WAY USING OUR CERTIFIED THERAPY DOG TEAMS.  ONCE A WEEK CHILDREN WILL READ LIBRARY BOOKS TO THE DOGS AS PART OF "DOG TALES".

*ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY - TAX COUNSELING -- 50 INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL PREPARE 1,500 FEDERAL AND STATE TAX RETURNS FOR FREE FOR RURAL, ELDERLY, LOW INCOME AND LIMITED ENGLISH TAXPAYERS THIS YEAR SAVING THEM OVER $409,500 IN TAX PREPARATION COSTS, FREEING THAT MONEY TO BE USED FOR OTHER FAMILY NEEDS SUCH AS FOOD, HOUSING, UTILITIES, MEDICINE, ETC.
*CAPACTIY BUILDING -- IMPROVING WATERWAYS - 43 ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY TRAINED WATER QUALITY MONITORS WILL COLLECT OVER 2,500 WATER QUALITY DATA SAMPLES ON 54 STREAM SITES AND 5 ENBAYMENTS DURING THE YEAR.  THUS, 250 MILES OF WATERWAYS WILL BE IMPROVED.
- CARTRIDGE RECYCLING -- 4 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH 25 COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO COLLECT RECYCLE EMPTY PRINTER CARTRIDGES, KEEPING A TON OF MATERIALS OUT OF LANDFILLS AND RECOVERING 600 GALLONS OF OIL BY REUSING THE EMPTY CARTRIDGES.

DAVIS COUNTY RSVP IS SPONSORED AND MANAGED BY SENIOR SERVICES, 1 OF 4 DIVISIONS WITHIN THE DAVIS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (DCHD). SENIOR SERVICES INTERACTS WITH THOUSANDS OF OLDER ADULTS AND CAREGIVERS EACH YEAR, OFFERING VARIOUS SERVICES INCLUDING RSVP, MEALS ON WHEELS (MOW), TRANSPORTATION, SENIOR CENTERS, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND IN-HOME SERVICES. THESE PROGRAMS HELP OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN AT HOME IN THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, AGING IN PLACE WITH RESPECT AND DIGNITY.
     DAVIS COUNTY RSVP PROPOSES TO FACILITATE AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICES FOR AN ESTIMATED 375 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING SERVICE TO OLDER ADULTS, PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, CHILDREN, COMMUNITY MEMBERS, ANIMAL SERVICES, VETERANS, MILITARY, AND THEIR FAMILIES. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL ADDRESS AGING IN PLACE, ACCESS TO CARE, AND OBESITY AND FOOD OBJECTIVES.
     VOLUNTEER SERVICES SUPPORTING AGING IN PLACE INCLUDE ASSISTING AND PROMOTING INDEPENDENT LIVING, MOW DELIVERY, SOCIALIZATION TO HOMEBOUND, ISOLATED SENIORS, AND ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION EFFORTS. ACCESS TO CARE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION, COACHING, DISTRIBUTE NUTRITIONAL EDUCATION, AND INFORMATION ABOUT MEDICARE FRAUD AND INSURANCE OPTIONS. SENIOR SERVICES UTILIZES EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING AND WILL TRAIN RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN PROVEN HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS. OBESITY AND FOOD VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FOOD BANKS WITH COLLECTION, SORTING, DISTRIBUTION, AND PREPARING OVER 1300 WEEKLY PANTRY PACKS TO SCHOOL CHILDREN WITH FOOD INSECURITY. 
     AT THE END OF THREE YEARS, 80% OF THE PERSONS RECEIVING AGING IN PLACE SERVICES WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED PERCEIVED SOCIAL TIES AND CONNECTEDNESS. NEARLY 1400 OLDER ADULTS WILL RECEIVE EDUCATION TO PROMOTE HEALTHY, INFORMED DECISION-MAKING THROUGH ACCESS TO CARE. AND OVER 3,100 RSVP VOLUNTEER HOURS WILL HELP DISSEMINATE 3,000,000 POUNDS OF FOOD TO PEOPLE IN NEED.

DURING THE TIMEFRAME OF APRIL 2018 THROUGH MARCH 2021, WE WILL MAINTAIN AT LEAST 200 RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE TO WASHOE COUNTY, NEVADA. THE MAJORITY OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) TRANSPORTATION FOR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS; 2) COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED OLDER ADULTS; 3) SUPPORT FOR HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS; AND 4) SUPPORTING OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE QUALITY OF LIFE AND WELLBEING FOR OLDER ADULTS IN OUR COMMUNITY. 

THE SANFORD CENTER FOR AGING, BASED OUT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA, RENO?S SCHOOL OF MEDICINE, IS DEDICATED TO ENHANCING QUALITY OF LIFE AND WELL-BEING AMONG OLDER ADULTS AND THE EFFORTS OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM ARE CRITICAL TO THE MISSION OF THE CENTER. THROUGHOUT THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT LEAST 250 UNDUPLICATED OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS IN RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THE SANFORD CENTER FOR AGING?S RESEARCH ASSOCIATE WILL EVALUATE THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS A RESULT OF VOLUNTEER PROGRAM EFFORTS. THE EVALUATION OF RSVP EFFORTS WILL HELP DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT OF OUR VOLUNTEERS PROGRAM ON WASHOE COUNTY AND THE INTEGRAL ROLE OUR VOLUNTEERS PLAY IN ENHANCING QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OLDER ADULTS. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $108,751 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A GRANTEE SHARE OF $48,778. RSVP OF WASHOE COUNTY IS AN EXISTING CNCS-FUNDED SITE THAT IS A PROGRAM OF THE SANFORD CENTER FOR AGING AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA RENO, WHICH IS UNDER THE SPONSORSHIP OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS FOR THE NEVADA SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION. WITH THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE UNIVERSITY, INCLUDING EXPERTISE IN DATA COLLECTION AND PROGRAM EVALUATION, COMMUNITY VISIBILITY, AND DONOR CULTIVATION, RSVP OF WASHOE COUNTY HAS GENERATED THE RESOURCES NECESSARY TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY SERVICE ABOVE AND BEYOND TARGETS OUTLINED BY CNCS.

THE NEVADA RURAL COUNTIES RSVP PROGRAM, INC. (NV RURAL RSVP) IS A SELF-SPONSORED 501 (C)(3) ORGANIZATION WITH A VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS THAT HAS BEEN SERVING RURAL NEVADA COUNTIES FOR OVER 43 YEARS. NV RURAL RSVP HAS A DEMONSTRATED RECORD OF OUTSTANDING SERVICE WHICH HAS IMPROVED THE LIVES OF SENIORS AND STRENGTHENED COMMUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING; AND HELPED NEVADA?S ELDERS REMAIN INDEPENDENT AT HOME WHERE THEY CAN AGE IN PLACE, MAINTAIN A HEALTHY QUALITY OF LIFE, AND REMAIN A VITAL PART OF THEIR COMMUNITIES.
RSVP?S MISSION IS TO HELP FRAIL, HOMEBOUND, AND LOW-INCOME SENIORS REMAIN INDEPENDENT BY PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY PROGRAMS WHICH ALLOW THEM TO STAY IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH DIGNITY.  ADDITIONALLY, RSVP COORDINATES A VOLUNTEER NETWORK OF SENIORS WHO USE THEIR SKILLS AND TALENTS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY AGENCIES AND ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH SERVICE. 
NV RURAL RSVP'S INDEPENDENT LIVING PROGRAMS INCLUDE: ESCORTED TRANSPORTATION, HOME COMPANION, RESISTANCE EXERCISE TRAINING, RESPITE CARE, LEGAL AID,  PERSONAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE SYSTEM(S), VETERANS VOLUNTEERS IN PARTNERSHIP (VIP), HOMEMAKER SERVICES, AND SENIOR NUTRITION. THESE EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS WERE IMPLEMENTED TO ADDRESS THE INCREASING NUMBER OF LOW-INCOME SENIORS THAT ARE UNABLE TO ACCESS THE BASIC RESOURCES, GOODS AND SERVICES, HEALTHCARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES. FURTHERMORE, THIS POPULATION IS AT HIGH RISK FOR COSTLY INSTITUTIONALIZATION, CREATING A HEAVY BURDEN ON LOCAL ECONOMIES AND ALREADY STRETCHED GOVERNMENT RESOURCES FOR MEDICARE, MEDICAID AND NURSING HOMES.  
NV RURAL RSVP WILL MEET THE HEALTH NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS THROUGH FOUR CORE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES IN THE CNCS HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AREAS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES ADDRESS SUPPORTING THE ABILITY OF HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. NV RURAL RSVP PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN A DIVERSE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO ENSURE THE BEST OUTCOMES FOR THIS POPULATION AND TO HELP MEET OUR COMMUNITY?S GREATEST CHALLENGES.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) ESCORTED ROUND-TRIP TRANSPORTATION, 2) COMPANIONSHIP, 3) FOOD DISTRIBUTION AND DELIVERY, AND 4) VETERANS RESOURCES, SUICIDE PREVENTION AND AWARENESS ACTIVITIES, AND REFERRALS TO SUPPORTIVE SERVICES; 5) IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED IN A DIVERSE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH SERVICE.

THE RICHLAND COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (RCHD) HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE NORTHEAST MT RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 2004, NOW COVERING DANIELS, MCCONE, RICHLAND, ROOSEVELT, SHERIDAN COUNTIES, AND THE FORT PECK INDIAN RESERVATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS CAPACITY BUILDING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $191,045 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TOTALING $106,972. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: 1. 180 INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS WILL USE PREVENTIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS; 2. 175 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD DELIVERY & COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; 3. 170 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD & EDUCATION WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN; 4. EIGHTEEN WORKSTATIONS WILL RECEIVE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT IN ADDRESSING ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY NEEDS IN ADULT LITERACY, YOUTH MENTORING, VETERAN SUPPORT, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS & RECOVERY.
THE NORTHEAST MT RSVP PROGRAM HAS PLAYED AN INVALUABLE ROLE BY HELPING BRIDGE COMMUNITY GAPS AND COMBINE AVAILABLE RESOURCES SINCE 2004. THE VISION OF RICHLAND COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT NORTHEAST MT RSVP IS TO TRANSFORM OUR FRONTIER REGION BY SHOWING PARTNERING AGENCIES AND NON-PROFITS HOW TO MORE EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS SO THOSE ORGANIZATIONS CAN BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BECOME A SERVICE ENTERPRISE. SERVICE ENTERPRISE IS DEFINED AS AN ORGANIZATION ENGAGING 50 OR MORE VOLUNTEERS UTILIZING BEST VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. RCHD IS HOSTING ONE AMERICORPS GRANT PROGRAM. TEN FULL-TIME AMERICORPS MEMBERS ARE SERVING IN THE ISSUE AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND CAPACITY BUILDING, SUPPORTING ALL RSVP PRIORITIES.

THE BUTTE SCHOOL DISTRICT #1 IS THE PROUD SPONSOR OF THE BUTTE RSVP PROGRAM.  THE BUTTE SCHOOL DISTRICT #1 WILL CONTINUE TO OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR AN ESTIMATED 240 RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CONTINUING TO MAKE BUTTE, MONTANA THE "RICHEST HILL ON EARTH".  OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVICE OUR COMMUNITY BY PARTICIPATING IN THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES:
K-12 EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS:  OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR AND MENTOR STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT AT APPROPRIATE GRADE LEVELS FOR MATH AND READING.  IDENTIFIED STUDENTS WILL WORK WITH OUR VOLUNTEERS IN CLASSROOMS TO IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PROGRESS.  OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED WITH THE TOOLS CURRENTLY AVAILABLE IN SCHOOLS.  THESE TOOLS ARE ISIP PROGRESS MONITORING (READING), DIEBELS PROGRESS MONITORING (READING) AND MAPS (MATH) AS WELL AS THE YEARLY SUMMATIVE ASSESSMENT FOR THE STATE FOR READING AND MATH CALLED "SMARTER BALANCE". WE WILL ALSO TRACK ATTENDANCE OUTCOMES WITH THE SCHOOLS WITH RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  K-12 EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS WILL BE OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT.   
HEALTHY FUTURES:  OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREA OF SUPPORTING AND ASSISTING OUR COMMUNITY EMERGENCY FOOD BANK.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSISTING WITH FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT IN THE WAREHOUSE.  OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED BY THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY BECAUSE OF THESE SERVICES OF THE BUTTE EMERGENCY FOOD BANK.  
HEALTHY FUTURES:  OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH SENIORS WHO ARE IDENTIFIED AS "AT RISK" DUE TO LACK OF SUPPORTIVE SERVICES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE THE NEEDED SERVICES FOR THE IDENTIFIED SENIORS THROUGH FOOD DELIVERY AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES.  
ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY:  OUR VOLUNTEERS ASSIST THE VITA (VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM) AND PROVIDING HELP TO INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED ASSISTANCE IN PREPARING THEIR OWN TAX RETURNS.  THESE VOLUNTEERS ALSO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND INFORMATION ON TAX LAWS.  THIS SERVICE ALLOWS INDIVIDUALS TO RECOUP MONIES THAT THEY MIGHT NOT HAVE DONE ON THEIR OWN.  
OUR BUTTE RSVP PROGRAM WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH A DIVERSE GROUP OF AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY BASED ON THE NEEDS AND PRIORITIES OF THE BUTTE SILVER BOW COUNTY.  THEY INCLUDE SUCH NON-PROFIT AGENCIES SUCH AS ST. JAMES HEALTHCARE, OUR LADY OF THE ROCKIES FOUNDATION, , BUTTE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE, BUTTE SILVER BOW ARCHIVES, ACTION INC., THE WORLD MUSEUM OF MINING AND ALL OTHER APPROPRIATE PARTNERS.  
OUR GOAL FOR THIS GRANT CYCLE IS TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE IN WHICH INDIVIDUALS MAY SHARE THEIR EXPERIENCES, ABILITIES, AND SKILLS FOR THE BETTERMENT OF THEIR COMMUNITY AND THEMSELVES.  BUTTE RSVP WILL ENSURE THAT VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTERESTS AND ABILITIES OF THE VOLUNTEER AND THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY SERVED.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $81,693.00 ALONG WITH OUR NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF 30% WILL SUPPORT OUR DEDICATED AND MOTIVATED VOLUNTEERS IN BUTTE, MONTANA.

THE AGENCY ON ELDERLY AFFAIRS IS THE LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND THE DESIGNATED AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER.  THE MISSION OF THE AREA AGENCY: PLANS, IMPLEMENTS, SUPPORTS AND ADVOCATES FOR THE WELL-BEING OF KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS; AND SERVES AS A ONE-STOP SOURCE OF INFORMATION ON LONG-TERM CARE SUPPORT OPTIONS AND SERVICES FOR ALL RESIDENTS. THE VISION OF THE AREA AGENCY:
-	KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS WILL LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME OR IN THE COMMUNITY WITH DIGNITY AND RESPECT.
-	KAUAI'S FAMILY CAREGIVERS RECEIVE ADEQUATE SUPPORT TO CARE FOR THEIR OLDER ADULTS.
-	KAUAI'S OLDER ADULTS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS WILL MAKE INFORMED CHOICES AND HAVE STREAMLINED ACCESS TO LONG-TERM CARE SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 350 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN 35 VOLUNTEER STATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE ISLAND.  AT LEAST SIXTY OF THESE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 
 
PROVIDING "HEALTHY FUTURES" THROUGH FOOD DISTRIBUTION, COLLECTION AND PANTRY SUPPORT BY VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING CHURCHES AND OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHO PROVIDE FOOD PANTRIES AND FOOD BANKS.  HAVING VOLUNTEERS ASSIST WITH FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP AND PREVENTION OF ELDER ABUSE BY PROVIDE SUPPORT TO CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.  PROVIDING "ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY" THROUGH FINANCIAL LITERACY OF INCOME TAX TUTORING AND PREPARING THROUGH VOLUNTEERS AT AARP AS WELL AS BUILDING, REPAIRING OR ASSISTING HOMES THROUGH HABITAT FOR HUMANITY.  

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE CAREGIVERS NEEDED RESPITE THROUGH EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL SUPPORT AS WELL AS INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR FINANCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER.  THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO ASSIST ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE WITH BUILDING NEW CONSTRUCTION OR REPAIRING/RENOVATING OF RESIDENTIAL HOMES TO ASSIST FAMILIES? TO TRANSITION INTO OR REMAIN IN SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  AS WELL AS PROVIDE INCOME TAX TUTORING TO CONTRIBUTE TO FAMILIES' IMPROVED ECONOMIC WELL-BEING.

ON TOP OF THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS AND PROJECTED OUTCOMES, THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO CONTINUE WITH CAPACITY BUILDING BY FUNDRAISING THRU VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT THRIFT SHOPS AND GIFT SHOPS, GARNERING DONATIONS AND SUPPORTING BLOOD DRIVES. COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL REMAIN WITH VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT LIBRARIES, MUSEUMS, SERVICE INFORMATION DESKS, ENTERTAINMENT OUTREACH AT LONG-TERM CARE FACILITIES AND HOSPITALS, SPECIAL PROJECTS.

AS WE CONTINUE WITH THESE COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND CAPACITY BUILDING, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIOR SERVICE TO ADDRESS UNMET LOCAL AND STATE NEEDS, EMPOWER THOSE 55 AND BETTER TO CONTINUE BEING A CONTRIBUTING MEMBER OF THEIR COMMUNITY AND GIVE THEM AN OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE.  THROUGH SENIOR, SERVICE THE PROGRAM AIMS TO ACHIEVE IMPROVEMENT OF QUALITY OF ADULT DAY CARE BY PROVISION OF THERAPEUTIC, SOCIAL & ACTIVITY PROGRAMS; REDUCE ELDERLY ABUSE IN LONG-TERM CARE FACILITIES; ASSIST SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES WITH FUNDRAISING THRU THEIR GIFT SHOPS AND THRIFT SHOPS; SUPPORT COMMUNITY LIBRARIES AND MUSEUM'S CULTURAL AND HISTORICAL PRESERVATION; PROVIDING THERAPEUTIC OUTREACH THROUGH MUSIC TO THE RESIDENTS OF LONG-TERM CARE FACILITIES.

THE CITY AND COUNTY OF HONOLULU'S DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS)/ELDERLY AFFAIRS DIVISION (EAD), HAS BEEN A KEY PARTNER IN THE AGING NETWORK FOR OVER 30 YEARS. 
SERVING AS THE DESIGNATED AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) FOR OAHU, EAD IMPLEMENTS ACTIVITIES DEFINED IN THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT, AS AMENDED IN 2006 AND PROVIDES SUPPLEMENTAL SERVICES THROUGH THE STATE OF HAWAII KUPUNA CARE PROGRAM. 
THE MISSION OF EAD IS TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE AND COORDINATED SYSTEM OF SERVICES TO ASSISTS OLDER PERSONS IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. EAD COORDINATES ADVOCACY EFFORTS ON BEHALF OF ELDERS AND CONTRACTS WITH DIFFERENT AGENCIES TO PROVIDE CASE MANAGEMENT, PERSONAL CARE, ATTENDANT CARE, HOME DELIVERED AND CONGREGATE MEALS, HOUSING, LEGAL INFORMATION & ASSISTANCE, TRANSPORTATION, CAREGIVER RESPITE SUPPORT, AND EDUCATION HEALTH PROMOTION SENIOR CENTER PROGRAM SERVICES TO SENIORS AND CAREGIVERS IN OAHU.  EAD IS ALSO THE LEAD ORGANIZATION IN THE COMMUNITY SUPPORT & HEALTH SERVICES DOMAIN, ONE OF SIX WORKGROUPS OF HONOLULU'S AGE-FRIENDLY CITY INITIATIVE. THE CITY AND COUNTY OF HONOLULU'S DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS)/ELDERLY AFFAIRS DIVISION (EAD), IS THE INCUMBENT SPONSOR FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIORS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU SINCE 2011. CURRENTLY, RSVP HAS PARTNERSHIP WITH 40 NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES CALLED RSVP VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  RSVP'S POOL OF VOLUNTEERS INCREASED FROM 159 IN 2012 TO 250 IN 2016. TWENTY-TWO (22) VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE THE ELDERLY UNDER HEALTHY FUTURES AND OTHER AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES WHILE 18 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SERVE ADULTS, YOUTHS, AND CHILDREN AS PART OF OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES OUTSIDE OF CNCS FOCUS AREAS.  RSVP'S PROPOSAL FOR THE GRANT YEAR STARTING FROM APRIL 1, 2018 AND ENDING ON MARCH 31, 2021 ARE THE FOLLOWING:
CNCS FEDERAL FUND REQUESTED - $90,514.00
YEAR 1, COST/VOLUNTEERS IN PERFORMANCE MEASURES OUTCOMES - $1,250.00
YEAR 2 AND 3, COST/VOLUNTEERS IN PERFORMANCE MEASURES OUTCOMES - $1,000.00
TOTAL UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS - 211
TOTAL REQUIRED UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS - YEAR 1 IS 74, SECOND AND THIRD YEAR IS 91
NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOMES - 106
REMAINING POTENTIAL UNDUPLICATED NUMBER -120 
OF THE TOTAL PROPOSED FY 2018 BUDGET OF $152,391.00, WE ARE REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL FUNDING OF $90,514, EAD WILL SUPPLEMENT THE PROGRAM WITH A 41% MATCH OR $61,877.00 OF THE TOTAL YEARLY BUDGET.

AN ESTIMATED 339 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE RSVP PROGRAM OF KERN COUNTY.  OF THIS NUMBER, 248 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE; FOOD PREPARATION AND SERVING OF CONGREGATE MEALS AT SENIOR CENTERS TO SENIOR INDIVIDUALS FACING ISSUES SUCH AS FOOD INSECURITIES AND THE LACK OF SOCIAL INTERACTION ON A DAILY BASIS. DELIVERY OF NUTRITIOUS DAILY MEALS THROUGH THE MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAMS, SERVING LOCAL FOOD BANKS AND GLEANING PROJECTS THAT ARE DEDICATED TO FEEDING THE HUNGRY, REPLENISHING LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, REDUCING FOOD WASTE AND THE AMOUNT OF DISCARDED FOOD IN KERN COUNTY'S LANDFILLS.  ASSISTING IN SENIOR SACK DISTRIBUTION OF SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD ITEMS TO SENIORS AT THE END OF THE MONTH FACING THE LACK OF NUTRITIOUS FOOD DUE TO BUDGET CONSTRAINTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, CNCS FOCUS AREA.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THOSE SENIORS RECEIVING SERVICES WILL REPORT RECEIVING ADEQUATE NUTRITIOUS FOOD NEEDED TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING STATUS AND AGING IN PLACE, AGE APPROPRIATE NUTRITION INFORMATION AND AN INCREASED NUMBER OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARTICIPATION IN SOCIAL INTERACTION ACTIVITIES, EQUALLY AS IMPORTANT IN LIVING HEALTHY INDEPENDENT LIVES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,148 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,860 OF NON FEDERAL RESOURCES.
KERN COUNTY'S 60 AND OVER SENIOR POPULATION CURRENTLY REPRESENTS 12.5% OF THE COUNTY'S TOTAL POPULATION.  IN THE NEXT 10 YEARS, THIS POPULATION IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE BY 51% AS A RESULT OF THE BABY BOOMER PHENOMENON.  AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF PROGRAMS AND FUNDING FOR SENIORS DETERIORATES, MORE SENIORS WILL BE AT RISK, JEOPARDIZING THEIR HEALTH AND WELL BEING, THEIR QUALITY OF LIVING AN INDEPENDENT LIFE AS WELL.  THE VOLUNTEER CENTER OF KERN COUNTY WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1972, DEDICATED TO SERVING THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF VOLUNTEERS.  IT PRIDES ITSELF IN PROVIDING MORE THAN FORTY THREE YEARS OF COMPLIANCE SPONSORSHIP EXPERIENCE WITH THE RSVP PROGRAM OF KERN COUNTY AND THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.  MISSION STATEMENT:  TO MOBILIZE PEOPLE AND RESOURCES TO DELIVER CREATIVE SOLUTIONS TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY ISSUES THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM.

RSVP OF GREATER LONG BEACH, SPONSORED FOR 45 YEARS BY THE LONG BEACH ALPERT JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER (AJCC), WILL UTILIZE THE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE OF 300 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ADDRESS IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT HAVE BEEN DETERMINED BY LOCAL COMMUNITY PARTNERS, STATE AND NATIONAL STUDIES. ALL PEOPLES COMMUNITY CENTER HAS SPONSORED RSVP FOR FORTY-THREE YEARS. WE HAVE BUILT A CORE OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH DEPARTMENT OF AGING, POLICE STATIONS, PUBLIC SCHOOLS, FAITH-BASED CONGREGATIONS, HOSPITALS, AND SENIOR CENTERS. AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES IN GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY: CITY OF LOS ANGELES COMMUNITY OF SOUTH LOS ANGELES; THE CITIES OF BELL, BELL GARDENS, CUDAHY, HUNTINGTON PARK, LYNWOOD, MAYWOOD,  VERNON AND SOUTH GATE. THESE COMMUNITIES ARE HOME TO A DISPROPORTIONATE NUMBER OF THE ONE-IN-SIX COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO WERE LIVING BELOW THE POVERTY LINE IN 2010 (CENSUS BUREAU ESTIMATES). HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT, HOMELESSNESS, ILLITERACY, AND VIOLENCE ALSO ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AREA, SO THE NEEDS OF RESIDENTS ARE ACUTE AND NUMEROUS. BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS ALL PEOPLES LOOKS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT FIT IN WITH MEASURABLE OUTCOMES, ALLOW SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES, PROVIDING ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS COMBATING UNMET COMMUNITY NEEDS AND SUPPORT THE ROLE PARTNERS PLAY BY PROVIDING BASIC SERVICES FOR LOW INCOME RESIDENTS. HUNGER IS A CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED IN THE CATCHMENT AREA. AN ESTIMATED NUMBER OF 73 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 73 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WHICH WILL INCLUDE EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PLACEMENT IN YOUTH BUILD CHARTER SCHOOL TO PROVIDE TUTORING.  IN ADDITION RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH EDUCATIONAL FOCUSED AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS PROVING TUTORING IN MATH AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE.  WITHIN THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIORITIES RSVP WILL ENGAGE WITH THE COMMUNITY TO ESTABLISH AN INTERGENERATIONAL MICRO FARM THAT WILL BECOME AN ICONIC ECOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL GATHERING FOR THE COMMUNITY. COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL ADDRESS ISSUES OF OBESITY AND FOOD INSECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $73,382 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,287.

FOR GRANT YEARS 2018-2021, WE WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED FORTY-NINE (49) RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL SERVE THROUGH A NETWORK OF AT LEAST TEN (10) STATIONS, INCLUDING THE CALIFORNIA HIGHWAY PATROL (CHP); MANTECA POLICE DEPARTMENT (S.H.A.R.P.); AND NUMEROUS COMMUNITY AND SENIOR CENTERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS EDUCATION. OUR GOAL IS TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY AND ENCOURAGE SMART MONEY MANAGEMENT, INCREASED FAMILY STABILITY, AND HIGHER EDUCATION WHICH WILL ALL CONTRIBUTE TO DECREASING THE OVERALL CRIME RATE AND INCREASING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OUR COMMUNITY AND SOCIETY. WE WILL ALSO BE IMPLEMENTING PROGRAMS LIKE VITA, OUR VERY OWN FINANCIAL LITERACY & MONEY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, A CUSTOMIZED LIFE SKILLS PROGRAM, TUTORING FOR ALL AGES, AND A READING PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN IN TK-2ND GRADE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE HOPE TO SEE AT LEAST 100 STUDENTS' GRADES IMPROVE THROUGH OUR TUTORING SERVICES; 500 INDIVIDUALS EDUCATED THROUGH OUR SIGNATURE EDUCATION PROGRAMS; AT LEAST 200 FAMILIES SERVICED BY OUR TAX ASSISTANCE VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THE VITA TAX PROGRAM; AND OVERALL LOWER CRIME RATE AND SAFER NEIGHBORHOODS AND HIGHWAYS THROUGHOUT OUR COMMUNITY. 
   THE MAJORITY OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ACTIVELY PARTICIPATING IN TEACHING FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION AND LIFE SKILLS TO MIDDLE SCHOOL AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO HELP PREPARE THEM FOR LIFE AFTER HIGH SCHOOL. THIS INCLUDES, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, TEACHING STUDENTS ABOUT HOW TO MANAGE A BANK ACCOUNT, RECONCILE TRANSACTIONS, MAINTAINING A HOUSEHOLD BUDGET, SAVING FOR AN EMERGENCY, MANAGING CREDIT, AND PURCHASING A VEHICLE. A SMALL PORTION OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO FAMILIES IN FILING TAX RETURNS, ASSISTING THE COMMUNITY ACCOUNTABILITY BOARD WITH AT-RISK YOUTH, AND PARTICIPATING IN CRIME WATCH AND DISASTER-RELATED TRAINING AND SERVICES WITH CHP AND S.H.A.R.P.
   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $48,938 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY MORE THAN 50% OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM SAN JOAQUIN COUNTY.

THE ALEUTIAN PRIBILOF ISLANDS ASSOCIATION, INC. (APIA) HAS DEVELOPED AND SUCCEEDED IN BUILDING AND GROWING THIS RSVP PROGRAM FOR THE ANCHORAGE AND MATANUSKA-SUSITNA BOROUGH DURING THE PREVIOUS THREE YEARS. WITHIN THESE FIRST THREE YEARS, APIA?S NEW RSVP PROGRAM HAS BEEN FOCUSED ON BUILDING A STRONG PROGRAM FROM THE GROUND UP, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS, FOSTERING AND MAINTAINING LONGEVITY WITH RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND LISTENING AND ADAPTING TO THE CHANGING COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE APIA RSVP PROGRAM IS EAGER TO SHAPE THIS PROGRAM WITHIN THE NEXT THREE YEAR CYCLE AND DIVE DEEPER INTO MEETING THE MOST CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS WHILE FOCUSING OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS, STATIONS AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES ACCORDING TO THOSE EXPRESSED COMMUNITY NEEDS. 
THE STATE OF ALASKA HAS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING SENIOR POPULATIONS IN THE NATION. ACCORDING TO THE FY2016 ANNUAL REPORT: ALASKA'S ROADMAP TO SUCCESSFUL AGING, WRITTEN AND PUBLISHED BY THE STATE OF ALASKA COMMISSION ON AGING, THE 65 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER SENIOR COHORT HAS INCREASED BY 61.5% FROM 2004 TO 2014. WITHIN A 6 YEAR PERIOD FROM 2010 TO 2016 THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE OF 30.5% INCREASE IN POPULATION FOR THE SENIORS AGE 60 TO 64. IN ADDITION TO THOSE STAGGERING INCREASES THE 85 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER SENIOR COHORT HAS INCREASED BY 33.3% FROM THE YEARS 2010 TO 2016. ECONOMIC AND POPULATION ANALYSTS' CONTINUE TO PROJECT LARGE INCREASES IN THE SENIOR POPULATION IN THE FUTURE AS THE "BABY BOOMER" GENERATIONS COME OF AGE.
IN ALASKA, THE STATE APPROVED LONG-TERM CARE/ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY, THE PIONEER HOME, HAD A WAITLIST OF 368 APPLICANTS IN 2016. IN ADDITION TO THE LACK OF SENIOR HOUSING OPTIONS, ALASKA HAS ONE OF THE HIGHEST MEDIAN COSTS FOR ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY CARE. CONSIDERING THAT THE AVERAGE MONTHLY SOCIAL SECURITY PAYMENT FOR ALASKA SENIORS AGE 65 AND OLDER WAS ONLY $1,306 IN DECEMBER OF 2016 THIS LEAVES A LARGE GAP OF SENIORS UNABLE TO PAY FOR ASSISTED LIVING HOME CARE. SENIORS THAT FALL WITHIN THIS FINANCIAL GAP RELY ON SENIOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND SUPPORTS TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCY.  APIA WILL BE REDIRECTING EFFORTS INTO SUPPORTING SENIORS BY FOCUSING 76 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND 8 ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS PLACED WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND OTHER FOCUS AREAS, FOR A TOTAL OF 84 RSVP VOLUNTEERS FOR THIS PROJECT. THROUGH THE PARTNERSHIPS WE HAVE ALREADY ESTABLISHED AT 20 DIFFERENT STATIONS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY WE WOULD LIKE TO MATCH RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVICE ASSIGNMENTS THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY (MEASURE H8). WE PLAN TO MEET THIS GOAL THROUGH A HOME VISIT PROGRAM AND THROUGH SEVERAL ESTABLISHED STATIONS WITH OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHICH MAY INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERIES, INFORMATION AND MATERIAL DELIVERIES AND SUPPORTS, COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE WE ANTICIPATE THE OUTCOMES WILL SHOW THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIE/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT (OUTCOME H9). THE LAST SERVICE ASSIGNMENT AND ACTIVITY THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO OUTCOME MEASURES UNDER THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA AND OBESITY AND FOOD OBJECTIVE WILL BE WITH OUR SOUP KITCHEN AND FOOD BANK PARTNERS. OUR RSVP MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND ASSISTING SOUP KITCHENS (MEASURE H16). THIS RECENTLY HAS BECOME A CRITICAL NEED IN OUR COMMUNITY AS FUNDING HAS DECREASED OVER TIME TO KEEP OUR HOMELESS SHELTERS, SOUP KITCHENS AND FOOD BANKS OPEN FOR SERVICE. 
THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY WILL PROMOTE THE FURTHER GROWTH OF A VOLUNTEER PROGRAM ENGAGING OTHER ENTITIES IN THE ANCHORAGE AND MATANUSKA-SUSITNA AREAS WITH ITS PRIMARY PURPOSE TO SERVE ELDERS AND MEET CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES, (CCS) LOCATED IN SUPERIOR, WI, IS A NON-PROFIT SUBSIDIARY OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES BUREAU (CCB) CATHOLIC CHARITIES BUREAU, INC. (CCB) VIA CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE NORTH EAST RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (N.E.RSVP) LOCATED IN RHINELANDER, WI FOR OVER FORTY YEARS. THE RSVP PROGRAM COVERS ONEIDA COUNTY.  CCB & CCS HAVE BEEN SERVING AS A PROGRAM SPONSOR SINCE 1973.  THE MISSION OF CCS IS TO PROTECT FAMILY SAFETY AND SANCTITY AS WELL AS THE SAFETY OF THE WIDER COMMUNITY.  THIS IS A GREAT FIT WITH RSVP'S VISION WHERE VOLUNTEERS USE THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS TO HELP MAKE A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF OTHERS IN NEED.
 N.E. RSVP HAS CHOSEN HEALTHY FUTURES AS ITS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, WITH WORK PLAN OUTCOMES IN AGING IN PLACE AND OUTPUTS IN OBESITY AND FOOD. WORK PLAN OUTCOMES FOR AGING IN PLACE WILL BE DEVELOPED TO INCREASE OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM  TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  WORK PLAN OUTPUTS FOR OBESITY AND FOOD WILL SUPPORT THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS THAT ADDRESS HUNGER THROUGH SERVICE AT THE RHINELANDER AREA FOOD PANTRY.

RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, SHOPPING, AND OTHER NECESSARY EVENTS TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING.  CLIENTS RECEIVING THESE SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AS WELL AS PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

WESTERN DAIRYLAND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC. (WD, THE AGENCY) LOCATED IN
INDEPENDENCE, WI, IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT FOR THE WESTERN DAIRYLAND RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). WDEOC WAS ESTABLISHED JUNE 6, 1966 TO HELP DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS IN BUFFALO, EAU CLAIRE, JACKSON, AND TREMPEALEAU COUNTIES, LOCATED IN WEST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN, BECOME SELF-RELIANT. THE AGENCY'S MISSION IS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY RELATED CONDITIONS AND PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES WHICH ENABLE PEOPLE TO ADVANCE ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY. RSVP HAS BEEN OPERATING SINCE 1973. A TOTAL OF 350 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE UNDER THE PROGRAM. RSVP WORKS BY EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 OR OLDER TO PERFORM ACTS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE THAT MAKE WESTERN WISCONSIN A BETTER PLACE FOR EVERYONE. AS A RESULT OF THEIR SERVICE, SENIORS GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING HOW THEIR EFFORTS CONTRIBUTE TO THE GREATER GOOD OF THE COMMUNITY. 
THE AGENCY WORKS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL. WD PROGRAMS ARE DEVELOPED IN RESPONSE TO IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS AND ADVOCATE FOR THE INTERESTS OF THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH WORK PLAN OBJECTIVES IN THE AREAS OF OBESITY AND FOOD, AND AGING IN PLACE SERVICES WHICH INCLUDES ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER TRANSPORTATION, IN HOME SERVICES, AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION. THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF DOUGLAS, SARPY, CASS, DODGE AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IS SPONSORED BY EASTERN NEBRASKA OFFICE ON AGING (ENOA) WHICH WAS OFFICIALLY INCORPORATED JULY, 1974. ENOA SPONSORS THREE SENIOR CORPS. PROGRAMS INCLUDING RSVP, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) AND FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) WHICH ALL UTILIZE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS INTEGRAL PARTS OF THEIR OPERATION. HUNDREDS OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES ARE AVAILABLE TO SENIORS. ENOA'S MISSION IS TO HELP OLDER NEBRASKANS LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND REMAIN FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN THEIR OWN HOMES. IT ASSESS THE NEEDS OF OLDER INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO MEET THOSE NEEDS, BY CREATING UNIQUE PROGRAMS THAT FILL GAPS IN SERVICE. CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF FORT WAYNE-SOUTH BEND, INC. IS A STATE LICENSED, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE RANGE OF SERVICES TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS SINCE 1922. THE MISSION STATEMENT OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS AS FOLLOWS: "CATHOLIC CHARITIES SERVES THOSE IN NEED AS CHRIST WOULD HAVE US DO." THE AGENCY IS A MEMBER OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES USA AND THE CATHOLIC LEGAL IMMIGRATION NETWORK (CLINIC). ADDITIONALLY, THE AGENCY IS RECOGNIZED BY THE BOARD OF IMMIGRATION APPEALS, FULFILLS THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU, AND COMPLIES WITH UNITED WAY STANDARDS.

FULTON COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING (FCCOA) WAS ESTABLISHED AS A NON-PROFIT IN 1974 IN ROCHESTER, INDIANA.  THEY, IN TURN,  SPONSOR RSVP OF FULTON COUNTY.  BOTH FCCOA AND RSVP OF FULTON COUNTY ARE BASED AT THE COMMUNITY CENTER IN ROCHESTER.  WE WORK TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS & SERVICES THAT SUPPORT OUR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, BOTH YOUNG AND OLD, SO THAT LONGER INDEPENDENT LIVING IS ACHIEVED, AND THE LIVES OF THOSE IN OUR COMMUNITY WHO ARE DISABLED OR LIVING AT OR BELOW POVERTY-LEVEL CONDITIONS ARE ENRICHED.  AS AN EVER-GROWING COMMUNITY CENTER, WE STRIVE TO CONTINUALLY ADD MORE ACTIVITIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR EXPANDING & AGING COMMUNITY.  RSVP'S GOAL IS TO MATCH INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN NEED OF HELP WITH VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE TALENTS AND SKILLS AND A DESIRE TO ASSIST THOSE IN OUR COMMUNITY. 


WE CURRENTLY HAVE 238 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE OUR COMMUNITY THIS YEAR.  SOME OF THEIR PLANNED ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING FREE TAX PREPARATION SERVICES FOR ELDERLY AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, PROVIDING A NEW HOME FOR A LOW-INCOME FAMILY, PROVIDING LOW-COST OR FREE HEALTH CARE INFORMATION AND SERVICES TO ELIGIBLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF FOOD PLUS FUNDS FOR RENT, UTILITIES, & MEDICINE TO ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS, HELPING WITH INTAKE OF 5+ TONS OF RECYCLABLE MATERIALS IN THE COMMUNITY, AND BRINGING LOCAL HISTORY TO LIFE FOR SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN BY ACTING AS DOCENTS FOR THE ANNUAL TRAIL OF COURAGE FESTIVAL EACH SEPTEMBER.  

OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  OUR MAIN GOAL OF INCREASING ACCESS TO FOOD FOR ADULTS AND CHILDREN WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH VOLUNTEERS WORKING WITH STATIONS SUCH AS COUNTY FOOD PANTRIES AND WOODLAWN HOSPITAL MEALS ON WHEELS.  VOLUNTEERS ALSO ASSIST WITH ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY ISSUES BY PROVIDING FOOD THROUGH MATTHEW'S MARKET, UNITED MINISTRIES CHRISTMAS BASKETS, AND FREE MEAL @ GRACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: A INCREASE IN THE SATISFACTION OF SENIOR CITIZENS WHO CAN STAY IN THEIR HOMES LONGER TO ENJOY INDEPENDENT LIVING DUE TO ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD, AN INCREASE IN THE SATISFACTION OF FOOD PANTRY RECIPIENTS WHO HAVE FAMILIES/CHILDREN AT HOME AND ARE ABLE TO PROVIDE FOOD FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR FAMILIES, AND STRONGER SOCIAL TIES FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN NEED DUE TO INTERACTION WITH RSVP VOLUNTEERS.

AN ESTIMATED 137 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 112 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PREPARING FEDERAL AND INDIANA INCOME TAXES FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME FAMILIES; PROVIDING FOOD RESOURCES TO LOW INCOME FAMILIES; ASSIST VETERANS, INCLUDING HOMELESS VETERANS AT ALLEN COUNTY MILITARY STAND DOWN, AND SECOND CHANCE LEGAL ASSISTANCE IN GAINING EXPUNGEMENT OF CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORDS, AND RETURN OF INDIANA DRIVERS LICENSES; PROVIDE RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS OF DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED ADULTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 112,429 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,361 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (ICAP), INC., IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE "HELP FOR TODAY AND HOPE FOR TOMORROW". WE CARE ABOUT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY AND WE ARE DEDICATED TO HELP PEOPLE FROM ALL DIVERSITIES TO HELP THEMSELVES AND EACH OTHER. ESTABLISHED IN 1965, UNDER THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT, AS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, ICAP WILL DESIGN, SPONSOR AND ADMINISTER PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE HELP TO SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS THAT THEY MAY BECOME RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS. ICAP SERVES THE COUNTIES OF DELAWARE, FAYETTE, GRANT, HANCOCK, HENRY, MADISON, RUSH AND WAYNE LOCATED IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA. THROUGH GRANT PROGRAMS SUCH AS RSVP, THE AGENCY PROVIDES SUPPORT AND RESOURCES TO THE MANY COMMUNITIES IN NEED. AS A RSVP GRANT APPLICANT, ICAP PROPOSES A TOTAL NUMBER OF 106 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AND RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS $40,000 IN FUNDS FOR THE GRANT PERIOD OF APRIL 2018 TO MARCH 2021. ICAP PROPOSES RSVP PROJECTS IN THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OF HEALTHY FUTURES, WHICH WILL INCLUDE WORK PLANS FOR FOOD DISTRIBUTION, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE CARE AND ACCESS TO CARE. THROUGH THESE SERVICES, THE OUTCOME BASED MEASURES WILL SHOW THAT THE WORK OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTED TO INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR 24 HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS AND INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR 10 HOMEBOUND CLIENTS. RESPITE CARE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED FOR 6 CARETAKERS TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CARE. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ADDRESSED BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE PEOPLE OF DELAWARE, GRANT, HANCOCK, HENRY, MADISON, RUSH AND WAYNE COUNTIES OF EAST CENTRAL SUPPORT AND VALUE THE SERVICES OF VOLUNTEERS.

AN ESTIMATED 700 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN CLARK, FLOYD, HARRISON, JEFFERSON AND SCOTT COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA, DURING THE FISCAL YEAR 4/1/2018 - 3/31/2019.  OF THIS NUMBER, 105 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  AMONG OTHER THINGS, THEY WILL OFFER COMPANIONSHIP TO AND TRANSPORT HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND VETERANS; WORK IN FOOD PANTRIES AND SOUP KITCHENS; USE A SKIT TO TEACH FIRST GRADERS (AND THEREFORE THEIR FAMILIES) HOW TO WASH THEIR HANDS PROPERLY AND WHY AND WHEN THEY SHOULD DO THAT; TUTOR AT-RISK CHILDREN; BUILD WHEELCHAIR RAMPS FOR SENIORS AND THE DISABLED.  THESE AND OTHER SERVICES WILL BE PERFORMED THROUGH A NETWORK OF OVER 100 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS OUR AREA AGENCY ON AGING, 7 FOOD PANTRIES, SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, HOSPITALS AND A VARIETY OF PRIVATE NON-PROFITS.  

OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH 3 OUTCOME BASED WORKPLANS FOR AGING IN PLACE AND 1 FOR OBESITY AND FOOD.  AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, 130 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT THROUGH DIAL A CARE, RAMPS TO FREEDOM OR RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION; 1,000 SENIORS WILL HAVE SAVED $200,000 BY HAVING THEIR TAX RETURNS PREPARED FREE; AND 35 THIRD GRADERS WILL MAINTAIN AT LEAST A C IN LANGUAGE ARTS.  IN ADDITION, 1000 FIRST GRADERS WILL HAVE LEARNED ABOUT PROPER HAND-WASHING, AND THOUSANDS OF FOOD INSECURE FOLKS WILL BE SERVED THROUGH FOOD PANTRIES AND SOUP KITCHENS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $76,710 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A LOCAL INVESTMENT OF $53,259 FOR A TOTAL BUDGET OF $129,969.

LINCOLN HILLS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (LHDC) HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION OF THE CRAWFORD, PERRY, AND SPENCER COUNTIES RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 1977 AND THOUSANDS OF LOYAL AND DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS HAVE CONTRIBUTED GREATLY TO IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SOUTHERN INDIANA DURING THAT TIME.
LHDC WAS INCORPORATED AS A PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IN 1965, AND SERVES PRIMARILY CRAWFORD, PERRY, AND SPENCER COUNTIES IN SOUTHERN INDIANA. THE AGENCY IS GOVERNED BY AN 18 MEMBER VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND IS LED BY A TALENTED, DYNAMIC SENIOR EXECUTIVE TEAM. IT IS THE PHILOSOPHY OF THE BOARD AND STAFF THAT IMPROVING THE LIFE OF ONE PERSON DOES, IN FACT, IMPROVE THE LIVES OF ALL PEOPLE, AND THAT PHILOSOPHY IS CARRIED OUT DAILY AS THE BOARD AND STAFF STRIVES TO MEET THE AGENCY VISION:
"WE BELIEVE IN A SOCIETY WHERE ALL PERSONS HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE ADEQUATELY FED, HOUSED, EDUCATED, EMPLOYED AND IN GOOD HEALTH. WE BELIEVE THAT ALL PEOPLE SHOULD HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES IN AN ENVIRONMENT OF ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL JUSTICE WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, SEX, COLOR, RELIGION, AGE, ANCESTRY, NATIONAL ORIGIN, VETERAN STATUS, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, OR DISABILITY."
THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF LHDC ARE TO PROVIDE THE FACILITIES, PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND ACTIVITIES IN SOUTHERN INDIANA THAT ENABLE AND EMPOWER SOME OF SOCIETY'S MOST VULNERABLE AND DISADVANTAGED CITIZENS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES. SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE: HEAD START AND EARLY HEAD START PRESCHOOL SERVICES, HEALTHY FAMILIES HOME VISITING SERVICES, ENERGY ASSISTANCE, HOUSING REHABILITATION, WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE, HOUSING COUNSELING, RENTAL ASSISTANCE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING APARTMENTS AND RENTAL ASSISTANCE, COMMUNITY SERVICES, CASE MANAGEMENT, HEALTH INSURANCE NAVIGATION, AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.
A MINIMUM OF 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH LHDC'S SPONSORSHIP OF THE PROGRAM. HOWEVER, HISTORICALLY LHDC HAS MAINTAINED AN ACTIVE ROSTER OF 180 ACTIVE AND DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTING OVER 15,000 HOURS OF SERVICE ANNUALLY SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS WHO REQUIRE ASSISTANCE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, SERVING AND MENTORING CHILDREN OF ALL AGES, BACKGROUNDS, AND ECONOMIC STATUS, AND A MULTITUDE OF VITAL SERVICES. VITAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEER PARTICIPANTS WILL CONTINUE AND WILL FOCUS ON THE VARIOUS FOCUS AREAS OF THE CORPORATION AS DESCRIBED IN LHDC'S WORK PLANS. LHDC'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND IS DESCRIBED AT LENGTH IN LHDC'S WORK PLANS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $45,401 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $19,458 OF LOCAL IN KIND SUPPORT.

TRI-CAP RSVP WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 195 VOLUNTEERS SERVING DURING THE GRANT PERIOD OF 4/1/18 THROUGH 3/31/21.  SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, CARING FOR INFANTS UNDER OTHER EDUCATION SERVICE, AT RISK ECOSYSTEM RECYCLING AND REUSING PROJECTS UNDER ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
   HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AND THE GRANT WILL ASSIST WITH MEETING HEALTH NEEDS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF DUBOIS, PIKE, AND WARRICK COUNTIES, INDIANA TO INCLUDE ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, AND OBESITY AND FOOD.  TO ACHIEVE PERFORMANCE GOALS IN YEARS 1 AND 2, AT LEAST 33 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, AND IN YEAR 3, AT LEAST 42 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SUPPORT THE ABILITY OF HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, HAVE FEWER POOR MENTAL HEALTH DAYS, AND ASSIST INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESS TO EMERGENCY FOOD RESOURCES. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL MIRROR THE CORE PRINCIPLES IDENTIFIED BY CNCS WHICH ARE TO IDENTIFY AND INVEST IN COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS; ENGAGE AMERICANS IN SERVICE; SUPPORT COMMUNITY EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS AND LEVERAGE PUBLIC-PRIVATE COLLABORATIONS.
   IN YEAR THREE OF THE GRANT CYCLE, AN ESTIMATED 150 HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND 200 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS IN THIS THREE COUNTY SERVICE AREA WILL RECEIVE SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND EXPERIENCE INCREASED HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $41,674.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,416.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES THAT WILL ACCOUNT FOR A 39% MATCH.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
UNITED WAY OF PORTER COUNTY IS A NONPROFIT 501(C)3 CORPORATION THAT MANAGES THE UNITED WAY RSVP NWINDIANA GRANT TO SERVE OUR REGION. UNITED WAY OF PORTER COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO LEAD, UNITE AND INSPIRE OUR COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE LIVES. WE ARE PROPOSING TO PLACE (400) RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN LAKE, LAPORTE, PORTER AND STARKE COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST INDIANA. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE, FOCUSING SPECIFICALLY ON FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION. WE ANTICIPATE 4,500 MEALS DELIVERED TO OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, 1,000 OLDER ADULTS WILL INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL TIES IN THE COMMUNITY AND 1000 VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE AT-NEED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. 
WE WILL ALSO PLACE VOLUNTEERS IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY SERVICES AT OUR RSVP STATIONS (AS WELL AS CNCS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS) TO ASSIST NON-PROFITS WITH THEIR SERVICES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS TO ADDRESS UNMET LOCAL AND STATE NEEDS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE FINANCIAL, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE LIVES OF NORTHWEST INDIANA RESIDENTS BY THE END OF OUR 3-YEAR GRANT CYCLE.

OUR PARTICIPANTS CITE SATISFACTION OF SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY AND WE WORK TO MAKE SURE THEY ARE FULFILLED AND SATISFIED, AS ARE THEIR SITES. LAKE, LAPORTE, PORTER, AND STARKE COUNTIES MAKE UP OUR SERVICE AREA. WE ARE HOME TO 777,825 INDIVIDUALS AND HAVE MORE THAN 32 SCHOOL DISTRICTS WITHIN THIS SERVICE AREA.  ONE IN EIGHT HOOSIERS ARE LOCATED HERE AND IT IS COMMON FOR WORKING FAMILIES TO TRAVEL NEARLY 26 MILES EACH WAY TO GET TO WORK, WE ARE A VERY TRANSITORY REGION, AND YET WE HAVE NO CENTRAL LINES FOR TRAIN OR BUS TO TRAVEL WITHIN. WE HAVE A CULTURALLY DIVERSE POPULATION WHEREBY 38% ARE MINORITY POPULATION.

THE LEGAL AGENCY NAME IS WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, ESTABLISHED THROUGH THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 1964.  WICAA SPONSORS A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND IS FUNDED THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL SOURCES.  THE GOVERNING BOARD IS COMPRISED OF VOLUNTEER REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND LOW-INCOME SECTORS OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.  OUR AGENCY'S MISSION IS, TO PLAN, IMPLEMENT, OR CAUSE TO BE IMPLEMENTED, COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES TO THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, THE ELDERLY, AND THE PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY CHALLENGED.  WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. WILL ADVOCATE FOR AND STRIVE TO ALLEVIATE CONDITIONS OF POVERTY, IMPROVE LIVING CONDITIONS, AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND SOCIAL SERVICES TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN NEED WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA.  ALL OUR ENDEAVORS PURSUED WITH THE CLIENT IN MIND, NEVER FORGETTING THE VALUE OF EVERY HUMAN BEING OR THE IMPORTANCE OF OUR RESPONSIBILITY TO THE PUBLIC WE SERVE.  
THE WICAA RSVP PROPOSES TO SUPPORT 95 RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO ONE OF THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: ALLEVIATE FOOD INSECURITY, PROVIDE SERVICE TO VETERAN'S THROUGH A NETWORK OF VETERANS ORGANIZATIONS AND THE REDUCTION OF WASTE AT AN ALUMINUM RECYCLING CENTER.  OUR MAJOR PROJECTS ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, AS EXPANDED UPON IN THE WORK PLANS ARE TO HELP INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD BY REDUCING FOOD INSECURITY AND RESPONDING TO FOOD EMERGENCIES; PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR VETERANS TO APPOINTMENTS, JOB SEARCHING, TRAININGS AND BE VALUABLE RESOURCE GUIDES.  THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $27,246 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $11,683 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
BY SUCCESSFULLY AWARDING THIS APPLICATION, THE CENTER FOR YOUTH AND FAMILY SOLUTIONS (CYFS), WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR THOSE OVER THE AGE OF 55 WITHIN PEORIA AND TAZEWELL COUNTIES. AS WELL AS PROVIDING CRITICAL SERVICES TO TARGET UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS AND INITIATIVES; INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL AND PHYSICAL DISABILITIES, VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES, AND SENIORS EXPERIENCING ISOLATION AND FOOD INSECURITY. IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK TO BETTER COMMUNITIES THROUGH DEVELOPING AND PARTICIPATING IN ENVIRONMENTAL BETTERMENT THROUGH RECYCLING AND LITTER ABATEMENT.

IF AWARDED, CYFS ANTICIPATES HAVING A MINIMUM OF 58 VOLUNTEER PARTICIPANTS PROVIDING SERVICES THROUGH THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES/ACCESS TO CARE, HEALTHY FUTURES/OBESITY AND FOOD, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, AND AT RICK ECOSYSTEMS. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL CERTAINLY MAKE A SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCE IN NOT ONLY THEIR OWN LIVES BUT THE LIVES OF OTHER INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THE COMMUNITIES THAT WE SERVE.  WITH THE FOUR RELATED WORK PLANS SPECIFIC TO THESE FOCUS AREAS, WE EXPECT TO SHOW TANGIBLE AND DEFINABLE OUTCOMES RELATED TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED.  


WE WILL BE CONTINUALLY BUILDING CAPACITY, BY ACTIVELY RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS THROUGH MULTIPLE COMMUNITY OUTREACH STRATEGIES AS WELL AS ENGAGING NEW SENIOR VOLUNTEERS THROUGH EXISTING RSVP VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE HAD A POSITIVE EXPERIENCE. TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS WE HAVE EMPHASIZED SPECIFIC PLANS FOR RECRUITMENT, TRAINING AND RETENTION.  FUNDING FOR THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE  FROM THE FEDERAL GRANT AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED  FROM DEPARTMENT ON AGING FUNDS SET ASIDE SPECIFICALLY FOR THE RSVP GRANT MATCH AND/OR MATCH FROM THE SPONSORING AGENCY. ADDITIONALLY, THERE WILL BE IN KIND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AND OTHER DONATIONS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT.

OUR AGENCY'S VOLUNTEER PROGRAM CURRENTLY COORDINATES THE RECRUITMENT, ORIENTATION, TRAINING, RETENTION, QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND RISK MANAGEMENT OVER 250 VOLUNTEERS ANNUALLY. THE CENTER FOR YOUTH AND FAMILY SOLUTIONS HAS AN ESTABLISHED PRESENCE SERVING BOTH TAZEWELL AND PEORIA COUNTIES IN SENIOR SERVICES, SERVICES THAT BETTER COMMUNITIES, AND SERVICES THAT ARE RESPONSIVE TO COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE STORY CITY SENIOR CITIZENS (SCSC), INC. IS THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE STORY CITY SENIOR CENTER (MANAGING ACTIVITIES AND FACILITIES) AND THE SPONSOR FOR CENTRAL IOWA RSVP.  SCSC, INC. BEGAN AS AN RSVP GRANTEE IN 1973, SERVING STORY COUNTY AND EXPANDING TO SERVE MARSHALL COUNTY IN 2003.  MORE RECENTLY (2012), SCSC, INC. APPROVED THE EXPANSION OF CENTRAL IOWA RSVP TO ALSO INCLUDE HAMILTON AND WEBSTER COUNTIES, EACH REPRESENTING  TWO FORMER PROJECTS THAT RELINQUISHED THEIR RSVP GRANTS IN 2011. STORY CITY SENIOR CITIZENS, INC. WAS ALSO AWARDED STATE FUNDING IN JULY, 2012 TO RESTORE SERVICES TO THIS GEOGRAPHIC AREA. THIS SUMMARY OUTLINES PLANS FOR CONTINUED SERVICE AND SPONSORSHIP OF CENTRAL IOWA RSVP.   

AN ESTIMATED 780 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN A VARIETY OF ASSIGNMENTS IN THESE FOUR COUNTIES. CIRSVP IS BROAD IN ITS SCOPE OF SERVICES BUT WILL CONTINUE EDUCATION AS ITS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA BEGINNING IN JULY, 2018.  ALTHOUGH CIRSVP HAS TWO SIGNATURE PROGRAMS THAT WILL CONTINUE TO ENGAGE RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN MEETING NEEDS IN THE AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES:  1. VOLUNTEER DRIVER TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (ENGAGING 50 RSVP VOLUNTEER DRIVERS PROVIDING RESIDENTS WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES); 2. BASE SENIOR FITNESS PROGRAM (BONE BUILDERS MODEL OFFERING AREA SENIOR CITIZENS AN OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE THEIR PHYSICAL AND MENTAL WELL-BEING THROUGH LOW-IMPACT FITNESS INSTRUCTION BY TRAINED RSVP VOLUNTEERS), AND ONE IN DISASTER SERVICES (VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT FOR DISASTER, PUBLIC SAFETY AND PUBLIC HEALTH), THE LARGEST NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE IN ASSIGNMENTS THAT ADDRESS SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. THROUGH A VARIETY OF PRE-SCHOOL/SCHOOL-BASED AND SUMMER ENRICHMENT ASSIGNMENTS INCLUDING: ELEMENTARY READING MENTORS, HEAD START, LITERACY PARTNERS WRITING PROJECT, AND SPEAK UP! (PUBLIC SPEAKING COURSE), WE ANTICIPATE ENGAGING 397 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN ASSISTING 892 STUDENTS/CHILDREN (YEAR 3) WITH INCREASING ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT. 
     
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $164,998 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED $164,274 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND $3,449 FROM EXCESS RESOURCES ANNUALLY.

"INSPIRED TO SERVE". NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP (RSVP) HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY IOWA LAKES COMMUNITY COLLEGE (ILCC) IN ESTHERVILLE, IOWA, SINCE 1977. NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP SERVES CLAY, DICKINSON, EMMET, KOSSUTH, AND PALO ALTO COUNTIES, ALIGNING WITH ILCC BY MAINTAINING AN RSVP OFFICE ON EACH OF THE FIVE COLLEGE CAMPUSES. IOWA LAKES COMMUNITY COLLEGE COLLABORATES WITH BUSINESS, INDUSTRY, HEALTHCARE FACILITIES, SCHOOL DISTRICTS, AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES TO DELIVER COLLEGE CREDIT AND NON-CREDIT COURSES.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AREA RESIDENTS SERVED BY RSVP INCLUDE THOSE WHO ARE ELDERLY, VETERANS, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL, MENTAL OR EMOTIONAL DISABILITIES. OF THE ESTIMATED 300 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING THE NORTHWEST IOWA RSVP PROGRAM, 135 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE (NPM) OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. 65 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN HEALTHY FUTURES AREAS OF MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT. AN ADDITIONAL 70 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN EDUCATION WORK PLANS INCLUDING MENTORS/TUTORS AND PEN PALS WITH ELEMENTARY STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE FIVE-COUNTY REGION. THE REMAINING 165 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED WITH OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WHICH WILL REFLECT GARNERING DONATIONS (THRIFT STORES FOR HANDICAPPED AND/OR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS), DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION (SHIIP COUNSELORS), EDUCATING (NUTRITION INFORMATION FOR OBESITY AND FOOD), SUPPORTING BLOOD DRIVES (AMERICAN RED CROSS AND LIFESERVE BLOOD CENTERS OF IOWA), AND ADULT BASIC EDUCATION AND LITERACY PROGRAM FOR ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS. RSVP STAFF WILL USE MEASUREMENT TOOLS AND SURVEYS TO BEST MEASURE AND REFLECT THE PROJECT OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $85,408 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,226 FROM NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES INCLUDING FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM IOWA LAKES COMMUNITY COLLEGE, ELDERBRIDGE AGENCY ON AGING, THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, VOLUNTEER IOWA (IOWA COMMISSION ON VOLUNTEER SERVICE), UNITED WAY, COUNTY BOARDS OF SUPERVISORS, CITY COUNCILS, AND COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION GRANTS. THROUGH THE SKILLS, EXPERIENCE, AND COMMITMENT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS COMBINED WITH THE SUPPORT OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES, RSVP WILL CONTINUE "TO ENGAGE 55+ VOLUNTEERS IN MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY SERVICE" TO POSITIVELY IMPACT AND IMPROVE THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS, FROM YOUTH TO SENIORS, LIVING IN THE RURAL SERVICE AREA.

ESTABLISHED IN 1973, CLINTON COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (CCRSVP), CHALLENGES INDIVIDUALS 55 AND OLDER TO UTILIZE THEIR ENERGY, SKILLS, AND EXPERTISE RESPONDING TO THE ESSENTIAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE. GIVEN THE POVERTY RATE OF 14.2% THE COMMUNITY DEPENDS ON VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT THE NECESSARY RESOURCES TO MEET THE HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE. CCRSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOCUSING ON THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, ELDERLY, AND DISABLED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE SERVING IN HEALTHY FUTURES; FOCUSING ON THE OBJECTIVES OF AGING IN PLACE, ACCESS TO CARE, AND OBESITY AND FOOD. CCRSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE IN THE AREAS OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, AND OTHER FOCUS AREAS. TARGETED POPULATIONS INCLUDE THE HOME-BOUND, DISABLED, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, OLDER ADULTS (INDIVIDUALS 65 AND OLDER), AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS. AN ESTIMATED TOTAL OF 185 CCRSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. 

IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES, A TOTAL OF EIGHTY-FIVE (85) UNDUPLICATED CCRSVP VOLUNTEERS AND A TOTAL OF NINETY (90) WILL SERVE IN THE (H8) AREA TRANSPORTING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS; TIED TO AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME TO SUPPORT THE ABILITY OF INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS, VETERANS, OR HAVE A DISABILITY.  ANOTHER SIX (6) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE (H2) AREA DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE, HEALTH CARE ACCESS AND HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS; TO SUPPORT ACCESS TO CARE. RSVP 55+ VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF BOONE AND GREENE COUNTIES CHALLENGES PEOPLE AGE 55 AND OLDER TO USE THEIR ENERGY, SKILL, INNOVATIVE SPIRIT AND EXPERIENCE TO RESPOND TO COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM. ACTIVITIES AS OUTLINED IN WORK PLANS INCLUDE ADULT CAREGIVER RESPITE, IN-HOME VISITATION, GROCERY SHOPPING, FOOD SECURITY SERVICES AND EDUCATION, AND HEALTH EDUCATION. -STRENGTHEN AND IMPROVE OPERATING CAPACITY AT 15 OF OUR 28 RSVP STATIONS BY PROVIDING SERVICES SUCH AS CLERICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES, COMMUNICATION ASSISTANCE, HOSPICE SUPPORT, EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT, AND BLOOD COLLECTION AND DISTRIBUTION.
