IN JULY 2016, THE FORT MADISON AREA UNITED WAY AND THE BIG RIVER UNITED WAY MERGED UNDER NEW LEADERSHIP AND RE- NAMED THE UNITED WAY OF THE GREAT RIVER REGION.   RECOGNIZING THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RSVP PROGRAM, IT HAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ALL OF LEE COUNTY IOWA.  RSVP HAS BEEN A PART OF THE LEE COUNTY COMMUNITY FOR OVER TWENTY FIVE YEARS. THE RSVP PROGRAM IS VERY WELL RESPECTED AND LOOKED UPON WITH HIGH REGARD BY LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, BUSINESSES, AND INDIVIDUALS. LEE COUNTY IS AN AREA THAT NEEDS TO USE EVERY POSSIBLE RESOURCE AVAILABLE AND RELIES HEAVILY ON SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO ACHIEVE COMMUNITY GOALS WHILE OPERATING ON TIGHT BUDGETS.  LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF THE RSVP PROGRAM IN THE COMMUNITY.
UNITED WAY/RSVP COMMUNITY PARTNERS WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON A WIDE VARIETY OF CRITERIA, INCLUDING EFFECTIVENESS OF CURRENT PROGRAMS, THE IMPACT PROGRAMS HAVE ON THE COMMUNITY, AND THE ORGANIZATIONS WILLINGNESS TO WORK WITH RSVP TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL AND REWARDING EXPERIENCES FOR THE VOLUNTEERS.    THE RSVP PROGRAM CURRENTLY COLLABORATES WITH SEVENTEEN FUNDED PARTNER AGENCIES TO IMPLEMENT AND DEVELOP COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS THAT ARE BENEFICIAL TO THE ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS RSVP AND ITS VOLUNTEERS. THERE IS A DEMONSTRATED NEED FOR IMPROVING THE READING AND FINANCIAL LITERACY AND IMPROVE THE OVER HEALTH IN OUR PRIMARY REGION. AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO HELP MEET THESE NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY.  OF THIS NUMBER, AN ESTIMATED 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. AN IN SCHOOL READING AND TUTORING PROGRAM FOR 2ND AND 3RD GRADE STUDENTS WILL CONTINUE  ONSITE AT ALL THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN LEE COUNTY, IOWA FOR SCHOOL YEAR 2019-2020. THE GOAL IN 2ND AND 3RD GRADE IS TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE THE FORMATIVE ASSESSMENT SYSTEM FOR TEACHERS (FAST) SCORES. THE RSVP VOLUNTEER WOULD THEN FOLLOW THE STUDENTS' PROGRESS AND CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE STUDENT FOR 1 -2X PER WEEK.

AS THE INCUMBENT RSVP SPONSOR FOR ALLEGHENY AND BEAVER COUNTIES, PITTSBURGH CARES SEEKS FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $206,375.00 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE IN SUPPORT OF THE CONTINUATION AND EXPANSION OF THE ROBUST RSVP PROJECT IN ALLEGHENY AND BEAVER COUNTIES, PENNSYLVANIA, WHICH INCLUDES THE CITY OF PITTSBURGH. THE MISSION OF PITTSBURGH CARES IS TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF OUR REGIONAL NONPROFIT PARTNERS BY MOBILIZING VOLUNTEERS AND ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY. AS THE PRIMARY VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION CENTER IN ALLEGHENY COUNTY AND THE GREATER PITTSBURGH REGION (INCLUDING BEAVER COUNTY), WE SERVE MORE THAN 13,000 VOLUNTEERS PER YEAR. AS A LEADER IN VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT, PITTSBURGH CARES CONNECTS ALL SECTORS IN THE GREATER PITTSBURGH REGION -- INDIVIDUALS, BUSINESSES, NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOLS, AND GOVERNMENTS -- TO MEET THE MOST CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM AND CAPACITY BUILDING.

RSVP, AS SPONSORED BY PITTSBURGH CARES, WILL PLACE A MINIMUM OF 206 SENIORS IN MORE THAN 50 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING ACADEMICALLY AT-RISK YOUTH, IMPROVING LITERACY SKILLS, AND REDUCING SUMMER LEARNING LOSS THROUGH TUTORING AND ACADEMIC REMEDIATION SERVICES. WHILE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE BY ASSISTING WITH ENVIRONMENTAL AND NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION PROJECTS, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST IN MAINTAINING THE SAFETY AND WELLBEING OF HOMEBOUND SENIOR CITIZENS. 

ADDITIONALLY VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT AGENCIES SERVING THE MOST ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS OF ALLEGHENY AND BEAVER COUNTIES. LASTLY, THROUGH PITTSBURGH CARES VAST NETWORK OF OVER 300 NONPROFIT PARTNERS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO SELECT SERVICE SITES THAT SIMULTANEOUSLY SUPPORT THE IDENTIFIED FOCUS AREA (EDUCATION), WHILE ALSO MEETING THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF THE VOLUNTEER. AT PITTSBURGH CARES WE PRIDE OURSELVES IN CUSTOMIZING THE VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL, TAKING INTO ACCOUNT SCHEDULING, GEOGRAPHIC, AND SPECIFIC AGENCY PREFERENCES AND REQUESTS.

SHARECARE FAITH IN ACTION, A NON-SECTARIAN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE COMPASSIONATE AND PRACTICAL SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY AND THOSE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IS PROPOSING TO CONTINUE AS THE PROVIDER OF RSVP SERVICES IN LEHIGH, NORTHAMPTON AND CARBON COUNTIES IN PENNSYLVANIA.  
AN ESTIMATED 420 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH A NETWORK OF STATIONS (NON-PROFIT AGENCIES OR PROPRIETARY HEALTH FACILITIES) WHICH WILL OFFER A BROAD BASE OF SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS 55 AND OLDER. 

OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 147 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL BE SERVICES THAT HELP KEEP SENIORS LIVING SAFELY IN THE HOME OF THEIR CHOICE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY VOLUNTEERS WILL INCLUDE: SUPPORTING HOME-DELIVERED MEALS PROGRAMS, TRANSPORTATION, GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER IN-HOME SUPPORTS. 

OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE. WE WILL FOCUS OUR EFFORTS TO PLACE 147 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY BY HELPING THEM WITH ACCESS TO HOME-DELIVERED FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES.

ADDITIONALLY, SINCE OUR UNITED WAY INVESTS IN STRATEGIES THAT ALIGN TO KEY PARTNERSHIPS AND COALITIONS WORKING TO ADVANCE CRITICAL OUTCOMES, THERE ARE OPPORTUNITIES AND NEEDS FOR VOLUNTEERS IN MEETING TWO OTHER BOLD GOALS - TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE WHO ARE FOOD INSECURE BY 50% AND TO HAVE ALL THIRD GRADERS READING ON GRADE-LEVEL.  RSVP, AS A KEY PARTNER, WILL ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN ACTIVITIES THAT HELP OUR REGION ACHIEVE THOSE GOALS. RSVP WILL PLACE VOLUNTEERS IN LOCAL PROGRAMS SUCH AS EMERGENCY AND CHOICE FOOD PANTRIES THAT HELP ALLEVIATE FOOD INSECURITY AND ALSO PLACE VOLUNTEERS IN COMMUNITY SCHOOLS IN THE ALLENTOWN, BETHLEHEM AND EASTON SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO WORK WITH AT RISK ELEMENTARY STUDENTS NEEDING MENTORING/TUTORING AND HOMEWORK HELP TO IMPROVE MATH AND/OR READING SKILLS AND SCHOOL ATTENDANCE.
RSVP OF LEHIGH, NORTHAMPTON AND CARBON COUNTIES WILL BE OPEN TO ALL PEOPLE AGE 55 AND OVER IN OUR SERVICE AREA. RSVP WILL CONTINUE TO MOBILIZE PEOPLE AGE 55 AND OLDER TO SERVE IN A DIVERSE RANGE OF VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT HELP MEET LOCAL COMMUNITY NEEDS WHICH INCLUDE: COUNSELLING CONSUMERS ABOUT HEALTH INSURANCE AND OTHER BENEFITS; PROVIDING SERVICES AND SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO VETERANS, MILITARY AND THEIR FAMILIES; ASSISTING AREA NON-PROFITS THAT NEED HELP LEVERAGING RESOURCES TO KEEP PACE WITH INCREASED DEMANDS FOR SERVICES.

THE 147 RSVP MEMBERS SERVING AS VOLUNTEERS IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE -  BY PROVIDING SERVICES SUCH AS TRANSPORTATION, MEAL DELIVERY, GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE, AND OTHER IN-HOME SUPPORTS - WILL HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF SENIOR CITIZENS WHO WANT TO AND CAN REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES WITH THE HELP OF ASSISTANCE SERVICES. THROUGH DEEP PARTNERSHIPS AND AN INCREASINGLY ALIGNED COMMUNITY, WE ARE MAKING SIGNIFICANT ACHIEVEMENTS ACROSS THE REGION. OVER THE PAST 4 YEARS, WE HAVE ACHIEVED THE GOAL WE SET OF 50% OF THE AT-RISK POPULATION OF SENIORS MEETING THEIR BASIC NEEDS AT HOME.  HOWEVER, 40,000 VALLEY RESIDENTS WILL BECOME SENIORS BY 2025 SO NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES WILL CONTINUE TO GROW AND EMERGE. THE LEHIGH VALLEY ALLIANCE ON AGING DEVELOPED A PLAN TO MAKE OUR REGION AGE-FRIENDLY. AGE-FRIENDLY COMMUNITIES ARE DESIGNATED PLACES WHERE ALL PEOPLE, INCLUDING SENIORS, HAVE THE RESOURCES IN PLACE TO LEAD STRONG LIVES AND REMAIN HEALTHY AT HOME. TO ACHIEVE THE STATUS OF AN AGE-FRIENDLY COMMUNITY WILL REQUIRE ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE SERVICES SO SENIORS CAN AGE-IN-PLACE.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 90% OF THE SENIORS WHO ARE SURVEYED WILL REPORT THAT, WITH THE HELP OF ASSISTANCE SERVICES PROVIDED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS, THEY EXPERIENCED AN INCREASE OF SOCIAL SUPPORT AND THIS SUPPORT MAKES IT POSSIBLE FOR THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF WESTMORELAND COUNTY HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY WESTMORELAND COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE (WCCC) SINCE 1971.  AN ESTIMATED 533 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY, 224 OF THESE WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS DURING THE NEXT THREE-YEAR FUNDING CYCLE.  VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS INCLUDE PREPARING AND DELIVERING MEALS TO THE HOMEBOUND; SERVING IN FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND SOUP KITCHENS; PROVIDING FREE INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE;  SERVING AS COUNSELORS THROUGH THE APPRISE AND APRPISE TELECENTER PROGRAMS, THE STATE HEALTH INSURANCE COUNSELING PROGRAM FOR INDIVIDUALS ON MEDICARE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, PROGRAM OUTCOMES WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT HOMEBOUND PARTICIPANTS RECEIVING VOLUNTEER ASSISTANCE WILL BE MORE LIKELY TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES AND INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL INTERACTION THROUGH MEAL DELIVERY, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS, AND FRIENDLY VISITORS.  PA MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WILL RECEIVE FREE, CONFIDENTIAL, AND UNBIASED INFORMATION ON MEDICARE AND/OR HEALTH INSURANCE-RELATED ISSUES.  INDIVIDUALS WILL BE ASSISTED IN APPLYING FOR PROGRAMS TO ASSIST IN LOWERING THEIR PRESCRIPTION COSTS.  THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH WORKING WITH OUR NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS. FOR ALMOST 70 YEARS, VOLUNTEER NEW YORK! HAS BEEN THE ONE-STOP RESOURCE DEVOTED TO INCREASING VOLUNTEERISM IN WESTCHESTER COUNTY, NY. SINCE 1974, VOLUNTEER NEW YORK! HAS BEEN THE SOLE SPONSOR OF RSVP OF WESTCHESTER. UNDER OUR GUIDANCE, RSVP OF WESTCHESTER HAS SUCCESSFULLY CONNECTED THOUSANDS OF OLDER ADULTS WITH VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT ADDRESS PRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS.  OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS IMPROVE THEIR OWN LIVES AS THEY STAY ACTIVE AND ENGAGED, AND FEEL USEFUL AND VALUED.
FOR THE PROPOSED GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 850 RSVP OF WESTCHESTER VOLUNTEERS WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH FOUR FOCUS AREAS: PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, EDUCATION: VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS AND MENTORS IN PROGRAMS TARGETING AT-RISK YOUTH AND IN LOW-INCOME HIGH SCHOOLS TO HELP STUDENTS ENTER POST-SECONDARY INSTITUTIONS. HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA: VOLUNTEERS WILL FILL THE SUPPORT GAP TO HELP IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND HEALTHY CHOICES OF ADULTS WHO ARE AGING IN PLACE AND INCREASE ACCESS TO CARE FOR YOUTH IMPACTED BY THE OPIOID EPIDEMIC.  ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA: VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT, COUNSELING, AND TRAINING TO HARD-TO-EMPLOY INDIVIDUALS.  VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA: VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS OF THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION?S FOOD PANTRY SYSTEM THAT SERVES LOW-INCOME OUTPATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES, AND VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE RECREATIONAL SUPPORT AND COMPANIONSHIP AT A HOME FOR VETERANS. ALSO, THROUGH OTHER COMMUNITY NEED PRIORITIES AND CAPACITY BUILDING, VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT HOSPITALS, SENIOR CENTERS, FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER NONPROFITS.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, KEY OUTCOMES IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION WILL INCLUDE: AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF K-12 STUDENT PARTICIPANTS FROM 250 TO 500, STUDENTS WILL SHOW DOCUMENTED IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS WILL BE PREPARED FOR SUCCESS IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $106,734 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $80,218 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

PUTNAM COUNTY OFFICE FOR SENIOR RESOURCES (FORMERLY PUTNAM COUNTY OFFICE FOR AGING), LOCATED 50 MILES NORTH OF MANHATTAN, HAS BEEN THE SOLE RSVP SPONSOR SINCE 1973.  FOR THE PROPOSED GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 425 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE CITIZENS OF PUTNAM COUNTY BY PERFORMING SERVICE ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH FEDERAL FOCUS AREAS AT 57 CNCS-SPONSORED ACTIVITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH EMPHASIS ON DEMAND RESPONSE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION.  50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THESES VOLUNTEERS WILL TAKE NON-DRIVING SENIORS AND VETERANS TO AND FROM DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS.  AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, 150 SENIORS WILL HAVE BEEN ABLE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY BECAUSE OF THE AVAILABILITY OF MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION.  

OBESITY AND FOOD, ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE AND K-12 SUCCESS ARE ALSO ADDRESSED.  800 PEOPLE WILL HAVE HAD INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, 500 SENIORS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO SOCIALIZATION AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS, 160 SENIORS WILL BENEFIT FROM TELEPHONE REASSURANCE AND 40 STUDENTS WILL HAVE COMPLETED K-12 EDUCATION PROGRAMS IMPROVING READING SCORES.

TWO EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS,  CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS AND  TAI-CHI FOR ARTHRITIS, WILL BE TAUGHT, SERVING 70 PEOPLE.

SOME OF THE SERVICES RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PERFORM IN OTHER SERVICE AREAS ARE: RESPONDING TO NATURAL DISASTERS, PROVIDING INCOME TAX PREPARATION AND TUTORING FOR ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, COMPANIONSHIP VOLUNTEERING IN LIBRARIES, THRIFT SHOPS, HISTORIANS, MUSEUMS, AND SENIOR OUTREACH.

THE OFFICIAL APPLICANT IS THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION (RF) OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION CHARTED IN 1951 BY THE NEW YORK BOARD OF REGENTS. A 1977 AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE RF AND SUNY SYSTEM FINALIZED RF'S ROLE AS THE ORGANIZATION RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING RESEARCH GRANTS AND OTHER SPONSORED PROGRAMS. SUNY OSWEGO'S LOCAL RF OFFICE IS THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS (ORSP), WHICH IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DAY-TO-DAY ADMINISTRATION OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS. AS A SPONSORED PROGRAM, RSVP IS ADMINISTERED BY RF/ORSP AND IS SUBJECT TO ALL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATE, FEDERAL, AND SPONSOR REQUIREMENTS. THEREFORE, RF IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FISCAL ADMINISTRATION OF RSVP, AND AS WITH OTHER SPONSORED PROGRAMS AT SUNY OSWEGO, PROGRAMMATIC OVERSIGHT IS LEFT TO THE DEPARTMENT ON CAMPUS FROM WHICH THE GRANT PROPOSAL ORIGINATED. IN OUR CASE, THE OFFICE OF BUSINESS AND COMMUNITY RELATIONS (OBCR) HAS RESPONSIBILITY OF THE DAY-TO-DAY SUPERVISION OF THE RSVP PROGRAM, STAFF, COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION GROUP AND PUBLIC OUTREACH. AN ESTIMATED 375 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES' FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $59,692 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY UPWARDS OF $73,141 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SVP OF WARREN AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IS SPONSORED BY THE TRI-COUNTY UNITED WAY. THE MISSION OF THE TRI-COUNTY UNITED WAY IS DEDICATION TO HELPING PEOPLE.  WE WORK TO IMPROVE LIVES AND MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT IN OUR COMMUNITIES BY RAISING RESOURCES, BOTH MONETARY AND VOLUNTEER.  WE STRIVE TO DO THIS THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH OTHERS; ENCOURAGING VOLUNTEERISM, AND RESOLVING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS THROUGH IDENTIFYING AND COMMUNICATING OUR COMMUNITY'S PRIORITY ISSUES.
VISION STATEMENT:  WE WILL IMPROVE LIVES IN OUR COMMUNITY BY:
	IDENTIFYING PRIORITY ISSUES WHICH WE CAN IMPACT.
	BRINGING TOGETHER PEOPLE AND ORGANIZATIONS TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED PRIORITY ISSUES
	CONNECTING PEOPLE TO NEEDED SERVICES AND PROGRAMS.
	RAISING RESOURCES, BOTH MONETARY AND HUMAN, TO ACHIEVE OUR GOALS.
	BEING REFLECTIVE OF OUR COMMUNITIES, AND
	DEMONSTRATING MEASURABLE RESULTS OF OR PROGRAMS, WORK AND INITIATIVES.
RSVP CURRENTLY HAS 292 VOLUNTEERS AND 63 COMMUNITY PARTNERS. WE ARE IDENTIFYING THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE NO LONGER INTERESTED OR ABLE TO CONTINUE VOLUNTEERING AND REMOVING THEM FROM OUR ACTIVE FILES.
OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE 300 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS BY THE END OF YEAR THREE.  OF THOSE, 80 WILL BE IN THE OUTCOME PROGRAM OF MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE ANTICIPATE THAT THERE WILL BE 150 CLIENTS USING THE SERVICE.  
OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE SERVING THE COMMUNITY IN A WIDE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES WITH OUR PRIMARY FOCUS BEING HEALTHY FUTURES.  OUR PRIMARY PROGRAMS INCLUDE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, OSTEOBUSTERS EXERCISE PROGRAM, AND HOME DELIVERED MEALS. THESE PROGRAMS ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF AREA SENIORS WITH THE ACCESS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, REDUCTION IN ISOLATION, HEALTH EDUCATION, AND RECEIVING MEALS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS THAT THOSE CLIENTS IN NEED WILL BE PROVIDED ASSISTANCE TO HELP THEM LIVE HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENTLY IN ORDER TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES. 
RSVP OF WARREN AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IS REQUESTING THE FEDERAL FUNDING AMOUNT OF $40,000 FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2018-2019. THE NON-FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL IS $26,736 FOR A TOTAL OF $66,736.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE OF ATLANTIC AND CAPE MAY COUNTIES (JFS) HAS DEVELOPED AN RSVP PROGRAM IN ATLANTIC COUNTY IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY. IN THE PAST YEAR, MORE THAN 70 VOLUNTEERS SUPPORTED THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA. LOOKING AHEAD, IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, A TOTAL OF 120 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT WITH AGING IN PLACE SERVICES, ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD, ACCESS TO BENEFITS, AND MORE. THIS INCLUDES THE VOLUNTEER STATION AT GILDA'S CLUB, WHICH OFFERS 15 VOLUNTEERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO SUPPORT THOSE WITH CANCER DIAGNOSES. SECOND, JFS PLANS TO USE 50 VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOCUS AREA OF COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. OF THESE, 40 WILL SUPPORT THE AGENCY'S ANNUAL FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, AND 10 WILL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT AT THE AGENCY. IN THE FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, 10 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE EMERGENCY SHELTER OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AND CONNECT THEM TO LONG-TERM HOUSING THROUGH THE FAMILY PROMISE ATLANTIC COUNTY VOLUNTEER STATION. FINALLY, IN THE FOCUS AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS, JFS WILL CONTINUE TO PARTNER WITH READING BUDDIES, MEANING 5 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT CHILDREN'S ACADEMIC SUCCESS. IN TOTAL, THROUGH JFS' RSVP PROGRAM, 185 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT JFS AND ITS PARTNER STATIONS.
	BY YEAR THREE, JFS WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING:
	1. MEAL DELIVERY AND HEALTH PROMOTION FOR OLDER ADULTS -- DELIVERY OF AT LEAST 3,600 KOSHER MEALS TO AT LEAST 30 SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. THIS WILL INCREASE THEIR INDEPENDENCE AND PROVIDE SOCIAL SUPPORT. IT ALSO PROMOTES HEALTH, WITH BI-MONTHLY GROCERIES DELIVERED TO THEIR HOMES THROUGH JFS' GROCERY DELIVERY PROGRAM, WHICH USES VOLUNTEERS TO HELP SENIORS PLACE ORDERS, SHOP, DELIVER, AND UNPACK FOOD. 
	2. OLDER ADULT COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE -- 10 OLDER ADULTS WILL RECEIVE FRIENDLY VISITS THAT OFFER SOCIALIZATION, CONVERSATION, AND ACTIVITIES LIKE BOARD GAMES. VOLUNTEERS ALSO HELP WITH BASIC TASKS LIKE READING MAIL AND REVIEWING BILLS.  
	3. FOOD SECURITY -- 2,000 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE EMERGENCY FOOD FROM JFS' FOOD PANTRY.
	4. BENEFITS ACCESS -- JFS' BENEFITS ENROLLMENT CENTER (BEC) WILL ENROLL 500 MEDICARE-ELIGIBLE CONSUMERS FOR MEDICAL AND FINANCIAL BENEFITS BY PROVIDING SCREENINGS, HELPING FILE APPLICATIONS, AND RE-CERTIFICATION AS NEEDED.
	5. AGENCY FUNDRAISING -- VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST AT JFS' THREE MAJOR FUNDRAISING EVENTS, REACHING HUNDREDS OF ATTENDEES EACH YEAR. 
	6. ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT -- VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH JFS ADMINISTRATIVE AND CLERICAL WORK, SUCH AS MAILINGS AND FILINGS, WHICH ULTIMATELY ALLOWS FOR JFS TO IMPACT 8,000 CLIENTS PER YEAR. 
	7. INCREASED ACCESS TO CARE FOR CANCER PATIENTS -- 175 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR CHILDREN WILL BENEFIT FROM VOLUNTEERS, ENSURING THE NO COMMUNITY MEMBER EXPERIENCES CANCER ALONE.
	8. HOUSING SUPPORT -- 20 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE EMERGENCY SHELTER WITH SUPPORT FROM VOLUNTEERS.
	9. EDUCATION AND CHILDHOOD LITERACY -- 20 CHILDREN WILL BE SUPPORTED TO IMPROVE THEIR LITERACY AND COMPLETE EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

THE RSVP CENTER HOSTED BY JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE OF CENTRAL NEW JERSEY (JFSCNJ), A NON-SECTARIAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY IS PRIMED TO BUILD ON THE STRENGTHS OF THE INCUMBENT RSVP PROGRAM AND EXPAND ITS IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION, THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE IMPROVING THE LIVES OF THE VOLUNTEERS AS THEY STAY ACTIVE, CIVICALLY ENGAGED AND EMPOWERED TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE. 
AS A STRONG, REPUTABLE AGENCY, JFSCNJ REMAINS WELL SUITED TO CONTINUE RECRUITING AND MATCHING VOLUNTEERS WITH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES. JFSCNJ IN KNOWN IN UNION COUNTY FOR PROVIDING AN UMBRELLA OF SERVICES, INCLUDING MEALS ON WHEELS, AN URBAN COMMUNITY VEGETABLE GARDEN, HOMECARE, CASE MANAGEMENT, NURSING AND SOCIAL WORK SERVICES, SOCIALIZATION PROGRAMS, TRANSPORTATION AND A NEWLY RENOVATED AND EXPANDED FOOD PANTRY. THE CLIENTS ARE DIVERSE AND COME FROM ALL PARTS OF UNION COUNTY AND THE STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS ARE VERY DIVERSE TO REFLECT THESE NEEDS. EFFORTS ARE MADE TO ACCOMMODATE VARIOUS LANGUAGES AND ETHNICITIES. PROGRAMS FOR THE ELDERLY ARE ALL GEARED TO KEEPING FRAIL, IMPOVERISHED, HOMEBOUND ELDERLY SAFELY AGING IN PLACE IN THE COMFORT OF THEIR OWN HOMES. THE JFSCNJ RSVP PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD UPON THE STELLAR REPUTATION OF SERVICE AND COLLABORATION IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING AN ARRAY OF VOLUNTEER LINKAGES TO OTHER COUNTY RESOURCES AND ORGANIZATIONS. FURTHERMORE, JFSCNJ HAS EXPERIENCED SIGNIFICANT PROGRAM GROWTH IN THE LAST THREE YEARS THAT HAS CREATED AN INCREASED NEED FOR VOLUNTEERS AND ESTABLISHED NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERS TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE. 
JFSCNJ WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE STRONG REPUTATION THE AGENCY MAINTAINS AND THE CONNECTIONS WITH OTHER SERVICE PROVIDERS TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN A LENGTHY LIST OF QUALITY OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERS TO CHOOSE TO MAKE AN IMPACT. THESE CONNECTIONS WILL BE CRITICAL IN THE ONGOING RECRUITMENT OF VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS THE ABILITY FOR RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO GENUINELY MAKE AN IMPACT TOWARDS VARIOUS NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY. 
THROUGH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, WE WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TUTORS TO ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENT STRUGGLING TO SUCCEED ACADEMICALLY AND AFFORD TUTORING HELP. THIS WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE RSVP-UCNJ TUTORING PROGRAM AS WELL AS MATCHING VOLUNTEERS AT OTHER PARTNER SITES. THROUGH THE FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, WE BE HELPING UNDERPRIVILEGED INDIVIDUALS OBTAIN THEIR GED AND IMPROVE THE ENGLISH THROUGH ESL PROGRAMS. THROUGH THE COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WE WILL CONTINUE TO MAKE THE IMPACT RSVP-UCNJ HAS BEEN KNOWN FOR AS WELL AS ADD NEW OPPORTUNITIES AS OUTLINED IN THE NARRATIVE.

THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN WHICH THESE OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE INVOLVED INCLUDE DELIVERING KOSHER MEALS ON WHEELS, COLLECTING, ORGANIZING AND DELIVERING FOOD FOR OUR PANTRY, PROVIDING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE AND FRIENDLY VISITING, AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND MITIGATION. OUR OVERARCHING GOAL IS THAT SENIORS REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES, AS SAFELY AS POSSIBLE, FOR AS LONG AS THEY ARE ABLE.  
JFCS WILL RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS WHO REFLECT THE DIVERSITY OF THE 948,406 RESIDENTS OF OUR BERGEN COUNTY COMMUNITY. WE WILL DO SO THROUGH RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCIES, SENIOR CENTERS, AND THE FAITH COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE COUNTY.

JFCS IS A MULTI-SERVICE, NONSECTARIAN COMMUNITY AGENCY WITH OVER 60 YEARS OF PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN NEED.  JFCS' PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO DEVELOP HEALTHY INDIVIDUALS, STRONG FAMILIES AND VITAL COMMUNITIES.  THE AGENCY MAINTAINS THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF ETHICAL LEADERSHIP, FISCAL INTEGRITY, TRANSPARENCY, COST EFFECTIVENESS AND RESPONSIVENESS.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $65,893 PER YEAR THAT WE RESPECTFULLY REQUEST WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED EACH OF THE THREE YEARS BY MATCHING FUNDS CONTRIBUTED TO JFCS BY THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF NORTHERN NJ.

 	THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $59,529 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $25,839 IN NON-FEDERAL SHARE MATCHING FUNDS, AND AN ADDITIONAL $27,395 IN ADDITIONAL OR EXCESS FUNDING, FOR A TOTAL ANNUAL BUDGET OF $112,763.
	ICGMC, IN OPERATION SINCE 1994, HAS A MISSION TO PROMOTE THE INDEPENDENCE, DIGNITY AND WELLNESS OF HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BY MATCHING THEM WITH CARING VOLUNTEERS WHO ASSIST WITH THE TASKS OF EVERYDAY LIFE. VOLUNTEERS ARE PROFESSIONALLY SCREENED AND TRAINED, AND ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED WITHOUT PROSELYTIZATION OR REGARD TO RELIGIOUS AFFILIATION. IN 2015 THE AGENCY ADDED THE RSVP PROGRAM, ALLOWING THE ORGANIZATION TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE RECRUITING AND SERVICE ACTIVITIES.  THIS GRANT REQUEST ENABLES THIS PROJECT TO CONTINUE PAST ITS INITIAL THREE-YEAR FUNDING PLAN, STRENGTHENING THESE VITAL ACTIVITIES AND AIDING WITH FUTURE EXPANSION NEED.

OUR MISSION IS TO "STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES BY BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS THAT EMPOWER PEOPLE, ENCOURAGE COMMUNITY SERVICE AND RESTORE FAITH IN THE HUMAN SPIRIT."

WE WILL WORK WITH OVER 100 COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR INDIVIDUALS AND HOUSEHOLDS; AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF SENIORS WHO EXPERIENCE INCREASED STRENGTH, BETTER BALANCE, MORE ENERGY, AND ENHANCED FEELINGS OF WELLBEING THROUGH FRIENDS RSVP BONE BUILDERS PROGRAM. THE NORTH CONWAY COMMUNITY, CARROLL COUNTY RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM'S SPONSORING AGENCY, IS SUBMITTED THIS GRANT APPLICATION (APP. ID  - 18SR201004) TO THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR THE GRANT PERIOD APRIL 1, 2018 - MARCH 31, 2021. THE NORTH CONWAY COMMUNITY CENTER (NCCC) IS A NON-PROFIT 501 (C) (3) THAT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1949 (EIN #026012540). THE ORGANIZATION IS COMMITTED TO ITS PARTNERSHIP WITH THE COMMUNITY.  IT SEEKS TO PROVIDE A BROAD RANGE OF QUALITY AND PROGRESSIVE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS AND TO SPONSOR OTHER COMMUNITY GROUPS WITH LIKE GOALS.  THE NCCC HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF CARROLL COUNTY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (CCRSVP) SINCE 1978.

CARROLL COUNTY RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IS LOCATED AT 53 TECHNOLOGY LANE IN CONWAY, NH AND ITS SERVICE AREA IS CARROLL COUNTY NEW HAMPSHIRE. THE COUNTY IS APPROXIMATELY 70 MILES LONG, 30 MILES WIDE AND CONTAINS ABOUT 569,800 ACRES. CARROLL COUNTY IS A RURAL AREA WITH NO INDUSTRIAL OR METROPOLITAN BASE. ITS MAJOR INDUSTRIES ARE TOURISM AND RECREATION.

THE NCCC IS REQUESTING A GRANT WITH 3-YEAR COMMITMENT. GRANT FUNDS OF $49,301 TO BE AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ADDITIONAL FUNDS NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF RSVP WILL BE RAISED THROUGH A COUNTY GRANT, NH DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, VARIOUS GRANTS INCLUDING: EVERSOURCE, GRANITE UNITED WAY, NH CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, NH ELECTRIC CO-OP, SKRUNGLOO FARMS INC. GRANT, THE GIBSON WOODBURY FOUNDATION, THE ROBERT & DOROTHY GOLDBERG CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, AND THE PEQUAWKET FOUNDATION. LASTLY , MAJOR FUNDRAISERS, IN-KIND DONATIONS, AND AN ANNUAL APPEAL ALL HELP TO SUPPORT RSVP'S WORK.

RSVP PRESENTLY HAS A TOTAL OF 383 VOLUNTEERS, 249 (65%) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN OUTCOME-BASED ACTIVITIES IN HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE AND 134 (35%) VOLUNTEERS ENGAGED IN COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. ALL OF THESE VOLUNTEERS ARE WORKING TO FILL IN GAPS IN COMMUNITY AND OUTREACH SERVICES THROUGH EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACHES, WHETHER THAT INVOLVES TRANSPORTING PATIENTS TO DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENT THROUGH OUR NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM; OR MEETING A VITAL NEED FOR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUAL WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING REGULAR NOURISHMENT AND  SOCIAL CONNECTION THROUGH OUR MEALS-ON-WHEELS PROGRAMS; OR VOLUNTEERING IN LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, PROVIDING CRUCIAL ASSISTANCE TO RESIDENTS OF CARROLL COUNTY IN NEED OF FOOD ASSISTANCE; OR GIVING THE GIFT OF TIME THROUGH VOLUNTEERING IN LOCAL HOSPITAL, FOR-PROFIT AND NONPROFIT LONG-TERM CARE FACILITIES AND COUNTY NURSING HOMES; OR SPREADING SOME WARMTH BY DONATING MITTENS, HATS AND SCARVES TO LOCAL SCHOOL CHILDREN; OR DONATING HAND-MADE QUILTS TO SO MANY WHO NEED QUILTS NOT ONLY TO KEEP THEM WARM BUT TO SHOW THEM THAT SOMEONE CARES ABOUT THEM; OR LEADING A BONE BUILDERS CLASS, DELIVERING A PROVEN EXERCISE PROGRAM TO RESIDENTS OF CARROLL COUNTY.

THE MISSION OF BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT IS TO ADVOCATE, LEAD, AND PROVIDE SERVICES OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY IN ORDER TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF BALTIMORE CITY RESIDENTS.  AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, DISTRIBUTING FOOD AND OUTREACH. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 600 OLDER ADULTS' WILL HAVE REPORTED INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/SOCIAL SUPPORTS AS WELL AS INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $95,737 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $72,908 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDS FROM BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WHICH INCLUDES "AGING IN PLACE," "ACCESS TO CARE," AND "OBESITY AND FOOD." AN ESTIMATED 155 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUR OVERALL PROJECT FOR APPROXIMATE 4,750 BENEFICIARIES. 

IN A UNIQUE OFFERING TO RSVP PARTICIPANTS, AACF ALSO OFFERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO COMPLETE 80 HOURS OF FREE TRAINING AS COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS (CHWS). THESE CULTURALLY-COMPETENT, OFTEN BILINGUAL ANCILLARY HEALTH CARE EDUCATORS THEN WORK IN A VARIETY OF HEALTH, HUMAN SERVICE AND EDUCATIONAL SETTINGS AS DIRECT CONDUITS INTO HARD-TO-SERVE COMMUNITIES, ENSURING HEALTH CARE FOLLOW-UP AND CONNECTING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES. WHETHER WORKING AS PART OF A TEAM SERVING SENIORS THROUGH THE FREDERICK COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S AERS (ADULT EVALUATION AND REVIEW SERVICES) PROGRAM, WITH THE LOCAL FREEDOM CENTER, ASSISTING DISABLED ADULTS, OR THE FREDERICK COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN DEVELOPING BETTER PARENT/CHILD/EDUCATOR RELATIONSHIPS IN ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNING FAMILIES, RSVP CHWS HAVE AN IMPORTANT ROLE TO PLAY IN CONNECTING AREA RESIDENTS TO SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES. SUBJECT MATTER TRAINING WILL INCLUDE: HEALTH DISPARITY ISSUES THAT RELATE  ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES), SUBSTANCE ABUSE, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, ADVANCE DIRECTIVES, AND CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT (CDSMP), ETC. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING OLDER ADULTS WITH HOUSING SERVICES, DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT, AWARENESS ON ELDER FRAUD AND ABUSE,  AND MEAL DELIVERY SERVICES IN ORDER TO HELP THEM AGE HEALTHILY AND INDEPENDENTLY IN PLACE; PROVIDING TRANSLATION SERVICES FOR ETHNIC MINORITIES TO FACILITATE THEIR ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE SERVICES; OFFERING ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL) CLASSES TO ADULTS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY (LEP) TO HELP THEM ACCESSING TO VARIOUS HEALTH AND SOCIAL NEEDS, AND SUPPORTS OF VETERANS TO INCREASE THEIR ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE AND HOUSING SERVICES. ADDITIONALLY, IN A REQUESTED AUGMENTATION TO OUR ORIGINAL GRANT, WE WILL RESPOND TO A GROWING NEED IN YOUTH SERVICES AS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROVIDING ACCESS TO CARE THROUGH OUTREACH, EDUCATION, AND MENTORING SERVICES TO AREA MIDDLE SCHOOL-AGE STUDENTS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 100 OLDER ADULTS WILL RECEIVE MEAL DELIVERY 5 TIMES A WEEK AND 300 WILL RECEIVE FINANCIAL LITERACY AND HOUSING SERVICES. TWENTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND RESOURCES TO OLDER ADULTS AND VETERANS TO FIND AND MAINTAIN APPROPRIATE HOUSING, AS WELL AS ASSIST THEM WITH REPAIRS SUCH AS WEATHERIZING, PAINTING, REPLACING APPLIANCES, AND REMOVING SAFETY HAZARDS.  SEVENTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROVIDED HEALTH-RELATED INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS AND RESOURCES TO SHARE AND DISTRIBUTE TO OVER 4000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES DURING MONTHLY LOCAL EVENTS SUCH AS THE DENTAL FAIR AND ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR. THIRTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE ORIENTATION AND TRAINING TO PROMOTE AND PROVIDE CLASSES ON CHILD SAFETY AND WELFARE INTERVENTIONS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (DSS) AND MINORITY OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (MOTA) AND HEALTH PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS PARTICIPATE IN ADDITIONAL MENTORING OPPORTUNITIES WITH 60 LOCAL YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES. A NUMBER OF NEW STATIONS / NEW PROGRAMS SUCH AS 4H, AARP, KIWANIS, LITTLE FREE LIBRARY (EARLY LITERACY EXPERIENCE INITIATIVE) WILL SUPPORT THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO MEET OUR OBJECTIVES OF THESE FOCUSES. OVER 300 ADULTS AND CHILDREN WHO STRUGGLE WITH FOOD INSECURITIES WILL BE PROVIDED FRESH PRODUCE AND NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS DURING WEEKLY DISTRIBUTIONS SERVED BY SIXTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS AT LOCAL ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, SENIOR CENTERS, AND FOOD BANKS. SEVENTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AS NEEDS ARISE LOCALLY TO ADDRESS ELDER JUSTICE ISSUES, OPIOID ABUSE, MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONCERNS, EDUCATION ON COMPLETING ADVANCED DIRECTIVES FOR HEALTH SERVICES, AND CULTURAL COMPETENCY DURING PROFESSIONAL WORKSHOPS AND EDUCA

THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES IS TO ENSURE THE PROVISION OF COMPREHENSIVE AND RESPONSIVE COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT STRENGTHEN THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY COMMUNITY. THE LOCAL RSVP PROGRAM IS HOUSED IN THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES AGING AND DISABILITIES SERVICES DIVISION WHICH ALSO SERVES AS THE LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING.  
THROUGH THIS GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 450 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH APPROXIMATELY 30 HOST SITES.   OF THIS NUMBER, 281 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  DUE TO VOLUNTEER ACTIVITY, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, SENIORS WILL RECEIVE HOT HOME DELIVERED MEALS; CALLS WILL BE PLACED TO ISOLATED SENIORS RESIDING IN THEIR HOMES AND LONG TERM CARE FACILITIES; TRANSPORTATION WILL BE PROVIDED TO SENIORS FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY SHOPPING AND OTHER ERRANDS; AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO NON-PROFIT AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS.  THE TOTAL BUDGET FOR THIS PROJECT IS $110,201, THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $66,601 AND THE GRANTEE CONTRIBUTION IS $43,600.  THE SERVICE CATEGORIES SELECTED ARE A DIRECT RESULT OF IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS TO VOLUNTEER IN THEIR COMMUNITY THUS PROMOTING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND TO ASSIST OLDER ADULTS WITH THEIR DESIRE TO AGE IN PLACE AND REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
AN ESTIMATED 950 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE COMMUNITY OF BALTIMORE COUNTY, MARYLAND. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION AND FOOD TO HOME BOUND OLDER ADULTS; AND PREPARING TAXES FOR THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 300 OLDER ADULTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO MAINTAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY; AND AT LEAST $625.000 OF TAX REFUNDS WILL HAVE BEEN PREPARED AND GENERATED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $61,190 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $30,248 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 55 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PREPARING AND DELIVERING MEALS TO FRAIL HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN OUR FOUR COUNTY AREA; PROVIDING RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS, PROVIDING HELP AND INFORMATION ABOUT HEALTH INSURANCE AND CALLING HOMEBOUND SENIORS TO CHECK ON THEM DAILY. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THIS GRANT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES CONCENTRATING ON AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO CARE.  WE WILL ALSO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY UNDER OBESITY AND FOOD, BY PLACING RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 800 UNDUPLICATED HOMEBOUND SENIORS PROVIDING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HELP THEM REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES LONGER AND HELP TO  INCREASE THEIR FEELINGS OF SOCIAL SUPPORT. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED RESPITE CARE FOR LOCAL CAREGIVERS, PROVIDE SENIORS WITH IMPORTANT INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE AS WELL AS HELP LOCAL NON-PROFITS MEET THE COMMUNITY NEEDS IN OUR AREA.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $52,800 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37779 IN MATCHING FUNDS FROM THE SPONSOR, LOCAL BUSINESSES AND LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS.

OLD COLONY ELDER SERVICES (OCES) SERVES AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SENIOR CORPS GRANT (PROJECT). THE PROJECT BECAME A SPONSORED PROGRAM OF OCES ON APRIL 1, 2015. OCES IS DESIGNATED AS ONE OF 26 PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AGING SERVICES ACCESS POINTS (ASAPS) IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS AND OUR MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF ELDERS AND INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING ESSENTIAL INFORMATION AND SERVICES THAT PROMOTE HEALTHY AND SAFE LIVING. OCES' DYNAMIC PROGRAMMING, 44-YEAR HISTORY AND EXPERIENCE, AS WELL AS OUR COMMITMENT TO SUPPORT PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, CONTINUES TO PLACE US IN AN EXCELLENT POSITION TO MANAGE THIS PROJECT. THE PROJECT NAME WAS CHANGED FROM MAYFLOWER RSVP TO RSVP OF PLYMOUTH COUNTY IN THE CURRENT 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD, TO BETTER REFLECT THE FULL RSVP SERVICE AREA. OCES AND THE RSVP OF PLYMOUTH COUNTY ARE WELL KNOWN AND WELL RESPECTED RESOURCES IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

WE ARE REQUESTING THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $126,132 (ANNUAL FEDERAL GRANT) WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $54,057 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES) FOR A TOTAL BUDGET OF $180,189. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. OTHER AREAS OF FOCUS INCLUDE EDUCATION, VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT ANY GIVEN TIME OVER THE COURSE OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT; OF THIS NUMBER, 127 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO ELDERS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY EDUCATION, SUPPORTING VETERANS AND ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY, AND TUTORING STUDENTS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS INCREASED SOCIALIZATION AND QUALITY OF LIFE,  INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED FINANCIAL LITERACY AND INCREASED TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO ATTEND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WILL INCREASE THEIR READING LEVELS/SKILLS AND LOCAL AGENCIES WILL INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INCREASED SUPPORT OF PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY					 
BERKSHIRE RSVP'S MISSION IS TO ENCOURAGE OLDER ADULTS TO VOLUNTEER BY MATCHING THEIR SKILLS TO LOCAL COMMUNITY NEEDS, TO RECRUIT AND PLACE VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST AGENCIES IMPLEMENT IMPACT PROGRAMMING, TO IDENTIFY UNMET COMMUNITY NEEDS, AND TO DESIGN SIGNATURE IMPACT PROJECTS TO ADDRESS COMPELLING PROBLEM ISSUES.
RSVP'S TOTAL FY'18-19 BUDGET IS BEING SUBMITTED FOR $11939. OUR SPONSOR WILL PROVIDE $78,450.00 (67.3%) AND OUR GRANT REQUEST TO CNS WILL BE FOR $40,689 (22.7%), RSVP PROJECTS 355 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS AND 70 STATIONS PROJECTED FOR FY 18 AND 5 SIGNATURE PROGRAMS.

RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY IS SPONSORED BY THE HAMPSHIRE COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (HCG), A VOLUNTARY ASSOCIATION OF CITIES AND TOWNS FACILITATING REGIONAL COLLABORATION IN HAMPSHIRE COUNTY AND BEYOND. HCG?S MISSION IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE IN THE REGION BY HELPING CITIES AND TOWNS SAVE MONEY, IMPROVING QUALITY OF SERVICES, AND BEING A VOICE FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS. HCG HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 2008.  IN ADDITION TO RSVP, OUR HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT INCLUDES A REGIONAL TOBACCO FREE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP. 
 	
RSVP OF THE PIONEER VALLEY BEGAN IN HAMPSHIRE COUNTY IN 1973, EXPANDED NORTH INTO FRANKLIN COUNTY IN 1999, AND SOUTH INTO HAMPDEN COUNTY IN SEPTEMBER 2017.  RSVP IS A WELL-KNOWN AND WELL-RESPECTED RESOURCE IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  IN 2010, CNCS AWARDED RSVP A PROGRAMS OF NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE GRANT TO EXPAND ITS HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE PROGRAM, WHICH HAS SINCE GROWN BY 60% AND SERVES HUNDREDS OF SENIORS EACH YEAR AT 26 COMMUNITY SITES.  FOLLOWING A CNCS MONITORING VISIT IN 2016, CNCS STAFF DESCRIBED OUR CURRENT PROJECT AS ?A STRONG RSVP PROGRAM THAT?HAS INVESTED IN ACHIEVING PROGRAM OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES WHICH ARE BOTH ACCURATE AND BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY.?  

	WE ARE REQUESTING $257,182 WITH A $111,948 NON-FEDERAL MATCH, AND WE PROPOSE TO ENGAGE 875 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, INCLUDING 267 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN IMPACT-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE RELATED VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BROWN BAG MONTHLY GROCERIES FOR SENIORS, COMPANIONSHIP, HEALTHY BONES & BALANCE EXERCISE CLASSES, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION, MONEY MANAGEMENT, AND LEADING ENRICHMENT CLASSES.  THE PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY THROUGH BUILDING HOMES AND ESL TUTORING.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE EXTENSIVE CAPACITY BUILDING SUPPORT THROUGH CONSULTING, FUNDRAISING, AND BLOOD DRIVES, AS WELL AS SUPPORT TO LOCAL VETERANS? ORGANIZATIONS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE CENTRAL OUTCOMES WE ANTICIPATE ARE:  SENIORS WILL INCREASE THEIR SOCIALIZATION AND QUALITY OF LIFE AND SENIORS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE WILL HAVE TRANSITIONED INTO AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  LOCAL AGENCIES WILL INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INCREASED FUNDING AND SUPPORT OF THEIR PROGRAM INFRASTRUCTURE.

THE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY OF WESTERN CONNECTICUT, INC. (CAAWC) IS ONE OF 9 COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES IN THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT. FOUNDED IN 1965 AS PART OF PRESIDENT LYNDON B. JOHNSON'S WAR ON POVERTY PROGRAM, CAAWC HAS BEEN A STAPLE IN THE COMMUNITY IN THE PROVISION OF SERVICES FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. CAAWC WORKS HARD TO CONNECT ITS CLIENTS WITH SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES, THE AGENCY ITSELF AND LOCAL COMMUNITY INITIATIVES AND PROGRAMS. ALL OF THE AGENCY'S INITIATIVES AND PROGRAMMING HAS ONE CENTRAL THEME; HELPING CLIENTS MOVE TOWARDS SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

THE MISSION OF CAAWC IS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICES AND PROGRAMS TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN THE WESTERN AREA OF CONNECTICUT TO HELP THEM STABILIZE AND IMPROVE THEIR LIVES.

CURRENTLY THE AGENCY OFFERS MANY SERVICES INCLUDING ENERGY ASSISTANCE, EARLY CHILDCARE EDUCATION, COMPREHENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT, JOB SKILLS TRAINING, VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE, DIAPER PROGRAM, FOOD PANTRY, AND RSVP. 

IN JULY 2009, CAAWC MADE ITS COMMITMENT TO SERVICES FOR SENIORS BY ASSUMING RSVP SPONSORSHIP FROM THE AMERICAN RED CROSS. TO DATE, CAAWC OPERATES THE RSVP PROGRAM OF NORTHERN FAIRFIELD COUNTY. CAAWC SERVES A 25 TOWN CATCHMENT AREA IN FAIRFIELD AND LITCHFIELD COUNTIES. 

THE TERRITORY SERVED BY RSVP ENCOMPASSES THE FOLLOWING TOWNS: BETHEL, BROOKFIELD, DANBURY, NEW FAIRFIELD, NEWTOWN, REDDING, RIDGEFIELD AND SHERMAN. THE AGGREGATED POPULATION EXCEEDED 194,000 ACCORDING TO THE 2010 US CENSUS. IN FAIRFIELD COUNTY, OVER 21,000 PEOPLE AGES 65 AND OLDER LIVE IN THESE TOWNS, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO GROW AS BABY BOOMERS AGE.  CAAWC HAS ENJOYED ADMINISTERING RSVP AND LOOKS FORWARD TO CONTINUING TO SERVE THE AREA AND PROVIDING NEEDED SERVICES WITH ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS IN THE PROGRAM.

CAAWC IS PROPOSING 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. THEY WILL PROVIDE EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND FOOD SECURITY THROUGH 4 VOLUNTEER WORK STATIONS/PLACEMENT SITES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES. IN EDUCATION, 90% OF STUDENTS WILL EXHIBIT IMPROVEMENT IN EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT SKILLS THAT WILL BE ASSESSED BY PRE AND POST TESTS. IN HEALTHY FUTURES, 75% OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED WILL REPORT THAT THEY RECEIVED ENOUGH FOOD TO PREVENT THEM FROM GOING HUNGRY WHICH WILL BE OBTAINED FROM A CLIENT EVALUATION/SURVEY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $17,384.

RSVP OF DALLAS AND COLLIN COUNTIES HAS BEEN SPONSORED LOCALLY FOR OVER 40 YEARS BY THE SENIOR SOURCE, SENIOR CITIZENS OF GREATER DALLAS, A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION PROVIDING SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE GREATER DALLAS AREA SINCE 1961.  THE AGENCY HOUSES TEN PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON MEETING THE NEEDS OF SENIOR ADULTS.  THE MISSION OF THE SENIOR SOURCE IS TO ENHANCE THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE AND EMPOWER ALL OLDER ADULTS IN GREATER DALLAS TO THRIVE.
AN ESTIMATED 975 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THIS PROJECT.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING AT-RISK ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; PROVIDING HOME MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR SERVICES TO HOME-BOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; MAINTAINING AND SUSTAINING THE OPERATION OF NUTRITION AND FOOD-SECURITY PROGRAMS THROUGH VERIFYING CLIENT CRITERIA FOR PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AND ASSISTING WITH SERVICE DELIVERY; AND PROACTIVELY PROVIDING DISASTER PREPAREDNESS ASSISTANCE.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT: 400 OLDER ADULTS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES RESULTING FROM RSVP SERVICES; 700 INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT DALLAS AND COLLIN COUNTIES WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND/OR THEIR CHILDREN (HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY) AS A RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS' SUPPORTED SERVICES; 90 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO WERE MENTORED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; AND 20,000 SERVICE HOURS WILL BE REPORTED IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, MITIGATION, RESPONSE, AND/OR RECOVERY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $189,173 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $128, 516 ANNUALLY.

THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS FUNDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND SPONSORED BY THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY LOCATED IN EDINBURG, TEXAS FOR THE LAST 30 YEARS.  THE CHCSA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY OF THE LOW INCOME AND VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS BY PROVIDING EFFECTIVE, EFFICIENT, AND COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS.  ACCORDING TO THE 2010 CENSUS, HIDALGO COUNTY'S POPULATION IS 774,769 OF WHICH 410,103 INDIVIDUALS, 30,000 FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS OVER THE AGE OF 65 LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL. THE RSVP OF HIDALGO COUNTY AIMS TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS, PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT IMPACT TO THE COMMUNITY, TRAINING AND PROVIDE A HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE FOR ALL VOLUNTEERS. SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AGED FIFTY-FIVE AND OVER ARE LINKED WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS BASED ON THEIR PERSONAL EXPERTISE AND INTERESTS THROUGHOUT CAMERON, HIDALGO AND WILLACY COUNTIES. THE RSVP PROJECT COORDINATES WITH APPROXIMATELY THIRTY-EIGHT VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE PROVIDED WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WHICH, IN TURN, HELPS THOSE RESIDENTS OF OUR COMMUNITY IN NEED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY - RSVP WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WHICH WILL HAVE THE GREATEST IMPACT ON OUR COMMUNITIES.  AN ESTIMATED 394 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS HELPING THE ELDERLY, VETERANS, AND LOW INCOME FAMILIES PROVIDING FOOD DISTRIBUTION FOR 35,000 FAMILIES AND SERVED 208 CONGREGATE MEALS TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY AND VETERANS OF WHICH REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. RSVP VOLUNTEERS FROM ELEVEN FOOD PANTRIES IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA UNLOAD, SORT, STACK, PREPARE AND ORGANIZE FOOD FOR DISTRIBUTION. A TOTAL OF 60 LOW-SOCIO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGE YOUTH ARE PROVIDED TUTORING SERVICES BY 15 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING INDIVIDUALIZED INSTRUCTION IN TUTORIAL SETTINGS IN TWO LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS. OVER 500 VOLUNTEERS ASSIST 26,000 VETERANS IN 34 VOLUNTEERS STATIONS PROVIDING FINANCIAL SUPPORT, HEALTH INFORMATION, CARE PACKAGES, AND FACILITATE WITH ACCESS TO MEDICATION. 29 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE TOURS, SHORT STORIES ON THE HISTORY OF THE VALLEY, THE UNITED STATES AND ARTIFACTS TO VALLEY INDIVIDUALS IN 2 MUSEUMS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 600 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE ELDERLY, HOMEBOUND, DISABLED, VETERANS AND LOW-INCOME FAMILIES IMPACTING INCREASED FOOD SECURITIES, HEALTHIER DIETS AND INCREASED ACCESS TO CARE.  THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO'S RSVP PROJECT CONNECTS 600 VOLUNTEERS WITH 38 NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF $76,751 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TOTALING $96,388.

PART II -- SECTION A. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
AN ESTIMATED 83 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 75 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY TO HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, ASSISTING WITH HOUSING SEARCHES FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING HOMELESS, VITA TAX PREPARATION AND VETERANS SUPPORT SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 100 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND  60  ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING HOMELESS WILL TRANSITION INTO SAFE, HEALTHY AFFORDABLE HOUSING. $1,560,000 OF TAX REFUNDS WILL BE GENERATED BY VITA TAX PREPARATION. $137,500 OF TAX PREPARATION FEES WILL BE SAVED BY VITA TAX PREPARATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $22,500 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. 
CENTRAL TEXAS OPPORTUNITIES, INCORPORATED (CTO) IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY ESTABLISHED IN 1965 AS A 501(C)3 NON-PROFIT CORPORATION. CTO'S MISSION STATEMENT IS AS FOLLOWS: A COMMUNITY IN ACTION, EMPOWERING PEOPLE, CHANGING LIVES, AND OFFERING HOPE TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY. CTO'S VISION STATEMENT IS AS FOLLOWS: TO BUILD THRIVING AND SELF-SUFFICIENT COMMUNITIES BY CREATING EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGHOUT THE CENTRAL TEXAS REGION.
CTO HAS STRONG, EFFECTIVE SYSTEMS TO SUPPORT CONTINUOUS QUALITY CLIENT AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FOCUSED ON PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO THE RESIDENTS IN A VERY RURAL SEVEN (7) COUNTY SERVICE AREA IN CENTRAL WEST TEXAS.  THESE COUNTIES INCLUDE BROWN, CALLAHAN, COLEMAN, COMANCHE, EASTLAND, MCCULLOCH, AND RUNNELS COUNTIES. CTO USES FUNDS FROM THE VETERANS GENERAL ASSISTANCE GRANT, COMPREHENSIVE ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (CEAP), UTILITY CORPORATION GRANTS, COMMUNITY SERVICES BLOCK GRANT (CSBG), THE HOME PROGRAMS AND VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) GRANT TO ASSIST THE POPULATION WITHIN OUR SEVEN COUNTY SERVICE AREA.  CTO HAS A LONG HISTORY OF WORKING WITH VOLUNTEERS TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT IN OUR COMMUNITIES. IN 2016, 50 VOLUNTEERS WORKED IN OUR PROGRAMS.

THE ARC OF TEXAS IS THE STATE'S PREMIERE NONPROFIT SERVING INDIVIDUALS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE 100 OR MORE RSVP VOLUNTEERS DEPLOYED ANNUALLY BY THE ARC OF TEXAS WILL SERVE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN WILLIAMSON COUNTY, TEXAS, WITH A PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON SUBSTANTIALLY INCREASING THE INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RESIDING IN THE COUNTYS RURAL COMMUNITIES INCLUDING TAYLOR, GRANGER, BARTLETT, THRALL, JARRELL, FLORENCE, COUPLAND AND LIBERTY HILL. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 90 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN EACH 12-MONTH PERIOD. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: (1) PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP [REGULAR, MEANINGFUL SOCIAL SUPPORTS] FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; (2) PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; (3) PREVENTING ELDER ABUSE OF OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES; AND (4) DELIVERING SCHOOL-AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING TO K-12 STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS INCLUSION OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON HELPING WILLIAMSON COUNTY (WILCO) RESIDENTS WITH DISABILITIES RESIDING IN RURAL COMMUNITIES ATTAIN AND MAINTAIN IMPROVED ENGAGEMENT AND INVOLVEMENT IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITIES SOCIAL, ECONOMIC AND POLITICAL ENVIRONMENTS, SPECIFICALLY BY ACHIEVING IMPROVED STATES OF ECONOMIC WELL-BEING AND FINANCIAL SECURITY, ACCESS TO HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT, AS WELL AS DEPENDABLE COMPANIONSHIP, IMPROVED TRANSPORTATION AND MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE: A) AT LEAST 200 INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; B) AT LEAST 50 WILLIAMSON COUNTY RESIDENTS WITH DISABILITIES ARE TRANSITIONED INTO SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING; C) AT LEAST 100 OR MORE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED (UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED) WILLIAMSON COUNTY ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES ARE PLACED IN JOBS THAT IMPROVE THEIR FINANCIAL STATUS (INCOME) AND/OR PROMOTE THEIR LONG-TERM, ECONOMIC STABILITY; D) AT LEAST 75 INDIVIDUALS/CAREGIVERS OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; AND, E) AT LEAST 40 K-12 STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVE SCHOOL- OR COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING SERVICES THAT IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OVER THE COURSE OF PARTICIPATION IN THE PROJECT. A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $100,000 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM $10,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE ARC OF TEXAS IN YEAR ONE; $20,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IN YEAR TWO; AND $30,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IN YEAR THREE.

AN ESTIMATED 227 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN 12 OF THE COUNTIES SERVED BY OF THE NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS' (NCTCOG) AGING DEPARTMENT SERVICE AREA. OF THIS NUMBER, 125 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE (1) DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND/OR HELPING AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES, (2) CONDUCTING EVIDENCE-BASED CLASSES AS VOLUNTEER LEADERS,  (3) PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES, (4) BUILDING WHEELCHAIR RAMPS, (5) DELIVERING INFORMATION ON MEDICARE AND OTHER HEALTH INSURANCE, HEALTH CARE ACCESS, HEALTH BENEFITS, MEDICARE FRAUD, AND (6) ASSISTING VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS WITH ACCESS TO STATE AND FEDERAL BENEFITS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,151 OLDER ADULTS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND/OR WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $103,764 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE GRANTEE SHARE OF $12,161 FOR THE PRO-RATED 10-MONTH FIRST YEAR OF THE GRANT.

THE EVELYN RUBENSTEIN JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER OF HOUSTON (ERJCC) PROPOSES TO ADMINISTER RSVP OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS, A PROJECT PROVIDING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT SERVICES AMONG THE 18 TEXAS COUNTIES OF AUSTIN, BRAZORIA, BRAZOS, BURLESON, COLORADO, FT. BEND, GRIMES, HARRIS, LEON, LIBERTY, MADISON, MATAGORDA, MONTGOMERY, ROBERTSON, WALKER, WALLER, WASHINGTON, AND WHARTON. AN ESTIMATED 750 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: SUPPORTING AGING IN PLACE BY PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES, COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND HOME-DELIVERED MEALS; SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CARE BY DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION ON MEDICARE INSURANCE; ADDRESSING HUNGER BY FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT; ADDRESSING EDUCATION BY ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AT EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS; AND PROVIDING DISASTER SERVICES BY PERFORMING OUTREACH TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ON DISASTER PREPAREDNESS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ADDRESS ACTIVITIES IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS, INCLUDING EDUCATION AND DISASTER SERVICES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 270 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, 30 CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS/INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND 150 CHILDREN WHO COMPLETE EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS.  THESE RESULTS WILL HAVE BEEN ACHIEVED THROUGH THE WORK OF 315 RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $271,718 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $149,483 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

HILL COUNTRY COMMUNITY ACTION ASSOCIATION, INC. (HCCAA), IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR HILL COUNTRY RSVP (HCRSVP).  THE CENTRAL ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE IS IN SAN SABA, TEXAS IN SAN SABA COUNTY.  HCCAA'S MISSION: "HCCAA IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CENTRAL TEXANS".  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $110,430 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $75,070 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES MADE UP OF STATE, LOCAL AND IN-KIND REVENUE.  
THERE ARE 500 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS CURRENTLY SERVING THE NINE COUNTY RURAL PROJECT AREA WITH A POPULATION OF 472,954 PEOPLE COVERING 8,424 SQUARE MILES (2010 CENSUS).  VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS IN BELL, CORYELL, HAMILTON, LAMPASAS, MILAM, MILLS, SAN SABA, LLANO AND MASON COUNTIES, PLUS FT. HOOD ARMY BASE IN KILLEEN (POP. 405,300).  THE POPULATION INCLUDES 49,172 PEOPLE OVER 65; 61,314 VETERANS; AND 70,066 PERSONS BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL (2010 CENSUS).  THE AVERAGE UNEMPLOYMENT FOR OUR 9 COUNTIES IS 6.33%.  THE NATIONAL AVERAGE AS OF JULY 2013 IS 7.4%  (US DEPT. OF LABOR-JULY 2013 REPORT).  THE COUNTIES ARE PRIMARILY RANCHING, FARMING, AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITIES AND VARY IN CULTURAL, ETHNIC, AND ECONOMIC CHARACTERISTICS.  HCRSVP WILL MAINTAIN AT LEAST 500 VOLUNTEERS AS WE TRANSITION INTO THE CNCS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES.  HCRSVP'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND SERVICES WILL CONSIST OF: HOME DELIVERED MEALS/TRANSPORTATION/COMPANIONSHIP TO KEEP THE FRAIL ELDERLY LIVING INDEPENDENT LONGER; FOOD BANKS/PANTRIES TO ADDRESS FOOD SECURITY ISSUES FOR ALL RESIDENTS; AND, CAPACITY BUILDING-VOLUNTEER MANAGERS/RECRUITERS PLACED IN NON-PROFITS WILL ENABLE THE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE DIRECT AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES OR BUILD CAPACITY TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN OTHER FOCUS AREAS.

THE TARGET POPULATION OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS SENIORS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER. OUR GOAL IS TO ENHANCE THE WELL-BEING OF SENIORS THROUGH MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN A POSITIVE SELF-ESTEEM AND SELF-IMAGE.
 SAN ANTONIO RSVP HAS IMPLEMENTED A COMPREHENSIVE VOLUNTEER SERVICE PROGRAM CHARACTERIZED BY THREE CRITICAL FEATURES. THE FIRST FEATURE IS THE DEVELOPMENT OF MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER PLACEMENTS. RSVP CREATES PARTNERSHIPS WITH 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT AGENCIES AND PUBLIC ENTITIES WHICH BENEFIT FROM THE TIME, EXPERIENCE, AND COMMITMENT OF THE 55 PLUS POPULATION. SECONDLY, THE PROGRAM MAINTAINS THE VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES THROUGH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES AND REWARDING WORK WHICH GIVE BACK TO THE COMMUNITY AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE WELL BEING OF OUR VOLUNTEERS. THE THIRD FEATURE IS VOLUNTEER RECOGNITION. SYSTEMATIC FORMAL AND INFORMAL RECOGNITION GREATLY CONTRIBUTES TO ELEVATED LIFE SATISFACTION AND CONTINUED PARTICIPATION, WHICH IN TURN PREVENTS AND REVERSES ISOLATION. 
 AN ESTIMATED 800 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH SAN ANTONIO RSVP. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON HEALTHY FUTURES INITIATIVES AS WELL AS OTHER CNCS INITIATIVES. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING, TUTORING, MONEY MANAGEMENT, GUARDIANSHIP, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, AND MILITARY AND VETERAN SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTH FUTURES PROVIDING SUPPORT SERVICES TO SENIORS AND THE DISABLED. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE A MINIMUM OF 150 SENIORS CLIENTS WILL REPORT AN IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR PHYSICAL WELLNESS, EMOTIONAL WELLNESS, SOCIAL WELLNESS AND/ OR ENVIRONMENTAL WELLNESS AS A RESULT OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS ACTIVE IN THE AREA OF FOOD SECURITY, IMPROVING LIVING ENVIRONMENT SAFETY, OR ENHANCED ACCESS TO SENIOR SERVICES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $114,052.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,128.

AN ESTIMATED 850 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ANGELINA, HOUSTON, JASPER, NACOGDOCHES, NEWTON, POLK, SABINE, SAN AUGUSTINE, SAN JACINTO, SHELBY, TRINITY, AND TYLER COUNTIES, THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH NINETY-FOUR (94) RSVP VOLUNTEER STATIONS.
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  DISTRIBUTING NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO FEED THE FOOD INSECURE OF VARIOUS AGES THROUGH FOOD PANTRIES, AND SOUP KITCHENS;   PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS THROUGH ADULT DAY CENTERS AND HOSPICES; OFFERING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES (VIA WEEKLY PHONE CALLS) TO MEALS-ON-WHEELS RECIPIENTS, FRAIL ELDERLY, AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE RSVP RING TEAM; PROVIDING TUTORING/MENTORING TO K-12 STUDENTS THROUGH PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS; ASSISTING VETERANS WITH CLINIC SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, AND MAKING COMFORT PILLOWS FOR REHABILITATION; GARNERING DONATIONS FOR MORE THAN SIXTEEN (16) NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN DEEP EAST TEXAS, WHILE ALSO RAISING FUNDS FOR MULTIPLE COLLEGE/UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND ENDOWMENTS; IN ADDITION TO OTHER PRIORITY SERVICES.
THERE ARE FOUR (4) WORK PLANS (42.5% OF VOLUNTEERS) CONNECTED TO THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT; HEALTHY FUTURES.  FIVE (5) WORK PLANS (37.5% OF VOLUNTEERS) ARE IN THE CATEGORY OF OTHER FOCUS AREAS AND CAPACITY BUILDING, AND ONE (1) WORK PLAN (20% OF VOLUNTEERS) SPEAKS TO COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 8% OF THE VOLUNTEERS (68) ARE VETERANS, AND THIS PROJECT AIMS TO SERVE MORE THAN 5,000 VETERANS/FAMILIES.
AT THE END OF THIS GRANT PERIOD:  AT LEAST 5,000 OF THOSE SURVEYED WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; A MINIMUM OF 75 CAREGIVERS OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS/INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES, AND 100 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES (VIA PHONE CONTACT); AT LEAST 100 STUDENTS (K-12) WILL BE TUTORED AND/OR MENTORED; 4,500 VETERANS WILL RECEIVE NECESSARY MEDICAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, AND/OR SUPPLIES; AND MORE THAN $350,000 WILL BE RAISED TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF SIXTEEN (16) AREA NON-PROFITS.  THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $77,632 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $86,291 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE HEART OF TEXAS (H.O.T.) RSVP HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY MCLENNAN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (MCC) IN WACO, TEXAS FOR OVER 25 YEARS. RSVP SERVES THE SIX TEXAS COUNTIES OF MCLENNAN, FALLS, BOSQUE, HILL, FREESTONE AND LIMESTONE (TX-12). THE COLLEGE ENGAGES AND STRENGTHENS ITS COMMUNITY THROUGH STRONG EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS, BEST PRACTICES, COMMUNITY SERVICE, CULTURAL OPPORTUNITIES AND INTEGRITY.  
     MCC IS REQUESTING $71,865 AS A FINANCIAL INVESTMENT OF CNCS TO SUPPORT AN ESTIMATED 72 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN THE H.O.T. REGION PERFORMING PRIMARILY IN THE "FOCUS AREA" OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND THAT WILL BE PLACED IN PROGRAM SITES MEETING NEEDS ADDRESSING AGING IN PLACE AND NUTRITION. THESE OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE MEALS ON WHEELS AND 5 FOOD PANTRIES THAT ADDRESS THESE NEEDS. THE H.O.T. RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF 60.2% ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL GRANTEE RESOURCES AND A $95,000 ANTICIPATED EXCESS RESOURCE. 
   THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAU STATES THAT IN TEXAS, 11.7% OF THE POPULATION IS MADE UP OF SENIOR ADULTS AGE 60 AND ABOVE YET, IN THE CENTRAL TEXAS REGION OF H.O.T. RSVP, THIS NUMBER JUMPS TO 18.7 % AND IS ONLY EXPECTED TO RISE RAPIDLY.  TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR AGING CITIZENS, THIS PROJECT PLANS TO ADDRESS PRIMARY AREAS OF (H8) "AGING IN PLACE," ADDRESSING DELIVERY OF MEALS TO HOME BOUND FRAIL AND ELDERLY AND (H10) OBESITY AND FOOD, ADDRESSED THROUGH VOLUNTEER SUPPORT IN REGIONAL FOOD PANTRIES.  CURRENTLY, THIS SERVICE AREA IS ADDRESSED THROUGH THE CENTRAL TEXAS SENIOR MINISTRIES (CTSM) ORGANIZATION THAT DEPENDS ON VOLUNTEERS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OVER 5000 ISOLATED SENIOR ADULTS. THERE IS A WAITING LIST OF ALMOST 200 AT ANY GIVEN TIME. CTSM OFFICIALS STATE THAT VOLUNTEERS ARE THE CRITICAL COMPONENT TO SERVING THEIR CLIENTS AND WITHOUT NUTRITION, MOST WOULD IMMEDIATELY OR WILL NEED INSTITUTIONAL CARE WITHIN A FEW SHORT MONTHS. IN 2016, VOLUNTEERS DELIVERED 7,540,645 MEALS IN THIS REGION.  
       IN THE AREA OF (SC1) "COMMUNITY PRIORITIES," RSVP WILL MANAGE VOLUNTEERS IN SUCH PROGRAMS AS HOSPICE, EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY AND OMBUDSMAN SERVICES.   MCC HAS A LONG HISTORY OF STRONG MANAGEMENT, FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY, MEASURABLE IMPACT AND VISIONARY THINKING.  WITHOUT A SINGLE FEDERAL FINDING DURING MONITORING IN 20+ YEARS, MCC WAS RECENTLY AWARDED THREE CNCS AUGMENTATION GRANTS IN THE LAST YEAR TO ADDRESS DISASTER SERVICES AND, IF FUNDED, IS DEVELOPING A MOBILE VOLUNTEER CORPS THAT CAN TRAVEL TO SPECIFICALLY UNDER-SERVED AREAS OF NEED AND ASSIST COMMUNITIES DURING RECOVERY FOLLOWING A DISASTER.

FOR 23 YEARS MIDLAND RSVP HAS BEEN LOCALLY SPONSORED BY SENIOR LINK MIDLAND (SLM). SLM (FORMERLY COMMUNITY & SENIOR SERVICES) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT AGENCY USING A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEET THE RECOGNIZED NEEDS OF OUR OLDER POPULATION IN MIDLAND COUNTY. WITH A 35 YEAR HISTORY, SLM HAS A PROVEN TRACK RECORD OF EXCELLENCE AMONG THE LOCAL NON-PROFIT SECTOR AND CONTINUES TO STRIVE TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPABILITY OF ITS LARGEST SENIOR CORPS PROGRAM, MIDLAND RSVP. THE MISSION OF SLM TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES RELATED TO AGING AND DEVELOP EFFICIENT, FLEXIBLE AND COMPASSIONATE WAYS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY.
THROUGH RSVP, SLM EMPOWERS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO STEP UP AND ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF 38 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, AS WELL AS OTHER CRITICAL LOCAL NEEDS THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM THE SENIOR POPULATION INVOLVEMENT. ANNUALLY, AN ESTIMATED 510 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH MIDLAND RSVP WITH 250 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA. THEY WILL SERVE THE FRAIL, ELDERLY, HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED SENIORS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE MEALS-ON-WHEELS AND HOMEBOUND SERVICES THAT INCLUDE THE ANNUAL FUNDRAISER THE TEXAS-SIZE GARAGE SALE, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM AND GENERAL SERVICES FROM THE HANDYMAN PROGRAM. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA BEING ADDRESSED IS HEALTHY FUTURES (H8 AGING IN PLACE). RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP PACKAGE DAILY MEALS, DELIVER MEALS, MAKE VISITS, AND CONDUCT CHECK-IN CALLS THAT WILL IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL TIES. 
ANNUALLY, 200 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH MEALS-ON-WHEELS AND, 75 VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP HOMEBOUND SERVICES FUNDRAISER PROGRAM BY VOLUNTEERING FOR ANNUAL TEXAS-SIZE GARAGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $43,551 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ($34,674) IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES ($18,874) STATE GRANT AND GOLF TOURNAMENT FUNDRAISER-WHICH WAS $24,800 IN 2015 OF WHICH 10,800 WENT TOWARDS RSVP, WHILE SCP AND FGP RECEIVES 7,000 EACH).

GOLDEN TRIANGLE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) HAS BEEN PROVIDING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY, TEXAS FOR 44 YEARS. IN 2016, THERE WERE 586 VOLUNTEERS WITHIN RSVP THAT VOLUNTEERED AN AVERAGE OF 500 TO 1000 HOURS PER YEAR. RSVP SUPPORTS THE EFFORTS OF 50 DIVERSE NON-PROFIT AGENCIES IN THE THREE COUNTY AREA. RSVP IS THE ONLY AGENCY IN ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY TEXAS THAT PROVIDES VOLUNTEERS TO A DIVERSE, NON-PROFIT POPULATION. THE TOTAL COST OF THE GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP PROJECT WILL BE $375,563.00. WE ARE REQUESTING $212,013.00 FROM CNCS TO CONTINUE THE WORK OF GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP. THE APPLICANT SHARE WILL BE $163,550.00. GRANT FUNDS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS IN ORANGE, JEFFERSON AND HARDIN COUNTY TEXAS. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO PAY SALARY, AND FRINGE BENEFITS TO HELP WITH THE OVERHEAD OF THE OVERALL PROGRAM OF RSVP. 
AN ESTIMATED 520 COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WILL VOLUNTEER AND OF THIS NUMBER, 441 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN CORE PRIORITY ISSUE AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE SERVE AMERICA ACT WHERE CNCS FOCUSES NATIONAL SERVICE AND MEASURES ITS IMPACT. 
THESE AGENCIES INCLUDE SOUP KITCHENS THAT FEED THE HOMELESS DAILY, A HOSPITALITY CENTER THAT CLOTHES THE LESS-FORTUNATE, MAINTAINING COMMUNITY GARDENS, AND THE PUBLIC LIBRARY THAT OFFERS TUTORING SERVICES FOR GENERAL EDUCATION DEGREE (GED) AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL).
UNITED CHRISTIAN CARE CENTER(UCCC) UTILIZES 36 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AS THE ONLY PEOPLE WHO OPERATE THE ENTIRE FACILITY.  GLENN BRADLEY FROM UCCC SAYS ?WITHOUT RSVP, WE COULD NOT FUNCTION?.  THE REASON GOLDEN TRIANGLE RSVP IS NEEDED IS BECAUSE OF THE GROWING VOLUNTEER NEEDS OF NON-PROFIT AGENCIES ARE NOT BEING MET. MOST NON-PROFIT AGENCIES DO NOT HAVE THE FINANCIAL CAPABILITY TO PAY EMPLOYEES SO VOLUNTEERS ARE A NECESSITY TO HELP DELIVER SERVICES TO CLIENTS. VOLUNTEERS HELP REDUCE AND IN SOME CASES ELIMINATE EMPLOYEE COST AND OVERHEAD. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES; MEETING NEEDS WITHIN COMMUNITIES INCLUDING ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, AND ADDRESSING CHILDHOOD OBESITY. AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT RSVP ANTICIPATES THAT THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES AND AN INCREASE IN PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 47 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO AND VISITING WITH HOMEBOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS WITH ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE, SERVING AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES, MENTORING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS, AND BUILDING OR REPAIRING HOUSING FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT:  OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING DELIVERED MEALS AND VISITATION/COMPANIONSHIP FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND A GREATER PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL SUPPORT; CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND A GREATER PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL SUPPORT; INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING SERVICES FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY FOR THEIR HOUSEHOLD; ELEMENTARY STUDENTS RECEIVING MENTORING SERVICES FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; AND INDIVIDUALS WHO RECEIVE HOME BUILDING AND REPAIR SERVICES FROM RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TRANSITIONED INTO SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,355 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $36,458.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $141,619 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $69,383 WHICH INCLUDES NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND IN-KIND.

AN ESTIMATED 51 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 51 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS AND MANAGING VOLUNTEERS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 144 OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND 10 ORGANIZATIONS WILL IMPLEMENT AT LEAST THREE EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. RSVP OF TARRANT COUNTY, TO BE ADMINISTERED BY CORNERSTONE ASSISTANCE NETWORK, WILL RECRUIT AND PLACE AN ESTIMATED 95 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED IN TARRANT COUNTY, TEXAS.
