THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $90,530 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED LOCALLY BY $40,756 EACH YEAR.

AN ESTIMATED UNDUPLICATED 76 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, UNDUPLICATED 76 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS; TRANSPORTING ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS TO HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY SHOPPING, AND OTHER ESSENTIAL TRIPS NECESSARY TO INDEPENDENT LIVING; EDUCATING, ASSISTING, AND SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS REGARDING ABUSE, NEGLECT, AND EXPLOITATION; AND PREPARING TAXES FOR ELDERLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED; OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL BE UTILIZED FOR VOLUNTEERS SERVING VETERANS AND WHERE THERE ARE TOO FEW TO JUSTIFY A WORK PLAN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES H-8, AGING IN PLACE TO INCLUDE: FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, AND PREVENTION OF ELDER ABUSE. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE THAT 25% OF RECIPIENTS SURVEYED WILL REPORT AN OVERALL POSITIVE IMPACT ON THEIR SOCIAL TIES AND FEELINGS OF SATISFACTION WITH THEIR LIVES BECAUSE THEY WERE SERVED BY AN RSVP VOLUNTEER. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE REQUIRED 10% NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $7,500.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
FIFTY-SEVEN (57) UNDUPLICATED RSVP OF KAY COUNTY VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  TRANSPORTING THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED KAY COUNTY RESIDENTS TO NEEDED MEDICAL CARE, ASSISTING WITH MEDICARE AND PART D ENROLLMENT, DELIVERING NOURISHING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS AND THE DISABLED, BUILDING HANDICAP ACCESSIBILITY WHEELCHAIR RAMPS, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS WITH KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS BEHIND, SERVING AS TUTORS TO SUPPORT ADULTS WHO STRUGGLE TO READ AND WISH TO COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION, AND/OR THOSE WHO WANT TO LEARN TO SPEAK ENGLISH.   
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE--HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THIS GRANT, 360 (120/YEAR) ELDERLY AND DISABLED WILL RECEIVE DAILY MEALS AND 75% WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES, 60 (20/YEAR) ELDERLY AND DISABLED WILL RECEIVE RAMPS AND 75% WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES, 75 (25/YEAR) OF THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED WILL HAVE BEEN ABLE TO SEEK MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND 75% WILL REPORT ABILITY TO STAY IN THEIR HOMES LONGER AND PERCEIVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT 600 OF THE ELDERLY WILL HAVE RECEIVED SUPPORT WITH THEIR MEDICARE AND MEDICARE PART D NEEDS.    
OTHER FOCUS EFFORTS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT.  THROUGH THE EMPLOYMENT FOCUS AREA AT LEAST 27 ADULTS BY YEAR THREE OF THIS GRANT WILL BE ABLE TO READ SUCCESSFULLY AND CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATIONAL/WORK PATHWAY.  THROUGH THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA 60 KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS WILL HAVE SECURED ENOUGH SUPPORT TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN THEIR EDUCATIONAL EFFORTS.  
TO CONTINUE TO ENGAGE MORE FULLY THE RETIRED VOLUNTEERS OF OUR COMMUNITY, APPROXIMATELY 200 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE NEEDED FOR OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES IN KAY COUNTY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF  $56,639 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY  $21,920.00  PER YEAR IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 130 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  EXAMPLES OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR LOW-INCOME ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE NO LONGER ABLE TO DRIVE, AND PROVIDING FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED FOOD RESOURCES.  
     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE ACHIEVED:  500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTRIBUTE 312,000 SERVICE HOURS IN CNCS FOCUS/OTHER COMMUNITY AREAS.  70 OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE, DOOR-THROUGH-DOOR MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION TO 425 LOW-INCOME ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE NO LONGER ABLE TO DRIVE, AND 60 OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL DISTRIBUTE HEALTHY AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO 1,250 LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS THROUGH FOOD PANTRIES IN OKLAHOMA CITY, NORMAN, MOORE, AND MIDWEST CITY, OKLAHOMA.
     BASED ON THE 2016 INDEPENDENT SECTOR'S VOLUNTEER SERVICE WAGE VALUE FOR THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AT $21.50 PER HOUR, AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL GENERATE $6.7 MILLION DOLLARS WHILE MEETING THE MOST CRITICAL NEEDS IN OUR SERVICE AREA.  
     THE THREE-YEAR CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $900,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

INCA CURRENTLY OFFERS RSVP SERVICES IN CARTER, JOHNSTON AND MURRAY COUNTIES IN RURAL SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA SINCE 1985.  INCA-RSVP IS LOOKING TO EXPAND ITS SERVICE AREA TO INCLUDE THE ADDITIONAL RURAL NON-SERVED SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA COUNTIES OF ATOKA, COAL, GARVIN, LOVE, MARSHALL, AND PONTOTOC. 
OUR GOAL IS TO HAVE 120 VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE  WORKING IN FIFTEEN KEY OBJECTIVES OF WHICH NINE WILL HAVE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE 3 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WORKING WITH LOCAL HEAD START PROGRAMS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ASSISTANTS IN CLASSROOMS. ANOTHER EMPHASIS WILL BE TO HAVE 24 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS OFFERING TRANSPORTATION AND/OR COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIORS WHO ARE CONSIDERED AGING-IN-PLACE BY DOING A REGULAR CHECK IN, TRANSPORTING TO AND FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OFFERING ASSISTANCE WITH LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. INCA-RSVP WILL HAVE 6 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PARTNER WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS, AND CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS TO OFFER AN ENHANCED SUBSTANCE ABUSE EDUCATION PROGRAM IN THE PREVENTION OF OPIOID ABUSE. VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP TO PREPARE, PRESENT, AND DISTRIBUTE SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION INFORMATION TO AREA YOUTH. IN ADDITION, TO PROMOTE THE SAFETY AND WELFARE OF OLDER CITIZENS IN THE AREA, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL  EDUCATE THIS VULNERABLE POPULATION ON PROPER STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION TO AVOID BECOMING A TARGET OF THEFT AND/OR ABUSIVE TREATMENT. INCA-RSVP WILL HAVE 2 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS ASSIST LOW-INCOME FAMILIES WITH TAX PREPARATION THROUGH VITA PROGRAM. INCA-RSVP WILL HAVE 12 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WORKING CLOSELY WITH PROJECT STAFF TO SET GUIDELINES AND DEVELOP VOLUNTEER RESOURCES FOR RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF NEW VOLUNTEERS. WITH FOOD INSECURITY RATES BEING HIGH IN THE SIX COUNTIES, INCA-RSVP WILL STRIVE TO PLACE AN UNDUPLICATED NUMBER OF 6 VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL ASSIST IN FOOD PANTRY SERVICES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS DISASTER PREPAREDNESS BY EDUCATING AND MAKING INFORMATION ALONG WITH RESOURCES MORE ACCESSIBLE FOR THE HOME-BOUND AND ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS IN OUR COMMUNITIES. INCA-RSVP PLANS TO DO SO BY HAVING 15 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE  TRAINED TO INFORM OTHERS ON THE NECESSITIES OF SURVIVAL TECHNIQUES, WHICH INCLUDE WHAT TO DO IN CASE OF A DISASTER AND HOW TO HELP EACH OTHER. THESE EFFORTS WILL ALSO BE ENHANCED BY HAVING THE VOLUNTEERS CREATING AND DISTRIBUTING BE READY BAGS, OR SUPPLIES NEEDED IN CASE OF A CRISIS WHICH EITHER TRAPS THEM IN THEIR HOMES OR NECESSITATES FOR SHELTERING OUTSIDE THE HOME. 
OF THE ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS, 40 WILL BE UNDUPLICATED AND SERVE ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 210 CHILDREN WILL HAVE RECEIVED TUTORING AND MENTORING SERVICES, 100 ELDERLY OR DISABLED WILL HAVE RECEIVED COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, 700 PEOPLE WILL FEEL MORE FOOD SECURE, WE WILL HAVE RECRUITED AND TRAINED 120 NEW VOLUNTEERS TO THE CNCS FAMILY, 600 SENIOR OKLAHOMAN'S WILL BE MORE PREPARED TO FACE DISASTERS, 300 YOUTH WILL HAVE RECEIVED SUBSTANCE ABUSE EDUCATION, 100 PEOPLE WILL HAVE RECEIVED LOW-INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE, AND  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE WORKED WITH THE OKLAHOMA BLOOD INSTITUTE TO  INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE OBI TO COLLECT BLOOD;  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 80,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 14,041.

BRYAN COUNTY RSVP, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT, 501C3 SELF-SPONSORED PROGRAM WITH A GOVERNING BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ADVISORY BOARD. OUR MISSION IS TO LINK PERSON 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS AS WELL AS THE VOLUNTEER.  THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, AN ESTIMATED 250 RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES. THEY WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO VETERANS IN THE FORM OF TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL CENTER APPOINTMENTS AND HELP COMPLETING THE NECESSARY FORMS. THEY WILL ASSIST IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND CAPACITY BUILDING BY RECRUITING COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS. THEY WILL DELIVER MEALS ON WHEELS TO THE HOMEBOUND, HELP WITH BLOOD DRIVES, PREPARE TAXES, AND HELP WITH COATS FOR KIDS, AND NATIONAL DAY OF SERVICE AND REMEMBRANCE. ALL OF THIS WILL BE CARRIED OUT THROUGH A NETWORK OF 45 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. STATIONS INCLUDE: EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT, DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS, VETERANS OF FOREIGN WARS, HOSPITALS, HEAD START, SENIOR CITIZEN CENTERS MEALS ON WHEELS DELIVERY, VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA) SITE, CAPACITY BUILDING SITES AND OTHER COMMUNITY SITES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROGRAM IS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. AT THE END OF THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 1,200 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES, IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES.
BRYAN COUNTY RSVP IS REQUESTING $40,000.00 IN BUDGET SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR THESE ACTIVITIES. BRYAN COUNTY RSVP WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FEDERAL BUDGET WITH $41,055.00.

THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, INC. (COA).  THE COA IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) CORPORATION OPERATING AS A SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN LUNA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO SINCE 1976.  THE COA HAS BEEN THE LEADER IN IMPLEMENTING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS IN LUNA COUNTY WITH A STRONG MISSION OF PROMOTING INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVING DIGNITY, AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTY.  OUR ORGANIZATION ADVOCATES AND PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES TO OLDER, LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO HAVE HEALTH AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN A DIGNIFIED MANNER WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE COA CURRENTLY OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE THE SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT, SENIOR COMPANION AND RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.

FOR THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION'S RSVP PROJECT, AN ESTIMATED EIGHTY-ONE (81) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF "HEALTHY FUTURES" FOR OUR IDENTIFIED "PROGRAMMING FOR IMPACT" STATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE PROVIDING COORDINATION OF TRANSPORTATION FOR HEALTH CARE, FOOD PROVISIONS, AND ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSING AND UTILITY PROVISIONS.  

AT THE END OF A TWELVE MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THE THREE "PROGRAMMING FOR IMPACT" STATIONS WILL BE THE FOLLOWING:
 DEMING SENIOR CENTER:  PARTICIPANTS/CLIENTS RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS/GROCERY SHOPPING, ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESS TO FOOD RESOURCES AND HEALTHY AGING INITIATIVES TO INCLUDE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY.
 TRANSFORMING LUNA COUNTY (TLC): CLIENTS RECEIVE CRITICAL ASSISTANCE WITH HOUSING ISSUES, UTILITY EXPENSE AND FOOD.  THE NEED FOR THIS SERVICE IS CRITICAL FOR CLIENTS TO REMAIN IN THE COMFORT OF THEIR HOMES WITHOUT THE FEAR OF PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION.
 DEMING HELPING HANDS: CLIENTS RECEIVE CONTINUED ASSISTANCE WITH FOOD ISSUES.  NEW MEXICO IS 2ND IN THE NATION IN FOOD INSECURITIES.  CLIENTS WILL HAVE THE RELIEF OF KNOWING WHEN AND WHERE THEIR NEXT MEAL WILL COME FROM.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT TO THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM IS ZERO DOLLARS.  THE PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH STATE, LOCAL AND IN-KIND FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $49,418 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES).

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO (VOR) COMMUNITY CENTER (CC) DEPARTMENT, WHICH HAS SPONSORED THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SINCE 1994. THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO IS A MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT WITH A MAYOR AND COUNCIL ELECTED BY ITS RESIDENTS. 
MISSION STATEMENT: THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO IS A FULL SERVICE MUNICIPALITY GOVERNED BY THE PROVISIONS OF NEW MEXICO STATE LAW AND THE VILLAGE CODES. THE VILLAGE PROVIDES A WIDE VARIETY OF SERVICES TO ITS 8,005 FULL-TIME RESIDENTS ACCORDING TO THE 2012 U.S. CENSUS AND UP TO 30,000 PART-TIME RESIDENTS AND VISITORS ON MANY WEEKENDS AND HOLIDAYS. MUNICIPAL SERVICES ARE FINANCED THROUGH A VARIETY OF TAXES, FEES, CHARGES FOR SERVICES, UTILITY RATES, AND INTERGOVERNMENTAL ASSISTANCE. THE VILLAGE ADOPTS AN ANNUAL BUDGET AS THE PLAN FOR DELIVERY OF SERVICES IN MANAGING RESOURCES AND REVENUES TO SUPPORT THESE SERVICES. THE VISION OF THE RUIDOSO COMMUNITY CENTER, WHERE THE RSVP PROGRAM IS HOUSED, IS TO BE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT SUPPORTS HEALTHY LIVING TO POSITIVELY TRANSFORM LIVES. THE MISSION OF THE RUIDOSO COMMUNITY CENTER IS TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH, EMOTIONAL, SOCIAL, AND INTELLECTUAL WELL-BEING OF EVERYONE--BUT ESPECIALLY SENIOR ADULTS LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY. THROUGH DAILY PROGRAMMING AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHERS, SENIOR CITIZENS ARE OFFERED OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE IN VARIOUS ACTIVITIES IN A SAFE, FULFILLING ENVIRONMENT.
THE RSVP PROGRAM PROPOSES TO MAINTAIN APPROXIMATELY 170 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT 15 VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITH AT LEAST 20,000 HOURS OF SERVICE PER YEAR TO THE RUIDOSO AND THE LINCOLN COUNTY AREA.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOT MEAL DELIVERY TO ELDERLY HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS; DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD AND CLOTHING TO NEEDY INDIVIDUALS; TAX PREPARATION FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES; ASSISTANCE IN NURSING HOMES TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS; EDUCATION AND LITERACY THROUGH CULTURAL HERITAGE PROGRAMS AND LIBRARIES; AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH SAFE WATER, WILDLIFE, LAND AND VEGETATION.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, RSVP WILL PROVIDE HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH FOOD OR OTHER SERVICES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND WILL REPORT THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  APPROXIMATELY 12,000 MEALS WILL BE DELIVERED TO 40 HOMEBOUND ELDERLY ADULTS, WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  RSVP WILL REPORT THAT 300 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVED EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES OR OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND 100 OF THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT INVESTMENT OF $35,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $30,329 FROM THE VILLAGE OF RUIDOSO.

SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SCSVP), LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS ARE ALSO SPONSORED BY SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. SANDOVAL COUNTY IS DIVERSE IN GEOGRAPHY, CULTURES AND PEOPLE.  THE SENIOR POPULATION IS A MICROCOSM OF THE LARGER DIVERSE POPULATION, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING OF WHITE RACE, FOLLOWED BY NATIVE AMERICAN AND A MUCH SMALLER AFRICAN AMERICAN RACE, WITH ALMOST HALF OF HISPANIC ETHNICITY. THE SCSVP PROPOSES TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE RSVP PROGRAM WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITY, HELP SENIORS MEET BASIC FOOD AND OTHER DAILY NEEDS AND INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE SERVICES THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ARE DELIVERY OF FOOD, REFERRALS FOR ACCESS TO FOOD AND NUTRITION TRAINING, BLANKETS AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN THE COMMUNITIES OF BERNALILLO, PENA BLANCA, PLACITAS, CORRALES, RIO RANCHO, JEMEZ VALLEY AND CUBA, NM. ADDITIONAL SERVICES WILL BE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT WHICH INCLUDES GREETING CLIENTS, RECEIVING, ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AND CLEAN UP.  
A COMMUNITY PRIORITY THAT WAS IDENTIFIED AND IN NEED OF INTERVENTION IS IMPROVING LITERACY FOR ADULTS AND CHILDREN WITHIN THE COUNTY.  THE SERVICES THE RSPV PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE TO ADDRESS IMPROVING LITERACY ARE VOLUNTEERING AT LOCAL LIBRARIES AND A LITERACY PROGRAM AND A PEN PAL PROGRAM WITH MIDDLE SCHOOL CHILDREN.  AN ESTIMATED TWO HUNDRED AND TWENTY VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES IN THE RSVP PROGRAM. APPROXIMATELY ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, FOCUSING ON AGING IN PLACE, FOOD INSECURITY, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND SOCIAL CONTACT AND APPROXIMATELY 45 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTPUT ASSIGNMENTS FOCUSING ON IMPROVING LITERACY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR TERM THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL BE 200 SENIORS RECEIVE FOOD, BLANKETS, SOCIAL CONTACT AS WELL AS NUTRITION INFO, EDUCATION AND REFERRALS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR TERM THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUT FOR SUPPORTING FOOD BANKS WILL HAVE BEEN MET.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE CURRY COUNTY RETIRED & SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. 
WE HAVE CHOSEN HEALTHY FUTURES AS OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WHERE 40 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.
HEALTHY FUTURES:
OUR GOAL IS TO PLACE FORTY (40) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES FOR THE THREE-YEAR PERFORMANCE PERIOD. OBJECTIVES WERE SELECTED TO ALIGN WITH COMMUNITY NEED.
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
?	DELIVERING NUTRITIOUS MEALS WITH THE GOAL OF ASSISTING THE HOMEBOUND TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, AID IN AGING IN PLACE AND IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH.
?	INCREASING ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOODS BY DISTRIBUTING USDA COMMODITIES TO LOW INCOME ELDERLY AND FAMILIES IN ORDER TO ADDRESS HUNGER, FOOD INSECURITY, AND PREVENT OBESITY DUE TO INADEQUATE DIETS AND IMPROVE OVERALL HEALTH OF THOSE SERVED.
?	WORKING AT FOOD BANKS, PANTRIES, AND LOCAL MEAL SITES WHERE NUTRITIOUS FOOD AND/OR MEALS ARE SERVED TO THE PUBLIC AT EITHER FREE OR REDUCED PRICE.
?	PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, SENIOR CENTERS, MEAL SITES, FOR THE HOMEBOUND IN OUTLYING VILLAGES 
OTHER FOCUS AREAS:
1.	ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY:
FOUR (2) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.  THEY WILL ASSIST LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY WHO NEED ASSISTANCE IN PREPARING THEIR OWN TAX RETURNS.
1.	VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES:
TWO (2) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE.
SERVING AT FREEDOM FOUNDATION OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO, A NONPROFIT AGENCY WHO PROVIDE HOUSING FOR HOMELESS VETERANS AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES FOR VETERANS.
SERVING AT CANNON AIR FORCE BASE READINESS FAMILY CENTER ASSISTING MILITARY SERVICE MEMBERS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
AN ESTIMATED TOTAL ONE HUNDRED (86) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. 
2.	OTHER COMMUNITIES PRIORITIES:
THE REMAINDER FORTY EIGHT (42) WILL SERVE IN NON-PROFIT 501 C-3 ORGANIZATIONS IN CURRY COUNTY WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE AT THEIR ASSIGNED WORK STATIONS THAT WILL IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THE PUBLIC SERVED AND/OR ASSIST THE WORK STATIONS IN ACHIEVING THEIR SHORT AND LONG TERM GOALS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OVER THE 3-YEAR GRANT PERIOD IS $120, 000 ($40,000 PER YEAR X 3). THIS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL $66,222 (OR $22,074 PER YEAR) RESOURCES.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE (COA) DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS (DSA).  BERNALILLO COUNTY (BC) OFFERS SENIORS 50+ SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE WHILE OFFERING A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR ACTIVE TO FRAIL ADULTS.  PROGRAMS PROMOTE BOTH HEALTHY AGING AND INDEPENDENT LIVING THAT MEET THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF SENIORS IN THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY AREA.  COA DSA OPERATES SENIOR CENTERS, MULTIGENERATIONAL CENTERS, SPORTS/FITNESS CENTERS, MEAL SITES, HOME SERVICES, INFORMATION & ASSISTANCE SERVICES, AND A CENTRAL KITCHEN. THE VISION OF THE DSA IS TO BE THE COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS INVOLVES SENIORS IN CREATING AND SUSTAINING A COMMUNITY WHERE THERE IS A GROWING SPIRIT OF INTERDEPENDENCE THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE. THE MISSION OF DSA IS TO BE A COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, INVOLVES SENIORS AND PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN CREATING A COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL, SHARE THEIR WISDOM, MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE, AND LIVE WITH DIGNITY.  
RSVP WILL PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED 800 VOLUNTEERS TO THE ALBUQUERQUE AND BERNALILLO COUNTY METROPOLITAN AREA TO SUPPORT APPROXIMATELY 74 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND ASSISTING WITH ENROLLMENT OF NEW PARTICIPANTS AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES; WORKING AT SENIOR CENTERS TO PROVIDE CLASSES AND ACTIVITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS TO INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT; WORKING AT THE SILVER HORIZONS MOBILE FOOD PANTRIES AT SENIOR CENTERS; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, TRIPS TO THE PHARMACY AND THE GROCERY STORE; DELIVERING HOT MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; TUTORING KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS ONE HOUR A WEEK DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL PROVIDE 2,500 INDIVIDUALS WITH SUPPORT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER, AND WILL HAVE REPORTED THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE RSVP WILL REPORT 1,000 OLDER ADULTS WHO HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. APPROXIMATELY 1,100 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE A HOME DELIVERED MEAL OR TRANSPORTATION THAT ALLOWS THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT OF $44,223 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,020 FROM THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND $168,569 FROM THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS.

AN ESTIMATED 65 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY.  OF THIS NUMBER, 49 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM-HEAD START, COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND FOOD COLLECTION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ADDRESSED THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE OUTCOMES; NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS, NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT REPORTED INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. 
THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC). COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER IS A NON-PROFIT MULTI-SERVICE CENTER THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY SINCE 1965, HOSTING THE RSVP SINCE 1981. THE CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES AND EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES, AND THE ELDERLY OF PORTALES AND ROOSEVELT COUNTY.  THE SENIOR PROGRAMS TOUCH EACH OF THESE GROUPS, AS SENIORS OFFER THEIR LIFE-LONG KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE TO HELP OTHERS IN NEED WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITY.  THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM?S VOLUNTEERS ARE ACTIVE IN SERVING LOW-INCOME CHILDREN/FAMILIES, HOMEBOUND AND OR DISABLED SENIORS, AND ROOSEVELT COUNTY RESIDENTS BY PROVIDING THEIR SERVICE IN THE HEAD START PROGRAM AND PARTICIPATING IN COMMUNITY SERVICE ACTIVITIES; VOLUNTEERING IN HOSPITALS AND NURSING HOMES.  THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AND THOSE THEY SERVE EXPERIENCE GREATER INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM THAT ENABLES THEM BOTH TO CONTINUE CONTRIBUTING TO THEIR ENVIRONMENT.
THE MISSION OF COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC) IS TO PROVIDE ON-GOING OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPOWER ALL OF THE PEOPLE OF ROOSEVELT COUNTY TO COLLABORATE IN REDUCING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS.  THIS ENLIGHTENED CONCEPT WILL BECOME THE NORM OF THE COMMUNITY.

FOOD INSECURITY, ACADEMIC STRUGGLES, AND AN INCREASING POPULATION OF SENIORS FACING NEW CHALLENGES - THESE ARE JUST A FEW ISSUES THAT MANY NEW MEXICANS FACE IN THEIR DAILY LIVES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS DEDICATE MUCH OF THEIR TIME TO HELP TACKLE THESE PROBLEMS AND MANY MORE, THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE MISSION OF OUR SPONSOR, THE CITY OF SANTA FE DIVISION OF SENIOR SERVICES IS TO ENCOURAGE AND ASSIST SENIORS IN MAINTAINING ACTIVE, HEALTHY LIFESTYLES THAT ENABLE THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, AND RSVP SANTA FE VOLUNTEERS DEFINITELY ASSIST IN MEETING THIS GOAL.
A PROJECTED 400 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ESSENTIAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO RESIDENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT SANTA FE COUNTY, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING WITHIN SANTA FE, THE CITY; AND OF THIS NUMBER THERE WILL BE [AT MINIMUM] 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES WILL INCLUDE:  PROVIDING EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE AND REFERRALS; TRANSPORTING HOMEBOUND SENIORS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO APPOINTMENTS OR ASSISTING WITH ERRANDS; SPENDING TIME WITH SENIORS WITH A GOAL OF INCREASING SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT; SERVING AS A BENEFITS COUNSELOR TO PROVIDE SENIORS WITH INFORMATION ON HEALTH AND BENEFITS PROGRAMS AND ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE; MENTORING OR TUTORING YOUTH AND ADULTS; AND ASSISTING WITH ADULT BASIC LITERACY AND TAX OR FINANCIAL LITERACY. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. UPON COMPLETION OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP WILL HAVE ENHANCED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS OF MORE THAN 300 INDIVIDUALS, AND IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY FOR MORE THAN 800 INDIVIDUALS IN SANTA FE COUNTY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,000 IN NEW MEXICO STATE FUNDS AND $62,044 IN LOCAL CITY FUNDS.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT, THE CHAVES COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS FOUNDATION, INC., HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY MANAGING RSVP SINCE IT BECAME AN INCORPORATED NON-PROFIT AND SPONSORING AGENCY IN 1991.  PRIOR TO THAT TIME, THE BOARD MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION HAD SERVED AS THE ADVISORY COUNCIL TO THE RSVP PROJECT SINCE 1975.  THE MISSION OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO SUPPORT THE RSVP PROJECT BY ENCOURAGING AN ACTIVE LIFESTYLE FOR THOSE 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER BY OFFERING QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WHILE MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS.  
AN ESTIMATED 130 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.   OF THIS NUMBER AT LEAST 55 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE COMMUNITY NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED INCLUDE PROVIDING FOOD BOXES TO THE ELDERLY, UNEMPLOYED AND DISADVANTAGED; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR VETERANS; PROVIDING SUPPORT TO VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES; BUILDING HOMES FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES; AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF NON-PROFITS IN THE COMMUNITY BY RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS AND GARNERING DONATIONS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE CHAVES COUNTY RSVP ANTICIPATES THAT AT LEAST 1,500 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY; AT LEAST THREE HOMES WILL BE BUILT HOUSING AT LEAST 12 INDIVIDUALS; 180 FAMILIES OF VETERANS WILL BE PROVIDED SUPPORT; 100 VETERANS WILL BE DRIVEN TO HOSPITALS AND/OR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS; AND CAPACITY FOR OTHER NON-PROFITS WILL BE INCREASED BY GARNERING DONATIONS TO RAISE $3000 IN THRIFT SHOP SALES.  THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $52,810 PER YEAR WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,780 PER YEAR OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
IN THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT PERIOD OF THREE YEARS, AT LEAST 130 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED, TRAINED, AND PLACED IN STATIONS THAT ARE ALIGNED WITH THE CNCS STRATEGIC INITIATIVES.   THE SERVICE CATEGORIES TO BE ADDRESSED INCLUDE:  HEALTHY FUTURES--OBESITY AND FOOD:  FOOD DISTRIBUTION; ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY--HOUSING: BUILDING OR ASSISTING HOMES; VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES--SUPPORT VETERANS IN RURAL COMMUNITIES AND ASSISTING VETERANS WITH TRANSPORTATION; AND CAPACITY BUILDING:  GARNERING DONATIONS AND RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS.
THE RESEARCH-BASED METHODS TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDE: ATTENDANCE LOGS, ACTIVITY LOGS, PRE AND POST SURVEYS, ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENT TOOLS, AND QUESTIONNAIRES.  EACH OF THE INSTRUMENTS WILL BE BASED ON "BEST PRACTICES" IDENTIFIED ON THE NATIONAL SERVICE KNOWLEDGE NETWORK.

AT RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP), WE FEEL IT IS OUR PURPOSE TO INSPIRE RESIDENTS, AGE 55 OR OLDER AND LIVING IN OTERO COUNTY, NEW MEXICO, TO SHARE THEIR TIME, LIFE EXPERIENCES AND TALENTS TO HELP MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY.  AN ESTIMATED 375 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN 60 PLUS ACTIVE WORKSITES THROUGHOUT OUR COUNTY.  ORGANIZATIONS THAT BENEFIT FROM OUR VOLUNTEERS DEDICATION INCLUDE HEALTH EDUCATION AND ACCESS RESOURCES, PROGRAMS DEDICATED TO VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND HEALTHY FUTURES, SPECIFICALLY FOOD SERVICE, WHICH IS ONE OF OUR COMMUNITIES? MOST PRESSING NEEDS.  NEW MEXICO REMAINS NEAR THE TOP OF THE LIST FOR SENIOR HUNGER AND LOCAL SURVEYS INDICATE THAT THE NEED FOR FOOD SERVICE FOR OUR SENIOR POPULATION REMAINS HIGH WHILE THE LOSS OF THIS SERVICE REFLECTS THEIR GREATEST FEAR.  
WE HAVE CHOSEN TO CONTINUE TO CONCENTRATE ON TWO FOCUS AREAS ? HEALTHY FUTURES AND VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES.  AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, MORE THAN 80% OF OUR SENIOR POPULATION WILL HAVE A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE DUE TO THE SERVICES AND INTERVENTION OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE THROUGHOUT OUR COMMUNITY.  THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $42,914 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN EXPECTED $63,000 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING AND INCLUDE STATE FUNDS, LOCAL CITY FUNDS AND LOCAL GRANTS.  OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE AN INVALUABLE ASSET TO OUR COMMUNITY.  THEY PROVIDE SERVICES, EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, THAT IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR MANY IN OUR COUNTY; SERVICES THAT COMMUNITY BUDGETS CANNOT AFFORD TO PROVIDE BUT ARE VITAL TO THE WELL-BEING OF THE PEOPLE WE SERVE.

AN ESTIMATED 375 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 353 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL BE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN ST. LOUIS CITY, ST. LOUIS COUNTY AND ST. CHARLES COUNTY, RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, AND COACHING CHILDREN IN K-3 GRADES HEALTHY LIFELONG HABITS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUT OF 706 K-3 STUDENTS, 413 WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AS MEASURED BY READING ASSESSMENTS USED BY THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS SUCH AS FOUNTAS AND PINNELL, GATES MCGINITIE, OR IREADY DIAGNOSTIC. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $115,628 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $49,697 FROM FUNDING FROM CORPORATIONS AND FOUNDATIONS. THE OASIS INSTITUTE (OASIS), A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION, IS PROPOSING TO CONTINUE A SENIOR CORPS RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN ST. LOUIS CITY, ST. LOUIS COUNTY AND ST. CHARLES COUNTY IN MISSOURI. THE MISSION OF OASIS IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY AGING THROUGH LIFELONG LEARNING, ACTIVE LIFESTYLES, AND VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT. THE OASIS ST. LOUIS RSVP PROGRAM WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 375 VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 AND OLDER BY THE THIRD YEAR OF PROGRAM OPERATIONS. BUILDING ON ITS PROVEN MODEL AND EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS, OASIS WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND ACADEMICALLY AT-RISK CHILDREN. THERE IS CONSENSUS AMONG EDUCATION EXPERTS THAT IT IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT FOR CHILDREN TO READ AT GRADE LEVEL BY THE END OF THIRD GRADE. RESEARCH HAS DEMONSTRATED THE CORRELATION BETWEEN A STUDENT'S READING ABILITY AT THIS POINT AND HIS OR HER SUBSEQUENT ACADEMIC SUCCESS. THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS IN MISSOURI INCLUDING STUDENTS IN THE SERVICE AREA OF THE OASIS ST. LOUIS RSVP PROGRAM FAIL TO MEET THIS BENCHMARK. ON THE ENGLISH/LANGUAGE ARTS PORTION OF THE 2016 MISSOURI ASSESSMENT PROGRAM (MAP), 57.8 PERCENT OF ALL THIRD GRADERS IN THE STATE FELL BELOW THE PROFICIENT LEVEL. THE OASIS ST. LOUIS RSVP PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO MEET THE CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEED OF IMPROVING STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY WHILE STRENGTHENING SCHOOL COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE PRESENCE OF CARING, WELL- TRAINED, OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS. TO MEET THIS NEED, OVER THE COURSE OF THREE YEARS, OASIS WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE AT LEAST 375 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WITH 353 SERVING DIRECTLY IN SCHOOLS (VOLUNTEER STATIONS) PROVIDING LITERACY TUTORING AND SUPPORT TO 706 STUDENTS. OF THE STUDENTS BEING SERVED BY YEAR THREE, 90% OR 635 STUDENTS WILL COMPLETE THE PROGRAM AND 65% OF STUDENTS OR 413 STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AS MEASURED BY PRE- AND POST-TESTS.  OVER THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE MORE THAN 30,091 HOURS OF SERVICE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
INTERFAITH COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. (INTERSERV) IS A 108 YEAR OLD HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY BRINGING PEOPLE TOGETHER IN SERVICE AND ADVOCACY TO HELP CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES AND SENIORS LIVE LIFE MORE FULLY AND CAPABLY.  THREE COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST MISSOURI ARE SERVED, INCLUDING THE CITY OF ST. JOSEPH.  THEY WILL HAVE 130 VOLUNTEERS WITH A REQUESTED ALLOCATION OF $40,000, WHILE INTERSERV WILL LEVERAGE RESOURCES TO PROVIDE AN ADDITIONAL $49,873.  HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE CHOSEN PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, WHERE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING IN CAPACITIES INCLUDING: FOOD SECURITY, HEALTH ACCESSIBILITY AND AGING IN PLACE.  OUTCOMES FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE MET BY IMPLEMENTING AND PROMOTING VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMPANIONSHIP AND FOOD DELIVERY, WHICH WILL ASSIST HOMEBOUND AND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, SO THAT THEY REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  ADDITIONALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FOOD PANTRIES WITH BOTH ACQUISITION AND DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD, WITH THE OUTCOME ACHIEVED OF INCREASING FOOD SECURITY WITHIN FAMILIES WHO RECEIVE THE SERVICES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST SENIORS WITH HEALTHCARE ACCESSIBILITY BY COUNSELING CLIENTS THROUGH MEDICARE PART D ENROLLMENTS.

RSVP IS HOUSED UNDER THE CITIZENS' AFFAIRS DEPARTMENT AND COLLABORATES DIRECTLY WITH JEFFERSON COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS (JEFFCAP) TO FULFILL ITS MISSION OF EMPOWERING AS MANY FAMILIES OF JEFFERSON PARISH, INCLUDING OUR ELDERLY, DISABLED, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND YOUTH THROUGH OUR VARIOUS PROGRAMS. CITIZENS' AFFAIRS COORDINATES ALL THE FACTORS NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE AGING POPULATION OF JEFFERSON PARISH. THE DEPARTMENT ALSO ADDRESSES THE NEEDS OF CONSTITUENTS WITH DISABILITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT. 
AN ESTIMATED 400 VOLUNTEERS CONTINUE TO SERVE JEFFERSON PARISH RSVP. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 400 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD HEALTHY FUTURES, DISASTER SERVICES, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE HEALTHY FUTURES. THE SPECIFIC PROJECT ADDRESSED IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS HAVE INCREASED THE INDIVIDUAL NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT REPORTED INCREASED FOOD SECURITY. THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE RSVP PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS IMITATIVE WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING SUPPORTED SERVICES AND FOOD SECURITY BY UTILIZING FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES OR OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $51,046 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,909, FROM CITIZENS' AFFAIRS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MISSION OF ST. CHARLES PARISH IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY, EFFICIENT SERVICES TO SUSTAIN AND ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF ST. CHARLES PARISH.  IN KEEPING WITH THIS MISSION, THE PURPOSE OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IS TO ENABLE OLDER AMERICANS, AGE 55 AND OVER, TO STRENGTHEN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE, ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THE VOLUNTEERS AND THOSE WHOM THEY SERVE, AND PROVIDE COMMUNITIES VALUABLE SERVICES. 
THIS YEAR AN ESTIMATED 340 RSVP VOLUNTEERS AT 40 STATIONS WILL PROVIDE A VARIETY OF INVALUABLE SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE RIVER PARISHES (ST. CHARLES, ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, AND ST. JAMES PARISHES). THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RIVER PARISHES RSVP PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN THIS AREA INCLUDE FOOD BANK AND FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES FOR SENIORS. OTHER FOCUS AREAS THE RSVP CONTRIBUTES TO INCLUDE  ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, DISASTER SERVICES, VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THESE AREAS WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, TRAINING, AND MOCK EMERGENCY EVACUATION TRAININGS. THESE ACTIVITIES ALONG WITH NUMEROUS OTHERS WILL TOUCH THE LIVES OF OVER 15,000 TRI-PARISH CITIZENS EVERY YEAR.
ST. CHARLES PARISH IS REQUESTING $54,900 IN ANNUAL FEDERAL FUNDING. THIS AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $185,000 DEDICATED FROM ST. CHARLES PARISH AND ANNUAL DONATIONS OF $20,000 FROM ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST PARISH AND $12,000 FROM THE UNITED WAY OF ST. CHARLES, AS WELL AS OTHER IN-KIND DONATIONS.  
IN 2015, VOLUNTEERS LOGGED A TOTAL OF 75,166.25 HOURS OF SERVICE AND THE RSVP ADMINISTRATORS ANTICIPATE MEETING OR EXCEEDING THAT LEVEL OF SERVICE IN 2017.  NEW CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS ARE LIKELY TO CREATE NEW STATIONS AND GARNER NEW PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES IN THE RIVER PARISHES.  THE RSVP ALSO PLANS TO PROVIDE THE SAME FULFILLING OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEERS.  THE VARIOUS ACTIVITIES THE VOLUNTEERS PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ORGANIZATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS AND THE PARTNERSHIPS OFFER MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE AND IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE RIVER PARISHES.

THE MENTAL HEALTH ASSOCIATION OF SOUTH CENTRAL KANSAS (MHA) IS REQUESTING FUNDING TO BEGIN THE RSVP PROGRAM IN SUMNER COUNTY, KANSAS. THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER AND ASSIST YOUTH, FAMILIES, AND ADULTS IN OUR COMMUNITY TO ACHIEVE OPTIMAL MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY AND SERVICE. THE VISION IS ACHIEVEMENT OF A JUST, HUMANE, AND HEALTHY SOCIETY WHERE ALL PEOPLE ARE TREATED WITH RESPECT, DIGNITY, AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL FREE FROM STIGMA AND PREJUDICE.
 MHA IS REQUESTING $106,309 IN SUPPORT OF 106 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IS $10,635. THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL USE THESE FUNDS IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES: ACCESS TO CARE, AGING IN PLACE, AND OBESITY, WITH A SECONDARY FOCUS OF FOOD AND EDUCATION: SCHOOL READINESS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET THE NEEDS OF HOME-BOUND AND SENIORS WITH DISABILITIES, INCLUDING VETERANS, AS WELL AS AT-RISK, LOW-INCOME AND CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING RSVP PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES. MEETING THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL ALLOW DISABLED SENIORS, INCLUDING VETERANS OF WAR AND AT-RISK VULNERABLE SENIORS WHO NEED HELP AT HOME TO EXPERIENCE INCREASED SELF-EFFICACY AND THE ABILITY TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME. CHILDREN WILL INCREASE THEIR SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS, IMPROVE THEIR ATTITUDES TOWARD SCHOOL, AND BUILD THE SKILLS NECESSARY FOR A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE. CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES WILL ALLOW THE PROGRAM TO QUICKLY GROW INTO AN EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WITH STRONG OUTCOMES FOR CHILDREN, SENIORS, AND THE COMMUNITY OVERALL.

AN ESTIMATED 124 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 52 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 75 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 
$17,960 IN LOCAL MATCH DOLLARS.

ORGANIZATION: HIGH COUNTRY RSVP
SPONSOR ORGANIZATION (LEGAL APPLICANT): COLORADO MOUNTAIN COLLEGE (CMC)
COLORADO MOUNTAIN COLLEGE IS A COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THEIR MISSION IS TO CREATE A BETTER FUTURE FOR OUR STUDENTS, EMPLOYEES AND COMMUNITIES.
AN ESTIMATED 192 HIGH COUNTRY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. 
SOME OF RSVP'S SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVING LUNCH AT THE SEVEN SENIOR MEAL SITES, COUNSELING SENIORS ON THEIR MEDICARE AND HEALTH INSURANCE NEEDS, PREPARING AND FILING TAXES FOR SENIORS, THE DISABLED AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS, HELPING SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITH HOME REPAIRS, DELIVERING MEALS TO THE HOMEBOUND AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO THE NEEDY.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 180 VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 12,000 CLIENTS AND CONTRIBUTED APPROXIMATELY 75,000 HOURS OF SERVICE. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $47,705 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,689.00

AN ESTIMATED 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE SENIORS, HOME BOUND SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PEOPLE OF HISPANIC ORIGIN. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR RECIPIENTS TO ESSENTIAL MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING, AS WELL AS BASIC SOCIAL SERVICES AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HELP THEM AVOID ISOLATION WHILE AGING AT HOME WITH SAFETY, DIGNITY AND INDEPENDENCE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE 85% OF RECIPIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. PARTICULAR EFFORT WILL BE MADE TO REACH AND EXPAND SERVICES TO UNDER-SERVED INDIVIDUALS BILINGUAL IN ENGLISH AND SPANISH. 
FOR THE FIRST YEAR, 10 MONTH FUNDING PERIOD, CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $103,770 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,006 IN MATCHING, NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE EXPERIENCE MATTERS (EM) MISSION FOCUSES ON CONNECTING THE SKILLS AND TALENTS OF EXPERIENCED ADULT VOLUNTEERS WITH THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO BUILD A STRONGER, MORE VIBRANT COMMUNITY. WE PREPARE AND CONNECT EXPERIENCED ADULTS AGE 55+ TO MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WITH A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOLS AND OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTIONS IN MARICOPA COUNTY. WORKING WITH ONE OF THE LEADING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS, ENCORE.ORG, WE ARE AT THE FOREFRONT IN THE NATIONAL MOVEMENT TO TRANSFORM MODELS OF COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT AND HEALTHY AGING. EM SENIOR CORPS RSVP PROGRAMMATIC GOALS CLOSELY ALIGN WITH ENCORE.ORG NEW NATIONAL CAMPAIGN GENERATION TO GENERATION, WHERE WE HAVE DEVELOPED INNOVATIVE PARTNERSHIPS THAT MOBILIZE OLDER ADULTS TO SUPPORT YOUNG PEOPLE IN A VARIETY OF AREAS.  OVER THE LAST FIVE YEARS, EM HAS PLACED NEARLY 1,000 INDIVIDUALS AGE 50+ IN OVER 500 SOCIAL PURPOSE ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH OUR VARIOUS MATCHING PROGRAMS.  EM IS THE CONDUIT CONNECTING THE SKILLS, TALENTS AND PASSION OF THESE INDIVIDUALS TO BUILD CAPACITY AND RESOURCES IN THE SOCIAL SECTOR.  EM VIEWS SENIOR CORPS RSVP AS A POWERFUL PATHWAY FOR OLDER ADULTS TO ENGAGE IN, STRENGTHEN AND BUILD RESILIENCY IN OUR COMMUNITY.  SINCE 2014, EM HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE RSVP PROGRAM THAT ENCOMPASSES THE GREATER PHOENIX AREA AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF PHOENIX.  OUR PLAN IS TO CONTINUE THE PROGRAMMATIC COMPONENTS THAT HAVE BEEN HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL IN TERMS OF OUTCOMES, PARTNERSHIPS AND INTERGENERATIONAL VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT.  THE MARICOPA COUNTY CENSUS POPULATION WAS 4,167,947 (2015) WITH 14.2% OF RESIDENTS 65+ YEARS. BY 2020, IT IS PROJECTED THAT 25% OF MARICOPA COUNTY RESIDENTS WILL BE 65+ YEARS. THE SERVICE AREA FOR THE PROPOSED PROGRAM INCLUDES MARICOPA COUNTY CITIES EXCEPT TEMPE, MESA, CHANDLER, GILBERT, GUADALUPE AND QUEEN CREEK -- FROM HERE ON WILL BE REFERRED TO AS MARICOPA COUNTY.  THIS MARICOPA COUNTY REGION IS CURRENTLY SERVED BY EM.  APPROXIMATELY 13% OF THE POPULATION IN THIS SERVICE AREA ARE INDIVIDUALS 65 AND OLDER. FOR THE PROPOSED RSVP PROJECT, WE ANTICIPATE AN ESTIMATED 190 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 130 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE FOCUSED IN TWO AREAS.  EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS) WHICH INCLUDES SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED TUTORING/MENTORING IN EARLY LITERACY, MATH AND COLLEGE AND CAREER READINESS AND HEALTHY FUTURES (AGING IN PLACE) WHICH INCLUDES TRANSPORTATION AND FOOD DELIVERY.   THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE AT LEAST 80% OF THE STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THE SCHOOL-BASED EARLY LITERACY AND MATH TUTORING WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $95,034 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,720 FOR THE GRANT PERIOD.

STUTTGART CHAMBER OF COMMERCE WAS FOUNDED IN 1940 AS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION WITH THE MISSION OF PUTTING STUTTGART ON THE MAP.  IN ITS MORE THAN 70 YEARS AS AN ADVOCATE OF AREA BUSINESS, THE CHAMBER HAS ESTABLISHED STUTTGART AS AN ECONOMIC LEADER IN SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS.  YOU COULD SAY THE CHAMBER WORKS ON THOSE ISSUES THAT AFFECT THE "QUALITY OF LIFE" IN OUR COMMUNITY WITH VOLUNTEERS BEING A CRITICAL PIECE IN OUR COMMUNITY.
SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP SPONSOR SERVES STUTTGART, PINE BLUFF, ARKANSAS COUNTY, AND JEFFERSON COUNTY IN ALL SERVICE CATEGORIES WITH THE MAJORITY OF THE 671 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION, DISASTER TRAINING, VETERANS, MILITARY FAMILIES, AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. SEARSVP UNDERSTANDS THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND CONTINUES TO IDENTIFY, AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS TO MEET THOSE NEEDS WHILE SUCCESSFULLY PLACING VOLUNTEERS INTO ESSENTIAL COMPONENTS THAT IMPACT THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS IN A WAY THAT COMPLIMENTS THE VISION OF SENIOR CORP.  THE US DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE ANNUAL REPORT RELEASED ON SEPTEMBER 5, 2013, RANKED ARKANSAS FIRST IN LOW FOOD SECURITY AND WITH THE FEDERAL NUTRITION PROGRAM NOT REACHING ALL FOOD-INSECURE PEOPLE, THIS SHOWS THE IMPORTANT ROLE OF CHARITABLE HUNGER RELIEF PROGRAMS IN ARKANSAS.
AN ESTIMATED 120 RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN MONROE AND PHILLIPS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST REGION OF ARKANSAS, A RURAL AREA TYPICALLY KNOWN AS THE "ARKANSAS DELTA".  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY$23,229 TOTAL BUDGET OF $$93,229.
SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT AN RSVP PROGRAM IN MONROE AND PHILLIPS COUNTY, IN ARKANSAS BEGINNING JULY 1, 2017.  SEARSVP WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN AND PLACE 120 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, 55 AND OLDER, BY THE THIRD YEAR OF THE PROGRAM.  SEARSVP HAS INTENTIONALLY CHOSEN THESE COUNTIES DUE TO THEIR LOCATION, WITHIN 100 MILES OF THE SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP DIRECTOR AND PROGRAM MAIN OFFICE AND THEIR EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS ALREADY ESTABLISHED WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS. SEARSVP BUILDING ON THEIR EXPERTISE IN ENGAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS WHILE BUILDING ON AN EVIDENCE BASED WORK PLAN MODEL THROUGH EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH UNITED WAY OF SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS, AMERICAN RED CROSS, OFFICE OF EMERGENCY SERVICES, TRI DELTA FOOD MINISTRIES AND THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY COMMISSION WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES ACTIVITIES.
HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, PROVIDING SUPPORT SERVICES, AND EDUCATION TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM FOOD INSECURITY.  VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDE:  FOOD INSECURITY MEASURES, FINANCIAL COUNSELING, MEAL PACKING, DISTRIBUTING FOOD, PROVIDE IN-HOME AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO VETERANS, DISABLED AND THE ELDERLY INCREASING FOOD SECURITY VIA A SURVEY INSTRUMENT.
THE MISSION OF SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS RSVP IS TO ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS OVER 55 YEARS OF AGE TO LEND THEIR TIME AND EXPERTISE IN SERVICE NON-PROFITS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO STRENGTHEN THE WELL-BEING OF BOTH SELF AND COMMUNITY.  WE KNOW NOW MORE THAN EVER, VOLUNTEERS, ESPECIALLY BABY BOOMERS FEEL THEIR TIME IS PRECIOUS BY OFFERING UNIQUE EXPERIENCES WITH ADDITIONAL FLEXIBILITY WE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE BY TOUCHING LIVES AND LIFTING SPIRITS.

WE WOULD LIKE TO EXPAND OUR RSVP PROGRAM INTO BRAXTON AND POCAHONTAS WHICH ARE UN-SEVERED COUNTIES IN WEST VIRGINIA.  WE WILL HAVE 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.   SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING OR MENTORING 100 STUDENTS WHICH INCLUDE TEENS, ELEMENTARY AND HEAD START CHILDREN AT LOCAL SCHOOLS OR LIBRARIES TO IMPROVE THEIR SKILLS SO THEY WILL BE PROPORTIONED TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL AND SCHOOL READINESS.  THE FOCUS AREAS WILL BE IN EDUCATION AND THE TWO OBJECTIVES ARE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. WE WILL HAVE 50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL BE POSITIVE ROLE MODELS TO CHILDREN AND IN RETURN HELP THEM WITH THEIR BEHAVIORAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL PROBLEMS.  WE WILL RECRUIT NEW STATIONS THAT WILL NETWORK WITH THE TWO COUNTIES BOARD OF EDUCATIONS, HEAD START PROGRAMS, AND LOCAL PUBLIC LIBRARIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 60% OF THE CHILDREN WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR SKILLS TO BE PROMOTED TO THE NEXT LEVEL AND WILL BE SCHOOL READY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 75,000.00  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $9404.00
THE VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE NOT SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS EMBRACE OTHER VOLUNTEER SERVICES WITH MANY OTHER COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.  WE WILL HAVE 10   VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT FOR HEALTHY FUTURES IN OBESITY AND FOOD.  THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH EDUCATING INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE HOME BOUND, OLDER ADULTS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THE IMPORTANCE OF LONG TERM HUNGER ISSUES AND HELP INCREASE THEIR HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY. ALMOST DAILY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES PRESENT THEMSELVES AND FORTUNATELY ARE MET BY MANY SELFLESS INDIVIDUALS WILLING TO DEDICATE THEIR TIME AND ABILITIES REQUIRED FOR THESE CHALLENGES. .  WE WILL HAVE 15 VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AND OBJECTIVE WILL BE CAPACITY BUILDING AND LEVERAGE.  AND RECRUIT 300 NON-RSVP VOLUNTEERS FOR PROGRAMS LIKE RED CROSS, CERT, AND COUNTY HOMELAND SECURITY TO BUILD A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER GROUPS TO ASSIST IN THESE ORGANIZATIONS.

BY APPLYING FOR THIS EXPANSION GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 80 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN MASON AND WETZEL COUNTIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MEETING THE NEEDS OF HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND VETERANS, SERVING MEALS, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND ENCOURAGEMENT TO  HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED ELDERLY, STAFFING FOOD PANTRY, FOOD DISTRIBUTIONS, TAX COUNSELING AND SPONSORSHIP OF OTHER PROGRAMS BENEFITING SENIORS IN MASON AND WETZEL COUNTIES.  
THE MOVRC/RSVP IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING $75,000 FROM THE CNCS TO FUND THIS EXPANSION. IN ADDITION TO THE CNCS FUNDING, THE MOVRC/RSVP WILL SECURE SUPPLEMENTAL  FROM IN-KIND DONATIONS AND OTHER LOCAL AND STATE (NO FEDERAL) RESOURCES AND THROUGH DONATIONS MADE BY THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.
ACCORDING TO THE JULY 2016 US CENSUS ESTIMATES, THE 21.8% OF THE POPULATION IN WETZEL COUNTY IS AGED 65 AND OVER.  IN MASON COUNTY, 19.1% ARE OVER AGE 65 WITH A STATE POPULATION OF 18.2% OVER 65. BOTH COUNTIES ARE OVER THE  STATE AVERAGE.
2,688 VETERANS CURRENTLY RESIDE IN MASON COUNTY AND 1,526 IN WETZEL COUNTY, AS OF 7/1/15 US CENSUS ESTIMATES, WITH 150,021 VETERANS STATEWIDE. ACCORDING TO THE 2012 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEYS 1 YEAR PROFILES SHOWS 17.9% OF WV LIVES IN POVERTY. MASON COUNTY HAS 22.3% AND WETZEL AT 20% OF THEIR POPULATION LIVING IN POVERTY.
THE MOVRC/RSVP PROGRAM IS EAGER TO EXPAND THE RSVP PROGRAM INTO MASON AND WETZEL COUNTIES.  RSVP INTENDS TP SUPPORT EXISTING AGENCIES AND PROGRAMS, AND SEEKS EXPANSION IN AREAS WHERE NEEDS ARE NOT BEING MET.  ENGAGING SENIORS TO PROVIDE THE MUCH NEEDED VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IN THESE COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT MASON AND WETZEL COUNTIES, AND WEST VIRGINIA AS WELL.

RSVP OF UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL WV IS REQUESTING $116,068 TO SUPPORT 332 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN DODDRIDGE, HARRISON, MARION, MERCER, MONONGALIA, MONROE, PRESTON, SUMMERS, TAYLOR AND UPSHUR COUNTIES WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS OF HEALTHY FUTURES.  RSVP OF UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL WV WILL ALSO ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS:  DISASTER SERVICES; ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY; AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOCUS AREAS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE SERVICES THROUGH A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY 40 VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SENIOR CENTERS, HOSPITALS, VETERAN-CENTRIC ORGANIZATIONS, FOOD BANKS, NUTRITION PROGRAMS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING A VARIETY OF THE ABOVE LISTED SERVICES.
   AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE: 1200 SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE PREPARED MEALS DELIVERED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS; 900 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE NUTRITION EDUCATION AND MEAL PREPARATION INSTRUCTION; 1300 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE HEALTH LITERATURE AND HEALTH EDUCATION; 500 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY SHOPPING AND OTHER SHOPPING ACTIVITIES; 900 SENIORS WILL PARTICIPATE IN HEALTHY ACTIVITIES LED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS; 900 INDIVIDUALS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH FOOD, NUTRITION INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES TO ASSIST IN ALLEVIATING LONG TERM HUNGER; 600 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING ON INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY DISASTER PREPARATION; AND 300 RESIDENTS WILL RECEIVE COMMUNITY DISASTER RESPONSE TRAINING.
   THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $116,068 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $53,038 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

CLINCH VALLEY COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CVCA) IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) IN TAZEWELL COUNTY, VIRGINIA, THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR SINCE 1972. CVCA IS ALSO THE SPONSOR FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN TAZEWELL AND BUCHANAN COUNTIES IN VIRGINIA. AN ESTIMATED 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PERFORMANCE MEASURED ACTIVITIES DURING THE GRANT TIMEFRAME (TBD) AND AN ESTIMATED ADDITIONAL 30 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER INCLUDED WORK PLANS. SOME OF THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, INDEPENDENT LIVING SUPPORT, CAPACITY BUILDING (FUNDRAISING, VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT, IN-KIND SOLICITATION), TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND ESSENTIAL ACTIVITIES, AND SUPPORT FOR VETERANS AND VETERAN HOUSEHOLDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROPOSED RSVP PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED, TRAINED, PLACED AND SERVING IN A NETWORK OF COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS VETERANS ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES, FAITH BASED THRIFT STORES AND FOOD BANKS, AND VOLUNTEER EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROVIDERS. ANTICIPATED RESULTS OF THESE VOLUNTEER SERVICES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND RESOURCES FOR VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES; DECREASED SOCIAL ISOLATION FOR HOMEBOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED CITIZENS; AND INCREASED CAPACITIES FOR VOLUNTEER SERVICE THROUGH ENHANCED VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND MANAGEMENT OF EXISTING AND NEW COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $8,334 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP PROPOSAL - JULY 1, 2017 - JUNE 30, 2018
THE KNOXVILLE-KNOX COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION COMMITTEE (CAC) SUBMITS THIS PROPOSAL TO ADMINISTER RSVP IN BLOUNT COUNTY, TENNESSEE.  THE CAC RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) PROPOSES TO ENROLL 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, WITH 100% OF THEM IN OUTCOME BASED WORK PLANS.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND ESCORTING OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY SHOPPING, AND OTHER SOCIAL-RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES.  ONE HUNDRED PERCENT OF VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT - HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 200 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH A DISABILITY WILL RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE TO ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; SEVENTY-FIVE PERCENT OF CLIENTS SERVED WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  WE REQUEST $75,000, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,142 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES BY YEAR THREE.

THE MISSION OF SOUTHWEST HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY IS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN OUR SERVICE AREA BY DELIVERING SOCIAL SERVICES AND RESOURCES.  THROUGH EFFECTIVE COLLABORATION WITH FEDERAL, STATE AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS, WE ARE DEDICATED TO ENHANCING QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROMOTING SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND ALLEVIATING THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY.  
AN ESTIMATED 110 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN TWO COUNTIES IN WEST AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE, BENTON AND PERRY. THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING THE ABILITY OF ADULTS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND AND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO ASSIST THE LOW INCOME AND FOOD INSECURE POPULATION, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO VETERANS WITH MEDICAL NEEDS AND PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES TO VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE "HEALTHY FUTURES".  WE PLAN TO ACCOMPLISH GOALS THAT WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING HOMEBOUND SENIORS, VETERANS AND DISABLED PERSONS WITH HOME DELIVERED MEALS THAT SHOULD IMPROVE THEIR EATING HABITS AND HELP THEM MAINTAIN A HEALTHY DIET, WHICH SHOULD ENABLE THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST WITH LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRIES AND OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS SUCH AS SECOND HARVEST FOOD BANK OUT OF NASHVILLE, TN AND RIFA OUT OF JACKSON, TN TO INCREASE THEIR FOOD SECURITY.

AN ESTIMATED 187 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. THEY WILL DRIVE THE SICK AND HOME BOUND TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, DELIVER MEALS TO THE HOME BOUND, ASSIST WITH TRANSPORTATION TO SUPERMARKETS AND GROCERY STORES, VISIT THE SICK AND DYING, HELP WITH TAX TUTORING, GIVE OUT EMERGENCY FOOD, CLEAN, CHOP, SORT, DELIVER AND EDUCATE WITH FRESH FRUIT AND VEGETABLES IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS, RECEIVE AND SORT FOOD DONATIONS, FILL FOOD BOXES, AND FILL SNACK PACKS FOR CHILDREN. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 11 STATIONS SUCH AS;  THE CHATTANOOGA AREA FOOD BANK, MEALS ON WHEELS, AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND DISABILITIES, THE PARTNERSHIP FOR FAMILIES, CHILDREN AND ADULTS, LADIES OF CHARITY, HOSPICE OF CHATTANOOGA, THE HAMILTON COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE CHATTANOOGA HOUSING AUTHORITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RSVP CHATTANOOGA, HAMILTON COUNTY WILL REPORT 104 VOLUNTEERS IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, 88 WILL HAVE OUTCOMES. OUTCOMES WILL MEASURE THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS REPORTING IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY AND THE NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $83,982.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37,640.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA HEALTHY FUTURES WILL MEET THE NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD CHOICES, CARE, AGING IN PLACE AND POVERTY.  THE WORK PLANS WILL ADDRESS THE INCREASING AGING POPULATION AND POVERTY RATES, TRANSPORTATION FOR DISABLED AND OLDER ADULTS LIVING IN FOOD DESERTS IN OUR COMMUNITY, SENIOR CITIZENS STRIVING TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND HEALTHY, AND SENIOR HEALTH, HUNGER, AND MEDICAL CARE ISSUES.

UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT, SPONSOR OF THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF SPARTANBURG COUNTY, ENVISIONS A COMMUNITY WHERE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES LIVE UNITED AS AN EDUCATED, FINANCIALLY STABLE, AND HEALTHY COMMUNITY.
RSVP OF SPARTANBURG COUNTY CURRENTLY HAS 73 ACTIVE, UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER PARTICIPANTS. SOME OF THE PROGRAM'S ACTIVITIES CURRENTLY INCLUDE DELIVERING AND SERVING MEALS IN SOUP KITCHENS, MENTORING AND TUTORING, DELIVERING HEALTH CARE SERVICES, AND PREPARING TAXES FOR LOW INCOME AND ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS. 
FOR THE 2017 ? 2020 GRANT CYCLE, AN ESTIMATED 100 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 58% WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE LEADING FINANCIAL LITERACY CLASSES, ASSISTING WITH VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE (VITA), AND HELPING WITH GED CLASSES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS PROVIDING FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS, ALLOWING THEM TO AGE IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, 100 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES, 10 VETERANS AND VETERANS? FAMILY MEMBERS WILL RECEIVE CNCS-SUPPORTED ASSISTANCE, 20 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE SKILL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES (GED), AND 30 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE THEIR TAXES COMPLETED THROUGH VITA. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY PARTNERING WITH LOCAL NONPROFIT AGENCIES WHO ARE CURRENTLY SERVING SENIORS, DISABLED ADULTS, VETERANS, AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS AND IN PARTNERSHIP WITH UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT?S FINANCIAL STABILITY INITIATIVE. 
RSVP OF SPARTANBURG COUNTY HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED FOR AN OPPORTUNITY TO RAISE BASELINE FUNDING. THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDS WOULD INCREASE FROM $26,899 TO $40,000 IN THIS PROPOSAL. UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT WILL LEVERAGE THE ADDITIONAL FEDERAL FUNDS TO HIRE AN RSVP COORDINATOR AND INCREASE THE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT / LONG-DISTANCE TRAVEL BUDGET FOR THE RSVP DIRECTOR. FOR THE LAST NINE YEARS, RSVP OF SPARTANBURG COUNTY WAS PERMITTED TO HAVE A PART-TIME RSVP DIRECTOR. SINCE APRIL 2016, UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT HAS IDENTIFIED SEVERAL DATA COLLECTION ERRORS THAT WERE MADE IN PRIOR GRANTS AND HAS SOUGHT TO BRING ALL RSVP POLICIES INTO COMPLIANCE. THIS PROCESS HAS DEMONSTRATED THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL STAFF SUPPORT TO EFFECTIVELY AND ACCURATELY MANAGE THE RSVP PROGRAM. THE CURRENT RSVP DIRECTOR IS UNABLE TO MOVE TO FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT, SO UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT PROPOSES KEEPING THAT POSITION AS A 24 HOUR / WEEK PART-TIME POSITION AND HIRING A 16 HOUR / WEEK PART-TIME RSVP COORDINATOR TO ASSIST WITH ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS. THE ADDITIONAL STAFF SUPPORT WILL ENABLE RSVP OF SPARTANBURG COUNTY TO CONTINUE TO PERFORM AT THE HIGHEST STANDARDS. SOME ADDITIONAL FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED TOWARD PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR THE RSVP DIRECTOR. THIS STAFF MEMBER HAS BEEN WITH UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT SINCE JULY 2016. THE RSVP COORDINATOR AND THE PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT FROM HAVING A LEADER WITH ENHANCED KNOWLEDGE OF THE PROGRAM AND VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT BEST PRACTICES.
CAREFULLY UTILIZING THE REQUESTED $40,000 IN GRANT FUNDING, UNITED WAY OF THE PIEDMONT WILL SUPPLEMENT THE PROGRAM WITH AN ADDITIONAL $27,792.  THE RESULT OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WILL BE AN OUTSTANDING RSVP SPARTANBURG PROGRAM WHICH HAS RETAINED AND RECRUITED A TOTAL OF 100 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS AND HAS PRODUCED MEASURABLE OUTCOMES IN THESE VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
AN ESTIMATED 280 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 47 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
 1. VOLUNTEERS' HELPING WITH FOOD SECURITY WILL ASSIST WITH PACKING MOW (MEALS ON WHEELS) AS WELL AS WITH MEAL DELIVERY.  THE MEAL DELIVERY VOLUNTEER IS ALSO THE SOCIAL SUPPORT WHO MIGHT RECOGNIZE CHANGES IN THE CLIENTS' PHYSICAL OR MENTAL CONDITION AND ALERT THE APPROPRIATE CONTACT. 
2. AT CHRISTIAN CHARITIES AND UNITED MINISTRIES VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP DISTRIBUTE EMERGENCY FOOD TO THOSE IN NEED. 
3. VOLUNTEERS WITH TUOMEY HOSPICE WILL HELP TERMINALLY ILL PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH SUPPORT, COMPANIONSHIP AND ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES AT THE HOSPICE OFFICE. 
4. CONGREGATE MEAL SITE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE NUTRITION PROGRAMS AT SUMTER SENIOR ACTIVITY CENTER, WEDGEFIELD/DELAINE CENTER AND SHILOH ST. JOHN CENTER. VOLUNTEERS SERVE CLIENTS MEALS, PLAN & IMPLEMENT NUTRITIONAL PROGRAMING AS WELL AS VISIT WITH SENIORS, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIAL SUPPORT.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, LONG TERM OR PERMANENT CHANGES/IMPROVEMENTS ARE EXPECTED IN THE COMMUNITY DUE TO THE SERVICES OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $58,450 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $25,050. 
SUMTER COUNTY RANKS 9TH OUT OF THE 46 COUNTIES IN SOUTH CAROLINA IN MORTALITY. CERTAINLY, IMPROVING OUR COMMUNITY'S HEALTH IS A MAJOR NEED THAT WOULD GO A LONG WAY TOWARD IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SUMTER COUNTY.

TRI-COUNTY RSVP IS DESIGNED TO ADDRESS A CRITICAL NEED FOR COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WITHIN ROBESON, SCOTLAND, AND HOKE COUNTIES, NC.   THE AREA IS RURAL, PREDOMINANTLY LOW INCOME, WITH A DIVERSE POPULATION (WHITE, NATIVE AMERICAN, AFRICAN AMERICAN, AND HISPANIC).    THE BASE FUNDING PROJECT WILL RECRUIT 55 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND OLDER, WHILE AUGMENTED FUNDS WILL RECRUIT 375 VOLUNTEERS THROUGH MEDIA OUTLETS, COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS, FLYERS, CHURCH ANNOUNCEMENTS, AND OTHER TRADITIONAL APPROACHES.   VOLUNTEER ORIENTATION AND TRAINING WILL BE ORGANIZED BY THE PROJECT COORDINATOR, 3 CARE CONSULTANTS, 1 INTAKE SPECIALIST AND 1 ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF AREA SOCIAL SERVICES, HEALTH AND SUPPORT AGENCIES AND BRI CARE CONSULTATION PROGRAM.  PRIOR TO PLACEMENT OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS, STATION SUPERVISORS WILL BE REQUIRED TO ENTER INTO A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WHICH WILL DEFINE THE WORKING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, THE SPONSOR, RSVP STAFF AND ASSIGNED VOLUNTEERS CONSISTENT WITH THE POLICIES, RULES AND REGULATIONS OF RSVP AND CNCS.   
     55 BASE FUNDED RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THROUGHOUT THE CONDUCT OF THIS PROJECT, ACTIVITIES THAT ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN MEANINGFUL LIFE EXPERIENCES WILL BE OF PARAMOUNT INTEREST.   SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD COLLECTION, AND FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES - FOOD AND OBESITY AND FOOD INSECURITY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE 205 INDIVIDUALS REPORTED INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN (HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY) AS A RESULT OF CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICES. 375 AUGMENTATION FUNDED RSVP CAREGIVER UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPLEMENT ACTION PLANS FOR ADULT SENIORS WITH CHRONIC CONDITIONS WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF 3 CARE CONSULTANTS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALLOW FOR 430 TOTAL RSVP UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL SHARE INVESTMENT OF $50,432 IN BASE FUNDING AND $125,000 IN AUGMENTATION FUNDING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $104,664.00 FROM SACRED PATHWAYS.  
     PREVIOUS ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS READING ENRICHMENT TO ADDRESS LOW EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND INCREASED ACCESS TO READING MATERIALS AND DISSEMINATING INFORMATION FOR INCREASED ACCESS TO SUPPORT AND PUBLIC AGENCY SERVICES WILL CONTINUE TO BE SUPPORTED BY SACRED PATHWAYS BUT ARE NOT PART OF THIS RSVP PROJECT.  PLANNED ACTIVITIES THAT PREVIOUSLY ADDRESSED ACCESS TO CARE FOR THE ELDERLY AND SHUT-INS THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP WILL BE TRANSITIONED INTO A NEWLY PROPOSED EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAM KNOWN AS BRI CARE CONSULTATION.

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, 100 WILL HAVE COMPLETED EVIDENCE BASED HEALTH SERVICES, 150 OLDER AND/OR DISABLED WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT, 200 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL HAVE INCREASED THEIR FOOD SECURITY AND 50 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROJECT WILL SERVE 75,000 INDIVIDUALS OVER THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, EMPOWERING THEM WITH INFORMATION, SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, IMPROVED SELF-MANAGEMENT SKILLS AND BENEFITS ENROLLMENT AS LAID OUT IN PROGRAM WORK PLANS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $149,695 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A $64,155 GRANTEE MATCH AND AN ADDITIONAL $28,156 IN EXCESS FUNDING SUPPORT.

LEGACY LINK, AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) PROJECTS 275 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE GEORGIA MOUNTAINS RSVP SERVICE AREA, A DIVERSE ELEVEN COUNTY REGION IN THE NORTH GEORGIA MOUNTAINS (BANKS, DAWSON, FORSYTH, FRANKLIN, HALL, HABERSHAM, HART, LUMPKIN, TOWNS, UNION AND WHITE). THE SERVICE AREA ENCOMPASSES OVER 2600 SQUARE MILES WITH 60 MUNICIPALITIES AND 70 ZIP CODES. MOST COUNTIES ARE RURAL AND INCLUDE TWO SMALL CITIES AND A SUBURBAN METRO AREA. AS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, LEGACY LINK IS AN AGENT TO PROMOTE AND ASSIST THE INDEPENDENT LIVING OF THE REGION'S AGING POPULATION. THE MISSION OF THE NON-PROFIT AGENCY IS TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT WHICH ENHANCES AND FACILITATES INDEPENDENCE AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF OLDER INDIVIDUALS. LEGACY LINK PROVIDES SERVICES, ASSISTANCE, INFORMATION, AND REFERRALS THAT ENABLE OLDER ADULTS TO "AGE IN PLACE", THUS ELIMINATING OR POSTPONING THE NEED FOR MORE COSTLY ASSISTED LIVING ARRANGEMENTS OR NURSING HOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE GEORGIA MOUNTAINS RSVP PROGRAM IS TO SERVE LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA WITH ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT "AGING IN PLACE" AND ACCESS TO CARE FOR OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DELIVERING FOOD AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, PROVIDING RESPITE TIME FOR CAREGIVERS, AND PROVIDING HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFIT INFORMATION. OTHER RSVP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT THE OTHER FOCUS AREAS OF VETERANS AND MILITARY, DISASTER SERVICES, EDUCATION, AND CAPACITY BUILDING. SERVICES WILL BE COORDINATED THROUGH A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE ELEVEN COUNTY AREA.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, EXPECTED OUTPUTS ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE AS FOLLOWS: 1300 CLIENTS SERVED WITH MEAL DELIVERY, 100 CLIENTS SERVED WITH COMPANIONSHIP, 30 CAREGIVERS WITH RESPITE TIME, 1000 CLIENTS WITH HEALTH BENEFITS ASSISTANCE AND COUNSELING, 20 STUDENTS WITH MENTORS, DISASTER PREPARATION READINESS FOR 200 SENIORS, AND 300 MILITARY MEMBERS RECEIVING RECOGNITION OF THEIR SERVICE. PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED TO BE 50 HOME DELIVERED MEAL RECIPIENTS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, 15 CAREGIVERS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND 500 BENEFICIARIES ENROLLED IN HEALTH BENEFITS PROGRAMS. ADDITIONAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL PROVIDE IN-KIND FUNDING FOR NON-PROFITS, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS EDUCATION, AND A VARIETY OF LOCAL SUPPORT FOR COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS.
OVER 200 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME PRODUCING ACTIVITIES WHICH GREATLY EXCEEDS THE GRANT MANDATE OF 40. LEGACY LINK AAA REQUESTS A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $19,900 OF LOCAL DOLLARS WHICH EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED 30 % MATCH.

BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF TAMPA BAY'S (BBBSTB) MISSION OF MENTORING IS CLEAR AND SIMPLE IN SCOPE, BUT COMPLEX IN ITS HOLISTIC APPROACH TO BETTERING THE OUTCOMES OF THE YOUTH. OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE CHILDREN FACING ADVERSITY WITH STRONG AND ENDURING, PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED ONE-TO-ONE RELATIONSHIPS THAT CHANGE THEIR LIVES FOR THE BETTER, FOREVER. WE ACHIEVE THIS BY PARTNERING WITH PARENTS/GUARDIANS, VOLUNTEERS, DONORS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN THE COMMUNITY AND HOLDING OURSELVES ACCOUNTABLE FOR EACH CHILD IN OUR PROGRAM ACHIEVING: (I) HIGHER ASPIRATIONS, GREATER CONFIDENCE AND BETTER RELATIONSHIPS, (II) AVOIDANCE OF RISKY BEHAVIORS, AND (III) EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS. BBBSTB HAS BEEN PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING SERVICES SINCE 1964, AND STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES THROUGH THESE HIGH-QUALITY, LIFE-ENRICHING, ONE-TO-ONE RELATIONSHIPS FOR CHILDREN, BY PAIRING THEM WITH CARING, SCREENED, TRAINED, AND PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED ADULT VOLUNTEERS. TODAY, OUR MENTORING PROGRAMS ARE EVIDENCE-BASED AND OUTCOME DRIVEN.

ALL VOLUNTEERS UNDER THE RSVP EXPANSION GRANT WILL ENGAGE IN ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING IN EITHER A COMMUNITY OR SCHOOL-BASED SETTING. VOLUNTEERS WILL MAKE A COMMITMENT OF AT LEAST ONE YEAR, THOUGH MOST MATCHES LAST LONGER. SCHOOL-BASED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT ONE OF THE TWO SCHOOLS ALREADY ENGAGED IN SUMTER COUNTY, FL (VOLUNTEER STATIONS), AND BBBSTB WILL SERVE AS THE STATION FOR COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY SERVING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN. AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF SEVENTY-FIVE CHILDREN WILL HAVE BEEN SERVED IN SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING, WITH THE OUTCOME OF IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $28,895 (27.8%) IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING.

AN ESTIMATED 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:

SCHOOL READINESS - VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH STUDENTS IN VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN (VPK) TO IMPROVE THEIR LEVEL OF SCHOOL READINESS BEFORE THEY ENTER KINDERGARTEN.  
CAPACITY BUILDING - RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP NON-PROFITS WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT FOR COMMUNITY, EDUCATIONAL, AND FUNDRAISING EVENTS AS WELL AS DIRECT SERVICE ACTIVITIES.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, STUDENTS IN THE CNCS FUNDED PROGRAM WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY. STUDENTS IN THE VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN PROGRAMS WILL BE MORE READY TO START KINDERGARTEN AND WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $43,760 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,375.

THEY HAVE ALSO SUCCESSFULLY SPONSORED THE RSVP LEE PROGRAM FOR OVER 20 YEARS.
RSVP OF LEE COUNTY IS SUBMITTING A RENEWAL FOR A 3-YEAR GRANT OF A SUCCESSFUL 2014 COMPETITION GRANT PROPOSING AN ESTIMATED 458 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO IMPACT ALMOST 3,130 CITIZENS, LEVERAGING A REQUESTED GRANT AMOUNT OF $50,228 WITH $20,000 LOCAL SUPPORT FROM THE UNITED WAY OF LEE, HENDRY, GLADES AND OKEECHOBEE.

POSITIVE MATURITY WAS CREATED BY THE INDEPENDENT PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH IN 1971 TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE AGING COMMUNITY IN JEFFERSON COUNTY ALABAMA. IN 1972 THE AGENCY BECAME INCORPORATED, RECEIVED IT'S NON-PROFIT 501(C)3 STATUS, BECAME A SPONSOR FOR THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS) AND A PARTNER FOR UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL ALABAMA. POSITIVE MATURITY'S MISSION IS TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS THROUGH SOCIAL SERVICES AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.
AS A SPONSOR FOR SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS, POSITIVE MATURITY OFFERS ADULTS 50 AND OLDER A VARIETY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH RSVP (SERVING BLOUNT, JEFFERSON, SHELBY AND WALKER COUNTIES), FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (JEFFERSON COUNTY) AND THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER PROGRAM THAT ALSO SERVES JEFFERSON COUNTY.   IN ADDITION TO THE THREE (3) SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS; POSITIVE MATURITY OFFERS AN EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM; AGING WORKERS ARE RELIABLE EMPLOYEES, A SENIOR CENTER; SHEPHERD CENTER EAST AND A GERIATRIC SOCIAL SERVICE DEPARTMENT WHOSE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS TO ASSIST THOSE PARTICIPANTS ALREADY ENROLLED IN POSITIVE MATURITY PROGRAMS.  EACH PROGRAM IN ITSELF IS DESIGNED TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE PARTICIPANTS, BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY ARE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE MENU OF SERVICES AND THAT IS DESIGNED TO KEEP PARTICIPANTS ACTIVELY ENGAGED AND INDEPENDENT FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.
POSITIVE MATURITY?S MISSION IS CARRIED EACH YEAR THROUGH THE HARD WORK OF STAFF, A DEDICATED BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND FUNDING THAT IS COMPRISED OF OVER 10 DIFFERENT LOCAL, STATE AND COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS AND FUNDRAISING EFFORTS.  EACH YEAR POSITIVE MATURITY ASSESSES THE NEEDS OF THE AGING COMMUNITY THROUGH RESEARCH, SURVEYS AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. THIS INFORMATION IS COMPARED TO AND INCORPORATED INTO A STRATEGIC PROCESS THAT GIVES OUR STAFF CLEAR GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TO REACH AS MANY GOALS AND PARTICIPANTS AS POSSIBLE WITH FUNDING THAT IS AVAILABLE.  POSITIVE MATURITY ALSO PARTNERS WITH SEVERAL COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO ENSURE PARTICIPANTS HAVE ACCESS TO RESOURCES NEEDED TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT, ACTIVE AND ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE AGENCY SERVES AS AN ADVOCATE FOR ISSUES THAT PERTAIN TO THE AGING COMMUNITY AND ARE LOOKED TO AS LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY.
POSITIVE MATURITY IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING $127,638 FROM CNCS FOR THE RSVP PROGRAM ($382,914 OVER THE COURSE OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD). IN ADDITION TO THE CNCS FUNDING, POSITIVE MATURITY, INC. AND RSVP WILL ALSO ADDRESS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES THROUGH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THIS VERY SPECIAL COMMUNITY. THE COLBERT COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 160 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 90 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY, COMMUNITY GARDENS, TUTORING, JOB SKILL TRAINING AND JOB PLACEMENT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR PROGRAM INTENDS  TO BUILD UP FOOD SECURITY, EDUCATE ABOUT ENVIRONMENT AND NUTRITION, AND INCREASE INDIVIDUAL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING. VOLUNTEERS, COMMUNITY, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES WILL WORK TOGETHER TO PLAN, PLANT, AND GROW COMMUNITY AND CONTAINER GARDENS AS WELL AS PROVIDE SEVEN MEALS A WEEK TO ELDERLY, SHUT IN, AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN OUR AREA.  THESE PROGRAMS WILL MEET BOTH IMMEDIATE NEEDS FOR NUTRITION AND FOOD, BUT WILL ALSO PROVIDE MEANS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ABILITY FOR INDIVIDUALS TO CONTINUE TO MEET THOSE NEEDS IN THE FUTURE.  RSVP WANTS TO BRING TOGETHER PEOPLE FROM ALL BACKGROUNDS AND FINANCIAL STANDING TO ENABLE THEM TO LEARN THAT THEY CAN WORK TOGETHER TOWARD A COMMON GOAL.  WE ALSO HOPE TO INCREASE THE INDIVIDUAL'S NUTRITIONAL KNOWLEDGE, CREATE MORE STABILITY IN THEIR FOOD RESOURCES, INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND PROMOTE BETTER PERSONAL HEALTH AND A SENSE OF ACCOMPLISHMENT AND PRIDE IN THEIR OWN WORK.

AN ESTIMATED 245 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN OUR SERVICE AREA OF ETOWAH AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES, ALABAMA.  OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES; HOWEVER WE PLAN TO ADDRESS ALL SIX FOCUS AREAS TO SOME EXTENT. LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES NORTHWEST (LCSNW) IS A NONPROFIT 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION SERVING WASHINGTON, OREGON AND IDAHO.  OUR MISSION IS TO PARTNER WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES FOR HEALTH, JUSTICE AND HOPE. OUR FOCUS IS ON IMPROVING THE LIVES OF PEOPLE THROUGHOUT THE NORTHWEST.  FOUNDED IN PORTLAND, OREGON IN 1926 TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF STRUGGLING FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS, LCSNW HAS EVOLVED INTO 34 OFFICES.  THE LCSNW SOUTH PUGET SOUND (SPS) OFFICE IN TACOMA SERVES PIERCE AND KITSAP COUNTY PRIMARILY FOCUSING ON THE SUPPORT, CARE, AND VOLUNTEERISM FOR SENIORS AND CAREGIVERS. WE HAVE EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IN PROVIDING SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS AND ARE FAMILIAR WITH SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS. WE HAVE BEEN A SPONSORING AGENCY FOR RSVP OF KITSAP COUNTY SINCE 1981 AND FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM COVERING PIERCE AND KITSAP COUNTIES SINCE 1998.  
WE ARE PLEASED TO SUBMIT THIS APPLICATION TO BECOME A NEW PROVIDER FOR RSVP PIERCE COUNTY BY RESPONDING TO THE FY 2017 RSVP EXPANSION COMPETITION. RSVP OF PIERCE COUNTY FITS WITH OUR MISSION, VISION AND VALUES OF IMPROVING THE LIVES OF SENIORS WITHIN OUR LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  WE RECOGNIZE THAT UNITED WAY OF PIERCE COUNTY HAS BEEN PROVIDING THE RSVP PROGRAM SINCE 2007 AND MADE THE DECISION NOT TO REAPPLY WHICH PROVIDED THIS NEW OPPORTUNITY.  WE HAVE TAKEN THEIR WORK WITH RSVP INTO CONSIDERATION AND HOPE TO BENEFIT MANY OF THE SAME CLIENTS, VOLUNTEERS, STATIONS AND COMMUNITIES IN PIERCE COUNTY.
WE ANTICIPATE AT LEAST 210 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUR PROGRAM. OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND WE WILL BE REPORTING ON OUTCOMES FROM SENIOR CONGREGATE MEAL SITES AND MEAL DELIVERY ACTIVITIES.  ALONG WITH MEAL SITE AND DELIVERY TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, OTHER RSVP ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING;  SUPPORTING LOCAL FOOD BANKS; READING TO CHILDREN TO PROMOTE LITERACY AND EARLY LEARNING AND PROVIDING ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL) CLASSES FOR REFUGEES;  AND GARNERING DONATIONS.  WE EXPECT TO SERVE 2100 CLIENTS THROUGH THE MEAL ACTIVITIES, 50 CLIENTS IN TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, 500 IN FOOD BANK SUPPORT, 100 STUDENTS IN EARLY LEARNING AND ESL. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $112,529 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OUR SHARE OF $13,977 FROM NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
