COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (CCAP) HAS BEEN SERVING GRAYS HARBOR AND PACIFIC COUNTIES FOR OVER 50 YEARS AND HAS DEDICATED ITSELF TO HELP IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THE PEOPLE WITHIN THESE COMMUNITIES. CCAP IS VERY COMMITTED ABOUT THE SENIORS LIVING IN OUR COMMUNITY AND HAVE PROGRAMS THAT TARGET THE 60+ AGE GROUP.  THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE; RSVP, SENIOR NUTRITION, IN HOME CARE, PRIVATE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, AND MEALS ON WHEELS.  CCAP RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE AND IMPACT IT?S HAD ON THE LIVES OF OUR SENIOR COMMUNITY AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE AN ASSET FOR THEM.  AN ESTIMATE OF 350 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN BOTH GRAYS HARBOR AND PACIFIC COUNTIES, SPONSORED BY COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM.  VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER MEALS AS A PART OF THE MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSIST LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, TUTOR ELEMENTARY STUDENTS IN READING AND MATH AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS, PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING THROUGH AMERICAN RED CROSS BLOOD DRIVES, SERVE VETERANS THROUGH COMMUNITY BASED ACTIVITIES AND OTHER ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED AS COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RSVP PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROJECT COORDINATOR HAS SUCCESSFULLY DEVELOPED WORKSITE RELATIONSHIPS AND IMPACT BASED WORK PLANS TO ENSURE PARTICIPANT HAVE A VITAL AND MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE.
AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD BANKS, FOOD PANTRIES OR OTHER NONPROFITS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN. THE RESPONSIBLE PARTIES FOR THE CLALLAM/JEFFERSON RSVP PROGRAM WILL BE: JANE COVELLA, RSVP PROGRAM MANAGER WILL ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM; PAMELA LEONARD-RAY, RSVP VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR, WILL COORDINATE AND SUPPORT THE VOLUNTEERS; MARKI LOCKHART, COMMUNITY SERVICE DIRECTOR, WILL ADD HER NATIONAL SERVICE EXPERIENCE TO OVERSEE THE GRANT AS AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE. OLYMPIC COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (OLYCAP) PROVIDES SERVICES IN CLALLAM AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES. THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE: FOOD DISTRIBUTION (FOOD BANKS), SENIOR NUTRITION, EMERGENCY SERVICES, EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT (HEAD START), RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP), WEATHERIZATION, ENERGY AND HOUSING ASSISTANCE, AND ADULT DAY CARE (ENCORE!/ARTS & MINDS). THERE IS A STRONG EMPHASIS ON EFFECTIVE PROGRAMMING TO MEET THE NEEDS OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITHIN THESE TWO COUNTIES. THE NEXT OLYCAP COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT REPORT WILL SERVE TO GUIDE RSVP SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN THE FOCUS AREAS DETAILED BELOW:
OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE 'HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE'- (H10 & H11) SERVING DISABLED AND HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: COMMUNITY FOOD BANKS- ENCOMPASSING FIVE SITES: BRINNION, QUILCENE, TRI-AREA, PORT TOWNSEND, AND PORT ANGELES; SENIOR NUTRITION AND MEALS ON WHEELS (H8) ENCOMPASSING FOUR SITES; ENCORE! AND ADULT DAY CARE PROGRAM (H13) AT ONE SITE; ECCHO (H8) AT ONE SITE; AND VOLUNTEER SERVICES (H8) AT ONE SITE. THIS CNCS FEDERAL FUNDING GRANT OF $56,460 WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR 185 VOLUNTEERS, 50 OF WHICH WILL BE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING THESE SITES, WITH ANOTHER 7 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS FOCUS AREAS (ED21 &ED2).    
THE FOOD BANKS IN JEFFERSON AND CLALLAM COUNTIES SERVED NEARLY 7,000 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH VOLUNTEER EFFORTS THIS PAST YEAR. WE PROJECT 6,000 HOUSEHOLDS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL CONTINUE TO NEED EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE FROM PARTICIPATING RSVP STATION SITES EACH YEAR OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS. FORTY UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CLIENT FOOD DISTRIBUTION SERVICES TO THESE FIVE FOOD BANKS WHICH RELY ON VOLUNTEERS TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE. MANY FOOD BANKS HAVE NO MORE THAN ONE PAID PERSON ON STAFF PAYROLL (OR OFTEN NONE). RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE THE BACKBONE FOR THESE PROGRAMS TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE PROVIDING ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO VETERANS, DISABLED ADULTS AND SENIORS, AND LOW-INCOME FAMILIES. CLIENT SURVEYS WILL BE ADMINISTERED ANNUALLY TO 5% OF ALL NEW ELDERLY CLIENTS USING THE FOOD BANKS IN THIS AGING POPULATION WHICH NUMBERS 15,540 RESIDENTS COMBINED IN BOTH COUNTIES WHO HAVE FOOD INSECURITY ISSUES.

THERE WILL BE SIX UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING SUPPORT FOR MEAL DELIVERY TO HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED SENIORS WHO DEPEND ON WEEKLY MEAL DELIVERY TO PROVIDE THE NUTRITIOUS BENEFITS THEY NEED TO SURVIVE IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THESE ADULTS WILL BE ENGAGED BY THE MEALS ON WHEELS DRIVERS TO PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION AND AN INFORMAL ASSESSMENT OF THEIR PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS AS THEY DELIVER FOOD TO THESE HOUSEHOLDS. LAST YEAR A TOTAL OF 1,457 MEALS WERE DELIVERED TO THE ELDERLY THROUGH OLYCAP, WITH ANOTHER 33,517 MEALS SERVED WITHIN THE SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAMS OF THIS NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. THESE NEEDS WERE MET BY 22+ RSVP VOLUNTEERS. ANNUAL SURVEYS OF PARTICIPATING SENIOR NUTRITION CLIENTS WILL BE UNDERTAKEN TO REVIEW HOW MANY SENIORS CAN CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY DUE TO THIS LIFELINE SUPPORT FROM VOLUNTEERS.

AN ESTIMATED 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN DAGGETT, DUCHESNE AND UINTAH COUNTIES. THEY WILL PROVIDE HEALTHY FUTURES TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING TO MEET THEIR DAILY NEEDS, AS WELL AS PERFORM OUTREACH IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS. THEY WILL DO THIS THROUGH A NETWORK OF 13 STATIONS, INCLUDING HOME HEALTH AGENCIES, THE FOOD BANK, AND SENIOR CENTERS. ADDITIONAL SITES INCLUDE THE VETERANS CLINIC, EMERGENCY SERVICES OFFICE, HOSPITALS, HISTORICAL CENTER, AND THE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80 VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED ONGOING COMPANIONSHIP TO 20+ HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS EXTENDING THE TIME THEY CAN REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THEY WILL ALSO PROVIDE OVER 500 FAMILIES (MONTHLY) WITH HEALTHY, NUTRITIOUS FOOD AND EDUCATION ON EXTENDING THEIR FOOD DOLLARS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $17,000 IN IN-KIND, CASH AND STATE SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 214 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN SALT LAKE COUNTY. THEY WILL TUTOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN READING, REDUCE FOOD INSECURITY, PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO SENIORS, HELP OLDER ADULTS REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES, PROVIDE INFORMATION AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO VETERANS, IMPROVE OPEN LANDS, PROVIDE INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE TO SENIORS AND DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION TO HOSPITAL AND MUSEUM PATRONS THROUGH A NETWORK OF A NATIONAL SERVICE PROGRAM, THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD 17 STUDENTS WILL BE READING ON GRADE LEVEL, 60 ACRES OF PUBLIC LAND WILL BE PRESERVED, 300 VETERANS WILL RECEIVE INFORMATION ON BENEFITS, 7,000 PEOPLE WILL RECEIVE FOOD ASSISTANCE AND 200 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES TO HELP THEM REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $80,082 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $102,265 ($37,136 IN REQUIRED MATCH AND $65,129 IN EXCESS) OF NONFEDERAL RESOURCES.

SIX COUNTY RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) COVERS THE SIX COUNTY REGION WHICH INCLUDES (JUAB, SANPETE, SEVIER, WAYNE, PIUTE, AND MILLARD) COUNTIES AND WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 240 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO MAKE AN IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, VETERANS AND FAMILIES IN NEED, PROVIDING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES TO THOSE WHO ARE STRUGGLING TO MAKE A LIVING, FRAIL ELDERLY, PERFORM OUTREACH IN DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE UNPREPARED FOR TIMES OF DISASTERS, EDUCATE AND INSPIRE YOUTH, WOMEN AND CHILDREN INVOLVED IN DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SITUATIONS, AND DISABLED VETERANS WHO LIVE ON SMALL FIXED INCOMES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS DISASTER PREPAREDNESS AND THE GOALS FOR THIS FOCUS AREA WILL BE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH CURCCC (CENTRAL UTAH REGIONAL CITIZEN CORPS COUNCIL), SHERIFF'S OFFICES, AND LEPCS.  THROUGHOUT A THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE OVER 20 DISASTER PREPAREDNESS TRAININGS, AT LEAST 300 PEOPLE WILL BE TRAINED IN EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS SKILLS, OVER 1,000 PAMPHLETS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED, AND AT LEAST 10 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TRAINED WELL ENOUGH TO TAKE ON LEADERSHIP ROLES.  THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS THROUGH A NETWORK OF 55 STATIONS.  ADDITIONAL SITES WILL INCLUDE OTHER STATIONS SUCH AS: FOOD BANKS, HOME HEALTH AGENCIES, DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS, AMERICAN LEGION, SENIOR CENTERS, SCHOOLS, NEW HORIZONS CRISIS CENTER, AND VOLUNTEER INCOME TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.  THE CNCS DOLLARS INCLUDE $88,388 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,525 THROUGH LOCAL SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 400 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 112 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SERVICE TO LOCAL FOOD BANKS, HELPING PROVIDE FOOD SECURITY TO THE COMMUNITY AND VULNERABLE SENIOR CITIZENS, PROVIDING ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED SENIOR CITIZENS THROUGH VISITING AND PHONE CALLS, TEACHING EDUCATION AND HEALTH CLASSES TO THE COMMUNITY, TUTORING AT RISK CHILDREN IN LITERACY SKILLS AT LOCAL SCHOOLS, AND OPERATING CULTURAL AND HISTORIC MUSEUMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT, 75% OF THE ELEMENTARY AGE STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING WILL IMPROVE THEIR DIBELS READING SCORES BY THE END OF EACH SCHOOL YEAR, EDUCATIONAL CLASSES WILL BE TAUGHT TO 200 COMMUNITY MEMBERS , 60% OF THE SENIOR CITIZENS RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND/OR COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORT AND LESS OF A FEELING OF ISOLATION AND 60% OF INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD ASSISTANCE AT LOCAL FOOD BANKS WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $90,564 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,223 ANNUAL DOLLARS AND IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS.

OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS, AN ESTIMATED 150 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 120 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING INFORMATION AND DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO OLDER ADULTS IN ACCESSING HOUSING, TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO AGE IN PLACE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OVER 1000 OLDER ADULTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOWED THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AS THEY AGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $114,928 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $12,957 IN-KIND FROM ELDERS IN ACTION.

 THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $78,912 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $33,788 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AARP FOUNDATION IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1961 AS THE CHARITABLE AFFILIATE OF AARP, THE LARGEST SOCIAL WELFARE ORGANIZATION SERVING OLDER AMERICANS IN THE NATION. AARP FOUNDATION SERVES VULNERABLE PEOPLE 50+ BY CREATING AND ADVANCING EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS THAT HELP THEM SECURE THE ESSENTIALS. AARP FOUNDATION WORKS WITH ORGANIZATIONS IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE NATION TO HELP WIN BACK OPPORTUNITY FOR OLDER ADULTS.
OUR WORK INVOLVES INVESTING IN INNOVATIVE APPROACHES AND CONNECTING AMERICANS WHO ARE 50 AND OLDER TO PROGRAMS, RESOURCES, AND BENEFITS TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR LIVES IN OUR FOUR IMPACT AREAS: HUNGER, HOUSING, INCOME AND ISOLATION. AARP FOUNDATION UNDERSTANDS THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND CONTINUES TO IDENTIFY, IMPLEMENT, AND BRING TO NATIONAL SCALE INTERVENTIONS TO MEET THOSE NEEDS. 
AARP FOUNDATION PROPOSES TO ENGAGE 375 RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN THE SAN GABRIEL VALLEY COMMUNITY (CA-13) OF WHICH 250 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY, FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT, ASSISTING SOUP KITCHENS, AND PROVIDING TAX PREPARATION SERVICES.   AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOMES BASED ACTIVITIES WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 2,500 UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS WITH 250 DOCUMENTED OUTCOMES AND, IN THE CASE OF VITA, SAVE $25,000 IN TAX PREPARATION FEES FOR BENEFICIARIES. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $239,595 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN AARP FOUNDATION MATCH OF AT LEAST 10% IN YEAR ONE OF THE GRANT.

ACTIVITIES THAT MENTORS WILL ENGAGE IN WILL INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO) EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES FOR THEIR MENTEES, TRIPS INTO NATURAL SETTINGS (E.G., BEACH, FOREST, FARMS), ART ACTIVITIES, HOMEWORK HELP AND TUTORING, AND SCIENCE PROJECTS. ED6. 50% OF CHILD/YOUTH PARTICIPANTS (110) WILL SHOW IMPROVED SCHOOL ATTENDANCE OVER AS MEASURED ON THE YOS. THE RELATIONSHIP FORMED BETWEEN THE MENTEE AND THE RSVP VOLUNTEER MENTOR WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF BOTH MENTOR AND MENTEE PARTICIPANTS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
HANDSON CENTRAL CALIFORNIA (HANDSON) IS AN INDEPENDENT 501C3 WHOSE MISSION IS TO INSPIRE, EQUIP AND MOBILIZE VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES IN FRESNO, KINGS, TULARE, MADERA, AND MERCED COUNTIES. HANDSON, A SPONSOR OF RSVP FOR FRESNO, MADERA, KINGS AND TULARE COUNTIES SINCE 2000, REQUESTS FEDERAL FUNDS FROM CNCS TO CONNECT SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY SENIORS WITH THE PEOPLE AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT NEED THEM THE MOST. 400 RSVP VOLUNTEERS FROM 4 CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES WILL SERVE.
THE PRIMARY OUTCOME FOCUS AREA WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. DURING THE COMING GRANT PERIOD, RSVP WILL RECRUIT UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO MEET OBJECTIVES IN THE AREA OBESITY AND FOOD.  COUNTY HEALTH RANKINGS AND ROADMAPS REPORTS 270,000 CENTRAL VALLEY RESIDENTS (ABOUT 17%) EXPERIENCE FOOD INSECURITY.  SUPPORT TO LOCAL FOOD RESOURCE AGENCIES IS A CRITICAL NEED.  RSVP WILL RECRUIT AND PLACE AT LEAST 270 VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF FOOD PROGRAMS IN EACH COUNTY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 300 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN (HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY) AS A RESULT OF CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICES.  
RSVP WILL RECRUIT AND DEVELOP A CORE GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT VETS AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS WITH PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING STAND DOWNS, JOB FAIRS AND THERAPEUTIC RECREATIONAL PROGRAMS IN THE FOUR COUNTIES. 
HELPING CHILDREN READ AT GRADE LEVEL BY THE 3RD GRADE IS A COMMUNITY PRIORITY. RSVP VOLUNTEER TUTORS WILL ADDRESS EDUCATION FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES OF SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUPPORT. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS, LIBRARIES, SCHOOLS, CBO'S AND OTHER PROGRAMS SERVING PRE-K TO PROVIDE LITERACY TUTORING SUPPORT FOR SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12. HANDSON WILL PARTNER WITH CBO'S, LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT WILL IMPROVE CHILDHOOD LITERACY.  
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS THE HEALTHY FUTURE FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVE: ACCESS TO CARE BY PARTNERING WITH HEALTH CARE NAVIGATORS AND PROVIDERS TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS TO GET HEALTH INSURANCE.  IN ADDITION, WE WILL PARTNER WITH MEDICAL PROVIDERS TO ENSURE PATIENTS GET SUPERLATIVE CARE IN HOSPITALS AND CLINICS. 
RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ADDRESS COMMUNITY PRIORITIES; SUPPORTING POLICE AND HIGHWAY PATROL, ANIMAL SHELTERS, AND PROVIDING INFORMATION TO TRAVELERS VISITING CENTERS AT THE AIRPORT AND CITY INFO DESKS. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $178,933 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $119,821.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DISTRIBUTING FOOD THROUGH COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRIES, TRAINING COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE TEAM MEMBERS, SUPPORTING COMMUNITY GARDENING, PROVIDING INCOME TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE, DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS, TUTORING STUDENTS, HELPING TO REBUILD LIVES AND HOMES OF THOSE AFFECTED BY WILDFIRE DISASTER, AND MAINTAINING FRAGILE ECO-SYSTEMS WHILE MAINTAINING HIKING TRAILS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, NORTH COAST OPPORTUNITIES (NCO) ANTICIPATES THAT 75% OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE PARTICIPATING IN FOOD DISTRIBUTION AND COMMUNITY GARDENING PROGRAMS THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN (OUTCOME H12). THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $66,282 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $69,922 IN CASH AND IN-KIND MATCHING CONTRIBUTIONS. 
           THROUGH ITS COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMMING, NCO FOCUSES ITS EFFORTS ON A BROAD THEME OF SELF-EMPOWERMENT AND ALLEVIATION OF POVERTY. IN KEEPING WITH THIS THEME, NCO WILL CONTINUE OFFERING A WIDE RANGE OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOCAL SENIORS. WORKING WITH 500 VOLUNTEERS, THE LAKE AND MENDOCINO COUNTIES RSVP 2017-2020 PROJECT WILL ADDRESS FIVE NATIONAL SERVICE FOCUS AREAS (HEALTHY FUTURES, ENVIRONMENT, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, AND DISASTER SERVICES).

AN ESTIMATED 340 MONTEREY BAY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AT 63 PARTNER AGENCIES IN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA.  DUE TO THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY, WE HAVE CHOSEN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.  OUR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING HEALTHY MEALS, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, AND MINOR HOME REPAIRS TO HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED SENIORS.  IN ADDITION, OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY WITH A FOCUS ON ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, COMMUNITY POLICING, AS WELL AS OTHER CRUCIAL COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
AT THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT TO HAVE THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IN OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA AS FOLLOWS:  (1) 1500 SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO RECEIVE FOUR HEALTHY MEALS A WEEK (2) 200 SENIORS AND INDIVIDUAL WITH DISABILITIES WHO RECEIVED 4 TO 6 RIDES PER MONTH TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS; (3) 250 LOW-INCOME SENIORS WHO RECEIVE MINOR SAFETY HOME REPAIRS WILL REPORT INCREASED PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $66,206 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,345, WHICH WILL COME FROM LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES, INCLUDING BUSINESS PARTNERS, INDIVIDUAL DONORS, FUND RAISING EVENTS AND PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS. 
DUE TO OUR ROBUST VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES, OUR RSVP HAS BEEN 6 TIMES MORE COST-EFFECTIVE THEN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE.  OVER 38 YEARS, OUR ANNUAL COST (ABOUT $200 PER VOLUNTEER) TO SUPPORT AND ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS HAS EXCEEDED THE REQUIREMENT TO ACHIEVE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE GOALS.

AGING & INDEPENDENCE SERVICES (AIS) WILL SERVE AN ESTIMATED 1,100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 570 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME AREAS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 300 CLIENTS WILL BE PROVIDED COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $101,578 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AGING & INDEPENDENCE SERVICES, THE GRANT SPONSOR, WITH A MATCH OF $63,699, WHICH EXCEEDS THE 30% REQUIRED MATCH.

A PROPOSED 230 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WASHINGTON CO., WISCONSIN THROUGH RSVP OF INTERFAITH CAREGIVERS OF WASHINGTON CO.(SPONSOR PROGRAM), A 501(C)3 COMMUNITY BASED NON-PROFIT, WHOSE MISSION IS TO CONNECT SENIORS WITH CARING VOLUNTEERS. OF THE 230 RSVP VOLUNTEERS, 175 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  OUTCOME SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE 1.) TRANSPORTATION FOR HOME BOUND SENIORS TO PREVENTIVE/MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY; 2.) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TRAINED IN ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY AND MITIGATE ELDER ABUSE OF FINANCIAL FRAUD, ABUSE AND/OR NEGLECT; RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION ON ELDER ABUSE TO AT RISK SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS AND OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE COMMUNITY. NON-OUTCOME SERVICE ACTIVITIES OF 1.) NUTRITION TO HOME BOUND SENIORS; 2.) TRANSPORTATION FOR HOME BOUND VETERAN SENIORS TO ACCESS PREVENTIVE/MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER CRITICAL SERVICES 2.) COMPANIONSHIP TO HOME BOUND SENIORS AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOME BOUND SENIOR VETERANS; 3.) SERVE AS COACHES/LEADERS FOR EVIDENCE-BASED HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS - HEALTHY LIVING WITH DIABETES,WALK WITH EASE. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA: HEALTHY FUTURES. PRIORITY AREA: AGING IN PLACE - TRANSPORTATION AND ELDER JUSTICE. INTERFAITH'S MISSION, VISION AND PROGRAMMING STRONGLY SUPPORT WORK IN THESE PRIORITY AREAS. THESE ARE ALSO STRONGLY SUPPORTED BY WASHINGTON CO. AS HIGH PRIORITY NEEDS FOR SENIORS IN OUR COMMUNITY.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM 600 HOME BOUND SENIORS WILL HAVE ACCESSED PREVENTIVE/MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER CRITICAL SERVICES WITH TRANSPORTATION PROVIDED BY 125 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OF THESE, 83% OF SENIORS WILL INDICATE "INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT." 50 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED ELDER ABUSE PREVENTION TRAINING AND 200 SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE EDUCATION ON ELDER ABUSE. 82.5% OF SENIORS RECEIVING ELDER ABUSE EDUCATION WILL INDICATE "INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT" IN ADDITION TO THESE OUTCOME ACTIVITIES, 20 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO 50 HOME BOUND SENIORS;10 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST  SENIOR VETERANS WITH TRANSPORTATION; 10 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIOR VETERANS; 10 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE NUTRITION FOR 125 HOME BOUND SENIORS. 120 SENIORS EXPERIENCING CHRONIC CONDITIONS WILL PARTICIPATE IN AN EVIDENCE-BASED HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAM LED BY 5 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS.   
$8,334 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WILL SUPPLEMENT THE CNCS'S FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000, FOR A FIRST YEAR RSVP PROGRAM BUDGET OF $83,334.

WESTERN DAIRYLAND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC. (WDEOC, THE AGENCY) LOCATED IN INDEPENDENCE, WI, IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT FOR THE WESTERN DAIRYLAND RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). WDEOC WAS ESTABLISHED JUNE 6, 1966 TO HELP DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS IN BUFFALO, EAU CLAIRE, JACKSON, AND TREMPEALEAU COUNTIES, LOCATED IN WEST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN, BECOME SELF-RELIANT. THE AGENCY'S MISSION IS TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY RELATED CONDITIONS AND PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES WHICH ENABLE PEOPLE TO ADVANCE ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY. WESTERN DAIRYLAND HAS BEEN OPERATING AN RSVP PROGRAM SERVING EAU CLAIRE, JACKSON, TREMPEALEAU, AND BUFFALO COUNTIES SINCE 1973. A TOTAL OF 400 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVE UNDER THE CURRENT PROGRAM. 
WE ARE LOOKING TO EXPAND OUR CURRENT SERVICE AREA TO INCLUDE PEPIN COUNTY. RSVP WORKS BY EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 OR OLDER TO PERFORM ACTS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE THAT MAKE WESTERN WISCONSIN A BETTER PLACE FOR EVERYONE.  AS A RESULT OF THEIR SERVICE, SENIORS GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING HOW THEIR EFFORTS CONTRIBUTE TO THE GREATER GOOD OF THE COMMUNITY.  
THE AGENCY WORKS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL. WESTERN DAIRYLAND PROGRAMS ARE DEVELOPED IN RESPONSE TO IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS AND ADVOCATE FOR THE INTERESTS OF THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RSVP IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH WORK PLAN OBJECTIVES IN THE AREAS OF OBESITY AND FOOD, AND AGING IN PLACE SERVICES WHICH INCLUDES ACTIVITIES SUCH AS VOLUNTEER TRANSPORTATION, IN HOME SERVICES, AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION. 
 A TOTAL OF 50 (UNDUPLICATED) OF THE 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING IN THE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. THE ANNUAL REQUESTED FEDERAL GRANT AMOUNT FOR THIS PROGRAM SERVING THE RESIDENTS OF PEPIN COUNTY IS $75,000 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,500 BY NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 125 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE INTERFAITH CAREGIVERS OF OZAUKEE COUNTY (ICO) RSVP AGING IN PLACE PROGRAM.  ICO WILL SERVE AS THE RSVP SPONSOR AND SOLE VOLUNTEER STATION WITH TRAINING AND SCHEDULING OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONDUCTED BY ICO STAFF AND COORDINATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE PROGRAM BY THE RSVP PROGRAM DIRECTOR. ALL RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS SEVERAL NEEDS OF SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY IN THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, FOOD INSECURITY, ISOLATION, RESPITE NEEDS OF CAREGIVERS AND EDUCATION RELATED TO SAFE INDEPENDENT LIVING. SPECIFIC VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTING SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, FOOD PANTRIES AND GROCERY STORES; VISITING CLIENTS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND COMBAT ISOLATION; PROVIDING EDUCATION AND GUIDANCE TO CLIENTS ON AN ARRAY OF ISSUES PERTINENT TO INDEPENDENT LIVING AND PROVIDING RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS OF CLIENTS. THE EDUCATION FOR CLIENTS ON INDEPENDENT LIVING WILL COVER SUCH ISSUES AS INCREASING HOME SAFETY TO PREVENT FALLS AND OTHER ACCIDENTS, EDUCATING AND PREVENTING ELDER ABUSE AND IDENTIFYING FINANCIAL SCAMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE- YEAR GRANT, 600 SENIORS, ADULTS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY AND CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS A RESULT OF THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS' COMMITMENT TO PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, EDUCATION TO PREVENT ELDER ABUSE AND RESPITE COMPANIONSHIP.  DURING THE FIRST YEAR OF THE GRANT, THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $7,500. ICO SERVES CLIENTS AND RECRUITS VOLUNTEERS WITHOUT REGARD TO SEX, RACE, ETHNICITY, NATIONALITY, DISABILITY, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR RELIGION.

AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 225 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS, PROVIDING COMMUNITY INFORMATION AND RESOURCES TO OLDER ADULTS, AND MAKING DAILY CHECK IN CALLS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, 70% OF THE 2,000 STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED TUTORING WILL DEMONSTRATE INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS MEASURED BY THEIR TEACHER. NINETY PERCENT OF THE 100 OLDER ADULTS THAT RECEIVE DAILY CHECK-IN CALLS WILL REPORT FEELING MORE SUPPORTED AS A RESULT OF THE CALLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $145,886 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $62,523 IN MATCH FUNDS AND AN ESTIMATED $6,534 IN EXCESS FUNDS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
THE FRIENDS OF COULEE REGION RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, INC. (COULEE REGION RSVP) WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1994, AS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, WITH THE PRIMARY GOALS OF PROVIDING FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT AND PROGRAM GUIDANCE TO COULEE REGION RSVP STAFF.  COULEE REGION RSVP IS A RESPECTED AND VITAL PART OF BOTH LA CROSSE AND MONROE COUNTIES, FULFILLING OUR MISSION OF PROVIDING INDIVIDUALS AGES 55 AND BETTER WITH MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES.  AN ESTIMATED 500 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY100 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
1.   PROVIDING MINOR HOME REPAIR WORK THROUGH OUR HANDYMAN PROGRAM
2.  SUPPORTING THE ELDERLY AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH GAINING ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD THROUGH TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND FOOD DELIVERY
3.  COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH OUR TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, WE ANTICIPATE THAT OUTCOMES WILL MEET OR EXCEED ALL WORK PLAN GOALS, MEETING THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY BY ENHANCING THE MISSION, PERFORMANCE, AND SUCCESS OF OVER 80 OF OUR CURRENT PARTNERED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,618.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $252,000.00 IN ADDITIONAL RESOURCES.

PORTAGE COUNTY RSVP IS THE INCUMBENT GRANTEE WITH AN ESTIMATED 564 RSVP VOLUNTEERS  THAT SERVE OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH PLACEMENT AT ONE OR MORE OF THE 64 VOLUNTEER JOB STATIONS WITH WHICH RSVP HAS MEMORANDUMS OF UNDERSTANDINGS. 
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES BY: SERVING AS DRIVER/ESCORTS ELIMINATING THE BARRIER THAT TRANSPORTATION OFTEN PRESENT SENIORS WISHING TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT, PREPARING AND DELIVERING HOT NOON MEALS, LEADING CLASSES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF SENIORS, TUTORING STUDENTS WHO ARE STRUGGLING WITH READING PROFICIENCY AND MENTORING AT RISK STUDENTS ENCOURAGING  POSITIVE CHOICES AND INCREASED SCHOOL ENGAGEMENT.
  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WHICH WILL ENGAGE 225 VOLUNTEERS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT; MORE THAN 36 VOLUNTEER DRIVER/ESCORTS WILL ASSIST 230  VETERANS, SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS ANNUALLY WITH TRANSPORTATION; MORE THAN  INDIVIDUALS WILL BENEFIT FROM A HOT HOME DELIVERED MEAL PREPARED AND DELIVERED BY 120 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND 150 TOTAL VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTING TO THIS EFFORT; HEALTH EDUCATION AND EVIDENCED BASED PROGRAMING SHALL BE PROVIDED BY 20 RSVP VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTORS BENEFITING AT LEAST 175 PARTICIPANTS ANNUALLY. FINALLY, 38 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TUTORING TO 100 STUDENTS ANNUALLY RESULTING IN IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT IN 80% OF THE STUDENTS AS MEASURED BY SCHOOL RECORDS. 
  THE AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER OF PORTAGE COUNTY (ADRC) IS THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION AND LEGAL APPLICANT FOR PORTAGE COUNTY RSVP. ADRC IS A DEPARTMENT OF COUNTY GOVERNMENT ITS MISSION IS TO SUPPORT SENIORS, AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, THEIR FAMILIES, AND CAREGIVERS.  
  PORTAGE COUNTY RSVP IS REQUESTING $83,644 OF FEDERAL FUNDING ANNUALLY. PORTAGE COUNTY PROVIDES THE MATCHING FUNDS FOR THE PORTAGE COUNTY RSVP PROGRAM IN THE SUM OF $62,906.00. THIS BUDGET ALSO REFLECTS $9886.00 OF STATE FUNDING RECEIVED THROUGH A GRANT AND $2,500.00 OF DONATIONS MADE FROM PRIVATE CITIZENS AND ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS SCHOOL PTO'S.

UNITED WAY OF MANITOWOC COUNTY HAS BEEN IN OUR COMMUNITY FOR 85 YEARS FOCUSING ON HELPING THOSE IN NEED THROUGH VOLUNTEERING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF OUR PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH WORK PLAN OBJECTIVES IN THE AREAS OF K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. AN ESTIMATED 288 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE SERVING IN SEVEN SCHOOLS COUNTY WIDE TO PROVIDE READING ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN WITH DEFICIENCIES AND DELAYS.   THE GAP BETWEEN CHILDREN WHO READ WELL AND THOSE WHO DO NOT INCREASES OVER TIME. EARLY INTERVENTION IS THE KEY TO IMPROVING THE READING SKILLS OF THESE STUDENTS. OF THIS NUMBER, 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LITERACY TUTOR, MATH TUTOR, READING BUDDY AND MENTORS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 100 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AS EVIDENCED BY THEIR READING PROFICIENCY SCORES. IN ADDRESSING SCHOOL READINESS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE RECRUITED TO ASSIST THE HEAD START PROGRAM AND PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY EARLY LEARNING INTERVENTION IN READING TO AT RISK CHILDREN AGES 3-4.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $64,868 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,141.

	SOME OF THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES UNDER THE HEALTHY FUTURES' AGING IN PLACE OBJECTIVE INCLUDE:  PROVIDING FOOD DELIVERY, COMPANIONSHIP AND COMPLIMENTARY TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY MEALS ON WHEELS, THE RACINE DOMINICAN'S SENIOR COMPANION INC. AND THE VOLUNTEER CENTER OF RACINE COUNTY?S MYRIDE PROJECT UNDER THREE RESPECTIVE, SEPARATE WORK PLANS.

	100 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE COMPLIMENTARY TRANSPORTATION THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH 30 OF THOSE INDIVIDUALS REPORTING HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

	THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $94,759.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,626 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. EXCESS AMOUNT IS $1631.

AN ESTIMATED 395 ADVOCAP RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS IN FOND DU LAC, GREEN LAKE AND WINNEBAGO COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL WISCONSIN.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OLDER ADULTS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES, PRESCHOOL CHILDREN WILL HAVE INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS BY IMPROVING THEIR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS, SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN WILL SHOW AN IMPROVEMENT IN STUDENT ENGAGEMENT, INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, TAX PREPARATORY FEES WILL BE SAVED, AND INDIVIDUALS WILL TRANSITION INTO SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $179,954 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $77,123.

AN ESTIMATED 240 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN WAUKESHA COUNTY, WISCONSIN. THEY WILL TUTOR CHILDREN AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HELP INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING VETERANS BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND FOOD DELIVERY, AND SERVE AT THRIFT STORES AND LOCAL SCHOOLS THROUGH A NETWORK OF 21 STATIONS SUCH AS SCHOOL DISTRICT OF WAUKESHA COUNTY, SCHOOL DISTRICT OF MENOMONEE FALLS, SALVATION ARMY, AND THE AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER OF WAUKESHA COUNTY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,150 STUDENTS WILL PARTICIPATED IN EDUCATION SERVICE ACTIVITIES, AND 575 WILL HAVE INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH AND 19 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL HAVE ASSISTANCE WITH IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE APPLICANT IS THE VOLUNTEER CENTER OF BROWN COUNTY, A PRIVATE NOT-FOR-PROFIT AGENCY THAT ANNUALLY MOBILIZES APPROXIMATELY 12,000 PEOPLE TO MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS AS VOLUNTEERS. THIS IS DONE THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER CENTER WEBSITE, COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS, PUBLICATIONS, AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND GROUPS WISHING TO SERVE. IN ADDITION TO $32,929 OF STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS, FEDERAL FUNDING OF $76,073 IS REQUESTED TO SUPPORT AT LEAST 280 RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) VOLUNTEERS IN BROWN COUNTY, WISCONSIN.
     RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS IN NUMEROUS SERVICE CATEGORIES, BUT THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION BY IMPROVING ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS IN LITERACY THROUGH RSVP'S READING COACHES FOR KIDS PROGRAM. SCHOOL ASSESSMENT TESTS SHOW THAT NEARLY 50% OF STUDENTS IN BROWN COUNTY STILL READ BELOW PROFICIENCY LEVEL BY THE END OF THIRD GRADE. INCREASES IN POVERTY RATES AND NUMBER OF ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS IN THE COUNTY HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THIS SITUATION. RSVP OF BROWN COUNTY WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, PLACE AND SUPPORT A MINIMUM OF 75 VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE LITERACY TUTORING TO AT LEAST 300 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS ANNUALLY. PROGRESS OF TUTORED STUDENTS WILL BE MEASURED BY IMPROVEMENT IN STUDENTS' READING LEVELS AS DOCUMENTED IN SCHOOLS' RECORDS. AT LEAST 75% OF TUTORED STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE READING SKILLS TWO GRADE LEVELS AFTER RECEIVING AT LEAST FOUR MONTHS OF THE TUTORING ASSISTANCE.
     RSVP OF BROWN COUNTY WILL ALSO FOCUS ON HELPING A GROWING NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND AVOID SOCIAL ISOLATION. AT LEAST 10 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE MATCHED AS FRIENDLY VISITORS WITH AT LEAST 12 ELDERLY. PROJECT ADMINISTERED SURVEYS OF THESE ELDERLY WILL SHOW THAT 80% EXPERIENCE LESS ISOLATION AS A RESULT OF VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT. 
     THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER CENTER OF BROWN COUNTY'S PROGRAMS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS (STATIONS), RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF VETERANS/MILITARY FAMILIES, HEALTH, OTHER ELDERLY SERVICES, EDUCATION, ECONOMIC SUPPORT, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, SAFETY, ARTS/CULTURE, AND RECREATION.

RSVP OF DANE COUNTY, INC., ESTABLISHED IN 1972, BECAME A 501 (C)(3) INCORPORATED AGENCY IN 1977.  OUR MISSION IS TO MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT IN THE COMMUNITY BY RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OLDER TO HELP DELIVER PRIORITY SERVICES TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, PROVIDING DANE COUNTY WITH A VALUABLE RESOURCE.  OUR VISION:  RSVP ASPIRES TO BUILD AND EXPAND A COMMUNITY WIDE NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT UNITES COMPASSIONATE, EXPERIENCED ADULTS WITH MEANINGFUL AND FULFILLING SERVICES OPPORTUNITIES, WHICH ENRICH THE LIVES OF THE VOLUNTEERS WHILE ENHANCING SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE IN NEED.  WE ARE REQUESTING $209,059 TO SUPPORT 1,500 VOLUNTEERS.   
AN ESTIMATED 1,500 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING: TRANSPORTATION OF SENIORS, VETERANS, AND AMBULATORY DISABLED TO APPOINTMENTS, AND DELIVERING MEALS TO FRAIL ELDERLY TO REDUCE ISOLATION AND ENABLE SENIORS AND VETERANS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT; K-12 TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS; AND RECYCLING/REUSING MATERIALS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND WE WILL EXCEED OUR REQUIREMENT OF 209 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN A NATIONAL PERFORMANCE TRANSPORTATION WORK PLAN. IN ADDITION TO VOLUNTEERS IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE ACTIVITIES, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY ASSIGNMENTS HELPING NONPROFIT AND PUBLIC AGENCIES EXTEND THEIR SERVICES TO PEOPLE IN NEED.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $209,059 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $89,809 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, SENIORS  (INCLUDING VETERANS AND THEIR SPOUSES), AS WELL AS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION THROUGH OUR DRIVER SERVICES/VETS HELPING VETS PROGRAM, WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. PSA 3 AREA AGENCY ON AGING DBA THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING 3(AAA3) HAS BEEN ADMINISTERING STATE AND FEDERALLY FUNDED PROGRAMS SINCE 1974.  THE AGENCY'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-SPAN RESOURCES THAT INSPIRE, EDUCATE, AND EMPOWER OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS.  AAA3 
WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND DIRECT VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR AN ESTIMATED 190 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS THROUGH THE RSVP EXPANSION GRANT.  THE PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES PROVIDING IMPROVING ACCESS TO CARE AND AGING IN PLACE. THESE COUNTIES ARE IN NORTHWEST OHIO AND ADJACENT TO THE RSVP PROGRAM OPERATED BY THE AREA OFFICE ON AGING OF NORTHWEST OHIO.  AAA3 IS EXCITED TO COLLABORATE WITH OUR SISTER AGENCY IN TOLEDO WHO HAS OPERATED AN RSVP PROJECT FOR MANY YEARS.  THE AREA OFFICE ON AGING OF NORTHWEST OHIO HAS AGREED TO MENTOR AAA3 THROUGH THE PROCESS OF REPLICATING THEIR SUCCESSFUL RSVP PROJECT.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTRIBUTE SERVICE TO OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS.  190 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, AND A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL PROVIDE ALL SERVICES. THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES ARE REPRESENTATIVE OF THE HEALTHY FUTURES WORK PLANS. THE VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES ADDRESS AGING IN PLACE WILL INCLUDE SERVICES SUCH AS WEEKLY ONE ON ONE VISITATION OF HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES  TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, MONITOR THEIR ONGOING QUALITY OF LIFE, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION ON ELDER JUSTICE ISSUES.  THIS SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PATROL UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE LIMA COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING PROGRAM.  VOLUNTEERS ARE NEEDED TO PROVIDE RELIEF TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS ALONG WITH EDUCATION TO IMPROVE THE SELF-MANAGEMENT OF CAREGIVING.  THROUGH THE COMPANIONSHIP RESPITE PROGRAM, VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE WEEKLY NON-PROFESSIONAL RESPITE ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT PRIMARY CAREGIVERS WITH THEIR CARE GIVING RESPONSIBILITIES. CAREGIVERS WILL BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO ATTEND THE EVIDENCED BASED PROGRAM, POWERFUL TOOLS FOR CAREGIVERS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL LEAD THE CLASSES AFTER EXTENSIVE TRAINING ON THE FIDELITY OF THE PROGRAM.  AAA3 HAS 10 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE UTILIZING VOLUNTEERS TO LEAD EVIDENCED BASED CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT CLASSES.  THE RSVP PROJECT WILL SUPPORT AAA3 IN EXPANDING OUR ABILITY TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS TO LEAD CLASSES AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.  FINALLY, THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT VOLUNTEER CAPACITY BUILDING FOR DISASTER PREPARATIONS, THE ELDER JUSTICE PROGRAM AWAKENINGS AND THE REGIONAL LONG TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OUR LORAIN COUNTY COMMUNITY. OF THIS NUMBER 24% RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DELIVERING MEALS TO HOMEBOUND OLDER AND/OR DISABLED ADULTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THREE-YEAR GRANT, 395 UNDUPLICATED OLDER AND/OR DISABLED ADULTS WILL RECEIVE HOME-DELIVERED MEALS WITH 118 UNDUPLICATED OLDER AND/OR DISABLED ADULTS REPORT THEY HAVE IMPROVED PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $50, 861 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $30,036.

CREATED IN 1916, CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO (CCSWO) IS A NON-PROFIT, 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION SEPARATE FROM THE ARCHDIOCESE OF CINCINNATI. CCSWO SERVICES ARE OPEN TO  ALL VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY REGARDLESS OF RELIGION, RACE, GENDER, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN. THE MAIN OFFICE  IS LOCATED AT 7162 READING ROAD, CINCINNATI, OHIO 45237. THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO IS TO ENLIGHTEN, SERVE, AND EMPOWER. CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOCUSES ON ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY IN OUR MISSION.  HIGH QUALITY S AND EXEMPLARY. CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO IS CONTINUALLY LOOKING TO EXPAND SERVICES, STRENGTHEN PROGRAM QUALITY, AND BUILD COMMUNITY SUPPORT.
CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO HAS SPONSORED SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS SINCE 1967, AND HAS HOSTED THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) GRANTEE SINCE 2008. THE RSVP PROGRAM PROMOTES CIVIC ENGAGEMENT IN CINCINNATI AND HAMILTON COUNTY, OHIO BY PROMOTING MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR 55 AND OLDER SENIORS AND RETIRED MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. 
ALL THREE OF THE SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS (FGP, SCP, AND RSVP) ARE CURRENTLY SPONSORED BY CATHOLIC CHARITIES. CATHOLIC CHARITIES HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY INVOLVED WITH SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS AND PILOT PROJECTS SINCE 1967. CATHOLIC CHARITIES HAS ALWAYS TAKEN A LEADERSHIP ROLE IN PROGRAMS INVOLVING SENIORS IN THE CINCINNATI AREA AS THE GRANTEE FOR BOTH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN HAMILTON COUNTY.  
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RSVP GRANT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES. SPECIFICALLY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK IN HAMILTON COUNTY FOOD PANTRIES.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED WITH PARTNERING FOOD PANTRIES TO PROVIDE OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE. 
CURRENTLY, RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE AND WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE AS FACILITATORS FOR THE CAREGIVER SUPPORT NETWORK (CAN), PROVIDING RESPITE FOR THE EVER INCREASING NUMBER OF PEOPLE WHO ARE CARING FOR FAMILY MEMBERS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE ACCESS TO CARE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE SU CASA HISPANIC CENTER. A PROJECTED 65 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIS CNCS FOCUS AREA; WITH ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS STAYING ACTIVE GIVING HOURS IN THE OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL FULFILL MANY ROLES INCLUDING GROUP FACILITATORS, INSTRUCTORS, TUTORS, DRIVERS, AND PROGRAM SUPPORTERS THROUGH A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS. THIS INCLUDES CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO, VARIOUS FOOD PANTRIES, AND OTHER CINCINNATI NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.  THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE INVESTMENT OF $60,105 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $27,553 IN LOCAL AND IN-KIND SUPPORT.
VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF: EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT WITH THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO REFUGEE RESETTLEMENT SERVICES AND SU CASA HISPANIC CENTER.  VOLUNTEER WORK FOCUS ON HELPING INDIVIDUALS OVERCOME CULTURAL AND LINGUISTIC DIFFERENCES, AND ULTIMATELY BECOME EMPLOYABLE.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITY NON-PROFITS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR AND ACCESS TO AGE APPROPRIATE, SOCIAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES IN ORDER TO STIMULATE SENIOR CITIZENS MENTAL, SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL HEALTH.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
 BOX BUTTE COUNTY RSVP IS WELL ESTABLISHED WITH A FORTY YEAR HISTORY OF PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT MEET IMPORTANT COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE RSVP OFFICE IS LOCATED IN ALLIANCE, NE AND SERVES THE CITY OF ALLIANCE AND VILLAGE OF HEMINGFORD. AN ESTIMATED 268 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVES INCLUDE FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, COACHING, FOOD COLLECTION AND TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. FOOD INSECURITY IS HIGH FOR OUR MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. IN ADDITION, MANY OF OUR OLDER ADULTS NEED SOCIAL CONNECTION AS WELL AS HELP WITH THE BASICS OF DAILY LIVING. AT THE END OF THE REPORTING PERFORMANCE PERIOD, AT LEAST 150 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO RECEIVING DELIVERED FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER HELP. THIS IS JUST A SAMPLE OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH AN ORGANIZED AND WELL MANAGED NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS AND VOLUNTEER STATIONS. VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA AND INCLUDE SCHOOLS, NURSING HOME FACILITIES, ART CENTERS, MUSEUMS, LIBRARIES, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND MANY MORE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 90 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO RECEIVING DELIVERED FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER HELP, 300 INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, 6 PEOPLE PLACED IN HOUSING AND 20 STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMICS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $45,411 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES EACH YEAR.

OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY NEED OF HUNGER BY SORTING, PACKAGING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD IN LOCAL PANTRIES AND FOOD BANKS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $74,742 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $316,854 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH COME FROM LOCAL, STATE AND OTHER FUNDS, AND INCLUDES THE REQUIRED MATCH OF $32,032.  
THE SELF-SPONSORED, LEGAL APPLICANT IS A.C.E. OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA.  OUR MISSION IS TO ENGAGE COMMUNITIES BY EDUCATING, CONNECTING, AND ADVOCATING WITH AN EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEERISM AND INDEPENDENT LIVING.  OUR ORGANIZATION SERVES 7 COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA, AND IT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972.  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (JOINT POWERS BOARD) MEETS MONTHLY AND PROVIDES OPERATIONAL OVERSIGHT AS WELL AS FINANCIAL SUPPORT (PER CAPITA, FACILITIES AND SPACE).  OUR FINANCIAL AND DATABASE SUPPORT SERVICES ARE COMPLETED BY SOUTHWEST REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION STAFF, PER AN ANNUAL CONTRACT.  A.C.E. OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA EMPLOYS AN EXECUTIVE/PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND 7 PROGRAM COORDINATORS.  
OUR 2016 YEAR-END REPORT WILL INDICATE THAT AT LEAST 2,122 ENROLLED VOLUNTEERS WERE ACTIVE.  AS OF NOVEMBER 30, 2016, THE CUMULATIVE COST PER HOUR OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEAR TO DATE WAS $1.44/HOUR.  IN 2016, OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS RECORDED MORE THAN 242,000 HOURS OF SERVICE AT 350 STATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 1,365 ARROWHEAD RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 275 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WORKING DIRECTLY WITH INCOME-ELIGIBLE CLIENTS AT FOOD PANTRIES, SOUP KITCHENS, AND NAPS (NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FOR SENIORS) FOOD DISTRIBUTION SITES. THEY WILL PERFORM REQUIRED TASKS OF REGISTERING CLIENTS, ACCOMPANYING CLIENTS AS THEY SHOP AT FOOD PANTRIES, DELIVERING FOOD BOXES OR A MEAL TO HOMEBOUND NEEDY RESIDENTS, AND COOKING AND SERVING MEALS AT A SOUP KITCHEN. OTHER RELATED TASKS INCLUDE RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS, SEEKING DONATIONS TO PURCHASE FOOD AND MAINTAIN THE PROGRAM AND FACILITY AND PREPARING MONTHLY SERVICE REPORTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 30,000 INDIVIDUALS IN NE MN WILL HAVE BEEN ASSISTED IN OBTAINING NUTRITIOUS FOODS AT PANTRIES, NAPS SITES AND SOUP KITCHENS; AND 18,000 OF THAT TOTAL WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $133,923 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 58,070.

AN ESTIMATED 1,100 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 465 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOOD DISTRIBUTION, FOOD DELIVERY, TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY BASED MENTORING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED 20,000 LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS SEEKING TO INCREASE THEIR FOOD SECURITY THROUGH THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES - OBESITY AND FOOD. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $113,812 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $183,584 IN FUNDING FROM THE MINNESOTA BOARD ON AGING; CITIES OF ST. CLOUD, SARTELL, SAUK RAPIDS, ST. JOSEPH, WAITE PARK, STEARNS, BENTON AND SHERBURNE COUNTIES AND UNITED WAYS OF SHERBURNE COUNTY AND CENTRAL MINNESOTA.
LOCATED IN ST. CLOUD, MINNESOTA, THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD-GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) SERVES CENTRAL MINNESOTA COMMUNITIES LOCATED IN BENTON, SHERBURNE AND STEARNS COUNTIES. THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD IS A RAPIDLY GROWING CORE CITY WITHIN CENTRAL MINNESOTA, LOCATED JUST 65 MILES NORTHWEST OF MINNEAPOLIS-ST. PAUL, AND IS CONSIDERED ONE OF THE STATE'S LARGER METROPOLITAN AREAS. IT HAS ALSO BEEN REPORTED AS ONE OF THE STATE'S FASTEST GROWING METRO AREAS WITH AN OVERALL GROWTH RATE OF 13.6% SINCE THE 2000 CENSUS.  FIVE INDIVIDUAL CITIES MAKE UP THE ST. CLOUD METROPOLITAN AREA: ST. CLOUD, SARTELL, SAUK RAPIDS, WAITE PARK, AND ST. JOSEPH.
THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF ST. CLOUD IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY COST EFFECTIVE PUBLIC SERVICES.  THE GREATER ST. CLOUD AREA RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM EXPECTS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THIS MISSION BY SERVING AN ESTIMATED 1,100 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS THAT CONNECTS THEM WITH TARGETED COMMUNITY NEEDS, IN A COST EFFECTIVE MANNER.  VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND CAPACITY BUILDING WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA BEING HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD, AND TRANSPORTATION. THESE AREAS COMPRISE THE GREATEST NEED OF OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY.  PROVIDING VOLUNTEER SERVICES IN THESE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AREAS WILL STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY AND THE PARTNERSHIPS WE HAVE WITH AGENCIES WHO ADDRESS THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO HAVE MET ALL OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES PROJECTED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES - OBESITY AND FOOD (150 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE HELPED INCREASE FOOD SECURITY FOR 20,000 PEOPLE AND 50 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH FOOD DELIVERY TO THOSE WHO ARE HOMEBOUND.) THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF PEOPLE OF ALL AGES BY ADDRESSING PRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH HUMAN SERVICE, GOVERNMENT AND LICENSED HEALTH CARE AGENCIES. RSVP WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO TRACK PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT OUTCOMES THROUGH SURVEYS AND STATISTICS GATHERED FROM THE AGENCIES BENEFITTING FROM THE SERVICES OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.

THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) BEGAN AS A NATIONAL PROGRAM IN 1971.  ANOKA COUNTY HAS SPONSORED RSVP SINCE 1973, VALUING CITIZEN PARTICIPATION IN RESPONDING TO LOCAL NEEDS AND PARTNERING FOR SOLUTIONS.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP STARTED WITH 53 VOLUNTEERS AND CURRENTLY HAS 448 ENROLLED VOLUNTEERS.  IN THESE CHALLENGING TIMES, ANOKA COUNTY RECOGNIZES THE RESOURCES OF OLDER VOLUNTEERS AND AS A SPONSOR CONTINUES TO SUPPORT RSVP IN CONNECTING VOLUNTEER ASSETS TO MEANINGFUL SERVICE.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP [AC RSVP] LINKS VOLUNTEERS WITH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES WHICH MEET THE CNCS FOCUS AREAS AND COMMUNITY NEEDS. 
AN ESTIMATED 320 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE BENEFICIARIES IN A WIDE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE (PROVIDE RESPITE/COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND VETERANS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSIST 4 LOCAL FOOD SHELVES, MEAL DELIVERY, PROVIDE FREE TAX ASSISTANCE, AND PROVIDE HOUSING ASSISTANCE).  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT: CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE AND INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES; INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM FOOD SHELVES WILL REPORT AN INCREASE IN FOOD SECURITY; AND INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING HOUSING SERVICES WILL TRANSITION INTO HOUSING.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $40,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ANOKA COUNTY (LOCAL) IN THE AMOUNT OF $121,510.00 (INCLUDING EXCESS FUNDS) AND ALSO THE MN BOARD ON AGING (STATE) IN THE AMOUNT OF $14,335.00 FOR A TOTAL OF $135,845.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  ANOKA COUNTY RSVP HAS DEMONSTRATED SUCCESS IN THE PREVIOUS GRANT CYCLE WITH 180 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING WITHIN PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND CAPACITY BUILDING AREAS.

THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF THE RED RIVER VALLEY (RRV) HAS BEEN A FUNDAMENTAL ORGANIZATION TO AREA SENIOR CITIZENS SINCE 1974.   FOR OVER 40 YEARS, THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA CROOKSTON HAS PROUDLY ACTED AS THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION OF RSVP IN THE RED RIVER VALLEY.  THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA CROOKSTON CONTINUES TO ACTIVELY SUPPORT THE INNOVATIVE PROGRAMMING TO AREA SENIOR CITIZENS BY CONTINUING TO SUPPORT THE OUTSTANDING EFFORTS OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS.  THE MOST RECENT DEMOGRAPHIC INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE US CENSUS DEPARTMENT SHOWS THAT THE AVERAGE PERCENTAGE OF SENIOR CITIZENS IN MINNESOTA AGE 65 AND OLDER IS 13.6%.  IN ALL 7 COUNTIES WITHIN THE RED RIVER VALLEY THIS PERCENTAGE RANGES FROM 14.9% TO 22.9% THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  WITHIN RURAL COMMUNITIES IN THE RED RIVER VALLEY IT IS CONCLUDED THAT LARGE AGING POPULATIONS ARE INCREASING THROUGHOUT THIS REGION, WHILE THERE IS AN OUTFLOW OF YOUNGER ADULTS ACCORDING TO THE RURAL ASSISTANCE CENTER.   ACCORDING TO THE U.S. ADMINISTRATION ON AGING, BY 2020, NEARLY ONE IN SIX INDIVIDUALS WILL BE AGE 65 OR OLDER. COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE RED RIVER VALLEY RANGE IN POPULATIONS OF LESS THAN 500 TO COMMUNITIES OF 7,000-9,000. SENIOR CITIZENS THAT RESIDE WITHIN THE RED RIVER VALLEY FACE CHALLENGES OF REMAINING HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT WITHIN THEIR OWN HOMES DUE TO GAPS WITHIN CRUCIAL SERVICES THROUGHOUT THIS RURAL REGION.   A DEFICIT OF ACCESS TO SPECIALTY MEDICAL SERVICES AND SUPPLEMENTAL SERVICES CAN BE DIFFICULT FOR SENIORS TO ACCESS WITHIN REMOTE RURAL REGIONS.  THIS CAN POSE A PROBLEM FOR SENIORS WISHING TO AGE IN PLACE.  IT IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER FOR SENIOR CITIZENS TO REMAIN HEALTHY, ACTIVE, AND REMAIN IN CONTROL OF THEIR PERSONAL INDEPENDENCE THROUGHOUT THE AGING PROCESS.   THE OLDER AMERICAN ACT (OAA) SERVICES ARE INTENDED TO FOSTER CONNECTION BETWEEN OLDER ADULTS AND COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES.  
RSVP OF THE RED RIVER VALLEY RECOGNIZES THE CHALLENGES SENIOR CITIZENS ARE FACED WITH AND ACTIVELY SUPPORT THE HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE OF SENIOR CITIZENS WHO WISH TO AGE IN PLACE.  OUR VOLUNTEERS ACTIVELY WORK TO HELP FILL IN GAPS IN COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.  AS A RESULT, RSVP OF THE RED RIVER VALLEY IDENTIFIES A PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON HEALTHY FUTURES AS A FOCUS AREA FOR VOLUNTEER SERVICES. THE MISSION OF RSVP IS TO FACILITATE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEN AND WOMEN, WHERE THEY CAN  APPLY  VALUABLE TALENTS AND SKILLS THROUGH VITAL AND ESSENTIAL VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES OF THEIR CHOICE, WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES THEY CALL HOME.  RSVP OF THE RRV PROPOSES TO ENGAGE APPROXIMATELY 550 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN IMPACTFUL VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES, WITH 192 OF THEM IN OUTCOME BASED HEALTHY FUTURES WORKPLANS.      AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, RETURNED SURVEYS WILL INDICATE AN INCREASE IN PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT/REDUCED ISOLATION, INCREASED FOOD SECURITY, VIABLE ACCESS TO HOME, COMMUNITY AND HEALTH RELATED SERVICES AND OVERALL IMPROVED WELL-BEING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $57,653 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL RESOURCES OF $33,125 (COUNTY FUNDING, LOCAL UNITED WAY, UMC), AND FUNDING FROM THE MINNESOTA BOARD OF AGING GRANT AT $26,342 ANNUALLY.

EVERY PARENT'S DREAM IS TO SEE THEIR CHILDREN BECOME PROSPEROUS, HEALTHY, AND HAPPY. THE EASTERN UPPER PENINSULA IN MICHIGAN'S U.P. IS A RUGGED AND ISOLATED AREA. MANY OF THE PEOPLE ARE NATIVE AMERICAN AND LIVE IN LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS. WHILE COMPARING THE DATA ON COMMUNITY CONDITIONS, WE MUST ASK OURSELVES, ARE WE THRIVING?  IF NOT, HOW DO WE GET THERE AND WHAT IS THE VISION?
UNITED WAY OF THE EUP IS IN THE BUSINESS OF BUILDING COMMUNITIES. OUR VISION IS TO TACKLE PREVALENT ISSUES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF VOLUNTEERS. WE FIGHT FOR THE HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND FINANCIAL STABILITY OF EVERY PERSON IN OUR COMMUNITY. WE PROPOSE TO FOCUS ON BUILDING KIDS' ACADEMIC SKILLS THROUGH AN INTERGENERATIONAL APPROACH TO READING AND MENTORING. WE WILL PLACE 75 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WITH 325 STUDENTS MOST VULNERABLE AND AT-RISK OF NOT GRADUATING IN SITES AROUND 3 COUNTIES. ALL 75 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE OUTCOME MEASURED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 ANNUALLY WILL BE MATCHED WITH THE REQUIRED 30% IN 3 YEARS PROVIDED THROUGH UNITED WAY'S LOCAL FUNDING.
ACTIVITIES OF THE RSVP PROGRAM WOULD INCLUDE A READING BUDDIES PROGRAM TARGETING LOWER-INCOME 3 TO 5-YEAR-OLDS THAT ATTEND VARIOUS HEAD START LOCATIONS, A CHIPPEWA TRIBAL HEAD START, AND PRESCHOOLS. THE OUTCOMES OF THIS WORK WOULD INCREASE CHILDREN'S SCHOOL READINESS TO THOSE MOST VULNERABLE.
A SECOND APPROACH TO INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING WOULD BE TO DEVELOP A MENTORING PARTNERSHIP WITH THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB. THIS CLUB HAS 3 LOCATIONS; MALCOM ALTERNATIVE HIGH SCHOOL, BRIMLEY SCHOOLS, AND A TRIBAL LOCATION IN BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY. OUR INTENTION IS NOT TO CREATE A NEW PROGRAM, BUT TO STRENGTHEN THE EXISTING MENTORING PROGRAM WITH THE USE OF ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS. THE CLUB OFFERS ACTIVITIES THAT INCLUDE: CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION AND CAREER DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH/LIFE SKILLS, THE ARTS/CULTURAL DEVELOPMENT, AND FITNESS. OUR OUTCOMES WOULD BE TO INCREASE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT WITH IMPROVEMENTS IN SELF-CONFIDENCE, POSITIVE ATTITUDES AND PERFORMANCE IN SCHOOL. THE RESULT IS THAT OUR CHILDREN WOULD HAVE THE SKILLS AND TOOLS NECESSARY TO SUCCEED IN SCHOOL AND GRADUATE HIGH SCHOOL. WE'VE SET THEM ON A PATH TO PROSPER AND THRIVE THROUGH A CARING VOLUNTEER.

NORTHEAST MICHIGAN COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY, INC. (NEMCSA) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY (CAA) WITH AN 11-COUNTY CORE SERVICE AREA. THIS AREA INCLUDES ALCONA, ALPENA, ARENAC, CHEBOYGAN, CRAWFORD, IOSCO, MONTMORENCY, OGEMAW, OSCODA, OTSEGO, AND PRESQUE ISLE COUNTIES. NEMCSA IS UNIQUE IN THAT IT IS THE ONLY ONE OF MICHIGAN'S 29 CAAS TO ALSO SERVE AS AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA). THE NEMCSA REGION 9 AAA COVERS THE CORE 11 COUNTIES PLUS ROSCOMMON COUNTY. NEMCSA ALSO OPERATES A HEAD START PROGRAM IN 21 COUNTIES, A QUARTER OF MICHIGAN'S 83, MAKING IT ONE OF THE LARGEST PROGRAMS IN THE NATION.  NEMCSA WAS INCORPORATED IN 1968 AND HAS GROWN FROM AN INITIAL BUDGET OF UNDER $500,000 TO OVER $51 MILLION IN FISCAL YEAR 2015. NEMCSA EMPLOYS OVER 700 STAFF TO PROVIDE VITAL SERVICES TO THOUSANDS OF LOW INCOME AND OTHERWISE DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE THROUGH 32 PROGRAMS. HAVING THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) UNDER THE SAME UMBRELLA AS MANY OF THE PROGRAMS THAT THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WILL FACILITATE REFERRAL AND COOPERATION. NEMCSA'S CURRENT RSVP COVERS CRAWFORD AND ROSCOMMON COUNTIES AND HAS SERVED NORTHEAST MICHIGAN FOR 15 YEARS. IT IS THE "YOUNGEST" OF NEMCSA'S THREE SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS. WITH THE ADDITION OF NINE NEW COUNTIES, APPROXIMATELY 3,000 MORE CLIENTS WILL BE SERVED BY AN ESTIMATED 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 160 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: DELIVERY OF IN-HOME MEALS, PROVIDING MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION, MAKING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS, SERVING AT FOOD PANTRIES, AND MENTORING HEAD START PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN. THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL ADDRESS TWO OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE EMPHASIZED FUNDING PRIORITIES: AGING IN PLACE: TRANSPORTATION; AND EDUCATION: INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMMING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, NEMCSA RSVP EXPECTS TO HAVE HELPED MAINTAIN THE INDEPENDENT LIVING STATUS OF 370 HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS AND HELPED THEM TO INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT BY HAVING RSVP VOLUNTEERS: 1. SERVE AS HOME DELIVERED MEALS DRIVERS (FOR 120 PERSONS PER YEAR); 2. PROVIDE NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION (FOR 150 INDIVIDUALS PER YEAR); AND 3. MAKE TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS (TO 100 PEOPLE PER YEAR). IN ADDITION, THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO ANNUALLY INCREASE THE FOOD SECURITY OF 2,500 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT FOOD PANTRIES AND BY MENTORING MORE THAN 125 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS PER YEAR. THE TOTAL GRANT BUDGET IS FOR $175,607 PER YEAR OR $526,821 FOR THE THREE YEAR CONTRACT. BUDGETS AND WORKPLANS WILL BE GENERATED ANNUALLY. FOR YEAR ONE THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $122,051 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $53,556.

BY JUNE 2020, EIGHTY-FOUR (84) VOLUNTEERS AT MINIMUM WILL SERVE IN THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF MUSKEGON AND OCEANA COUNTIES IN OUTCOME-BASED PERFORMANCE CAPACITIES ALLOWING MOBILIZATION TO IMPACT LOCAL NEEDS.   
TO ALIGN MORE EFFECTIVELY AND SYSTEMICALLY WITHIN THE MISSION AND VISION OF THE UNITED WAY OF THE LAKESHORE AND TO SECURE A SOLID FOUNDATION FOR THE RSVP TO FLOURISH UNDER THE UNITED WAY SPONSORSHIP, THE RSVP OF MUSKEGON AND OCEANA UPDATED WORK PLANS TO EXPAND SPECIFIC VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND EFFORTS OF THOSE AGED 55+ WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT FOCUS ON ASSISTING THE ASSET LIMITED, INCOME-CONSTRAINED, AND EMPLOYED (ALICE) ALSO KNOWN AS "THE WORKING POOR".  "UNDERSTANDING THAT IF WE WANT A GOOD ECONOMY, IF WE ARE GOING TO BE A STATE OF OPPORTUNITY THAT PROVIDES GOOD JOBS AND GOOD WAGES ONCE AGAIN -- WE MUST PURSUE EDUCATION AND ENHANCED OPPORTUNITY FOR EVERYONE."  REACHING FOR OPPORTUNITY:  MICHIGAN POSTSECONDARY CREDENTIAL ATTAINMENT (2017)
TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FOR GRADES K-12 FOCUSING PRIMARILY ON EDUCATION, AN IDENTIFIED "KEY" TO IMPROVING THE LOCAL ECONOMIC CLIMATE, THE RSVP WILL STRUCTURE PRIORITY WORK IN CONJUNCTION WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS: THE MUSKEGON AREA INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT (MAISD) AND ITS AFFILIATES, LOCAL COMMUNITY SCHOOLS AND CLASSROOMS (CRITERION SPECIFICALLY DEFINED BY PERFORMANCE MEASURE), EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS, AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMMING AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED GROUPS.

AN ESTIMATED 85 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ACROSS THE TRI-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF HURON, SANILAC, AND TUSCOLA COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, DELIVERING MEALS TO THE HOMEBOUND ELDERLY, TRANSPORTING NON-MOBILE SENIORS TO HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS, MAKING TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS TO THE FRAIL (OFTEN HOMEBOUND) ELDERLY, AND VISITING WITH ISOLATED SENIORS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE ANTICIPATED.  IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE 215 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT (H9).  THIS TOTAL INCLUDES A MINIMUM OF 15 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES, 150 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES, AND 50 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES,  ADDITIONALLY, IN HEALTHY FUTURES, 1000 FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE INCREASED FOOD SECURITY OF THEMSELVES AND THEIR CHILDREN (HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY) AS A RESULT OF CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICES (H12).  IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, THERE WILL BE 10 STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12 THAT PARTICIPATED IN THE MENTORING OR TUTORING WHO WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT (ED27).

CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF WASHTENAW COUNTY (CSSW), A NONPROFIT HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY IN ANN ARBOR, MICHIGAN, WILL SPONSOR RSVP WASHTENAW.  CSSW HAS SPONSORED RSVP WASHTENAW SINCE 1989. AN ESTIMATED 250 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES AT APPROXIMATELY 40 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN WASHTENAW COUNTY, MICHIGAN. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 88 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS DESIGNED TO HELP MEET THE UNMET NEEDS IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS OUR SERVICE AREA.  WITH THE INTENTION OF SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS WHO WISH TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, SOME OF THE VOLUNTEERS' ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS, PROVIDING HOME CHORE SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS, DELIVERING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS, AND ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS WITH TAX PREPARATION AND WITH NAVIGATING MEDICAID/MEDICARE SERVICES AND FORMS. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT RSVP WASHTENAW VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO MEET NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING AGING IN PLACE, ACCESS TO CARE, AND FINANCIAL LITERACY. HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE FOOD, RESPITE AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.
THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $88,325 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT OF $24,723 FROM THE STATE OF MICHIGAN AGING AND ADULT SERVICES AGENCY AND AN ADDITIONAL $33,707 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

RSVP OF INGHAM, EATON AND CLINTON COUNTIES WILL CONTINUE TO MEET NEEDS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES; AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, VETERAN AND DISASTER SERVICES. AN ESTIMATED 400 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE TRI-COUNTY AREA. IN HEALTHY FUTURES, 120 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE WORKING IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS WITH HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE, AND FOOD DELIVERY TO IMPROVE SOCIAL SUPPORT, AS WELL AS NUTRITIONAL AND HEALTH STATUS. AN ADDITIONAL 80 VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK IN HEALTH CARE AND OTHER SYSTEMS BY PROVIDING INFORMATION AND SUPPORT IN MEDICAL SETTINGS AND ORGANIZING AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD AT THE LOCAL FOOD PANTRIES TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY. TWENTY VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HOUSING ASSISTANCE IN BUILDING OR REPAIRING HOMES FOR LOW-INCOME PEOPLE LIVING IN SHELTERS OR SUB-STANDARD HOUSING IN THE AREA OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY. LANSING WAS DESIGNATED AS ONE OF THREE SITES IN MICHIGAN TO HAVE A FREEDOM CENTER THAT SERVES VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES BEFORE DEPLOYMENT. OVER 40 RSVP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE HOSPITALITY SERVICES TO OVER 24,000 PEOPLE GOING THROUGH THE FREEDOM CENTER IN LANSING EACH YEAR. ONE OF THE MOST VALUABLE RESOURCES IS THE TRI-COUNTY AREA RIVER WALK; 50 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE ON THE 13 MILES OF THE RIVER WALK TRAIL TO MONITOR THE TRAIL AND REPORT PROBLEMS THAT NEED ATTENTION. AT THE END OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT TO FILL ALL OUR NUMBERS WITH GROWTH IN SERVICES TO VETERANS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AND NUTRITION. THE  CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $102,698 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $59,527 FROM OTHER SOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 700 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN WAYNE COUNTY, MICHIGAN.  OF THIS NUMBER 313 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS DESIGNED TO HELP MEET THE UNMET NEEDS IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS OUR SERVICE AREA.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  PROVIDING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS IN WESTERN WAYNE COUNTY; ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS WITH COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES MAKING DAILY REASSURANCE CALLS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES; ASSISTING FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY DISTRIBUTING FOOD FROM PANTRIES; ASSISTING CHILDREN IN AFTER SCHOOL LITERACY AND TUTORING PROGRAMS.  RSVP OF WAYNE COUNTY HAS CHOSEN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES:  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 1,956 HOMEBOUND SENIORS WILL RECEIVE NUTRITIOUS MEALS DAILY AND WILL INCREASE THEIR SOCIAL TIES, 70 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE DAILY TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS TO ENSURE THEY ARE DOING WELL AND ARE HAPPY TO CONTINUE INDEPENDENT LIVING, 750 FAMILIES WILL RECEIVE MONTHLY PANTRY ITEMS TO INCREASE THEIR FOOD SECURITY FOR THEIR HOUSEHOLD, AND 125 ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WILL REPORT AN IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN READING AND/OR MATH.  THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF  $288,171 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY GRANT FUNDING FROM MICHIGAN AGING AND ADULT SERVICES AGENCY $72,476, GRANT FUNDING FROM SMART/DDOT TRANSPORTATION $ 35,254, AND IN-KIND DONATIONS OF $17,699, IN NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WAYNE COUNTY SPONSORED BY COMMUNITY SOCIAL SERVICES OF WAYNE COUNTY.

THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP) OF KNOX AND GREENE COUNTIES IS A PROGRAM THAT VINCENNES UNIVERSITY'S GENERATIONS (GENERATIONS), AREA 13 AGENCY ON AGING & DISABILITY WOULD LIKE TO SPONSOR AS PART OF THE EXPANSION FUNDING THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE.  GENERATIONS IS PART OF VINCENNES UNIVERSITY'S COMMUNITY SERVICES DIVISION AND HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN THESE TWO COUNTIES FOR OVER 40 YEARS.
IN ADDITION, GENERATIONS HAS OVER 35 YEARS' EXPERIENCE MANAGING VOLUNTEER PROJECTS INVOLVING OLDER ADULTS AS EITHER THE VOLUNTEER OR THE RECIPIENT OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITY.  PAST ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FOCUSING ON HEALTHY AGING, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, EDUCATION, REDUCING ISOLATION OF OLDER ADULTS, INCREASING INTER-GENERATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORTING LOCAL VETERAN PROGRAMS.  
RSVP OF KNOX AND GREENE COUNTIES WILL HAVE 60 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN ASSIGNMENTS WITH OUTCOMES IDENTIFIED IN HEALTHY FUTURES, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY OR FACILITATING EVIDENCED-BASED CLASSES AND 80 RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVING THEIR COMMUNITY BY THE END OF YEAR 1.  BY THE END OF YEAR 3, THERE WILL BE 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN ASSIGNMENTS WITH OUTCOMES OR FACILITATING EVIDENCED-BASED CLASSES AND 110 VOLUNTEERS.  
	BY THE END OF YEAR ONE, RSVP TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE FACILITATED CLASSES IN 5 LOCATIONS AND HAD 60+ OLDER ADULTS COMPLETE THE MATTER OF BALANCE OR CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT PROGRAM; BY THE END OF YEAR 3, 80 PARTICIPANTS WILL BE TRAINED ANNUALLY.
	RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PREPARE TAXES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND OLDER INDIVIDUALS (OVER $36,000 SAVINGS ANNUALLY IN YEARS 1 TO 3 WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO HAVE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO BUY FOOD, MEDICINE AND COVER OTHER DAILY LIVING EXPENSES.
	25 OLDER ADULTS WILL INDICATE THAT THEY HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES DUE TO THE RSVP VOLUNTEER.
	10 OLDER ADULTS WILL INDICATE THEY HAVE DECREASED FOOD INSECURITY. 
	RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL ATTEND COMMUNITY EVENTS DISTRIBUTING INFORMATION ON S.H.I.P., SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL, CHRONIC DISEASE, CAREGIVER RESOURCES AND OTHER HEALTH AND INSURANCE RELATED TOPICS.  
	RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO HEAD START AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT PRESCHOOLS HELPING CHILDREN PREPARE FOR KINDERGARTEN AND HELPING STUDENTS IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL INCREASE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS.  
	THIRTY-FIVE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
DOVE, INC. SPONSORS THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, RSVP, OF MACON AND DEWITT COUNTIES.  DOVE, INC. IS A PRIVATE, NONPROFIT 501(C) 3 MULTI-SERVICE AGENCY FORMED IN 1970 TO ADDRESS UNMET HUMAN NEEDS AND SOCIAL INJUSTICES IN OUR COMMUNITY.  RSVP HAS BEEN A PART OF DOVE FOR 41 YEARS.  IN CONTINUING SUPPORT OF THIS LONG-STANDING AND SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM, WE ARE PROPOSING TO HAVE 410 VOLUNTEERS AND ARE REQUESTING $62,768 IN FEDERAL FUNDING.  THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $62,768 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A PROPOSED $16,200 IN STATE MATCHING FUNDS SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 2,650. IN AGENCY RECEIVED DONATIONS TO MEET A 30% MATCH AND $65,467 IN LOCAL SUPPORT IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THE TOTAL BUDGET OF $147,085.  AS OF THE CURRENT DATE OF SUBMISSION, THE STATE OF ILLINOIS HAS FAILED TO PROVIDE A BUDGET FOR THE SECOND YEAR IN A ROW. THERE WAS A STOP-GAP BUDGET THAT PROVIDED $30,801 IN FUNDS FOR AN 18 MONTH PERIOD. NO NEW GRANT APPLICATIONS FOR THE 2017 FISCAL YEAR HAS BEEN OFFERED BY THE STATE. DOVE INC. AND THE RSVP PROGRAM HAVE BEEN VERY PRO-ACTIVE IN THIS SITUATION AND HAVE MANAGED TO ELIMINATE NON-ESSENTIALS IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN A HEALTHY ACTIVE RSVP PROGRAM THAT CONTINUES TO SERVE OUR MOST NEEDED POPULATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY.  
MANY RSVP STATIONS HAVE BEEN AFFECTED BY THE BUDGET IMPASSE AND THE PROGRAM HAS SEEN A SLIGHT DECREASE IN VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE COMMUNITIES DUE TO CLOSURES OF STATIONS THROUGH THIS BUDGET CRISIS. VOLUNTEERS HAVE REMAINED ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES SERVING THOSE WHO ARE MOST AT RISK. THIS HAS CHANGED THE DYNAMICS OF STATIONS AS MANY ARE WORKING WITH LESS STAFF AND/OR PRIORITIZING THE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES BY ELIMINATING ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT COST EFFECTIVE AT THIS TIME.  
WHILE NEEDS ARE EXPECTED TO GROW IN ABSENCE OF A STATE BUDGET, RSVP WILL WORK HARD WITH OUR AREA PARTNERS TO HELP SHOULDER THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE GROWING NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY WHERE WE CAN AND FILTER ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS FROM CLOSED PROGRAMS TO STATIONS THAT REMAIN ACTIVE. THE BUDGET CRISIS IN ILLINOIS CONTINUES TO LOOM WITH NO REAL SOLUTIONS IN SIGHT.   IN COLLABORATION WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, VOLUNTEER STATIONS, ADVISORY COUNCIL, VOLUNTEERS AND STAFF WE WILL WORK HARD TO MEET THE NEEDS WE WILL ADDRESS WITH THIS GRANT.

HANDSON SUBURBAN CHICAGO HAS SERVED AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE RSVP OF NORTHERN COOK AND NORTHERN DUPAGE COUNTIES SINCE 1992.  AN ESTIMATED 725 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 182 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.   SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE AGED STUDENTS; ACTING AS A PEN PAL FOR LOCAL ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS; ASSISTING WITH SERVICE LEARNING ACTIVITIES FOR LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS; REPAIRING AND PAINTING THE EXTERIOR OF HOMES OF ELIGIBLE SENIORS, VETERANS OR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES; AND HELPING WITH TAX PREPARATION.  
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT: 
(1) THROUGH TUTORING AND MENTORING PROGRAMS, 350 ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; (2) THROUGH THE PEN PAL PROGRAM, 40 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; (3) 20 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT; (4)  67 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES RESULTING IN THEIR REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; (5) FIFTEEN HOMES OF AN ELIGIBLE SENIOR, VETERAN, OR PERSON WITH DISABILITIES WILL BE PAINTED OR REPAIRED; AND (6) 793 ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE NO CHARGE TAX PREPARATION ASSISTANCE, RESULTING IN APPROXIMATELY $158,600 WORTH OF SAVINGS IN TAX PREPARATION FEES.   
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $180,118 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF $77,193.

ESTABLISHED IN 1974, CARROLL COUNTY BOARD CHALLENGES PEOPLE AGE 55 AND BETTER TO USE THEIR ENERGY, SKILLS, INNOVATIVE SPIRIT AND EXPERIENCE TO RESPOND TO CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE.  HAVING BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR A LONG TIME AND THEREFORE RECOGNIZED AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED AS AN AGENCY PROVIDING QUALITY VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND SERVICES TO RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS CARROLL COUNTY BOARD IS APPLYING FOR EXPANSION OF PROGRAMS INTO THE GEOGRAPHIC AREAS OF CALHOUN AND CRAWFORD COUNTIES IN IOWA. THE PRIMARY CNCS FOCUS AREA SELECTED FOR VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN IS EDUCATION. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE IN COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. POPULATIONS SERVED INCLUDE HOMEBOUND ELDERLY, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGES INDIVIDUALS AND PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL DISABILITIES. IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, EDUCATION, 75 OR 75% OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS TUTORS AND MENTORS IN PUBLIC K-12 SCHOOLS. 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PROJECTS THAT RESULT IN AN OUTCOME. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL FULLFILL ED5: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY; ED27: NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12 THAT PARTICIPATED IN THE MENTORING OR TUTORING OR OTHER EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM, INCLUDING CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICE LEARNING, WHO DEMONSTRATED IMPORVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.. STUDENTS RECEIVING RSVP VOLUNTEER HELP WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN LITERACY, COMMUNICATION SKILLS AND SOCIAL/BEHAVIORAL SKILLS. CARROLL COUNTY BOARD STAFF WILL UTILIZE CURRENT OUTCOME TOOLS AS WELL AS WORK WITH PARTNER AGENCIES DEVELOPING TOOLS AND SURVEYS THAT BEST MEASURE AND REFLECT THE PROJECT OUTCOMES.  
CARROLL COUNTY BOARD IS REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR 100 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. THOSE FEDERAL DOLLARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY BUT NOT LIMITED TO CITY OF LAKE CITY - $6,000 AND CRAWFORD COUNTY- $6,000. MANY LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY CHESTS, FOUNDATIONS, PRIVATE DONORS AND STAFF FUNDRAISING ROUND OUT THE ADDITIONAL $6,183 FUNDS NEEDED TO FULFILL THE PROPOSED BUDGET IN YEAR ONE. WITH THE FUNDING INVESTMENT MADE BY MANY ENTITIES CARROLL COUNTY BOARD?S EXPECTATION IS TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT IMPROVE AND IMPACT THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS.

UTILIZING A HIGHLY QUALIFIED PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND EIGHT DEDICATED SITE COORDINATORS WHO ARE INTIMATELY ACQUAINTED WITH THE COMMUNITIES THEY WILL SERVE, SOUTHERN IOWA RSVP WILL PREPARE CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL AND GUIDE STUDENTS TO EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS, WHICH WILL HELP TRANSFORM THE COMMUNITIES OF SOUTH CENTRAL IOWA. THE CENTRAL VERMONT COUNCIL ON AGING (CVCOA) WISHES TO CONTINUE SPONSORING RSVP OF CENTRAL VERMONT AND THE NORTHEAST KINGDOM (RSVP). CVCOA HAS BEEN A SPONSOR AND SUPPORTER OF SENIOR CORPS PROJECTS SINCE 1988. THE MISSION OF CVCOA IS TO SUPPORT ELDERS AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL, AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES. IN ALIGNMENT WITH OUR SPONSOR'S MISSION, AND THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE, OUR PROPOSAL IS TO HAVE 170 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON AGING IN PLACE (H8/H9) AND ACCESS TO CARE (H4), AND CAPACITY BUILDING (G3-3.3)
	 BUILDING ON LONG-TERM COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS, RSVP VOLUNTEERS IMPROVE LIVES BY ENGAGING IN SERVICE THAT SUPPORTS OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  VOLUNTEERS ASSIST WITH ACCESS TO FOOD RESOURCES BY PARTNERING WITH 26 INDEPENDENT MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAMS (H8) TO DELIVER NUTRITIOUS MEALS TO HOME BOUND ELDERS. THEY PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN CONJUNCTION WITH TWO TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS (H8).  RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO GROW PEER-LED WELLNESS PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING AND PROVIDE LEARNING EXPERIENCES THAT IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF INDIVIDUALS, AND THE COMMUNITY (H4).ALL HELP ADDRESS THE GROWING PROBLEM OF SOCIAL ISOLATION OF SENIORS. 
	RSVP STAFF WILL CONTINUE TO FOSTER THE SUCCESS OF OUR PARTNER AGENCIES BY ENGAGING IN CAPACITY BUILDING SERVICES EMPHASIZING EFFECTIVE VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES SUCH AS RECRUITING AND MARKETING TO PROSPECTIVE VOLUNTEERS; INTERVIEWING, SCREENING, AND SELECTING VOLUNTEERS. 
	THEY WILL ALSO WORK WITH PARTNERS TO DEVELOP METHODS FOR MEASURING OUTCOMES AND EVALUATING THE PROCESS. (G3-3.3) THE GOAL IS TO STRENGTHEN OUR PARTNER AGENCIES' VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS; ALSO BY INCREASING THE POOL OF VOLUNTEERS, THE NUMBER OF MEALS DELIVERED BY EACH VOLUNTEER CAN BE REDUCED, ALLOWING FOR MORE TIME TO VISIT WITH MEAL RECIPIENTS  AND INCREASING SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT. 
	THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $142,334 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $78,289 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
