EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
IN 1972 RSVP OF DUTCHESS COUNTY WAS ESTABLISHED ACCORDING TO THE OLDER AMERICAN'S ACT AND HAS BEEN SERVING THE RESIDENTS OF DUTCHESS FOR 45 YEARS.  FOR THE PROPOSED GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 320 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CITIZENS OF DUTCHESS COUNTY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH THREE OF THE FEDERAL FOCUS AREAS.  OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, HEALTHY FUTURES, WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  FOOD DELIVERY TO THE HOME-BOUND AND DISABLED, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING, HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAMS, ADVOCATING FOR RESIDENTS LIVING IN NURSING HOMES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES, RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS AND INCREASING FOOD SECURITY THROUGH FOOD PANTRY SUPPORT AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION.  A TOTAL OF 165 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  IN THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOCUS AREA, VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSISTING ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS BY ASSISTING WITH INCOME TAX RETURNS AND ASSISTING VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES AT OUR LOCAL VA HOSPITAL.  THE REMAINING AREA, COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, WILL BE SERVICED BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS IN THRIFT SHOPS, ADVISORY BOARD, HISTORIC SITES, HOSPITAL SUPPORT, SERVING CONGREGATE MEALS AT FRIENDSHIP CENTERS AND MORE. 
AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED.  HEALTHY FUTURES WILL PROVIDE HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH FOOD, ACCESS TO MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND GROCERY SHOPPING AND COMPANIONSHIP THAT ALLOWS THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  SENIORS, THROUGH EXERCISE, WILL GAIN INCREASED STRENGTH AND BALANCE TO REDUCE RISK OF FALLING.   OVER 4,900 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE FINANCIAL LITERACY SERVICES AND OVER 1,500 VETERAN FAMILIES WILL BE ASSISTED.  IT IS PROJECTED THAT SERVICE HOURS RENDERED IN ALL THESE AREAS BY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL TOTAL OVER 62,000 ANNUALLY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $80,979 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,294 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC DIOCESE OF SYRACUSE (CCOC) IS DEDICATED TO CARING FOR THOSE IN NEED WHILE PROMOTING HUMAN DEVELOPMENT, COLLABORATION, AND THE ELIMINATION OF POVERTY AND INJUSTICE.  WE STRIVE TO EMPOWER THOSE SERVED TO TRANSFORM THEIR LIVES IN THE SPIRIT OF GOD'S LOVE AND COMPASSION.
CCOC IS AN RSVP APPLICANT WITH 450 VOLUNTEERS PROPOSED. 
132 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
  1. DELIVERING MEALS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS
  2. PROVIDING FOOD TO THE NEEDY THROUGH WORK IN FOOD PANTRIES
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH 234 RSVP VOLUNTEER PLACEMENTS IN THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: AGING IN PLACE, OBESITY AND FOOD AND ACCESS TO CARE.   EIGHTY-ONE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREAS: ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES AND CAPACITY BUILDING.  THE REMAINING 135 RSVP VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACED IN ORGANIZATIONS MEETING OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.
THE AMOUNT OF CNCS FUNDING REQUESTED IS $64,733.  THIS AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY STATE FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $6,368 AND THE REQUIRED 30% AGENCY MATCH IN THE AMOUNT OF $28,537.

AN ESTIMATED 60 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN THE FIRST YEAR. OF THIS NUMBER, 100% WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AFTER PARTICIPATING IN ULSTER LITERACY ASSOCIATION'S (ULA) 18-HOUR LITERACY TUTOR TRAINING PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE-TO-ONE BASIC LITERACY OR ENGLISH LANGUAGE TUTORING FOR ADULTS, ENGLISH CLASSES IN A SCHOOL OR WORKPLACE SETTING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE ULA'S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS IN ULSTER COUNTY TO SERVE  ADULT STUDENTS AT THE VERY LOWEST LITERACY LEVELS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ULSTER LITERACY ASSOCIATION WILL HAVE EXPANDED ITS EXISTING PROGRAM TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND MANAGE 210 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $79037 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $7903 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES DURING THE FIRST 10-MONTH PERIOD OF THE GRANT. 
ULA HAS A 36-YEAR TRACK RECORD AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES ADULTS WITH MULTIPLE LITERACY-RELATED ISSUES. ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY FIVE (185) VOLUNTEERS CURRENTLY WORK WITH LEARNERS THROUGHOUT ULSTER COUNTY TOWARD A VARIETY OF LITERACY-BASED EDUCATIONAL GOALS. WE RETAIN 85% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS FROM YEAR TO YEAR AND THE AVERAGE LENGTH OF SERVICE IS THREE YEARS. THE DEMAND FOR VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES IS THRIVING IN ULSTER COUNTY. ACCORDING TO A RECENT STUDY, "VOLUNTEERISM IN ULSTER COUNTY", BY THE BENJAMIN CENTER FOR PUBLIC POLICY INITIATIVES (2017), 45 PERCENT OF ULSTER COUNTY RESIDENTS SURVEYED SAID THAT THEY HAD VOLUNTEERED AT LEAST ONCE IN THE PAST YEAR. BY EXPANDING OUR TRAINING PROGRAM TO RURAL AREAS AND OFFERING MORE FREQUENT TRAININGS, ULA CAN CAPTURE THIS ENTHUSIASM AND PROVIDE A PATHWAY FOR MANY RESIDENTS OVER THE AGE OF 55 TO VOLUNTEER IN THEIR OWN HOME TOWN.
OUR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY BY KEEPING SENIORS INVOLVED, HELPING FAMILIES IMPROVE THEIR LIVES THROUGH LITERACY, AND ENABLING SELF-MOTIVATED ADULTS TO REACH THEIR PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL GOALS. OUR TUTORS, MANY OF WHOM ARE RETIRED EDUCATORS, SERVE NEARLY 400 LEARNERS ANNUALLY, YET IT IS ESTIMATED THAT 16,000 IN ULSTER COUNTY STILL NEED OUR HELP (2010 CENSUS, PROLITERACY). IT IS WELL DOCUMENTED THAT A LACK OF FUNCTIONAL LITERACY OR ENGLISH LANGUAGE PREVENTS A RUDIMENTARY UNDERSTANDING OF BASIC HEALTH, FINANCIAL, AND CONSUMER ISSUES AND IS THE COMMON THREAD OF THE INCARCERATED AND IMPOVERISHED POPULATIONS. OUR INSTRUCTIONAL SERVICES ARE RESEARCH-BASED, EMPLOY THE LATEST TECHNOLOGY, AND PROVIDE REAL-LIFE, CONTEXTUALIZED LEARNING DESIGNED TO BUILD PERMANENT LANGUAGE COMPETENCIES. LITERACY LEADS TO EMPLOYMENT, OPPORTUNITIES, AND INDEPENDENCE - GIFTS EVERY ULA VOLUNTEER GIVE TO THEIR ADULT LEARNERS EVERY DAY.

AN ESTIMATED 75 HAMILTON COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOSPICE, COMPANIONSHIP, HOME DELIVERED MEALS, TRANSPORTATION, K-12 TUTORING, AND FOOD PANTRY.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THIS PROGRAM ANTICIPATES REACHING OVER 400 OF OUR HOME-BOUND AND HARE TO REACH COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND AT LEAST 75 CHILDREN IN NEED OF TUTORING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $70,000.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OVER $6,000.00 FROM NYS OFFICE OF THE AGING. THIS PROJECT PLANS GAINING LOCAL SUPPORT BY RECEIVING COUNTY WIDE MONETARY AND IN-KIND DONATIONS. THE HAMILTON COUNTY RSVP WILL VOLUNTEER HOURS OF SERVICE TO THOSE THAT PROVE TO BE IN NEED THE MOST THROUGHOUT HAMILTON COUNTY. THE VOLUNTEER HOURS SERVED WILL HELP NOT ONLY THE PEOPLE SERVED BUT THEIR FAMILIES AS WELL. VOLUNTEER HOURS WILL ENCOURAGE HEALTHY LIVING AND INDEPENDENCE AND HELP TO COMBAT LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION, AND GIVE THE YOUTH OF OUR COMMUNITY AN UPPER HAND IN EDUCATION. THIS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY PLACING VOLUNTEERS WITH HOME BOUND AND HARD TO REACH ELDERS BY PROVIDING FRIENDLY VISITING, RUNNING ERRANDS, DELIVERING MEALS, FRIENDSHIP AND ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH READING AND TUTORING. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE CLEARLY OUTLINED IN WRITING BETWEEN THE VOLUNTEER STATION AND THE HAMILTON COUNTY RSVP, AND WILL BE REVIEWED ANNUALLY TO ENSURE ALL MEMBERS INVOLVED ARE ENGAGING IN A WIN- WIN SITUATION. IT IS ANTICIPATED THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS BEING SERVED WILL REPORT THEY ARE ABLE TO LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOMES BECAUSE RSVP FILLED IN THE GAPS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OUTLINED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MADISON COUNTY OFFICE FOR THE AGING (MCOFA) REQUESTS A RENEWAL OF THE CNCS GRANT IN ORDER TO CONTINUE ITS HEALTHY FUTURES PROGRAMS.  THROUGH THE CNCS GRANT, MCOFA HAS ENGAGED THE SERVICE OF 112 VOLUNTEERS DURING THE PAST THREE YEARS.  WITH 2 TO 3 MONTHS LEFT IN THE CURRENT GRANT PERIOD, THE POSSIBILITY OF MEETING OUR 130 VOLUNTEER TARGET IS WELL WITHIN REASON.  OUR VOLUNTEER-BASED PROGRAMS HAVE HELPED 569 OLDER ADULTS LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BE HEALTHY FUTURES.  OUR HEALTHY FUTURES ACTIVITIES ARE IN-LINE WITH THE OBJECTIVES OF CNCS, AS EACH ONE SERVES TO PROMOTE AGING IN PLACE AND/OR ACCESS TO PRIMARY AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTHCARE.  THE ACTIVITIES REFLECT THE CNCS PRINCIPLES TO IDENTIFY AND INVEST IN COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS; ENGAGE AMERICANS IN SERVICE; SUPPORT EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMS AND LEVERAGE PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS.
GRANT FUNDS WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN HEALTHY FUTURES PROGRAMS WHICH ACTIVELY ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN A VARIETY OF AREAS.  SERVICE VOLUNTEERS CURRENTLY PROVIDE NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP VIA TELEPHONE SUPPORT, ASSIST IN FOOD PANTRIES, LEAD OR AID IN OUR EVIDENCE-BASED BONE BUILDERS PROGRAM, AND RECRUIT AND SUPPORT NEW VOLUNTEERS.
AT THE END OF THIS GRANT PERIOD, OUR GOAL IS TO ENGAGE 120 VOLUNTEERS IN MCOFA RSVP PROGRAMS.  MCOFA PROJECTS THAT 600 OLDER ADULTS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND EXPERIENCE INCREASED HOUSEHOLD FOOD SECURITY, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $43,438 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $24,589 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

CURRENTLY, RSVP HAS 257 VOLUNTEERS AND AN ESTIMATED 257 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FUTURE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 76 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION, EDUCATION, HEALTH AND NUTRITION, TAX PREPARATION, AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL GAIN A WORTHWHILE, REWARDING VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE WHILE HELPING TO FILL COMMUNITY NEEDS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 40,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $46,818 OF SARATOGA COUNTY FUNDS.

FAMILY & CHILDREN'S SERVICE (FCS) WAS FOUNDED IN 1909 BY A GROUP OF PHILANTHROPIC LONG BRANCH BUSINESSMEN WHO SAW THAT A LARGE NUMBER OF POOR LOCAL CHILDREN RECEIVED NO TOYS DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON.  RECOGNIZING THIS UNFULFILLED NEED IN THEIR COMMUNITY THEY CREATED A HOLIDAY GIFT-GIVING PROGRAM, THE FORERUNNER OF FCS'S CURRENT OPERATION SLEIGHBELLS PROGRAM. THAT INITIAL EFFORT GREW TO INCLUDE THE DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD AND COAL TO THOSE IN NEED AND LATER EXPANDED TO PROVIDE CRITICALLY NEEDED SOCIAL SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGHOUT MONMOUTH COUNTY.  FCS ALSO PROVIDES ADULT PROTECTIVE SERVICES AND TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM IN MIDDLESEX COUNTY.
TODAY, FCS SERVES OVER 8,500 OF PEOPLE ANNUALLY, ADDRESSING HOMELESSNESS; NEGLECT, ABUSE OR EXPLOITATION; HEALTH AND RESPITE CARE; FINANCIAL INSTABILITY DUE TO PHYSICAL, DEVELOPMENTAL OR MENTAL DISABILITIES; CHILDHOOD LITERACY AND OBESITY; MEDICARE COUNSELING AND LONG-TERM CARE ASSISTANCE.  FCS IS ALSO A LEADING VOLUNTEER ORGANIZATION.  OUR 14 PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ARE PROVIDED REGARDLESS OF THE AGE, GENDER, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE, RELIGION, ETHNICITY, LANGUAGE SPOKEN OR PHYSICAL OR MENTAL ABILITY OF THOSE WE SERVE.  WHILE FCS PARTNERS WITH MANY ORGANIZATIONS AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, IN MANY CASES, WE ARE THE SOLE COUNTY-DESIGNATED PROVIDER OF UNDUPLICATED SERVICES AND OFTEN THE LAST HOPE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN CRISIS.  
ONE PROGRAM, THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OR RSVP, NURTURES THE CONCEPT AND VISION THAT'S BEEN AT THE HEART OF THE AGENCY SINCE ITS INCEPTION: WE INSPIRE PEOPLE TO HELP PEOPLE. FCS HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF RSVP SINCE 1973, AND THE AGENCY IS COMMITTED TO MAINTAINING THE HIGH QUALITY OF SERVICE OFFERED BY THE PROGRAM. 
THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE RSVP GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 200 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTRIBUTE THEIR TIME TO HELPING CHILDREN IN MONMOUTH COUNTY ACQUIRE A LOVE OF READING, LEARN MORE IN SCHOOL AND BE HEALTHIER. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT, A PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS, STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS, IS EDUCATION AND INCLUDES READING BUDDIES, AND EARLY-CHILDHOOD LITERACY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM WHICH ADVANCES LITERACY SKILLS AND CREATES ENTHUSIASTIC, CONFIDENT YOUNG READERS IN 18 LOCAL PUBLIC SCHOOLS; AND HEALTHY BUDDIES, AN INTERGENERATIONAL NUTRITION AWARENESS AND PHYSICAL FITNESS INITIATIVE FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES THREE THROUGH FOUR.  WHEN CHILDREN GET A DAILY DIET OF NUTRIENT-RICH FOODS AND ARE HEALTHY, THEY ARE MORE LIKELY NOT TO MISS SCHOOL AND TO LEARN MORE WHILE THEY ARE THERE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 4,800 STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH SECOND GRADE WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT IN THE AREA OF LITERACY THROUGH THE READING BUDDIES PROGRAM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $94,407 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,913 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE RSVP PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY FAMILY & CHILDREN'S SERVICE.

AN ESTIMATED 180 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED BY YEAR THREE BY THE RSVP CENTER OF ESSEX AND HUDSON COUNTIES, 139 OF WHOM WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED PERFORMANCE MEASURES. THE RECRUITMENT EFFORT WILL BE ENHANCED BY A BROAD ARRAY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. CHILDREN NEED STRONG COMMUNITY SUPPORTS AND PERSONAL RESOURCES TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS HEALTHY, PRODUCTIVE ADULTS. THE RSVP CENTER OF ESSEX AND HUDSON COUNTIES TAKES A TWO-PRONGED APPROACH THROUGH TWO TIME-HONORED PROGRAMS. THE FIRST IS A SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING PROGRAM ENTITLED LISTEN TO CHILDREN WHICH PAIRS OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEER "LISTENERS" WITH TROUBLED YOUTH, CREATING A SAFE NON-JUDGMENTAL ENVIRONMENT AND A SECURE SOUNDING BOARD FOR CHILDREN TO EXPRESS CONCERNS OR ANXIETIES.  THE SECOND, A READING PROGRAM IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, TRAINS VOLUNTEER READING BUDDIES TO READ TO CHILDREN IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN SMALL GROUP SETTINGS ON A WEEKLY BASIS.  
A SECONDARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. THE TARGET AUDIENCE FOR THIS FOCUS AREA IS FRAIL, HOMEBOUND, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED OLDER ADULTS. IT IS COMMONLY UNDERSTOOD THAT WITHOUT COMMUNITY-BASED SUPPORTS, OLDER ADULTS RESIDING IN THEIR OWN HOMES WHO STRUGGLE FINANCIALLY MAKE RISKY DECISIONS ABOUT WHETHER TO FOREGO DOCTOR VISITS AND PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS. THEY MIGHT CONSUME CHEAP, LESS NUTRITIOUS FOODS, DEFER BILL PAYMENT AND LET INTEREST EXPENSES ACCUMULATE IN ORDER TO MAKE ENDS MEET. FOR THOSE WITHOUT NEARBY FAMILY, SOCIALIZATION IS CONSIDERED A LUXURY THEY CANNOT AFFORD. THESE PRACTICES LEAD TO POOR HEALTH AND PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION. THE RSVP CENTER ADDRESSES THESE NEEDS THROUGH A MULTI-LAYERED APPROACH: FRIENDLY VISITING, A SERVICE WITH WHICH JFS OF METROWEST HAS A SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD IN VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND OUTCOME MEASUREMENT; THE NEW JERSEY STATE HEALTH INSURANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SHIP), PROVIDING ASSISTANCE WITH MEDICARE GUIDANCE; AND, THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP) ENROLLMENT INITIATIVE, PROVIDING ACCESS TO SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION SERVICES. 
ADDITIONALLY, THE RSVP CENTER ADDRESSES COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AS NEEDED.  
THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $139,190 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $86,628 IN STATE AND LOCAL SOURCES.

ESTABLISHED IN 1982, SENIOR CORPS/ RSVP IS THE SOLE SENIOR VOLUNTEER RECRUITING ORGANIZATIONS IN GLOUCESTER COUNTY NEW JERSEY.  THE EXPRESS MISSION OF SENIOR CORPS IS TAPPING INTO THE SKILLS, TALENTS, AND EXPERIENCE OF RESIDENTS AGE 55 AND OVER TO MEET A WIDE RANGE OF COMMUNITY CHALLENGES AND NEEDS.  AT PRESENT GLOUCESTER COUNTY RSVP ENGAGES 320 PEOPLE AGE 55 AND BETTER IN A DIVERSE AND IMPORTANT RANGE OF VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES AT 31 LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCIES.  
THE RSVP MISSION COUPLED WITH THE FOCUS AREAS OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE ARE AIMED AT PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCIES DEMONSTRATING THE ABILITY TO ALLEVIATE THE PRIORITY NEEDS OF COUNTY RESIDENTS WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF SKILLED AND WELL PLACED VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION, HEALTHY FUTURES, VETERANS AND MILITARY, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, AND DISASTER SERVICES.
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: 
AN ESTIMATED 320 GLOUCESTER COUNTY RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COMMUNITY. OF THIS NUMBER, 57 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL BE WORKING WITH FRAIL ELDER, VETERANS BENEFITS, TUTORING ADULTS, HELPING THE NUTRITIONALLY CHALLENGED AND COUNSELING FOR HEALTH AND TAX BENEFITS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF IS HEALTHY FUTURES. 
LOCATIONS OF THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES:  UNDER OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES AT 8 STATIONS. THE TYPES OF STATIONS INCLUDE ELDERLY MEAL PROGRAMS, FOOD BANKS, SENIOR SERVICES, HOUSING, SENIOR CENTERS, VA SITES, SCHOOLS, LIBRARIES, HOSPICE, DIVISION OF HEALTH, RESOURCE CONNECTIONS, PARKS AND RECREATION, THRIFT STORES, TAX OFFICES, CHURCHES, FOOD BANKS, CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS, COUNTY COLLEGE, ANIMAL SHELTERS, BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS, AND HABITAT TO NAME A FEW.
EXPECTED RESULTS OR OUTCOMES OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE:  GLOUCESTER COUNTY SENIOR CORPS RSVP ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL SHOW ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT THROUGH NUTRITION PROGRAMS, COMPANIONSHIP, COUNSELING, EXERCISE PROGRAMS AND ACCESS TO RESOURCES, AND AS A RESULT WILL BE ABLE TO MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE IN THE COMMUNITY. 
NUMBER OF STATIONS: 60
NUMBER OF STATIONS IN PRIMARY FOCUS AREA: 8

THE APPLICANT IS THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE COUNTY OF NORFOLK, MA, AN INCORPORATED REGIONAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY WHICH HAS SPONSORED THIS VOLUNTEER COMMUNITY SERVICE ORGANIZATION FOR OVER 30 YEARS. 
   THE SERVICE AREA FOR NORFOLK RSVP CONSISTS OF ALL 28 OF THE COUNTY'S 28 CITIES AND TOWNS, COMMUNITIES MOSTLY LOCATED TO THE SOUTH AND WEST OF THE CITY OF BOSTON.  INCORPORATED IN 1793, THE COUNTY PROVIDES REGIONAL SERVICES INCLUDING LAND RECORDS MANAGEMENT, VOCATIONAL EDUCATION, TRIAL COURT FACILITIES, ENGINEERING, VETERANS SERVICES, CONSERVATION, RECREATION, REGIONALIZATION PROGRAMS FOR OUR CITIES AND TOWNS (IE. PARTICIPATORY ANIMAL SHELTER)  AND FULFILLS ADDITIONAL STATUTORY RESPONSIBILITIES.
  NORFOLK COUNTY RSVP'S CORE MISSION IS TO RECRUIT, PLACE, SUPPORT AND REVITALIZE VOLUNTEERS LIVING IN NORFOLK COUNTY AGE 55 AND OLDER IN PROGRAMS TO HELP MEET DIVERSE COMMUNITY NEEDS.    
  AN ESTIMATED 315 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, WITH A MINIMUM OF 78 VOLUNTEERS TARGETED TO MEET SPECIFIC PROGRAM OUTCOMES TO MEET OUR 3 YEAR GRANT REQUIREMENTS.  HEALTHY FUTURES IS OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR TARGETING TO MEET SPECIFIC PROGRAM OUTCOMES. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES (VETERANS) WITH TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, AND FOOD DELIVERY (MEALS ON WHEELS) TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING; RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES (HOSPICE) AND INFORMATION ON HEALTH BENEFITS (VETERANS); RECEIVING EMERGENCY FOOD FROM PANTRIES AND FOOD BANKS.  ADDITIONAL RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM AREAS INCLUDE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL K-4 ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OF STUDENTS IN THE READING AND TUTORING PROGRAM, ECONOMY OPPORTUNITY-EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT THROUGH ESL FOR IMMIGRANTS AND JOB SUPPORT TRAININGS FOR VETERANS.  OTHER VETERAN PROGRAMS AND SUPPORT TO OUR GENERAL POPULATION OF OLDER AND DISABLED ADULTS THROUGH A VARIETY OF VEHICLES INCLUDING HOSPITAL AND SENIOR CENTER VOLUNTEERING ROUND OUT THE RANGE OF COMMUNITY NEEDS WE WILL ADDRESS THROUGH OUR PROGRAMMING.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, GOALS INCLUDE QUANTIFIABLE ASSISTANCE TO OLDER ADULTS, TO VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA AND IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND FOOD SECURITY THROUGH OUR FOOD SERVICE PROGRAMS.  IN THE FIRST YEAR, THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $78,602 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPLICANT NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES OF $107,466 WITH A RESERVE BUDGET OF $18,882. IN FUTURE YEARS, APPLICANT RESOURCES ARE EXPECTED TO BE SIMILARLY PROPORTIONATE, OR HIGHER, WITH RESPECT TO THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MISSION OF MYSTIC VALLEY ELDER SERVICES, SPONSOR OF MIDDLESEX COUNTY RSVP SINCE 1996, IS TO SUPPORT THE RIGHT OF ELDERS AND ADULTS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH DIGNITY IN A SETTING OF THEIR CHOICE.  TWO HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-ONE (271) RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO ALLEVIATE LONG-TERM HUNGER, DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION ON HEALTH INSURANCE, HEALTH CARE ACCESS, AND HEALTH BENEFITS, PROVIDE FINANCIAL LITERACY, TUTOR AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND SERVE MEALS AT CONGREGATE MEAL SITES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES INCLUDING OBESITY AND FOOD, ACCESS TO CARE, AND AGING IN PLACE.  THE OTHER FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF K-12 SUCCESS AND A COMMUNITY PRIORITY OF CONGREGATE MEAL SITES THAT ENABLES RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS THE LOCAL UNMET NEED OF SENIOR HUNGER AND SOCIAL ISOLATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 450 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED FOOD SECURITY AFTER ATTENDING THE FOOD PANTRY 3 TIMES OR MORE,  35 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING  INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AFTER 3 OR MORE MONTHS OF MONEY MANAGEMENT SERVICES,  595 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AFTER  COMPLETING 5 OR MORE MONTHS IN THE READING PARTNERS PROGRAM,  AND  48,000 CONGREGATE MEALS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THE RSVP VOLUNTEERS. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $74, 897 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY SEVERAL NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES, BOTH CONTRIBUTORS WITH LONG -STANDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH SPONSOR MVES AS WELL AS MANY NEWLY CULTIVATED CONTRIBUTORS. THE READING PARTNERS PROGRAM RECEIVES ANNUAL SUPPORT FROM THE ELLA FITZGERALD CHARITABLE FOUNDATION AWARD OF 4,500 CHILDREN?S BOOK AND LEARNING TOOLS, VALUED AT $15,000, BY $20,000 FROM THE TUFTS HEALTH PLAN FOUNDATION, $3,000 FROM TARGET CORPORATION, $5,000 FOR SEVERAL YEARS FROM THE CAMPBELL AND HALL CHARITY FUND, AND $2.500 FROM THE EVERETT COOPERATIVE BANK. THE READING PARTNERS PROGRAM HAS ALSO BEEN CHOSEN AS A FINALIST FOR AN AWARD FROM THE METROWEST FOUNDATION?S YOUTH IN PHILANTHROPY PROGRAM. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WERE ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS AND MET WITH THE FUNDERS TO SHARE INFORMATION ABOUT THE IMPACT OF THEIR WORK WITH STUDENTS. THE WELLS FARGO CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, THE WALMART FOUNDATION, THE BARR FOUNDATION, THE LUDTKE FOUNDATION, THE RGK FOUNDATION, AND THE PITNEY BOWES FOUNDATION HAVE ALSO BEEN APPROACHED FOR FUTURE FUNDING. THE MONEY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM HAS RECEIVED $20,000 A YEAR FOR THE PAST 3 YEARS FROM LONG TERM SUPPORTER THE ADELAIDE BREED FOUNDATION, $5,000 FROM THE MASSACHUSETTS BANKERS ASSOCIATION CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, $10,000 (UP FROM $2,500) FROM NORTHERN BANK AND TRUST CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, $7,500 FROM THE CHARLES BACON TRUST, $2,500 (UP FROM $1,000) FROM EAGLE BANK, $3,000 FROM WINCHESTER SAVINGS BANK CHARITABLE TRUST, $3,000 FROM THE JOHN DONNELLY TRUST,  $7,000 FROM THE HOWARD C. CONNOR CHARITABLE TRUST, $4,000 FROM PEOPLE UNITED COMMUNITY FUND,  AND $2,500 FROM THE SAVINGS BANK FOUNDATION. ADDITIONALLY, AN AVERAGE OF $10,000 IS TYPICALLY RAISED FROM LOCAL BANKS VIA A FEBRUARY APPEAL. FOOD PANTRIES RECEIVED $5,000 FROM BJ?S CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, $1,000 FROM THE WALMART FOUNDATION, $1,000 FROM THE EXELON POWER CORPORATION, AND $500 FROM STOP & SHOP. THE ROTARY CLUB OF MELROSE HAS PLEDGED TO START A YEARLY SPRING DRIVE TO SUPPORT FOOD PANTRIES AND APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING ARE PENDING WITH LIBERTY MUTUAL, AND BLUE CROSS BLUE SHIELD. THE CONGREGATE MEAL SITE PROGRAM HAS RECEIVED AWARDS RANGING FROM $7,000 AND HIGHER FROM THE MALDEN REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY, $ 2,542 FROM THE MELROSE WHOLE FOODS SUPERMARKET, SUPPLIES SUCH AS CHINA FROM MALDEN?S JUNIOR AID ORGANIZATION, AND A PORTION OF THE $25,000 RAISED AN THE ANNUAL MYSTIC VALLEY ELDER SERVICES? COMEDY NIGHT FUND RAISER. DURING THE FALL OF 2015, SPONSOR AGENCY, MYSTIC VALLEY ELDER SERVICES, MERGED WITH ANOTHER STATE HOME CARE

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
COMMUNITY TEAMWORK, INC. IS AN $80 MILLION DOLLAR COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY SERVING OVER 50,000 LOW INCOME RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER LOWELL AREA WITH A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE: ALL THREE SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS, CHILD, FAMILY AND ADOLESCENT SERVICES, HOUSING AND HOMELESS SERVICES AND ENERGY AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES. OUR MISSION IS TO SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR SOCIAL CHANGE.  WE STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND REDUCE POVERTY BY DELIVERING VITAL SERVICES AND COLLABORATING WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS TO CREATE HOUSING, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES.  WE ARE APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO ALLOW US TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT WITH AN ANTICIPATED 220 VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE CRITICALLY IMPORTANT SERVICE ACROSS OUR COMMUNITY WORKING WITH A WIDE RANGE OF INSTITUTIONS AND WITH AN EVEN BROADER RANGE OF INDIVIDUALS. CTI'S SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS HAVE ESTABLISHED THEMSELVES AS A VITAL CONTRIBUTOR ACROSS THE ENTIRE SPECTRUM OF NEEDS HERE IN OUR COMMUNITY. OUR RSVP VOLUNTEERS TEACH BONE BUILDER CLASSES TO HUNDREDS OF PARTICIPANTS PROVIDING THEM WITH HEALTH EDUCATION AS WELL AS STRENGTH BUILDING. THEY SERVE IN LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS TO KEEP THEIR PEERS ENGAGED AND VITAL AND ACT AS FRIENDLY VISITORS TO HOME BOUND SENIORS.  OTHER SERVICES OUR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE ARE HELPING LOW-INCOME FAMILIES TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF EITC TAX RETURNS, SUPPORT AMBITIOUS MATH AND LITERACY INITIATIVES WITH STUDENTS OF ALL AGES, WORK WITH LOCAL VETERANS PROVIDING RESOURCES, SUPPORT AND COUNSELING.  RSVP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE MIGHTILY TO THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN OUR REGION, OUR AGENCY AND OUR COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE.
OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS GRANT CYCLE IS HEALTHY FUTURES. BY THE END OF YEAR ONE OF THE GRANT CYCLE, CTI ANTICIPATES THAT RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED COMPANIONSHIP TO OVER 500 PEOPLE. THEY WILL ASSIST OVER 250 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH EMERGENCY FOOD NEEDS AND SERVE MORE THAN 832 HOURS. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO OVER 30 NON -PROFIT AGENCIES IN THE COMMUNITY. RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS FOCUSING ON MATH AND LITERACY SKILLS WITH AT LEAST 50 CHILDREN. TEN VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT CTI'S EITC PROGRAM ASSISTING WITH OVER 500 TAX RETURNS, SERVING IN THE CHILDCARE ROOM WHILE PARENTS ARE HAVING THEIR TAXES DONE AND PROVIDING RESOURCES AND REFERRALS TO CLIENTS. TWO RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO OVER 180 VETERAN'S AND MILITARY FAMILIES. RSVP VOLUNTEERS SERVE THE COMMUNITY IN VAST WAYS. CTI FORESEES THAT RSVP'S WILL GARNER THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS IN DONATIONS FOR LOCAL NON-PROFITS TO OPTIMIZE THEIR SERVICE DELIVERY.
THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $52,631.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $26,623.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 78 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 75  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, COMPANIONSHIP FOR VETERANS, FOOD DELIVERY, TUTORING K-12, TUTORING HEAD START, OTHER COMMUNITY SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE TVCCA PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF 105 OUTCOMES WILL BE RECORDED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $75,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF $31,143 PER YEAR BY THE END OF THE THIRD YEAR. THE SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS AND IN-KIND DONATIONS WILL BE SECURED THROUGH LOCAL IN-KIND AND CASH SUPPORT FOR THE VETERANS FOCUSED PROGRAMING; LOCAL SUPPORT FOR THE CHILDREN'S FOCUSED PROGRAMING  (SANTA WINTER BOOTS PROGRAM) UNDER OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES; THE UNITED WAY OF SOUTH EASTERN CONNECTICUT; DONATIONS RECEIVED FROM LOCAL BUSINESSES FOR RECOGNITION EVENTS AND OTHER RESOURCES AS THEY BECOME AVAILABLE.
TVCCA CURRENTLY OPERATES RSVP IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF NEW LONDON COUNTY (THE COUNTY REFERENCED IN THIS APPLICATION) AND IN WINDHAM COUNTY WHICH BORDERS TO THE NORTH.  THE TEN TOWN REGION THAT THIS GRANT WILL COVER IS SANDWICHED BY THE TWO REGIONS TVCCA'S RSVP COVERS PRESENTLY.  IN ADDITION, TVCCA IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY THAT IS WELL ESTABLISHED AND RESPECTED IN THE ENTIRE REGION WITH NUMEROUS COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND WELL DEVELOPED RESOURCES FOR RECRUITMENT.  THE WORK PLANS WILL BE ALMOST IDENTICAL TO THOSE CURRENTLY BEING CARRIED OUT IN THE NEIGHBORING REGIONS.  THE CURRENT RSVP OFFICE IS LOCATED 13 MILES FROM NORWICH, THE MOST POPULATED POINT IN THE SERVICE AREA AND 27 MILES FROM THE FARTHEST POINT IN THIS SERVICE AREA.  THE CURRENT COORDINATOR WILL CONTINUE TO BE BASED IN THE ESTABLISHED OFFICE IN NEW LONDON AND TVCCA OFFICE SPACE IS AVAILABLE FOR DAILY USE IN NORWICH.

AN ESTIMATED 123 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH THE AGENCY ON AGING?S RSVP VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 73 RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: MONEY MANAGEMENT SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS AT FINANCIAL RISK; FRIENDLY VISITOR SERVICES RESULTING IN COMPANIONSHIP AND INCREASED SOCIAL TIES; RESPITE RELIEF PROVIDING DIRECT SUPPORT TO CARE GIVERS; AND SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY BASED EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT THROUGH TUTORING AND PEN PAL PROJECTS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL BE 50 + SENIORS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS RECEIVING SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND/OR AT HOME WITH THEIR FAMILIES. A SECOND FOCUS AREA IS THE CHILDREN?S LITERACY PROGRAM WHICH WILL ENSURE 50 + STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE IN THEIR ACADEMIC SKILLS THROUGH TUTORING AND PEN PAL PROJECTS.   
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $72,382. WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,784 ANTICIPATED NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

FRIENDSHIP CENTERS OF EMMET COUNTY--COUNCIL ON AGING IS THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR THE RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM OF CHARLEVOIX AND EMMET COUNTIES (RSVP). AS THE COUNCIL ON AGING, FRIENDSHIP CENTERS OF EMMET COUNTY (FCEC) SERVES AS THE COUNTY'S FOCAL POINT FOR ISSUES RELATED TO AGING. THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO ENSURE THAT ALL SENIOR CITIZENS HAVE THE OPPORTUNITIES, INFORMATION AND SERVICES NECESSARY TO LIVE HEALTHY, SAFE AND ACTIVE LIVES IN DIGNITY. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY PROVIDING VITAL SERVICES FOR SENIOR CITIZENS AGE 60 AND OVER.
 RSVP IS THE ONLY FCEC PROGRAM THAT EXTENDS ITS SCOPE BEYOND EMMET COUNTY. OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CHARLEVOIX COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING HAS BEEN EFFECTIVE IN ALLOWING US TO PROMOTE AND OFFER VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO SENIORS IN BOTH COUNTIES. BOTH ORGANIZATIONS HAVE FOUND RSVP TO BE A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF THEIR OVERALL PROGRAMMING, IN THAT IT PROVIDES SENIORS WITH A VITAL MEANS OF STAYING ENGAGED AND ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. 
AN ESTIMATED 115 UNDUPLICATED RSVP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MEDICARE COUNSELING, ASSISTANCE AT FOOD PANTRIES, AND PROVIDING TAX SERVICES TO LOW INCOME SENIORS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE 380 UNDUPLICATED FAMILY GROUPS RECEIVING NUTRITION INFORMATION AND FOOD. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $0 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $87,182 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

WAYNE ACTION GROUP FOR ECONOMIC SOLVENCY, INC. (WAGES) IS PROPOSING TO BE THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE RSVP PROGRAM IN WAYNE COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA.  WAGES IS A LOCAL NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHICH PLANS, DEVELOPS AND ADMINISTERS HUMAN SERVICE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. WAGES IS DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND HEALTH AND GAIN INDEPENDENCE. WAGES ADVOCATES FOR THE DISADVANTAGED, ENCOURAGES PEOPLE TO RAISE THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH EDUCATION; PROVIDES SERVICE AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERISM; AND MOBILIZES COMMUNITY, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE RESOURCES.
WAGES COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IS REQUESTING SPONSORSHIP OF A NEW THREE-YEAR RSVP GRANT.  THIS PROPOSAL REQUESTS FUNDING OF $98,094 FOR 300 RSVP VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED NEEDS IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES- INDEPENDENT LIVING AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WAS PREVIOUSLY OPERATED IN WAYNE COUNTY BY WAYNE COMMUNITY COLLEGE BUT WAS RELINQUISHED IN 2010, THEREFORE, WAYNE COUNTY IS A GEOGRAPHIC AREA WHERE THERE IS NO LONGER A RSVP PROJECT.   WAGES IS THE CURRENT GRANTEE FOR BOTH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS IN THE COUNTY AND THEREFORE IS VERY FAMILIAR WITH THE MISSION AND EXPECTATIONS OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. 
HEALTHY FUTURES- INDEPENDENT LIVING IS AN AREA OF ON-GOING NEED IN WAYNE COUNTY. A COMMUNITY WIDE SURVEY BY THE UNITED WAY OF WAYNE COUNTY AS WELL AS THE WAGES 2012 COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT IDENTIFIED HEALTH AND WELLNESS AS A TOP COMMUNITY PRIORITY. WITH THIS INFORMATION AS A BASIS, THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS THE HEALTHY FUTURES RSVP FOCUS AREA THROUGH THE "CONGREGATE MEALS" AND "FOOD SECURITY" SERVICE CATEGORIES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED TO SUPPORT THE MEALS ON WHEELS HOME DELIVERY PROGRAM WHICH PROMOTES THE ABILITY OF HOMEBOUND, FRAIL OLDER ADULTS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THE RSVP PROJECT WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH THE SENIOR CENTERS IN WAYNE COUNTY TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS FOR THE CONGREGATE MEAL PROGRAM SO THAT SENIORS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD RESOURCES.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL RESULT IN 200 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS DELIVERING MEALS AND PROVIDING A DAILY CHECK FOR 250 MEALS ON WHEELS RECIPIENTS AS WELL AS 70 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING 275 CLIENTS WITH CONGREGATE MEALS.
WAYNE COUNTY IS THE HOME OF SEYMOUR JOHNSON AIR FORCE, BASE. THE 4TH FIGHTER WING PROVIDES WORLDWIDE DEPLOYABLE AIRCRAFT AND PERSONNEL CAPABLE OF EXECUTING COMBAT MISSIONS OF THE US AIR FORCE.  AN ON-GOING DEPLOYMENT SCHEDULE RESULTS IN CHANGES FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES OF ACTIVE-DUTY MILITARY.  THE VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES FOCUS AREA WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH THE "MENTORING FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN EDUCATION" SERVICE CATEGORY.  THE RSVP PROJECT WILL COLLABORATE WITH 4-H AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO YOUTH OF ACTIVE-DUTY MILITARY.  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED TO INITIATE A MENTORING PROGRAM FOR THE LOCAL MILITARY 4-H CHAPTER.  THROUGH THE MENTORING PROGRAM, SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND LEADERSHIP TO MILITARY YOUTH.  THE RSVP PROGRAM WILL RESULT IN 30 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS DEVELOPING A RELATIONSHIP AND PROVIDING MENTORING FOR 30 MILITARY YOUTH.
